Reviews.Title: “great time!!”
Reviews.Author: tina p
Reviews.Content: my husband and i went with another married couple for a little vacation and it was perfect, we are a middle class family and did not expect anything major fancy.the resort was beautiful, wonderful sandy beach,always enough chairs.Bars never disappointed,drinks were not watered down by anymeans.beds a little hard but got a mattress pad and was all better.after dinner the entertainment for the night was always hilarious! we prefered the buffett as they always had many choices.we did wonder off the resort to a flea market which i did not like so much,we were offered drugs and were really haggled to buy things.very pushy.i would not go off the resort,thats my opinion. we did do snorkling which was amazing just the boat ride alone was worth the $55 a person.i would return to this resort!we had a great time and always felt safe,left our money and passports in the safe they provided and never had a issue,also we tipped a dollar or two each meal and to the housekeepers to be polite and they were very grateful.Tina from st.louis

Reviews.Title: “relax, relax, relax”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much to Karla, Maria, Barbara, Felix, Oscar, and the rest of the great team of entertainers. My husband and I laughed so hard at the contests and skits you had with the audience. Your enthusiasm kept us at the resort as much as possible. You get a fantastic beach with no rocks, a great pool, a room that is plenty big for 2 people, and a huge variety of food including barbecues at the pool and beach. The employees go out of their way to help you and are always polite. The bartenders do whatever they can to keep you quenched. Love the place. See you next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Canadian Review”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Ref
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with two friends vacationed March 3 to March 10. We are middle age and have travelled to Cancun/Maya Riviera 6 times, Puerto Vallarta 3 times, Huatulco once, Dominican 5 times and have travelled the U.S. and Canada extensively. We've stayed at all inclusive 3 star to Palaces. In our opinion the RIU Playacar is at least a 4 star property. We stayed in building 3 on the 3rd floor. There was a full king size bed. The bathroom had a full bathtub/shower. The bathroom was separated by a door not the curtains you see in some pictures. Closet was huge and included the safe box, mini fridge and liquor dispensor. The balcony was secluded by a 3.5 foot wall, very quiet! The room was updated, clean and spacious. The king bed was firm. We asked for a foam pad which was installed within an hour. It made a very nice difference. Building 3 was super quiet and smack dab in the middle of the property. The main buffet is adjacent to the lobby. This buffet is one of, if not the best we've ever attended. There is a huge variety of food for breakfast and supper. There is a theme supper but does not diminsh the amount or variety. This buffet closes at 10:30. The buffet (Turquesa) near the pools opens for continental breakfast at 10:30 then serves as a lunch buffet. Again, a wide selection of food. Not as big as the lobby buffet. The Turquesa turns into the al a cartes for supper. 1/2 is the Mexican, 1/2 is the steakhouse. The Japanese is a separate restaurent in the lobby. We ate at all 3. The Japanese is buffet style. Lots of food and specific to Japanese cooking. The steakhouse and Mexican were served at your table. All 3 were very good. Making reservations was easy. At 7am in the main buffet, in the middle of the buffet a gentlemen took your room number, number of guests and what time you want service: 6:45 or 8:45. No mad rush for this, lots of spots available. There are 3 bars. Lobby, pool and theater. Lobby abd pool open at 10am, Pool closes at 5:30. Theater opens at noon til midnight. The pool area fills up in the mornings, however there was not a mad rush for loungers. The beach area is huge! There were so many loungers available at all times of the day. The animation team works very hard at the pool area. Lots of music and activities. There is a second pool adjacent without a bar and is a little more secluded and quiet. The beach was very quiet, just your normal volleyball and people watching. Water is magnificent to swim in. The best spot to go in is directly in front of the life guard tower. We went to the RIU Yucatan beach. Wow, a lot more people and crowded. The folks from RIU Tequila use this beach. The RIU Lupita has an area at the RIU Palace. So the Playacar did not have any additional pressure. You can visit the Yucatan and Tequila. So we did just that. The pools are nice but busy. In the evening it was fun to entertain at both bars. The Tequila's bar is at the theater. It's a blast. There is a sports bar there too with snacks in a fridge. Pool will cost you 30 pesos. We can tell you this is an amazing hotel with access to 2 others. The hotel staff are so nice, firiendly and attentive. Their English language was very good. We will return to this property, soon!

Reviews.Title: “Counterfeit Cigars”
Reviews.Author: kerry p
Reviews.Content: Vactioned at this resort with family on Christmas, 2011. Patrons of this hotel should be alerted to the selling of counterfeit Cuban cigars by vendor stationed by the front desk. Called this matter to the attention of management after situation was discovered. Totally disappointed by their response.

Reviews.Title: “Had higher hopes”
Reviews.Author: Connie D
Reviews.Content: The service at Riu Playa Car is fantastic. The staff is very helpful and fun! The buffets were very disappointing. I would give them a 3/5. The ala cart meals were very disappointing. Out of the 3 to choice from the Jade, which is a sushi experience, so to say,was the best. The rooms are cozy. Beds are hard. Unfortunately when the "partiers" come back to thier rooms at all hours, you can hear them clear as day. The beach is gorgeous. The pools are nice, but close by 7pm, which is a bummer. The nightly entertainment starts at 9:45pm which is kind a late if you have children. The shows were nothing special. Basically book lots of tours! And you wont be disappointed like us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent attention”
Reviews.Author: Esquia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the beautiful gated community of Playacar, where there are a lot of hotels and private homes. Although the hotel is about 15 years old the facilities are in good condition. Our room was pleasant and comfortable. The only downside was that the room we had booked was supposed to be a triple. However, when we got there we found out there were two queen beds and a third one which was way too short for an adolescent or adult person, so beware! We complained about it and the management fixed the problem. Two days later, the staff left a bottle of champagne and a note of apology in our room. They really know how to treat their guests. The food was delicious and varied, although it's true that if you are staying for more than a week, it can get a bit repetitive. The beach was wonderful and all the staff extremely friendly and helpful. All in all, this resort is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time! Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: rebel-14
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 had an excellent time at Riu Playacar. We would most definitely go back next year! Great Value, and we were highly impressed. Staff-Awesome! They will get you whatever you want, whenever you want and are very happy, friendly. The anamacion team does an excellent job with activities by the pool and on the beach (dance, water aerobics, stretching, trivia questions, beer drinking contest =) This stuff goes on by the pool bar, but there is also a quiet pool for people looking for more relaxation. Maria, Karla, Oscar from anamacion team were excellent. Enrique at the pool bar does a great job and very friendly. Rooms- Very nice and clean. towel creations are left for you every day. we tip our room cleaners because they did an excellent job. Get a room in bldg 3 or 4 so you are in the middle (close to the beach, and close to the lobby/breakfast/supper buffet) and they are more quiet as well. And yes, the beds are firm, but nothing is going to be as good as your bed at home-ask for a mattress topper if you think you'll need it-we did and slept well each night) Also, the grounds are kept very clean. You will always see the grounskeepers cleaning, trimming, raking, ect so everything is in good shape. Food- Great Selection! Compared to other AI's we have been to, this resort by far, had the best food and best selection around. The restaurants do a wonderful job presenting with ice sculptures, and carvings/creations of food-presenation was amazing! Also, my mom is gluten-free, and she had no problems finding enough different foods to eat throughout the week. This resort also allows access to a few sister-resorts, all within walking distance of Riu Playacar. Taxi's to town are $7 from the front of the hotel, about a 5 minute ride. This hotel is very nice, and small enough so you get to know people and meet friends, but big enough where you will meet someone new every day, and it offers great selection of food and fun for everyone. If you don't have a great time at this hotel, its your own fault. I cant stop smiling as I think about our week at the Riu Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mario F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar twice (2009 and 2012), we love the size of this hotel, not too many peoples, so it is easy to find a good spot on the beach or around the pool. Food is ok but could be a little more healty. Service is very good, same thing for animation. It is a great place for everyone that wants to spend some quiet time in Mexico. Also, the location of the hotel is 25 min. walking from the 5th av. of Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but watch the patio doors.”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: Our family especially loved the pool bar attendants. They were worth the tips. Buffet was great. Our room and patio was cleaned perfectly everyday. But everyday, after the cleaning, the patio door was left unlocked. We went frequently to the rooms to make sure after the cleaning that we locked the patio doors. Also received a call saying we won a free room upgrade and the cab was paid for. I said that we would not like to take the offer as I am sure that we would have all of our belongings in a cab and taken to another location and robbed or murdered. Beware anything envolving the cab system. Took a cab to 5th ave for shopping. This was ok. No bad happenings there. Would not take a cab off the gated resort area. This resort was a great location. Not too big for a good time but small enough so there were no waiting in lines. Great entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times!!”
Reviews.Author: PeeOweD
Reviews.Content: Went the week of Feb. 20th, 2012. First all-inclusive so we weren't sure what to expect. Check in was quick and painless. The front desk staff were very informative. The rooms were nice but had to order an extra foam for the bed as they are quick solid. The pool was nice and the swim up bar staff were great. The nightly entertainment was good and different each night. Good selection of food at the buffets but also tried all 3 restaurants. The steakhouse was quite good, the other 2 were o.k. Lots of room at the beach but the pool chairs would get saved with towels from people that rarely showed up. Went to 2 of the 3 other affiliated resorts. Liked ours better as it was a little smaller with less people but the others were good. Enjoyed our week and would definitely go back. Did the Xplor excursion which was lots of fun.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: roger489
Reviews.Content: February 21st 2012 we went to this lovely little hotel with open minds, this was our first trip to Mexico but not the first to Riu Hotels. On arriving we were quickly dealt with and given all the advice needed for the first night. Rooms were perfectly fine, okay beds were firm, but good for the back. Food was very good, in fact I don't think I ever had the same thing twice, except if I really wanted to. Plenty of choice and well presented. The pool and surrounds were ideal for lapping up the sun. The staff were all great and couldn't do enough to keep you happy, but not at all "over the top". Beach was great and even though the hotel was full there were plenty of sun beds for everyone. Downsides ?? none really !! Just remember, if you want 5 star luxury then pay loads more, this is not 5 star but very good value for money. Only complaint was that the housekeeping staff were not security concious. I asked at reception on four occasions for the cleaners to lock the balcony door, as we were on the ground floor at the rear of the hotel overlooking the garden and could have been vulnerable. The door was rarely locked by the cleaners, ok the room was never entered illegally but it could have been. Overall, a damn good holiday !!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Arseniclad
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and easy with friendly reception staff, the lobby staff were enthusiastic whenever we needed something like an extra bottled water, an cot or some local information. Rooms were clean with nice tile floors and a large bathroom area. there is a "liquor dispenser" in the bathroom area with a mini fridge stocked with beer, pop and water. the liquor in the dispenser is poor quality except for the tequila which was a popular brand. The cleaning staff is outstanding and helpful as all the staff were there are a couple of nice pools one of which is quiet and the other has a swim-up bar and social activities. there is nightly entertainment which is lame but fun at the same time. Definitely not Broadway, The beach area is beautiful with plenty of shade and loungers. Non motorized watersports are included. There was a quite a variety of food at the various buffets and there is something for everyone with lots of fruit and fresh salad and different themes (Mexican, Asian etc) depending which night it was. At the bars you can ask for better quality drinks but there did not appear to be any high end liquors and drinks such as Pina Coladas or Margaritas were made from mixes which taste somewhat artificial and sugary. No serious nightlife at this hotel with only a small lobby bar open till the wee hours, better bet is the neighboring sister hotel Riu Tequila which has a big outdoor bar area open til midnight which then moves to the adjoining disco which open until 2:00 am. The Riu Playacar is well located easy driving distance to all local attractions and a 15 -20 minute walk to the town of Playa del Carmen and the Cozumel Ferry. There is a small mall across from the hotel with a rental car service and the neighborhood itself is in a gated community which feels very safe. Although represented as a five star it is probably a 3.5 overall but this is reflected in the cost. wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotels for adults or young families

Reviews.Title: “Riu's service is great... the employees made my stay enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Tunera
Reviews.Content: From the time I checked in at the hotel I was greeted and felt welcome at the hotel. I booked the hotel throught hotels.com to get my best rate, therefore I also booked my transportation to the hotel with expedia for $40 dollars roundtrip (the company they used is Best Day).... Our front desk person, Vero, was the best. Everytime we stopped by the desk she was always smiling and willing to help us. Our rooms were a bit outdated but there were always clean and comfortable with the exception of the hard bed. We had not ocean view but we did not mind since we spent our days in the beach. The facility has about six small buildings and we stayed at the one near the beach. The mini bar is not replenished every day. There is one main buffet restaurant in the main building building that is used for breakfast and dinner. The restaurant area by the pool/beach is used primarly for lunch and snacks. The food was always good and had a good selection. The coffee was terrible. The bartenders and servers were always friendly through the faciltiy. There is only one beer Dos Equix and the top liquor is Jimador tequila. everything else is generic liquor. We drank lots of Jimador which is a pretty good tequila for the money. We used the car rental on site to plan a trip to Cancun and tulum which costed us about 70 USD. The roads are great now adays. I had no problems. The Riu has five other hotels in the area. If you stay at the regular RIUs you can visit Playacar, Tequila, Lupita, Yucatan. For two days we were upgraded to the RIU Palace and the main difference are the physical facilties. The service and people are the same which I think is excellent. I opted to tip the employees that made my stay memorable. It was not required but well deserved. I would definitely stay at another RIU property. PS the Best Day service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Better than reviews”
Reviews.Author: Gerbob13
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff where great, the beach perfect, the rooms large and super clean, the beds yes..... Hard for sure good sleep yea , but my ribs still hurt 3 days later..... The coffee brutal thank heavens for Starbucks across the street... The food bland for sure.... But lots to eat.....we did not like our room 1st night but they changed us to a room in the front of building 5 which we loved,, nothing really wrong with 1 st room other than in back of building .... But we asked to be in front and we thank them for the change.....overall would not hesitate to return to this hotel chain again.... The golfing was fantastic...... Looking to return next year

Reviews.Title: “See this travel agent”
Reviews.Author: HeatherCancun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older but quaint and well kept. Our Delta travel agent Diego Perez Hernandez was unbelievable. He bent over backwards to ensure that our trip was a success. From finding us outings to a phillips screwdriver to fix a broken suitcase. His only goal was to ensure that we had the best time possible. I had a dental emergency, he got me in with his wifé.s dentist, put me in a cab and gave the driver specific instructions . Needless to say this could have wrecked my vacation, but he went above and beyond to make sure that didn´t happen. He was like that with each guest, no matter what.ç Delta is very lucky to have this person as an employee. I now consider him a friend and even if I didn´t fly Delta vacations, or stay at that hotel again, I would seek him out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff - will go again.”
Reviews.Author: happy_mexico
Reviews.Content: First off a bit about us so you can put this review in context to your travel expectations. We are a low key couple from Canada - 37 and 44. The purpose of our trip was some sun and R&R. We enjoy food but are not picky, we like to chill on the beach, walk the beach, and swim in the ocean. We are not big shoppers but I do enjoy the art of the haggle! We don't party at the disco every night, but like a little night life. We have been to Mexico several times in the past and this is the best location for us. It's close to the beach, very safe in the area of Playacar, walk to Playa-del-Carmen in 30 minutes and its not far from the marina for fishing and golf course. What we loved about the Riu Playacar was: ** our Sunwing Rep Alex*** (1) Location (2) Staff / Service (3) value(we paid 2400 all in for 7 days including flights - so I guess that is about $1400 for the week for the hotel) (5) Food - the buffet was really the best, the a la cart restaurants were ok (6) access to other Rui resorts in Playacar. (7) Rooms - decent, clean and comfortable (8) Spa (9) Shops (10) Activities. Areas that need improvement at the Riu Playacar are: (1) Smokers - they can smoke anywhere. i'm a non-smoker but tolerant of those who smoke but not while i'm eating. Grossed me out at times. (2) Beds - they are hard, i know this is common in resorts but I think these were a bit worse than other places i've stayed. (3) Entertainment - don't expect much from your night time shows. they are great dancers but I can't watch that every night. (4) Stray / Wild Cats - we are not cat haters, but it was a bit much with the strays around at night while eating outside on the patio. Tips for other travelers: - ask for a room in Building 5 or 6 if you want to be close to the pool and beach - but note if you're one to go to bed before 11 don't have your balcony door open. Facing into the pathways is nicer, but the outside rooms are not bad. - Take a walk to the other Riu resorts they are a great way to change up the scenery and see what they have to offer. - Take in a massage or body wrap at the SPA - great value and very great staff. The staff were amazing, I can't say enough about the servers, bar tenders and front desk staff. We were treated very well and everyone had a smile! Over all this was a great trip and we will go back when we need some more R&R. I have to add that I spoke with a lot of people while on this trip and some were disappointed by the food and lack of a la cart restaurants. If that's what is important to you try the sister property, Riu Palace, its notch above and will give you the "fancy" you want. Also, folks this is not a cruise ship so don't expect to have that type of experience. Happy Travels! Mexico is a wonderful country with great hosts ready to welcome you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Toni M
Reviews.Content: So to be honest the rooms aren't amazing! and first impressions weren't great . . . . but honestly I have never stayed at a hotel where the staff go so out of their way to make your stay exceptional! The food is really good, they try really hard to ensure both quality and variety is consistent and of a high standard. The variation helps on a 2 week holiday with access to the other Riu Hotels, shame its not for dinner though, and people consistently stated that this hotel was the best for food. So notable staff; Enrique @ the Pool Bar - manages a very busy and popular bar with ease! Absolutely hilarous, and great bar tender. You will defintely laugh a lot here Arsenio, Oswaldo, and Nancy - what a classy professional team! Great times, amazing cocktails superb service, Waiting Staff - always so highly efficient and accomodating Entertainment Staff - Led by Pablo, Alex, Israel, Maria and Carla - all spend so much time ensuring that both the daily sport activiities and the evening show are great! Above and beyond the call of duty at all times and multi lingual Honestly I cannot re-iterate enough how much the staff really make this holiday - fantastic! wonderful atmosphere. Great facilities across the group, wonderful beach, perfect location! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “A great smaller resort”
Reviews.Author: Tina B
Reviews.Content: My partner, Paul, and I had a great time, we returned on 16.02.2012 and spent 14 nights at the resort. The beds were a little hard, however, a s has been previously pointed out, can be remedied with a mattress topper. We were able to visit other resorts, Yucatan and Tequila, which offered more in the way of evening entertainment than the smaller of the resorts, the Playacar. Staff always friendly, polite and attentive. If you do plan to travel and get around try to ADO, local bus station in Playa de Carmen, so much cheaper and more fun using the local transport to all the tourist attractions, at a fraction of the cost, wish we we had done it sooner.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time and would go again”
Reviews.Author: nirt
Reviews.Content: We booked a Signature Vacations 5 star Mayan Mystery on the Beach vacation and ended up at the Riu Playacar. It was not a 5 star resort (but maybe classed as one because you can visit some of the other Riu resort pools and restaurants). But we still had a great two week vacation and for the price we paid we would do it again no problem. Ended up being $2,300 a person all taxes in from Calgary mid January for two weeks. The staff was friendly and always smiling, we loved the food! in the buffets but hated the a la carte dinners - we tried the Grill (rib steak) and Mexican (I was hoping for much better here and was surprised). You need to sync up with the restaurant times. If you miss breakfast from 7a-10:30am then there is a continental buffet available from 10:30a-noon. Some people were upset they had to wait until noon to strap on the feedbag - but it suited us just fine to have some fruit and light breakfast - then we would just come back again in a few hours and have some lunch too if we were still hungry :-) Lunch is noon-4pm when they bring out more items besides snack food. From 4-6:30pm is only snack food again until the dinner buffet is opened. There is lots of variety - and every day I thought I would limit myself to only having a few items and try the rest another time - but it was hard and I always ended up overeating. I love the skinny tender porkchops, the salsa fresca and the guacomole! We thought the house red wine was very good for house wine and enjoyed it every night with dinner. The staff works very hard at the restaurants. We had a room in Bldg 3 on the main level - was loud because other guests have no respect for being quiet. Also you can hear the person above you "clicking" around all night in high heels. Yes the mattress was very hard but we still slept good. Our room was clean and the towel animals were fun. The shower had plenty of hot water - although can be a bit dark in there! Yes the TVs are tiny but we did find English channels to watch and kept up to date on the news from around the world when we wanted to - even found a few good shows to watch on the couple of nights it rained and we just wanted to stay in and relax. Some of the commercials are in Spanish but the shows were in English on some of the channels. We didn't like any of the liquor in the room dispenser, (but the beers and the water were good) but found a few favorite drinks at the bars/lounges on site - try the Russo Blanco and the Mariachi! We found the drinks strong and the bartenders friendly at all of the bars/lounges. We hung out at the Lobby bar and made lots of new friends and thanks to Alberto and Ramos our bartenders who were lots of fun! We never had a problem finding a lounger poolside or beachside, and lots of umbrellas and shade the majority of the time - but we did notice during our second week it was quite a bit more filled up than our first week (we went the last two weeks in January). I think a lot of guests from the other Riu resorts come and hang out at the Playacar because it is beachside. We had fun playing ping pong and taking some water aerobics and rhumba dancing poolside. We liked the location - you can walk into Playa but we always cabbed it for $7 each way. They have great shopping at the shopping plaza right across from the resort - could find pretty much everything you can find on 5th avenue in Playa - without as much hassle and calling to you so that was nice as we find that gets tiring in a short amount of time. We went on one tour to Coba booked through our Signature rep - and had a great time climbing the pyramid. We took the ferry into Cozumel on our own one day - in hindsight we should have rented a driver for the day and toured the island as it was kind of a carbon copy of hanging around on 5th avenue - but it was still fun to go look and eat and drink :-) Most of the two weeks we just de-stressed, hung out, ate, drank, relaxed and just had a great time. I'll save my review of it not being a 5-star for Signature Vacations - as they were the ones who billed and sold it as that . . . but as far as the resort goes we had an excellent time! and don't regret if for a second - go have fun and be on holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Service excellent...hotel wonderful....beds very hard though...”
Reviews.Author: kleinehn_mom
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week and returned last week. The hotel is very clean and the service is excellent. The entertainment people work so hard to keep you happy and they were the best!!They have awesome night shows and we were never bored. The food was excellent also! I am amazed at how well the workers work and how accomidating they are! The beds were hard though so we asked for an extra two blankets and a foam pad which helped tremendously. The rooms did smell a little musty but once we turned on the A/C and kept it on, it was all good. Yes, they were fun at the pool bar...the bartender Enrica was so much fun. Also, Oscar and Marie made sure everyone was entertained and having fun. I would definately travel there again and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “HAD THE TIME OF OUR LIVES!!!”
Reviews.Author: kdreams
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome, staff was really friendly and the place was always clean. Bartenders at pool were awesome and made us want to only get drinks there. Karla Elizonda is the best activities director ever. She made sure everyone was involved and having fun. Thanks Karla!!! It was awesome how they made sure you were always having fun. Scuba in the pool was also well worth the time. Teachers were good and very patient. Great instructors(the female was the best). The food was great and plentiful. The only down fall was the beds- they were pretty uncomfortable-- they really need to update that horrible materess. THANKS FOR A GREAT TIME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Resort & Staff"”
Reviews.Author: ashcat
Reviews.Content: We just spent one week at the Riu Playacar which was a wonderful holiday! The service & staff were very friendly & always there to help if you needed them. The resort is small enough that you never have to walk far to get from one place to another. The rooms were always clean and large enough for two people to feel very comfortable. If you don't like hard beds then make sure you ask for a foam, as you will need it. I did, but my husband did not. The air conditioning is a little weak, but not bad and there is an overhead fan as well. We stayed in building 4 on the 3rd floor and loved the location right in the middle!!! The food was good as well, but one tip - go try out the buffet at the riu yucatan just down the street, Very Good!!! You are allowed to visit 3 other Riu's with your one bracelet on. If you are a family traveling with younger children, you will like this resort as the entertainment staff are fantastic with the kids and lots for them to do. With it being smaller you will feel comfortable with them wandering around. I would definitely go back to this resort again as we felt very safe and comfortable walking from one resort to the other and as well as going into Playa Del Carmen's 5th Avenue for a day - a must see! You really have to take the bad reviews with a grain of salt as it is all in what your expectations are when you book your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Kris731
Reviews.Content: Just got home from 7 great days at Riu Playacar. Outline below: Rooms - small but very clean, plenty of hot water, lots of TV channels and the mini bar well stocked. Dinning - buffets were great, the fresh donnuts and breads were out of this world! The steak house was wonderful. Make sure to make your reservations by 7am for same day. Pool - swim up bar was nice but small, lots of loungers at the pool and on the beach. Drinks - weak, but if you asked for a double or top shelf booze it was no problem. Beach - can't say enougth, it was beautiful, lots of shells to be found. Shows - good but not the greatest, but the crew sure worked hard. Any questions I will be glad to answer if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, well-kept hotel”
Reviews.Author: L C
Reviews.Content: The Playacar was overall a good choice. I might have preferred something a little more extravagant, but it was a great value. I've never done an all-inclusive before, so that took a little getting used to. It took us a while to get the hang of reserving a spot for dinner ("signing up" would be a better term), but eventually we did get used to the "rules". Also, as a vegetarian, I wished they had more options, but found it overall to be pretty accommodating (but why does all the mexican food have to have meat prepared into it? Can't I have a veggie fajita or cheese quesadilla?) As a side note, is chocolate not a common thing in mexico? As a professed chocoholic, let's just say I was in withdrawal. The beach was beautiful. It tended to get cloudy in the late afternoons, so I stuck to the mornings/midday for the best sun. Yes, the beds are hard, but after a long day on the beach I found we slept pretty well anyway (got some good advice to sleep on top of the blankets they give you in the closet, which helped a little too). Overall, my biggest complaint was that it wasn't closer to the town of Playa del Carmen. We were given misleading information from a travel agent that it was within walking distance, only to find it was nearly a half hour away on foot (10 mins in a cab). Not bad, and I love a good walk, but not when I'm in the mood to go out. As someone who lives in NYC I would have rathered something closer to the town (especially since nightlife at the hotel was lacking).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor food and alcohol.”
Reviews.Author: dkny67
Reviews.Content: Although the location and beach was great, the food was terrible. I guess that's what happens with any all inclusive resort. Our original hotel was overbooked, so they moved us here, although it was an upgrade, there were certain things that did fit the upgrade: food, alcohol, room service at any time of the day/night. Overall it was a great stay with a great group of old and new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: abbygirl22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar Jan 14-21 of 2012, and it was a great experience. It was our first trip to the Riviera Maya, and we were excited to go there, since we had been to Puerto Vallarta 3 times previously,and had heard so much about Playa Del Carmen, and the beautiful water, and sand on the beaches. We were not disappointed, and really enjoyed our trip. First of all, I would like to mention that the weather is very unpredictable on the Gulf of Mexico. We encountered this when we landed in Cancun, to pouring rain- we are talking -downpour! I have not seen rain like that -ever. The rain lasted all day, so that really scared me- we had never had any rain in Puerto Vallarta, and I was afraid it would ruin our trip, but I was wrong! Thankfully it was only one day, (we had no more rain after that) and it was a nice tropical rain- warm, and it definitely memorable. The resort had umbrellas in the room, which we could use, and the staff did their best to keep everyone's spirits up. When we arrived, they made us feel welcomed, and gave us a cocktail right away- reminding us frequently, to relax, we are on vacation. This resort is smaller than the Riu we had been to before, and much plainer, but having said that, it was nice to not have a ton of walking to do(everything is close together), and I felt like we got to know people better in this resort(and staff). It was always kept clean, and I liked the pool areas, and the beach was awesome. No complaints there, except the wind was a bit much at times. The food was really good as far as AI's are concerned. One day, however, we missed breakfast(due to a meeting with our sunwing rep), and were disappointed that it was over by 10:30 am, and they only had bread and fruit at the Turquesa. The service was hit and miss. Sometimes we had awesome servers, and other days, I couldn't even get their attention. Lots of choice, and always found something good. Loved the guacaomole, and salsa! We went to two of the ala cartes- the steak house, and the mexican. They were both good, but not great. I liked the steak one better- my husband really enjoyed the bbq ribs. My steak wasn't cooked enough- be sure to order it well done, if you don't like a red inside. The shows were great-esp the Michael Jackson, and Grease, Mayan, and Mariachi nights. Not a big fan of the Mr, and Mrs Riu shows- but lots of people enjoyed them. They only had one day where they served drinks by the pool, so expect to get your own drinks most of the time, and same thing at the nightly shows. The staff were very friendly though, and worked hard. Rooms were the same as the other Riu we had been to, and pretty basic. Asked for a bed crate, and it made a big difference! (yes, the mattresses are hard) Didn't get a towel animal unless we tipped, I was kinda surprised at that. Drinks in fridge were replenished once in the week while we were there, but we called the desk, and they brought us more when we ran out.(we drink alot of water) What more can I say? Overall,this was a great resort, we enjoyed it immensely! I liked that there is a shopping center across the street, and a Starbucks. Great location, and we hope to return again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful atmosphere, GREAT staff!!”
Reviews.Author: heb14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar May 21-28, 2011 for a wedding. Our room was nice, with an amazing shower/bathroom/closet. The beds were large, but on the hard side. We weren't in our rooms much, because the weather was beautiful. The staff knew us by name by our third day there and were always getting us involved in pool volleyball, drink samples, karaoke, etc. The nightly shows were great. The beach is very large and clean in front of the resort, as well as the water itself. Not much for weeds or debris, and the beach is cleaned nightly. It's beautiful at night when you can see the lights of Cozumel! The resort was pretty quiet while we were there, until we arrived. We were probably the rowdiest people there, but I'm sure it can get crazier during peak times. The front desk was quite generous, as we had several lost keys in our group throughout the week and they were replaced. We had one room in our group that lost air conditioning, and though a fan was provided, there was little relief during the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: mikedoughty1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Riu Playacar form 12-9-11 to 12-19-11 and had the time of my life. The resort is a smaller resort consisting of 6 three story buildings. The rooms are good sized, although a little dated. The beds are hard (the same as all other Riu's) but if you ask for a mattress topper it will help. The TV was small, probably about 19" and did not have the best picture, and not a lot of channels. Other than that the rooms were just fine, the shower was nice and large, with good water pressure, and plenty of hot water. The mini bar was re-stocked every other day, although if you requested it would be re-stocked more often. House keeping did an amazing job cleaning the rooms and even got all the sand off of the floor, tat I tracked in from the beach. The beach at the resort was one of the nicest that I have ever been to, it was nice and wide (about 100 yards/meters) from the entrance to the water. The upper portion of the beach was planted with palm trees, and offered plenty of loungers. We had drink service everyday on the beach, and a small tip to your server ensured his frequent return. The pool area was large, clean, and remarkably uncrowded. There were two large pools, one with a swim up bar, and one that seemed to be much more quiet. There were plenty of loungers around the pool, and lots of room to sit either in the sun or shade. A real nice touch was the waiters that came around to you, so you did not have to get up and walk to the bar if you wanted a drink. The animation team was one of the hardest working groups at the resort, they kept everyone who wanted to be involved in an activity involved, and left the others alone. The shows at night, while not Las Vegas caliber, were very good and certainly kept everyone entertained. After working all day, and putting on a show at night, the team took groups out to different clubs every night. The food at the resort, while not gourmet fare, was very good for an all inclusive resort, and offered a great deal of variety. I have stayed at a few other Riu resorts, and in my opinion the food was better here than it was at the other Riu's I stayed at. Even picky eaters can find something that they will like on the buffet. The Steak House and the Mexican restaurants were OK, nothing special, but a nice change, while the Japanese restaurant was a waste of time, with the food served buffet style. The grounds and common areas of the hotel were clean and well kept, we always saw someone cleaning or painting something. The bars were fun and lively, but not over the top, with a lot of rowdy out of control drunks. Drinks were good and the bartenders could make anything you asked for. A small tip would ensure that you got great service, and you choice of alcohol, be sure to ask for the better brand or you will get well liquor, which may not be the best. Overall I had a great stay, the staff was extremely helpful, very friendly, and very courteous, and would do almost anything you asked. I have heard a rumor that the hotel is going to be getting a remodel in the summer of 2012, if this is true it would transform the resort from very good to great. Either way I am already beginning to plan my return in December 2012. PS if anyone wants to see the photos: https:/…20111230Playa

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing trip....but we'll probably try someplace else next time.”
Reviews.Author: Headhiggins
Reviews.Content: Positives: * Great, friendly staff...very helpful with recommendations for downtown and money exchange, etc. (You CANNOT exchange American money @ the hotel. Different places have different rates and may require that you show your passport). * Very clean * Beach is beautiful * Great service by the staff. Everyone is constantly cleaning everywhere! Your glass is usually full and used dishes are quickly swept away. (you never see staff standing around smoking cigarettes like in the US) * Elaborate buffet with pretty food/ice sculptures. Kid-friendly food too. * Family friendly * Swim up bar is fun, great bartenders * Our kids had a blast boogie boarding NEGATIVES: * The neighboring resort's central operations were right outside our window and were EXTREMELY noisey during ALL hours of the night. We should have asked for a new room after the first night, but once you start doing fun activities you forget about the miserable night of sleep lol. And we are pretty easy going but the last night was THE WORST!!!! Carts being pushed on the rough sidewalk, reverse alarms on trucks, banging, yelling, a car alarm that repeatedly went off. * I thought the food was just ok......not that great....EXCEPT the guacamole and fresh pico. Yum yum! That's mostly what I ate. My ten year old totally loved the ice cream bar at all of the buffets. They have PEPSI products and I'm a Diet Coke fan. My husband said the coffee wasn't so great, but there's a Starbucks across the street. It seems like the non-buffet restaurants at the resort have the same food, except they serve you. We went to town for dinner a couple of times and had excellent food. * The kids' room had a sewer smell frequently but it wasn't super bad. * The air conditioner in our room was a little whimpy. * The sheets SUCK!!!! They have a plastic backing on them so you sweat and stick to them. The beds were ok. Just FYI: * This place is basically the exact same as the Riu Yucatan (from what I remember from 10 years ago). * LOTS of Canadians and Europeans ...(lots of Speedos, only a couple topless) * It's worth the cab to Walmart to get stock up on sunscreen because it's about $30 for a can of spray sunscreen in the gift shop. And grab a waterproof camera for any of the Eco-parks like Xel-Ha. Those are about $40 at Xel-Ha. * You need biodegradable sunscreen for Xel-Ha too, and only certain types are ok.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing 2 week holiday”
Reviews.Author: barby_travels
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar is great, very friendly and clean. It's not a honeymoon place, so do not expect that. To us, it looked more like a place where one could stay with children. It would do better with a bit of of renovation though, just to make it more elegant. Room is big, the bed is great, we loved it, it's very hard but it kept us asleep for 9 consecutive hours on the first night. If you find it too hard you can ask for pads at the lobby, but for us it was perfect. We stayed on building nr 6. We could hear the music coming from outside but it didn't bother us. There is no lifts on the blocks hence if you carry heavy luggage just ask for someone at the lobby to help you. Food was ok, from 1 to 5 i'd give it a 3. There is plenty to chose from so you won't be left hungry. You can hit the buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner as well as 3 different restaurants that are open for dinner only: Mexican, steakhouse and Asian. We loved the Asian, especially the fried ice-cream. We went there twice. The beach looks amazing, fine white sand and clear water. No bar on the beach, but none of the resorts we have seen from the beach have a bar on the beach, so it's the same for everyone. The wi-fi is in the lobby only and sometimes the signal is poor. There's a wifi in Starbucks though, which is just across the road from the resort. We saw other resorts who were far from the beach or far from town hence you are forced to use a car or commuting to move around while the Riu Playacar is just 30 minutes walking from Playa del Camen on the main street and 40 minutes on the beach. We walked almost every day and was great. Animation is really good, plenty to do during the day, from yoga, aqua gym, volleyball, crazy games to darts, ping-pong, dance classes and so on. Overall, we would give a 3 for furniture and fittings and 5 for the position and everything else. Bring a mosquito repellent with you, as you will need it.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Playacar in Jan. 2012. I would rate this hotel as very good. I am sure there are nicer hotels around the area but I can guarantee for the money you pay here it is the best. The food is great, the landscape is pretty good, the rooms are nothing special, the staff is great, and so is the beach. I would highly recommend this hotel but you need to remember it is not the most expensive for a reason. if you remember this is a cheaper hotel you will have an excellent time. Highly Recommended for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Riu!”
Reviews.Author: wineandcaviar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at this resort the beginning of December 2011 and loved our two-week stay. Before we arrived, we had emailed a request for a third floor room in bldg. #3 and they honored our request. Of all the resorts, we found the staff here to be the most friendly and obliging of all. The first day we requested softer pillows and that evening they were on our bed. We needed a couple of small repairs and they were done within the hour. We loved the location, the beautiful beach, size of the resort and it was very quiet at night. Our favorite time was before dinner, sitting on our lanai with a glass of wine, listening to the birds and watching the beautiful colors of the sky change until it got dark. The animation team worked very hard to provide us with good entertainment and we especially liked the Michael Jackson show. If you want a bigger show and a larger crowd, just walk over to the Riu Tequilla. The cleanliness of the whole resort, including the public restrooms, was outstanding. The Chef is very talented and cooks with a passion. We found the food to be excellent and really appreciated the beautiful and delicious variety of vegetable dishes. There are so many to thank for our wonderful stay but a special thanks to the Assistant Manager, Louis Miguel, for making our dining experience so enjoyable, to our favorite server,Oscar, who gave us such excellent service (and congratulations on the birth of his first son, Brandon!), to Jesus who always made us laugh, to Nelson who makes excellent martinis, and Nancy for her great drinks. We always like to leave a small tip because everyone there works very hard and long hours, and they show their appreciation by giving back such lovely service. The lady who cleanned our room always left us with a cute animal made from towels and fresh flowers on our bed. The front desk was amazing and always greeted us with a lovely smile and ready to help. We came to the conclusion that the reason everyone is so happy there is because of the General Manager, Elena Calvo Lopez, and her Assistant Manager, Louis Miguel Ventura. We have stayed in four different Riu resorts and this is our favorite. We would recommend this resort to anyone, and we would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: Jane G
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday with our 3 adult children. The hotel and grounds were lovely. The staff very friendly and welcoming. The food was very good, with a great selection of fruit everyday. Salsa, guacamole and chips were the best! The hotel room is a little outdated but very clean and well stocked. Fresh bottled water, pop, beer etc. Our only complaint would be the beds are super hard so make sure you request a mattress pad. Their idea of a king is two beds pushed together so that was kind of weird having two sets of sheets to contend with. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel. The quietest of the Riu's but you could travel to the other ones. The kids liked Tequilla which had the night club. Do make sure you try a tequilla boom boom, a Scoobydoo and a Mummy! Great drinks just made at the Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimmber
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this Riu. Nice beach, and pool area. The entertainment crew was good.The food was good and fresh. Safe area for walking around. 5th ave was a good experience. I will visit this area again. The rooms are clean, but the beds are really hard, so make sure you get your mattress pad, it makes a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: terk
Reviews.Content: Was there Dec 3-10 2011, Wife and I both 40 . Got a good deal from Winnipeg $1600 for 2 of us air,hotel, all incl & taxes. First time to Playacar area but 4th time to Playa. By far the best location , excellent beach, safe area, 20 min walk into town. Hotel was rated 5 star, but would only give it a solid 4. No real reason but for 5* I would expect new and top of the line. It wasn't real busy when we were there so eating was easy. You have to go down in the morning to reserve for the 3 sit downs. This may be an issue at a busy time unless your down there at 7 am. All 3 were good and ate at them all twice. Breakfast and lunch is your usual > lots of choices and always something for everyone. Not sure what some people complain about you don't get that kind of choice at home. Beach and Pool areas had lots of chairs and loungers. Drink service was slow so usually had to get up and get your own but still not a big deal. Small things like that would not give it the 5 star rating. Beach is nice sand and clear water. Easy walking up and down in both directions. Night life was the usual type of shows, so -so. They try hard and put on what they can. Not alot going on later at night if your looking to party should probably stay somewhere else. Across the street was one of the sister resorts that you have full access to and seemed more lively. They had a decent sports bar there so could go and watch your favourite game which was good. One of the other things that knocked it down from a 5* rating was in brochure they list a gym/spa. Actually it is down the street a block at another resort so had to walk down there to use the gym or have a sauna. Rooms were nice, sure bed was hard but try and find a hotel that has your bed at home at it. Nicely cleaned everyday , fridge restocked , towels changed > what more do you want. I used the dive shop to go on 2 scuba trips which was handy being able to leave right from the beach. Lots of choices of places to dive at , just a matter of picking your day and what you want to do. The boat just goes along and picks up a few at each resort and away you go. Then drops you back off in a couple hours. For the price we paid it has hard to beat. Will definately go back to the playacar area and would go to this hotel again. It is the smallest of the 6 Riu's that are all within walking distance so is less busy than some of the others which is why we would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Indy-Beach-Bum-TR
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying from 12/31/11 to 1/7/12 at the Riu Playacar. It was a wonderful experience and we will return again. As for the hard beds, with all that was going during the day and evening, when I was ready for bed I could have fallen asleep anywhere. The beds are firm and my back did not bother me the whole time there. As for the food, it was great. If there are complaints about the variety it is because you ate the same thing everyday. There was plenty of variety on the buffet and there are 3 free a la carte resturants. On New Years eve there was a special buffet and party complete with all the party stuff provided. The Animacion (Entertainment) Group was awsome. They did a great job keeping things lively all day. The beach was wonderful and the grounds well kept. Thanks to Isreal, Maria, Carla, Alexander, Oscar, Nestor, Geyder, Pedro, all all the others who made our stay wonderfull. This was not our first trip to Mexico, we have stayed at many places on the Pacific (8) and the Caribean (3) sides including Punta Cana and Jamaica so we are not new to this. The only complaint I can think of was the weather could have been nicer, but I don't think the resort could control that.

Reviews.Title: “This was just great!”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: OK, the negative comments about the rooms/beds are definitely overstated. We asked for a mattress pad via e-mail prior to our arrival and the beds were just fine. Rooms were very clean and well kept. If you want something "fancier" spend the money and go to Riu Palace. We wanted a smaller resort which is why we chose Playacar. We spent time at both Yucatan & Tequila and they were very nice also but if I had to choose, I would come right back to Playacar. The staff was just AWESOME from the front desk and all the way through the resort. They really made X-mas special in so many ways. Every single request we made was fulfilled quickly and with a smile. The entertainment staff was fantastic. I know they were there 12 hrs a day, easy and they were just full of energy all the time. We really liked the food; so many choices and all very good. We only ate at one of the specialty restaurants (Steakhouse) which was very good but we were so happy with the regular menus, we just ate that. The wait staff was just great and they greeted us every time as if we were long time customers. The pools, beach and all facilities in general were kept so well (one morning as I was out walking around 6AM, there was a guy wiping down the lampposts in the walkways). There is very nice shopping right across from the resort and town is about a 1/2 hour, very pleasant walk. Overall, if you looking for a great value and just a really comfortable place to vacation, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Missplaced clients”
Reviews.Author: DragonTales
Reviews.Content: Was scheduled to stay December 2011. Upon arrival was informed that we had been granted an upgrade to the Riu Palace. When we told the young lady that they could give the upgrade to the next couple we were meet with a stoney stare. "But it is an upgrade" sorry we don't want it. We had several appointments set for the week and the hotel was where we were to meet. After ten minutes or so of whinning at us, the lady stepped over to get a manager. Told her also that we didn't want the upgrade. She informed us that they would pay for the taxi. So, I don't want it. Finally it became clear that the hotel was overbooked. (Large tour buses started arriving.) So my wife asked the lady why are you giveing us the upgrade. Was told you are the lucky ones. Just be honest. After waiting another 15 minutes, we became fed up and told them we would take the upgrade, but only if she would inform the people who were to meet us about the change. (In case we didn't get ahold of them). She agreed. Next morning, not trusting them to honor their word, I meet the first of our appointments coming out of their lobby. (He was early) He informed me that when he had requested that the desk ring our room he was informed that No one by my name was booked there and did not have any record of us having made any booking. Class Act. Will I return, who would trust them. I can't rate the rooms, but I can rate their service.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: sheila197
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel from 19th dec to 3rd january, 2012 we liked the friendly atmosphere in the hotel the food was lovely especially the christmas eve buffet. we have been on cruises and never seen a buffet like this one the effort put in by the staff was fantastic. the rooms are a little tired but the cleanliness was second to none. we found the staff to be so helpful and friendly special mention to Daniel our bartender who makes the best cocktails ever! with Froilan Nancy and Nelson pretty good too. The entertainment wasnt always to our taste but the dancers put in 110 per cent effort. The beach is gorgeous could be anywhere in the caribbean and always plenty of sunbeds for everyone there or at the pools. Overall for value for money it was a fantastic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa M
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week stay at the RIU Playacar. 12/28/11-1/04/12. I should have taken the previous reviews on this hotel more seriously but trusted the opinion of our travel agent instead. The rooms are old and out dated, the beds were hard as a rock...not exaggerating. They had to be the worst beds I have ever slept in. By the 4th day all I could smell was sewer gas coming up from the shower drain. None of the drains worked properly and the bedding was thin, worn and even had a nice cigarette burn in the bedspread. You would think a company that was in the "Hotel" business would make the comfort of the beds a prioity. When we tried to switch hotels through Apple we were told that it would cost between $3000 to $4800 PER room as we currently had 2 rooms and it was their busiest time of year. This is the only review I have ever written and my husband and I have traveled all over. Our Apple rep was extremely understanding and when he tried to talk to the gentleman at the front desk I could see from where I was sitting that he was giving the Apple rep a hard time. The rest of the Hotel staff and workers were outstanding. The beach was nice but the hotel pools were not well maintained and dirty. From now on I will take the reviews more seriously before I book a trip. Lesson learned... Riu, you should be ashamed!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Snowputter
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this particular resort twice now...and loved it both times. My family and I find the food to be outstanding, the rooms clean, and the service is first class. This is the third Riu resort we've stayed at in the Playa region and we can't find fault with any of them. If you have a bad time here....it's your own fault! The beach is great again, now that the sand whales are gone. This trip took place in mid-August 2011. If your thinking of travelling to Mexico in the summer don't even hesitate. The water was literally 90f degrees and the air temp was comfortable in the low 30c range. There is fancier resorts but for the money you can't beat this one!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean room, nice beach but 4 star food”
Reviews.Author: Regi86
Reviews.Content: Traveled 12/04-12/11. Very clean hotel, amazing beach, great service, but the food and entertainment could be better. We had lunch at Riu Yacatan couple of times, but the food selection was the same. We have been to RIU hotel before and like the other one more.

Reviews.Title: “maybe our new #1 !”
Reviews.Author: perogies
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar Nov 20-27/2011 We stayed at this resort Nov 20-27/2011 and had a wonderful time, a little quiet probably due to being before the major holiday season. The resort itself is well laid out, small and is easy to get around. The room is basic no frills but was clean , as stated from other reviewers the bed is hard as a rock but after laying at the beach all day which is wonderful and drinking all day had no trouble falling asleep. The only trouble with our room was the TV. Only had 3 channels which where only in Spanish made several attempts with front reception but was not looked into , good thing weather was great and did not need the TV . Due to the fact that the resort was maybe half full had no issues with noise and no issues getting beach chairs and waiting at bars and reservation at the ala cartes. The food was great gained 5lbs the selection was fabulous, and presented beautiful. The ala cartes were all good our favorite was the Mexican least favorite was the Chinese the food was good but is not really an ala carte as is a buffet. The beach is amazing and clean lots of chairs, very little for boats, seadoos etc so very safe to swim and play in the ocean, water clean and clear with soft sand and no seaweed/grass. The location of this resort is great right across the street is a mall with Starbucks and plenty of shops selling trinkets to expensive jewellery to cowboy boots and everything in-between. You are also in a gated community with resorts, private houses and condos so we felt amazingly safe and comfortable walking around, we walked to 5th Ave Playa Del Carmen was very safe walked during day and also at night but for 70 peso a cab will take you there. Plenty of shopping to do, would recommend taking U.S currency along with pesos if you wish, we took only pesos and in some cases could have gotten a better deal if had U.S cash. We travelled with Sunwing all was great and have always had no problem with Sunwing but the rep (Jorge) was little to be desired, was never there on time and missed our welcome briefing, we have travelled with Sunwing and have always found the reps helpful and available but if Jorge is there and not one of the other reps just be prepared not see him on time. Overall was a great experience and would highly recommend this resort and would go back again, this was our first trip to Mexico and had a great time, we have traveled several times to Dominican Republic and to Cuba and now have a new favourite. (Check out my reviews on Hotel Barlovento /Varadaro and IFA Bavaro village resort and spa / Punta Cana)

Reviews.Title: “The motel 6 of the Mexico”
Reviews.Author: crazycirce
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 5 star resort, was also not comparable to the other hotels offered within the Riu chain. They say all of their resorts are 5 star, but if you want 5 star, go to a Riu Palace (Which we moved to after 3 days). Having stayed in Riu hotels before...this was a HUGE disappointment. Rooms: Very dated and inhospitable. Broken toilet, hard beds with springs poking out, mold, broken television in room. Upgraded to a suite next to the stage...incredibly loud, fridge made a strange sound. Suites are what you'd expect from a standard room in a 4 or 5 star. Staff: Aside from the front desk, the staff were exceptionally unfriendly by any standard. At meals, no drinks were offered (this is typical at ALL resorts I've stayed in that a waiter will offer you a coffee at breakfast at minimum), animacion staff ignored us, and vendors harassed us on main walkway within hotel grounds nightly. That being said, if you have an issue...if you can get to the real management THEY will help you almost immediately. Don't talk to the "front desk" manager, as for the director or sub director. Food: Very little variety, cold food was warm, hot food was warm. Quality was lower than what one would expect at a 5* resort. Between my family, we've travelled to Mexico and the Caribbean upwards of 50 times...we are more than happy to stay at a 3 star if we have paid a 3 star price. So, if you can get an exceptionally good deal go for it, otherwise the Tequila, Yucutan and the two Riu Palaces are FAR better.

Reviews.Title: “Honest feedback”
Reviews.Author: K L
Reviews.Content: This is my first Tripadvisor review but I wanted to let everyone know that this resort is OK. I am not writing this review to bash Riu Playacar. Not at all. But I want the truth to be told. This is not a 5-star resort by any stretch of imagination. I stayed here for 7 days in late December. The rooms are old. They desperately need to renovate the rooms. The bed is fine, the room is clean. But the shower is not very nice. In fact, it is quite dirty. Hot water doesn't come on at certain times. Water does not work well (ie, dripping water at times so we had to request a fix two times). The shower does not drain well. Additionally, the TV is from the 80s it seems like. Would not turn on. Now the food is really good. I enjoyed the food very much. The staff is very nice as well. All in all, it is OK. I personally would not come back. I would pay a bit more to get a better place. I guess you get what you pay for. The food -- great. The staff -- great. The rooms -- not so great. They need to reinvest in their resort and renovate the bathrooms especially. This is just one opinion and I hope you find this helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SuzVic
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great 2-week holiday at the Riu Playacar. This was our first time to the Cancun-Playa del Carmen area, and as we have always enjoyed the Pacific coast of Mexico we thought we’d try the Caribbean side for a change. The hotel was ideal for us – it is smaller than the other Riu hotels in Playa del Carmen, but we were able to eat, drink and watch the entertainment at a couple of the others. The first night we had a room overlooking the “forested area”, but we asked to be changed to the inner section facing the little pathway through the middle of the hotel. Our room was quiet and very clean although we did have some musty smells on a few days (probably due to the rain on those days). The 2 Queen-sized beds were fine – I have no complaint with the mattresses, as the firmness is good for the back! None of the rooms overlook the ocean but it’s only a short stroll to the beach along the pathway. The food was good – plenty of choice, and the staff throughout the hotel were outstanding – always happy to help with a smile and “Ola buenas dias.” The beaches are wonderful – soft white sand and warm turquoise water. We walked along the beach into the town of Playa del Carmen a few times and walked back along the road. We also rented bikes every few days from the Riu Tequila and thoroughly enjoyed the cycle to and from town. The whole area of Playacar is very safe and we were happy that we chose the hotel within that area. If we had a complaint it was the vendors on 5th avenue, who were very pushy. However, the few vendors we encountered on our hotel beach were great – they didn’t put any pressure to buy their goods. We visited Tuluum by a Collectivo from Playa del Carmen, a huge saving from the excursion tours. Tuluum was interesting, but an even better little spot we found were the ruins right in Playacar – no tourists, no big signs anywhere yet the much smaller area of ruins were every bit as good as those in Tuluum. We also visited Cozumel, which was a bit of a disappointment since it was Sunday and many of the shops were closed. If we ever go again we would rent a scooter to get around the island. We met lots of Europeans, Brits and Canadians – and had some interesting conversations and “mimes” in Spanish, Finnish, German, Russian and Swedish! I would definitely recommend the Riu Playacar to people who do not want a “party” hotel, but do want a beach location and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: CeeandTee028
Reviews.Content: Staff 110% - they are all brilliant. Hotel not too big, not too small. Food very very good - large variety and something for everyones taste. Do not miss the beach BBQ which is superb. Rooms very clean, but could do with a refurb. Beach brilliant. Easy accress to Playa Del Carment and Cozumel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best all inclusive resorts”
Reviews.Author: JMPM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RIU Playcar for two weeks (Nov 24-Dec 8) with our dear friends from England. We have stayed at 5 different all inclusive resorts in Playacar and found this resort one of the best. The hotel has only 6 three story buildings, not too big nor too small. The food is excellent, even for the most pickiest eaters as there is a great variety of food. The hotel and grounds are spotless. The rooms are a bit dated and the beds are a bit hard, just ask for mattress mat, this adds to a more comfortable sleep. The TVs are very small and the reception is not the best (nice to watch a little TV before bed time), but not a deal breaker. The two pools are warm and clean, there was no problemo getting a lounge, same with the beach, spotless and the ocean was clear and the water warm, again no problemo getting a lounge and there is plenty of shade from the palm trees. The staff is warm and friendly and cannot do enough to help and serve you, the managers are always available and very accomadating. The town of Playcar was a twenty minute walk or a 70 peso ($7.00 US) taxi ride. Venders in town are a bit pushy but just say no thank you and move on, again no big deal. We rented a Jeep from Avis, just across from the Riu Playcar, talk nice and get the agent down in price, we got him down to $100.00 US, tax and insurance, you pay for the fuel. We drove to Tulum and Akumal, nice resturant just across from the dive shop in Akumal, one of the best lunches ever, and very reasonable, also visited a small fishing village Puorto Morellos, beautiful place. Just a some advice, PLEASE, make sure you have good travel insurance, on the second day of our trip, I got an insect bit on my left big two, 3 days later it go badly infected and I ended up in the hospital for two days on intervinus, my impretion was they would not take the intervinus out until they were paid. I sat there after the last bottle finised for 5 hours untill my insurance paid the bill, the bill was over $2000.00 US. The health care was good, food sucked, ham sandwichs for lunch, dinner and breakfast. This did not spoil our vacation only a distraction. People always get bug bits and nothing happens, this was just a fluke, it could happen anywhere. We have stayed at over 16 RIU hotels and I would highly recommend The RIU Playacar and will be going back sometime in the New Year. If you have any question or comments please email and I would be pleased to answer....

Reviews.Title: “Great escape”
Reviews.Author: placestogo50
Reviews.Content: I spent a week (Nov 26 - Dec 3) with a friend and found the Playacar to be wonderful in every way! I would give it a "five" but it seems that some people want to compare it to a Riu Palace, which it is not, and which is reflected in the price of the trip. Personally, I prefer the smaller size resorts so if you do as well, the Playacar is for you. The resort was spotlessly clean, the food was delicious (never have I consumed so many calories),the drinks were plentiful, the beach and water fabulous and the service outstanding. It was also very quiet at night, unlike the last place we stayed where you coudn't sleep because of noise from the disco. Our first room smelled quite musty, which seems unavoidable in such a climate. After a few days, we thought we would like a different room and that request was granted right away. The beds were firm but we found them to be very comfortable (and I do have a pillow top at home) plus the sheets were always so lovely and fresh and the rooms beautifully cleaned each day. The curtain between the bathroom and sleeping area was fabulous for extra private dressing space in the morning so I can't understand the complaints I have read about that feature. The resort is in a very safe area within a gated community. In fact we walked home from town at night alone and felt very comfortable doing so. A walk to town is twenty minutes and a half hour the other direction takes you to an undeveloped beach. These walks saved me from gaining ten pounds, I'm sure. I have been to many other areas in Mexico. This area differs in that you don't have many locals selling their wares on the beach. There was the odd one but usually he/she only had a handful of necklaces. Perhaps this changes as the busy season starts. One of the girls at the desk gave us the name of a bar "Les Tabernaque" (spelling??) on 1st Avenue where we watched the Grey Cup. Great little bar with a huge projection TV for any hockey fans Eight beer and nachos for $20.00 - a lot less tha you would pay on 5th Avenue. Claudia at the front desk can give you directions. We also went to the Riu Yucatan for a change of scene and a Spanish lesson. This resort is bigger and has a few more bars so might appeal more to younger adults. All in all, the Playacar was a great place. I would definitely go back if there weren't so many other places to see.

Reviews.Title: “Better for adults - senior toppless ladies at beach, cheap beds”
Reviews.Author: traveltipsElPaso_TX
Reviews.Content: Went to Riu Playacar on Thanksgiving week 2011 with my family (two teens, me and my wife). Even though Riu Playacar was good, this hotel is a much lower quality than the upscale sibbling Riu Palace family. The Playacar complex involves 6 Hotels from the Riu group (plus other hotels from other brands); there are two Riu Palaces (to which you do not have access if staying at the lower class Riu sibling); and there are other three Riu Hotels of the same class as the Riu Playacar (do not take me wrong, they are all five star hotels, but cheaper than the Riu Palace). As a guest of Riu Playacar, you can use the facilities of the nearby The Riu Lupita, Riu Tequila and Riu Yucatan. Among all four, I belive the Riu Playacar is the best with direct beach at the hotel. Riu Playacar is probably smaller than the other three, just by the size of the dinning and show theater. This is an all inclusive hotel. Rooms were clean, staff was cordial and professional, decent food (not gourmet), two pools, great and large (wonderful) beach with palm trees, excelent shows at night (we liked the Michael Jackson, Vegas show, Maya show and Mariachi show). Beautiful landscaping. There is a golf course withing walking distance (hotel discount to $160 dlls or $136 dlls for early bird). What we did not like, quality and size of beds, all rooms have two full size beds and are supposley designed to hold four people, (better be four small people); beds are not too comfortable and have cheap mattresses, pillows and blankets are also very cheap; The hotel was booked with Aeromexico Gran Plan (air, hotel, transportation), maybe because of that, we got two adjacent rooms and the size of the beds was no longer an issue as it was good for one person each. (I was about to see if I could get another hotel because of the beds) The hotel should look to change to better quality queen beds rather. The hotel got very cheap with the shampoo, they give you two or three VERY SMALL pouches of shampoo - not even the typical small bottles. (my wife and daughter each used two pouches to shower) so I needed to request more every time. There is a mini bar that is replenish every two days, the three beers they have go fast, then you need to go to any of the bars for drinks. The hotel was mostly occupied by young adults and seniors, children and teens were rarely seen (perhaps due to the time of the year); so most activities were directed to adults. We had to create our own activities with our kids. We were very uncomfortable to see toppless ladies at the beach and around the pool, most of them were very very old senior ladies. We were told by hotel personnel that it is a common practice from European travelers. I think that practice should only be tolerated in adults-only hotels. As we respect the culture of other places, I believe visitors should also respect other cultures. The hotel should inform guests that being toppless is not customary in Mexico, specially in 'family' hotels. It was an uncomfortable experience, our only fix was to look to another direction.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel travelled 2008”
Reviews.Author: djwoz67
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon there. We found a fruit basket upon arrival which was great. The minibar in room is well stocked, rooms are clean and cleaned daily. When it rained sometimes the room felt damp but that wasn't thru a leak it was just the circulation of air. Could not fault the food in the hotel and infact some of the reps ate at this hotel instead of their own Riu up the road! Beach is lovely and cocktails start at 11am! There is no room service, but who wants to eat in their room when restaurants are so lovely. A must is a day visit to Xel-ha, you can go on your own or with your tour company, it is amazing place. The food and service is plentiful. We paid to go the underwater walk with the fish, if you have the extra money then you must do it. The rest of the time you can relax on the hammonks, sunloungers or in the bar. go snorkeling around the reef or get a rubber ring and start at the top of the lazy river which is fun. A day in cancun is nice, get the local bus which costs about £2 in a luxury coach. With your wristbands you can eat in the Riu Cancun which is old but very grand. Entertainment in the hotel is ok, some nights were not to our taste but everyone has different likes. The shops across the road are good and there is a Santandar cashpoint and a good chemist. You can walk into playa del carmen but there is a bus, there is some good bars in there, Senior Frogs is a must, during the day is good, but of a night its normally lively and its one price to get in of a night time. There is a huge Walmart if you need a supermarket or along the main street there is loads of cheap n expensive shops. Its a lovely place with very friendly people especially in the hotel and Playacar resort. We visited the other 5 hotels in the Riu group but if you are not staying in a Riu Palace you can not eat in either of the Palaces but you can in the other 3 Riu's. Have a great time x

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Jahjammin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day visit to the Riu Playacar. Fantastic is about all one needs to say. Food was excellent, something for everyone in any combination. Drinks, what ever you wanted whenever you wanted it. Your wish is my command is the order of the day with the staff, certainly the friendliest I've ever seen. The beach and water are classic Yucatan, crystal blue water and wide sandy beaches. For a bonus, down town Playa del Carmen is a short ride (30 min walk) and is a great place to go shopping and have a beer with the locals.
