We took the ferry to Cozumel and a catamaran (Fury) to snorkel the reef. Very fun day trip but not for the faint of heart. The room was a little needy, in need of a little updating I think. A moldy smell persisted throughout our stay, there was a foul smell coming from the toilet occaisonally and the bed was a little hard. But, it certainly wasn't hard to sleep at night, because the days were exhausting, what with all that eating and drinking and beach walking and surfing and swimming and trips to Playa etc., etc., etc., etc. So a few glitches with the room were minor issues because we only slept and showered there. Overall 4 stars for this trip and this hotel. Everything was as smooth as a baby's behind

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: caribbeangirl48
Reviews.Content: You have to be very very picky to not enjoy your stay at the Playacar. Its not a brand new hotel but it is very pretty and very clean. Food is more than good, we ate at the buffet almost every night it was so good. Weve travaled for the last 11 years to Cuba, Dominican Republic, Jamaica and St-Martin so I think I can really see the good and bad of each place. The beach is just beautiful and you can walk and walk.....wouldn't hesitate to go back. Next time another Riu...excellent hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good service”
Reviews.Author: sdiro
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a perfect location in Riveria Maya. Staff was very polite and accomodating. Although we did need to call the front desk to request a few things (more towels, mattress pads, etc) they were delivered in a timely manner. Things I enjoyed- water, soda, alcohol is included in the mini bar in the room. I was not expecting this, even though it was all-inclusive. The mini-bar was stocked daily. The food was excellent. I don't think there is much need to for reservations at the restaurants, because there are theme nights with pretty much the same menu. I stayed at an all-inclusive on another Carribbean island and the food was not nearly as good as at Playacar. The other guests were a wide variety of ages. I was traveling with friends, so wewere glad it was not all couples or families. The rooms could use a little updating, but they were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach!”
Reviews.Author: terryjomo
Reviews.Content: The beach at the Riu Playacar is absolutely fabulous. Staff was very friendly and helpful and our family had a fantastic vacation. The buffet food is ok, not stellar. The steakhouse is not good, I have to say. But the Asian restaurant was delicious. The beds are really, really hard! On the third night we requested some bed cushions and that helped a lot.

Reviews.Title: “riu playacar”
Reviews.Author: evieo62
Reviews.Content: recently returned from playacar feel rooms would benefit upgrading though spotlessly clean would of liked a tea /coffee machine in room i also would of liked to pre book steak house a few days in advance its a hit or miss if you get in or not you have to book at breakfast all the optional restuarants the staff were really friendly and helpfull i stayed at riu yucatan 5 years ago i personally prefer it to the playacar the food there is great more choice

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaileeep
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Playacar 1st to 14th of November 2011. This hotel is spotlessly clean throughout. Staff are excellent, efficient and very friendly - nothing too much trouble. As previously mentioned I think this is RUI hotel is the best of this standard in this area - we visited Yucatan and Tequilla but not the Lupita. Some of the whinging about smoking is a bit much - can't smoke outside now!!! Plenty of good food and the juices and friut smoothies at breakfast were to die for as were the cocktails served at the bars. Entertainment at night was a bit samey but the animation team worked hard and were never too much in your face. Couple of down things - coffee not readily available during the day; just from a machine and not too nice to be honest., plus encountered a number of drunken Americans, very loud, whooping and screaming all the time - and they say the Brits are bad..... Oh and never found a problem with the beds - they are never like your own at home in any case are they?

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this little corner of paradise”
Reviews.Author: alanjoynson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem,not just the surroundings,but the whole ambiance of the place,the staff must be the most accomodating i've ever had the pleasure of meeting, nothing is ever too much trouble,from the minute you arrive to the moment you depart the experience is fantastic. Although the location is wonderful,it means nothing without the staff to look after your every need,and they do this most willingly i cannot praise the staff enough,we could learn well in England from these wonderful people, they smile from morning till night. I am not going to name names because i am afraid i would miss some one off. Just one word of warning,the accomodation is three stories high with no lifts, but do not let this put you off,simply ask fot the ground floor when booking,cannot wait to return.roll on.

Reviews.Title: “Ground level rooms a little smelly”
Reviews.Author: RobBullock51
Reviews.Content: Food was abundant and pretty good Rooms were cleaned promptly every day Everything was great except two things 1 - our room #1106 had a really bad sewage smell in the bathroom area it was coming from the sink and shower drains 2 - the included ala carte meals where ok the steakhouse was terrible the Mexican and Asian where ok But the Mexican and steakhouse you ordered off a menu and they had a really hard time organizing everything and then proceeded to rush us out as we were the early seating but they didn't serve our meals until 30 min prior to the next seating

Reviews.Title: “The location great but the rooms have difficulties!”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne F
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our vacation in Riu Playacar, the food and the staff are really good but our rooms had some difficulties. Like other people earlier wrote the location is great, the beach is a dream and my family loved the animation program! Sad was also that there is no non smoking area on the patio from the restaurants, we are non smoking family with kids, and it was not nice to have breakfast with smoky flavor. Back to our rooms, when we arrived we had a room on the ground floor in a building next to the lobby, when we opened the door this really intensive odor from moisture, mold and I guess some pest chemicals came right into our noses. We also found a lot of ants in the bathroom. We asked for another room and they gave it to us. This was also a ground floor room in another building. After a couple of days this room smelled also moist and moldy, the shower didn't drain and the wall between restroom and shower was so wet that the texture bubbled! So we asked again for another room, this time we got one in the 3rd floor and it was perfect! We spoke to other families and some of them had the same problem with odor in the rooms, I really think they should start remodeling the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Ken A
Reviews.Content: Hola. We stayed at the RIU Playacar Nov6 - Nov13 and had a great time. This is a smaller resort with the ammenities of the larger ones but not the crowd. Mostly couples of all ages staying here, a few with young children. Both family and couple friendly. PRO's: The resort layout is great with smaller buildings lining a walkway that takes you to the pools and beach. The beach is fantastic with Palm trees providing shade instead of pallapas - much better. You can walk to four other RIU's and use their facilities; the hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful - they work for a few dollars a day so tips are much appreciated; resort is extremely clean; food is very good and they change the buffet menu regularly - recommend going to the RIU Yucatan for lunch since they have a better selection. Location is great with a long beach to walk on and a developed area / road with sidewalks to safely walk along - even at night. The Playacar area is like a gated community which helps keep the area safe. CON's: I didn't realize how many people still smoke ... only place smoking is not permitted is inside at the one restaurant. All rooms have ashtrays, but I did not smell anything. Some rooms have two 3/4 beds touching side by side so we switched to a room with a king bed. Beds are very hard and the rooms only have a 19" TV. Catamaran's, kayaks, etc. use is run by an outside company with a focus on making money - they limit you to one hour per day (which is not mentioned until you get there) and you may have to pay for a lesson first. Overall: We checked out several other resorts in the area and prefer the size, setting, layout and cleanliness of the RIU Playacar. If returning to this area we would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: moobradford
Reviews.Content: just got back from riu playacar mexico. what a fantastic holiday!!!. everything from the room to the food & staff was the best. i read a few reviews before i went but nothing really does it justice. from walking through the door at reception the staff couldnt have been more helpful. only one thing could be improved coffee & tea facilities in the rooms would have been the finishing touch. i would certainly go back again. we looked at the other hotels in the group but everything in them was too big and too impersonal. if you want a laid back holiday with the option of activities if you want them this is the place for you. i give them 10 out of 10. les

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jana V
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel with my boyfriend in January 2010. The beach was close because they were making it bigger. We did not really mind because we traveled lot so we didn't spent lots of time in hotel anyway. Hotel has got great location. It is only 30 minutes walk from town where you can get boat to Cozumel. There is small shopping area just in fron of hotel and on the way to town lots of places where you can hire a car. Hotel itself was clean, each room has got it's own bar and if we left little tip on bed for housekeeper we even got animals from towels and room was much nicer clean than if we forgot. The food was amazing as well as drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Like most facelifts, looks good on the outside but still old on the inside”
Reviews.Author: tigermtbabe
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful and the staff were very helpful but the room(s) that we stayed in had their issues. We checked into our first room and it was adequate. The water pressure was weak in the shower and the walls were paper thin so our neighbor's loud partying kept us up all night. The beds were the worst though. Rock hard mattress wrapped in bed wetting protection plastic that was almost as loud as the neighbors when moving around in the middle of the night. We requested another room and it was marginally better. This time the sink was leaking all over the floor and continued to do so even after notifying the front desk. The two pools were a bit cool but that was okay. The activity pool was loud most of the day with constant techno music. The quiet pool wasn't so much since it was connected to the other. Go to the ocean. Much better. The breakfast was outstanding! The lunch was good too but the Asian, Mexican, and Steakhouse for dinner were disappointing. We have great Asian food in our city so by comparison this was very bland. The Steakhouse had tough steak, not really a surprise, and the Mexican dinner was probably the biggest disappointment. Hey, where are we??? It's a nice walk to town or you can take a taxi for $7.00. The Riu won't change US dollar so keep that in mind. Mostly Europeans while we were there. Great trip but not a 4 star property. The

Reviews.Title: “Interesting trip”
Reviews.Author: beenthere47
Reviews.Content: Spent eight days here, Oct 22-29. Bldings are ? Hacienda type not facing the ocean, great during the storm thursday. Felt secure.Buffet Food was ok a little something for everyone, Steak and Asian pretty good, Mexican was so so. All of the staff has a big thumbs up!! Tips go a long way here, most guests are European so the feel of the area is a little different than Cancun over all. The in room bar is ok, tequila good, vodka rum ok, brandy? pepsi 7up orange sodas, dos exe beer, club soda. A tip to the beverage stocker gets you anything they serve in quantity! The bad, a few la cucaroaches they keep bug spray on the maids cart. shower temp can change fast. beds a bit hard.transportation to playa del carmen a little pricey compared to cancuns buses. Overall agood trip

Reviews.Title: “great trip, nice resort”
Reviews.Author: ECMTravelers
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a great week at the Riu Playacar. It is a lovely place, and I would recommend it. Check-in went very well. The front-desk staff spoke English very well and everything went smoothly. They gave us something to drink upon check-in. I don't know what it was, but it was delicious. The hotel itself is very nice and well-maintained. The rooms were very clean and fairly large and they all had balconies, though none faced the ocean. We were in building 4, which is in the middle of all the buildings. It was close to the beach and close to the restaurants and bars, which was nice. However, the buildings all have an open courtyard on the interior, which makes sound bounce around a lot whenever anyone is talking in the hallway. It made it a bit difficult to sleep late at night after the bars closed and early in the morning when the early birds were going to breakfast. Out biggest complaint about the room is the bed. The hardness didn't bother us, but the set-up did. The King bed was actually two full size beds pushed together, and each had its own set of sheets, blankets, etc. It made sleeping a bit awkward. The food was overall pretty good. The buffet had a ton of options, and the Mexican offerings, like barbacoa and conchita pibil, were amazing. The fresh salsas were great, too. There was so much variety that I don't understand how anyone could get bored or feel like they're eating the same thing every day. The steakhouse was also amazing - the tomato soup was arguably the best we've had. We weren't too crazy about the Mexican restaurant or the Asian restaurant, though, the tortilla soup at the Mexican restaurant was great. The beach was beautiful. Even though I'd heard that the water was extremely blue, I was completely blown away. Even when it was raining, it was as blue as I've ever seen water. Our only complaint about the beach is that the only shade available is from palm trees - there are no sun umbrellas. Despite SPF 50 and constantly keeping our chairs in the shade, we both got very burned. We also would have preferred a private beach, but we know that's extremely rare in the area and knew this hotel did not have a private beach when we booked. We also have to give major kudos to the entertainment team. They all work so very hard. I don't remember a single day where I didn't see Carla and a few others whose names I don't remember. We went to a few of the evening shows and they were really fun. We expected them to be rather cheesy, like at some of the other all-inclusives we've been to, but these were good - the ones we saw were choreographed dance shows. The dancers were very talented. Drinks were good. We didn't have problems with them being too weak or made with cheap liquor. The mango daquiris were really yummy. We didn't use the alcohol dispenser much, but we enjoyed being able to mix a cocktail in our room. Another general complaint is that smoking seemed to be allowed absolutely everywhere, including inside the restaurants. We expected to find a lot of smokers, and we expected smoking to be allowed most places, allowing smoking in the restaurants surprised us. It also rained all day the day we checked in, the next day, and most of the day after. We learned on our third day that they do have rain activities, but they did not make their "in case of rain" activities well publicized. Also, each room had an umbrella in it, which was really nice. Overall, we had an excellent vacation. We probably will not go back because we try to go different places each time we vacation, but if we found ourselves in Riviera Maya again, we would strongly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Alegro Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Ines I
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week stay, the first 3 days it rain (all day), but the rest of the week, when the sun came up we spend all days at the beach which is beautiful. All the workers are very pleasant and they make you feel important. The entertainers were always trying to get people to participate in their many activities, I will return to this hotel, the people are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Agadorx1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the RIU Playacar and even though it poured during our first two days there we still had a great experience. The entire staff from the gardeners to the bartenders were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, the beach was beautiful (when the sun finally came out), we always felt safe and the entertainment staff really worked hard to keep people involved. There was always a wide variety of food on the buffets, I cannot understand how anyone can complain about not finding something they liked to eat. We chose this resort based on the price and never regretted it. If you are looking for a 5-star resort you should pay more and stay somewhere else. If you are looking for a fun, clean and friendly place, try the RIU Palace. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT !!! from Ilkeston”
Reviews.Author: Muriel H
Reviews.Content: Returned home at the begining of October from a great holiday. It was our first time to Mexico and the first time that we had used a Riu chain of hotels, but it will not be our last. The hotel is getting to look a bit tired in the bedrooms and requires some tender loving care but all the staff, from gardeners, cleaners, bar staff and the waiters in the restaurant make up for it. Polite and very friendly and not one bad sole that we encountered.The food is fantastic and the variety vast and plentiful, be prepared to put on loads of weight I did. The entertainment is sometimes very loud and can be heared in some of the bedrooms, but the entertainment team try the hardest to fulfill their roles and are extremely friendly. One down side is in the swim up pool bar, sometimes with the Americans and Candians all that you can smell and taste is cigarettes as they can take over the bar area. Have booked again for next year in another Riu hotel. Hope it lives upto this one, but we have plans to return to this one again in 2014.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico's best vacation”
Reviews.Author: Willy13579
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec 2010 and now have booked for Jan 2012. The resort offers everything the bigger resorts offer but add a very personal touch. The size of the resort allow for the very freindly staff to get to know you better. This time we are taking our family and their children. The food is fantastic , rooms are very clean and comfortable, We have travelled to the Mayan several times always to different resorts but this is the only one that I would go back to. You will not be sorry to make this your holiday stop

Reviews.Title: “What a place - brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: Jedworthy
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand the bad reviews about this place, it is totally fantastic!!! The food was really good with loads of choice, the staff and entertainment crew were unbelievably friendly and always had a big smile for the guests and made them feel as though they cared about them. Rooms were very nice, exceptionally clean and we did not experience any bad smells. Don't listen to the moaners, its wonderful here and we would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Accorse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar sept. 7th to 14th. Very clean rooms. Friendly staff, nothing to much trouble. Close to Playa del carmen for days & nights out. Great value for money. Would go back there .

Reviews.Title: “Best Week In Mexico Yet”
Reviews.Author: Moony12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from 09/29-10/0611. I think we had one of the best vacations so far in Mexico. The property is smaller than most, but that's a good thing. The resort is a little older, but impecable from the lobby to the rooms, the grounds and the staff. The staff is the friendliest staff we have encountered. We had so much fun with the entertainment staff, they were very friendly. Pablo, Maria, Ruben, Isra, Carla, Alexander and a few names I forgot. We played beach volleyball, water polo, water volleyball and of course crazy games at the pool every afternoon. The bartenders, Felix, Roberto Enrique and David, the bar manager, were great, they always had a smile for you and once they got to know you your drink was waitying for you. The pool bar was our favorite and we had a lot of fun there and meet a lot of nice people. We did not watch the theme shows, they are a little repititious when you have been to resorts as many times as we have, however, we enjoyed the live music in the lobby every night. We also had a lot of fun with the entertainment staff in the lobby in the early evening playing different games. One morning it rained for about 4 hours, the entertainment staff set up games and different things for us to participate in until the rain stopped. Maria gave us an excellent spanish lesson. I only wish I could remeber everything. I figure if I can learn five new words in spanish every time we go, I'm OK. One afternoon we had drinks in real coconuts. Playa Del Carmen is about a twenty minute walk from the resort or a five minute cab ride. We decided to walk to get a little exercize. We went late in the after noon and came back about eight. The sidewalks are well light and we always felt safe. On the way to Playa Del Carmen there are some small ruins you can see right off the sidewalk. There are some information plaques along the path telling you about the ruins. It.s small and there are two sets of ruins you can visit. The food was good, it needs to be mixed up a little. We had turkey one night that was excellent, Paella for lunch one day (our favorite) and an excellent buffet dinner with 3-4 different kinds of shrimp. pasta and great deserts. Luis Miguel and William went out of thier way to make you feel like old friends. The steakhouse was OK, since we are from the midwest you would have to go a long way to find a nice juicey steak like we have at home. The Jade (Aisan restaurant) was the best Aisan I have had a t a resort, The duck was fantastic as were the rest of the items on the menu. I had fried ice cream for the first time and loved it. We didn't eat a tthe Mexican restaurant, it was closed the night we wanted to go. Some of the reviews said the TV needs to be upgraded to a flat screen TV. I don't go on vacation or to Mexico to watch TV. The bed was a little hard for me, but I asked for a mattress topper and it was fine. This was our fourth time at a Riu Resort and we will surely be back. It's like being with a long time friend.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas88_11
Reviews.Content: Me and ny fiancee recently stayed at the RIU 29/08/2011 - 12/09/2011. This was our first holiday abroad together as a couple and staying there we are considering the RIU as our honeymoon destination! From the moment we arrived we fell in love with the hotel, in fact everything about the resort. The reception staff were extremly helpful when we checked in and so was the staff member who carried both our suitcases up three flights of stairs in one go. When we arived at the room, we found a clean, tidy and comfortable room along with a bear made out of towels!! The cleaning staff at the hotel did an excellent job and really do work very hard. When we went to the pool for the first time (and every other time) we found it to be clean and kept tidy. There was always sunbeds available which saved the hassle of having to compete with other holiday makers. The staff at the pool bar were friendly and always happy to help. The pool is literally like getting into a warm bath, its fab! One of the best things was that the hotel had its own section of beach which was literally a stones throw away from the pool area! It was just as we had seen in the brochure with pure soft white sand and clear warm turquoise sea! So picturesque! After reading previous reviews regarding the food we were apprehensive due to other people's negative comments. However we were delighted with the selection, quality and freshness of the food on offer at breakfast, lunch and dinner. My fiancee is quite a fussy eater but she always found something to eat. We were pleasantly surprised with the way the food was constantly being replenished. The restaurant staff, in particular Ricardo were fantastic! They were always on hand to clear used plates away and also keep our drinks topped up. One of the nicest things the hotel did for us was on my fiancee's birthday. The room cleaners decorated our room with balloons and later in the evening they brought us a bottle of sparkling wine and 2 glasses to celebrate her birthday. Overall we were very impressed and we really, really, really enjoyed our stay at the RIU Playacar and would not hesitate in recommending it to anybody! We both hope to return in the very near future!! It was perfect in every way! xx

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ToesInTheSand23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar Sept. 25-Oct. 3. It's a smaller resort than some but that made it very nice. Did not have to fight to chairs by the beach. No palapas on the beach but a grove of palm trees which provided plenty of shade. You just have to move your chair around a lot if you want to stay in the shade. Very few Americans, many Europeans staying here. Large beautiful beach so we NEVER went to the pool, so I can not say how it was. The 2 pools (one activity pool and one quiet pool) had plenty of palapas for shade. Food at the resort was very good. Three restaurants + one buffet. The Steakhouse is open everynight. The Asian and Mexican Restaurants rotate on a nightly basis. Asian was probably our favorite. Be sure and ask for the fried ice-cream for dessert--Very good. Sushi was great. The other 2 were also very good. Fajitas were great at the Mexican. At the Steakhouse, I tried the Land and Sea KBob, with shrimp and steak. It was very good. I had a ribeye one night. It was good but just not the kind that we are used to. Food at the buffet, was also very good. We usually aren't much for buffets, but at there, twice and at each of the restaurants twice. We were in Room 3116--a ground floor room that faces the main walkway that runs between the front desk and the beach. There are 6 buildings. Our first room we were assigned was #1310. After looking at it and stepping out on the balcony, I went to the front desk and politely requested a different room. It was on 3rd floor of the backside of the first building closest to the frontdesk. Right next door to an extremely LOUD room (generator or something?) of the resort next door. Extremely loud. They were very gracious and gave me 2 keys to rooms to go check out and choose the one I wanted. I realize that if the resort was full they might not have given me this option but it worked out. I personally would also not want a room on the backside of buildings #1, #3, or #5. There is a pathway going down the area that is used as a service sort of walkway. Staff pushing carts of glassware, etc., makes it very noisy also. Building #5 is the closest to the theater so it might be a little loud when the show goes on at night (9:45 p.m.) No oceanview or poolview at the resort due to the way the rooms are situated unless the couple of suites on the ends of Buildings #5 & #6 have one but I wouldn't think you could see through all the trees. As stated previously, the beds are extremely hard. We did request the egg crate mattress pad but, to be honest, I don't know that it helped. Refrigerator in room kept stocked with Pepsi products, Dos Equis, club soda, orange soda and water. Above the mini bar, was a cabinet with bottles of rum, Vodka, tequila and something else that you could add to your drinks or whatever. Took us a couple of days to figure out the A/C...Couldn't turn it all the way up or it wouldn't come on, had to be set around 73, I think, for it to run. Small shopping center across the street has a few necessities in case you are in need plus the usual touristy items to take home as gifts. Merchants were very nice. One word of warning, though, there is a man with 2 spider-monkeys asking to take your picture with a monkey. One of the monkeys bit a young lady that we had visited with at dinner one night. I think I'll clear stear of the monkeys! We thoroughly enjoyed our 8 days at this resort. Would I go back? Yes..but then again, we don't usually do trips to the same resort. Too many out there to try out!

Reviews.Title: “great week”
Reviews.Author: peter d
Reviews.Content: the best animacion,have travels alot their the best.alex,karla,maria,the hold gang of animacion.very clean,staff excellect,food very good.will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for the price!”
Reviews.Author: StLouis_beachbum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from RIU Playacar last week. We stayed 5 nights and this was our fifth trip to Mexico/Cancun but our first time to Playa Del Carmen. We had read reviews on trip advisor prior to booking, so we pretty much knew what to expect. It was worth it and we are so glad we booked despite some of the negative comments. We are not the fancy/luxury type, so perhaps our expectations were right on. Atmosphere: The beach is the best we've seen so far in Mexico. The beaches in the resort strip of Cancun fail in comparison to the beauty of Playa Del Carmen. The resort is quaint and very laid back. The staff work the pool area to get people involved, but in general this is a nice, quiet resort. If you are looking for a party atmosphere, a different resort is better for you. However, if you are looking for a relaxed environment where the staff is happy serve you, this is it. Food/drinks: We were very satisfied with all of the food options at RIU Playacar. The steakhouse is nice, and we really enjoyed the asian restaurant. Make sure to get your reservations early in the morning at breakfast. The buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner had a wide variety to choose from and we had no complaints whatsoever. The bartenders at the lobby bar and the swim up bar make sure you have a drink in hand at all times, and often get you your next drink before you have to ask for another. The only complaint we had was that there isn't beach service, so if you are enjoying the sun by the beautiful ocean on one of the resorts many beach chairs, you have to walk up to the bar to get your drinks yourself. We saw several people that had brought their own mugs, and that seemed to be a good idea. Rooms: As expected, the beds are pretty hard. We asked the front desk clerk on our first day for a mattress pad/cushion for the bed. She didn't seem to know what we were talking about, but had us write down our request. When we returned to the room later that day, someone had put a pad on the beds. We knew ahead of time that the rooms did not have "true" king beds. RIU could really improve upon their rooms if they just changed the beds because two doubles pushed together does not equal a king. It was okay though, small in comparison to the beauty and service of the resort. The room was cleaned daily, and we recommend leaving a few dollars by the sink each morning because the staff really appreciate it and they work hard for little to nothing. Also, we left quarters in the refrigerator and by doing so got extra cerveza and water. They only service the room drinks every two days, but if you track down the carts you can ask for extra water any day. We recommend visiting the other RIU properties in the area. The RIU Yucatan is about a 10 minute walk from the Playacar and has a great outdoor bar. Also, the show at the Yucatan is outstanding and more spectacular than the Playacar! There is a singer that performs with the dance group at the Yucatan and she is very good. We ate lunch at the Yucatan one day, and we actually preferred the buffett at the Playacar because it seemed to have more variety and options than our visit to Yucatan's lunch buffett. We also recommend taking a walk down the beach to the undeveloped, natural beach. It is gorgeous and very secluded. It takes about 30 minutes from the RIU Yucatan, but so worth the walk/time once you get there. WIFI in the lobby is a nice feature, we spent many most mornings and evenings in the lobby using our laptop. There is also shopping right across the street if that is your thing. Overall, we were very pleased and are looking forward to visiting Playa Del Carmen again!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: jmckib
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Playa del Carmen, Mexico from 9/24-10/1/2011. We went via an Apple Vacations package out of Cincinnati and stayed at the Riu Playacar. We arrived at the hotel at 1:30 and were able to check in to our room immediately. We got our room keys, which are real keys, not electronic cards and the key to the room safe, again, not electronic, a real, old fashioned key. They gave us one lanyard so you may want to bring one of your own if multiple people will be using the keys. We stayed together almost the entire week so we just used the one key. Ours was the standard Riu room. We did not opt for the Jr. Suite upgrade. The room was pretty big with a king sized bed with 2 nightstands, a small table and 2 chairs, a desk and dresser. The bathroom was big with a single sink, mini fridge and Riu liquor dispenser (4 flavors of cheap liquor which we never used), a giant closet which held the safe. The shower stall was pretty big with a curtain. The water pressure was good although the temperature was subject to change without notice. The mini fridge had 2 liters of water which we used for brushing our teeth and taking pills since the tap water is not potable. It also had some Dos Equis beers, some Pepsis, 7-Ups, Orange Soda and Club Soda. We would leave the housekeeper notes asking for specific drinks and they always honored our request. The room was nice but showed some signs of wear and tear. A couple of the tiles had cracks, some of the grout lines were a little worn and some of the woodwork showed some wear. The ceiling had a couple of cracks in the stucco. It wasn’t terrible but could just use a little freshening up. The TV had a lot of channels. Most were in Spanish or had Spanish subtitles. There as an ABC and NBC channel from Miami and a Mexican WB channel than had an odd mix of reruns like Friends as well as some new programs from a variety of US networks. There was a CNN Headline News channel in English and a very strange Fox News offering that had shows starting at stopping at random times. The TV itself was about a 26” CRT type set. I wish the remote had a sleep timer but was fine otherwise. As always, the beds were really hard. I love the hard Mexican beds but my wife asked for a mattress pad which was added right away. It was considerably softer. Our room was #5316, on the 3rd floor of building 5, closest to the entertainment stage. You could hear the shows at night but it didn’t keep us from sleeping. I’d actually requested a room as close to the beach and pool area as possible and at check-in it seemed that they’d made note of that. There are no elevators so if you don’t like steps you may want to ask to be on a lower floor. The grounds were very well kept. All the trees, shrubs and plantings were immaculate. The walkways were wide and well lighted. They staff in charge of the grounds always seemed to be working on something and were very friendly. The pool area has 2 pools, one where all the activities seem to take place, with a swim up bar, and another that is quieter. The quieter pool was big enough and seemed to be so little used that it was easy to swim laps if you wanted. The more active pool had Aqua-size sessions, Water Volleyball and Polo and other activities every day. The swim up bar also had a walk up side. The beach at the Riu Playacar is very nice. The sand was a little coarse so it didn’t stick to you as badly as some really fine sands do. There is lots of shade under palm trees. There were always plenty of lounge chairs. We were told that occupancy was low so it could be harder to find a good spot in busier times. The sand was not hot so it was easy to walk on but it’s not a great walking beach because doesn’t have a wide, smooth, hard surface like you find of some beaches. The water was super clear and a very nice temperature. The Riu Playacar offers kayaks, Hobie Cats, and snorkeling gear for guests to use free of charge. There are vendors on the beach who offer parasailing and jet skis for a fee. We weren’t interested so we didn’t ask about the price. There are other vendors who roam the beach, selling mostly silver jewelry or Cuban cigars. I’d be very doubtful of the authenticity of either. They weren’t too pesky and were easy to wave off if you weren’t interested. The food overall was good. Breakfast and dinner are both served in the main dining room just off the lobby. Lunch is offered at an open air restaurant adjacent to the pools and beach area. There are also 2 specialty restaurants, a steakhouse and an Asian place, that you can go to once per week. We ate at the steakhouse and it was not bad. They offer 4-5 different entrees and everything else, salad, sides and dessert, is the same. Breakfast was good and about the same every day. They had cereals, an assortment of cold cuts, cheeses and fruits, as well as bacon, sausages, fried potatoes and pancakes. Lunch was also pretty unchanging day to day. There were hamburgers and hot dogs as well as a big salad bar. They always had some Mexican offering along with some pastas. Some of the foods seemed a little odd or out of place. But they do cater to a lot of Europeans and South Americans so things are a little different. It seemed odd to us that they’d have cold cuts at breakfast but not for lunch. They also had a soft serve ice cream machine. Various juices, coffee and soft drinks (Pepsi products but 7-Up instead of Sprite and no Mt. Dew) and beer were available in the lunch and breakfast area. Dinner in the main buffet dining room seemed to usually have a theme. One night was Mexican, another was Seafood and another was Asian. There was a huge variety of things to eat. There were soups and hors d’ oeuvres, salads, bread of all kinds. They had a carving station with various side dishes close by. They also had a sort of kids corner that always had pizza, hamburger and hot dogs and spaghetti. They had a big variety of desserts and an ice cream freezer with 8-10 different flavors. Some of the theme nights appealed to me more than others but I don’t see how you could ever be in danger of not finding something you’d like. The quality of the food was good to very good, 4 or a scale of 1-5. We enjoyed drinks at all the bars. The beer on tap was Dos Equis. I didn’t see any other kind of beer anywhere in the resort. The selection of liquor was good, not great, with usually 1 or 2 name brands. For example, they offered Jim Beam or Early Times bourbon, good booze but nothing premium. The bartenders were not stingy. I always got a healthy portion in all drinks I had. They made a pretty good Pina Colada and my wife said that the other blended drinks she tried were good too. There was entertainment every evening. Many nights there was something going on in the lobby outside the main dining room. One night they had a band, another night there was a singer and another a traditional Mexican trio. Each night at 9:45 they put on a show in the theater. We went to a couple of these. One in particular, The Movie Show, had some pretty good dancers interpreting various movie musicals. We were surprised to learn that The Matrix was a musical as it was featured in one dance number. Other shows were a little weak and we left early. The Vegas Show had some showgirls but not much else in the way of Vegas references, no Elvis, no Rat Pack, no Wayne Newton or Liberace. The Animation Team at the Riu Playacar did a great job of interacting with the guests and keeping things lively. It always amazes me how these kids work so hard for what seems like about an 18 hour day and always be so upbeat. They really do seem like they’re having fun. Having been to this area 2 other times we did no excursion or side trips of any kind. I walked into town one morning, moseyed around and took some photos. I bought 2 Cokes and took a cab back to the hotel since it was hot. All told my wife and I spent about $15.00. Here are my pros and cons of the Riu Playacar: Cons: • I hate shampoo and body wash in those little envelopes. They are difficult to open with dry hands and just about impossible when you’re in the shower. Why not go with a refillable pump dispenser in the shower? It would have to be cheaper and would produce virtually no waste compared to all those little packets that get used daily. • The service in the main dining room was inconsistent. One day we’d get a waiter who was very attentive about clearing plates or bringing drinks. The next time, we ended up stacking dirty plates on the table next to us and getting our own refills. We thought maybe we were giving off some signal that said “don’t approach us” but we couldn’t figure out what it was. • On our departure day we’d requested a wake up call that never came. We had set the alarm clock in the room as well as a cell phone alarm for backup. • It was nice that they offered Wi Fi in the lobby but they should really crank up the bandwidth. Some nights it was almost impossible to get a web page to open. It was always very slow, especially when there were a lot of users. The shadow of the service area was confined strictly to the lobby. It didn’t even work in the dining room or just outside the lobby. Pros: • The staff was great. Everyone was friendly and cheerful. Even when it was spotty, as in the dining room, I didn’t feel like they staff was lazy or didn’t care. It seemed like someone was mistaken about who was responsible for us. The front desk was helpful; the housekeepers did a great job. No complaints about the staff at all. • I felt like the value of the trip was excellent. We got a very good low season price. The air travel was smooth and hassle free and the resort had everything we wanted. • Playa del Carmen is a beautiful spot. The weather was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Didn,t want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: patsky22
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Sept 18th-25th only bad part is we had to leave and come back to reality the hotel grounds,rooms and staff were all wonderful beach was excellente this was our first alinclusive that we pretty much were on the beach from morning till late afternoon palm tree,s for shade instead of palapas was great funny to watch everyone move there loungers allday to get shade or sun including us.The food was great no complaints there never had to take imodium or zantac and being able to have the use of three sister resorts was also wonderful.The evening shows were also great went to all which was a first the entertainment staff work very hard all day then at night!!!Now for the bar staff Ramos,Charlie,Daniel,Friuedious(think thats how it,s spelt if not sorry) and dear sweet Nancy were all welcoming and fun watch out for those teqiula slammers!!!Rooms were always nicely cleaned love the animals on the beds .The only complaint I would say pillows are alittle firm or flat I like soft my other half no problem and our room was 1204 on the service side of the resort next door and the walk way to and from for the employees between the 2 reastuarants and show theater besides would we return deffinately planning next April usually try another but loved this one being able to walk around the area outside the resort within the other resorts was great also a market across the street alittle pricey but found that even on 5th from last time we were the last April all in all Excellente!!!!! P.S. Worst thing is we left our camera on the table at the show on the saturday night before we left he thought I had it and visa versa Enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Denise W
Reviews.Content: We've been to Mexico at least 20 times in the past 8 years or so & always stay in 4 star (or above) resorts. This was our first time to stay at this resort. It is our new favorite!! The beach was beautiful, one of the best I've seen. The grounds looked very tropical and were very well kept. The food was excellent and had lots of variety. Loved the shows too. I thought the rooms were very nice and most important, very clean. The staff was very friendly & helpful. Absolutely no complaints here!!! After reading the other review I almost changed hotels. Very glad I didn't. Had a wonderful time and will book this hotel from now on if it is available!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jb12182
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews I felt are not true I decided to write my own. This hotel is a very nice hotel for the money. It is better than the riu tequila, yucatan. The food was good, location was very good. The rooms were standard but really who care about the room when all your time should be spent outside. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I think people expect way too much from these hotels and they are never and will never be satisfied. If you want a reasonable hotel for a good price stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohamad M
Reviews.Content: Had a great vacation there! The staff were great, the food was good and the stay was unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: Sammy410
Reviews.Content: Don't know how anyone can slate this place, one of the best holidays ive ever had. Firstly i was close to cancelling my holiday after reading these reviwes in the end decided to see for myself and glad i did so. The hotel was really nice not too big but big enough for us everything was clean (NO cockroaches,spiders in bathrooms) as people have prieviously mensioned in fact the bathroom was great very big the shower could problery fit 3people! toilet had a seprate door for more privacy and a huge mirror there with a mini bar which was re-stocked every 2 days (all free of charge) the rooms was big two big double beds lots of storage, balcony, beds yes are a little on the hard side but arnt all beds when you go on holiday!?! nothing to cry about. The food was lovley you had a buffet breakfast every morning so much choice cereal, bacon, eggs, fruit, hams, cheeses, pastries(crossiants muffins...) pancakes, fried bananas, porridge etc also made there own smoothies which was very nice. Dinner again buffet different made soups everyday, cassoroles, stews, different veg, pizza's, pasta's, chips, different meats to make your own fajitas, salad, cakes, ice cream etc. Evening meal another big buffet or you have choice of 3 restaurants (Steak, Mexican, Asian) all 3-4 course meals. Steak was our favourite you could choose from steak, ribs, ckicken, skewers all very nice. Mexican you could have fajitas chicken pork beef another good menu. Asian was buffet style basically chinese food spring rolls rice's curry's also had sushi lots to choose from. If you want to go to one of the 3 restaurants (not the evening buffet) you book them at breakfast with waiter eaisly done. Evening wear for men is no t-shirts (not that people took this into notice) and 3 quarter pants are fine. The weather was also good we had a afternoon of thunder + lightning one day but was so glad of it as was still so humid. The pool area was fab! 2 large pool (and they was clean, witnessed this every morning) The staff are fantastic could'nt do enough for you each and every single one of them, could of brought one (mauricio) home with me, he was so nice to us but they all was and do such a good jod. The entertainment staff are brill too Maria, Ruben (so funny), Israile, Alexandar your never bored. They do pool aerobics, football on beach, beach volley ball etc The hotel is litrally located on the beach you can see from the pool. Overall fantastic holiday please don't be put off by these review's, see for yourself i gaurantee you will not be dissapointed. Will be back again soon! :-)

Reviews.Title: “It was a great trip; small problems though”
Reviews.Author: larachristine
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Mexico many times before with my parents and have stayed at other RIU resorts so i felt good about making a reservation here. My boyfriend and i were on a tight budget so that is another reason we chose this resort. As others have stated, the buildings are a little outdated, but the grounds were gorgeous and well kept. I had read on here about the beds, and believe me their not lying-they are the most uncomfertable beds ever! The food wa a bit of a disappointment; as someone who has stayed at other all inclusives, i know the food is not always great but this food seemed worse than other hotels; the "nicer" places to eat for dinner that you make reservations for were delicious however so we ate there instead of the buffet. Overall the staff was fine; small communication problems but overall fine. We booked through apple vacations and our apple rep at the hotel was amazing!!!! overall it was worth the money and we had fun but i will probably stretch my budget next time and go back to the RIU palace.

Reviews.Title: “The Good the Bad and the Not so Ugly”
Reviews.Author: kittybee123
Reviews.Content: The facts. The Riu playacar is a little outdated. However, it does offer its charm. It is right on the beach and if the price is right... do not think about it. The beach is beautiful and the staff is very nice and accomodating. The hotel rooms do smell a little moldy and the sheets on the beds are old and un appealing. Once you get over that, it is a great place and it is very relaxing. I was able to book for the restaurants everytime and did not have a problem. The bugs were out of control. I have blisters everywhere from them so take OFF or any other bug spray because if you are prone to bites, they will eat you alive. The hotel is good and and there are really no complaints. I have stayed at the RIU Lupita and also at this one and RIU Ocho Rios in Jamaica. The RIU in Jamaica was much more "fancier". This hotel and the Lupita are like a 3 and a half star hotel. Know what to expect, this is not a luxury hotel but it is your moneys worth. Tip It can get expensive to go to the "La Quinta" Fifth Avenue for shopping. You can walk about 2 blocks to the beach club that is next to the Riu Palace and the Riu Lupita shuttle can drop you off at the Rotonda that is 1 block away from there for free. Tip the driver and you will have saved some money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing 5 days”
Reviews.Author: matt10e
Reviews.Content: We took the Apple Vacation package from St. Louis to Cancun. We were greeted at our St. Louis airport. When we arrived we were put in a comfortable bus and taken to our hotel with a few stops along the way to drop off other passengers at their hotels. When we arrived check in was quick. We took our luggage to our 2nd floor room which when we first entered smelled a bit musty from some recent rains. As other people have written our bed was hard so we asked for the waffle cushion to be put on our bed which was promptly. There were always 3 large bottles of water in our refrig ever day. The food at all the resturants were more than adequate. We never had any trouble getting to the resturant of our choice. My wife had her birthday while there and they made her a whole chocolate cake, which we gladly shared with others that were sitting near us. When it came time to get back to airport a van took six of us from our hotel directly to the airport non stop. So that was cool. The one thing I wished I knew was that they post in the lobby the things the hotel offers that day. ie yoga classes, pool excersise, ping pong tourney, but I did not see it until the second last day. I would liked to have participated more in them. So look for the bulletin board in the lobby for the fun things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Goralka1994
Reviews.Content: we just come back from Riu Playacar resort and I think was great. Lake some other reviews hotel is not perfect and mabey 4 star or apples , but it was great and for me it is worted 5 star. I have been read others reviews and beach is super. It is clean and you can see Cazumel on the other side and big cruseships going there. Very nice in 6 am or late in night. Food was pretty good. I love "riu donats' on brekfast (Riu Jalisco got little better) but i go to RIU hotels just for that. This hotel is very familly frendly, kids feel good there. Nice people. Hotel is clean, nice cleaning people (Hello for Cecilia my kids love her for making all towel animals).Funny animation team especialy Ruben.We realy got good and feeeeetttt time there. We are thinking to go back next year. Not fency hotel but very good for week of vacation and not to big.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the coast of the Caribbean! !!”
Reviews.Author: Penka G
Reviews.Content: Paradise on the coast of the Caribbean! We visited the Hotel Riu Playacar by 08,28,2011-09,04,2011. The hotel was great, wonderful service, and for the sea and swimming pools have no such words to express my amazement! Beach is very clean, pools, also service, superb restaurants, as they constantly surround smiling people, good and ready to help you for what you want. Food is so many and so diverse and professional chefs and waiters. We spent a fabulous holiday and we were just a little piece of paradise! Thanks for everything we got! Family Georgievi -Bulgarian

Reviews.Title: “Be careful, I was robbed from my room”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: I was robbed from my room, when I reported the incident, the hotel Director did not take any responsibility and only gave me an email address which wiill not respond until 20 days later. Be careful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Meh...We will pay more next time to stay at a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Brandy_n_DW
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was kinda run down and the rooms...omg....We called it the Motel 6 of Mexico. They were very small and the bed was soo small and felt like you were sleeping on boards. I have a bigger TV in my bathroom. lol The bathroom tub was hard to get in and out of and it was moldy and yellow and really gross. The first day we found a boc of condoms in our room (that were not ours!) We told the Apple guy and he want too concerned. The food was meh..Same stuff everyday. If u didnt make a reservation for 1 of the 3 resturaunts by 7am that day, you were out of luck and eating lunch for dinner again at the buffett. My husband and I went for a little getaway and tried to save a few bucks. Next time we will pay more for better accomadations and better food. But if are going to drink and be by the beach, this is your place! Oh, and no elevators for the guests and we stayed on the 3 rd floor...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: amy c
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our honeymoon at Playacar! We could not have asked for a better hotel. The staff were ALWAYS friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The food was good for a buffet style restaurant. William in the restaurant was particularly good as was Ruben, Maria and Alexander from the Entertainment team. The shows were great, but this is a hotel for couples and young families, teenagers would be better in the Tequila. We had no probelms with the matresses, it must just depend on your preferences. The beach was beautiful. Overall a perfect holiday. We will be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu”
Reviews.Author: Christenmg
Reviews.Content: The staff was all very friendly and helpful. The Playacar community was wonderful. I went running/walking a couple days on the main street in Playacar, and it felt very safe. The food at both buffets and the Mexican restaurant was delicious. Alex and Enrique at the pool bar were so accomidating. We saw that a lot of people were drinking from coconuts and asked for them. Alex and Enrique said they were only served on Saturdays at noon, and they were out. The next day, they had coconuts for us! We used the kayaks and body boards available on the beach, which was a lot of fun. The beds at this hotel were the worst I have ever been in. Sooo hard. There is free wi-fi in the lobby that had a decent connection. The entertainment at the theatre on site was not great. All Riu guests can visit the other Riu hotels. The Riu Tequila, which is right across the street from the Riu Playacar has a disco. That was just ok. Only stayed for one drink. This hotel was great overall, and I would definitely stay at a Riu property again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabolous food!!”
Reviews.Author: Diana A
Reviews.Content: Upon reading some of the other reviews I was a bit reluctant when I arrived at the hotel. I am very happy that I didn't take all those reviews into consideration. Yes the hotel is a bit outdated (room keys are on a key chain not actual card keys, your safe is actual a lock with a key) they both work perfectly fine but if your the type of person that needs everything up to date & just plain fancier then the small details might bother you. The food was soooo good. Ive stayed at five star hotels where the food selection/service/taste wasn't as good as the Playacar. I can't say enough about the staff, they were amazing!! The Hotel was constantly busy yet the staff always helped to get us a drink or what ever else we needed. If you want to eat to the "nicer" restaurants they have, they start taking reservations as early as 7am so make them early. With that said the steak house is great, and their Asian restaurant is great as well. Beach is amazing! My only complaint was that the beds/pillows/sheets were definitely not comfy. My room was freezing but my friends next door had a warmer room that just never cooled off as much as ours did. This is a great deal!! and you get to enjoy the other two hotels as well!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service from this all inclusive resort!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureTraveler41
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this resort from 8/5-8/11/2011. This resort offers very good service. The buffets are outstanding and the choices are plentiful. You will find something if not several things that you will enjoy eating. The service in the restaurants is very good. As soon as you sit down, they are right there, asking for your drink orders and they are very attentive to your needs. This doesnt always happen at all inclusives. I think this hotel offers some of the best service I have witnessed in the restaurants at an all inclusive. This hotel is an older property. However, it's very well kept. The bathrooms are very clean and modern with nice tile floors and a marble vanity area. Yes, there are plenty of newer hotels you could stay at, but for the price, this hotel is a nice value. The beach at this property is amazing. It's a wide beach area with white sugar sand and lined with palm trees. You can find plenty of shady area's where you could curl up with a book under a palm tree, or you could drag your chair out from underneath the palm areas and have exposure to full sun. The water color here is blue blue crystal clear water. There are not rocks as you are walking into the water. It's soft sand and just a georgous beach! Most beaches in the Playa Del Carmen area are very nice. This one is one of the best beaches. They do offer exchange privledges with the Riu Tequila (across the street) and the Riu Yucatan (a few hotels down). Here is my only criticism. This hotel is by far the smallest out of the Riu's in the Riviera Maya. We traveled with our two children ages 14 and 16. They were very bored in the evening. They are just a little too old to enjoy the shows. During the day they were fine, they kept busy with poolside games and beach activities. The evening entertainment is non existant for teenage kids. You have to walk across the street to the Riu Tequila where they have a sports bar. It's a total rip off. They want $3 a table to play a game of pool. It's a racket, because they know there is nothing else for kids that age to do. So you will end up spending a lot of money in the game room to keep kids of that age entertained. Other than that, they can watch tv, or go to bed. I feel the Riu could offer something for them to do in the evenings. They could have games for them to use. Chess, Checkers, more ping pong tables for night play for their ages. They were very bored. If we didnt have the kids we would have been fine. For teens though, virtually NOTHING for them to do in the evenings without you spending money. Other than that, this is a solid 1st class hotel. Beautiful grounds and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased”
Reviews.Author: bob31924
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, i was very reluctant to book my stay here but in the end price won me over . I can honestly say it was one of my best vacations yet !! the resort grounds were beautiful, the ocean / beach perfect, the food wonderful !

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar, definitely worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: BevoBoomer
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Playa del Carmen from July 21-25 with another couple at stayed at the Riu Playacar. Although we had read some negative reviews, we all decided to go with an open mind, and glad we did. Even though we experienced some things that could be improved upon, none of them were a deal breaker for us. I will begin with the rooms, they were exceptionally clean upon arrival and stayed that way throughout the trip, the room staff did a great job of cleaning the room every day and even left us a towel animal every day!! The next part is the food, the breakfast buffet was awesome, there was not anything we ate that was bad. The lunch buffet was hit or miss, for us anyways, but we still found something to eat. We even visited Riu Tequilla and Riu Yucatan for lunch and there food was great. The dinner buffet was also very good, great selection of food and always fresh. We did eat at the steakhouse one night and it was delicious, but keep in mind that it is outdoors and during July it was hot. On to the outdoors, the pool was fantastic, and the beach was even better. We did partake in the kayaks one day, all non-motorized water sports are included, and the kayak was an adventure if you have never done one..hahaha. The staff, what can I say, there was not one staff member that we came across that did not have a smile on their face!! There were 2 in our mind that really stood out, one of them was Adriana, she was a bartender in the bar at Turquesa. The other one was Alberto at the poolside bar, both of these employees went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. One thing I will recommend, take your own insulated cup, the ones that they serve drinks in are about 8oz. We went across the street to the market and did find some plastic cups, with lids and straws that were 28oz and the bartenders were more than happy to fill them up!! All in all, we had a fantastic trip and are already planning our next vacation for Oct 2012!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would return”
Reviews.Author: caldispatcher
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here. The people were nice, and very helpful. Food was good and there were plenty of people to assist if needed. The beds are hard but if you need, go to the desk and ask and they will provide foam padding (we slept like babies once we got it!!). Small bar and fridge in the room, on the beach, fun fun fun! (Actually stayed in March 2010, but not in the drop down box!)

Reviews.Title: “"This was a nice exceptionally kept hotel"”
Reviews.Author: shelleytudin
Reviews.Content: The resort was quite beautiful as are most of the riu hotels in playa del carmen. Visiting in October is quite warm. 'This resort is topless so you may not want to travel here with your family. The food was good but there is only a few restaurants to chose from. When you pay at one riu you can dine at all 4 playa del carmen hotels in the playacar complex. The Riu Tequesa, and the Riu Palace and the newer 51/2 Riu hotel have great food with alot of restaurants you can choose from. Book the restaurants in advance. We went swimming one day at the Tequesa and shopping at the other riu hotel located next door to the riu playacar.(can't remember the other riu hotel name). We had a great time here, met so many nice people from Canada and the US. I would definatly go back to this hotel. The beach was fabulous and the colour of the water was like no other place I have been.

Reviews.Title: “Been here twice -- it is perfect and very well priced”
Reviews.Author: findbrian
Reviews.Content: Visited the RIU Playacar inside the Playacar sanctuaryin Playa del Carmen in 2007 for our honeymoon. Liked it so much that we returned in 2011 after four years. Still loved it. The price was excellent, the RIU folks are top-notch and the beach was...incredible. Very well done, and we're thinking another trip to this same resort in the near future. Highly suggested if you're looking to avoid the busy-ness of Cancun and want a getaway in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, good buffet, bad restaurants”
Reviews.Author: When-I-Go-I-Review
Reviews.Content: Let me start the review by saying I have been to a Riu resort in the past and I had a great time both times. This is my sixth time at an all-inclusive and my fourth to Riviera Maya, so I have some experience. I have stayed at Riu Bambu (D.R.), Xcaret, Ocean Bavaro(D.R.), H10 Ocean Coral & Turquesa, Dreams Tulum, and now Riu Playacar. The Riu Playacar has a couple of things going for it. First the location is central Riviera Maya, about 5 minutes from Playa Del Carmen and close to the Ferry in Cozumel. Because of this, you will find some of the best excursions and Scuba diving in Mexico. The beaches are pristine, probably the most beautiful and calm that I have ever seen. There are no reefs off of the beach and very few debris when going in and out of the water. The main buffet was generally good, better than most resorts I have been to. They had a wide variety of foods, including American and European fare. I can honestly say I didn't throw much away because I liked most of it. I can also say I did not get sick the entire time I was there -- a first for any resort. The snack bar was OK standard pool-side fare (burgers, fries, chips, etc). However, there are many things this resort can improve upon. First, do not be fooled by claims that they have theme restaurants, or that you can share the other resorts ameneties. You were only allowed to eat dinner at your own resort. Riu Playacar had three "themes", one steakhouse, one Mexican, and one asian. We were confused the first night trying to find the steakhouse, because it was combined with the Mexican on the lunch buffet (not air conditioned). Their idea of a theme restaurant was a different colored tablecloth, and that meant a different restaurant. The asian did have its own separate space, but it was just a buffet! It was the only air conditioned place aside from bathrooms and bedrooms in the entire resort. They served carnival-style fried vegetables with every theme meal, which was strange. The salads were terrible. The asian was acceptable. The steakhouse only let you choose your entree -- the appetizers and dessert were standard. Overall I would give the theme restaurants a 3/10. Do not come here unless you plan to eat at the buffet a lot. The entertainment was good, but nobody showed up! They have a themed Michael Jackson show, Mariachis, and the general entertainment crew shows. Later on our trip we found out where everybody was each night because they have the same shows on different nights -- Riu Tequila across the street. Other issues with this resort: The beds were hard as a 4 inch stack of towels on a cement floor. The "king" bed was two doubles pushed together. There was a constant gap between us, although we didn't mind since we would just snuggle up on one side or the other. It also didn't hurt that there was unlimited liquor bar in your room and that certainly could help a person to sleep. The TV was a standard definition at about 24 inches. Loud fire alarms went off every single night. When we questioned the desk about this, they said everything was OK. I'm glad there were no fires or we would have been in trouble. The Scuba diving instructors were awesome especially Javier and Pancho. However, please know that they do not actually have their own scuba boats. When you want to dive, you take a nice hike 2 resorts or so to the south to the Wyndham. They are not cheap either, about $15 higher than other resorts I have been to. I mentioned previously that the beaches are pristine, and they are. There are plenty of people during the day and night due to the central location, so don't try to sneak in any skinny dipping (we contemplated this on a full moon). There is another problem with the location: right next door is a jet-ski rental place, so all day there are jet skis in and out from where you are swimming. Jet-ski and motor boat fumes were almost constant during the day, and this really annoyed me. The water in the resort could use some extra chlorine. I could often smell sewer stench in the outside showers and only smelled it once on the showers in the room. Dos Equis is the standard beer, which is good enough for me. They do have top shelf liquors but rarely serve them unless requested. The tequila here is not good. I have been to tequila tasting in Dreams Tulum and they provided interesting and good aged tequilas. Riu's idea of tequila tasting was flavoring cheap mezcal tequila with different types of fruits. On a lighter note, I am from Pittsburgh so we know our ketchup (Heinz). The ketchup here is horrendous so bring your own. Overall, I had a good time as would be expected with a beatiful beach, happy and relaxed wife, unlimited drinks, food, and entertainment. However maybe I'm becoming a bit spoiled. I know what to look for, so I will not be back to this resort or the others we visited (Tequila, Playacar, Yucatan).

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt fault Rio Playacar”
Reviews.Author: scarlettpolo
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and we loved it . The weather could have been better we had a few rainy days but we booked knowing there was a fair chance of this.After we had booked negative reviews were appearing on tripadvisor which got me really worried ie reports of Bed Bugs! I got myself all worked up but I can honestly say we had no bad experiences on this score. Our room was on the 2nd floor right hand side last block near the Theatre the bed was not too hard, was definatly big enough, the room didnt smell and plenty of storage space. The beach and pool area was great ,food plenty of choice and staff very friendly a particular mention about Nancy and Ramos in the lobby bar and Adriana at the swim up bar , were very friendly.We used facilities at Yutican and Tequila and hired a cycle and rode to Lupita but think we made the right choice in Playacar. Cannot understand some of the negative reports its as if these people stayed at a differant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A laid back experience”
Reviews.Author: sandman_47
Reviews.Content: We are traveling here again on August 9/2011. It will be the second time for my wife, my youngest daughter(19) and myself. My other 2 daughters(ages 22 and 25) and one of thier boyfriends are also going with us at the same time. This will be thier 3rd time to this resort . We have been to many of mexico's destinations but this one has become our "go to resort". We have been to Acapulco, la paz, cancun, etc.. but we just love this one. Probably because we like to feel like we are in mexico here and not on the cancun strip which is just miles and miles of hotels. This place is not too touristy..if thats a word...Stayed at the Palace hotels, cancun palace, moon palace...etc. And they are great places to go for a vaction and would recommend those over this resort if its your first trip to mexico. But this hotel is charming. Doesnt feel like your staying at a mega resort even though you are. Most complaints reported here i agree with "somewhat" but there isnt any resort in mexico that has some deficencies. Also you have to take into concideration that we are only paying for myself, my wife and youngest daughter and no one else. The other 3 , paid thier own way and booked thier vacations at the same time as ours because they love this place as well. The biggest bonus to this hotel is that you dont feel like your staying at mega resort, even though you are. Two other RIU resorts are within walking distance so you can change things up a bit if you want. Also there are shops right across the street from the hotel to buy everything you need, let alone playa del carmen is a very short distance away with hundreds of shops, mcdonalds, senior frogs...etc. Love this place for thier hospitality, wild parrots in the trees and just alot of fun!!!!!....We have been to Italy and everywhere inbetween but as far as mexico goes....if you just want a laid back experience, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service!”
Reviews.Author: pubprof
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to an all-inclusive resort and it was a great experience. The resort is beautiful, peaceful, and well-maintained. The staff are friendly and efficient, the food is excellent, and the beach is beautiful. I've read comments from travellers complaining about the food and I don't understand them. Although if you only eat hamburgers, hot dogs, and chicken nuggets then, yes, these are not the best items on the menu. However, there is an unlimited supply of fresh fruit and vegetables, fresh fish, chicken, beef and a large variety of desserts. If you want to eat healthily, it's available. If you want to gorge yourself, that's easy, too! Each night there was a special entree along with sveral other "standard" entrees like grouper, grilled chicken, steak, etc. For breakfast the smoothie bar is great and there are plenty of options from bacon and eggs to dry cereal to oatmeal to fresh donuts. The coffee was excellent. Our family of four never had a bad meal and we all have varied preferences. We tipped the waitstaff a few bucks at each meal and they treated us like royalty. The rooms were very nice: Spacious and clean. We had connecting rooms which worked out very well. The housekeeping service was excellent. I have never seen a maid lying on the floor mopping under a bed before! The room was spotless. As people have mentioned, the beds are very hard. I liked them but you can request mattress toppers. The pillows are small so we requested extras. The beach is clean and beautiful with plenty of lounge chairs. The bar is close by and they also bring drinks down to the beach to hand out. Very nice. With regard to drinks, they are small but our solution was to request two at a time. The alcohol is certainly not top shelf but the drinks were delicious. Dos Equis beer taps are everywhere so beer is not an issue. As far as tipping goes, we gave the bartenders a dollar or two about half the time and they were very appreciative. My only complaints: 1. The room keys are standard metal keys with the room number stamped on it. This is a major security issue. We lost one of our keys and it was never found so we had to have the room lock changed. The room locks should be upgraded to card-keys or keyless entry devices especially at a beach resort where you don't want to carry keys around. 2. the in-room safe has a removable lock cylinder that you are issued upon check-in along with the safe key. It is very awkward to manipulate the lock cylinder. These safes should be upgraded to keyless entry. 3. The fitness center is located at an adjacent RIU property. It is a very sad fitness center: very few pieces of aerobic equipment, the facility is very small, the weight machine was missing components. It really needs to be upgraded and it would be nice to have the fitness center located on the RIU Playacar property. Overall, we all loved the place and we would definitely return if we have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal for the price!”
Reviews.Author: sshepher11
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star hotel, but a very good value for the price! The pool seems outdated/old, and I was surprised how early the swimup bar closed (they were gone by 5:30pm every day) but the beach was awesome, that is where we spend the majority of our time anyway! My kids loves the nightly shows in the outdoor theatre, they did a great job with those productions! Food was for the most part good, the best restaurant was the chinese one, that fried ice cream dessert was wonderful!! We also walked down a couple of hotels to the Rui Yucutan, and it had a much larger/nicer pool area, same quality of food in the restaurant there for lunch. Same wonderful beach! All in all, for an all inclusive resort, it was worth what we spent on it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: misstraveller1
Reviews.Content: I went to the Riu Playacar late May for 2 weeks with my boyfriend. I checked the reviews on all the hotels in Playacar for a while and nearly booked the Yucatan. I'm so glad i didn't and chose the Playacar instead as it's a smaller hotel and everything is so close. We were in the pink block, the last one on the left hand-side when walking down to the pools. Our room was better than expected. Cleaned everyday, with a mini bar and fridge loaded every other day. We did ask for a pad mattress on arrival as bed was a bit hard and that really helped. The food at the restaurants was great. I'm not a big fan of buffets and can be quite fussy but i always found lots of things i liked. The service is absolutely perfect, we did give some tips sometimes but nobody is really waiting for it and everyone is happy to serve you with a smile as well!! The entertainment team was cool, we did some activities during the day and would go to the shows most nights as they were really good. My favourite were Michael Jackson and Grease. We went twice to Coco Bongo with the hotels and i really recommend it. You will get an area reserved for the hotel with your own waiter. They do expect tips though so you will need to give them some money at the end of the night. The bars at the hotel are great, the service is really fast and they do remember what you like. We would tip them $1, especially at the pool bar. The pools are nice and cleaned everyday. The water is really hot in the afternoon so we would use them in the morning and go to the beach at the end of the day. We went a few times to Riu Tequila which i really liked.
