It's a shame it's not by the beachfront. The pool over there is great and much bigger, as well as the pool bar. We tried the Yucatan once but didn't like it. Too crowded and looks dated. Excursions: we went to a full day trip to Chitzen Itza. Was great but such a hot day. On an other occasion, we went to Tulum and Hel-Xa in the afternoon but that was too short. I wished we had gone there the whole day as there is so much to do. We didn't book them with our rep as it was nearly double of what we paid. We found cheaper prices accross the hotel. Overall, i would recommend this hotel to anyone, it was a really good trip and as i'm a travel agent, i'm more fussy and exigeant and see lots of little details, and i have to say that Riu Playacar didn't disappoint. It is not a 5* hotel but the service, facilities and staff are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: acitr
Reviews.Content: This resort was very disappointing on many levels. First, we were in a large group with at least 3 people booked in each room. One group was given a room with 1 full size bed! They paid for a double room just like everyone else. When this was brought to the front desks attention, they would not move them until the next day and when they did move them it was too the third floor. Second, front desk staff was very rude as well as other staff throughout the resort. Third, this resort was hot everywhere, the main dining area was so warm it was almost impossible to eat. Fourth, the pool water was warm, but was very beautiful as was the beach area. I could go on and on.... I have been to many resorts throughout mexico and this was by far the most uncomfortable. Despite the hotel the vacation was wonderful, we just will never book at this resort again

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: pkelly21742
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the negative reviews that have been posted. I stayed here July 17th-22nd and absolutely loved it! The staff were extremely hard-working and very friendly and helpful. I never smelled the "staleness" of the room that other reviewers have complained about. The humidity is intense, so of course everything would smell a little damp! Yes, the beds were hard but I did request a foam cover to place over my mattress. That made a world of difference! I never ate at the specialty dinners because the buffet was more than adequate. Plenty of fresh fruit, vegetables, fish, different types of meat, desserts, etc. I was especially impressed by the breakfast buffet. So much to choose from! And if need variety, just walk over to the Riu Tequila or Riu Yucatan to use their dining facilities, bars and pools. It is less than a 5 minute walk to either of the other properties. The beach was absolutely amazing. Clean, warm water and plenty of beach chairs. There is a small marketplace across the street that is comparable to the prices charged in Playa Del Carmen. Plenty of hand-crafted items and souveniers that can be bargained for. Watch out for the time share booth at the marketplace, however. They are persistent! Playacar is within a gated community and I felt completely safe walking between hotels even late at night. I would definitely recommend not letting the negative reviews sway your decision to stay here. I can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Will never visit this resort again”
Reviews.Author: moldham
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this resort to anyone! The beds were like sleeping on rocks, it says double room but its to full size beds pushed together. Rooms were very warm and never got "cold" enough even with ceiling fans on. Some of the staff was very rude and could not communicate enough to even understand when you wanted an extra washcloth. They say they restock fridge and beverages every other day but I asked 3 times on the third day and they finally gave us 2 pepsi and 2 bottles of water and only 2 towel and 2 washclothes for 3 people!! The view and beach was amazing and the swim up bar had great service, the buffets were great, with lots to choose from but other than that I was not impressed!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore Bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: alandt60
Reviews.Content: We 7 of us (3 rooms) must have either been very lucky as we all had good rooms or some of the reviews are a little picky. Yes its a standard set up from reception/restaurant walking down to pool and beach past 6 3 storey blocks of apartments. Rooms big enough, beds arnt the biggest but I am 6 ft 8. First time I have ever had 4 optics in the room, fridge and optics change every 2 days and more if requested, we requested an extra towel and it was there every day. Only downsides I would say and I am being picky now is, no lifts, if your on the 3rd floor its a pain carrying your suitcases, only wifi is in reception and it free but very slow, the individual restaurants arn't worth the effort unless you want it a bit quiet as the food is the same as the restaurant. Overall very good and we all would go again, and most others we spoke to would. Whatever you do through dont go on the Lorry/Truck Safari, its good for 2 hours in the middle out on the boat but its a 10 hour round trip of which approx 6 are travelling on a rutted pot holed trail on a truck with wooden seats.

Reviews.Title: “FALSELY RATED !!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerCritic
Reviews.Content: i have no idea how this hotel got 5 starts, considering the lack of many services that seemed to unavilable and definitely up to a 5 star hotel. I have travelled extensively and would pick a clean, well-run 3 star hotel over this disaster, if it were not for the beach and wonderful water and friendly (but un-trained) staff. Reception was disorganized, they ran out of beach towels more than once during stay, they ran out soda at the bar!, they threw a Coconut party and had one little table for huge crowd and ran out of those as well!, TVs had awful reception and not propertly working, safety deposit boxes looked like they had been broken into! Other RIU hotels had much better ambience and ammenities! They should have their star rating corrected! very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach.......sad hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelduchess25
Reviews.Content: Spent one week for the first time at the Riu Playaycar, I would recommend this resort only for the beach, the hotel itself is very outdated and needs a lot of work done to it, this was a last minute decision to go on holiday and so we did not have enough time to review any locations, the rooms Are smelly and damp, but so are the rooms in most of Mexico, our ceiling light , when turned on, honestly looked like it would fly off any minute so we did not use it after the first night, so it was freezing a/c for the rest of the week, our fridge was supposed to be re-stocked every 2 days, was not done until the 4th, the screen door took all our strenghth to open it every time, but when we were walking around I noticed most other rooms had the same problem, the food leaves a lot to be desired, not much from the buffet to choose from , I've been to a lot better, and only 3 a la carte to choose from We only went to the steakhouse one night, and it was all from the buffet menu!,so only change was you getting personal service.The nightly entertainment was not the best so we would go over to the Riu tequila where it is bigger and more open areas with the local venues selling their merchandise. Much nicer area in all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: jeffstan
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews we were a little worried about our trip. Once we got there we realized there was nothing to worry about. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. We made sure to follow the advice of getting a mattress cover to make the beds a bit more comfortable. If you go to bed early it would be best to stay in building 1 or 2 as they are the furthest from the theater. It is a longer walk to the pool/beach, but not too bad. The food ranged from adequate to pretty good. There was always a variety of foods to choose from. The specialty steak house (the only one we tried) was decent but not worth the wait in our opinion. The buffet was satisfying enough. The beach was amazing and the staff did a great job of cleaning it each evening. Take advantage of the free boogie board and snorkel rentals. They also have kayaks, catamarans, lifejackets, and windsurfing equipment available.

Reviews.Title: “Always happy to return”
Reviews.Author: infogal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here about 7 times. This year we made a different trip. We started off in belize at ambergris caye at The Phoenix. We then flew to corazal and was met by George morales who transported us across both borders and right to our hotel. We already had been in belize for 8 days then stayed 5 more in playa del carmen. We were on the beach by one. Easy and fast check in, changed, grabbed some lunch and on the beach we stayed. On ambergris there is not beach (grassy) and no waves due to the reef. We were so happy to be in the water. For the next 3 days we went downtown and stayed on the beach. We had the same young man who set up our chairs/umbrella/table and brought drinks. We were so close to town (1 block) and would get massages, eat, and head back to beach. The water was amazing. This was a great trip. We met some really nice people. (rachel rey back east).. We look forward to our yearly trip to playa next year either by way of belize or florida. we may try something different.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: cubsfan8169
Reviews.Content: If you our an first timer 2 mexico this place is ok. But 4 experienced travelers this place is a 3star resort. Hope you dont get put on the south side as thats the processing center for the resort next door. Trucks& there back up beepers in & out all day & night, bottles crashing in garbage & best of all the sound of pool pumps running. It make for a really peacefull envirorment not.Then the staff has to be the most unfriendly I have ever stayed at in mexico. This resort was nice 20 years ago very out dated

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, take no notice of bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: CatrionaS
Reviews.Content: Just back from here 2 days ago and decided to write a review due to all the negative reviews! The check-in was excellent, the staff couldn't do enough for you and always did everything with a smile! The room was kept spotless, no complaints. The location was perfect with the beach literally on your doorstep and there are also shops right across the road with a Starbucks! The animation team made the holiday exceptional and worked extremely hard. My only complaint is that the entertainment isn't too varied, much of it is dancing which was excellent but this was a personal preference. As of the food, fantastic! Dont know how anyone could complain, the buffet changed each night, there was even a chocolate fountain. The breakfast had wide variety, and at lunchtime they often had parties with a BBQ which was excellent! Coconut party and beach party was among these! As for the review about the asian restaurant, laughable! It was great, my favourite! Good choice of food, and even got made deep fried ice cream which was delicious! Don't think twice, this hotel was excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbBoston
Reviews.Content: Pros- beautiful beach, nice pool, friendly staff, lots of chairs at beach and pool, easy to eat dinner and lunch- no waiting in ling lines. Quick cab ride to fun night life Cons- hotel rooms smell very badly like mildew, all my my clothes and personal items needed to be aired out when I went home. Towels for room and pool also did not smell clean. No hot water during peak shower times in evening before dinner served. Weird smell by the pool bar. The entertainment at the hotel was loud late into the night which I could see would be annoying if you weren't up late.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful holiday with a great beach location”
Reviews.Author: jimdebs
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic with the beach right on your doorstep and an ideal place to unwind. Anyone who has been to a Riu hotel will know that the staff are always friendly but we found at this hotel the staff were happy to go the "extra mile". They just could not do enough for you. Although far from a new hotel all areas were kept spotlessly clean and the grounds were beautiful. Many of the reviews mention the beds are hard and they certainly are but I have to say we had no problems with them. The selection of spirits available in the room is fairly limited and consisted of local brands. We drink gin which was not available in our room although we eventually were given a bottle at the third time of asking. The buffet (main) restaurant always had a wide choice of food available with a different theme every evening and the quality was excellent, far better than the speciality restaurants particularly the steak house which was very disappointing. Back to the drinks. International brands were available at all bars that also offered a wide range of most enjoyable cocktails which we sampled on a regular basis, have to say however that the wine on offer in this hotel is undrinkable. As we like a nice wine with our meals we switched to Cava only to find that after 3 days it was no longer available so again a bit disappointing. To sum up. This is not really a 5 star hotel, you could perhaps say it was a good 4 star hotel and if you enjoy the beach then it is well worth considering. Both of us would be happy to return especially if they get some decent wine.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in quality”
Reviews.Author: tumble4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar for a week in June, 2011. We booked a junior suite with Ocean View. The suite was directly across from the theater where the entertainment, music, LOUD DJ played until 11:30 or 12:00 pm. Neither daughter could sleep through the noise. We asked to me moved to a different suite but none were available, however, we did downgrade to a regular room. In that room, the shower was broken which we didn't discover until getting ready for dinner reservation. The maintenance staff fixed it, but we missed dinner. The dresser drawer was stuck after my daughter's clothes were in it and again maintenance came and fixed it, but it recurred the next day. We finally removed clothing and stored it back in the suitcase. Both daughters ended up with dozens of mosquito bites due to mosquito's being in the room. I was told that if we had complained to the front desk, they would have given us a plug in to zap the mosquitos but we didn't find out until the last day. The oddest thing is that there were no umbrellas on the beach. We love to spend time on the beach, but need the umbrella as we're all pretty fair skinned and don't want to be in the sun all day. Thus, we had to spend most of the time at the pool which was small, and very loud, but had umbrellas. The "quiet" pool was not at all quiet as a group of 21 arrived, mostly kids, and they used the "quiet" pool, rendering it very noisy. On the positive side, the staff was lovely, friendly, helpful. Of particular note, the entertainment staff was awesome - a woman named Elizabeth ran the Kid's Mini Club and for the first time, my daughter wanted to go to kids club each day -- Elizabeth was amazing with the kids and didn't "babysit" them but engaged them in all sorts of activities. The wait staff were also great. The grounds of the resort were very nice as well. All in all, we would not return to a Riu hotel even though we signed up for their loyalty program before we left as it looked as though they have hotels in many of the places we travel. If the Riu Playacar is indicative of the quality of the hotel, we definitely would not return as we found the overall experience to be sub-par compared to other all-inclusives which we've used previously. Also the fitness center is located at another Riu - a short walking distance but not very convenient at all. The food was mediocre and of the 3 restaurants, only 2 are open each night so you need to be at the lobby at 7:00 am in order to make reservations. The breakfast buffet was good, but lunch and dinner were ho-hum. I would not recommend a Riu hotel, and think you can do much better and spend less money elsewhere. Be very careful before you book at this "resort".

Reviews.Title: “We Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: jennTexas
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better vacation. The resort is made up of 6 tropical colored buildings with a walkway running through the middle. The walk leads down to the beach and 2 large lagoon pools. One pool is for those who like to relax while the other pool has a swim up bar with plenty of activites going on. You are never pressured to join in the games but if you do, you'll have a great time. Felix and Alexx will take care of your drink needs at the pool bar. Don't listen to those people on here who talk about watered down drinks. It just isn't true. The drinks are fantastic. If you need more booze though, just ask. The beach and the pools have plenty of chairs. We went down to the pool late some days and had no problem finding chairs. There are lots of palm trees on the beach so there's plenty of shade if you don't wan to tan. If you go to the beach you will have to walk back to the pool/bar to get drinks but there were many times they brought trays of mixed drinks to the beach and handed them out. You can also take your own large mug and have them fill it for you so you won't have to go back and forth as much. The beach is gorgeous. They have kayaks, jet ski's, snorkel equipment, sail boards etc. All are free of charge except the jet ski's. We went parasailing down there too - $55 per person. The food is very good with lots of choices. You could spend your whole vacation without eating the same thing twice if you wanted but it was so good, we looked forward to our favorites daily. We were lucky enough to have 2 beach barbecues and 2 pool cookouts while there. The beach cookouts had barbecue chicken and ribs and the pool cookouts had lots of seafood - shrimp, fish, prawns, clams all cooked up in large pots over rice. The people who work at the resort are the nicest group of people you could ask for. They always joked around with us and made sure we had the best vacation. A big shout out to Ramos and Nancy at the lobby bar. We had a great vacation and we're looking forward to going back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great .... People really should give this hotel a bit more respect!!”
Reviews.Author: slinky35
Reviews.Content: I have used trip advisor several times before I went on holiday, I read the reviews to this hotel before I left and almost cancelled, if this is your thought please dont!!! This hotel was great the staff are exceptional they will go out of their way for you. This was our honeymoon and we had this best time ever, the rooms were so clean they could have passed an Army inspection (trust me I know). Their cleaners made cute little towel animals everyday. The mattresses that people are moaning about - I have no idea what they sleep on possibly cotton wool, because in my opinion the beds were fine. I have noticed that it is a lot of English speaking people that complain. I will give you the main reason for this, this hotel is for many nationalities if you want to go to an all English, Butlins entertainment please re-book to the Riu Tequila over the road which was awful their drinks were so watered down!! Anyway enough moaning about that Riu Playacar was great, we went to Chichen Itza which was beautiful, well worth the trip, the beach that flowed from the hotel was so pretty and I would like to thank the night barman Enrique he made our holiday enjoyable, And YES WE WILL BE BACK !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can I give the RIU Playacar 3.8 Stars instead of 3.0?”
Reviews.Author: stefanofranco
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, her friend and I stayed at the RIU Playacar for 5 days/4 nights starting on June 12, 2011. Prior to this trip, my wife, daughter and I have been had stayed at the RIU Palace Las Americas in Cancun and my wife and I celebrated our 10th Anniversary at the Grand Palladium Kentenah Resort in Riviera Maya so we had other all-inclusive examples to compare to the RIU Playcar. If you are looking for large swimming pools with 'beds' submerged just below the water level to keep you cool, multiple swim-up bars, a wide variety of specialty restaurants (RIU Playacar has three of which only two were open during our four night stay), a large range of options in the daily breakfast, lunch, dinner and snack offerings or a work-out room, then look into a bigger RIU resort where they will tell you in advance that they offer or specialize in such amenities. Of course those 'extras' will cost you. The RIU Playacar is compact, perfectly situated and a really good value. First, this resort is small and by that I mean you are no more than a 3-4 minute walk from the farthest room to the pool. From your room, you are also no more than 3-4 minutes from the lobby where they offer free WiFi. Those are REALLY good things! Second, this resort is set up for you to roll to the beach with no hassles. From your room, you are no more than a 5 minute walk to the pristine azure beaches which is one of the main reasons to come to Riviera Maya in the first place. That gets me to my third point. The friendliness, professionalism and promptness of the entire service, bar and front desk staff was above, and beyond, expectations. At this RIU, you get MORE than what you pay for and that is called 'value'. Perhaps 'value' is a RIU trademark but I appreciated this resort's polite, quick and thorough responses to my requests nonetheless. Finally, the RIU Playacar is 1.8 miles from Playa Del Carmen's 5th Avenue shopping, shops and restaurants which is a $7.00 cab ride away. This resort is also a 10 minute walk to the RIU Yucatan and RIU Tequila where you will enjoy breakfast and lunch and also pool/beach privileges. This gives you options to change up your vacation 'routine' if you plan to visit more than 4 nights. I took an informal poll of my wife, daughter and her friend as our 4-night vacation wound down. Each of them agreed that the RIU Playacar felt safe and relaxing and that it had an abundance of capable/outstanding staff, excellent performers in their nightly shows and comfortable (ask for the mattress pads before your first night of sleep) and clean rooms. They marveled how easy it was to reach their main goal every day of getting much-prized sun time at the beach/pool and how they didn't feel pressured by beach salesmen hawking faux silver or quasi-Cuban cigars, unlike at some other all-inclusive resorts they'd experienced (and definitely unlike the salesmen in the circus atmosphere of 5th Avenue in Playa Del Carmen). In the same breath, however, they spoke about how much fun it was to leave the resort for shopping in Playa Del Carmen, to go work out a few doors down at a different RIU, to take an excursion or enjoy extra activities elsewhere outside this resort. In sum, at the RIU Playacar, you WILL relax and you WILL enjoy tasty frosty drinks in an idyllic beach setting easily accessible from your room. You will get more than your money's-worth as long as you aren't expecting the amenities of the larger and more expensive resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach”
Reviews.Author: beachbumIllinois
Reviews.Content: Of all the Riu resorts.Playacar is a small one that packs a punch..Also great mexican food..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Chrispy52
Reviews.Content: Resort was great! Yes the beds were a bit hard but have experienced alot worse. LOVED the restaurant reservation availability - no waiting in a long line. Just stop by the breakfast buffet in the morning, pick the restaurant & seating time (6:45 or 8:45) worked great. Celebrated a friends birthday while there and they did an awesome job of making the evening in the Mexican restaurant outstanding even tho they were a bit understaffed. Beach is great and all the people we ran into were extremely polite!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Party Animals had a great time as usual”
Reviews.Author: Bunnyman1958
Reviews.Content: This year the group consisted of 6 couples ranging in age from 30 to 50 and instead of the Dominican Republic which is where we have been for the last 7 years we decided on Mexico and the Riu Playarcar from May 29th to June 9th. We couldnt have asked for anything more. As usual the staff were very helpful, and the hotel and rooms were always spotless. We emailed the hotel a week before our arrival and requested 2nd floor rooms in the middle blocks and Elena the hotel manager emailed back the same day saying they would try and accomadate us, which they did perfectly. The food was great and plentiful but we did not try the speciality restaurants.The one and only minor complaint we had were the hard beds but you can ask for a mattress topper from reception. We never had a problem getting loungers by the pool or on the beach. The beach is wonderful and a 20 minute walk along it will take you right into Playa Del Carmen and all the shopping you can handle. Our thanks to Felix and Adrianna our pool bartenders who were awesome, and to Maria, Reuben, Mario, Emilio, Pablo and Angie who were part of the Animation team who were always keeping everyone entertained. We will definately be going back next year with more people to this great hotel and the Riu Party Animal Reunion 2012 !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel but stayed in better 3*s”
Reviews.Author: char93_x
Reviews.Content: Just some things I think people need to know before they book - We stayed here in Nov last year and when we arrived I think it was fair to say we were a little disappointed.... There are a few Riu's on the same stretch and when you go and browse around the others you will see for yourselves that this isn't the nicest one. It's advertised as a 5* hotel but to be honest I think I've stayed in better 3*. However it was my first time to the Caribbean and I'm not sure if i was expecting too big a thing! The one thing I can say here though is the people are absolutely lovely! They all work really hard to maintain the hotel to look as pretty as it does - The animation team are fab and we had a really great time with them. They even took us on a couple of nights out in the main town which I thought was really nice .. They made a real effort! The food wasn't all that to be honest - There's a vast choice but they don't really cater for fussy eaters! It all tastes the same... Eggs for breakfast is as good as it gets! We did a few trips The Dolphin Swim which was absolutely amazing ... We got to swim with stingrays and manatees which was a real experience. We also went on a speedboat trip were we sailed out into the middle of the sea and jumped off to go snorkeling around a barrier reef - That was brilliant! If you go into the town shopping it's the same as many other towns abroad - They are extremely pushy..... You can't have a look at something because you WILL leave with it! The entertainment in this hotel wasn't really good ... you could tell they made the effort but it was tailored to suit children more than anything which I found a bit boring - and...It started at 10.30! I was ready for bed by then after a long day in the sun! The rooms aren't really anything new.. They are just very basic...Beds are so uncomfortable! Our room was infested with mosquitos as-well so we were all ripped to shreds by the end of our stay.. after asking several times at check in someone came around and sprayed outside the room and the mosquitos eventually disappeared (A tip..Turn your outside light off and they won't fly in) Pools were absolutely freezing but always kept really clean which was a bonus.. The beach was lovely but I think after a few storms the sea was abit rough and there were alot of debris so you couldn't really swim in it... The water was lovely and warm when you could get in though. If your going to go on the Jet Skis please be advised they are VERY expensive... Overall this hotel was OK but I don't think it was really up to the standard of what we paid for. Hope this helos a little without sounding too moany!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar was fine”
Reviews.Author: lostresamigos
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Riu Playacar the week of Memorial Day - it was clean, the food was good and the drinks were fine. The staff -with the exception of one woman in the internet cafe area-were gracious and the beach fabulous. My husband and I have stayed at many Rius - including all the ones in Cancun - and we agreed that the Playacar was very nice, but didn't give the same "aura" as we found at other Rius. The rooms were decent - in need of some TLC -though nothing major. The A/C was lacking- but not so bad that it wasn't bearable. Beds were hard (we find this to be the case in most places we've stayed in Mexico though - There were 3 in a room - trying to get towels -and replacement beverages in the fridge-for 3 versus 2 was a challenge - even when requesting such in both Spanish and English. We took to swiping towels off the housekeeping carts! It was the usual early morning reservation system (Mexico) for the specialty restaurants. The Asian one was a waste- more a limited buffet. LONG walk into town -if you're up to it!- taxi was $7 each way - can add up as there's not much in the way of entertainment at the resort. Little shopping mart across from them with prices more or less as high as 5th St in Playa - have to get off the main street to find real deals! A trip to Cozumel is easy from town via ferry and a nice day out. All in all, it was fine - nothing overly special, but a clean place to stay with a very decent buffet and nice pools and beach - and basically - that's what we were there for -

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Kperr
Reviews.Content: Before we left for our trip we read every single review and expected the worst. When we arrived we could not understand how anyone could complain! The hotel was gorgeous, the landscaping was kept up constantly by the employees, the food was great and if you don't like the buffet that Playacar had to offer you could go to another riu for breakfast or lunch. We enjoyed the riu tequila the most. The buffet was huge! The activities were endless and the entertaient staff was very kind and definitely entertaining. Even the water aerobics with Reuben was fun. The swim up bar was awesome and the staff was hilarious. Best vacation ever. The ONLY problem we had was toward the end of our stay our bathroom started to smell badly like sulfur. The sprayed some fragrance but it came back immediately. A family with a new born baby came to the room right next to us and the baby cried all night and all morning long but the reception staff was more than happy to move us. Luckily the family left before we could move. Over all I'd recvonend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: MickCornell
Reviews.Content: Our trip was planned for the all inclusive Hotel Riu Playacar in Playa Del Carmen. While not the most luxurious accommodations, we found our room comfortable and clean and actually, not too small. The beds were hard but comfortable and, if you ask, they will give you a mattress pad to make it even more comfortable. The food was pleantiful and average. The steak dinner was very good. The drinks are numerous and everywhere (there is even a liquor dispenser in the bathroom). They offer activities all day long including their large pool with a swim-up bar. Catamarans, kayaks, windsurfing, and several others. There is a show each night at their stage and it is actually entertaining! As far as safety goes, with the packge we selected, we were picked up at the airport and dropped off at the gated hotel. The cab ride into town cost us $7 and was arranged by the hotel. The return trip was the same but we selected our own cab for the return...they are all over the town. We also took a tour with Edventure Tours and had a fabulous time with them. We felt completely safe the entire trip. They take us money everywhere so don't worry about exchanging it beforehand. Take lots of small bills so you wont' get Mexican as change although many of the stores will give you change in US. HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: tagent
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the RIU Playacar May 7-14, 2011. We LOVED it, we haven't been back to the Cancun area since Wilma, we have been going to Punta Cana instead. Decided to go back once again to try new adventures. We loved the smallness of this resort. Not as much walking as most resorts in the area. Our room was nice & clean, had to call and get the foam topper put on our bed, because of the hardness. Once they did it was much better. The beach was BEAUTIFUL and clean, plus both pools were kept clean. Water in the pool and ocean was a nice temp. Not too cold or too warm perfect. We went to 5th Ave in Playa del Carmen one night, decided on a taxi, cost $7 each way. Went to the shopping area across the street, but was much pricier than 5th Ave. We also did two excursions Xel-Ha which we have been to before, but wanted to go back there for the snorkling. We also went to Xplor which I would HIGHLY recommend. We had a blast there. First time to zipline for me, it was so much fun. Took advice from a forum, we bought our tickets on-line before we left at a discount and took a taxi from the hotel ($15 each way), which was cheaper than buying a package from a tour operator. What was really nice when we got there the line for on-line purchases was MUCH shorter than the one with the people who took the tour buses. I would not recommend this park for children under 5, not much for them to do there. We are in our mid-50's and was able to do everything the park had to offer. Except the Jaguar zipline. One of the towers was just too much to climb. Would def go back to this park. We are considering our fall vacation and will probably go back to Punta Cana, but will not rule out going to this resort. We will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: tify1
Reviews.Content: this was our first vacation to mexico, and i must say it was GREAT! the entertainment crew was awesome ensuring everyone was having a great time!! drank out of coconuts, had themed parties!! shot out to RUEBEN!!!!! master of entertaining!! the service was wonderful. the bartenders and server were very attentive, our room was very clean. The front desk was very good and polite , the whole staff at this place was just perfect!! the food is 24 hours and quite deverse nice solection!!! WE will DEfintly be coming back!!!!!!! best vacation ever! and the pool bar.... EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “great place, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: 33Max33
Reviews.Content: safe area, great beach, clean rooms, always friendly and welcoming staff, our best romantic getaway!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Staff, food, beach and location”
Reviews.Author: lsfborges
Reviews.Content: I've been in this hotel in August 2010 and loved it. The staff is excellent very friendly and kind, always ready to do what's best for the clients. We had food and drinks at any hour of the day and the buffets were very diversified and with good quality. The reception of the the hotel had free wi-fi and the rooms had a free safe. The rooms were big and very clean, the waiters cleaned the room and switched towels every day. The beach in front of the hotel was amazing, blue waters and that fine white sand, hummm, i'm already missing Mexico .... Mexico is a good place to go if you and sun, beach and culture ... you have all!!!! Don't miss Xel-Ha, Xscaret and Chichen Itza ... and of course do snorkeling, its amazing :) Resuming, i loved the hotel and Mexico, I recommend it to all of my friends Bye

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ntay
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying this is my first time in Mexico and the first time in all inclusive resort. stayed in the resort with a friend for 4 days end of May. Though the hotel is definitely not a 5* hotel but we got exactly what we've been looking for: clean rooms, good pool, great beach, excellent location. The resort is very close to Playa del Carmen and you can walk there from the resort for about 20min or catch a taxi that will cost you 7US dollars. Also the hotel offers the use of the favilities in other Riu hotels (except the Palace hotels) however you can eat only breakfast or lunch in the other hotels, no dinner. This is added value in case you are tired of the pool/bar in Playacar.  The hotel is quite a small one compared to other resorts in the area but I believe it's only an advantage as the rooms are very close to beach. Food: buffet has fresh variety and I would recommend it to anyone staying in the resort, but cannot say the same about the 2 restaurants that we tried, Jade (sushi) and the Steak restaurant. Steak restaurant was pretty terrible, unless you really like your steak well done. As for the sushi, unless you really like rice, it doesn't worth the visit.  The best lunch I had is where they prepared seafood sabiche along the pool that was one of the best I ever ate. In general, great hotel for the price you pay. FYI: No need to bring pesos to Mexico. we went from the resort with the entertainment staff to coco-bongo night club. The staff mentioned that the entrance to the club is 60$ US and when we wanted to pay in pesos (thinking that it'll be better to pay with local currency) we were charged a conversion rate 20% higher than the actual one, to convert pesos to US dollars in Mexico, who would ever think!

Reviews.Title: “Would never book again!”
Reviews.Author: jrs911
Reviews.Content: No a/c, we thought maybe we need to keep the drapes closed. Still could not get room below 80. Bed was so hard thought I was sleeping on the floor. And there is nothing like waking up at night to use the bathroom to find cockroaches on the bathroom floor. Sweet! The food is fried or covered in grease. Which, is okay for a day or two but after that I need something better. None of the specialty restaurants are anything to rave about. One night we ended up at the buffet after dinner at the Asian restaurant. Buffet was so so warm food nothing to write home about.. I would not stay here or at the Riu Yuctan down the street we moved there and all I can say is there were no bugs and we had a/c. Save yourself the trouble and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst beds, and rude service”
Reviews.Author: Aroundtheworld4619
Reviews.Content: The bartenders seemed to serve us drinks, waiting for a tip in return... They were rude and unfriendly. The beds could pretty much be taken out of the rooms, as it's equivalent to sleeping on the tile floor. The hot dog wieners as breakfast sausage, and leftover wieners as pizza toppers, not a nice touch!!! I don't think I'd come back, getting harassed constantly by activities staff, and rude service, topped off by next to no sleep on a hard bed..... Not really the vacation I hoped for!

Reviews.Title: “RIU Playacar is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tomted
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on the 5th of May this year and was taken aback by the location of the hotel.On arriaval we were treated like a king and queen of our country.We were shown to a room in block 3.My wife wasn't impressed with the room as it smelled musty and had dirty bed linen on it and the shower tray had rust round the plug hole.We went to the holiday rep (Laura who was great) and she asked us if we wanted to move that day.We said we would put up with it tonight as it was late when we got there,but could she see about us getting moved in the morning, and she said it would be taken care of and we thought "yea we have heard it all before".The morning came and we went to the meeting and was surprised to find out that not only had we been moved to another room,we had been upgraded to a suite on the top floor of block 5 and we had a sea veiw at no extra cost to us at all.The holiday really got started then. The Room. The room was a surprise to us and was great. It was roomy and had a bath and a shower too.The bed we found to be a bit hard but we have been to places where the beds are much harder than the one's we encountered there.A mattress topper wasn't needed,but I have been told that one is available if it is needed. The Food. The food was great. We had at least 8 different courses including fruit,soup and sweet's.It would suit the fusiest of eaters and if there is any compaint about the food there then I would suggest to the people to try to find somewhere else to complain about.The Mexican restaurant was a bit of a disapiontment though as the food wasn't at all spicy but was still good none the less.The Steakhouse was good too as we had Ribeye Steak with everything with it and it melted in your mouth and was cooked how we wanted it.We didn't try the Oriental restaurant as we forgot to book it. The Show's. The show's were very well done and dispite the small venue was exelent. There was a disapointment at one of the show's but the free beer made up for that.Well done to everyone cocerened with those show's The Place. Playa De Carmen is only a short walk from the hotel. My wife and me walked into the town with out any bother at all.5th Avenue is a bright and colourful sight to see. Be prepared to be asked by all the traders to look into their shop.Apolite "No thank you" will be OK and they wont bother you again unless you walk back through.We didnt get to see any of the club's in town as we can't see everything on the first trip.Coco Bongo's is the place to go as well as Senior Frog's.They are both easy to get there and a short taxi ride will take you to either of them. Dont pay more than 7 dollar's for the taxi from the RIU Playacar hotel. The People. We felt very safe in Mexico. You hear about trouble in various places,but there is none in Playa De Carmen at all.We went to a Mexican bar and had a drink there and I even went scuba diving and left my wife to her own divices and was surprised to find out later that she had walked back to the hotel without any sort of trouble at all.The police were very polite and would talk to you and treat as you would hope to be treated. The Beach. The beach was great and the sand was very white and glorious.The sea was great and was turquoise in colour and very safe.The tempratures were between 28 and 38 deg.My wife went topless and wasn't bothered by anyone.Dont try to go topless round the pool as there are children about and it would be impolite to do so.I didnt notice anyone topless round the pool anyway. Our thanks. Our thank's go out to:- Rouben,Joshua,Maria and Paulo who were the entertainment staff.Joshua was a mad man and not from this planet.Paulo was a great compair and was very daft as well.Rouben made our stay a pleasure and was a credit to the team.Maria was the birthday girl and helped my wife to play some games etc.Gilberto in the lobby resteraunt was great and a couple fo dollars went a long way with him.The room's were kept to a standard high enough for a more expensive place,again a couple of dollars went down well as we had towel animals on our bed everyday.The boss man who upgaded us was a star and we thank him alot.There was also a great couple from Vancouver Canada who we have become very close too and are planning a visit to their country as soon as we can.Hello to Joanne and Greg.We love you lot's guy's.There was also a few people from Featherstone Yorkshire who we met there as well who have said they will come over to see us. Hi to Rob and his wife(sorry dont know your name love) and to Skippy and his wife (again I cant remember your name either) I know what a plonker I'am. In General. The place deserves it's 4 star rating but is in need of some updating.My wife was game for a laugh and joined in with a couple of games as did I. She was a gehsha girl in one play on stage and I did a striptease to one of the bar staff on stage. (Thanks Rouben for pulling up my boxer shorts).I was showing off my bum crack.It is a family show after all.I think that my wife should have won the Miss Playacar as she performed her little butt off and the girl that won went home the very next day to Argentina but it was a good laugh any way.Skippy's wife was also in the play too and was great.Well done to all of the people who took part in the stage show's.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the location and value – excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: AlbCab
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Mexico. We came from Portugal in a direct flight (Lisbon – Cancun, 10 hours to Mexico, 8,5 hours to Lisbon). We stayed at Riu Playacar from 2nd to 9th of May, 2911 (both Mondays). Nothing wrong to say regarding the flight and the transfers airport-hotel, that were included in the package. In the airport, of course, Mexican border control took some time – around 1 hour to 1,5 hours. But the transfer organization was perfect and we had no problems at all. In Mexico nowadays, they accept usdollars, euros and of course pesos. The exchange rate in most shops was correct, in the hotel was a bit worse. From Europe, take euros (in May, 1 euro = 16.5 pesos). It took us around 1 hour to get to the resort, as the bus stopped at several other resorts first (we were the last ones !). The resort, built in 1997, is beautiful, well maintained and clean. The staff, as said before, was excellent, always friendly and smiling, respectful and polite. Check-in was simple and fast – the room key, 2 towel cards and a key for the safe – and the room was large, with two double beds pushed together. The mattresses were a bit hard, but we are used to this. There is a bar in the room, refilled every other day. The tap water is potable, although we had at all times 3 x 1,5 liters mineral water bottles in the fridge, together with cans of cola and soda. There were 4 full bottles of vodka, tequila, gin and whisky, that were also refilled every other day. The ice was available in a specific place, in the ground floor. The drinks and the food were included in our all-inclusive package. We could drink and eat what we wanted, although bars and restaurants are not open at all times. But opening hours were generous. The bar staff (in any of the 3 bars) was friendly and very experienced. Of course there was a list of available drinks, and we loved the margaritas, strawberry daiquiris and pina coladas. Go to one bar and ask for 4 margaritas – no questions asked, they are ready in 2 minutes ! Lunches have to be in one of the restaurants, for dinners there are 4 options: Mexican, steak house, Oriental and general. The 3 first ones have to be booked at breakfast (limited places). The buffets were good, although a bit repetitive, after one week we were a bit tired of the same food every day. But the assortment was very good. Nice pool, but of course we preferred the beach (there are pools everywhere, although in this one the water temperature should be near 30 degrees C). But when the sea water is emerald blue and 27-28 degrees C, who wants to be in the pool ? There are some entertainment, but we didn’t pay too much attention to this. Some days were better, others not so nice. We walked into Play del Carmen, but beware: it will not take you 5 to 7 minutes, but half an hour to get to the start of the town, and 15 minutes more to get to 5th avenue. All ground floors were shops, selling souvenirs, handicrafts, clothes, etc. Prices were normal, but most of the items were junk, “made in China” type. We bought a Mayan type sculpture done in obsidian to take home – very nice for 300 pesos (18 euros !). The only BAD things for us – no decent expresso coffee available. Not in the hotel, not in the town. We only found a Nexpresso machine in an hotel near the ruins of Chichen Itza, were we had lunch in one of the full day excursions we took – outside the package, of course. The other excursion was to the island of Contoy. Both were very nice. After going to Chichen Itza, we plunge into a “cenote”, an unforgettable experience. There were many others excursions, to nature parks, adventure islands, etc. No mosquitoes or other bugs, although we were prepared with repellent. Not necessary to use during the day or night. I presume that after the rain starts (June ? July ?) the situation will change drastically. We would came back the next week, all other factors allowing!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: Sandybum1
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Mexico from California. We stayed @ Riu Playacar from 5/2-5/9 2011. My intent is to write a review for the Riu, however, I would like to add some travel tips as well. We traveled on a Monday and even though the lines we not too bad, it took us 1.5 hours to get through customs due to the lack of staff. Make sure you are not starving when you depart the flight. I strongly recommend pre-booking transportation prior to arrival. The number of people who try and get you into something else can be overwhelming. We pre-booked with Best Day travel and were very happy we did. At the exit of the airport doors (near the Margarita hut) there was a man wearing a Best Day uniform and holding a sign with company name. We walked up and he asked for our flight number and last name. With that information he knew our first names and where we were staying so I was very comfortable getting on the shuttle. It was only about a 35 minute ride from airport to our resort. Our resort the Riu PLayacar was beautiful. We didn't see much until the next day as we arrived right at nightfall and were exhasted from traveling. The lobby was beautiful open and large. CHECK-IN- Check-in was simple but they really didn't give much information about things that were offered. We were offered a map that showed the grounds and the other Riu resorts we could visit (and the ones we could not). Our single room key, 2 towel cards and a key for the safe. Next time we will ask all sorts of questions and not just assume we'll be told. He was a very pleasant young man. The ROOM- The room was spacious. It had two full/double beds pushed together. THey were VERY VERY hard mattresses but we usually sleep on a firm. (at home you can't feel the springs). They only use a top sheet and a cover that should not be used as a blanket. Covers at hotels should NEVER be used as a blanket. It was always warm/muggy, but if you get easily cold they have blankets in the closet. There is a bar in the room (yippee) along with a 2 -pepsi,2- 7up, 2-club soda and 2-orange drinks. 3 large bottles of water. They re-fill the fridge every other day. That was great. One thing that SHOULD have been mentioned at the check in 'the room water is not potable' I did not notice the little tiny sticker on the bottm corner of the mirror that stated so. I had already brushed my teeth when my boyfriend saw it! YUK. The bath towels were nice and soft and we had pleanty of them. We were in the first building off the lobby, very quiet most nights. THE FOOD- the head Waiter informed us where we had to sign up for the 2 of the 3 dinners they offered that were not a part of the buffet. This was optional. If you chose to have the buffet every night, you could. These were just alternative dining options at no extra cost. They had Japanese, Mexican and a Steak house. We just loved the buffet. We tried the Japanese place, 'Jade' something and were very very dissapointed :( After that we chose to stick with the buffet. The breakfast became monotonous, but the dinners were always a little different and delish. Breakfast and dinner were in the main Lobby area at the front of the resort. The lunches were offered, buffet style, out near the pool and beach. Lunches were always nice and changed every so often. The assortment on all buffets (B L & D) were wonderful. So much to chose from. THE POOL/BEACH- We loved the swim up bar. THough it was closed the 1st 3 days of our stay for maintenance (we understand things need upkeep). The water was warm in the pool closest to the beach, with the bar. We never got into the first pool, with the fountain. There is a bathroom by the pool, near the stage. Dont forget to turn in your towels or they will charge you. We left ours on chairs all day and nobody messed with them but we almost forgot them once :) The white sand beach was ten feet away from the pool. There were pleanty of chaise lounge chairs. THey never ran out. Palm trees line the first 7 yards (+ -) of sand and then it's open blue skys over powdered sand that paled in comparison to the blue/green water. We love kids, being parents ourselves, but we loved the fact that there weren't many kids around. We wanted to get away from it all. not for the screaming to follow us. ENTERTAINMENT- We missed out on a lot of things because until our 3/4th day there, we didnt realize there was a board in the lobby that informed you of activities going on. Also nobody ever told us about the water activites they offer. We found out on our 2nd to last day. The information is right past the pool by the kiddy play area. We did catch a few night shows during the week that they offered on the stage near the beach/pool. Friday and saturday nights were EXTREMELY dissapointing!! I can not stress that enough...BORING!! We are 37 and 41 years old. We aren't into 'clubbing' but some live music would be nice...anything other than watching what looked to be like Circ De Sole on a huge tv screen. GAK. The bar tender said everyone goes to bars and clubs on weekends so they dont do anything :( OUTSIDE the resort- We walked into town excited afer reading so much about 5th street/avenue. Again, let down. THe prices for the mostly 'junk' they had were just silly. Many of the things said 'made in taiwan' We didn't buy anything to take home. Nothing was worth it. EXPLOR-GO GO GO. It was the most fun we had. So worth every penny and we will go again! Xel HA- boring after the 1st few hours. Wouldn't go again. Would recommend if it were a tad cheeper. Being a diver, snorkeling there got very boring after half hour. THe rest of it was just ok. THE BAD- We both got very very sick for 2 days. I had it worse than my boyfriend. Thankfully he brought amodium ad with us and had it on hand. I don't know where we got sick because we ate at EXPLOR and XEL HA in addition to the resort. Not passing blame, we excpected it to happen. not to big of a deal. BUT, the worst part is my boyfriend waking up on our 3rd morning with approx 50 bug bites all over the lower half of his body. It was aweful, disgusting and sad. I didn't have any bites at all and we think its because he had given me a massage with lemon and Eucalyptus oil the night before and I fell asleep with it still on. We told the front desk that morning and was told they would take care of it. We went out for the day and when we came back to our room, we were hoping there would be a note or SOMETHING to acknowledge that they HAD taken care of it. Nothing. I was so scared to climb into bed that night. We descided to spray the bed ourselves and go out for drink for a few hours to let it soak in. Thankfully we brought deet free bug spray with us from home. We also used the massage oil every night there after before going to bed. They really should have laft a note saying they took care of that. Staff-always friendly and smiles. Some of the bar tenders went a little over board with being friendly to me and upsetting my boyfriend. But that was only a select few. Most were respectful and curtious. CONCLUSION- if you are going for ultra affordable, this is a great place to stay. We may come back again but we have our sites on another resort next time if we can save a few hundred $$ more. We really did like the resort a lot. It was beautiful, good food and great staff. The whole bed thing is what is making me re-think about returning. Maybe next time I should just demand another room so I'm not scared to go to bed every night!!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but still worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: MancMan78
Reviews.Content: The downsides first of all. The beds are indeed rock hard, the mattress topper does help but it was still an uncomfortable night's sleep a lot of the time. While the public areas were spotless, some of the room could have been better looked after - the fridge was stained as were some of the bedsheets and the clock radio had seen better days. There was a bit of a tired feel in terms of the decor, notably in the main restaurant and also the bedroom. Now for the good points. There are two pools, one is quiet and the other has the swim up bar and jacuzzi. The latter pool was closed for a few days for cleaning (it was less yellow afterwards!) but we scarcely used it so no loss. The quieter pool was lovely. Food was generally excellent. Good buffet restaurant for breakfast and dinner. There is a decent lunch buffet too at the restaurant by the pool. This splits into two at night as the steakhouse and Mexican speciality restaurants. Both are a la carte and very good. The Asian restaurant is by the lobby and is a buffet, relatively small choice but quality was fine. There is also a late night buffet here which is useful. In the early hours there are sandwiches and fruit in the lobby. On one occasion there was a delicious beach barbecue and another a tasty paella. The hotel has a wonderful location, right on the beach. Over the road is a pleasant shopping plaza. If you want to go to Playa del Carmen it is a 30 minute walk, or 70 pesos in a taxi (there's always a taxi around if need be). Playacar is a private complex, it was well kept and very safe. We had a quick look at Riu Yucatan and Riu Tequila and we think our hotel was smaller and more intimate, certainly more relaxed. The entertainment staff deserve huge credit. There were a handful of them but they never stopped, day and night. Always happy to see you, always smiling, always on the go. If there was an activity they wanted you to take part in they would approach you if you didn't look busy or asleep! But a no was always taken as a no and there was no hassle at all if you didn't want to get involve. The evening shows generally were worth watching, notably the professional dance acts. Service was always efficient and well done. If there was a problem it was solved quickly and with a smile. The restaurant and bar workers were very friendly all of the time. This hotel has its faults but they are easily outweighed by the good points and we'd recommend it to anyone. Nice hotel, great resort, lovely part of Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Bribrimn
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not amazing but the rest of the resort is great all exclusive is very convenient beach is great and the bar is awesome the shows at night are also very high quality

Reviews.Title: “Would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: Bexymilburn26
Reviews.Content: How anyone has any complaints with this place I just can’t understand. My friend and I had the most amazing stay and holiday at the Riu Playacar in April and couldn’t fault it. An absolutely stunning location with colourful blocks of rooms surrounded by beautiful gardens, trees and wildlife. The pool area is two tone, the pool with the fountain is very quiet and relaxed while the pool with the bar is more lively and where the games and fun happen. Throughout the day you never have to look very hard to get sun loungers; even at mid-day we managed to get 4 loungers together. The hotel is right on the white sandy beach and as there is no tide, the crystal clear sea is not far away. There are also ample sun loungers on the beach with palm trees to provide shade. Included in the package are a variety of water sports i.e. kayaking, windsurfing, catamaran and boogie boards (SCUBA diving demonstrations in the pool). Our room was sparkling on arrival and was cleaned daily, mini bar always full, clean sheets etc and was situated in block 5, which is closest to the pool/evening entertainment/beach which suited us well. We didn’t find the beds too hard or the music from the evening entertainment too loud; we had such a good time through the day, by the time we got into bed we went straight to sleep! The food selection and quality was fantastic, there was always something new, brilliantly presented and fresh; breakfast was our favourite. The speciality restaurants we tried (Mexican and Steak House) were lovely too; one word of advice-go hungry! As well as this often during the day around the pool the kitchen staff came out and started up a BBQ, Paella or traditional Mexican food for lunch followed by fresh fruit salads/desserts being brought round to your sun lounger! The coconut party is brilliant too; dancing followed by coconuts hollowed and served with vodka/rum. The staff here couldn’t work any harder. The housekeeping staff do a great job, are always smiling and pleasant (you will never walk past anyone with them giving you a cheery 'Hola!'). The restaurant staff are the same, always at your service and will come and chat to you. One member of staff was particularly happy and friendly (Pedro-Pablo) and always seemed happy to see you walk in. The entertainment team were also amazing and kind of made the holiday, Maria, Ruben, Mario and Joshua would always stop to say hello, crack some kind of joke and ask if we wanted to join in any of the activities, they would come and have a drink with us after the evening show and volunteer to escort us to bars/clubs in the town if we wanted to go. Activities happened most of the day with a different ‘lazy game’ and ‘crazy game’ each morning/afternoon which both were entertaining to participate in or watch-especially to water balloon fight! Plenty of laughs were had with all the team and we were sad to leave our new friends! The evening shows were well put together and good to watch while relaxing with a drink and on one evening the audience were the show; we all participated in various fun games (one side of the theatre against the other) and was great fun. If joining in is not your thing, you are never pressured to take part and can chose to do as much or as little as you like. The town of Playa Del Carmen is accessible by the beach or road and can be walked or a taxi will cost you 70 pesos. It is a lovely relaxing town with a beach and plenty of shops/bars/restaurants. If you want to venture further away, there is so much to do in Riviera Maya, Cancun and the surrounding area. We went on the Isla Mujeres trip which I would strongly recommend. For around $80 you get transport to Cancun, a private catamaran across to the Isla, about 1 hour to explore before getting back on the catamaran to go to dolphin discovery which included is a dolphin adventure swim. Then about an hour to explore dolphin discovery, chill out in the hammocks, go and see the sharks etc before boarding the catamaran once more back to Cancun and getting your transport back to the hotel door. On top of all this, all your drinks and food are included all day! This is a long packed day but worth it and is actually cheaper than just doing a dolphin swim trip! We also did the jungle speed boat tour which was great fun and value and we went to CocoBongo twice which is amazing, part Vegas show part night club with an open bar policy, well worth going! At the end of our holiday we discovered we had been delayed for 24 hours. This was dealt with incredibly well by our tour operator and hotel. We were notified via our room phone and were told to stay exactly where we were and go any enjoy another days holiday. Our wrist bands were still valid so everything was still included and we stayed in the same room we had all holiday while the tour operator organised a new transfer time and flight of which we were notified of in good time. Over all an absolutely brilliant place/holiday which I cannot speak highly enough of. I would recommend this holiday to anyone and would happily go back there tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, food, staff and entertainment, will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: s_grewal16
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar is by far one of the most friendliest and swanky resorts we've been too. The staff is amazing, the rooms are great, the beach front is beautiful. The entertainment in my opinion the best I've seen, great shows with a different crew and theme each night. Fifth avenue is great for shopping as well! Pablo, Mario and Maria - the Riu entertainment kick butt! Would recommend, if the price is right go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value and the location”
Reviews.Author: happytravelcounselor
Reviews.Content: I had read most of the reviews so was well prepared prior to arrival. I had asked for two adjoining rooms on the third floor of one of the middle buildings, buildings 3 or 4. I had also asked for mattress toppers. All of my requests were fulfilled. Buildings 3 and 4 are in the middle, so they are quiet. The mattress toppers were a must as the mattresses are hard and due to be changed. There are little hallways that lead off of the main inner corridor of each building to each group of two rooms. This was great for a family as we were able to lock the door to the main hallway and leave our main room doors open creating a really nice space for all of us. The hotel could definitely use a renovation. The decor is dated and there was rust around the sink and the shower drains in each bathroom. This did not concern me because I was looking for a hotel that was clean, well located, on a nice beach with good food and the Riu Playacar was definitely all of the above. The service is very professional with everyone working exceptionally hard to please and the hotel and grounds are impeccably clean. We travelled with our three older teenagers and our five year old and there was definitely something for everyone. The kids club is not very extensive, but the animators try harder to get the kids involved than any other more elaborate all-inclusive that I have stayed in. The water in the pool where the swim up bar is was not quite sparkling blue, but the second pool was quite nice. The nightly shows were amateur but again the staff really tried hard to entertain. There was live music in the lobby often at night and that was a really nice touch. The food was great.....lots of choice in the main restaurant. After a couple of days we learned to look at the board outside the dining room in the morning to see what the theme was that night ( before making reservations at the specialty restaurants). There are three specialty restaurants, two a la carte that are outside near the beach, a Mexican and a Steakhouse. They have a nicer atmosphere at night as the lighting is bright in the main dining room and the asian restaurant. The asian restaurant is buffet not a la carte. In all cases, we found the food was great. Even with a vegetarian in the group there was something for everyone. All in all I would recommend this hotel for the location and the staff. Playa del Carmen is about a twenty minute walk away and the little shops across the street are fun.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: verninscotland
Reviews.Content: Very nice all inclusive. The food was very good and quite a large selection for all meals in the main dining room. We were given a outdoor table dedicated to us on the patio overlooking the garden. Wonderful. If the dining room wasn't to our liking we were able to reserve dinner in one of two on property restaurants serving Italian (gourmet) or the steak house. Both were delightful. There were two or three shows, free scuba lessons, sea kayaks available for our use. The beach was very clean as were the pools (with swim up bar and serving your favorite beverages. All you could drink. Order Grande if you want 'em strong). Another nice thing about this property is they extend reciprocity between all of their properties in Playacar. Playa del Carmen is a short cab ride away and Cozumel a short but nice ferry ride. Highly recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “No water”
Reviews.Author: deskdriver2007
Reviews.Content: Arrive at hotel with apple vacations They listed as 4+ but really 2+ we have had no water here for over 24 hours and hotel is not accommodating at all Sister resorts not accessible

Reviews.Title: “Vacation was everything I dreamed of and more”
Reviews.Author: dottieldirksen
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Riu Playacar resort. We arrived on 4-2-2011 and departed on 4-8-2011. It was a beautiful vacation. We traveled with 7 close friends and we all had a great time. The resorts service was outstanding. Staff members, Enrique, Felix, Nancy, Reuben, Pepe and Mary will forever be remembered. They made every effort to ensure that our stay was exceptional and they exceeded our expectations. The resort was kept very clean and all staff were very helpful and friendly. The food was exellant. If anyone walked away hungry, it was their own fault. The beachfront was breathtaking. We didn't do any of the activities through Apple because we quite honestly didn't want to leave the resort for a whole day. It was a very restful and enjoyable vacation. We would definately like to return some day. The only changes that I would make would be to stay in a room on the other side of the resort as our room faced the main drive into the resort and it could sometimes be noisy as you heard trucks loading and unloading at night and early morning. I am working on my photo album and know that I will always remember this great week in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “This may have been a 5 star many years ago...only a 3 star in 2011”
Reviews.Author: mfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: I read the tripadvisor reviews prior to our vacation and felt that the reviews were overall quite good...there are always a few people who are never satisfied and like to complain..so the low numbers of those that did not recommend this resort did not deter us. I felt I had a responsibility to write a review after our stay at the RIU Playacar. We would not recommend this resort! My husband and I travel down south at least once a year and have stayed at a number of resorts. This was our 5th. trip to Mexico and our 4th. stay in Playa del Carmen. We have always loved the area and still do. Due to special circumstances this year we were forced to book last minute and ended up staying at the RIU Playacar. Firstly I would like to say that the staff are outstanding. The food at the buffet was plentiful and well prepared. Unfortunately, the resort is old. The beds in the room are not only hard, but you will feel the springs. The pillows are so thin as to be non existant. We needed to use the extra blankets out of the closet only to find one with smears of something brown and the other smelling so foul that even the staff were revolted. The room was damp to the extent that the bedding always felt damp. We aired out the room everyday to no avail. When we arrived the room was full of mosquitos...we later found out this was because the screen door had been removed from the patio. We still took our chances with the mosquitos as it was the only way to get some air into the room (We did have one of the stray cats come to visit our room one day, it was outrageous enough to be hilarious!) The bathrooms are moldy, the toilet ran non stop. The rooms smell. The gym is not actually located at this resort. It is located two resorts down the road at another RIU resort. The pool with the swim up bar actually has yellow water. When you stand on the little bridge that crosses over the two sections of pool it is clearly evident that the urine level is very high on the sde with the pool bar the other side is a pristine blue....there is no washroom easily accessible for pool users (The only washroom in that area is beside the lunch buffet where you have to be wearing shoes, shorts and shirts). The fellas at the bar obviously felt the same way....they did not leave their stools at the swim up bar all afternoon. Hence the yellow water. The steakhouse and asian inspired restaurants are not worth your while. We didn't bother trying the mexican restaurant. I would recommend if you are going to stay at a RIU book yourself into one of the Palace resorts with RIU. It is truly a 5 star. It will cost you a little more...but well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort with friendly, accommodating service”
Reviews.Author: mackenna1
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Riviera Maya and stayed at Riu Playacar last March. We enjoyed it so much that we returned again this year. We arrived on March 29th and departed on April 7th. The weather was mid to high 80's while we were there. It was a bit more humid this year but that may be because we were there about three weeks later than we were last year. It didn't really bother us too much, we just jumped in the pool or the ocean when we needed to cool down. Most of the time, there was a good breeze. We also seemed to have missed alot of the "spring breakers" that like to party a little heavier than we do! We especially enjoy the friendly and wonderful service we receive from the staff at this resort. They all work very hard and always have smiles on their faces! We usually ended our evenings at the lobby bar for a nightcap (or two) and really enjoyed the variety of music they had some nights, as well as our bartenders, Daniel, Froylann, Nancy, and Abraham. They made us feel so welcome! We have been pleasantly surprised both visits with the food, cocktail quality. We had heard that "all-inclusives" are sometimes not so hot when it comes to those things, but we had no complaints. As far as rooms, they are clean and maid service is good. For those of us who are "light" sleepers, it can be a little noisy in the early mornings. We didn't have any loud people in our building at night so that was pleasant. Pads for the beds are a must unless you like hard beds. We were a little disappointed with the quality of the pool (the section with the pool bar) as it did not appear as clean as last year. Most days the water was quite cloudy so we chose to spend our time in the other pool. On our last day, it appeared they must have done something to make it better but it would have been nice if they could have had it clear and clean for our entire vacation. The beach is awesome. Mostly yellow and red flag days while we were there, a little rough on the feet at times when you first entered the water, due to shells, etc. Water shoes would be a good thing to have! We think this resort was great and it was a reasonable value for a 10 day all-inclusive vacation through Delta Vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for those looking for affordable fun and sun”
Reviews.Author: browland
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a 7 night stay at the Riu Playacar in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico from March 18 to 25, 2011. We are a two 20-something professionals who have previously traveled to the Dominican and Cuba, so we have traveled enough to know what to expect from a resort and we chose the Riu Playcar both for the good reviews and the reduced likelihood of running into crowds of spring breakers. Below is a breakdown of what we experienced, in order of what was most important to us. The Beach: Cancun is known for its white sand beaches and beautiful turquoise waters, and that is exactly what you will get here. The sand is full of broken seashells that may cause some discomfort when walking and the waves were especially harsh during our stay, but we spent most of our time at the beach and loved it. There are some palm trees that provide shade to those who desire it, while the majority of the beach is uncovered and perfect for getting that tan you’re after. The only drawback for us was the lack of a bar on the actual beach, which seems to be a standard for many resorts, so expect to trek a little to get your drinks. The aforementioned strong waves in the ocean did pose a problem when it came to swimming and I recommend parents of young children be cautious when letting them into the water on windy days, as the waves were downright violent at times. The Food and Drinks: Having been to Cuba and the Dominican, my expectations of the resort food were not extremely high, but I always found something I liked. The main buffet, adjacent to the lobby, is where we ate breakfast and dinner often and the food was good on the whole. There is a good selection of Mexican and international dishes, with staples you see every day and a few special dishes introduced on theme nights. Given the delicate pallets of many American and Canadian guests, the food is not overly spiced and you are given sauces and condiments to flavor the food to your liking. What impressed me most was how on-the-ball the staff seemed to be when it came to keeping food fresh and topped up. As soon as a dish was running low, there was a fresh batch right around the corner and this kept up until the restaurant closed. The only drawback to the main buffet is that it isn’t open for lunch, only breakfast and dinner, so you will need to find your daytime sustenance at the other buffet, close to the beach, which offers mainly standard burgers, hotdogs, pasta, nachos and salads. Not exceptional but still very tasty and convenient. The resort also offers three “themed” restaurants that guests can partake of; Asian, Steak House and Mexican. All three offer a fine dining experience and the food was good overall. The only downsides to the food was the death of good seafood, something my girlfriend and I were really hoping for, and the fact that the meat was often tough and overcooked. As for drinks, I was very impressed with the quality and selection of cocktails on offer at the lobby bar (open 24 hours), the pool bar that also has a swim-up section, and the main bar near the beach. The bartenders are well trained to make a variety of specialty cocktails and they also know the staples, and they are consistent across the board. A Pina Colada will taste the same regardless of which bartender makes it. If beer is your thing, Dos Equis flows like running water and it is also stocked in the mini-bar in your room, The usual caveat of bringing your own cup applies here as well, since the cups offered are fairly small. For teetotalers or the underage, a selection of soft drinks and juices are available, in addition to coffee beverages and tea. The Room: The Riu Playacar is divided into three-level villas and, given that this is a smaller resort, you will not have to walk far to get to either the beach or the lobby. The room itself is a standard room with all you really need, and while I do agree that the beds were a little on the firm side, I actually liked this and slept very well every night. The shower is rather small and lacks a light, but thankfully the water pressure and availability of hot water was constant throughout our stay. Every room also comes with a reliable safe for storing your valuables, a mini-bar stocked with soda, water and beer, and a liquor dispenser that offers tequila, rum, whisky and vodka. There is one think I need to strongly caution you about. The floors become incredibly slippery when wet and it is easy to slip and take a nasty fall, as I did, so be very careful when trekking water via your wet clothes or when stepping out of the shower.
