The other complaint I had is that the doors and walls do little to block out noise pollution from the hallways, so expect to get woken up repeatedly by rowdy guests and banging doors. The Staff: Most employees of the Riu Playacar start their days at the crack of dawn and they work hard to keep the grounds maintained, the drinks flowing and the guests entertained. I found them to be happy, cheerful and genuinely friendly, and to my surprise, they weren’t just pining for tips as staff at other resorts seem to do. Tips are always appreciated but they are rarely expected or asked for, which definitely helped guests warm to them. The maids do a good job of cleaning you room on time and they are very talented with making animals out of towels, so there is usually a nice surprise waiting for you in your room every day. Equally hard working are the entertainment staff, who spend their days at the pool doing fun games and classes, at the beach entertaining guests and putting on nightly shows in the theatre. We attended a few of these shows, which range from comedy sketches to themed dance shows, and we were thoroughly entertained. In short, the staff were fantastic and special props go out to Felix at the swim-up bar and Rueben, the uber-flamboyant and utterly hilarious entertainment team member. You’ll definitely remember him. The Excursions: Par for the course at any resort, representatives from your tour operator will be in the lobby booking organized excursions off the resort and we booked two of them that are especially noteworthy. The first was the Chichen Itza, which is an all-day trip to the fames Mayan ruins, and we had the good fortune to go during the first day of the spring Equinox. The second was the Jungle Maya, which was an adventure tour that involved swimming and snorkeling in natural caves, zip-lining through the jungle and taking a very bumpy off-road ride in a big 4x4. Both were well organized and run by fun and knowledgeable tour operators, and both excursions will give you a true taste of Mayan culture and history. However, this all comes with a big word of caution. When you get off the plan in Cancun and you are directed to a representative at the airport, speak with them and ask about the excursions you might be interested in. Not only will they give you some insight and advice, but they will also tell you the maximum price that you should be charged and this helped us avoid getting ripped off by our Sunquest representative who tried to overcharge us $20 for the excursions we wanted to book (he would presumably pocket the difference). The fact that they have the foresight to warn you against overpaying for an excursion obviously means that this happens often, so educate yourself before booking. Simple Advice: - Sunscreen, sunscreen and more sunscreen! Don’t underestimate the baking power of the Mexican sun, as I did, or else you will wind up with a nasty burn, also as I did. - The general store in the lobby is a good source for sundry items you will need or want during your stay, but they are also overpriced. There is a shopping complex directly across the street from the resort where you can shop around, or take a taxi into Playa Del Carmen and see if any better deals are to be found. - Given that plenty of uninhibited travelers come to this resort, prepare to see some bare breasts on the beach…both male and female. - The currency accepted at the resort is the US dollar and the Peso. Canadian dollars are generally not accepted, however you can do currency exchanges in the lobby and the rates are reasonable. - Avoiding making long distance phone calls from your room if you can, as the billing can go up to $5 per minute (no kidding). Use your mobile phone which has better roaming rates. The calling cards they sell at the resort also incur a service charge. - Given the tropical climate, expect to see bugs including some pretty ghastly looking mosquitoes. Be sure to pack bug spray and apply generously in the evening. Overall, my girlfriend and I have few regrets about choosing the Riu Playacar and we definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a relaxing holiday or somewhere family-friendly. As with any resort, people looking for things to complain about will find imperfections that satisfy that need, but modest people looking for something fun and affordable should definitely consider this place for their next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time--Here's some advice”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan48302
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and the resort. Smaller and quieter, but still lively. The grounds are attractive and well maintained. Staff is friendly and attentive. A relaxed setting with plenty to do. The beach is lovely. We had a ball with the waves. The pools were nice, too. This is our third time to Mexico and the Yucatan Peninsula and all time we stayed in RIU resorts. Very dependable brand and worth your money. We chose the Playacar for the beach, but have stayed at the Tequila. May try the Yucatan next. Our best tour was booked at the Tequila near the gate--ATV ride thru jungle to the Cenotes. Great guide and small group. Ask for Eduardo.

Reviews.Title: “great location,great staff, but very very dated......”
Reviews.Author: ceciliamjb
Reviews.Content: just returned today from 2 weeks at the riu playacar. i researched the hotel and other before we went and i sort of knew what we were expecting.!!! we stopped in block 5,2nd floor and we overlooked the pathway leading to the lobby/beach,could have been worse (overlooking the next hotels laundry room). we got to know some of the british holidaymakers over the 2 weeks,and they all were in block 5??? (coincidence by the hotel,we brits dont complain as much as some) 3 couples had no hot water for days,one couple had none for 7 days,and the maintainence man said just run it until it comes hot,it took 20 or so minutes,a waste of water. our room was clean,and cleaned daily,but it was far from perfect. the shower tray was damaged,and was clearly very old,the plug hole was loose and no light in the shower at all?? we had a mini bar/fridge and we requested pepsi light,and the lads did change it. the bed was like a snooker table,it took 3 or 4 days for our backs to get used to it,but it was clean ,apart from the throw on the top,which was filthy in places. the pool on the 2nd week was disgusting,you could'nt see the bottom,very cloudy,it should have been closed for health reasons,a couple who used it got mouth ulcers,so we used the beach. the food....there is the self service restaurant,and we ate here mostly,breakfast a great selection, and the evening selections varied ,overall a 9 out of 10. we went to the mexican restaurant one night and lets just say very average, food bland a score of 5 out of 10,(the mexican night in the self serve was far better) also we tried the steakhouse and very similar service/etc. again quite bland ,6 out of 10 from all of us. the bar staff canot do enough for you,we tipped them 20 peso's usually,and frequently,this got us good service,we especially liked nancy and enrique as well as abraham. when there you have to do the bar crawl with thomson,55 us dollars,and worth every penny. blows you away coco bongo's 10 out of 10. we were looked after by miguel and andy(thomson) and the made the perfect combination,(local knowledge and company experience) they were not pushy i seeling you trips,they explained them and said if we want any let us know. we went over to the tequilla to play pool 2 nights (sports bar) and the residents (kids) made playing pool almost impossible,take ear plugs if you want to brave drunk kids screaming,other wise stay clear, would we stay at the riu playacar next year, if the condition of the rooms was the same then no, but they might one day spend some dollars on the place. also lastly,we booked with portland holidays (thomson group) and they advised us to take mexican peso's with us,well we were given bad advice,take us dollars,every where takes them and you have to pay for trips in us dollars,so you get shafted on the exchange rate,also its better for you if you tip 1 dollar,as 20 peso is around1.6 dollars. hope this helps. john whitehead la duquesa andalucia spain

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: troythetraveler
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a group of 10, 5 adults and 5 teenagers. The Riu Playcar met all our needs. A smaller resort, 6 buildings, 3 stories high. Main Lobby is street front, 2 rows of 3 buildings, then restaurants, entertainment, pool, then beach. Rooms: We stayed in building 4, in the middle. try to get building 3 or 4, as it may have less traffic walking by. We had a middle floor, although we had requested a top floor, but 4 rooms were not available on top. slightly noisy at times, your room is only as quiet as your neighbors next door. most rooms open to a center open corridor, and the place is bustling by 8am. Beds are very hard. we had a mattress topper on our beds when we arrived so we didn't have to request one, but its still hard with the topper, and side sleepers will toss and turn at night! All rooms have 2 double beds pushed together. the bathroom has a curtain, then sink, closet, nice shower, and toilet with door. fridge with water, pop, beer, and a liquor cabinet dispenser. Small patio. We didn't have any odors in our room as some had in previous reviews. there is no ocean view rooms, buildings are set back a bit, and lots of palm trees, then beach/ocean. Food: Food was great! never tired of the menu. In main lobby is large breakfast buffet, something for everyone. Lunch is a buffet at Turquesa near pool/beach. taco station everyday, hot foods, cold foods, pizza, french fries, chips, pica de gallo, fresh guacamole. dinner is main lobby buffet again, they changed the menu every night. We did go to all the specialty restaurants, Turquesa which is the lunch spot, transforms to half steakhouse and half mexican at night. all great food. Jade is an asian buffet in main lobby. asian entrees and sushi. You have to make reservations for the steakhouse, mexican and asian restaurants at the breakfast buffet starting at 7am. reservations go fast! you need to be there a few minutes early to get what you want. seatings for dinner are at 6:45pm and 8:45pm. Lobby Bar, Pool Bar, and a Bar by the entertainment stage. the entertainment was not great, we walked by a few times at night to see the show, but never sat down to watch. There is a disco at Riu Tequila, and a sports bar there, went over there one evening. 2 pools, never crowded. we stayed on the beach all day everyday, got there around 9:30am, no problems getting chairs. Some palm trees for limited shade, or large open area near water. Great beach! activities all day, take it or leave it! Friendly employees, very clean, great location. 45 minute bus ride from airport. shopping area across the street. Starbucks, jewelry, clothing, misc. I would recommend this hotel, decently priced for a decent hotel. I probably wouldn't stay again, not that it was bad, but we like to try different properties, maybe another Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday ! Great Place !”
Reviews.Author: pitabread15
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Mexico, we booked with Thompson Holidays, we have used Thompson before and also stayed in Riu Hotels so we new what to expect and we were NOT disapointed. The Hotel was just like the other Riu hotels we have stayed in, the rooms are in blocks set in beautiful gardens and were off a good size, there are two large double beds which are hard so when you check in ask for a matress topper which is free, there is a tv and clock radio. There is a large area with sink wardrobes seperate toilet and seperate shower room NO bath which my wife prefers, you get a free safe, iron and ironing board. There is a small fridge with beer, soft drinks and water, also optics with brandy, rum, vodka and whisky which are refilled every two days for FREE. The only problem we found was that the rooms are off a large a large open space in centre of each building which amplifid any noise which can be heard in your room. There are six Riu Hotels in Playacar and you can use the facilities of four of the other Riu's which is good for a change. This is the smallest of the Riu's so the facilities reflect this but it is quieter than the others and is set on a beautiful beach. Ther is free WiFi in the lobby area and laptops can be rented .The Thompson reps Andy & Miguel were very helpful, they told use its cheaper and very easy to use local buses ect,Miguel even drew a map so we could go to Cancun.The intercity coaches are great with free WIFi and tvs on board and his map showed us were and which local bus to use, 45 miles to Cancun and less than £3 each. We booked to see the Mayan Ruins at Chiche'n Itza which was briliant with food and drink on the coach. All the other sites we used buses or taxis as they are very cheap, We went to the ruins at Tulum on the bus and had a taxi to Playa Del Carmen just ten minuets and got a ferry to the island of Cozumel and went on the Submarine Atlantis over the reefs Briliant.. We took a taxi to Xcaret big park on the coast were you can swim with Dolfins or Sharks plus loads more things to see and do. We plan to go back as there is so much to see and do, the people are very helpfull and frendly, an absolutely fabulous Holiday. Remember you need £38 each at Cancun airport for visa before you can check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TravelHeros
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Riu Playacar with another family between March 13-21. We were 5 adults and 4 kids aged 9-14. We vacation at Carribean All-Inclusives every year and are experienced family travellers. This is also our third stay at a RIU and were not dissappointed this time. This resort is wonderful for families and older empty nesters. Food: Food was great. We're fussy eaters and found great selections of fresh meat and fish everyday. The buffets have enough variety to please anyone, and even include North American staples like burgers, hot dogs and fries. The grouper fish everyday was fantastic, and we really enjoyed the daily selections of mexican food. Kids loved the swirl ice-cream machine close-by the pool, available all day long. The Steak House A La Carte was good, Asian was good, but I'd suggest not to bother with the Mexican, as this food was available in the Buffet on Mexican night. Do not miss the seafood night in the buffet! Rooms: Large enough for family of 4 and very clean. We asked to change rooms (were a little too close to the nightly show) and also needed a toilet looked after - both were dealt with promptly. Nice towel animal surprises by maids from time to time, and cold beer and pop in the mini-fridge. Staff: Probably the friendliest we've encountered. Truly nice, from the maids to the bartenders and the Animation team were a load of fun. Mario and Ruben are a laugh. Remember that they don't make a lot of money, so tipping a few dollars here and there go a long way for them. Pool: There are 2 large pools, one is very quiet, the other has the swim-up bar and gets a little noisier. Nice to hang around in the afternoons to cool-off, but we spent most of our day at the beach. Beach: Spectacular. White powdery sand for miles and miles, beautiful turquoise water and fun waves for the kids. There is no under-tow, so very safe. Beach is similar to Punta Cana, but this one goes on much longer. There must be about 500 loungers available, so there was never any problem any time of day to get as many as 5 when we needed them, and dozens of palm trees if you preferred shade. Resort: Property was meticulously kept clean and the gardens are very beautiful. While this is an older RIU resort, they are constantly freshening it up and it has a little more mexican culture than the Palaces (too stuffy for our taste anyway). We visited Riu Tequila and Yucatan and found them to be covered in Jungle. Tequila is not on the beach and more the party place having a Disco. I think average families would enjoy Riu Playacar more than these two. While both Riu Palaces were gorgious resorts, I couldn't justify paying the extra few thousand as these are on the same beach. Location and Shopping: Riu Playacar is in an excellent location. All of the RIU resorts plus many others and private residences are in a larger secure Playacar Complex. There's a cobblestone road with sidewalks that goes one end to the other, into the Playa Del Carmen town (20 min. walk, or $7 taxi ride). Wife and I had beautiful walks on this road every morning - lots of joggers and other walkers (very safe, day or night). There is a shopping plaza directly accross the street from the lobby of the hotel. Fun to walk through, but too expensive to buy from. Best prices for silver jewelry is from the vendors on the beach. Cheaper than in town too. You can pay as little as $10-$25 for heavy bracelets and necklaces on the beach. If you are looking for a relaxing holiday in the sun and on a beach, with a little bit of culture and fun, this is perfect for you and your families.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelCanada
Reviews.Content: First impressions are everything about the Riu Playacar. The property was everything that I looked for in a resort. I was greeted with a welcome drink and prompt attention on arrival. The property was clean and well kept. There was a great variety of food in the buffets. The entertainment in the evenings was excellent. The mattress was a bit too hard for my liking. The location of the property was about a 3 km walk into Playa del Carmen or a 5 minute ride by taxi. Playa del Carmen can be accessed by the beach from the hotel. The Playacar area consists of private homes, hotels, shopping area,and Mayan ruins. Its a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmacgirl
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 4 day stay with my best friend and my 8yo daughter. The resort is small, which is actually great because everything was just steps away. It is right on the beach, as well as shops and a Starbucks right across the street. The food was good and we definitely enjoyed eating... you can pretty much eat all day long, there is always something open. We did not, however, like the Asian restaurant at all (except for the fried ice cream). It was, in my opinion, similar to what you would find at the mall food court, maybe worse. The steak restaurant was excellent though and I would highly recommend asking for more chimichurri sauce, it was delish! They also have a Mexican restaurant, but since at the buffet there was always different selections of Mexican food along with American food, we never ventured to try that restaurant. The staff and the service are excellent. Everyone is so nice and so helpful. The beach is so beautiful, and my daughter had a great time jumping in the waves. The pool areas are small but even in the midst of spring break season, we didn't have too much trouble finding a chair. The resort is quiet and it seems like mostly older couples and some small families were staying there. It was a great option to be able to visit the other Riu resort pools and beaches which are all just a short walk from the resort. The drinks were great and I never had a bad one! Our favorites were mojito, pina coladas, and bloody mary. All excellent! We didn't even take advantage of drinks in the room mostly because we were mostly out enjoying the outdoors and getting drinks at the bars. When we got there, we had a standard room but were surprisingly upgraded to a suite which was great. I think that even if we had a standard room it would have been fine because we spent very little time in our room anyways. A suite was perfect for the three of us though, it gave us a great amount of room. The TV was a flat screen, though we did see in other rooms they had the older tube TV's. The beds were slightly firm but none of us thought they were too firm and we all slept quite comfortably. WE were on the first floor in the last building next to the bar and pools so at night it did get a little loud, but easily drowned out with TV and almost always everything was quiet by 11pm. We never had to complain about noise. If you are sensitive to noise and people walking by, then second floor and one of the middle buildings would probably work better for you. Overall, we really enjoyed the laid back, casual atmosphere. There are scheduled activities, but we didn't take part in anything... it was really great to just relax and eat and drink and relax some more! Oh, also note that there is free wifi but only in the lobby... it was ok for us and we both had iPhones. There is a business center if you need to do some real work.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller resort, excellent for families!!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonL38
Reviews.Content: This resort is one of the smaller Riu resorts which makes it perfect for families, especially smaller kids. The pool is only a few steps away from the rooms and the beach a well, this close proximity makes it great for families. The service is AMAZING, the entertainment is also great..various shows and activities during the day. Food is great, lots of choice and variety, even for picky kids. Pool and beach are both great too. Margaritas are the best drinks, Felix or Alex will fix you up at the pool bar!! Also, across the street just outside the front of the resort is an awesome place to shop!!! Overall, a very clean resort but could use a little attention to detail, I.e chipping paint above the pool bar...this however is very minor observation. This is easily a 4.5 star resort!!! Many of the people we met on this resort have been to this RIU many times or other Riu resorts in the area, so we will follow suit and go back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware for scams in the hotel fees”
Reviews.Author: nacexc
Reviews.Content: We travel a group of 7 family members, to mexico for vacations in February 2011. We reserve the Riu Playacar from the official webpage of the hotel. The price in the url was in dollars. We got our reservation vouchers via email with the price in dollars to pay in the hotel on the arrival. When we arrive, the hotel charge us 400 U$D more, then the price of our vouchers and the prices that are displayed in the RIU official webpage. We complained, but the manager of the hotel said that the error was caused by the RIU call center. Nobody listen to our complained, and we had to pay 400 U$D more in our total fee. So be aware with this hotel, because they don't care to scam clients.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jkwVacation
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Riu Playacar to celebrate my birthday. The entire trip was so much fun! The staff were great. The day of my birthday, we returned mid morning to find my room specially decorated and they went well aboved what I ever expected to make my birthday special. My sister requested flowers sent to my room and Alex took care of that and they were beautiful. Adriana had special shots waiting for our entire group which was so sweet and they were really good!!! The food and beach were fabulous. The sunrise spectacular. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous beach!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy4065
Reviews.Content: It was our very first all inclusive, hot vacation and I spent a fair bit of time reading online and researching where we would like to go. My cousin had invited us to go on vacation with them and they were staying at the Riu Tequila. After looking at the hotels, I chose the Playacar because of the location on the beach. That what was mattered to us and I was really glad to have made that decision. It was awesome to be able to walk to the ocean within minutes of your room. We requested a new room as we were situated in the first building which was right beside the Lobby Bar which was open until 7am. The staff was awesome and didn't hesitate to satisfy our request as soon as a new room was available a bit further away which was nice and quiet. The beds were hard but I understand that is pretty much the norm in Mexico. Request a mattress pad (I just used the extra blanket int he closet and that made a huge difference). The Starbucks across the street was a lifesaver!! I had read there were no coffee makers in the rooms so we actually brought a small coffeemaker all the way there only to find out there is no cream to be found anywhere!! I think the security people in the airport thought we were crazy dragging a coffeemaker to Mexico. For our first experience I thought it was fantastic. I would probably try another resort on the Mayan just for a different experience but for what we paid, I felt the Playacar was great value. I liked that it was a smaller resort, more personal and you could get around quickly - nothing was far away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back again”
Reviews.Author: Loubeck
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the RIU Playacar in February 2011. The resort has two large pools and is steps away from a beautiful beach. The grounds are very well maintained with palm trees and flowers which add to the 'tropical getaway' feel of the place. Throughout the day there are various activities you can join such as yoga/stretching, pool aerobics, volleyball, bingo etc. You can do as much or as little as you want- but there's almost always something to do if you're in the mood. All the staff were excellent, from the waiters and bartenders to the housekeepers and entertainment staff. The rooms are nice enough but the mattresses are very firm (think prison bedding) and the pillows are too small. I recommend having a shot or two from the complimentary in-room tequila dispenser before heading to bed. You can also request a mattress topper at the front desk if the tequila doesn't help. Our family found the food to be excellent. The dinner buffets have a large selection of staples like pizza, burgers, and pasta along with seafood, chicken, beef, and Mexican dishes. Our family has very different tastes but none of us had any trouble whatsoever in finding something we liked at the buffet. We only had one dinner at one of the reservation only restaurants and that was excellent as well. After dinner, there are nightly shows in the entertainment hall. The shows weren't exactly Vegas quality but it's much better than sitting in your room watching TV. Overall we loved our stay at the RIU Playacar and look forward to heading back there some day.

Reviews.Title: “Can't have stayed in the same place as some of the reviewers...”
Reviews.Author: mannyz
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from 2 weeks at the Riu Playacar with my wife, 2 daughters and their partners and had a brilliant time. All the staff we had contact with couldn't have been more friendly and fun. The speciality restaurants weren't great but with the buffet being as good as it was we didn't miss them. I've read lots of bad reviews about the beds but by the time I was ready for mine I was out for the count until breakfast. It seemed to me that a lot of guests from the surrounding Riu's chose to spend time at the Playacar because of it's smaller size and friendliness. If you go there wanting a good time you'll have one...and take the trip to xplor it's a good value full day out but not for the unfit as there's plenty of exercise and coco bongo is a loud lively night if that's your thing...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! My husband even liked it.”
Reviews.Author: centwifan
Reviews.Content: Just coming back from a 5 day. I can not say enough good things about the resort. Being a smaller one we didn't have the crowded beach like the Youcatan because the Tequilla guests are taken to their beach since their is no beach for the Tequilla resort. The resort is clean and the employees are all very friendly and helpful. Shopping across the street but more expensive than 5th avenue and they do not barder either. Overall, we are going back.

Reviews.Title: “I WOULD NEVER RETURN”
Reviews.Author: joyttwld
Reviews.Content: Despite the white sand and beautiful sea the resort was terrible. Mosquito infested, does not know the meaning of double beds or decent mattresses, with inedible food, I would never return and certainly would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Something to Be Appreciated!”
Reviews.Author: SunJunkieCanucks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed with friends at the Riu Playacar from Feb. 10th to 17th and absolutely loved the resort. This was our second Riu (having stayed at the Bachata in Puerto Plata last year) and highly recommend this chain to anyone travelling south. The Playacar is a smaller hotel than most other Riu's but we found the facilites and service to be stellar. The resort consists of six separate three story villas which gives more of a feeling of intimacy than high-rise type hotels. The rooms were kept close to immaculate (as well as the lobby, buffet, grounds, pools, a la cartes) with staff continually cleaning every spot of the place. The beds are hard as many other reviewers have stated but our beds already had foam toppers on them when we arrived and it wasn't an issue. Televisions in the rooms are the old tube style so the age of the resort shows a bit but we spent probably 2 hrs of the entire week watching our TV. The bathroom is just curtained off from the main room with a corner shower and separate doored bathroom for privacy. Not an issue at all, just a little different than normal. A mini bar is restocked every two days and we hardly put a dent in it because we spent so little time in the room. We were on the top floor and had no issues with noise from adjoining rooms and slept fairly soundly. The food at the Playacar was fantastic with plenty of choices every night for supper with several different entrees available each sitting as well as staples that were always there. We never tired of the food and always found everything cooked well, flavourful, and hot. Desserts were also awesome with a chocolate fountain there for dipping fruit, plenty of cakes, pies, ice cream (cones) for everyone's taste. There are three a la cartes and we did only two, the asian and the steakhouse. The Jade was still buffet style but the food was great. Steakhouse was a sit down meal and the sirloin we ordered was also tasty and tender. Again, great service! Every evening there was a decent show to watch including Las Vegas, Mayan, Grease, Michael Jackson themes. Lots of dancing, lots of seats available, great bar service! Before every show the animacion staff had guests come up on stage for embarrassing and/or funny games. The animacion staff were all friendly, entertaining, and engaging but didn't pressure you to join in if you didn't want too. Avoid the beer chugging contest.... it's fun at the time! There is also air gun, bocce, horseshoe, beach volleyball tournaments for those active enough to participate. Watersports such as sailing, kayaking, and boogy boarding are also available. Most importantly..... the beach is gorgeous! Powdery white sand that goes for miles and tons of lounge chairs available with the option of sun or shade under plentiful palm trees. It's a 20 minute walk to 5th Avenue in Playa Del Carmen for shopping along the beach and we did this a couple times. Five bucks will also get you a cab ride there from the hotel. Across the street is more shopping for those not interesting in venturing too far but the prices are higher than 5th Avenue. On two nights local vendors set up displays along the main path between the villas inside the hotel complex. It was even more pricey so know what the local souvenirs are worth before buying. The pools are a bit smaller than the other Riu's in the area but we could have used the facilities at the Tequila and Yucatan as well if we didn't live at the beach much of the day. We did eat lunch at both of the above but found the buffet lines longer and selection smaller than at the Playacar. The vendors selling excursions across from the hotel could be haggled down quite a bit from the posted prices and we did the ruins of Tulum and Coba for about half the advertised price. Never heard of anyone being burned by these guys and we had a great time on our excursions. To sum it up we had a great time at the Riu Playacar and would highly recommend it to anyone. The price is excellent for the quality and service you get here. We felt like we were pampered for a week! Playa Del Carmen is beautiful and there is plenty of activities both onsite or nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star Resort !!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed154985
Reviews.Content: With the exception of a few employee's at the resort the rest of the employee's could not care less. Front desk was atrotious!! to think that they are the ones you go to, if you need any assitance or directions - asking to speak to Management - was like asking to speak to a wall !! The food was always the same, only one real restaurant so not a huge variety. The beds were incredibly hard !! Some days the rooms were not cleaned until late at night - mind you we were advised that all rooms would be cleaned no later than 5pm. There was no bar on the beach ...so for those who enjoy the beach you only get to spend half a day at the beach because the other half is spent going to the bar and the rest rooms which were inconvenient and far from the beach. I will say a few good comments and that is that the weather was amazing and the ocean was absoluutely turquois wonderful. The brochure will say its a 45min. drive from airport to hotel ....it took us over 2 hours as we were the last ones dropped off. Clearly very disappointed, and would never go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value sunshine holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: RCWILLIAMS100
Reviews.Content: Visited for a week in February 2011 on an all inclusive holiday. Found the food to be good and there was a wide choice. Rooms were kept spotlessly clean by (Aurelia). The room themselves were getting a little tired and will soon be in need of re decoration, that said there were perfectly fine for a weeks holiday. The grounds are kept immaculately, and all the staff from reception to waiters could not be more helpful. The hotel provides beach barbecues, cocktails and the beach itself is simply stunning with free use of kayaks and catamarans. The resort centre is about 45 minutes walk away and an hour if you walk along the beach. Would certainly re visit this part of Mexico again. Robert & Heather Williams, Doncaster, U.K..

Reviews.Title: “One of our best trips ever”
Reviews.Author: johnnysjeep
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar is fantastic. Primarily the people and the food make this resort second to none. The resort was clean and well taken care of with enough loungers at the ocean. What a great vacation for our group. Management neeeds to be commended.

Reviews.Title: “A venue we would repeat”
Reviews.Author: mandd1
Reviews.Content: As first timers in Mexico we had no preconceived expectations. We had read the reviews but were unable to reach a firm conclusion. We travelled with Thomson and the service from the outset was good. The hotel, though not new was acceptable in its presentation and immaculately clean. Every member of staff from the top down were pleasant, helpful, polite (even in the face of some quite rude treatment) and extremely efficient. The food available was always top form and it would be an extremely fussy eater to not be able to find a good, tasty meal. The Jade restaurant was an extremely pleasant evening with brilliant food and service. The location on the beach and within walking distance of Playa del Carmen makes it ideal to ring the changes on your 'to do' list. Senor Frogs - a bar on the beach at the ferry terminal is a must if only for the experience as a very friendly welcome is extended to one and all. A cheap taxi ride to Playa is another option if exercise is off the list. If there is a down side it is the behaviour of some of the American customers who were much too loud for our tastes but then each to their own. We have already decided that when we return to Mexico, it will be a repeat of this holiday (not a habit of ours). Thank you Riu Playacar for a superb time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: RayMChatham_ON_
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from this resort, having travelled there with 4 other couples from Chatham, Ont. From start to finish, the experience at this resort was great! The service and friendliness by the staff EVERYWHERE on the resort was exceptional! The food was great with lots of variety. The staff in the dining room were very attentive and always there to look after you throughout the meal.The cleanliness of our rooms and the entire facility was excellent. It seems there was always somebody cleaning some part of the facility. Some from our group took a couple of excursions and that was a good experience as well. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone, and would not hesitate to return there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: GCBaker01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent seven days with four other couples from Chatham, Ontario. From the moment we were picked up at the airport to our being dropped off again, we had an incredible time. The staff, rooms food, beach and planned excursions were truly the best we had ever experienced at an all-inclusive resort. To a person, we were all absolutely blown away by the quality and variety of the food served in the buffet restaurant. No matter who, or where we came in contact with resort staff, be it our servers, cleaning staff or maintenance people we were always greeted with a smile and a "hola". The rooms were clean upon arrival and kept that way all week. Most days we were treated to a towel "creation" on our bed. A very firm bed, I must add! A great vacation at well managed resort. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, value and service. Rooms are so-so.”
Reviews.Author: Zeinho
Reviews.Content: Our fist time in an All-Inclusive hotel, so I spent basically 1 month to choose...and I wasn't disappointed at all. Perfect for a familly with kids. The service is excellent, really. The food is very good - I was actually surprised by the quality. The place is great, you're basically on the beach. The only issue was the rooms. Beds were good but bathroom and toilet could have been better cleaned and it was sometime smelly - which i understand if you have an hotel on the beach but still. Anyway, I have already recommended it to friends and will again if needed. Also great to go to Cozumel and Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation.”
Reviews.Author: lapdog67
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan 28- Feb 4. Had a great time! Being our 1st time at an all-inclusive we were unsure what to expect. Very nice resort, the grounds were kept very clean. The beach was cleaned by 7am daily. (There were weeds and debris that washed up overnight) Some of the neighboring properties didn't look like they cleaned very well.) The water is very clear with a sandy bottom, it gets deep quick and there is an undertow. Huge beach with plenty of chairs. The majority of the food was above average. Large selection in the breakfast and dinner buffet. Different theme each night but most of the stations were the same. Quality was very good. The lunch buffet was average, but we only ate there once, so really can't say much. Tried the 3 "specialty" restaurants. The Asian was decent as was the Steakhouse, probably the 1st decent steak I've had in Mexico. The Mexican was not good, so we didn't finish our meals. The bar service was excellent, they do serve the drinks and beer in tiny cups, so you meed to bring your own glass. We used 24 oz insulated cups and they worked great. They would make the drinks as strong as you want, so I don't understand the reviews about weak drinks. We also tipped a buck or 2 every few drinks. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Always smiling and pleasant. There are plenty of activities to participate in and the activity directors did a good job of letting you know what was going on. The rooms were clean, you need to ask for a mattress topper, typical hard beds. We stayed in one of the center buildings, so it was fairly quiet. We would definitely stay here again. Our 1st time at a RIU property and we were very pleased. We have been to Mazatlan the last 3 yrs and this is our 1st time in the Riviera Maya. The majority of the tourists seem to be European. There are Canadians and Americans also.

Reviews.Title: “Should've picked a better time of year for better weather...”
Reviews.Author: dustbunnyKS
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at Riu Playacar January 9-15, 2011. The trip from the Cancun airport was a bit long for my taste. Our plane landed by 1:00 and we arrived at the hotel at 3:00. Make sure you bring some snacks because you will have a late lunch on the day of your arrival. The hotel was beautiful. Everything was kept clean and the landscape beautifully manicured. We received wonderful service from housekeeping and the front desk. As soon as we were in our room we requested a mattress topper, because yes the beds are very firm! We had it in time for us to turn in for the night. There is a strong sulphur smell in this area and even in the room. We found plugging the sink drain helped a lot! The beach was great! Lots of powdery sand and lounge chairs. What was really nice was there were no noisy jet skis or boats in the water. Also, I think we encountered a vendor/peddler only a couple times and he pleasantly took a no thank you for an answer. We had access to the Riu Tequila and Riu Yucatan. Both are within walking distance. They were both beautiful and seemed to have their own different attractions/landscaping from the Playacar. We took a cab into town for $5 and walked back to the hotel. We felt very safe staying in the tourist area. You can also walk up the beach into town, which takes about 30-40 minutes. For those concerned about exchanging money, most places nearby and on 5th avenue take US dollars. There is a place across the street from the Riu Playacar that will exchange it to Pesos, if you'd like. Be smart and always use your room safe for all your valuables! We went on a bus tour to the Mayan ruins in Chichén Itzá. It was a very long and hot day, but I definitely recommend it. These ruins have recently been named one of the official new 7 wonders of the world. The food at the resort was good, but not amazing. So unless you are a very picky eater you will find something that you like at the buffet. The selection is wonderful. We did eat at the Mexican restaurant one evening and it was very good. We had no trouble making reservations around 9:00 a.m. The drinks were great and endless, of course. Be sure to bring your own travel cup. They will gladly fill it for you! I do wish I would have done better research before booking a trip for this time of year. We only had two days of sun out of five. The other three days were cool, cloudy and/or rainy, (but since it was snowing back home at the exact same time I'm not complaining!). I've been watching the weather for Playa since we've been home and it's been off and on rain and clouds. Someone at the front desk said the weather is much better there in March. This area of Mexico is beautiful and FULL of trees. I definitely recommend it and I have had good luck staying at Riu resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Better vacation”
Reviews.Author: fstrthnu90
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I did a lot of research when looking to plan our vacation to Playa Del Carmen. We chose this hotel for the smaller feel, great price (we booked 9 months in advance), and the nice looking pool and beach. This hotel lived up to everything we could have wanted for our vacation. The staff was very helpful and courteous for our entire stay, the pool and beach were beautiful, and it was a relatively quiet resort. Perfect for a relaxing vacation. The room was pretty good. The bed was extremely firm, but we took care of that issue right away and called for a mattress pad. The only big issue we encountered were small ants in the room. Some people might freak out and demand to switch rooms, but a little bug spray from the hotel staff, and we were good to go for the rest of the trip. For the food, at least it was available all day. They had everything you could want (pizza, chicken, salad bar, etc.), but if you want my advice, stick to the Mexican food; I thought it was fantastic! And make sure you wake up in time for breakfast! The pool was amazing. They had 2 pools; one for relaxing, and the other "party" pool. The party pool had the swim up bar, played music most of the day, and had activities. We enjoyed the beach, but eventually gravitated more towards the pool as it was nice to have the drinks and food a little closer. The hotel entertainment staff was fantastic! Consisted of a group of young guys and girls, who were always friendly, constantly engaging and thoughtful, and overall very funny. What I liked best was that they tried to get you to join in their activites (volleyball, darts, water aerobics, and even a beer chugging contest!), but were never too pushy. And they usually did some sort of show at night. The hotel was in a decent location. There were some nice little shops right across the street for shopping (and even a starbucks!). The hotel staff said Playa was about a 30 minute walk from the hotel, but we made it in about 20 mins. We felt very safe for the whole walk, as it is mostly tourist walking around. We overall loved the hotel, and if we go back to Playa, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: smurth1984
Reviews.Content: as soon as we got to the hotel it was perfect drinks when we got there the staff spoke good english. the ooms where very clean and smart beding and towels & cleaned daily and mini bar filled up every day. the food and resturant staff where amazing the best food abord by far. we was both made very welcome and it was our best every holiday by far. people who write bad reviews need to get a life and stop moaning you expect to much when you ppl go away or STAY AT HOME love you all a riu playacar we will BE GOING BACK

Reviews.Title: “rui playacar fab time and fab staff 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: charlearhodes
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from the rui playacar we spent 3 weeks there from 9th -30th jan and flew with thomson /first choice brilliant service from them both ways we did go premium but the staff were excellent first of all its my 3rd time to mexico - previously stayed at the bahia principe in riveria maya and in peurto vallerta on the pacific coast the hotel is on the playacar complex a nice private gated communtity with several other rui hotels such at the tequilla lupita palace and the yucatan its a 30 min easy walk to playa del carmem /fifth ave or 50 peso 3 pounds in a taxi we chose the rui playacar cos its a lot smaller than the other hotels and it was a great choice the rooms are dated but large and spacious big balconies and air con and fans lots of hot water bit of a musty smell but i think this is cos of the shower and ventillation and its the only thing that lets the hotel down to be honest if they modernised the rooms it would be totally perfect hotel small but friendly and if the there were a few seaview /beachfront rooms then i would definalty go back the food is great plenty of choice even for the fussy eaters - we didnt eat in the alla carte resturants but didnt hear any complaints staff in the resturant are very good and friendly the first choice rep Andy is great - very friendly honest and a good laugh always ready to take the time to chat and no hard pressure on buying trips which made a change one thing i will say is the staff are brilliant the most friendliest i have met ever always happy and smiling a small tip of 20 pesos will go a long away but its not required the beach is really nice lots of sunbeds and direct access from the hotel but it was very rough and the weather was that brilliant in fact in three weeks we had at least 8 crap days where it was so cold i had to go and buy a sweater from playa del carmen ( the lupita and the tequilla dont have direct access to the beach but the yucatan playcar and the palace do have direct access to the beach ) We went to cozuemel for the day by ferry its 140 pesos per person each way just buy a one way ticket cos that way you can decide when to return we booked a snorkle tour from the guys outside the hotel big mistake 750 peso and we were to be picked up on the other side but there was no one there luckily we speak fluent spanish so after aruging and explaining to the tourist police a different tour agent took us on there boat and said they would get the money back snorkling was amazing - we saw loads of fish and coral turtles groupers starfish and napolean rass and eals if you want to do it just get the ferry to cozumel and book when you get of the fairy as there are loads of tour agents there also paradis beach is amazing get a taxi from the ferry there are bars resturants snorkling ect and its great we also went to paradis bay in tulem /akumel wehre the ruins are we got a bus from playa del carmen it cos 35 peso eac one way and you get off at tulem and just walk for about 20 mins untill you see signs for paradis bay /.beach we did a snorkle trip for 200 pesos and saw loads and had lunch there fith ave is great lots of shops bars resturants ect very very safe we had a great meal at casa del agua and also at 100 percent natrual brilliant holiday and would reccomend to anyone who want to visit mexicio as its a great location as it close to playa del carmen without being right in it

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: canadiantraveler028
Reviews.Content: The Hotel had terrible food, lunch buffet was really bad. We only had towels in our room the first day after that we had to call room service every evening to get them to bring us towels. We NEVER got a beach towel as they told us they were sold out everyday. (even though they gave us a towel card) The Bedding and the pillows were really bad...the pillow was about 10 years old and was very flat and uncomfortable. The room had a very bad odour like a sewer but we were able to fixit it by covering the Drain in the shower with a plastic bag and leaving the plug in the bathroom sink. We asked to move rooms but they said we could not til the next day so we just stayed in that room ..as we were told most of the rooms had that bad smell. The nightly entertainment was boring. The Spa and Gym were in a sister hotel and the gym was TERRIBLE very old equipment some broken. The spa was very depressing and old. The good thing about the hotel was the fact that it was only a 30 minute walk to the 5th and we went there for most of our meals since he food in this all inclusive hotel were so bad. The food in the restaurants on the 5th were amazing and the atmosphere of 5th Avenue was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Playacar "The Beach is Back"”
Reviews.Author: trharts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the week of Dec. 13th at the RIU Playacar. First let me say that we visit the RIU Playacar yearly and have never been disapointed. About the only things that needed improvement were the weather and the ability for me to stay up as late as I would have liked to. Don't think I will have much luck changing either. Our weather last year seemed a little strange and that was the case in Playa del Carmen also. The days were partly cloudy and in the low 70's but the evenings cooled down enough to keep the pools from warming up. We booked our own transportation this year using USA Transfers. Made our reservations online and paid our driver at our destination. I would definately use them again. Private transportation with no stops on the way to your hotel. Check-in was quick and the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice. We had one of 6 rooms on the 3rd floor that have a view of the Carribean. Our room was cleaned daily and a new towel animal when we returned each afternoon. We did ask for, and were given, a cushioned matress pad because the matress was on the "firm" side. The most noticeable change at the hotel was the beach area. There was a great beach once again. Over the last 5 years the beach had been disapearing more each year. Last year the government undertook a huge beach reconstruction project and has it made a big difference. Last year the water was up to the neighboring hotel. Now I would quess there is over 250 feet of beach. You can walk to Playa del Carmen without getting wet. The food was good as always. We enjoyed the Jade (Asian) restaurant. Estaban and all the other dining staff do a great job. We spent some time at the pool bar and were always treated great. Osvaldo, Nelson and Enrique kept the glasses at the bar La Cumbia filled. Have the guys make you a Coconut Iceland. I don't want to forget the three "captains" David, Miguel and my friend Alexx. Danny takes care of the bar that is in the lobby, which is open 9am til 7am. There are activities offered each day if you would like to participate, and here are shows each night after dinner. We look forward to returning again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Of A Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Nat_the_Nurse
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this hotel with our two children aged 7 & 5 and my parents. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left nothing was too much trouble for the hard working staff at this hotel. The hotel is made up of six blocks.We stayed in the pink block (nearest to the beach) on the ground floor. We had two adjoining rooms which shared a communal porch area which could also be closed and locked at night.The rooms were spotlessly clean.Each room had two large double beds,a large dressing area/bathroom and a minibar. The minibar had four optics (white rum,dark rum,vodka and tequila) and a fridge with beers,coke,sprite,fanta and water.Each block had an ice machine and an icebucket was provided in the room.The minibars were routinely restocked every two days or by request. The rooms were spacious and more than adequate for a family of four. The main restaurant had a large variety of international foods.We honestly can not fault the food.We ate in either the main restaurant or on three occasions we used the steakhouse speciality restaurant.The hotel also has an Asian and a Mexican speciality restaurant which although we didn't use we only heard good things about.Also during our stay we also had the option of a lunchtime beach barbeque. The bars were well staffed and we never seemed to queue for a drink. The local beer Dos Equis went down a treat and the cocktail list was extensive! Twice a week on mexican street there would be stalls selling local painting and souvenirs. The communal areas were large and spacious and immaculately kept. The reception staff were courteous and professional and everything was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The hotel has two large pools a "quiet " pool and the main pool which houses the pool bar and is also the main setting for the daily activities.Ther is also a kids pool and a jacuzzi spa. All communal areas around the pool were immaculate. We never had any trouble getting a good spot around the pool. The animation team were fantastic.Our children had never attended a kids club before but they loved it.Mario and Ruby were fantastic with the kids organising all sorts of activities both in and out of the pool.The kids clubhouse was ideally located near the pool so we could keep an eye on them.Every day at 10.30 (when the kids were in the kids club) the pool bar staff came around the pool with Pina Coladas and the trademark Strawberry Daquiris.The rest of the animation team hosted a whole host of activities from rifle shooting to beach volleyball.they came around every morning to ask whether we wished to join in but didn't take offence when we said no! The beach was fabulous!The kids tried cayaking,snorkelling and bodyboarding (all non motorised watersports were included) However I would say that there was quite a strong undercurrent whilst we were there and we made the kids wear the life jackets when they were in the sea even though they can both swim. The evening entertainment took place in a partially open air theatre. It started with the kids disco and games and then there was a different show every night.Despite what previous reviews stated we missed the Michael Jackson tribute show!! The Riu Playacar is in a gated community made up of hotels and private villas. There is a manned security gate at either end.Opposite the hotel is a small shopping plaza with a chemist,gift shops,coffee shops etc.We took a taxi into 5th Avenue on a few occasions. The taxi cost approximately £2.50 each way.5th Avenue is a long promenade of shops with direct beach access with a great assortment of shops,bars and restaurants. You can also book excursions here .I was concerned it would be unsafe to leave the complex but it wasn't and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend a trip to the silver merchants. The quality is fantastic and the prices are approximately a third of what you can expect to pay in the UK. There is also a Walmart nearby where you can purchase suncream and beach inflatables for a fraction of what it costs in the shopping plaza. We booked an excursion to Chitchen Itza in house with our rep. Although we paid a little bit more the tour guide Victor was superb.The trip was "all inclusive" with croissants and coffee for breakfast and frequent soft drinks/beer. I cannot say enough about this hotel. I was told before we travelled to stock up on anti-diarrhoeal medications as this was a common ailment in Mexico! I would like to say that not one of us suffered any sort of upset tummy for the whole holiday. On one occasion the hotel manager stopped at our table in the restaurant to ask how we were enjoying our stay. My five year old mentioned she had seen a mosquito (a fly!!)The manager promptly asked for our room numbers and when we returned from dinner the room had been checked and sprayed. It was also our wedding anniversary whilst we were there and we returned to our room to discover a tray of chocolate coated strawberries compliments of the manager.We were also presented with a mayan figurine by the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone especially those travelling with younger children for the first time to Mexico. We had a fabulous time and if we hadn't already booked our holiday for this year we would be back at the riu playacar

Reviews.Title: “About that water....?”
Reviews.Author: tiger_i
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in January, 2011. We were well-treated by staff at all levels from hotel management, to restaurant management, to pool staff, cleaners, bus persons, bartenders, wait staff, at all times, and all were as helpful as could be. I can assure you that these folks aren't paid nearly well enough for the services they perform. I was most impressed by the wide variety of clientele; Americans, Canadians, South Americans, Brits, and almost any country you'd care to name in Western Europe were represented. The room was not exceptional; adequate size for a married couple with decent drawer and closet space. There is an in-room safe located in the closet, a wetbar with tequila (Cuervo Especial) , vodka, and two types of rum (all off-brand), and a mini-fridge with 4 bottles of beer (Dos Equis), 2 large bottles of drinking water, and several flavors of soda. The bathroom mirror is clearly marked with a "NO POTABLE" sign above the water faucet. Air conditioner worked well - we actually got a bit chilled our first night. There were a couple of glitches with housekeeping; no bath towels upon arrival, but the situation was corrected promptly. Another day, there were no wash cloths, but again, when it was brought to their attention, it was corrected. Buffet was better than average and the fare varied nightly. The buffet was divided into 3 areas; pasta/pizza in one area, Mexican fare (chips/salsas/cheeses) in another, and a different meat/vegetable selection each night, in the third. In addition, 3 other restaurants (steakhouse, Asian, and seafood), all of which required reservations for one of two seating "sessions." Location was OK; I would have preferred to be a bit closer to La Quinta (Fifth Avenue) and the ferry pier for shopping and a side trip to Cozumel. It's just a bit short of 2 miles, so too far to be considered an easy walk. Cab rides cost $5 and that was just fine. With that said, it was very convenient to the Riu Tequila, where we partied a few evenings in the Sports Bar and ate lunch one day, and Riu Yucatan, where we lunched one day and used the gym facilities. There is a shopping area directly across the street with a Starbucks, ATM, clothing, souvenir, and a internet/camera/video store. My camera went out on a side trip to Tulum, and I went to replace or recharge the battery. The proprietor didn't speak really good English and my "Spanglish" is horrific, but we were able to deduce that he would need 24 hours to get a replacement battery, or could sell a recharger (recargador). The latter worked just fine although it was a bit pricey. Lesson: make sure your backups for your electronics are with you at all times. All things considered, I would give the Riu Playacar a straight-A report card, EXCEPT The day before checkout we returned to our room from the beach and found a puddle on the floor, not near the bathroom or sink. We sopped it up with a hand towel, went to dinner, and returned to a larger puddle. OK, it was raining, and the roof is partially open, probably no big deal. The morning we checked out; NO running water! Uh-oh! We reported to the desk and were told it might get fixed in a couple of hours. Unfortunately, the bus to the airport left in 1 hour. So, we checked out without taking a shower. Major Deduction.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed will never return”
Reviews.Author: tripgirl07
Reviews.Content: There is a group of us that go on vacation every year together in my family, about 8 of us. We stayed at this exact place over 4 times and loved it. When we came in May of 2010, the place had fallen apart. Awful food choices and less of them, the rooms were not as nice and from the beginning our stays the beds were always hard which we could deal with. But this last trip was the worst ever. We never even got to enjoy our trip. On the second day my Aunt got extremely sick and was bed ridden. Then my mom started with it and got so dehydtrated she passed out hit her head and ended up four days in the hospital. Not only did the hotel charge us for the doctor and phone calls but tried to tell me that there was no way they got sick there and that we must have went out of the hotel grounds. I was so mad they didn't even try to help us or apologize, nothing. The hospital thought it was probably food posioning. We all ate rice and bread for our last day after being in the hospital for 4 days and then when we left they were very rude to us. I will NEVER RETURN EVER AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “handicapp acessible”
Reviews.Author: wisconsinsherwood
Reviews.Content: My husband , daughter, and future son in law nd I just returned from Riu Playa car.I checked to make sure we were staying at an acessible resort as I suffer from M.S. and have been in a wheel chair for 25 yrs. The resort is all on one level and the rooms have bars in bathroom and shower however any restroom located by lobby, pool ,etc has no bars in them.Ouyr first 2 days I fell twice having to resort to my daughter going to the restroom with me everytime I nneded to use them, they only stayed for 7 days my husband and I for 10. After my daughter left my husband then had to accompany me everytime I needed to you use the restroom. It would be such an easy fix just put bars in rest rooms and the resort would truly be acessible.I have tried to contact Riu Hotels as we want to go to Peurto Vallarta next year but will have to choose another resort if I can't go "poddy" by myself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: windieworld
Reviews.Content: The resort is on the older side and the rooms are dated. The mattresses are hard and I am glad I brought my own 2 fluffy pillows with me. Aside from that this is a great place. The food is excellent. The buffet menu varied every day, and you could get great sushi one night, huge grilled shrimp and also octopus another. May not be your favorite foods but my partner was wild over these selections. The a la carte restaurants were so-so. The best thing about this place is the huge beautiful beaches, and the fact that you could show up at noon and still get a great lounge chair, unlike every other place we go to where you have to get up at 5AM to reserve a place. The rooms have liquor stocked in the room but low quality. If you are at the bar you can ask for a better brand liquor like Smirnoff or CC...but you have to ask. Otherwise you get the really bad stuff. The staff is very friendly (hats off to Aldo!) At the price I would definitely come back to Riu Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “fun, active and great beach”
Reviews.Author: happyhikers33
Reviews.Content: We had been traveling around interior Yucatan when we decided to try an all inclusive for first time- Palace Riviera was too pretentious for us but playacar was nice combination of pretty and clean- breakfast (unlimited fruit) and lunch buffets (taco bars) were great- - dinners were mixed- steakhouse was good, mexican restaurant fish was barely edible- we enjoyed the beach activities-volleyball. futbol and strolling- bars and disco were great for our young adult kids- nice international mix of people- overall great experience for the money- probably good for a 3-4 days would get old over a week

Reviews.Title: “average not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Sandybear154913
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip. The resort was not too big and not too small. The food was good but I felt they served supper a little late. They don't open the buffet for supper until 6:30 pm. That leaves not much time for shopping on 5th ave if you have young children that need to get to bed. Room was nice but the beds were hard and pillows weren't great. Only pack enough valuables that fit in the safe because 6 out of the 7 days we were there the housekeeper opened and left the patio door unlocked. We were on the ground floor to make things worse. Nothing taken but we had to cart other valuables around in a backpack everywhere we went. Mario in the kids club is great! Overall friendly resort and great location to 5th. Great that you can book (and depart ) scuba and snorkeling right from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lots of things to do, clean, great to enjoy Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Devi2011
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is not new and the rooms are not as modern as I would like them to be, the hotel is very comfortable, the rooms are clean and the food is good (wine not very good). The location is excellent for someone that wants to enjoy both worlds: the comfort of an all inclusive hotel, with a great beach, good entertainment at night and all the attractions of the town of Playa del Carmen (20 min walk or $5.00 cab drive, 10 miles to Xcaret and Xplore). Maybe needs newer bigger TV´s and better ventilation at the restaurants, so they don´t smell so much to food. The staff is very kind and responsive, and the entertainment team does a great job keeping you going back to the daily shows. We had a very good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: Alicat79cat
Reviews.Content: I am a single professional in her early 50s, travelled with a girlfriend. Wesjet All Inclusive for $1140. ive been to quite a few resorts in Mexico, Cuba and DR including other RIUs. Small resort beachfront along "hotel row"/Mayan Riveria. It is part of a compound of 5 RIU resorts including Riu Palace and Riu Lupita. -Service and food are excellent - fresh, lots of variety. -Staff are happy - always smiling and there seems to be good morale. -Rooms small but clean and well decorated; nice bathrooms with marble and separate water closet/toilets. -Very accessible for shopping (Playa del Carmen) and XCaret etc. -While small (total of 8 3 story buildings) we found it noisy. the housekeeping staff start cleaning at 8;30 am and due to the construction of the buildings with interior open courts, the echo and noise can be considerable. Bring ear plugs. -Beach crowded and noisy - either you get the cha-cha music from the pools (which are adjacent to the beach), the volleyball courts or near the water the boats and see-doos. And there are wide areas that you cannot use as they are path-ways to drag down the catamarans and other watercraft. -Beach itself is okay - long so you can walk for miles; swimming is only average - it can be windy and wavy alot of time and there is a strong undertow that keeps carrying you sideways. They have marked swimming areas accordingly but most people only go out 5-10 or so yards. -Pool: same problem - the <quiet< pool is an extension of the activity pool area where they play loud music. -Very small lobby bar about the size of a large kitchen island with seating for 15 max. The alternative is the bar in the main outdoor restaurant which you cannot talk in because of the noise from the adjacent stage where they put on movies and animation shows for kids. -Drinks are okay; seem to be watered down and served only in small juice size glasses. -I agree with the other reviews - the wine is awful. We found a liquor store at the top of Playa del Carmen that sells a wide variety of good wines. If you are wine lover like us, i would suggest you go there your first day and stock up. Bring your own wine opener - the hotel does not supply one for the room which means bringing the bottle to the lobby bar. -Alot of families with small children. I would not recommend it if you are going for peace and quiet or to "chill" on the beach with a book, -Dinner starts only at 6:30; 6:45 for specialty restaurants. For families with small children or elderly, this may be a challenge. There was always alot of people waiting for the doors to open for dinner. While single/no kids, I did suggest to hotel management that they consider starting dinner at 6pm as that seems to be the main clientele they are getting. This is a good place for families/children; not adults or couples looking for peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Juicy33
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Playacr for 2 weeks over Christmas. First impressions were that the resort was beautiful, clean, colourful and well laid out. The hotel is in a great location, easy walk into Playa and 5th avenue (even with 2 children aged 9 and 10). Didn't need a taxi back either. We all felt perfectly safe and is well lit and clean. The beach at the resort is amazing, warm, clean water, but drops to waist deep quite quickly, but waters fairly calm, with not much of a current (only one red flag day in 2 week vacation). The beach also had a cooling breeze, which meant we didnt need the shade from the palm trees. There is no bar on the beach, but to be honest you didn't need one, as only 2 minute walk up the sand to the bar. We took 52 oz bubba kegs with us and filled them in morning and they lasted all day - bar men happily filled them for us. Sand is soft and not shingle. The pool was a lot cooler, but was refreshing sitting in the water at the swim up bar - the cocktails are yummy, especially the mango daiquirie :-) (even husband was addicted). Plenty of sunbeds around pool and on beach until about 11 am, then got quite busy, although the pool was always a lot quieter. Plenty of shade around the pool. It is also protected from the breeze, which means it gets very warm in the sun there. Pool and beach towels are available each morning from 8 am. The food was good, lots of fried food, which got a bit sickly, but I still chose to eat it, rather than the assortment of fresh fruit. Lunches were a bit to similar, but not a major issue, and certainly not worth being negative about, overall the food was good. Red wine with dinner ok, white wine like paint stripper (very chemically, so best avoided!). The rooms are laid out into 6 blocks each 3 storys high. In my opinion, it wouldnt matter which block you stayed in as it only takes about 1 minute to walk from 1st to last. We stayed in block 5 which is the lilac block nearest the beach and theatre. we stayed on the middle floor (which is classed as the 2nd floor). This was the main element that let the hotel down, as the walls are so thin we could hear EVERYTHING, all night! The entertainment finishes at 11 but being from Britain, adjusting to the time difference meant that we were in bed much earlier. We could hear all the entertainment, as if the window door was open, and could also hear every person walking up the stairs and talking, often shouting or being rowdy. If we were to go again we would opt for the yellow colored building, as it gets the sun in the evening and is a little bit further from the theatre. It would also be worth requesting a room at the end of a building so that you are away from the stairwell (this is only applicable on the middle and upper floors). The beds although not as hard and uncomfortable as some people have suggested, were incredibly tiny, as we had 4 in one room, there were 2 in each bed, and honestly not big enough for 2 adults to sleep comfortably. Also the head boards bang against the walls when ever you move in the bed - even the kids turning over caused this. The lack of sleep during the night was combatted by a margarita induced siesta on the beach most afternoons :-) We would go back, but would book 2 rooms and make sure the location was different. All the staff were fantastic and very helpful, especially Edgar in the restaurant. and apart from the noise and lack of sleep we had a fabulous vacation

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: mntraveler3
Reviews.Content: I feel compelled to write a reveiw since I really value the opinions of others before me. To start with, check in went very smoothly. They don't have electronic keys - just the old fashion metal kind. They only will give you up to two keys per room, which is not always good because I was sharing this room with my two adult daughters. The safe in the room was very small - we were hoping to be able to put our laptops in, but that was not possible. Now the worst part about the Riu Playacar and then the rest is all uphill! The beds! When we walked in, it didn't even take me to sit down on the bed to wonder if the bed was only a box spring (with the springs bulging in places) After sitting down on it, I still couldn't decide if it was just a box spring - very hard. I had read about the beds being hard so we just called room service and asked to a foam topper. They might be limited in how many they had because they didn't bring enough for all of our beds the first night - just our room. To continue on with the beds, they were very small - not quite as large as a full size bed here in the US and they had a plastic mattress protector on so every time you rolled over, it sounded like you were on a plastic air mattress. Not only that, but they had a plastic like beadspread on top so I was surrounded in plastic. ICk. I have read that the rooms smell bad...yes they sometimes had a litle funky odor - but hey - this is a very humid area. You didn't notice the aroma once you had been in the room a few minutes. The showers were to die for! They had wonderful pressure and lots of hot water. There were only curtains seperating the bathroom area from the bedroom, but it worked out fine. I also read that someone said the wall were very thin. I am a very light sleeper and I never heard a sound after we went to bed. Maybe there wasn't anybody in the next room? We really liked the food - I even will go as far as to say it was the best I have had down there and this is our 3rd AI that we have stayed at in the Riviera Maya. Try to plan your meals,however, because there is that bewitching time that there is only the burnt popcorn and nachos with cold cheese sauce! lol! We went to the steakhouse one evening and really liked it. The location was great - we walked into Playa a couple of times. (Took a cab back once for a $5 cab fair) The beach was wonderful - the pool clean, but cold - didn't really see a lot of people in the pool. The drinks were better in the lobby than down by the pool, but we don't drink much, so I really can't comment on quality. The kids liked the free internet in the lobby and didn't have any problems with it. I didn't notice it was slow. The gym was at Riu Yuk. which was a 10 or so minute walk away - but it was pretty full at most times. The entertainment was very good if you could stay up to watch it! We would stay here again. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Small, charming and wonderful for families”
Reviews.Author: rsleiner
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this, you've probably been going cross-eyed reading all the reviews of the all inclusives on the Riviera Maya so I'll keep this brief. In summary, this place exceeded our expectations and all the moderate comments we read held true. Pros: Small, easy to get from our room to the beach, pool and to the dining areas. Excellent buffet with a fabulous variety of choices for all meals and themed meals each evening. The quality of the food was surprisingly good. Excellent service overall, especially in the dining areas and very friendly staff. Great location, close to attractions (good if you plan to take a taxi rather than an organized excursion providing a van), with small shopping area right across the street and the downtown area 30 minute walk away. Nearly all the staff speak English - good for those who are monolingual. Excellent kids club. Mario was awesome! Clean rooms. Good entertainment in the evenings. Cons: Very hard beds - follow others' suggestions and request a mattress topper. Small rooms and small beds. Fine for a family wiith young children but would be cramped for a family of teens. Wireless access available only in lobby and very slow. Service sometimes spotty - we requested a folding bed and had to repeat our request about 4-5 times before it was finally delivered. Pool was cold - however I would imagine that since it's quite hot there for most of the year, probably none of the hotels have heated pools. Just a heads up. Meal in the steakhouse was mediocre and the buffet was much better. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers with families looking for a place manageable in size and with excellent food and good service. It was an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “NICE VACATION . . . nothing special !”
Reviews.Author: pbsdeb
Reviews.Content: FLIGHT - THOMAS COOK - good flights TRANSFERS from airport - too long . . . wasting most of the first day of the vacation CHECK-IN - no troubles ROOMS - very musty RESTAURANTS - not good ! FAJITAS were the best at the Mexican NO SNACKS available other than cold cheese & nachos BEACH - very nice SHOPPING - small shops in Playacar & the market at 5th Avenue for your souvenirs ENTERTAINMENT - animation team very entertaining & kept the resort happening Good vacation but would not go back to this resort in Mexico. Prefer the Barcelo properties over the RIU's ! Cheers . . .

Reviews.Title: “Average 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLK04
