Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar was an average 3 star hotel- not 5. If you are expecting a 5 star hotel, you will be dissapointed. If you are expecting a 3 star, with average food, entertainment, and amenities, then you will be satisfied. Location The hotel is about 45 minutes south of Cancun airport and the ride there is rather bumpy. However, the hotel is located (along with 2 other Riu hotels) in a large gated community including a small marketplace, residential homes, and a golf course. The area is very nice and has a great "exotic jungle" feel to it that I'm sure you can't get in the main Cancun hotel strip. It is close to several popular excursion sites, as well as 5th avenue- a quaint little cobblestone street lined with shops, restaurants and bars. We walked there on the beach from our hotel. Rooms/Cleanliness The rooms were nice and had everything we needed- small t.v., patio, large bathroom (with a regular door--some others complained about a curtain dividing the bathroom and the room, but this wasn't the case), mini fridge restocked as often as you request containing sodas, water, and beer, 4-bottle liquor dispenser, safe, ironing board, hair dryer. The patio only had a view of another building, but we didn't go there to stay in our room all day so we didn't care. The bed and pillows were quite literally hard as a rock, so if you are picky about this you may want to bring your own pillows. I heard that you could ask for a bed topper, but we never did. We never saw one bug in our hotel room, and the maids kept everything very tidy for us. They left us a towel animal on most days. The other parts of the hotel were very clean as well, though we never got in the pool so we can't attest to the cleanliness of it. Food/Beverages The hotel offered a buffet breakfast and lunch, and either a buffet or specialty restuarant for dinner. The breakfast buffet had an excellent variety of food and drinks each morning (7-10:30). The lunch buffet was the least impressive, with a smaller selection of options (due to its location in a smaller building) and usually luke warm food (served around 12 pm-4pm). The dinner buffett was very good, with a variety of options( served around 6pm-10pm). For dinner you also had the option of eating at a specialty restaurant (asian, mexican or steak house), but you could only make a reservation for these dinners the day of, at breakfast between 7-10:30am. Thus, if you are a late riser you might not get to make a reservation. We only made a reservation one night- for the steakhouse. It was very nice food-- still not 5 star quality, but defintely better than the buffet. These specialty restaurants are not separate buildings, but rather they are set up in a part of the lunch buffet area, and the food is brought basically at the same time to all the tables that have reserved for that night. The one very dissapointing thing for us was that the 24-hr "snack bar" that the hotel claims to have is actually just a popcorn machine with old popcorn in it and nachos and cold cheese dip like you would find at a movie theatre (but worse). We were slightly offput by having to time our meals to make sure we didn't get hungry at times when there was no food available, but it wasn't too bad. There were three bars- one of which was a swim-up pool bar. The pool (and the pool bar) closed at around 6 or 7 pm, which was a bit disappointing. However, the main big bar was open until 12am and the lobby bar was open 24 hours. The only beer that they had on tap was Dos Equis lager, which was fine by me because I like it. I never asked if they had other types of bottled beer. They have a somewhat limited bar selection, but they have enough to make a variety of drinks- mainly ones you've probably never heard of, so be sure to ask them to make you something new. They did have some higher level liquors such as Johnny Walker Red label and Bacardi Superior. Just be sure to ask for a higher end liquor if the quality matters to you. I have to say that my boyfriend and I did suspect that the liquors were watered down, because we drank a lot and did not get as drunk as normal. Perhaps it was the effect of being on vacation, or eating so much, or something else. However, we wern't really bothered by this because we enjoyed being able to try a lot of different drinks and still make it through the day without being too wasted. Entertainment There was something going on each night we were there, and if you participated and drank a good amount, the show was decently entertaining-though nothing to rave about. They also had a couple activities throughout the day like bartending class, water volleyball, etc. Water Sports There were kayaks and some other water activities to use in the ocean, and they were being used constantly-you had to time it right to be able to get there and use one when they were available. Beach The beach in front of the hotel was very nice, white sand, and nice water. There was a thin line of rock/shells right when you stepped into the water, but smooth bottom after that. When we went (I believe it may have been the end of hurricane season) there was a lot of wind and clouds, so the water was fairly rough. Thus, in the first few steps going into the ocean the water was a bit cloudy from the sand being turned up. However, after that and as far as we could see, it was a beautiful blue color. We also never had a problem finding a lounge chair on the beach. There is not much shade on the beach available (which didn't bother us at the time). Nightlife The hotel did not have much of a nightlife scene (maybe because it was still off season and not too many people were there?), but you can walk to the hotel Riu Tequila (which caters to a much younger crowd) and there is plenty of people hanging out and a dance club. This was free as you are free to drink at any of the three Riu hotels within the gated community. Overall, like I said, the hotel is an average 3 star hotel with nice rooms but hard beds (normal for Mexico hotels), average buffets and some nicer dinner options, decent entertainment, average drinks, etc. The best part is how relaxing the place is, but its hard not to find any hotel relaxing when you don't have to be at work and you have an all inclusive package. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: JLRWilliams85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Playacar for our anniversary. We weren't sure what to expect but were pleasantly surprised. After arriving we went to our room and did not like the view that overlooked the maintenance building but were moved right away when we went back to the front desk. My only complaint about this hotel was the hard beds. We should have asked for a pad for our bed. I guess we will know next time. The food was always good and hot when served. The rooms were clean and the staff went out of their way to meet your needs. The grounds were kept very nice and they had just decorated for Christmas during our stay. The beach was wonderful and we enjoyed many walks on the beach at night. We really enjoyed our vacation and look forward to going back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tobykizzy
Reviews.Content: I agree with just about all of the positive and glowing comments about the Riu Playacar. A lovely, smaller, All Inclusive, on a terrific beach and with the nicest, friendliest, most hard working staff ever. I was ready for the hard bed and was primed to ask Housekeeping for a mattress topper, as advised by previous reviewers, but when we arrived, there was already one on! As a result , we found the bed extremely comfortable. My only gripes were 1) The Riu Playacar has the thinnest walls of any holiday accommodation I have ever stayed in. Because of that we had to adapt our lifestyle to suit that of our near neighbours, who retired around 9.30pm/10pm and rose at 6.30 or 6.45am - a time of the morning I usually consider to be the middle of the night back home! 2) The lobby bar is a wind tunnel on a chilly evening (we had a few in our second week)and very uncomfortable with hard, cast iron 'garden' chairs. The other bar down at the theatre was too loud for conversation, with activities going on. We found the lobby bars at the Yucatan and the Tequila considerably more relaxed and comfortable. 3) We thought the evening entertainment was terrible! But being tired out by 10pm and mindful of our early rising neighbours, we were usually in bed by the time most shows started! Hardworking ents team though. All in all a great holiday with some minor blips that didn't overly affect our enjoyment of this terrific resort and country.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and very hard working staff.”
Reviews.Author: ptemere
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to Cancun in over 5 yrs and were a bit worried about what this Riu would be like. We loved the area, the grounds are well kept and the beach is quite large, there are no rocks when you get into the ocean. The food was varied and excellent. The head waiters: Ulysis, Geider are very attentive. We also loved these waiters: Guilberto, Mary, David and Enrique. The bar in our room was always well kept and our room was always very clean. We found that almost everything was over and above what we expected except for the following: the wine is just AWFUL!!! and the internet - although being advertised as being available in the lobby was really terrible, and when you asked the reception to check the connection (because nothing was working) you would get the LOOK...really you are disturbing them! I would not recommend this hotel for these reasons: wine - internet - and the lobby bar which is very small and has few chairs.

Reviews.Title: “even better than we thought”
Reviews.Author: applechamp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 9 years ago and had a great time, we decided to return, staying Nov. 27th for 7 nights. It was better than we remembered. We didnt like the room we were given to which they promptly took care of (thanks to Aldo and Daniel). The grounds are beautiful and lush for such a small resort and are intelligently laid out for easy navigation. We loved the buffet which served a variety of different food everyday. We ate the steakhouse and the mexican ala carte and would recommend both, we did not eat at the asian as they served an asian theme at the buffet one night. The entertainment staff is the best ,great shows every night. Every bar had great service and in fact this resort prides itself on service on every level. The beach and pool areas have plenty of chairs and there are palapas and palm trees around the pool for sun or shade. The beach, well it is the best in playacar, lots of palm trees, clean and again lots of chairs. Ok I didnt give this resort a rating of 5, as said before, very hard beds. It also needs an update on room keys which are old fashioned ,they need to go electronic as do the room safes which are keyed. We could only get one room key between us which was annoying. Would we return again? Yes ,and I would recommend this resort for the service ,cleanliness and quality. A solid 4.75

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn038
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the RIU Playacar Nov.16-13. We all had a fabulous time. Our 3 daughters aged 7,10,and 13 said it was the best vacation ever. They absolutely loved the RIU Playacar. My husband and I had stayed at the RIU Yucatan last year and we also really enjoyed the Yucatan, but after reading the rave reviews about the Playacar and their kids club we deciced to try the Playacar and we were not disapointed. From our first day to our check-out everything was perfect. The reception staff is fabulous especially Aldo, he always had a big smile and personal greeting for our family. He even went out of his way to find our family in the dining room on our last night to say good-bye, which we thought was very special. The food was fantastic and even our 3 picky eater daughters loved the food. There is always a great variety of foods to choose from from breakfast to dinner. We did not try any of the specialty restaurants as our family was very happy with the variety of foods at the buffet. As we are a family of 5 we had to get 2 rooms for our family which worked out great. We had side by side rooms and we all felt very safe. The rooms are very spacious and were always cleaned to perfection everyday by the cleaning staff. Our bar fridges were stocked everyother day with coke, sprite and orange as well as beer. I had seen all the complaints about hard bed matreses, and yes they do have firm matreses this was not a big problem for our family. We have stayed in hotels which the matreses were so soft you rolled into the middle. I would take the firm matress over the soft rolly matress. The pool area is fantastic, there is a busier pool and a quieter pool. Both pools were warm and spotless. There was always lots of pool side lounge either in the sun or shade, so no need to get up early to save your chairs as we did when we stayed at the Yucatan last year. There is only 1 swim up pool bar in the busier pool, but there was always a place for us to sit down. Felix the pool bartender was great, always a special drink for eveyone in our family. Our girls loved his chocolate milkshakes. The entertainment crew is unbelievable..fabulous!!! We had such a great time with all of them. There is lots to do from 10am- 5pm. The crew is not pushy at all, they will ask you if you want to be involved and if you say no then they will leave you alone. The night time shows were OK, we have seen better, but we have also seen worse. We travelled between the Yucatan resort and Playacar for entertainment and daily activities. We found that the Yucatan is much busier and louder than the Playacar. The Playacar is great for young families, and older couples. The Yucatan is more of a party resort. Our family did a couple of excursions as were sought out at the airport and agreed to attend a time share opportunity in which we got free and discounted activities. This was our first and last time share experience. But on the good side we got free ferry tickets to Isla Mujeres, and we got to see Isla Mujeres free by golfcart. We also got discounted tickets to Xcaret which our children really wanted to go to. Xcaret was great but very expensive for a family of 5, even with the discouted tickets!!!! We also took a cab into 5th Ave Playa Del Carmen, $5.00 US dollar each way, a 4 minute cab ride or 30 min walk. If you want great deals and a variety of mexican goods this is the place to go. The goods are much cheaper here on 5th Ave than they were with the sidewalk venders that come into the resorts. The beach infront of the Playacar is fabulous compaired to last year when there were the black sand bags trying to save some of the beach, but they have all disapeared and the beach is big and spectacular. We would highly recommend the RIU Plyacar for your next family vacation or quiet/relaxing getaway. If you are looking for more activity, excitement and night life I would recomend the Yucatan. All in all everything at the Playacar could not have been better!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: grammylaurie
Reviews.Content: From the time my girlfriends and I arrived we Loved this resort. It was beautiful and smaller to where we didnt have to spend the day finding our way around. Our room wa snice and clean, had a balcony facing the walkway. had a mini bar in room and also a stocked fridge. we left a note asking for pepsi light and that day it was filled. Also everyday had a new towel animal waiting for us. There is even a clothes hanger for your wet clothes out on balcony. The first night we ate in the buffet and we were wowed, as the buffet opened the staff apraded around the lobby singing and clapping and dancing to let you know i was time to eat, as we walked in there were colored lighted ice sculptures and more ice sculptures inside, the food was beautifully displayed with carved fruits, melons and such, food was very good also and the best was there was a chocolate fountain with all kinds of fresh fruit and marshmallows. We also loved the bars, The bar by the theater was great, our first day Adrianna introduced us to Tequilla Slammers. We thought it was a fun way to start the vacation. Very fun, The pool bar was great also, during the day I swear Felix really gave you the alcohol, wow. My favorite was the mango daquiri, I suggest you give it a try. The pools are beautiful and fun, never had any trouble finding a chair. The staff were always trying to get activities going and if you chose not to participate they left you alone, And of course the Beach is the best. plenty of chairs, you could either be in sun by ater or in shade under palm trees, the only bad part is if you want by the water you had to drag your chair there. There is no drink service on the beach or pool, I highly suggest you take a Bubba Keg or Tervis Tumbler, they are more then happy to fill them for you, they keep you drink cold or frozen and you dont have to take so many trips to the bar. If you are thinking about a massage go and personnaly ask the staff at the hut on beach, because I did I got a promotion price of $40 for a 50 minute swedish massage. It was great! We enjoyed the food everyday. Breakfast buffet had many choices, they do not have made to order omlet station, but did have omlets available and made, Lunch buffet was good in reg buffet and also in the snack bar where we ate lunch every day, Snack bar also had soft serve ice cream, nachos and popcorn available all day, They do have 3 restaurants that you have to make reservations for by 1030am, we only tried the steak house, it was excellent and a fun experience. we went into Playa del carmen 2 times. Taxi was $5 each way. I think it is about a 30 minute walk. Fun place to go. Also took ferry to Cozumel one day, you can your tickets from Best Day rep in hotel lobby $22 both ways and it saves you from having to stand in line at the terminal. Ate lunch at La Mission there. I highly recommend, food is great and experience is fun, they have live music and take photos of your group in sambraros. We used the prearranged transportation services with best day. Next time we will take a private taxi, had to wait a while before we departed airport and then had to drop off other people ant other places and then on the way back to airport had to be picked up 4 hours early. By the time we got through security we had 3 hours to kill, that made it a very long day. The only other issues were the hard beds. I have read this before and thought people just liked to complain. Well they were the hardest beds Ive ever slept on. Next time I will find out if there is a pad I can take or rent, We have decided that we like the playacar so much that we will probably make it a ritual.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families with children”
Reviews.Author: esbigpapa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another great vacation at a Riu resort. We've stayed at other Riu resorts previously. This time we chose the Riu Playacar because we heard it was great for children, whom we were bringing along for the very first time. And it absolutely was. The kids had a great time in the pool and on the beach. The pool with the swim-up bar did not prove to be "too adult", as we feared it might. And best of all was the entertainment crew. They put on great shows every night, including a pre-show for and including the kids which was a ton of fun for all. They even did their very first "big production" of Peter Pan, complete with aerial acrobatics. It was awesome. I have to give special notice to Mario and the daytime kids club. Our son loved him, and Mario was great with all the kids. He kept them so entertained. The food was good, as it always is at a Riu, although by the end of a week it can get a little repetitive. The room was typical, although with the kids along, I did not get to enjoy as much of my favorite Riu in-room feature, the liquor dispenser. The location is great-a $5 cab ride into Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Hook98
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this resort and my girlfriends first. I knew that it was a nice place but my girlfriend absolutely loved it. I was here 2 years ago and I would have to say it got even better then the first time. Whatever you hear about the food remember it is mexico! Are food was great had no complaints, the staff was great and the pools were great also. Tip your bartender and you will never wait for a drink. Just look out for tequilla volleyball its a little rough. My girlfriend and I walked to 5th ave one day and there are a lot of nice shops and resturants. If you are looking for authentic food try los rancheros on 5th ave. Overall the resort was great and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: gatesy81
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Mexico and the first time we have gone all-inclusive. From the moment we checed in we felt like we were treated as VIP'S. All the staff were very friendly and willing to help. Our room was very clean and we had clean towels and bedding every day and had a lovely towel folded into an animal shape placed on the bed with petals and sometimes chocolates. The food was wonderful! we are fussy eaters and wondered how we would get on but I can honestly say we had nothing to be concerned about. There was so much choice and everything was cooked to to perfection. the pool area was very clean and well maintained. There are two pools and neither were very busy . We tended to sit by the quieter one. The other pool had a swim up to bar and that was were the games were played. The beach is the best we have ever seen, so clean and wide so plenty of room. We walked several times into the town either along the beach or on the main street. It is a very safe and clean resort at all times. We often went to the riu yucatan and riu tequila which were ok but was glad we were at the playacar as the other two were bit to big and busy for our liking.Can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Riu Hotel”
Reviews.Author: huntersmomx2
Reviews.Content: we have been to the Riu chain of resorts 7 times in the past 10 years- I have to say I was never disappointed until this trip. The staff , facilities, and beach are all fantastic. You are always very pampered at these hotels.The staff are alwaysa lot of fun and the pool s wonderful. The only bad thing I can say was the food was awful. I had read the same thing from other people and thought they were being overly critical- after all it is buffet style for the most part. Wrong!!! The food choicees were non existant- I think my husband had grouper fixed the same way every lunch and dinner. Otherwise for dinner there were the same hamburgers, hot dogs and cheese pizza and spaghetti noodles with garlic oil and a"taco" bar and salads available- nothing else and even if you got there early it was cold and unappealing. We tried to get to the Japanese specialty restaurant but it was not open the entire 7 days we were there. Breakfast was just as bad, the omlettes were cold and tasted as if they were made at 4 am and put into the warming trays at that time. The breakfast sausagge s were cut in half hotdogs and the bacon was raw.Our family took to walking down the road to Riu Yucatan or Tequila for our breakfasts and lunches- they had a great assortment of foods and it was made to order a. t different stations. I would recommend staying at Tequila or Yucatan before staying at this Riu hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel in a lovely area”
Reviews.Author: alletsNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We went in mid October, and I was a little concerned what the weather was going to be like. We were delayed 24hrs due to hurricane Panda, but that was our only hiccup.with the exception of one heavy downpour for a couple of hrs. We stayed at the riu Playacar on the recommendation of e relative and were not disappointed The weather for us was ideal. We couldn't fault the staff, every one was keen to help in any way. The food was a lot better than we have had at other hotels on all inclusive and all the drinks were of top named brands. We were informed before we went to Mexico by the tour operator that we would not be able to use the USDs we had purchased before going but this is not the case at the moment and USDs are still accepted everywhere we went. We found taxis reasonable, but the trips on various excursions did appear to be expensive especially if you had children. We visited the other RIU Hotels in the area and we were able to use all their facilities, with the exception of the evening meal. We preferred the Riu Playacar . Would we go again ?? Yes. Would we use the same tour company?? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: muskokababe
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the resort we soon realized that the beach had been closed due to past storms that had washed out the beaches. We arrived on a Friday and we able to use the beach to some extent on the Sunday. We made the best of it even though it was disappointing at the time they eventually opened the beach and we enjoyed it for the rest of our stay. Beautiful sand and warm ocean waters. In the meantime we walked into Playa Del Carmen. Great little town. Loved the atmosphere, food, drink and of course the beach. A must if you visit. If you don't feel like walking you can take a $5US cab ride into town. We were going to head over to Cozumel but ending up enjoying what Playa had to offer. Restaurants, bars and shopping. I have been to a few RIU resorts (twice in the Dominican and 1 to Cabo San Lucas) The RIU chain is a definate resort to check out. Best customer service...they go the extra mile to make your stay as enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “first class holiday”
Reviews.Author: sally_hargreaves
Reviews.Content: This was the first time to Mexico so was guided by my local travel agency to stay at Rui Playacar. I was not disappointed. The room was nice with plenty of space. The cupboard space was more than adequate with plenty of hangers. The bedding and towels were a little old but they were clean. There was a mini bar in the room which consisted of a fridge stocked with local beer and soft drinks. There were also optics in the room. These were all restocked every other day. The main restaurant was large and airy with clean linen, crockery and cutlery. The waiters were attentive filling the water glass at regular intervals. The breakfast buffet was varied, if the same every day. However, there was enough choice to eat a different meal each day. The lunchtime buffet was similar. Plenty of choice which would satisfy even the fussiest of eaters. The Main evening restaurant had themed nights ranging from Mexican to the gala dinner. There are also three other restaurants to choose from. A steak bar, Asian and Mexican. Going this time of year it was low season so the Asian and Mexican were held on alternate nights but they both operate simultaneously during the high season. The food on offer was of a high quality and we noticed that the trays of food were changed at regular intervals even if not much was used and replaced with a fresh supply. Food hygiene was taken very seriously. All the food was well presented. There were three main bars. One in the front reception area, one by the theatre and the pool bar. The bartenders were very friendly. The entertainment staff were second to none. They would be by the poolside by 10.30am encouraging participation in the various games and activities, but were happy to leave you alone if you did not want to take part. The poolside games were varied and fun. They also helped with the evening entertainment. firstly with the kiddy disco (what fun) and then for the main event. They also did an excursion every night to Coco Bongo the hot nightclub in Playa Del Carmen. This did not finish until 3am. Then they were back on duty the following day. Guest from the other Riu hotels in Playacar came to our specific hotel because of the entertainment team. My overall impression of the resort was of a very clean and friendly place and I would visit again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service!”
Reviews.Author: naturalgrass
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation at the Riu Playacar Oct. 2-9. We had a wonderful time! Flight there was great as well as the transfer to the hotel. The trip in was a little long due to a detour because of construction. Check-in was seamless. The room was nothing special and the bed was hard...even asking for a mattress pad and two more pillows! We knew this going into the trip from reading the reviews on Trip Advisor though so it was no surprise. The air conditioning worked well and the maid service was good especially after a few tips! This hotel doesn't have purified water but they kept us stocked with plenty of bottled water all week. Overall the room, lobby and restrooms were very clean and well kept. We never noticed a bad smell other than the normal scent of the Mexican Yucatan! They do have wireless internet in the hotel lobby, but it was "hit or miss" as far as working or not. That being said, we were able to access it every day...we just had to try a couple of different times. Breakfast and dinner buffets were great. Lunch wasn't as good, but we could always find something (we love guacamole and chips) to eat. The Riu Playacar had three a la carte restaurants. They were OK with the steakhouse being the best and Mexican a close second. The Asian place was not very good and was a buffet in disguise! There wasn't much for sushi here so don't get your hopes up. Something you might like to know is that you could wear shorts to dinner as long as they weren't ripped or a bathing suit. I packed pants and dress shoes but was happy to find out that I could wear flip flops and nice khaki shorts! Drinks were great and they provided a better brand of liquor if you asked (Smirnoff, Bacardi, jack Daniels). One bad note here....the wine was AWFUL! No problem though, we went to Walmart and bought our own! Hola to Enrique, Dani, Polo and Froylan! These guys are great whether you tip or not...but a few dollars over the course of the trip make your service "extra" special. The beach was awesome! There were plenty of palm trees to get some shade from the sun when you needed it. We never had to play the "towel game" as there were always plenty of chairs. Pool was small and saw a lot of action everyday...so you can imagine, it wasn't very clean. We stayed out of it because the beach was so nice! The entertainment staff tried hard to keep everyone involved and overall all of the hotel staff were great. The Apple Vacations rep was very helpful at the hotel. After we told him we were not interested in any excursions, he showed us all of the places he recommended in town (his name was Roberto). We could go to two other resorts....Riu Yucatan and Riu Tequila. The Tequila isn't on the beach (it is across the street). The Yucatan was right down the beach and an easy walk. Our hotel seemed to be older than these other two and their pools were much larger. We could eat at both of these but only breakfast and lunch. Food was the same at all three so we only ate there once or twice to get a change of scenery. They were all great and fun but I would rate the Yucatan first, Playacar second and the Tequila last (no beach!). Of course, I didn't see any of the rooms in the Yucatan or the Tequila. Don't get me wrong, I loved our resort...but the Yucatan just seemed like it was newer or it had been updated recently. The shows are OK and there is much more atmosphere at the Riu Yucatan and the Riu Tequila....just take a short walk to either of these. The Playacar area is very safe at night to walk around. Downtown Playa was great and we enjoyed the fact that it was more "laid back" and "less commercialized" than Cancun. It was a $5 cab ride from our resort. Go to Walmart to get your coffee, vanillia, tequila, sunscreen, snacks, etc. Very safe and MUCH, MUCH cheaper! Overall we had a great time! The Riu Playacar is not a 5 star hotel...so don't expect it. It is great value with great service and great people....plus, you’re in Mexico on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday ,should of stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: johnkennedy1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, after reading some of the reviews on here some good some not so good (for stupid reasons). We were greeted with a drink upon arrival and were told all we needed to know about the hotel, the staff were really friendly and helpful and check in took no longer than 5 mins. Pool Area 2 pools one a quiet one and one with the pool bar where the activities took place throughout the day which were pretty funny to watch , the staff tried hard to show everyone a good tie but wouldn't hassle you if you didn't want to join in. both pools were never busy and could always find plenty of beds, but that didn't stop some idiots putting there towels down at 7am . Beach Beautiful beach ,again plenty of beds if needed sea was crystal clear ,clearer than the pool at times.the waves never got that big and most days the sea was very calm. We did get one or 2 people trying to sell us cigars and "silver" but they didn't hassle us. There is a hut just as you come onto the beach where you can paint your own plates etc which they then touch up for you and they come back looking very nice.also you have free use of snorkelling ,canoes and small sail boats jet skis are at an extra cost. Food The food was OK in the buffet restaurants, its never going to be amazing when cooking for so any people. I would recommend going the the speciality restaurants every night instead of the buffet . Room The rooms were very clean and were cleaned daily shower was really nice and powerful. we did go on a few trips , horse riding at Rancho Baxeal which was great fun riding along one of the best beaches i have ever seen and through the jungle, it was like being in an episode of lost. Also we went to Coco Bongo which was a good night total madness fro start to finish, my favourite trip was to Akun Chen where we went zip lining through the jungle, cave walking and snorkelling in the under ground caves (cenotes) we chose this place instead of the bigger Xplor park as Xplor is man made. I would recommend mexico to anyone but go for longer than 7 days which is not enough as we found out

Reviews.Title: “what a great getaway!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: possum7
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar is quite nice. All the staff were very very friendly; some were on the quiet side-perhaps they didnt speak much English, but everyone was nice. All the staff were immaculate and uniformed. The beachfront at this establishment like all of Playa's beachfront is perhaps the most beautiful there is, and this was certainly no exception. The pools were very warm and clean. All the food was good, and some of it was absolutely the best it could be. The a-la-carte restaurants I could take or leave- the buffet is really that good, and I would like to add that I never get any stomach problems when I stay at all inclusive. If you have had the astounding stomach trouble for a few days on a trip to Mexico you know what Im talking about- enough said. You will not get sick here. All the ice, water served for drinking etc has been purified. The minibar has water, soda beer etc, and there is a liquor dispenser with typical booze. Anyone who thinks there is a musty smell must be a first time visitor to Mexico. As soon as i step off the plane there is that dark, aromatic, mineral smell that is at once a smell and a feeling that says Hola! This is Mexico you are smelling near the sea with tropical climate, humidity and all. It is normal and to be expected. Room was nice, not brand new but nice- and 100 times better than some other hotels in Playa. All in all this was an incredible value as it was on sale thru Apple Vacations. 7 nights all inclusive, airfare nonstop from Chicago, airport transfers in Mexico, truly all inclusive for $741.00 per person final cost. Yeah Apple! I do however tip the maids, and the luggage bellman etc. Bring some $1 bills along and use them accordingly. If you want a fancier resort with fancier food, bidets, etc its all right there up the street at other Riu resorts and non Riu as well, however you will PAY higher for these. I was told by some Holland travelers that this was the nicest between this, the Riu Tequila, and the Riu Yucatan as they had stayed at each one. They emphatically preferred Riu Playacar. The only thing I found odd was the sometimes 'frenzy ' at the buffets. I think perhaps some people are frustrated or overwhelmed when confronting so much food and some of the "ladies" especially so. All in all I would recommend this at once. You have no idea what goes on in the kitchens at some resturants in some countries. Their standards of cleanliness are not the same as at home, and are not tolerated well by some stomachs, however Riu Playacar has excellent, excellent and clean eats. Take this for a whirl, and don't forget your Mexoryl !!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, casual and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: snorkelfins
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Rui Playacar was very pleasant. We stayed 4 nights, returning 9/23. Our room was a standard room 3124, close proximity to the Lobby and a very easy walk to the pools/beach area. The room was quiet to the outside noises. The beds were firm, but okay for sleeping. We liked the ability to adjust the AC and the room also had a ceiling fan. The service at the reception area was friendly and attentive to our requests. The service at the bars/dinning areas and housekeeping were also very friendly and accommodating. The gounds were always clean and beautifully groomed. The beach has wonderful white sand and the water was warm, however a little rough- expected for this time of the year. Still okay for swimming and wave jumping, but not for snorkeling off the beach. We enjoyed most of the food and there was something for every taste. We walked over to the Rui Tequilla and rented bikes for a very reasonable cost and rode into Playa del Carmen-only a couple miles away. Also, there are stores across the street from the hotel lobby with some good deals to be found if you don't want to walk or ride into the city. There is a golf course in the neighborhood if you enjoy golf. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much, enjoyed our package price, and will probably return.

Reviews.Title: “The best holiday EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amy2405
Reviews.Content: Dont listen to all the bad reviews you have to go on ur own judgement. Me and my partner decided to go with it and were amazed by everything this holiday had to offer. Firstly the rooms were clean and kept clean, tip the cleaner and fridge filler at the start of the hotel!!! the air con was amazing and kept the room fresh there was NO musty smell. I worried about the supposidly hard beds but slept better than ever and the rooms were large. The food was lovely, there was something for everyone, we ate at the steakhouse, the mexican, and the chinese, and they were all lovely and made it a nice treat. The drinks were not watered down, and the coctails were special!! All the staff could not do any more for us and they were so welcoming and happy 24 7 it amazed us just how wonderfull they all were. the entertainment was good all the staff worked very hard to please my son was entertained by lovely mario who coloured and painted and took a lot of agro from the kids, but my son loved him and he was very good! the daytime entertainment by the pool was funny and kept everyone involved with something, however they would not hasstle you if you didnt want to do anything and the way the pools are designed you can either graze by the quiet pool which is pretty r get involved in the main pool at the bar. The evening entertainment was brill it started quite late and the kids entertainment was repeated, but the staff who did the shows clearly worked hard and were very good. The beach is absoloutly stunning and the water is crystel clear. This truely was an amazing holiday for me my partner and son.

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for the money”
Reviews.Author: fender79te
Reviews.Content: Just got home from Riu Playacar. Good, not great food. Buffet was decent for breakfast but dinner got a little blah. Ala Cart was the steakhouse as the best choice. The others were just OK. The place was very clean, pool was nice and the beach was amazing. The work that was done to the Playacar Beach was well worth it. Let's hope for no more hurricanes. If your looking for a place to stay on a budget, this is for you. Decent for the money

Reviews.Title: “I would try somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: mtclassylady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with (3)families with kid (8-18). The rooms were just fine. The meals were ok. The restaurants were the same food as the buffet. We really are not picky people and can go with the flow. The entertainment was NOT GOOD!!! They just switched from hotel to hotel. I would recommend staying at the Iberostar Paraiso Del Mar. Very nice!! The only thing nice about this hotel was that you could walk to town if you wanted. The boys did go a fishing trip and liked that. And did caught fish.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: mckc143
Reviews.Content: nearly zero complaints. pool closes at 8 pm, but we heard thats normal now for most resorts. room did have musty smell. got used to it pretty quick. service was good to excellent. beds fine. ignore complaints on this. some topless. mostly on beach. in airport, ignore all the people after customs. walk directly outside to find your travel rep. people inside trying to get you for timeshare or other scam. they really try hard. we took the tulum extreme trip. ruins tour, rappelling, zip line, snorkel in cenote. decent extra. downtown playa del carmen seemed very safe. didnt even make it halfway down 5th street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - read this review”
Reviews.Author: jenbUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay at Riu Playacar - and before we describe our experience I need to say take each of these bad reviews you read with a view as to people have their own opinions and you need to go and form your own. Sometimes it can put you off but our experience was so good we had to write a review. We took our two small children so a hotel needed to be up to scratch for us to stay there. Transfer time to hotel is long - dont be fooled and a lot of it is stop and start but it is worth it when you get there. The hotel is SO clean and we have never seen so many cleaners around a hotel. There were people cleaning from morning through to night and the hotel and grounds were spotless. Checked in with no problem all reception staff speak really great english and were so helpful. The resort is a lovely size and you are never more then two/three minutes from anywhere. We stayed in block 5 which was perfect. The room was a typical room you would expect but absolutely spotless. The only down side was the view but that did not spoil it for us. Beds were fine - please do not worry about the bad reviews saying they were rock hard. We spoke to so many people whilst there and we never heard 1 person complain about the beds. Air conditioning is brilliant and at times we had to turn down as it was chilly :o). Food is very important to us with two small children and it was lovely. Nothing we had over the two weeks looked under cooked, was cold or left hanging around. The amount of food that was replenished was unbelievable - again didnt speak to anyone that had tummy problems. But be aware what you are going to :o) food is lovely but will be repetative on occassions - this was fine for us but again some other people would class this as bad. Now to the people who work there. Again we have never ever been to a hotel where ALL the staff, and seriously we mean all the staff are so happy and friendly . Special mention to Raul in the restaurant, Dani, Enrique and Polo at the bar - please if you are going soon tell them Sam Sam said hi :o) Entertainment is around you ALL the time so if you want to go for quietness spend all your time either down the beach or at the quiet pool. However saying that the entertainment team are brilliant. They again are so friendly and like to involve you. Special mention to Mario, Ruben, Alex and Rubi - if you dont want to get involved they wont hassle you like other hotels we have been too. Beach is fab. Much cooler than the pool but the sea can be rough. We couldnt let the kids go in on there own but they were content with building sandcastles and chilling. Finally be prepared for the heat - it is hot and humid and you need to be prepared for that. A quick tip we got some factor 80 out there as for kids 50 just didnt cut it. Overall we loved this holiday and we would definitely go back which confuses me as to why there were so many bad reviews. If you want to message me to ask anything else then please do but honestly if you are visiting Mexico for the first time try this hotel as you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: csully214
Reviews.Content: We booked a Last Minute Deal to this resort. We felt it was money well spent. This is a small resort, which is what we prefer. Easy to get around with one path leading from the lobby to the pools, rooms and beach. The last time we were in the area the beach was small and full of sandbags. Now the beach is wide and no sand bags to be found. You can walk north up the beach all the way to Playa Del Carmen or south until you hit the rocky shoreline. They have a beach grill, an air conditioned buffet and three A La Carte restaurants. The lunch grill had lots of choices and offered fish tacos and coconut ice cream everyday! The breakfast and dinner buffets were also very good with lots of fresh fruit and grilled meat and fish. We went to the steak house A La Carte. It was fine, but we preferred all the choices at the buffet. We've been to several resorts in the Riviera Maya and felt the RIU had one of the best buffets we've been to. We were worried about the air conditioned buffet being too hot this time of year, but were happy to find lot's of ceiling fans and a comfortable temperature. The service at the resort was excellent. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. The dive staff were especially great. They would thank you for diving with them after every trip. Their rental equipment was in very good condition and their dive boats were roomy and comfortable. The pools at the resort were nice, but the water temp was very warm this time of the year. The rooms were fine, however, with a little updating to the bedspreads, drapes and linens the rooms could be very nice. We would defiantly return if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: debz44hol
Reviews.Content: this is the second time we have been to playacar. 1st to the tequilla and this time playacar both were very good. had something to offer for all. the staff are friendly and go out of the way to make this a memorable holiday. they all work long hours and work hard. its great you can use any of the hotels and the entertainment in the evening is particully better in the tequilla. its very professional and the staff seem to enjoy entertainng us. we will definately be going back to either of these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever, didn't want to come home”
Reviews.Author: Hel03
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels (mostly Riu) across the Caribbean but our holiday at Riu Playacar far exceeded any other. From the moment we arrived we had fantastic service from every member of staff. Reading some of the previous reviews people obviously love to moan for very little reason! A great variety of tasty food was complimented with outstanding service from the restaurant staff, the bar staff were also great especially Francisco. We normally spend the majority of the time on the beach but couldn't tear ourselves away from the pool, the Animacion team were fantastic - extremely friendly without being pushy, the daily activities and crazy games were so much fun - we are a family that never takes part in anything but that all changed at Riu Playacar. The evening entertainment was equally as good, I was even involved in a show - you just couldn't help but get involved. The Animacion team really made our holiday, we have never laughed so much, big big big thank you to Emilio, Chuy, Alex, Mario, Ruben, Rafa, Rubi & Juan . I cannot rate this hotel any higher we absolutely loved it and did not want to come home

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: ellennn
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 and I stayed at this hotel for two weeks in august. LOCATION: Everything is absolutely faultless. The location is second to none and one of the best out of the local hotels as it is closest to the beach. I'm not a huge fan of spending lots of time on the beach but its right there so you can take a 5 minute walk and take in the gorgeous view, the turquoise water and golden sand. There is a little booth serving smoothies and fresh fruit juices as you walk onto the beach which is great and when you are sitting round the pool you still have the great view. It is landscaped brilliantly, there is a quieter pool and then the one with the swim up bar and where all the activities take place. The beach is just breathtaking, I would strongly recommend JET SKI'S so much fun and worth the money, parasailing is also fun and kayaking is also worth a go as it is free! The sea is warm but can get quite choppy but as long as you stay where you can stand up it is lovely for a little dip. Layout of the hotel works really well, no matter what block you are in you are always close to the lobby and the pool/beach area, the walkway is simple and the gardens are nice. It’s in my opinion better than the Riu Tequila as this is not only a lot more crowded and a bit more ‘tacky’ with the nightclub and sports bar and you are also a good 5 minutes from the beach and the rooms are really spread out which is not idea. The sports bar is nice though for kids of a quick drink and it is air conditioned which is something the Riu Playacar lacks. Riu Palace is nice, but it doesn’t have the homey feel, you feel immediately at home at Riu Playacar which I think is essential because you could really relax and enjoy it rather than worrying about looking good all the time(not to say that Playaca is less classy! But you get what I mean!) ENTERTAINMENT:The entertainment staff were absolutely fantastic in particular MARIO (head of kids club, which is also fantastic providing lots of great events for the kids and they sometimes do a show before the main show involving the kids, I helped out in the mini grease version and it was fantastic) and ALEX they are always so upbeat which really makes you feel in the holiday spirit and the games that were put on were always a good laugh especially water polo, and beach football and volley ball. They work really hard and you can’t fault them, although I will say if you have a teenage daughter I would keep a close eye as a lot of them are very 'flirty' and some seemed to be a bit hazy with boundaries, but 99% of the time they are fantastic and work very hard. Shows were mostly really good, and the ones were the audience joins in is good fun, karaoke was also on and was done really well. The bar in the theatre is great and it’s not hard to find somewhere to sit. Every other day at night there are stalls along the walkway, if you say 'mas tarde gracias' which means 'later thank you' they tend not to bother you. Water aerobics is great fun and done really well and the parties afterwards on the beach are VERY good, and highly enjoyable even if you don’t really like/can't dance ALEX, MARIO, RUBEN, EMILIO, RAFAEL, JUAN and RUBI they all really made our holiday! FOOD: Food is first class, the bbq's once/twice a week are really good, the buffet every night in the main restaurant is amazing and there is always lots of variety. Lunch is very samey but still really good and perfect for a light lunch, the Turquesa restaurant (where steak house/Mexican and lunch is served) is brilliant, views of the pool and beach and plenty of room. We only used the Mexican speciality restaurant and it was great. Breakfast is out of this world definitely recommend the ham and cheese omelettes! STAFF: Bar staff and waiters are very friendly and so happy to help. The lobby bar is open all night and is good for a quick drink. Before dinner there is often some entertainment in the lobby... Mariachi band or salsa dancing. People on reception, cleaners, everyone is so friendly and obliging which really does make a difference. ROOMS: Rooms, really good, aircon works great, sometimes even got too cold! Bathrooms are spacious, plenty of coat hangers, powerful shower, good range of TV channels, rooms cleaned really well and nice touches like towel sculptures were added and sometimes chocolates and sweets, especially if you tip, which is recommenced. About $2 every other or something similar and they really look after you, and they deserve it! Yes the beds are slightly hard but it didn’t bother me you can ask for a bed topper, these make a big difference and are very comfortable but not essential. TRIPS: We did not personally go on any, although we wanted to, but there are lots on offer and I have heard good review from people I met about the Coba trip, the Dolphin Trainer and Xcaret! 5th avenue is worth a look, I thought it was brilliant and unfortunately I left it to my last night to go and if I hadn’t I would have definitely gone there more, there are also shops directly outside the hotel with a bank and a drugstore, we brought a mosquito plug from the drug store and this really helped because that is one of the only problems you do get bitten a lot, but the plug really helped. All in all 5*, the only fault is that the bedding is a bit outdated, but that is it! Highly recommend giving ping pong and other activities a go, they are fun and you can win a prize like a hat or t shirt.. I found this very exciting! Although my team always seemed to lose! There's always next year! Seriously, ignore the petty bad reviews it is a holiday of a lifetime, you will love it, there is so much to do and it is somewhere I will definitely go back to. Not only is Riu Playacar fantastic but you will just fall in love with the Mexican culture and location, excellent! Learn a few words as they will be very helpful and they really appreciate it: (Thanks: Gracias, How are you: Como estas Okay: Muy Bien Buenas Dias, Buenas Tardes, Buenas Noches) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great all Rounder”
Reviews.Author: jman26
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel to stay. Location right on the white sandy beach, with lots of space and plenty of sun beds on the beach, waves can be a bit strong at times, maybe not suited for small children. Two large pools with lots going on every day, for the more energetic holiday maker. Buffet restaurant was excellent offering a wide selection of foods every morning and night, and most evenings there was a themed buffet, offering a different option of food. We used this most evenings as it was so good, we did try the Asian and Steak house on site, which you have got to book that day at breakfast time, but we found most of what was on offer here was available some nights at the buffet, so don't be disappointed if you don't get to these restaurants, as you will sample all these delights at the main buffet restaurant. The staff in here as throughout the hotel were excellent and always helpful at all times, and never looked to be tipped at every occasion, they just worked hard at all times to ensure you were happy with the service they provided. I would also mention the Manager (Joseph), who was always about the hotel and very welcoming, and very approachable. Keep up the good work !!! The rooms were very clean, and the beds were very comfortable, without the topper, again the maids were great. Great hotel and staff to match.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - we will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: LondonCarol18
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar is a fantastic hotel and we will be returning! The staff, rooms, pool, beach and entertainment staff are all brilliant! I can say i was a little worried about staying at the playacar after reading reveiws on this hotel with people moaning about STUPID things, we had a fantastic time and did not want to leave. The food is good and there is a large variety, people were moaning about the variety but what do people expect from and all inclusive Fillet Steak and chips everynight if they do then maybe they should check in to a hotel which is not all inclusive! We found the pool great and there was a little dirt in the pool but what can you expect when there are trees by the pool, the pool attendant was cleaning the pool at least twice a day. The beach was beautiful...we did not struggle once to get a sun bed on the beach or by the pool, you don't need to tip anyone to get a good bed despite what people say on here don't waste your money you will find a space. There were a few shops opposite the hotel where you could get anything you want from snacks to gifts. I cannot rate this hotel any higher we loved it and i'm sure you will too! Fantastic hotel and beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monica1072
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with our stay at this Riu. We have stayed at other Riu Hotels (Cancun and Ocho Rios, Jamaica) and we are usually pleased with this hotel chain. However, at this one the pool was dirty, the food selection was not that good and the evening entertainment wasn't that great either. When we returned home, 2 of the 5 people in our group had clothing missing....I will not be going to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach, Good Food”
Reviews.Author: bangstx
Reviews.Content: I will start my review with the location. The beach was nice, the water really isn't that pretty blue I was expecting. The ride from the airport is an hour, so If you are going for a short trip I would stay closer to Cancun. The hotel is nice I would say a 3 1/2 star. They do serve really strong drinks-not stingy with the alcohol at all. We had to tell them to cutt way back. The grounds are always kept really clean. The staff works hard to keep you happy. They also try to keep you entertained. They are pretty funny. The pool gets dirty by the end of the day but that is to be expected with that many people. The buffets are really good and lots of variety. Always was presented very nicely. We ate the steakhouse and it was really good too. Remember the steak there is not like the US, its thin and a little tough. We did not like the Asian resturant at all, as a matter of fact we got up and left and went to buffet. The rooms need a little updating. The beds are very hard but if you get a pad its not too bad. The rooms don't get very cold which is really important to me since its so hot and humid there. They are pretty roomy. Would like to see cable and T.V's updated but not that big of a deal since your not in your room much. Right across the street is a little shoping area that is very convinent. Be sure to bargain with them, they will go down on the price. Since it rains there everyday be careful not to fall because the floors get very slick- I nearly wiped out and saw other people fall. We went on the Chetzchen tour. It was fun ziplining through the jungle the caves are pretty but the cenotes was not very good. The lunch they served was very good. Overall the trip was alot of fun and the vacation is always what you make of it. I probably won't go back to Mexico because the water is just not that pretty to me. But for a quick vacation we had a really good time. The animals left by the maids on the bed are soo cute-they do a really good job.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hoilday”
Reviews.Author: tjm64
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us on this holiday, the only thing we could fault was that there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room. We all had an amazing holiday the choice of food was more than we expected something for everyone. The services we received was great. The animacion team: Marion Chuy Reuban Alex Rubi Raffiel and Juan were perfect they made sure evryone had the best time. We used OFF for the mosquitos and as long as you rubbed it in it worked also use a lemon spray they help keep them away as well. The beach is terrific. If you get a chance do the Captain Hook trip It was great fun and we laughed all night. The rooms was comfy and quite. Go to this hotel you will not be disapointed

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever”
Reviews.Author: Paige_Louise
Reviews.Content: 10 of us strayed at this hotel for two weeks. When we first arrived, the hotel was very welcoming and helpful. Cleaniness of the hotel was 5*. our rooms were cleaned everyday, the main area was always clean and tidy along with the pool and the theatre. Animation team were amazing they all made this holiday for us Ruben, Alex, Chuy, Emilio, Juan, Rubi, Mario and RAffael with out them the holiday would't have been so good. They are always happy to help, always make you laugh, the activites were fun and alway enteraining. the shows were always good and the entertament would always make us smile. the bar staff was always nice and friendly and willing to do anything, the only thing with the bar was they would run out of three of our parties drink (Pernod) nearly every night and never had a back up of it. the managment was willing to do anything they could to help you. it was a member of our groups birthday and when i spoke to them they oraganised, champange, birthday cake, and celebrations around the pool and in the resturant that evening. the room were very comfortbable and sapcious and clean. the food was the best food ive ever had in a hotel and the service was always good the whole hotel was 5* it is amazing and cant wait to go again next year! i would just go back for the anmiation team they were the best part of the whole holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Two days at RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: theucfan
Reviews.Content: I had been in Playa for two weeks at a spanish language school. We decided to end the trip at an all-inclusive for two days before heading home. The positive aspects of this hotel are location, room size, and food. The food was great, and you are really close to the main hub of playa del carmen. I didnt love the beach area, they werent enough covered loungers. There were plenty of chair, but not shaded. The pool was just so-so. The mixed drinks were not good at all. Overall, I thought it was a good deal and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING IN PARIDISE”
Reviews.Author: Bailey070
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rui Playcar Hotel, the staff and food were excellent, also the cleaniness of the whole area was first class. We went with our friends and got rooms next to eachother, our rooms aircon could have been better, but I was offered to change rooms without any hesitation. The rooms are cleaned daily and stacked up with drinks every other day. The mossies get you down but we were told to use OFF which you buy out there approx $9 a tin, we all still got bites, but might have been worse without the repellent. If I had anything negative to say about the hotel, I think it needs a bar/lounge with air con, somewhere you can have a relaxing drink or read a book and escape the humidity, especially on a night time. It was still a lovely hotel and pool and beach are top class.

Reviews.Title: “Bestest holiday ive been on!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luc04
Reviews.Content: Riu playacar was the best hotel and holiday trip ive been on. Mexico is such a beautiful place. The beach was so nice the sand its so soft and white the sea is such a lovely colour. Although i only swam init twice because i was in the pool most of the time. I loved the service. Me and my best friend were always entertained and never bored. everyday was great! The staff are actually amazing and so friendly. They all work so hard its unreal! Big shouts out to Chuy Emilio, and Ozvaldo! xxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “I'd go again.”
Reviews.Author: Homebrewer_2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Riu Playacar and had a wonderful stay. The staff are very friendly and attentive and the hotel is great. My only problem with it was that they need to purchase new bed linens as the ones we had were stained and old. But, the beach is beautiful, shade under the palms if you want it or full sun. Lovely sand and the ocean was so warm. Great walks in either direction. I did a 2 mile beach run to the Cozumel ferry and back one morning which was terrific. I didn't even go in the pool, but it looked nice. The grounds are immaculate and the tropical plants are great. Little agoutis (sort of like tall guinea pigs) and tropical birds were great fun to watch. The food was good and I am not a buffet person normally, but the selection was very diverse. I was especially happy that there were Mexican foods available at every meal as well as more European/American fare. The drinks were not watered down and easy to get. Most of the guests are European, a fair number with children, but lots of couples or adult families as well. It's very peaceful and I never noticed any obnoxious or drunk guests while I was there. The rooms are fine. I didn't notice any smell, which some people have said and our AC worked fine. There were some mosquitos, but it's the tropics, what can you do? The walk in shower and separate toilet closet were nice and I personally slept like a log on the hard beds. The lobby offers free wi-fi also. We went cenote diving one day which was very cool and creepy, watched the 10 year old on our trip swim with the dolphins and went over to Cozumel for a day of scuba diving. There is plenty to do in the area, but just to go for a swim in the wonderful ocean and then relax under the palms is heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, small improvements could make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: Richmax999
Reviews.Content: The food was excellent. Great variety, fresh and well prepared. The rooms were kept very clean with staff that took great pride in their work. There is a safe in each room but all staff seemed very trustworthy. There is a problem in some rooms with a damp / drain smell but it is minor and you can always ask for a move. The pools were incredible. There are two main pools, one where most of the games are played through the day and a second, quieter one. Both are well kept with plenty of pool space to either have fun with other residents playing the well organised games or a quiet swim on your own. Pools can get warm at the end of the day but that can happen when you have such great weather 32 degrees +. Service was good where ever you went with all the team willing to put themselves out to help you. Location can not be beaten. Great beach with easy walks along it to either go into town if you turn left of see a bit of wild coastline if you turn right. The small improvements that could be made is that the entertainment at night could get repetitive (a themed show with the same dance group most nights). You can go to two other local RIU hotels to break things up but as an all inclusive package it would be good to see a bit more variety. Finally if you are travelling with a young family i would want to know a lot more about the facilities for young children. The kids club did not seem very good and i have seen much better in this region of Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar <----”
Reviews.Author: MissFatGirlSlim
Reviews.Content: Just been to Riu Playacar Food is 5 star , excellent choice for everyone. Rooms are poor small, hard,old beds , old design that is going to re-done in january - aircon - very hot can move if you ask to . beach and pool lovely . lots to do if you have money !!

Reviews.Title: “Once again, not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: socrsusu
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Playa del Carmen and our second trip to the Riu Playacar. The service, food, and atmosphere were terrific again! I recommend it highly to those who want a smaller sized resort with a terrific beach.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzzyq48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little older but very nice. The staff is great. The Michael Jackson show was awful. "Michael" was basically going through the motions to get his job done. Last year I went to a Riu resort in Puerta Vallarta. We were upgraded to the Riu Palace which was amazing and gorgeous. They also had the Michael Jackson show. It was amazing. The food was good, tons to choose from. The beach is beautiful, the pools are great. We visited a couple of the other Riu Resorts that are all on the same strip. It was fun to venture to another hotel for an evening. The Yucatan has a pretty good night club if you like to dance. Overall the trip was good and I would definately go back! MAKE SURE you ask for a matress pad to make the bed more plush. They are extremely hard.

Reviews.Title: “Wish i`d discovered Mexico twenty years ago”
Reviews.Author: garviepaul
Reviews.Content: Awesome absolutely awesome.I am now 45 years old been on many lads holidays on many holidays with my missus many holidays with family but this holiday with the missus the mother-in-law and 20 year old step daughter ranks up with the best of them.As the only guy in our group (my first holiday in this situation) i was a bit dubious on such an unique destination how wrong was i .There was something for us all to do either collectively or individually.Aerobics in the pool for the girls pool bar for me.Sunbathing on the beach only seconds away from the pool, pool bar for me.Yep you can see where this is going the animation team kept everyone busy and for all of us with a different interest(the pool bar was mine) they just worked around you.The food was out of this world even in poolside lunch restaurant.At most all inclusive hotels everyone fights to get booked into the speciality restaurants even though these where excellent don`t be disappointed if fully booked main restaurant just as good but with a better selection.Staff where brilliant at all bars(especially pool) waiters just as good and all managers where introduced individually and they where always about helping guests.The sister hotels we walked around looked just as impressive.The pool bar at the Yucatan looked awesome.Will i go back probably but this holiday was that good i dont want to spoil the memory maybe try another riu hotel in Mexico maybe Cancun or on the atlantic coast no not maybe its a promise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cillawarrington
Reviews.Content: Wow what a holiday, this hotel sure knows how to give you a good holiday. The food, rooms, staff and beach we could not fault. They bent over backwards to make sure that you had a good holiday. If we ever go back to Mexico again (this was our second time) we would use this hotel again, WELL DONE

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money!”
Reviews.Author: superd296
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar is in the Riu Hotel Resort complex in Playa del Carmen, which is about an hour's drive south of Cancun. We knew ahead of time that it was a long drive from the airport, but it was a really LONG drive. Our plane arrived 2 hours late, so that put us in to the hotel at about 9pm, which shot our first day. Upon arrival our folio was ready and we were in our room within 10 minutes of check-in. No one offered to take our bags to our room, probably due to the later hour. No problem though. The Rooms: We stayed in building #3 on the ground floor, room #3114. Our room was very clean, the fridge was stocked with soft drinks and three very large bottles of water. It did seem very damp and musty, but there was no obnoxious smell that others have reported. We did bring a plug-in air freshener, but I think it was not really necessary. They provide small foil packets of soap and shampoo so bring your own. THE BEDS: If you're capable of sleeping soundly on the ground then you'll just LOVE the beds here. If you're like me, and require a little softer mattress, ask for a foam mattress topper at the front desk when you check in. (They have very thin ones and very thick ones. Ask for a VERY THICK one.) I'm not sure why a hotel chain as big as Riu doesn't get new beds when this is the #1 complaint on Trip Advisor. Also, they do not have King beds, they have two doubles pushed together, so if you want to snuggle with your honey you'll have to sleep on one side or the other. With the exception of the beds, our room was perfect and very clean. The Food: We ate most meals at the buffets. Just a minor gripe here and it probably won't bother most of you. The dining room off the lobby is more or less air conditioned. It seemed warm to me, but it was bearable. The other outdoor dining room was just plain HOT. I don't care to eat when I'm sweating but I toughed it out and the food made up for it. Very delicious and different each day. We ate in the reservation-only steak restaurant one night and the service and food was excellent. Don't forget to make your reservation at breakfast before 10:30am in the main buffet dining room! The Pools and Beach: Riu Playacar has two pools. Both were very clean. There is NO POOL DRINK SERVICE at this hotel. You will have to get up each time and walk a short distance to get something to drink. There are two bars very close though. One is a swim up bar. There were plenty of lounge chairs and it never seemed to be very crowded or too noisy. The beach was beautiful and clean as well. There are no umbrellas for shade on the beach, just palm trees with very little cover, so bring lots of sun block! We didn't partake of the entertainment but I don't think people come to this particular hotel for that. It's very laid back and quiet, a nice change from the Cancun hotels. If you're looking for a party, don't come to this hotel. If you want an enjoyable vacation with great food, awesome service, and a calm atmosphere, Riu Playacar is perfect. For the money, you can't beat it in Playa. We'll be back! (Riu Hotels: Please get rid of those hideously hard beds before we come back!!!)

Reviews.Title: “excellent would visit again”
Reviews.Author: tonyreed1
Reviews.Content: just returned on july 16 we had a great time. the grounds are beautiful and very clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. we stayed on the 1st floor of the yellow building our room was very clean and roomy. we took a plug in air freshener which gave the room a fresh smell, the room was cleaned every day, the food was great with a lot of choices. we ate at the steak house twice, at the mexican once, very good no problem in making the reservations. the beach is beautiful with plenty of lounge chairs. my husband recommends the Geofish dive shop in Playa on 10th and 1st . it is american owned . they have good gear no need to bring yours just your computer. ask to dive with Marco he was great. .

Reviews.Title: “All staff in every department friendly and obliging”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 11 nights at this hotel. I'll try not to repeat recent reviews and let you know things perhaps omitted or different. We spent most days on the beach. Once or twice there was a drinks service offered on the beach. Once a week at lunchtime there was food and drink served outside at the entrance to the beach. Food was excellent. I didn't speak to anyone with an upset tummy. We tried all 3 speciality restaurants. Enjoyed them all. The buffet was excellent. There were about 24 tables outside on a verrandah.We always sat there. We were always served our drinks and coffee. There were a couple of cats that visited but they were no problem. Occassionally there were geckos on the ceiling here. When I say outside there was a high roof. In the Asian you could have deep fried ice cream for dessert. There are no tea making facilities in the room but there are Nescafe coffee machines which were tempermental. Also in the restaurant near the beach you could help yourself to Nachos and popcorn We asked for diet pepsi in our fridge and they were happy to provide this. We had a whole day of rain. They did everything to amuse us. They put up gaming tables in the lobby and moved the table tennis table there to. The was a book exchange by the towel shack at the pool and they moved these too. They also produced all sorts of board games. The shower was very efficient. I dislike the little sachets of shampoo and shower gel but that was my only complaint about the room. We were on the top floor of the pink block nearest the pool and the sea overlooking the next hotel and found it perfect. Sunny balcony in th morning. If you want something from the evening stalls every few nights do so as they are packing up to get a bargain. We never had a problem getting a sun bed but we are early birds. We lunched in the Tequila and Yucatan and had pre dinner drinks in them too,We preferred our hotel only because it was smaller. You can also have lunch at the beach club of the Riu Lupita which is up the beach the other direction. We walked the road into town. It was about 30mins at a leisurely pace. There is a Walmart there but we didn't buy anything. I'm sure it would be great for value if you were not all inclusive. Oh, and the great bed debate. We didn't ask for a topper,the mattress did have a thin quilty cover. It was firm but very comfortable. Enjoy, I wish I was still there

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff in the Riviera Maya!”
Reviews.Author: bcinkv
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th trip to this part of Mexico and without a doubt the staff at the Riu Playacar are the friendliest and most efficient we've encountered anywhere. Whether interacting with guests or each other, they were just a happy bunch. That can go a long way towards making an enjoyable experience for all. Rooms are comfortable and spotless. I witnessed a housekeeping supervisor running a finger around the outside of the sliding glass door to check for dust! Even the balconies were immaculate. The rooms appeared to have been recently updated. Bathrooms were spacious and the toilets were another "best in the RM". If you've visited Mexico before then you know how hit and miss that can be. Updated toilets and sewer systems are a definite luxury! Another resort just a stone's throw away still has a "no paper in the toilet" policy. Taste in food can be very subjective but we thought it was delicious overall. Lots of variety and something for everyone! It was better than most we've had in the area. The meats were seasoned and cooked perfectly, for the most part, which is a rarity! Drinks are the typical AI fare, which is to say they aren't great, but the margaritas on Mexican night in the buffet were delicious, so they can make a good one when they want to ;-) The beach is gorgeous, with lots of palapas and not much shade and the pools are adequate (nothing spectacular) with lots of both. They don't have poolside or beachside service per se but staff members make the rounds offering drinks, ice cream and fresh fruit on a regular basis which is a nice touch. Overall a great little resort, just the perfect size, with amazing employees. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abi03
