Reviews.Content: we got 2 mexico on the 24th of june n it was cloudy n we then had a tropical storm " hurricane alex " hit us this kind of weather lasted for 4 days which was horrible coz alot of the trips were cancelled bcoz of the weather! but after it was blue skys and v hot BEAUTIFUL! Hotel was lovely people were amazing and cudnt do enough for u!!! whatever time it was they always had a smile on ther face! the maid cleaned our room everyday n it was spotless he also made wonderful towel animals! =) the minibar was stocked every other day with 6x beers 2x 7up 2x pepsi 2x fanta and 2x big bottles of water but if u ran out b4 u can always ask 4 more at reception n they will give u how many u want. the food was lovely breakfast lunch and dinner was always a variety and catered alot for all nationalities! animation team were wiked done alot around the pool all day n were great with the kids v freindly! the grounds were beautiful n the beach was to die 4 white sand and turquise sea which was like walking in to a bath! we visited riu tiquilla and riu lupita but i thought playacar was the best it is the smallest but u didnt seem 2 get lost or u didnt hav 2 walk 4 miles to get 2 a place and plus the tiquila doesnt hav the beach! there is a little shopping plaza accross the street but u can get everyting cheaper in playa del carman 5th avenue a taxi there is 5dollers or u can walk about 15mins we walked back along the beach at sunset which is a must see view! =) there is alot to see in mexico ! and some wiked trips to go on! we went to explore where u can zipline from platform to platform the highest line is 50metres! u can raft thru caves and swim in them drive a 4x4 thru the jungle and caves but remeber ur driving licence! was a rele good day and there are lots of cameras around takin ur photo but we didnt get any bcoz there are like 50dollers for 1photo! we swam with dolphines i love them!! it was the royal swim was rele gd and the trainer was english so that was rele good aswel and the photos were only 6dollers each!! we went 2 xel-ha which is like a natural park the ticket is all inclusive so u can eat and drink whenever u want which is good bcoz u dont need any money unless u want souvieners! u can snorkel swim ride bikes and go on rubber rings down the river! very good trip! on our last day we went on quad bikes throught the jungle which was rele good 2! there are so many trips you could do one everyday! there is lots of nightlife down playa del carmen coco bongo is deffently a place 2 visit!!! lots of wel named brands down there aswel it gets v busy at night so b a little bit carefull but there are taxis eveywher so u can jus jump in 1 of them and come bak at anytime and it is stil 5dollers! we only stayed 10nights but i could hav stayed alot more :( this was such a wiked holiday!!!!!!! mexico is deffently a place to visit!!!! this is a 5star hotel and is very recommened!! have fun!!! =) =)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Natacha B
Reviews.Content: Once I got there, I knew it was going to be great. The people on the reception were incredibly nice and helpful, always with a smile on their faces. When we went to dinner, the staff would come and talk to us, see if everything was ok and asking us where we were from, when were we leaving, etc. The rooms were nice and big, although the bathroom didn't have a door, only a curtain. The rooms were always very clean and cool because of the air conditioner. We stayed at the green building, the one furthest to the beach, which was nice, because it was far from the confusion and noise. The food was great, especially in the breakfast, such great variety. The pool area was super fun, music all day with activities, and the animation staff were incredible, super fun, as we would sometimes go to the bar and drink tequila, including the people who worked at the bar! Also I loved the pool bar! The animation at night wasn't anything special for me, but it depends on the taste (we watched Mariachi, Maya Show, etc). The beach was not full at all and it was pretty peaceful and quiet. Also great discos in the Fifth Avenue, not so far away from the hotel. I would SO want to come back there! And from the other RIU's I saw (Tequila, Lupita and Yucatan) this looked definitly the best.

Reviews.Title: “An experience not to be forgotten”
Reviews.Author: ntjt
Reviews.Content: Hotel:- excellent facilities, food and service. Location is ideal and right on the beach. Note there are no parasols on the beach just palm trees for shelter. The restaurant/bar/lobby areas are good and the service at front desk and everywhere around the hotel was excellent. The place is keep very clean and tidy and everyone takes great pride in what they do. Food:- Good choice with mixed menu to suit and cater for all nationalities. We always found something different to eat during our 2 week stay. Water:- Not convinced of the quality of the water in the hotel for drinking as both my wife and I suffered with upset stomachs for a number of days. Stick to bottled water from the start including brushing teeth. Drinks:- Whilst freely available I would suggest caution as far are cocktails particularly when mixtures of cream based ingredients are added. The heat and humidity are high enough for concern when it comes to cream/milk based products. Weather:- We visited between 19 June to 3 July and whilst the temperature was bearable, the humidity did make it feel very uncomfortable. Best time to visit would probably be in the high season around Jan/Feb. Also we encountered a tropical storm (Alex) which lasted for 4 days and made it difficult to get around. You can always borrow an umbrella from the front desk. Site seeing:- We visited Chichen Itza which was an interesting trip. Our guide was amazing (Rex) who had a wealth of knowledge and experience. A word of caution though, if you are visiting this great site particularly during the hot months, it gets very hot over 100F and there is not much shelter. Luckily our tour guide had arranged for umbrellas which were extremely useful to protect from the direct sun. People have been reported to faint due to the heat. Also wear suitable clothing to cover the neck and shoulder and take insect spray as there are horse flies which have quite a painful bite. Xcaret :- This was another amazing place we visited and thoroughly enjoyed it. Be aware that the tour operators will sell you the full day’s package at around $99 per person which includes entrance and lunch. You can take the halve day option which we did and it worked out to $69 per person. There is an evening show which starts at 7pm if you like seeing traditional Mexican dancing. If you using a taxi to get back to your hotel, then buy your return taxi voucher just before the entrance to the park so that later on once the show finishes you don’t have to queue. Taxis:- All around the resort there are excellent taxi services and from most hotels there are taxis waiting outside to take you around. From the Riu Playacar to Play del Carmen it is a $5 or 50 pesos ride to 5th Avenue. Here there are all the typical shops catering for tourists. You can also get a very good exchange rate to change $, £ or Euro into pesos. Probably better rate than most hotels will offer. Airport:- At departure two things to be aware of. A tax levy of $110 or £38 per person is payable so make sure you have some money left over. Also for folks travelling to UK, if you exceed your baggage allowance of 20KG there will be a charge imposed of $20/kilo. You can carry drinks (water) including any local liquor in your hand luggage even before you go through to security so don’t add any additional weight to your main bags by having liquor in you main case. Also carry shoes etc in your hand luggage to avoid being over the baggage limits. Hope this has been a useful review for all going to Mexico. It is a beautiful country to experience in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jennTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar June 16 - 26. I'm not sure where to begin. The resort has so much to offer. When we first arrived at the hotel we were greeted with a friendly "hola" and a welcome drink. "Check- in" was quick and easy. We got there around 11:00 a.m. and "check-in" wasn't until 3:00 but they had our room ready within an hour. They took our bags up to the second floor. We stayed in a junior suite in the pink building which overlooks the pool and has a view of Cozumel. The room was very pretty. We had a large swan towel animal on the bed swimming in rose petals when we got there. There was a large sitting area across from the bed with a sofa and chair. It was decorated very nice. There's a big walk in closet with six large cubes to stack your stuff in. This came in very handy since I brought too much stuff. The bathroom is nice with his and her sinks and a bathtub shower. There's also a refrigerator stocked with soda, beer and plenty of bottled water. They refill the refrigerator every 2 days but if you run out all you have to do is buzz the front desk and they'll bring you more. There's also a stocked bar above the refrigerator. Our cleaning lady was wonderful. She kept the room spotless and left us a different towel animal everyday. There's 2 large lagoon type pools at the resort. One is the quiet pool and the other one has a swim up bar with plenty of entertainment and games. We went back and forth between the two pools. There are a lot of actvities going on around the resort . They had 2 beach barbecues, swimsuit fashion show, cocktail class (lots of fun! - lots of drinks!), horseshoes, rifle shooting, ping pong, tennis, tequila volleyball, drinking games, scuba lessons, water aerobics and lots more. The beaches are beautiful. White sand and turquoise blue water You can walk all the way to Playa Del Carmen on the beach. It's breathtaking! They have jet ski's, parasailing, canoes, paddleboats and sailboats at the beach. There's also plenty of chairs at the beach and pools. The food is really good with LOTS to choose from. Lunch is served near the pool area and breakfast and dinner are up by the front lobby. They also have an Asian restaurant and a steak house. Our favorite was breakfast. French toast (yum), omelets (stuffed with ham and cheese), bacon and sausage, cereals, muffins and donuts, huge fruit bar and lots of fresh juices. Too much to name and sooo good! Good variety to choose from at lunch too. Dinner was different every night. They had Mexico night and Asian night at the buffet while we were there. At Asian night you can get the best sushi. They had 9 different types to chose from and oh so good. They always have a pasta station and a Mexican food station set up no matter which night you're there. There's lots of comfort food (potatoes and sauces and fried foods), lots of healthy food (grilled chicken, grilled fish/seafood, salad and fruit bars) and lots of foods in between (seafood, roast pig, roast beef, soups. If you can't find anything to eat then there's something wrong with you. Now to the staff - They're fantastic! Alexxx and Dani will joke around with you at the bars and make you the best drinks. If you need more alcohol in your drink, don't complain - just ask. They'll do you up right. Be sure and ask for the electric lemonade. The bar tenders work very hard and they really have a lot of fun with everyone. You'll make friends with them the first day. The animacion team is unbelieveable! (A big shoutout to Super Chuie) They not only entertain everyone with the games throughout the day but they also put together the shows at night. There's a Michael Jackson show, a Burlesque show, a crazy couples show (we had to get on stage for this one - don't be shy!), Mayan show etc. You need to see each show at least one time - it's worth it. The staff at this resort is by far the best I've seen. They really want you to have a good time. WE LOVED OUR VACATION! A big hello to our friends from Holland and our Boston "Bwoston" friends :)

Reviews.Title: “best holiday i'v ever had”
Reviews.Author: robajob
Reviews.Content: just got back home 1st july after 2 weeks at the riu playacar, hotel is very nice, food is fantastic, staff are very pleasent, must say it is the best holiday i,v ever had, it was a shame about the weather tho, would never go back this time of year,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Beach and place ...... just not 'great'”
Reviews.Author: rickkcir
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying I've been to 10 AI's in this area over the last five years.. so I'm a notch picky.... Overall, not bad. Nice Buffet restaurant in the Lobby area which has A/C.. Rooms are logically laid out.. six buildings, 3 on each side, 3 floors in each.. they reside between the lobby and pool area... makes sense. Beach area is beautiful and vibrant with activity.. but... no true shade which can be a notch brutal for a full day out there. Pool area. Not bad.. but .... water was extremely warm and the pool didn't appear to be kept clean .. at least not to my standards ( little algae, etc) .. Never saw them truly cleaning it or chlorinating it... and there were a LOT of people in there.... Bars... Hmmmmmm.. Pool bar, one in the food area near the bar, and one in the lobby . They lacked one down by the beach. This is a major snafu' IMHO. One more reason the beach are lacked.. whether you wanted water, sodas are adult beverages... nada' Bathrooms. MAJOR issue IMHO. None by the beach. None near the pool ( you getting my drift????) .. you had to dry off and go to the food are to use the small bathroom. If you were down by the beach.. you had to walk all the way back. Service. Hmmmmmmmmmmmm... in the food areas..... basic and average.. no real complaints. BUT.. none by the pool. none by the beach. Hell, none during the shows!! .. You had to walk to the bars, every time, for the little 6oz glass they gave you .... THAT , is one of my main issues with this hotel. Food. Ok. Not a lot of variety day to day, but a lot of choices among what they put out. I can't bash this... just nothing over the top, ever ....... just food..... Bedding. Room was ok... notch musty ( wife brought air freshener ).... but beds, as most I've found .. SUCK. Had them add a pad. Still .. SUCKED... never got a good nights sleep...... God my bed felt good when I got home last night! So, overall.. not bad. I just didn't think it was a good value. I heard that kids stay free, so for families it may be a good value. For me, for what I spent, I could have done better. However, I was in a group and the value for me was being with our friends.... and due to that ,was a great vacation. I just would go again, unless the price sucked me in .. and that wasn't the case this time around.....

Reviews.Title: “Superb you miserable lot !!”
Reviews.Author: amjw
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Mexico, had a great time at the Riu Playacar. The food is superb, anything you could think of on offer. The Entertainment shows were good too, Clare the Thompson rep is great, everyone is very attentive. Visit Chichen Itza and see what its all about.

Reviews.Title: “we didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Emilion276
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday after 2 fabulous weeks at this hotel / resort and absolutely loved every second of it, I haven't got anything negative at all to say. If anything the beds were hard, which I read about before we went, so I just put a blanket on the bottom which was no big deal to me really, after a belly full of food & tequila I didn't have any trouble sleeping !!! ALL of the staff are wonderful and friendly, nothing is any trouble to them, you are so well looked after, especially at meal times, the food here is really very tasty and of a high standard compared to other RIU's where we've been and experienced bland and tasteless meals. You can have lunch in the RIU Tequila & RIU Yucatan but dinner must be eaten here, our hotel was much better to eat at. There's always a 'hola' whenever you pass any of the staff, they do a trmendous job and these RIU chains are well-oiled machines. The hotel and surrounding pool and eating areas were spotless throughout, there's no shortage of sunbeds by the pool or beach, the entertainment staff work tirelessly to make it as fun as possible and will try to involve you in anything that's going on - Mario & Reuben were so funny and energetic, just watching them tired me out !!! 5th Avenue & Coco Bongos are worth a night out, we ate at a very nice Italian there called 'Da Gigis', it just made a nice change from eating in the hotel. Coco Bongos is great too and puts on a fab show, with time to party in between the acts, its worth paying extra for an 'Express' pass as you get ringside seats and a personal server all night, so much fun we had, brilliant, I didn't even like Tequila before we went !!! Oh and just one thing, for the mosquitos we found a spray called 'OFF!' which is available at the shop in the lobby, it worked brilliantly at keeping the little blighters away !! A great holiday all round and would have no trouble in recommending this to anyone, unfortunately we have financial commitments next year but will definitley be booking to go back in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSheribaby
Reviews.Content: travelled to the riu playacar hotel on june 14th for 7 nights, this is a very clean hotel, the staff are so friendly and so efficient, we had a lovely room 6304 on the 3rd floor, there was no problems there, it was cleaned every day and the mini bar was filled every 2 days, because it is a smaller resort the reception area and the beach are so easy to get to, the beach was fantastic, there are 2 pools a quiet one and the other where there is daytime activities, plenty of sunbeds on the beach and around the pool, and clean beach towels everyday, the weather was hot only only had half an hour rain one morning while we were there, we had a massage in the beach hut, neck, shoulder and back massage, 30 min $49, well worth it. the food was lovely, something for everyone, we visisted the steak resturant very nice, this was my 3rd visit to mexico, will definately go back to this hotel for my 4th visit

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Village Ambiance!”
Reviews.Author: sunnybeach2010
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from by 3rd amazing visit to the Riviera Maya. I wish travellers would stop complaining about the craziest things. If you want a Four Seasons Resort, then pay up and shut up! If you're paying for a 4star hotel, then expect a 4 star hotel experience. In the past I've stayed at the Riu Yucatan and the Riu Palace Mexico. Now the Riu Playacar. I loved my 8 nts stay at the riu Playacar. Yes of couse, if I had wanted to pay more money I could have stayed at the Riu Palace, but that was my choice. I know the Palace hotels has the WOW factor. But for this trip the Riu Playacar was more what I was looking for. I did go an tour around and was extremely happy with my choice and would recommended it to anyone who is looking more for a smaller and quieter hotel ambiance. Food at any of the Riu hotels is always excellent. My only recommendation for all the Riu Hotels, they need to spend a bit more money to upgrade their spas, gym water sport activities and kids clubs. This is to keep up with their competition. But overall, I still came home as a very HAPPY RIU client and will keep on going to other Riu properties. Hopefully next time, I will stay at a Riu Palace again! It is really worth every dollar and more! Many thanks to all their staff! See you in a few months! L Cormier. Toronto Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderfull time!”
Reviews.Author: dunroamin40
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 10 days at this hotel which is situated right on a beautiful white sand beach next to warm turquiose sea. This is one of six Riu hotels in the area and in my opinion we picked the right one. It is the smallest and therefore retains a personal feel, the staff are very friendly and helpful. We visited the Riu Tequila and the Riu Yucatan both were much larger, busier and noisier. The food was lovely, anyone who knocks the choice of food here must be a fussy eater, we found it very nice and with a bit of imagination not too repetative. 10 days was just right for us as the weather was very hot and the humidity very oppressive at times, 34 degrees at 9.30pm one evening! The hotel is getting a bit of a makeover at the moment, but this is being done unintrusively and does not interfere with your stay there. We travelled with Thomson, just be aware that the link to the hotel on the website does not give you the correct location, Check out Google Earth for the Riu hotels on the beach in Playacar and you will find the correct location which is perfect. We took a taxi to 5th Avenue in Playa Del Carmen which cost 5 dollars or 50 pesos each way, a bit tacky, all the shops the same but nice to get out of the resort, no worries re safety as this whole area is well policed. Only one complaint would be for the last couple of days two groups of young American kids arrived and were a bit loud and drunk in the lobby, but nothing to get alarmed about. Great trip, enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “The resort was lovely , our room was cold damp and very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: braedene
Reviews.Content: Make sure you have a room that gets the sun, we were cold and to be honest would not recommend this hotel because of the rooms, they smell of damp the beds are damp they need to install heating to dry the place out. Food was good, lots of heavy drinkers taking advantage of the all inclusive which is fair enough but do they need to be so loud? Not a bad time met some nice English people would not return, much nicer places to go in the carribean so good luck if you try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - not a bad word to say about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malandpam
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand some people - where on earth do you expect to have purified tap water in your room???? This is a really nice small and friendly hotel, the service was top class, food excellent, rooms impeccably clean. Ok not the grandest of hotels, but we loved the ambience. We visited the other Riu hotels nearby as they were included in our All Inclusive package, but we liked the Riu Playacar better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kristy_May
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two weeks and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel has a relaxed atmosphere and nice surroundings. Our room was clean and the food was good. We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet, lots and lots to choose from. The nightly entertainment was OK too. I took a manicure at the hotels beauty salon but I've had better. The only thing we actually really disliked during our stay were some of fellow tourists who had had a few tequila shots too much. The hotel can hardly be blamed for this though. We were all inclusive and found it to be worth the money. Friendly staff made us feel welcome during our whole stay. If you want service to remain excellent by the pool bar during your whole stay, don't forget to tip (even if you go all inclusive). You'll get your drinks faster. We loved Playa del Carmen and will definitely go back some day. There is so much to do that 2 weeks is not enough if you want to see and do everything. We made a lot of trips to Xel-Ha, Xcaret, Playa Maroma, Isla Mujeres, Tulum etc. We absolutely recommend Xel-Ha, Xcaret and Tulum. We actually got engaged at Tulum and I can't think of a more romantic setting for a proposal! :) We stayed in Mexico in June and the weather was pretty great. It was mostly sunny and only rained a couple of days. This is a nice friendly hotel with good food and helpful staff. We would recommend this hotel for families and couples and travelers with lower budget. If you want luxury, choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever.............”
Reviews.Author: Janice1964
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and we had an awesome time!!! The staff was amazing, everyone that we came in contact with always had a smile on their face and always were doing their best to make sure you had everything you needed!!! They all worked so hard and seemed so happy doing it. We never ended up trying out one of the restaurants because we didn"t want to be on a schedule and the buffett was great, There was always something to satisfy everyone! We traveled with our sons who are 18 and 21, and they had a great time as well. We met great people and hope to be hearing from them soon!!!!!!! We were able to go to the nightclub at Riu Tequila, which was alot of fun and within walking distance. The beach at the Playacar was absoultely beautiful. The beach area was very wide, so there was always a place to sun yourself, and there was never a problem getting a chair. We did a couple of excursions through Best Day Tours which were both amazing!! Hats off to Emilio and Tatiana...they were so much fun.... We went to the Coba Ruins, a cenote, ziplining, and had a real Mayan lunch on one excursion. And the other we went to Tulum and Xel-Ha which was good fun too!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I would definitely go back to this hotel, but it is also nice to go to other places... The beds could definitely be a little more comfy...but not an issue with us...It was a great trip, great hotel, great location,great people, great drinks and great food...

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Soonerborn
Reviews.Content: First off, I would not recommend a trip to Mexico in June, its just to hot, that being said, we were there for a wedding, and did'nt get to pick the time or place. Upon check in, we were totally shocked that the tap water in the rooms is NOT purified. Really????? It's 2010. No where on their website does it state this. We have been going to Mexico for 20 years, and only on our first trip 20 years ago was the water not purified in a resort. They dont have air conditioning, they have swamp coolers! Which during our trip did not work at all. We had no AC at all for 8 days. It was totally miserable. They don't have 5 resturants ike they make you believe. The Steakhouse, Jade and Mexican are only opened on certain nights, and only if you make a reservation. So you only have a choice of 2, one of which is the buffet. The food is average, nothing special. There is NO wait staff around the pool or on the beach, you have to go get all your drinks. There is no room service, no spa, no fitness center. They are located at a sister resort down the street. This resort is a ** 2 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near 5 stars-better choices out there”
Reviews.Author: staylormadison
Reviews.Content: Like many of you, we have traveled to the Riviera Maya area several times so this review comes from someone who has done MUCH better with other resorts. We booked our trip much later than usual and many of the resorts were sold out. When our travel found RIU Playacar, I thought it would be just fine because RIU has a great reputation. This RIU is the bottom of the barrel, not even close to 5 stars. What a joke. The two redeeming qualities were it's location and it's size. The location was ideal, very close to Playa del Carmen in a lovely area with a beautiful beach. The size was good because at the mega resorts we've stayed at if you forget sometihng in the room it's a 45 minute round trip excursion. Here's why the resort is nowhere near 5 stars. The rooms are musty and old. The beds are horrible, even with a "topper." NOTHING luxurious about the room at all. My question is if the beds are so awful and every bed needs a topper, why not make the investment in new mattresses? Perhaps guests would return if they got a good night sleep. The service was so bad compared to other resorts I have been to. The front desk staff was so rude, they appeared to be very bothered if you needed something. The entertainment staff was nice. If you wanted to particpate they were gracious, if not, they left you alone. The food and the choices were not up to par with the other resorts. There is very little food that is healthy, a meager fruit and vegetable selction at the buffets. Lots of heavy casserole type food and plenty of greasy choices. I think this is a suitable place for a budget traveler. The problem for me is that we wanted a true 5 star and this is nowhere near it. I guess it all depends on what you are used to and what your expectations are. I would definitely go back to this area, but NOT to this hotel. Some of the guests we met told us that the Playacar was the nicest of the RIU's. That scares me.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you RIU Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: flipside44
Reviews.Content: I was just down there for my sister's wedding the week of May 16 to 23, and from when we arrived till we said our goodbyes, I was thorougly impressed with the entire RIU chain!! Rooms: The rooms were perfect for what they were, specifically a nice cool place to sleep nightly. The furniture was nice, the beds were hard yes but I still managed a good nights sleep, the bathrooms well cleaned and the minifridge/bar well stocked. We tipped and got cute towel animals and a spotless room daily, a big shoutout to the hardworking cleaning staff!! Grounds/Facilities: It's hard to properly rate this part. I am a single younger male, so for a guy like me who's looking to let loose and meet others, this resort was not for me. But on the other hand, that hardly makes it a bad place to stay. It's a lot smaller than the other RIU resorts in the area, but the more intimate/relaxing/laid back atomosphere is definitely an advantage it has. It has a great buffet restaurant, the a la carte steakhouse where my sister had her wedding banquet was delicious, but never got a chance to try the Asian or Mexican restaurants. Another major plus is that it's right on the newly restored beach which was absolutely beautiful! The only major disaster of our trip was that the swimup bar was closed for repainting for our whole trip, but we were adequetely watered over at the Tequila and Yucatan pools so no huge deal. Staff: Now here's where the RIU Playacar shined. Every single person employed here always had a smile on their face and were always ready to help out for everything. From the lovely Kassy and the rest of the front desk who first greeted us, to Francisco, Polo & the rest of the bartenders who kept us alco-powered all week, to the hilariously awesome Reuben and the Animation staff who kept all guests entertained, to the tireless servers, pool staff, cleaning staff and all others who kept this place running a huge thank you for all your service and smiles! Wedding: In a word... Wow. Just to set the scene, the day of it was overcast and threatening rain all day. The wedding was at 4, and by 3:30 the rain threatened my sister's beachside wedding all day. At 4:45 we were told in the groom's room that the wedding would be moved to the RIU Palace chapel. Were we ever surprised at how well the hotel staffs at both Playacar and Palace managed to adapt and still throw such a beautiful wedding. It went off without a hitch, my sister looked beautiful, they threw an intimate and touching wedding ceremony, and got all our pictures in without any rain whatsoever. The reception at the Playacar steakhouse was equally intimate and delicious, and the wedding dance at the RIU Yucatan disco was just the perfect size for our group and we had the time of our lives. Brides to be, I'm no wedding expert, but if you choose to book here, you will not be disappointed, the RIU staff at all the resorts simply won't allow you to be! Overall: Make no mistake, the RIU Playacar, and the RIU properties in general, I would trust with any all inclusive vacation I ever take. The only reason I would not return to the Playacar specifically is that I perferred the more lively RIU Tequila and RIU Yucatan resorts, but don't let that in any way scare you away from the Playacar. Great grounds, great food and drink, a top notch staff, and excellent company (namely a few great friendly couples from Chicago and Wisconsin, lots of friendly Europeans, and a special someone from England I'm really hoping I'll see again someday :) Rest assured, your Riviera Maya getaway is in great hands with the RIU Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: rulaw
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to the Riu Playacar & I love this place!! The staff is amazing, the food fresh and varied. As to the firm mattresses a simple call to guest services and they will put a 2 inch thick memory foam topper on your bed..ahhhh heaven!! This is my favorite resort in the area ) I have traveled to Mexico 4 times in the last 8 or so years) Thanks again Riu Playacar for making my trip a pleasure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, lots of fun,claen, and lots of food and drink.”
Reviews.Author: brucad
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the staff and how well organized the activities and meals were. There was always food avalable somewhere on site. The beach was very clean, and towls and chairs were in plentiful supply. The staff were always helpful and frendly. The grounds were well kept and the flowers and plants were beautiful. There were planty of activities and the resort is located near lots of attractions, and there are shops near the resort as well as a short $5.00 taxie ride away. Tulum, The Mayan Ruins are just a half hour away and Xcaret is less than a mile South of the resort. Both are great places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of ten”
Reviews.Author: longclose
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel was brilliant, the food the staff the location, i really can't praise it enough. the size of the hotel was just right, plenty of room for everyone (even around the pool areas). Only been home four days and we are missing it already, we even got to have a look at the volanic ash on the flight home. It was our first trip to Mexico but it won't be are last.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller resort for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: iceclimber_2
Reviews.Content: If you need a beach, a bed and a buffet - the Riu Playacar is a good choice for you. You don't get pool or beach service, ocean front rooms, room service, decent amentities in the room, more than one lunch choice, or a door to your bathroom. What you do get is a beach in Playa del Carmen, an enthusiastic (and slightly out of step) entertainment crew, great bar staff (hola Francisco and Alexxx) a fair buffet and all the drinks you can stand. The disco over at the Tequila is worth a visit for the young or young at heart, and it's air conditioned. There is very little air conditioned public space at these Riu's and it was sweltering. So yeah, I know it gets warm in Mexico and all that, but it's nice to have some cool space to retreat to. If you do choose this place, I recommend you inspect the room first and ensure you get working air. I requested the air conditioner in the room be fixed four times, and it never was repaired. In fact, the last time I informed that "the whole building is not working so we are not offering to move your room." In response, I am offering to never stay at a Riu again. I can't review the restaurants, thanks to the Riu's ignorant reservation policy. I was told the food was identical to the buffet. The crowd was mostly European, so be prepared for topless action around the pool, and some amazingly small bathing suits on some not so in shape men. I mention this because you may not want your children to learn adult anatomy while on vacation...you've been warned amigos. I must admit, I enjoyed the English fellows singing along to their preferred tunes during the afternoon. Cheers lads. (There is no "quiet" pool, maybe a "quieter" pool.) Bring some "Off" with you for sure. The skeeters are really bad. Anyway, if you get a screaming deal then the Riu Playcar is passable mostly thanks to the awesome staff and the less crowded feeling. Except at the lunch buffet, there you will feel crowded like you are at the Golden Corral. The Riu Playacar is like the resort version of roughing it, and I pretty much knew that based on the price. If you prefer a little more resort in your resort, perhaps consider something a little nicer. Oh, I saw a lady tip 10 USD at the bar. Bless you lady... besides us - you were the only person I saw tipping in 9 days.

Reviews.Title: “terrific”
Reviews.Author: Tenny-Two
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant stay -- great food and service. Front desk staff and restaurant staff were outstanding. Special mention to Juarez, Wilbur and Marisol in the restaurant and Manual at the front desk. Nice room -well appointed. Rocha kept it clean and made the most creative animals out of the towels. Room smelled musty but given the rain and high humidity that is almost unavoidable. Only criticism was the stinginess with towels especially at the pool-- rigid application of "one towel per person per day"! First time I have encountered that and it is a real pain. Bed was comfortable once we got a mattress topper The Spa on the beach was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: lisab011
Reviews.Content: Just returned on the 30th of april - We loved the hotel, the people we met, the people that worked there. Weather was beautiful. The guys and girls working around the pool everyday made it alot of fun. Would go back again no problem

Reviews.Title: “There is no way this is a 5 star resort!”
Reviews.Author: Christina333
Reviews.Content: Whoa, way disappointed from the start. I did read the reviews about this hotel before we left and just thought "well some people are just overly critical". In this case, those people were telling the truth. The rooms were very very musty smelling. After over a month being home, I still can't stand the smell of the suitcases. The food wasn't real great. We were able to find enough to eat, but I wouldn't call it good. The buffet down by the beach was horrible. Breakfast was good. The Yucatan had better meals and we spent more of our time there. Also, by the fifth day of our trip 2 of us had horrible cases of food poisoning. The only place we ever ate was the hotel. The nightly entertainment was so bad it was laughable. If you like night after night of lip syncing and very uncoordinated dancing. It left nighttime with not much to do after supper since we had children in the group. Pool closes early. The hotels alcoholic drinks we very light in the alcohol department. You could drink all day and feel like you were drinking fruit punch. Very skimpy. The hotel room walls are very thin and you could hear screaming and yelling throughout the night. The fridge in our room was stocked only once during the week we stayed. I had to either flag someone in the hall or borrow some from another family member in another room. All we wanted was water to brush our teeth. The beach was absolutely beautiful though. We did notice that the majority of the other hotels along the beach had nice lounge chairs with covers, but not here. I'm not sure who does the rating system for these hotels, but if this hotel was in the U.S. I'm sure it wouldn't be over 2 and a 1/2 stars at tops. I'm wondering who put all the good review for this hotel on here and how much were they paid to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach- Nice Staff- but not going there again”
Reviews.Author: beach07
Reviews.Content: Let me start that this is the 9th all inclusive we have been to. We love Mexico and this was our third visit to the Mayan Riviera. (Prior hotels Sandos and Iberstar Quetzal) This is a smaller hotel about 400 rooms. There was never a problem finding a beach chair on the ocean or by the pool. This was a first since in the past we have had to do the chair battle every morning. The beach restoration is incredible. The sandbags are gone and the white sand is fantastic. Unfortunately, there is NO shade on the beach. Other resorts have shaded umbrella areas or allow you to rent beach umbrellas. Here the only shade you get is the shadow of a palm tree’s trunk. The water was fantastic. One day it was calm as anything and you could snorkel, water sports… the next was red flags and the current was so strong you could only go up to your knees. The pool area had the shade and many chairs. It is two pools connected by a bridge. The pool with the swim up bar was always busy with activities and people drinking. We stayed on the other side and it was quieter and cleaner. This is a quiet hotel. Not the place for party animals. The kids show was at 8:30 and there were only 3-5 kids participating. The kids club was a small covered building by the beach with some arts and craft activities. My kids thought it was lame and did not participate. (Hard to compare to the amazing program at Dreams, Cancun) The room layout is good for extended families. As you walk down the hall there is a mini hall that leads to two rooms. So a family could shut the hallway door and basically have two adjoining rooms. (Picture the letter Y) The rooms need some updating but appear clean and the maids make some cute towel animals and keep the mini fridge stocked with beer and soda. There is also a liquor dispenser in each room. One of our rooms was fine but the other had a sewer smell. There is free internet access in the smoky lobby. There is one main buffet restaurant that you have breakfast and dinner in. For lunch you can eat by the pool as long as you have shoes and a wrap/ t shirt on. We did not go to the reservation restaraunts as we hear that much of the same food is served at the buffet. There is always pasta, hot dogs and burgers available. Here is why we will not go back to this hotel. Two different times at the main buffet we saw cockroaches on the food. My kids discovered it one day at the bread basket for toast and then I saw it another day at the pastry/bread station. I am one those people who can not deal with bugs and after that could not stand going to the buffet for food. If it was out in the main dining area I could only imagine what was in the kitchen. After seeing it once you are always on alert. I only saw one in the building area but I did notice Raid cans on the maid carts. The day before departure our American Express rep did not show up to confirm our transfer time. The front desk made a big deal out of calling the 800 number for us to try to get a pick up time. The kept saying there would be an additional charge. Finally, they did it for us as a one time courtesy. So if it were not for the bug incidents this resort choice would have been good. The vacation is too expensive to spend your time worrying about what might be walking around your food.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: kah14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 night in April 2010. It was an easy transfer to the hotel, although we did wait for about 2+ hours in line at customs when we arrived to Cancun. Check in was easy and our room was located in building 6 at the ground level. The walls are thin, so you could hear a lot of noise, but it is not too loud here at night due to better entertainment at the other RIUS. We just put the fan on to block out any noise. Food was excellent with a good variety. THere were always lots of seats available at the beach and pool. Entertainment during the day was really good. At night, we went to the RIU Yucatan which had better shows. You could always see someone working and the place was spotless. We walked to the town, Playa, 3x. It took about 25 minutes. In general, we had a lot of fun and met a lot of cool people. There were mostly Europeans there, and the diversity was nice. We also asked for the mattress topper which was much better. Went to the Yucatan for a massage too- very good! We would definitely come back to this area, and would say here or stay somewhere a little closer to town. Have a nice trip *I did not like that even to call a local place, like the tour company, to arrange a ride back to the airport, the hotel charged*

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel in the world and certainly not the worsed”
Reviews.Author: rosscoe0312
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I would like to say we had a fantastic holiday and would definatly go back, however, to a different hotel, not that this hotel was bad but for the price there are better. As you are a Riu guest, you are able to visit other Riu chain hotels which are all within walking distance. Riu Playacar is the smallest of the chain in the resort, however, it has the beach unlike the Riu Tequila and Riu Lupita. The Riu Yucatan seems to be the best equipped of these graded hotels, with the gym, boutiques and various shops. The Riu Palace and Playa Maya are in a different league. My main gripes with this hotel where the small bar area in the foyer, you had to walk though a barrage of smoke to get to the resturant, the rooms had an odour the kind you would smell in an unaired old house, the sewarage system needs sorting out, the evening shows were nothing to write home about either. On the plus side, the food is spot on, there is no need to eat in the speciality resturants as the same food is served in the buffet resturant so save yourself a queue in the morning to book them, the beach was fantastic, the rooms were cleaned to a high standard, service was good, I always give a little tip to begin with, that way they are all over you like a rash after that. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The hotel entertainment staff were busy throughout the day and evening, there was always something to do. At lunch times the resturant can get a bit crowed, we used to go later, around 1330ish and never had to wait for a seat, you can have breakfast and lunch in any of the Riu hotels but they ask you to be at your own hotel for evening meal. It was my birthday whilst we were there and the staff catered for it very well with a cake, champagne and Mexican Singers all gratis. All in all it was a fantastic holiday, unfortunatly the resort was crawling with Spring Breakers so this made it loud with drunken teenages everywhere. We will be going back but will try somewhere different.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, the staff was excellent”
Reviews.Author: CaroHouston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the location is perfect. The beach is very beautiful. We spend a great time. The staff at the hotel was excellent. All the employees were always smiling and helpful. Very friendly, also with the kids. I definitely recommend this hotel. The only thing, is not a 5 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic vacation!”
Reviews.Author: truttchy4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with 5 other friends and family members(all adults) the week of March 6-13 2010, and stayed at the RIU Playacar and we all LOVED it! I had read ALOT of reviews on this site about the Playacar - and had mixed feelings of what we would find when we got there. We were absolutely thrilled with the resort! Personally, after staying there a week, I cannot fathom what some of the reviews were talking about. Granted, our entire group are all very laid back, easy to please people.... but we had a wonderful vacation in all aspects! First of all, the resort is the smallest of the three RIU's that we had "privaliges" to, but that certainly added alot to the visit. We did spend time at the Tequilla and Yucatan, visiting the sports bar (Tequilla) and attending a "show" at the Yucatan. We also walked around both of the other resorts during the day. I personally liked the "size" of the Playacar, alot less other guests to contend with at the bars, pools, etc. Granted the other resorts did offer a few more of these options, but we felt so at home at the Playacar... we all agreed that we'd go back in a heart beat. The staff was wonderful, the beds, with a mattress pad applied were great to sleep on ( I actually slept better on the beds than I do at home!), A few of the reviews complained about the rooms needing updating, I thought the rooms we all stayed in were wonderful. Everything was tiled, kept ultra clean.... the bedspreads could maybe use replacing (if I had to find something to say about it), and the shower stall floor was getting a little aged, but that too was kept clean. For one of the couples with us, it was there 4th or 5th trip to Mexico, they commented that of all the resorts they have stayed at, this was the BEST food that they had experienced! It was fantastic, the buffets were always full of food, there were some things you found everyday (but that is ok too!), but there was always something different too. We did dine at the Asian restaurant & the Steakhouse. I'm not a big "asian food" fan, but it was good. But we all raved about the meal we had on our last night at the Steakhouse. Most of us had the Kabobs. It was a skewer of Shrimp and skewer of "tenderloin" type steak, salad, soup, bread and "twice baked" type of potatoe. "FANTASTIC" !!! While there, we did the walk into Playa del carmen to shop & had a drink at Senior Frogs, took the ferry to Cozumel to have lunch & shop, did snorkeling in Akumal and rented Jet Ski's right at our resort. Did a bit of shopping at the little "mall" across from the resort... and found some very nice things there. The beach in front of the hotel was amazing (all of the "work" was done- all the "sandbags" were gone. We did spot a few topless "babes", (if you are offended by them) but they stayed at the beach and rarely did we encounter them at the pool. We will definaltely have a return trip to this resort in the future.... if you are considering the RIU Playacar... I wouldn't think twice of telling you to "go for it" ! If you are used to staying at 5-6 Golden apple type resorts, maybe it wouldn't be for you.... but for those of us who are just looking for a relaxing, beautiful spot to vacation, where thestaff will always go above and beyond to please you with their wonderful talents and smiles.... it is a very welcoming and pleasant place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Don't Pay Too Much”
Reviews.Author: c-spro
Reviews.Content: 50 of us stayed here and the service was top-notch. The facility was a little run down, so don't pay too much. It's a great place if you pay a reasonable amount. Low-lights include: -smelly rooms (sewer) -hard bed -out dated decor Highlights include: -beautiful beach -Riu's high standards for food and booze -the sister resort's disco We had a great time. Would recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Mindle
Reviews.Content: There were 8 of us girls that went. It was an absolute blast. The hotel was good, food was good, drinks were good and beach was AWESOME!! We spent time on the beach and near the pool. When there were activities going on, we were at the pool. RUBEN, Nadia, Erika, Super Bee and Super Chewy, etc. (some names we didn't get) - some of the nicest people I have ever met! So very, very helpful and FUN!! Nadia really impressed me with her enthusiasm with the kids. The shows were awesome; especially the Michael Jackson Show! ABSOLUTELY AWESOME VACATION!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place, beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: hikerdadlvp
Reviews.Content: I think these reviews say it all, good and bad. This was my first visit to a resort and I was accompanied by my wife and 6 and 9 year daughters. I had traveled around Mexico as an impoverished student 20+ years ago and was shocked at how pricey things are in this resort area. The girls had a blast the first two days just playing at the pool and jumping in the waves. The beach is beautiful and the waves were just the right size with no strong undertow. To our pleasant surprise there were not too many mosquitoes or spring break party drunks (I guess I would put both in the minor annoyance category), and the resort seemed occupied mainly by families with kids or elderly family members. The negatives: The pillows and beds, as other reviews point out, are terrible, but you can ask for a "sponge pad" to be put on top. I had requested this in advance by e-mail and through bookit.com, but there was none the first night and I didn't sleep much. I had booked a double for the four of us and expected two large beds but found a room with two full sized beds pushed together. When I called they said they could push them apart but that really would not have helped in our case so they sent up a small cot and one kid used it (the girls loved it) for the rest of the trip. A group of four young people checking into the next room had the same issue and I believe they changed hotels over it. A pool towel disappeared from our room after the maid came and I had to go beg for another towel card so as not to be charged $20. Internet and telephone service is absurdly expensive, but so is most everything else in this very touristy part of Mexico. I did not bring a laptop (the room safes are too small for them) but many guests did and seemed to get good wireless reception in the lobby/bar area. My family is half Asian and we found the Asian restaurant quite bad, but probably on par with what I remember from living in the midwest and others seemed to enjoy it. There was little to no Mexican food to speak of and I was a little disappointed about that, but having traveled in Yucitan know it's not really known for food. The vendors selling excursions in the lobby are over priced, as others have mentioned. We bought a dolphin encounter from them and I wished I had bought it in Playa del Carmen. The entertainment starts at 9:45, which was too late for my kids. I think they should have a kids' show at 8 and adult show later. The positives: The room, minibar, balcony, was fine and the air conditioning worked well. A mosquito or three got into our room on ocassion because my kids kept leaving the balcony door open but there is a ceiling fan that can be left on all the time. There is an outer door to close against nightime noise and mosquitoes as well as the room door. The TV had too many Nickelodeon/Disney channels in English if anything. The other reviews complaining about the moldy smell or other things indigenous to the tropics are a little over the top I think. Agoutis (google it) roam the grounds as do very tame and clean looking cats and provide entertainment for kids. The beach is perfect for small kids and my girls loved the swim up bar at the pool. We wandered to some other resorts (you are allowed to use 3 others but we used the pool at the Riu Palace and nobody kicked us out) but didn't try the food there. The buffet was very nice but we did get a little tired of it after 6 nights (we ducked out of the Asian place and went there) and we never tried the steakhouse. My wife and I had difficulty getting enough fiber in our diets and I ended up eating a lot of fruit and cereal instead of the well prepared dishes. We rented an econobox from the Thrifty counter in the lobby for 3 days for $99 US and there were no hidden charges. Parking at the hotel is tight but free and as we went to Tulum, Aukumal Beach, Xcaret and the town a few times and I think it was probably cheaper than taking taxis (we did take a taxi once after I turned in the car and found it's a US price, as is most everything else around there). Traveling with small kids in this area is completely safe but take a lot of mosquito repellent if you go to Tulum. Overall, I would say it's a very nice place and could be a great place if they got better beds and maybe had a few more snacks available by the pool. If I were going to go to a resort again, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: GoCubaGo888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar March 27 - April 4 2010... I have traveled quite a bit around Mexico and this resort was pretty good. The beach is amazing plenty of chairs and space...there was not enough shade on the beach for my liking but otherwise awesome. The drinks were strong the food was decent we spent a fair amount of time around the pool and the pool bar. We lucked out with a really great room...we were top floor corner unit! It didn't smell at all and everything in the room worked perfectly...the only complaint was the hard bed which we fixed quickly with the mattress pad. We talked to other guests who had loud neighbors but ...we didn't hear a thing! Over all we had a great time and I would definitely go back. We did walk around some of the other Riu's which were also really nice and we might try one of those next time.

Reviews.Title: “What A Blast”
Reviews.Author: cberkhahn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the Riu Playacar on April 5th, 2010. Our trip involved 8 of us girls and we had a blast. The people at the Riu are some of the nicest people we have ever met on our vacations, super friendly. Getting to know Ruben is a must, he is one of the entertainers by the pool and on stage at night, he will make a vacation worth staying there. The resort is medium size with everything close together which was nice. We ate at the mexican rest. along with the steak rest. both excellent, especially the steak place. Food over all was very good, many hot sauces which is a first. Rooms super clean and the beach by far the best of any where I've stayed in Mexico. "So Fun" !

Reviews.Title: “Plug your nose!”
Reviews.Author: blueyedgirl53202
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the RIU Playacar early March 2010. I paid extra for the direct transportation to the hotel which I highly recommend. The direct transportation was not easy to find and we were derailed by someone claiming to be with Apple vacations and trying to sell excursions. Once we got to the resort I was excited. Our room was the furthest from the beach and pool and the balcony overlooked buffet patio. I asked for a room closer to the beach but was told no rooms were available. I requested the mattress topper which was great advice and it made a huge difference on the bed. My major complaint was that every evening the room began to smell like the sewer was backing up and it stunk like Poo! Every night I would call the front desk and they would send up some young worker who did not speak English and he would spray Windex to eliminate the odor. He would flush the toilet, turn on the fan, spray and then leave. The front desk in the morning would send someone to fix the problem and claim it was fixed but every evening the smell of Poo would invade our room. It was so gross!! I did not feel the staff was accommodating. The Apple representative was clueless. I was really excited about my vacation and while I still enjoyed myself the resort was a disappointment. This was my boyfriend’s first trip to Mexico so I was hoping this would encourage more Caribbean vacations, not the case. My ratings for the hotel are below. Food - Excellent Drinks - Good Staff - acceptable but not great Rooms - ok (beside the smell) Smell - Awful Activities - were there any? I saw photos... Shows – Poor I recommend you spend the extra money to stay at a nicer resort unless you want to smell poo.

Reviews.Title: “Not a true 5 star but best vacation ever thanks to the staff”
Reviews.Author: sunandsandinmexico
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the RIU Playacar with 2 teenage girls and it was probably the best vacation EVER. Having travelled quite a bit through Mexico and the Caribbean though, I would not rate this as a 5 star hotel. The staff, however, is what made our stay so fabulous. Special thanks to the entertainment (Animacion) staff - Emilio, Chuy, Chocko, Mahui, Ruben and Nadia. This is the best Animacion staff I have come across. They provided tons of activities during the day - rifle shooting, darts, ping pong, beach and pool volleyball, water aeroblics, dance lessons, etc. - then led an entertaining pre- and post-show in the evening. This staff seemed to genuinely enjoy their job, were always happy, energetic and professional, and went out of their way to make every guest feel special. The beach is beautiful, especially with the millions of dollars recently put into it. Beach chairs were always available although there were no shaded areas close to the water. Chairs by the pool were a little harder to come by but I went out each morning before 8 am for our favourite spot. The grounds are well-maintained. Although it was March Break and the resort would have been at full capacity we did not feel crowded and line-ups for food were very small. The food was OK - nothing spectacular, but basic and plentiful. We only tried one of the 3 specialty restaurants as you had to line up by 7 am to reserve a spot for that night. The resort in general needs some "modernizing". Room and safe keys are actually old-fashioned keys (with the rooms numbers printed on them - yikes!) rather than the more modern electronic key cards. Many have complained that the beds are too hard but no one in our room had any problems with them. The bathroom set-up is rather odd with the closet and mini-fridge right in the sink/counter area. The maids did a decent job cleaning the rooms but we did have to call for towels and shampoo a couple of times. We did not do any excursions this time but we did go to nearby Playa del Carmen (a 5 minute/$5 cab ride away) to shop and to a couple of night clubs. If you do nothing else, GO TO COCO BONGO! This club features an amazing musical/dance show (midnight to 3 am) and is well worth the $55 entry fee (which includes an open bar). The resort actually arranges trips there with members of the Animacion staff. This is the way to go as you get VIP entry (no line-ups) and VIP seating (table right next to the stage). This was the highlight of my girls' week as they were asked to be a part of the show and danced on stage. Beware the vendors that the RIU brings on site on certain evenings. You can purchase the same things in Playa del Carmen or at the little shopping centre/market right across the street from the hotel at MUCH cheaper prices. The resort does have a business centre with computers ($3 for 20 minutes) or you can get free internet in the lobby with your laptop. There is no fitness centre on site but you can go across the street to the sister resort and use theirs. There is no room service but there is a lobby bar which is open all night. What I found most disappointing was the arrival of a very LARGE group of spring breakers towards the end of week. These loud and obnoxious young adults were not what I was expecting as I was under the impression that the resort and pretty much the whole Mayan Riviera, did not allow them. Had I wanted spring breakers I would have gone to Cancun. This is the only thing that would prevent me from returning. Overall, I would rate the resort as a 4 star hotel in terms of its comforts and ammenities. Where it gets its highest marks is in its staff and activities. I would definitely recommend this resort and if I can be guaranteed no spring breakers my girls and I will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “We made the most of it, it's VACATION”
Reviews.Author: skippy0420
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as a person that understands they are on vacation. Nothing is ever perfect when you have well over 800 people eating, drinking and sleeping in less than a square mile. If you have given this place less than a rating of 4 then you must be one of ‘those’ people. We knew going in that the resort was not NEW but the staff at the Riu never stopped cleaning that place and everyone was very nice and attentive. Amazing job Riu Employee’s! Check in & Room: Check in was very quick and before we knew it we had a margarita in hand and were ready to head to the room. What can you say, a room is a room and we are on vacation for the outside, not the inside. A/C(check), Bed(check), Pillows(check), Shower(check), towels(check). OK, we are all good…. The bed was quite hard but we did not mind and since it’s two pushed together it ends up being HUGE. FOOD: Lobby Buffet (breakfast and dinner): We ate here EVERY morning and had 3 dinners and there was something for everyone. We are not picky eaters so all was fair game. They have late hours in the evening so even if you have been out all day and needed a siesta you could still get dinner at 9PM if you wanted. Lounge Buffet (lunch): This buffet is smaller than the Lobby but they still have quite a bit to choose from. The beer is on tap there so you can grab a glass and fill’er up if need be. *** Go to the Lobby Buffet at 7AMish to sign up to eat at the three places listed below. There are two seatings for each: 6:45 & 8:45PM. I hate to say it but I preferred the buffet over these, but we did try them all and I think you should while you are there also*** Jade: Was our least favorite of the three. It was not bad, it was just like a Chinese buffet instead of a ‘special’ type dinner. The décor was a nice change of pace and we were able to skip the fork for some chopsticks. Steakhouse: We would put this in the middle of the three. Appetizers were good and there were nice choices on the menu and it was nice to not be in a buffet line. Steaks were cooked as ordered and the show for the Baked Alaska dessert was fun to watch. Mexican: Out of the three we liked this the best. Nice appetizers right away and it just felt like a ‘home’ cooked meal while in Mexico. Again, nice to not be in the buffet line and the shot of Tequila can’t hurt! BAR(s): Lobby Bar: Daniel was the man during the day’s there. Even though people were ordering every mixed and frozen drink under the sun at one time he was always smiling and doing what he could to help the customers. I suggest the lobby bar early afternoon through dinnertime. Pool Bar: Considering the size and shape of the pool I believe that it’s in a great location and all of the guys there are very helpful and attentive. The Pool is in the same general area as all of the pool activities but there is enough room for everyone. Lounge Bar: Francisco held this place down all on his own. He could speak English, French and was on top of anything that was required. This is the area that we would head to right after dinner for a nightcap as the entertainment is there. ENTERTAINMENT: Daytime: The pool is where it’s at for aerobics, volleyball and whatever other crazy things the guys have going on that day. Nighttime: Head to the lounge for one or two nights while you are there. They had a couples game that was so funny and it’s a real relaxed atmosphere all together. BEACH: We spent a day or two on the beach and all of the work done over the last months have paid off. We were able to walk out quite a ways and it tops any Cancun beach I have seen by FAR. OVERALL: We are already talking about getting a larger group together for next year. For the price and location I don’t think you can beat it. It’s listed as a family place and it is, although as a couple we had a great time. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “maybe it was spring breakers, but... I would never go back.”
Reviews.Author: SugarLandRan
Reviews.Content: The food is a repetitive volley of fried junk, heavy sauce, low protein foods and wilty greens. The specialty restaurants were a joke. They took the Lunch buffet area and divided it in half and called one half "the steak house" and the "other half" the "Mexican restaurant". The Asian food had it's own restaurant but don't be fooled. The "show" was nothing more than showing the kitchen cooking of crap food across the buffet line. Terrible. The rooms have an odd odor that is a mix of sanitizer and alcohol. The beds are absolutely the hardest I've ever slept on. You get two skinny pillows and that's it. The room echo's every sound above, below and around you. The fitness center is two hotels away and is very small. Save money and go further south to Grand Caribe or Barcelo Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: superstar1234
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a one week stay with my lovely boyfriend and as my title states, this resort is amazing! Easy check in, arrived early therefore they held on to our bags while we ran to the beach! Pictures dont do this place justice....way more beautiful than expected. Sand is white, beach is clear..watch for lots of seashells in the sand that can make walking a little uncomfortable but nothing too bothersome. Beach is large, gorgeous and spacious. Plenty of lounging chairs. Activities on the beach, we para sailed and jet skied. I also got a nice relaxing massage! Weather was fantastic, nice and sunny. 2 full rain days tho :( it was okay, we shopped on 5th ave on rainy days! great stores, trendy boutiques, well worth the visit. Back to the hotel: pool area was clean, and entertainment team was very fun! Food was INCREDIBLE! I admit im not a picky eater, but trust me you will be pleased! Lots of variety....i esp liked the mexican food :) rooms are very clean. i dont know why people complained about the beds they were perfect! my god people over react! only thing i would agree with is the humidity, things tend to get soggy. Go to 5th every night! 5 dollar cab ride, very safe. For authentic mexican food you MUST eat at El Fogon. Italian, we ate at da bruno. it's very authentic n tasty comin from an italian backround lololo. For nightclubs, we went to mandala every time :) awsome party! Santanera is a great after hours for those of you who enjoy house music. I tried blue parrot but the whole scene is not my type. Hotel Deseo quiet n boring, tequilla barrel great bar. DO NOT GO TO BRAHMA. Was having fun until the owners pissed us off, long story lol ask me if your interested in going there.. Over all had a fantastic fantastic fantastic vacation and will def. return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: jpowerskansas
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful and right on the beach. The young employees that help at the pool area are a lot of fun. However, we had several difficulties with the front desk. Aldo, a worker at the front desk. made us feel extremely uncomfortable from the minute we arrived as he pulled our teenage boys aside and read them the "riot act" about drinkiing on the premises and how they do not like spring breakers, if they do anything out of line they will be kicked out of the hotel. I understand the resort's concerns about under age drinking; however, this was not the right way to handle welcoming guests to the resort. Our boys were not typical spring breakers as they were with parents. Furthermore, a chair in their lobby had wet black paint on it as it was not fully dried before they placed it in the lobby. It ruined my brand new dress and I immediately showed the help what had happened. They took my name and room number and said they would get back with me, which they never did. When I asked them again the night before we left the manager proceeded to blame me for not bringing my dress down so they could try to fix it - they told me they would get back with me about it and never did. In the end, I had to take my ruined dress back with no compensation from the hotel. Would I go to Playa again - absolutely! Would I stay at this hotel - absolutely not!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: AveryFCanada
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Riu Playacar. I went with my parents, my brother and another family including a couple and their daughter (there were seven of us). The weather during our stay was beautiful! It only rained once; unfortunately it was on our last day. The rooms were pretty nice. The beds weren’t the best, but we borrowed mattress pads and that made them more comfortable. The cleaning service was good. Everything was done; our used towels were replaced, the floors were swept and even our shoes were neatly arranged! Also, if it matters to anyone, they make awesome towel animals! The service at the bars was great; we never had to wait more than 5 minutes, even at the busiest times. The bartenders (actually all of the employees) were super nice! The food at the buffet was pretty good, however the restaurants were mediocre. The steakhouse was awful (lots of fat!), the Mexican restaurant was okay, and the Japanese restaurant was good. It was hard to get reservations too; we had to wake up super early to make them because there were big lines! I’m more of an ocean person anyway, but the pool wasn’t that great. It was cold (colder than the ocean) and I found that it was pretty dirty, especially later in the day. They had volleyball in the pool and on the beach, as well as water aerobics which was fun. There was also a very handy pool bar! There were plenty of lounge chairs for everyone around the pool, but we went and reserved some with our towels every morning, just in case. The beach was absolutely gorgeous. It was just renovated like a month ago and it’s really nice. There was tons of white sand and turquoise water. I love to snorkel, and unfortunately the snorkelling was terrible; there is nothing to look at! I didn’t see any fish and there was no coral, only a sandy bottom. It was nice, just not for snorkelling. There were however snorkelling trips. Also, there is no shade, not umbrellas or trees, so that was a problem for my really pale friend! A final problem was that it was really wavy. On our first day, we couldn’t even go in because the waves were so big and the undertow was so strong. We went parasailing and it was awesome; totally worth the $60. Those staying in this resort were allowed to go visit two other resorts down the street; the Riu Tequila and the Riu Uketan (not positive about that spelling). We were allowed to do everything there (including drink and eat), except eat dinner. It was a nice change. The Tequila even had a club! There was a cute plaza directly across the street and it had tons of little shops filled with neat things. There was also a Starbucks in the plaza! Also, town is only a 5-10 minute taxi ride away and it had great shopping. You could even walk to town from the resort’s beach; it was about a 30 minute walk. There is free wireless internet in the lobby for those who bring laptops. There are plenty of weird, but cute, animals running around for those who care. As for excursions, we went to a place called XTREME and it was fantastic! Totally got our money’s worth; it was about $90 a person. There was zip lining over jaguars and crocodiles and through waterfalls (this lasted about 2hrs, and wear clothes that can get soaked), there were little cars that you could drive though the jungle, and there were underground caves with amazing stalactites that you could swim through, and take rafts through. Also, lunch and drinks were free and delicious! There was a buffet. If you go to this resort, go there. It’s awesome. Overall, it was a great time and it was beautiful! I would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “a good place for the price but not a 4-5 star and staff very nice”
Reviews.Author: Blair63
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful and well kept. The food was okay but did not have available all the time. The entertainment staff was the greatest and if you go be sure to meet "Chewy" he is great! Good shows nightly. $5.00 Taxi ride to town which was very interesting. Had asked for a 3rd floor room, non-smoking close to beach as possible. Received the bldg furtherest from the beach on 2nd floor and was a smoking room. Front desk said could not change us were overbooked. Need dehumidifers in rooms & new mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: happytravels0410
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Riu Playacar last Thursday and had a great time. Food was great (and most people that know me say I'm a picky eater), rooms were clean, staff was polite, helpful and entertaining. Gotta love Choco, Erica and Super Chey :) I def recommend this resort, although you won't go wrong with any other Riu resorts in the area. They were all beautiful and clean! This was my first time to Mexico and I will for sure go again. I recommend going to Xcaret as an excursion, it's a full day of learning about Mexican history which is very interesting. The only thing I would change is the time that I go, we caught the college kids on their reading week and they make a lot of noise at 1:30 am. Other than that our vacation was great and I would go to the playacar again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: isaba
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks and loved every day! Nice clean room, nice with two pool areas so we could get away from the daily activities (not the cind of vacation we like) in the big pool. All the food was excellent! In two weeks we never got tired of anything. We will absolutely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, was not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishEdProf
Reviews.Content: We booked our Delta Vacations trip to the Riu Playacar with Ardene Emmelkamp of the Travel Advantage. She took extremely good care of us and made sure that everything was fabulous! If you are hard to please, you might want to consider staying elsewhere--like in the U.S.--as this is a resort in Mexico (thus not everyone will speak English, there are different cultural expectations, the accommodations may not be perfect, etc.). But hubby and I had a fabulous time at the Riu Playacar and are looking forward to a return visit! Room: We had a beautiful room. The bathroom was slightly outdated but it was squeaky clean. We had plenty of towels and they brought more when needed. Requested more pillows and they were delivered no problem. Air conditioning didn't function perfectly but we were outside most of the time--no worries! Room fridge was well-stocked, and, upon request, was filled with diet soda. Pool/Beach: Perfect. The beach had plenty of chairs, all in good shape. Towel hut was well-stocked, no line. Plenty of shady and sunny spots for all. Bars: We enjoyed each of the bars--they had everything we wanted except REAL fruit drinks. The pina coladas and strawberry daquiris were the pre-mixed variety which was a disappointment; however, we enjoyed mojitos and bloody marys every day. Food: We tend to eat healthy and had no problem finding stuff we liked. We requested cheese omelettes every morning which was no problem for the omelette chef. There was plenty of fresh fruit at every meal and lots of fixings for salads. Great bread, cheese, etc. Americans and Europeans will not be disappointed. Desserts tended to be a bit bland but that seems to be pretty consistent in Mexico, whether it is off the beaten path or at an American-style resort. There were also plenty of fried foods, soups, meats, etc. from which to choose. I would not suggest doing Riu's a la carte restaurants as they seemed to simply serve food from the buffet--I would rather have lots of choices from the buffet than just a few choices at an a la carte restaurant (especially one that seems to serve the same food from the buffet). The only real gripe I have is that while the food was great, it was definitely NOT authentic Mexican food. But that's to be expected at a resort frequented by people who have never left the U.S. except for trips to Cancun etc. Entertainment: We are pretty quiet people on vacation and easily found quiet spots where we wouldn't be bothered, i.e. the quiet pool and the beach. There were other people who desired more interaction/entertainment and they found it at the "party" pool every afternoon. In other words, we got what we wanted and others did, too. It was great. RE: nightlife, the Playacar and its sister resorts seemed to have several great options for nighttime entertainment, such as a nightclub, shows, bars, etc. Since we were away from our children and wanted time for each other as well as SLEEP (!), we retired early every night after a nice walk into town (1 mile each way).
