Other considerations: We tipped frequently but noticed others who didn't--regardless, service was great. The one bit of advice I would give travelers is to eat your main meal BEFORE you head to the airport for your return flight, or sneak a few pieces of fruit from the buffet, or even pack a sandwich at the buffet (bring a few ziplocks with you!), as the prices for food at the Cancun airport are OUTRAGEOUS (i.e. $10 for a burger, $9 for a slice of pizza, etc.). Overall, a great value and a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great winter escape - Good value”
Reviews.Author: janandgary2010
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th. trip to Mexico and our first say at a Riu Hotel. From the moment we arrived, until the day we left, everything was pleasant and enjoyable. Oliver greeted us at the front steps as we were making our way to check-in and brought our drinks of choice. He said, "welcome to Paradise" and that pretty much sums up our trip. This resort is not for you if you are HARD TO PLEASE. There is something for everyone here - if you can't find it - ask - the staff is eager to please. We ate breakfast and dinner in the main dining area. The buffet was very good and the variety is amazing. We had lunch at the beach area and the chips and salsa are "the real thing"! All the food was delicious. We walked the beautiful beach every day, played tennis almost every morning, and enjoyed visiting The Yucatan and Tequilla Resorts also. The entertainment is really good, but after a few days, it can get tiresome because it is rather very loud. We enjoyed the entertainment crew - they made every effort to create a fun atmosphere for everyone. The houskeeping staff works very hard to keep everything neat and clean. They are completely trustworthy and will honor any request you may have for towels, soap - whatever. The only thing I can say negative about the rooms is that they are a little damp/musty - but you have to remember that this is a tropical area. The beds are very firm, but after a couple of night we realized how good they were for our backs. We tend to have lower back pain often, but no back pain whatsoever after sleeping on those beds. All-in-all this was the best vacation we have had in Mexico and will most likely return in the future. Unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Americas Benidorm. Worst holiday yet!”
Reviews.Author: bnfbabe
Reviews.Content: We arrived end of Feb, a group of 11. The purpose of the trip was a friends wedding, I was her bridesmaid. We booked and flew with Thomson. The girls in the office were awful, total waste of time. We and the rest of the group will not be booking with them again. The premier upgrade on the flight is well worth the money! Especially if you enjoy your sleep. We were the only two who paid for this pleasure, the others just paid additional to pre book seats together. WASTE of time. they paid over 150 GBP between them to have allocated seats, as the married couple have a young baby and wanted him to be easily passed between grandparents etc during the 9 hr flight. They did not get the seats allocated on the return trip. The mother was told- on the return- this was because of the baby- he could not sit in window seats due to the fact there are only 2 air masks and he was being put at risk.. funny how no one mentioned this when they prebooked in the travel agents, or on the flight out???? They were split up evenly front and baack of the aircraft. Not really great service esp when your newly weds!!! mum was also told very rudely baby was to remain in his seat, she was not to walk up the aisle with him in her arms to get him off to sleep- she wasnt told this on the way out either!! The wedding itself- I would not get married abroad. Wedding at 4pm, meal was 6.45 and we were instructed to be out by 8pm. No special allowances! when asked what we may do between 4.30pm and 6.45pm the response was 'well, we could organize a cocktail party we suppose??' The flowers in the book to choose from look pretty rubbish- but on the day were nothing more than stunning. If you get married here, do not expect any special treatment! you literally get what u pay for. That is, if you get the wedding breakfast delivered to your room next morning.. which this couple didn't either! It was a very quick ceremony, not what you dream of! For anyone marrying here- the 'gardens' are the short grass area infornt of the breakfast patio- not a secret garden like you may think!! The funniest moment was an american chap shouting 'holy cow' at full volume as the bride and her father made their way up!!! his mouth was swinging open like he had never seen a wedding before! The rooms- well- they stink of damp and the drains stink. This smell will be on your clothes when you get home, allow some extra kgs flying out free- the water on your clothes will weigh your cases down!! 2 others in our party did move rooms, we decided not to, as the rooms they moved to were no better than before. top floor is supposedly better than ground... Keep your patio door open and turn the air con off- this actually smells worse... As for our couple getting wed here, thomson apparantly emailed asking for a room with a bath, to which they were told all rooms had baths. This was so they could bath the baby. They were prepared to pay for the upgraded room with a bath, but seeing as the 'normal' rooms had baths..they didnt.. No rooms had baths-unless you upgrade. They put the couple, the baby, the buggy and the luggage, cases, suits etc on the top floor. Mummy decided she was not carting baby 3 flights of stairs 4 times daily with buggy and all the gear. The top floor room allocated smelt so badly she didn't pass the threshold before she requested a ground floor room. Which was given, after almost forcing the staff! When she arrived in this room, no bath, and concrete wall outside her balcony door. Still smelt damp. Bride now in tears- no bath, damp room with 14month old baby. In the end, it required the rep to intervene. They did get an upgrade. but not without being told several times the 'hotel was full nothing else'. Room upgrade was nice- much better- but not worth the money in the thomson brochure. Okay, the food- available all day, good food. Staff generally are very nice. If you stay for 14 nghts you will crave something other than deep fried, pizza, chips, burger or hot dogs. be warned! The hotel itself is ok, not to the star rating in our opinion. The americans- this place is their Benidorm. They threw up in the stair wells, were staggering about drunk at 1pm, loud, rude, rowdy, overtook the pool, the bar, the works. They walk into you. They push past you, they stand next to your table at dinner having a 'chat'- no worry about your meal! the animacion team are all great lively guys, but the beach volleyball, pool games etc- its no relaxing break here. From our party we were all in different blocks, and every one of us had trouble with drunk Americans. One couple with us had them shouting 1-5 repeatedly until 3am where one was escorted away security. Another night they were banging on everyones doors demanding everyone wake up and party at early hours. We heard our neighbours drunkly discussing their body parts, whilst loudly procreating most nights early hours- enough to wake us up! They also broke street lights, uprooted bins generally ruined the place. Your rooms are cleaned daily, fresh towels etc no issues here. We had a video camera stolen during the wedding, but we are almost 100% this was a guest. The staff to us are 100% trustworthy. By the end of our stay we left out money etc in our rooms and it was always exactly were we left it. 5th avenue is great for shopping, eating etc. Do not buy jewels here, visit playa las americas in cancun we got our best diamonds there. You can wear your jewels, wallets etc no prob in playa del carmen. great place. We visited cozumel- had its day in our opinion. Cancun was very lively, almost a 'mini mock up of vegas' but not cheap. Chichen itza is a long day, but fantastic if you can do the trip- our tour guide victor was abs fantastic full of info etc. Cream up well, take a hat, and plenty of water of not provided. This place is like an oven. we swam with dolphins- our advice, take a 'non swimming' friend to film and photograph- 50 USD for a ten min DVD is pretty harsh! Haggle for everything. Best 'touristy' stuff we bought was at chichen itza- 4-5USD for most things. we bought two of the chess sets for 250pesos! We did not enjoy the hotel. Not relaxing unless you enjoy getting drunk on tequila everyday and spewing up, no worries about where you sleep! We would recc to anyone to go to the mayan palace (2006) its worth the extra money. Thi is only half of the tale too- We will not be returning to this hotel. A further tip- if you go to bed before 11pm- try get a room in block one or two- the music h=thumps VERY loudly if your at the pool end of block 5 and 6!! poor baby managed to sleep through it, just! If you want a poolside, get your towel down early on the clear days, beach side there were always places till at least 10.30am. Weather was reasonable, mix of sun and half cast days. Rained only once. we enjoyed mexico though, fantastic, we preferred this to St Lucia, and would prob return some day. Please excuse my spelling, half the keys are stuck due to some loon on the return flight throwing wine all over me!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: lynzi042084
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best resort that I have stayed at in Mexico! Out of all the Riu resorts in the complex I would definetely stay here again- It was small (no chair hoarding in the wee hours) For your money pick this resort hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scarborotraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Playacar the week of Feb 22/10. Upon checking in, Aldo at the front desk made sure we were taken care of. Thanks Aldo. The resort was very clean and I liked the idea it was smaller than the other resorts, less pedestrian traffic, not long line-ups for food. The staff were very pleasant and made sure we were happy and well taken care of. Thanks to Gilberto, Elly, Herbert (in the dining areas) and Emilo (activities) and others that contributed to our enjoyment of the resort. The only thing I was not impressed with was the lunch buffet. Yes, they had a variety of food, but it was the same daily and due to it being outside, mostly cold. I'm not a very picky eater, but I feel there could have been more choice to make sandwiches. I personally found the breakfast and dinner buffets good. We did not get into any of the a la cartes as they were filled early in the morning. There was no shade on the beach but the beaches were beautiful. The ocean was very rough the week we were there and quickly pulled you under, even if you weren't out very far. The water was very warm and it sure beats snow and cold weather! There are no restrooms close to the beach, so be prepared to trek up to the buffet area. We had no problem getting chairs on the beach and most were in good working order. We lucked out with the weather and had a pretty good week of it, rain one day only. I would definitely return to this resort and recommend it to others. There was a constant musty smell in the rooms but that seems to be the case in a lot of the hotels. Nothing dried either (clothing) but what can you do. It did not spoil our time there. If you like peanut butter, they don't supply it at the buffet. It would be wise to take your own, especially if you have kids with you that eat it. We went into Playa Del Carmen a few times (even at night) by taxi ($5 fare one way) and the taxi drivers were very friendly and talkative. All in all, I would return to this resort as my stay was pleasant. The ladies from Toronto, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: KCofMN
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many tropical destinations and stayed at quite a few resorts in the Playa area. This is a small resort and low key. Very fun, staff is great, pool is wonderful and steps from the the beach. Beach has been totally rennovated and is fabulous! Food and drinks were good. Would stay here again for the price. Not large like Iberostars but very nice. Can't say anything negative about our stay except room service for morning coffee or a coffee maker in the room would be nice. KC of MN

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: dreamingofvacation44
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at this resort - don't let anyone kid you - we traveled with a group of nine AMERICANS and had a blast - we sat at the beach and at the pool and no it was not dirty - we were just having fun - there is a party pooper in every crowd and I guess some of the guests were - if you want an elite resort to go to then pay that price! - we were there to have fun and we did - our rooms were very clean every day - and the hard beds that they talk about where actually good for my back! The staff was awesome and we really enjoyed them. We ate at the steak house twice and it was very good - the buffet was always good with lots of things to choose from - if you are a picky eater which we are not there was always things to choose from - we went with all adults but would bring our kids there - we have teenage kids but would bring them there - they had such good entertainment for all ages - its all what you make it - sun and beaches are better than clouds and snow - we met such great people there - young and old . . . .. .if you want to go on an excursion go ziplining - I"m not a risking person but loved it!!! - charlie was a great tour guide for that!! - was very safe!!! We got put in a room that we didn't really like and they changed us - so if that happens just ask and they will change your rooms - very accommodating - wish we could be there right now - enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Oceanblues
Reviews.Content: After spending many hours reading reviews, I was a bit skeptical because of the few negative ones that were thrown in the mostly positive ones. I was pleasantley surprised at what a wonderful resort this is. Ignor the negative reviews...probably can't ever please those type of people. If you are looking for a 5 star Marriott, this is not your place. If you are looking for a nice, clean and friendly resort with a tropical feel then this resort is for you! They are constantly cleaning the resort, and are there for your every need. We had a topper on our bed the first night, and slept like babies each night. We rented a suite, so we had extra room which was nice. The drinks are not watered down as others have said, in fact sometimes I had to say "stop" when they were pouring the alcohol! The pool is loud during the day because they have contests. At first I thought I wouldn't like this, but the contests are pretty entertaining! If you want to get away from that head to the beach. The beach has been renovated so no more sand bags, just one big beautiful beach! The food in the buffett was always great. Never got tired of it even after 7 days as there is a variety. We ate at the ala carte steakhouse one night. We knew the steak wouldn't be that great as we are spoiled on steak being from Nebraska, but it was nice to be served your food close to the beach. No need to bring your laptop. They have an internet center with high speed internet $3 per 20 minutes of use. We walked to the other RIU resorts and decided we made the right choice. Thank you RIU Playacar...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Had an amzing holiday at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: sharleex
Reviews.Content: LAst week we got back from our first holiday to Mexico, and it was amazing. One of the things that surprised us the most was just how friendly the staff were. They were so nice and helpful, would do anything for you, were always smiling and encouraged us to practise our Spanish!! The hotel was great, real caribbean feel to it, and isin a great location; right on a beautiful beach. The hotel buffet restaurant was excellent, with loads of choice for all three meals, and i'm very fussy. The Asian restaurant is also a buffet, but they do excellent food there too if you like chinese. The Mexican restautant wasn't great, not a lot to choose from but might as well try it if you're there, although we didn't try the steakhouse, as we ate in town a few times as the steak was so cheap. Loads to do in 5th avenue so we spent many evenings there and its so close to the hotel. The facilities are great at the hotel. As the weather was pretty overcast for the WHOLE TWO WEEKS!, we played tennis which is free and they don't charge for lots of lost balls!! The pool is nice but the one with out the bar was very cold, and the one with didn't really attract us as there were a lot of Americans, who sat in there all day drinking so must've been pretty dirty! The sunbeds were awful, so uncomfortable and mostly all broken so they really should sort that out. Most of the people in the hotel were from USA or Canada, and they drank all day, and were so loud that they really got to us eventually. You couldn't really relax around the pool, or on the beach as they just made so much noise. Overally we had a fantastic holiday and would definately go back. Don't fly with thomson though, their service was terrible. HAppy holidays

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled”
Reviews.Author: Maddie33
Reviews.Content: We chose the RIU Playacar for its location and great reviews. Both were not a disappointment! We loved that it was close to Playa and fifth ave. We found the hotel to be wounderful! We went for my sisters 50th birthday. The beds are as they say, very hard. I e-mailed them before we went and we had matress toppers on our bed upon arrival and also the building we requested. Our room was perfect. My sister had left her safe open and the maid closed it and left a note to pick up safe key at the front desk. They watch out for you. We ate at the buffet resteraunt every night. My sister and her husband are vegitarians and we all found plenty of food. Every night was wonderful with different foods. For my sisters b-day we could not have asked for more!! Alaina at the front desk made sure here room was decorated and Tomas at the resteraunt made dinner the highlight of our trip!! We also found the drinks not water down and quality. It is a good time to try new thing. We could not have been treated better, they made us feel like family!!! We would defineitly go back. Thank you so much!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: TammyP7
Reviews.Content: Many food choices but would rank the food as a 8/10. Grounds and hotel very nice, clean. Great service. Fantastic beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip! Feb 10-24/2010”
Reviews.Author: FireStorm12
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Riu Playacar in Playa Del Carmen. We had a great trip, I read bad comments about the beds and beaches before we left. Five days before we arrived the beaches were under recontruction, now for 7 km up the beach from the hotel they added about 300 ft of sand. For the beds being to hard all you have to do is ask for a "topper". The servers was great, the staff very friendly. If you bring your laptop on your holiday you get free internet access in the lobby ( saves on buying a phone card to call home).. Great time...

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels we've been to in the Playacar district”
Reviews.Author: mustangGT_H
Reviews.Content: Basically, my wife and I joined Trip Advisor several years back because the service helped us find a clear path to the kind of vacation we wanted - trusting those of you who had been there over advertisements. We had a great experience then, and want to share this one with you all. We've been "regulars" to the Mayan Riviera district for about the last 7 years and stayed in a variety of places from Cancun down south of Playa Del Carmen. This hotel was one of our better experiences. Here's what we liked about about it. We are always "into" a place that is well suited to bring young children - not that we travel with ours every time. We like the family atmospher and try to steer away from the spring break hangouts. We decided that the Riu Hotels (there are several in the complex there) seem to cater well to families. We were pre-spring break this time and mostly there were middle aged adults and families. Staff was great; Food was some of the absolute best we have ever had at an all inclusive resort. No kidding, it was GREAT. Riu Playacar is within about a 30 minute walk into the shopping district of 5th Avenue of Playa Del Carmen, or take a cab ride for ~ $5. Great area, good food, (but you better like haggling, cause they sure do) The hotel beach was niceand spacious and kept clean - about a third of it under palms for those that like shade. Plenty of lounge chairs.. not enough hammocks for my liking. Overall, hotel grounds felt opened and airy with good breezes blowing through, were well kept, rooms were nice - One complaint was the beds were not all that comfortable - but so far not many have been. I'm usually so glad to be away, I don't care much. Some may feel otherwise. Hotel supplies plenty of bottled water and a wide range of other drinks in your in room frig. We've seen some more opulent hotels, this is not one of them, but it's not the low end either.. I'd rate it a 4 - 5 star. We walked through some of the othe Riu properties, and they all seemed nice. Some offer more ammenities than the Playacar, but not of interest to us. Choices.. though for others interested in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Four Diva's on vacation”
Reviews.Author: gcookie
Reviews.Content: Four ladies from Michigan began what we were sure would be a wonderful vacation... well we weren't disapointed.. had a very nice time at this resort.. The only thing was the weather... terrible weather...the resort was truly wonderful and they even gave my friend a surprise Birthday cake... Nestor one of our many wonderful waiter was awesome..Thanks.. Not to forget Aldo at the front desk ...For the price everything we needed was furnished for our group...The food and the drinks were better than the last Cruise we went on...would we return? not this time of year.. must be Global Warming but it sure was cold the week we were there...Go and enjoy yourself and say hi to everyone from the Four Diva's from Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation - Couldn't Ask for Much More!”
Reviews.Author: honeynmooner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Playacar the week of 2-6-10 thru 2-13-10, and had a wonderful time. The food was very good at the main buffet. They served Breakfast and Dinner here. My favorite meal of the day was breakfast, we had made to order omelets which were delicious. The only thing that was missing was has browns as they had fried potatoes instead. However, we went to both the Riu Yucatan & Riu Tequila and was able to enjoy them at those resorts with our exchange privileges. These were like the ones you get from Burger King. Thank You, Racine group at the Riu Yucatan for letting us know that you had them at your resort. We met the group during our visit to the Riu Yucatan's Swim up Bar, and had a great time. The bartender was providing us all with various shots including one called Donkey Semen. We ate at the Steak House & Asian Restaurants at the Riu Playacar and both are highly recommended. Lunch was served at the Beach restaurant which also was Buffet style with a nice spread. The rooms were kept very clean and the beds were a little hard, however we didn't need a mattress topper. Since we stayed at the Riu Negril 3 years ago, the resort provided us with a special gift. We had a wonderful time with the Animation Team. I would like to give a shout out to Choko who made me sweat in the pool during water aerobics. Ha! Ha!, that's what he would say to get us all in the pool. We also shot air rifles, played Mexican horseshoes and darts with Richie & Reuben. My husband received an award and a visor our last night on stage as he had won at air rifles. That was great fun. The resort, food, entertainment, and the animacion team was wonderful. Also, the shopping was either across the steet or within 25 mnutes walk, or a $5.00 taxi ride. Would be go back? Most definitely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Resort!”
Reviews.Author: CorvetteloverZ06
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute trip through the recommendation of our travel agent! This resort was super clean, friendly staff, great food and drinks and all the amenities you could ask for! We didn't even book the specialty restaurants because the food at the main dining areas was so good. We loved the rooms, except for the hard beds. We asked for the pillow mattress to be put on top of our bed and that helped. There were plenty of towels and sun beds by the pool and beach. The shopping across the street from the resort was so nice and we loved being so close to Playa del Carmen for the shopping. We are planning to take a large group with us next year to this resort! We enjoyed visiting the sister RIU's and using their restaurants and workout room also. All in all, the best so far!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: maggiemayWIS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the riu playacar. We were there from Feb. 7-14. The beach work is all done and it is awesome. You can walk all the way to PlayaDelCarmen on the beach. (25 minute walk) The staff is great, always there to give you anything you need. Food is good, entertainment is good. Went to Xel-Ha to go snorkling, that was awesome. Also to Tulum to see the ruins. Very neat. Also took the ferry to Cozumel, did a jeep trip around the Island. Very fun. My only complaint is that the beds are hard, but, I requested a mattress pad right away when I got there, and the staff put them on the beds first thing the next morning. Helped a lot with the comfort. I have stayed at bigger, more expensive resorts, but this place was great fun and plenty nice enough for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: stevetracey
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Xmas and New Year. Hotel was great, the rooms are a bit musty and dated but didnt spend much time in them. They can be a bit noisy if your room is by the stairwell, mainly dut to inconsiderate people bumping their cases down the stairs on late/early arrivals and departures. Meals but great, something for everyone and the Gala dinners for Xmas Eve and New Year were fantastic. The staff are very friendly and efficient. Entertainment wasnt for us and the kids disco etc., was on too late in the evening and very repetitive. However the bar staff are excellent fun. Beach and sea were great - the beach is only spoilt by people leaving plates of food lying around resulting in being bombarded by seagulls. However, plenty of sunbeds and towels readily available. Walked into Playa del Carman (25 min walk) on Xmas Day - everything was open and we booked our trips which were much cheaper than in the Hotel. Did Tulum and Coba and also a jeep safari to Sian Khan which was great fun. Good shops available outside the hotel and pool tables etc., available in the Tequila across the road. All in all a great holiday - any questions just ask !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: trishbEngland
Reviews.Content: We returned from this hotel at the beginning of February. The food, staff and grounds are wonderful. The rooms could do with a freshen up and the extractor fans in the shower and toilets should work to avoid the damp and must smells that we (and many others) experienced. We can't say enough about the hard working entertainment staff - Israel, Richie, Erika, Victor and Reuben. We had a lot of fun with them during the day and at night they worked hard in the theatre. At the time of our visit the beach was being repaired and we found it fascinating to watch. It didn't spoil our holiday one bit and we were able to get on the beach for a few days. We knew the work had to be done, so we didn't let us bother us at all. As to the food - fabulous in the main restaurant. Plenty of choice for everyone at breakfast and dinner. I wouldn't recommend the steak restaurant as the steaks were small and thin and tasteless. Plus the restaurant was very dark and we couldn't see what we were eating. Waiters in the main restaurant were very good - being efficient, helpful and good fun too. We found the bar staff in the theatre good fun, quick and very good at their jobs. As to the theatre, on the whole the entertainment was good for that type of hotel. The big drawback for us was not being able to get a quiet drink before and after dinner at the bar in the foyer of the hotel. We found it very noisy and the seats incredibly uncomfortable. We do like to sit with a coffee and brandy after dinner but we had no chance with the seating and noise at that bar. Any comfortable seats were taken up by people engrossed in their laptops for most of the evening!!!!! Surely they didn't need those on holiday as there was a very good Internet room. All in all we had a great holiday and would return at a future date. The bar staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place -- Relax, Go There”
Reviews.Author: Ottosan55
Reviews.Content: Travelled with wife and two children (13 and11) the week of January 29th....back just in time for the East Coast blizzard,,,,wish we had stayed put! This resort is lovely. It is meticulously maintained, the beach renovation is done now, and the food was good if not excellent. Ignore the negative reviews...this is not the Ritz, but the Riu Playacar is a great mid-winter getaway spot, and would recommend it to a friend in a heartbeat. It is probably not for singles, or honeymooners, but instead appears to cater to the middle-of-the-road vacationer looking to relax, and escape the cold, and not spend a fortune -- lots of Minnesotans, Argentinians and older Brits were with us there last week -- did not see many children at all, except my own. We did the tours to Chichen-Itza (a long day, but worth it if you are into Mayan culture and/or achaeology) and we also went to Xcaret. Xcaret was nice, and had a wonderful snorkeling beach, and The River is a unique experience -- go early in a taxi ($14 US), and you will have the park to yourself for an hour or more, before the buses arrive. We booked our excursions through Miguel at American Express (in the lobby most days) and he was very, very helpful. Overall, a great experience, including our non-stop flight on Mexicana Airlines from DC, which did not subject us to bag fees, and had pillows, blankets and a meal service (yes, I did say meal service) at no extra charge. And, they were on time, to the minute, both ways. (We booked through American Express Travel) We would return to the Riu Playacar. It is low-key and pleasant, which is exactly what we wanted for our family trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best, Friendliest, fun staff ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ajwint
Reviews.Content: We came as a group of 12 ranging in ages from 26-50 and we all thought the same thing the hotel was not the cleanest (but we are not high maintenance,so this was not a big issue), the beds are hard (but we all slept ok), with that said it did not matter cause the staff there makes up for any complaint any of us had!!!! Everyone was friendly and attentive...Ritchie is the BEST!!! He will make you smile everytime you see him ;) The bartenders had us all rolling with laughter every night Enrique was our fav. Ask for a Tequila Popper!! They make them really fun! The resort is nice and small so we could all find each other just fine. The shows were fun too...the animacion team does a great job w/ the kids and the adults!! I think anyone who has a complaint about this place is just too "high maintenance" and should go to the "Palace" where everyone is really boring and snobby. If you want fun "down to earth" people and staff...STAY AT THE PLAYACAR!!! I heard several guests say the same thing and had the same complaints but didn't care cause they were having soooo much fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: OntarioVino
Reviews.Content: Our vacation to Riu Playacar was enjoyable... as we had escaped the freezing temps and snow of Ontario. However, just want to point out that this resort should not be considered a 5 star - even for Mexico. First the pluses:: Landscaping is very lush and beautiful, pools are lovely, lots of shade at beach and pools, and food is very good. The entertainment team and bar staff are wonderful. What we did not enjoy:: the lobby is very small, not very inviting, the bar area is very loud. The rooms are in need of updating, not that this was a huge issue for us...as we don't spend much time in the rooms. However, for a 5 star resort, some attention is required here. We waited for close to 4 hours for a room when we arrived. We ended up in a third floor room close to the lobby. Location of rooms not an issue, as the resort is quite small, however, if you have mobility issues, you will not wish to be in a third floor room, as there are many stairs to climb. If you are intending to visit you may wish to keep this in mind, and ensure you request a first or second floor room. We actually spent a lot of our time in the other two Riu resorts we were able to use. We were very impressed by both of them... Riu Yucatan and Riu Tequila. Yucatan is on the beach and Tequila is across the road. Both of these resorts are sold at the same price point as Riu Playacar. I would strongly suggest you book at one of these as the facilities are much better than Playacar . You should also be aware the Mexican Govt. have currently embarked on a huge beach project to try to contain further beach erosion. This means that some of the beach areas may still be closed due to this work. However, we returned on Jan. 29th, so it may be nearing completion now if not already completed. This of course has nothing to do with the Resorts, but a mandate of the Government. This was not the most attractive aspect for me (but very necessary), however, seemed to be a source of enjoyment and curiosity for my husband and others to watch this work in progress! The Riu resorts complex location is wonderful, being close to Playa del Carmen, and having a market across the road. I would strongly urge you to visit Playa del Carmen, take the ferry to Cozumel, visit XelHa and XCaret...all of which were a wonderful addition to our trip and most certainly worth the visit. XelHa and XCaret are beautiful parks and one day visits are almost not enough to enjoy all they have to offer. Have a wonderful trip if you plan on visiting this area. I certainly wish I was back there now.

Reviews.Title: “Call to make sure beach is open!!!”
Reviews.Author: babsola
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar. for January 25th through January 30th. Upon arriving at the hotel, we checked in, got our room information, dining information, etc. and then the gentleman informed us: “Oh, and the beach is closed indefinitely. You can use the Riu Lupita beach club services (about a 15 minute walk) or we can shuttle you to a public beach (a 15 minute drive) where you have to pay for your food and drinks.” He said this as casually as if he was telling us there would be no shampoo in the room!! Not only was the beach completely closed off with orange fencing, there were large pipes laying on it and at least 3 to 4 tractors and bulldozers running all day long. Machinery was backing up with that “beeping” sound, from early morning throughout the day. Even while sitting at the pool there was a constant drone of equipment. Not what we had in mind for our relaxing, beachfront vacation. We do not understand why we were not informed about the beach being closed before we arrived. The Riu hotels should have informed Expedia who should have informed us. We feel we should have been given the option of changing hotels or changing the date to when the beach would be available. We booked a BEACHFRONT hotel because we wanted to be able to go to the beach whenever we wanted to! And we booked an all-inclusive so we would have access to food and drinks without having to worry about bringing money to the beach, etc. Trying to salvage our trip, we walked to the Riu Lupita beach club area: This area of beach was being used by guests from the Riu Playacar, Riu Yucatan and Riu Palace because all of the beach area in front of those hotels was closed. And the guests from Riu Lupita and Riu Tequila were already using it. Needless to say it was very crowded and meant we had to get to the beach very early to even try to get a lounge to sit on. And if we wanted to eat lunch somewhere besides the beach club, we had to walk back to one of the other hotels. And the only drinks available were beer and wine. One day it started raining and we had to walk the 15 minutes back to the hotel, not just go back to our room. Service at the hotel was fine, food okay, but the beach situation was awful. Would not stay here again unless the beach was open.

Reviews.Title: “What a great value”
Reviews.Author: bonyt
Reviews.Content: Seriously, to the naysayers who have negative reviews for this resort, word of advice, next year save your money and be miserable at home. The service and hospitality that we received from the hotel staff and employees was truly amazing. These people work tirelessly and for very low wages and never have a bad attitude. The bartenders: They were as efficient and attentive as any I have ever experienced and at the same time are very engaging and friendly. No matter what time of day or night or what drunk, non tipping idiot they had to deal with, they never had a negative disposition. The entertainment staff: I dont know how they keep their energy day after day, but they really go out of their way to make guests feel welcome and entertained. The grounds: they are beautifull and immaculate, with armies of friendly grounds people constantly attending to them. The food: The specialty restaurants were decent, but the buffet was great. The produce was amazing and the selection was great. We traveled with another couple and none of us ever had a complaint about the food. If you are looking for a posh 5 star experience, this is not where I would recommend someone to go, but for the value, you cannot beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, good food, would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: MitchWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to RIU Playacar with friends and just arrived home on 1/28. We have stayed at several RIUs before and have always been happy with the service and food and location. We were not disappointed in those things on this trip. You should know what kind of travelers we are as that affects the review... we want the hotel to be clean and nice, but not necessarily plush and upscale. We care about the food as we haven't been lucky eating away from our resorts in the past, but we aren't super finicky or expect 5-star dining. We like to have fun - have a social nightlife around vs. very quiet, romantic type of trip. Yet, not a ton of party people everywhere, all the time. Food We have always enjoyed the RIU food and again it was wonderful. Everyone we met raved about the food - now it is Mexico so when you rave about the food it's not raving in a Four Seasons 5-course meal sort of way... but much of it was excellent. My friend is an great cook and she was always commenting on how everything was so good. We ate in the mexican specialty, the asian, and the buffet. Asian was better of the specialities, but really, the buffet was probably our favorite. Rooms Basic Mexican rooms. Very clean. Always well stocked and maintained by staff. Nothing special, but nothing bad either. Not much storage - we used the bedside tables as drawers as well as dresser - that's a minor thing. Beds are hard - but the added mattress pad made more of a difference that I would have believed. We spend very little time in our room since we come from a cold weather climate and come for the sun. Service This is where the RIU shines. I can't speak to the front desk since I didn't deal with them much, but the waiters and bartenders are exceptional. Really exceptional. You never wait long for anything and often they anticipate what you need. They are very busy, yet never seem stressed or unable to accommodate any request. They work hard yet never show signs of strain or tiredness. There is no way, unless you are a difficult person and we did see difficult people there - that you could be unhappy with service. My husband lost his wedding ring during a pool game, but we had no idea where it was and didn't expect to ever find it. Viktor on the entertainment staff heard about it and actually searched for it with goggles at the end of his very long day. He surprised us the next morning with it. It was really touching and thoughtful and just a small example of the extra things that are done by the staff that go above and beyond. Beach We were there at the time of beach restoration. We used the beach for about 3.5 days and then it was fenced off. You could still lay on the beach but couldn't run into the water or walk along in front because of machinery and pipes. I knew this could be coming and it was a bummer but not unexpected. We could walk over one hotel and jump in. By the time others get there, it will probably be done. Not anything the RIU could control and it didn't impact our fun. Otherwise, the location is great - really close to town and just a few minutes to the RIU Tequila and Yucatan. Downtown Great. Really changed from the last time we went to this area 12 years ago. Many trendy restaurants and clubs. Lots of shopping. Felt very safe and it was really fun to hang out there. Saw an awesome fire show at the Blue Parrot on the beach. Went into town two nights and it was well worth it. Overall RIU Playacar is a great place to stay. The top things it offers is really good food, excellent staff, and a really good location. It's not upscale, but it wouldn't be for the price. You have to know that it's a more affordable-medium priced hotel, but in that category, I think it over delivers. Plus, you really have three hotels and their entertainment, bars, restaurants available to you which is such a great idea. We went back and forth everyday. I think anyone who stays at the RIU Playacar will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough!”
Reviews.Author: janef507
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviews below - not a 5 star resort, but good enough for a quick & cheap getaway. I just returned on Sunday 1/24, was there only 3 nights, celebrating my boyfriend's birthday. The only complaints we had were: - Fridge in the room wasn't working (not keeping stuff cold), but we asked someone to come fix it and they did and then it was fine. - Room did have a musty odor, i brought an air freshener and it was fine. The dresser drawers had a weird smell too, so i didn't put my clothes in there, put them all in the closet, which was huge. - Toilet kept running, had to play around with the handle to make it stop - Beach chairs (at the pool and on the beach) are not in the best shape, some were broken. They are made out of cheap netting which sags in the seat area and is sometimes ripped. A couple of the plastic chairs are cracked. But you just have to get out there early and reserve a few good ones. - FYI - If you don't make your dinner reservation between 7am and 10am, you will not be able to eat at the a la carte restaurants! So make sure to make your reservations early. What made up for this: - The beach is beautiful! - The staff are eager to please so if you are not happy with something, they will do their best to make up for it. - Aldo at the reception desk is the BEST! If you are going to celebrate a special occasion, tell them. They will hook u up! They gave us a great room (#6310) on the 3rd floor in the building all the way by the water (pink building). The room was good, nice king size bed and good size bathroom. And the balcony!!!! It was HUGE and overlooked the pool and the ocean, just amazing! We spent most of our time out there! - Lots of food options, we thought the food was pretty good, but we didn't have dinner on the resort (went to downtown PDC), just breakfast and lunch, which were both buffets with great options. - Locatin is great. We walked to town in about 25 mins, cab is $5. You can walk down the beach during the day and visit the other Riu's which is fun. Overall, we were happy with our vacation. But we're not picky and when we travel it's all about what we do, not where we stay, so it fit our needs just fine. If you're into higher end accomodations, i would suggest the Riu Palace Mexico or Riu Palace Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Keep an eye on your clothes”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireWatto
Reviews.Content: After staying in a ground floor room we found the beds to feel constantly damp. The room had a damp smell all the time. Our clothes were damp when we took them out of the wardrobe and to add insult to injury, when we got home, we found a number of our clothes that we hadnt worn were damaged by mildew. These were plain fabrics so it was very noticeable. We tried washing them but ended up having to throw some very good clothes away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Mizzou20
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. The beach is so close to your room and is as beautiful a beach as I have ever seen. The turquoise waters were unbelievable. The rooms were very clean and adequate. The food was good and always hot. I am a beer drinker (imagine that, a beer drinker from Missouri) and the Dos Equis on tap was great. As a matter of fact right off the beach at the lunch buffet they had beer on tap to fill up at your own leisure. The only thing I would say is that the pool water was cold in January. The beach, however was warm and was great. The service was very good. The bartenders were outstanding and the entertainment staff was good. The people at this resort really cared about making your stay a good one. The pride in which they did their jobs was noticeable. The mall across the street was small but quality. The vendors were fun and not pushy. The resort and Playacar in general had a very safe feel to it. If you want to take in the culture this is the area to visit as you are only 5 minutes from the Playa Del Carmen fun. This is a very enjoyable place. The sister properties offer a change in scenery and are a short walk down the beach. Book the Riu Playacar and spend hours sipping Dos Equis gazing across the horizon at Cozumel with the one you love and wear plenty of sun screen!! it's as good as it gets. We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: avery755
Reviews.Content: I got back January 19th and traveled with a girlfriend. We are both married and are in our mid 30's. We chose this hotel because it was close to town and I thought that would be easier for us as it was my friend's first time to Mexico. I wasn't expecting a 5 star hotel but it is close to a 3 star. I do travel to Mexico often so I am familiar with the area. Food- I have eaten at several all inclusives and the food at this hotel was not horrible but not great. Normally I am able to find a few things that I really like and eat them throughout the week but I really didn't find anything. The drinks were always strong but never tasted too good. Beach- It was nice and looks like the sand bags will be gone soon since they are renovating the beaches. It was a little small but just enough room because the hotel is so small. when I walked down the beach and looked at the other Riu's and hotels it looked like they were sitting on top of each other. Our beach felt a little tight but not as crowded as the other ones. Hotel- The hotel was small is size as expected. The grounds were kept up but it was very average looking. I was very disappointed in our room. It was very outdated. There was an odor but that doesn't bother me too much being in a damp area. I brought air freshners as suggested by others and it helped. The beds were indeed very hard but I have never had a very comfortable bed in any hotel in Mexico but these were the worst. From reading previous reviews I thought this was a quiet hotel but it seemed to get very loud at night. I don't mind a little noise because we like to have a good time too but every night we were woke up around 4am with people yelling, running through the halls, and slamming doors. Our room was located very close to the front lobby bar where everyone hung out so maybe that was part of the problem and maybe there was just a loud group at the hotel when we were there. Safety- We felt very safe on the hotel grounds at all times. There was always a taxi waiting at the front gate of the hotel and would catch a ride to town for $4-5 dollars never more. EL Fondo (sp)- Local Mexican rest- We ventured there because it had good reviews. The food was very good until we started seeing raw chickens and pork being carried from truck into the kitchen. Normally I wouldn't have an issue with that but there were chips and cheese laying across the meat that was loose and not packaged so we had to leave to restaurant for sanitary resons. Service- I felt the service was average. I have had better service in all of the other all inclusives I have stayed at. We were told to call the front desk before 4pm to have our fridge restocked with drinks. We had several issues with this as we called at 11am and came back to our room at 4pm and we had nothing to drink. We called the front desk over five times during the next 4 hours and was told each time they were on their way. We were very frustrated and called the manager who finally took care of it. I expressed my disappointment and when we returned to our room that night they had a bottle of champagne left out for us and our fridge was stocked to the max so at least they followed through. Most of the staff were plesant and fun. Pool- was average for this size hotel Overall this was an ok hotel on a budget but I would probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: July8
Reviews.Content: Service, food, accomodations all great. lots of sun beds and palm trees on the beach. If you want a bed by the pool that gets sun all day you may have to get there early to reserve your spot! grounds were beautifully landscaped and lush. $5 cab ride to Playa Del Carmen was well worth it, you could walk for 2 hours easily on 5th avenue. Across the street from the hotel is a really nice outdoor plaza with better quality souvenirs at reasonalbe prices. Be careful in Playa Del Carmen, if they say they are coming back with change, be prepared to go with them to get that change. stick to the shops on the main street and avoid the market stalls on side streets. Took a one day excursion for $107. Well worth it. Lunch at a real hacienda, underground cave that you could swim in, ruins at Ek Balam (wear sturdy shoes) and a trip to Vallendeloid, quaint town. I would recommend this hotel for a quiet relaxing holiday. Riu Tequila was a younger and partying crowd, 10 minute walk to the beach across the street. Riu Yucatan was very large and busy, beautiful southwestern theme. Playacar is a gated community so it was always safe to take an evening walk, many beatiful homes and hotels. trip from the airport took an hour and a half because this hotel is the last drop off. Only complaint I had was that some laundry had to be washed twice when I got back, there was a musty odour in everything. We were on the main floor and perhaps those rooms are mustier than upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: keswicking
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home yesterday. We were led to believe this is a 5 star hotel, a definite 4 star but not a five on anyones scale. The hotel simply does not have the facilities to qualify. Having said that I must say the service from everyone at the resort is excellent, any concerns or requests made by our group ( 8 adults ) were taken care of immediately, and a special thanks to my friend Aldo at the front desk. If you go to this resort in the future he will look after you, if it can be done, Aldo can do it! This spot is great value for the money, the food at the buffets is excellent but I tried all 3 a la carte restaurants and would not reccomend any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately return”
Reviews.Author: AlexesColorado
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with 3 other couples and found the Riu Playacar perfect for our group. Our main purpose was to relax and have some fun. The hotel was small enough so meeting up each day was easy. It was also very relaxing laying by the pools. We spent most of our time by the pool bar so we could watch and partake in the daily activities. Chocolate, Ruben, Isreal, and Victor were excellent. We all have traveled numerous time to different parts of Mexico and found the Riu's location excellent. We could walk into town in about 20 minutes. Cabs were only $3 or $5 per one way which is very reasonable. The comment I heard numerous times amongst our group was that the food was the best of any all inclusive we have stayed in. We also ate at the Steak and Asian resturant and both were very good. We really didn't do much sight seeing as I said we have been there, done that already, but we did go to an awesome resturant/bar, the Alux, that our Apple rep, recommended. Check it out on the web it is a dried cenote (cave). We didn't eat there just had drinks and toured the cave it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Just an OK resort”
Reviews.Author: rboysx3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the RIU Playacar. We planned a 6 day trip with another couple. The weather was pretty chilly and we were wearing pants and sweatshirts at night. The temps were in the mid 70's and pretty cloudy throughout the day. When we arrived at the hotel, there really wasn't anything that gave us that "WOW" factor. After looking at the other hotels before arriving at ours, ours seemed to be a bit smaller. This is smaller resort compared to the others that you will see. The real main reason for picking this hotel is that it was on the beach. There are several other hotels that are on the beach and next time, we will pick one of those. The grounds are very clean and well kept and the staff are very friendly. The entertainment at night wasn't that great. We went over to the RIU Tequila for 2 nights and there was quite a few more people and their shows were great! The advantage of the RIU chains is that you can go to the others for food and entertainment and to walk around. The food at the Playacar was very good, with much to choose from a lot of variety. We loved the food! I had read on the other reviews that the rooms had an odor...YES THEY DO!!!! Even the water smelled like sewer to us! I had ever brought air fresheners for the room and that did not help at all!! Bring dryer sheets for the drwers to keep your clothes from smelling!! The beds are rock hard and on arrival ask for a matress pad for your bed. They will put you on a list, so don't wait. The beach was very nice, there are great big sand bags that are an eye sore...but overall the beach was nice. The other thing that we noticed is it seemed that everyone smoked! If you don't mind smoking, than don't worry about it...but if you do, this isn't your hotel. Also, the beach is optional topless, so if you have kids...beware! If we were to back to this area, we would definetly pick a different resort. also, we took insulated mugs that were very helpful. They would fill them up and we didnt have to worry about our drinks spilling on the beach and needing a refill after a while. We went to bubbakeg.com and they have plenty to choose from and they keep your drinks cold for hours!! Happy vacationing!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort !”
Reviews.Author: Lucy1479
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this resort for a week, from Jan.8-15th. The property is very nice, and the people are so friendly ! We were very impressed by the staff at the Riu Playacar. The buffet is very good at breakfast and supper !! The lunch buffet was okay, but the supper buffet had so much selection ! The staff on the resort are very fun and there are lots of activities to do at the pool and beach. It is only a 5 minute taxi ride to Playa del Carmen, which is nice. I would definitely return to this resort !

Reviews.Title: “The entertainment team made our holiday”
Reviews.Author: blackcats22
Reviews.Content: We first came in August 2009 and loved it so came back in December 2009. We were impressed with the New year's eve dinner and party. Jessica did a great job in looking after our daughter and we miss her. Thanks to Erica for taking over when she left! The guys on the entertainment team were brilliant and to those who have left good luck and hope we meet again! The only day we had rain you did such a great job in keeping us amused and we forgot about the bad weather. Cesar thanks for loving our daughter and making her feel special. We love Mexico and you guys and we will be back and hope we see you somewhere along the way. Muchos gracias and all the best to you all. We have family who are coming to stay in the tequila in sumemr and october this year so you never know you may see them!! Morin, Craig and Toyo-England- aaahhhhhhhhhh!!!

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: devonjanner
Reviews.Content: everything about the hotel was wondeful. the rooms were good ,the drinks in your rooms were topped up every 2 days .the location was perfect right on te beach.the food was first class such a variety .they certainly went out of their way to please us all in the main restaurant on xmas eve and new years eves evening meal ,what a spread .it was our first holiday away during the festive season ,so pleased we chose this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation We've Had In A Long Time....5 Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGuys2010
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived at the Riu Playacar on Sunday, December 27, 2009 and stayed until Sunday, January 3, 2010. I wasn't sure what to expect based on the mixed reviews. We were overwhelmingly delighted! When we first arrived, we were greeted by ALDO at the front desk. He is AWESOME! He did a great job getting us just right right room, in building 6, close to the beach! Aldo even dropped off a welcome gift for us after we checked in! Both Aldo and Charley at the front desk took care of every request quickly, from asking for extra bottles of water and sodas for the mini bar to extra pillows and blankets! The rooms are clean and pretty spacious. We had a suite with one large bed. Be sure to ask for a mattress pad, as the beds are very firm! The bathroom was large and very clean. Had plenty of closet space with 20+ hangers, an iron, ironing board, safe and fully stocked mini bar. They stock the bar with large 1.5 liter bottles of spring water, pepsi, 7-up, orange soda, club soda and Dox Equis beers. The food at the buffet was very good. We preferred the buffet over the asian restaurant (Jade). The mexican and steakhouse restaurants were good as well. We were at the hotel on New Years Eve, and they exceeded our expectations with an enormous holiday buffet dinner with crab legs, shrimp, lamb, ham, prime rib, and on, and on....they also hosted an amazing New Years Eve party with champagne, a band, balloons, hats, noisemakers. Truly a memorable new years eve! The cool thing about staying here is at that you can use the hotel facilities at the neighboring Riu Tequila and Riu Yucatan (literally across the street)...the bars and the restaurants for breakfast and lunch. You have to eat dinner at your "home" Riu hotel. The Tequila has a late night "disco", and 24 hour snacks (sandwiches, fruit salad, burgers). The beach was great....plenty of lounge chairs. There's no waiter service on the beach, so you'll have to get your own drinks from the bar! We had a fantastic vacation.....and we would definitely return! Please let me know if I can answer any additional questions for you.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: Sarahinmontreal
Reviews.Content: Top notch location (5 minutes by cab or 25 minute walk from Fifth Avenue, the hub of Playa del Carmen) and beautiful beach (sandbags are largely off to the side, out of line of vision - only one in the middle & it was fun to try and climb on it - kids love it). Tasty (although uninspired) food. Something for everyone. Staff okay but service uneven (i.e. they told us a table with breakfast would be set up for early departure (5:30 a.m.) but there was nothing but coffee the next day; my sister-in-law got towel figurines but we didn't). That said, they will do anything you want if you tip them. Nice shows at night. Well laid out, relatively small property, therefore great for families with small children and those with mobility issues. One of my main issues: smelly rooms. Followed tips on this site, brought air freshener, opened balcony door, all to no avail. Took a week for the moldy smell to leave the suitcase when we got home. Interestingly, my sister-in-law's room did not have this smell so I don't know what to say. Second big issue: noise. Series of rooms encircle a small inner courtyard; therefore noise carries and the cleaning staff makes no effort to be quiet, calling out to each other and talking loudly on their walkie-talkies. Also, the layout is such that every two rooms have adjacent doors , which are heavy and although there is a stopper to minimize slamming, they still make incredible noise when they close. Forget sleeping in at this resort. Bugs fly into the room every time the door is opened and the maids leave the doors open while they clean so be prepared for this. Also, this is not a place for couples that like to cuddle. The two double beds are pushed together and if you separate them, you're left with half a headboard because it's one big piece that extends the width of the two beds. Saw a Riu hotel catalog and it looks like most of their properties set up the rooms this way. On the plus side, the cot brought in for our daughter was really more like a bed than a foldaway. As for the mattress & pillows, all the other reviewers were dead on so I brought my own pillow and asked for a topper, which made a huge difference. I must be pretty fussy because none of the other 18 members of our group complained about the mattress or pillows. Amazing weather means you can sometimes leave the balcony door open at night (there is a screen) but forget this if your room is in the back because the staff wheels large noisy carts at all hours. Make sure to bring a sweatshirt and pants because it can get chilly & windy at night. Another pet peeve of mine was that there was no Latin music. Why did I come to Mexico? In Cuba (I'm Canadian) there was music all the time, which did wonders for the ambiance. Our group had children aged 17-30; they hung out at the Riu Tequila bar & disco and went into town whenever we allowed them ($5 cab ride - make sure to have exact change because they rip you off on the exchange if you don't). If you have the bucks, do the excursions with a private driver. Costs the same if not less than an organized excursion and gives you more flexibility, not to mention time. Ask the front desk for recommended drivers. We went to Chichen Itza this way, shaved at least 90 minutes off the ride, which is a lot considering it's 3 hours each way. You can also see ruins closer by. Whatever you do, make sure to visit a "cenote," an underground river. If you have little ones, make sure to take a life jacket. It's an amazing nature site. Careful who you book with because the front desk told me that con artists take your $ but then never show up. Overall, this property gives you good bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BeachyCheecky
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived to the time we left we received wonderful service and as a family vacation at Christmas there was nothing missing! Check in was a breeze and although we arrived at 12 noon and our rooms were not to be ready until 3:00 pm, they stored our luggage, gave us a place to change, gave us our braclets and directed us to the bar and lunch buffet. Our room was actually ready at 2:00 pm and Charly from the front desk was actually looking for us to give us our room keys. The rooms were adjacent which was perfect as we travelled with our 18 year old son and 16 year old daughter. The extra large king size bed was great. We both suffer from bad backs and had no problem with the firm mattress. Both kids loved their big beds. The air conditioning and tvs worked fine in both rooms. The minibar was stocked everyday. A little note to our chambermaid ensured that we received extra towels and she did wonderful towel animals or left flowers every day. The only drawback was that there was only lukewarm water between 5:00 pm and 7:00 pm as it appeared that everyone in the 492 room resort went to their rooms at that time and showered. The swim up bar was terrific. We had no problem getting a seat at the bars, the pool side lounge chairs or the lounge chairs on the beach. Everything was very clean and beautiful. the grounds were well kept. The Christmas decorations and nativity seen were beautiful. The beach was very clean and we walked quite a distance to the point and back - very safe - no peddlers. we had access to the Riu Yucatan and the Riu Tequila - both were also very beautiful and well kept. Service was excellent at all three resorts. The nightshows were great especially the ones with the dancing - there were tributes to Michael Jackson, Grease and the Movie Show - a great shout out to Luis "Chocolat" and to Cesar from the animation team. At this resort the animation team was neither too loud nor too intrusive - you participated if you wanted and were left alone if you declined. The workout facilities used by my son were at the Yuctan which was a quick and safe 5 minute walk from our resort. The disco was at the Tequila and was a very short two minute walk and my son and daughter went a few nights and had no problems. Our day trip to Xcaret National Park was beautiful - 15 minutes away by taxi. The shopping in Playa del Carmen was terrific and go to the Walmart as it has the best prices for liquor, souvenirs, and tobacco - it is a 30 minute walk from the resort or a 5 minute cab ride from the hotel at a cost of $5 US each way. The swim with the dolphins was a great way to top off our week and we did this separate from the Xcaret park so as not to lose out on our Xcaret experience. The people from Delphinus picked us up at our hotel and brought us back. For those who need their Starbucks fix there was a Starbucks right across the street from the hotel - same prices as back home! There was a small shopping area across the street - prices were higher than in Playa del Carmen but still reasonable if you bartered. The hotel had internet service available and a business centre. If you take your own computer, the lobby is the place with the best WiFi. The restaurants were terrifice - buffet breakfast until 10:00 am, continential breakfast by the beach from 10:30 am to 12 noon, Lunch from 12 to 4 and dinner from 6 to 10:30, snacks after that. We tried the Asian restaurant and the Steakhouse Restaurant a la cartes -both wonderful - yes you have to book them in the morning at the buffet restaurant but there was no problem but since we are all late diners we preferred the 8:45 pm sitting as oppose to the 6:00 pm sitting. The big Christmas dinner is done on Christmas Eve and what a spread! There was plenty to eat and yes our traditional North American Ham and Turkey was available as well as lots of fish, lamb, roast beef, ribs, caviar and a variety of salads and desserts. A big shout out to Ramiero, Marcos and Nestor who took care of us through breakfast, lunch and dinner at the buffet restaurants. The catamaran was great fun, my son had enough of kayaking with his mother, both kids loved the paddle boat. There were snorkelling, parasailing and wave running available at a fee. By North American standards this would not be a 5 star hotel but it was more of a 3 1/2 or 4 star and for the money it was well worth it. Very safe, very clean and quite enjoyable. Lots of variety at the restaurants. Make your stay more enjoyable - when you see good service reward it early on and you will be taken care of - don't overtip and don't tip every time you get a drink but watch how hard these people work and reward them accordingly as well as your chambermaid. A little kindness is greatly appreciated and you will be rewarded accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic wsrc”
Reviews.Author: wsrc
Reviews.Content: this was our first holiday this year,an awfull lot was expected.we were not dissapointed atall. the extra touches the rooms had every day put smiles on both of our faces,the entertainment and the food is often the main stay of any holiday and the first things that any body complains about,this will not be the case here, fantastic variety of food allways on offer,the entertainment team worked so hard remember its not broadway or shaftsbury avenue. the beach is fantastic lots of things going on,trips were a little expenseive if booked at the hotel a short walk into town will help this the hotel is well laid out with ready access to one and all we only visited one other hotel which was the riu club it had a night club which was right up there

Reviews.Title: “It was a fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: kovs
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Food was great. Entertainment was fabulous, Not a big resort, clean. One thing to remember if the bed is a little hard ask for a mattress pad, we found this out on our last day. We will always remember Aldo and Victor you guys will have a special place in our hearts. Bob and Judy

Reviews.Title: “A special thanks to the entertainment team !”
Reviews.Author: vanessaBoston
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a week at the Riu Playacar. I was traveling with my 5 year old daughter. We had a fantastic time there ! The rooms where very clean, the entire staff is dedicated to making your stay enjoyable. The food was very good. Simple but always good. Lots of lounge chairs around the pool and at the beach. My 5 year old had a great time at the kids club. It is true, the place is small but they do not need bigger since Jessica, organizes Olympic games on the beach, walks around the hotel etc... There is a lot of stuff to do in the small house for crafts and my daughter loved it. There is a schedule with all the activities so it is better to check before. So 2 thumbs up to Jessica, for her patience, her smile, her energy especially during the Mini Disco at 8pm. Children where waiting for that moment everyday ! A special thank as well to the entertainment staff, especially Chocolate, Choco, Jessica, Raul, the DJs and all the others. They made us laugh a lot ! The resort is alive thanks to them. You guys rock ! I will miss you ! I look forward to my next trip in March ! Vanessa

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family resort”
Reviews.Author: Schmeds
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 day trip with Apple, and though we had a hard time finally arriving in Cancun due to weather issues, it was well worth it. We knew we liked the Mayan Riviera as we visited there a few years ago and this trip just reminded us how much we loved it. And the Riu was fantastic. What stood out most to me (aside from the obvious, like the beautiful beach and pool) was the food. I usually find resort food to be low quality but not here. It was very well prepared and there was a huge selection. Nice to have so many fruits, veggies and fish options as I don't eat chicken, pork, or beef. My daughter always found something she liked on the buffet as well. In fact, the buffet was so good, that we only took advantage of the a la carte option (Mexican) one night. Keep in mind that no matter how good the food is, after so many days, you do get tired of it. But it was definitely the best of any resort we've visited. The night we went to the Mexican restaurant was my husband's birthday and the staff surprised us with a song and delicious cake-- a very nice touch. The drinks are the usual sugary pre-mixed ones, but we did find a great Pina Colada in Playa del Carmen. The beach was great and our daughter (11 yrs) liked the boogie boards, snorkelling (though there is not much to see) and the pottery painting stand near the beach. When we first arrived (late at night) the assigned us to a room in the 1000 block of rooms (first building on the right as you leave the lobby) and had to be moved because it smelled bad and it was so close the dining room. Ended up in the 4000 building and loved it. no problems. Midway b/w pool and main building. The resort is a nice size; you really don't walk far to anything and it was good for families as it was easy to keep an eye on our daughter. We only went to one show. It was so-so. A lot of lip syncing and a bit of dancing. She didn't take part in the kids programming; the area for them was pretty small and she preferred to stay with us. That beach is amazing. we loved it and will go back. Families should book here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel, great value, great resort, great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Jennyanydots
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a weeks stay at the Riu Playacar and our first visit to Mexico. After reading several reviews on trip advisor we picked this hotel as it seemed to have the best of both worlds - the Riu Playacar is the smaller quieter hotel on the Playcar complex but we also had the use of other busier Riu hotels as well (Riu Yucatan and Riu Tequila). Had read some mixed reviews but we were really, really pleased. All of the Mexican people are lovely and this hotel is great value for money. You won't be disappointed by the selection of food and drinks (including international brands if you wanted - just ask for them). Be prepared though...I had a Smirnoff Vodka and Sprite but I couldn't actually taste the Sprite!! You have been warned!! ;-)) The hotel is set within the Playacar complex and it's great because you can choose from different Riu bars and entertainment each night, still part of your all inclusive (you do have to eat your evening meals at your own hotel though). Our hotel had 3 speciality restaurants (again part of all inclusive) Steakhouse, Mexican and Asian. We tried the Steakhouse which was nice to have waiter service and be in a different setting not far from the beach. The day we tried to book for the Asian restaurant they said they were doing Asian night in the buffett restaurant that night anyway so no bookings being taken, didn't get chance to try the Mexican one unfortunately but again always loads of choice on buffett from all cuisines! There were no problems walking around the Playacar complex at night between hotels it was really safe, in fact it felt much safer than some other large European resorts we have visited. It was nice to go the busier hotels and then return to our slightly quieter hotel if we wanted. There are two pools, the noisier one which has the swim up pool bar and all the activities centre around there mainly, although no pressure at all to join in but good fun either way. The other pool is quieter but to be honest we spent most of our time on the beach. The beach, although small, was good with a mix of shady or sunny spots with sunbeds. Due to the strong undercurrent it makes it great fun to bobble about in the sea which was lovely and warm too! Just be careful to keep an eye on the flag system they have in place for when the sea is too rough to swim in, although we only saw this happen once and it was just before a rain storm. There is a lovely massage hut on the beach which is brilliant. I had a fantastic swedish massage which I thought was great value (approx 50 dollars), it added to my lovely relaxing holiday perfectly just drfiting off into relaxation with the sound of the waves crashing in the back ground! If I am being totally honest (and maybe over critical) the only slight let down of this hotel was the rooms, although exceptionally clean they are a little tired and could do with an update to make it even better but hey, you aren't there to spend time in your room. Mini Bar in the room excellent touch for when getting ready to go out at night. Also a slight aside but....for those of you like me who see hairdryer listed in the hotel detals but still take your own because the hotels are usually so rubbish, dont worry and save packing space! The hairdryers are really powerful and placed in front of a big mirror in the bathroom!! The maids are fantastic too, after cleaning the rooms spotlessly they would leave little towel animal surprises in the rooms which was good fun coming back and seeing what had been left each day. We did tip her but only a couple of dollars every few days, as and when we had change, but she worked hard and the surprises were a nice touch. Thanks again Gregoria! As we were only there for a week we only did one trip but it was great and would definately recommend it. It was the Fat Cat Catamaran trip which is just over half day spent on a lovely Catamaran with all inclusive drinks and a packed lunch on board while you sail out to a beautiful snorkelling reef. We were fortunate enough to see turtles while we were snorkelling but even without those its a beautiful reef to snorkel in anyway. On the return journey back you also stop to swim where the cenotes (underground rivers) meet the sea, a kind of lagoon style area not far from the Marina. Even if you aren't keen on the snorkelling (although would try and persuade anyone because its such a lovely reef and the turtles are fantastic to watch!!) its still lovely to just lay on the nets at the front of the boat and get a tan while you are drifting out to sea with a rum punch in your hand! The weather was mixed while we were there, a couple of overcast days but overall I hope you can tell that we had a fab holiday. If you want to know anything else just contact me and I will try and help.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar was "awesome"”
Reviews.Author: hosedragger
Reviews.Content: I need to say what a great time my family had at the Riu Playacar. The staff was extremely friendly, especially the "entertainment" staff. The food was always "wonderful" and the drinks were even better!!!! The resort was immaculate and the rooms were very nice as well. The beach was perfect and the "entertainers" always had some type of activities to do. It was such a "bonus" to be able to use the "Riu Tequila" and "Riu Yacutan" resorts as well. My teen agers loved the "Disco" bar too. Thanks for giving us the best week ever. This was our second time there in the past five years and we really think it will become an annual vacation. thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Think about it twice...”
Reviews.Author: lizjmz
Reviews.Content: I just went this summer and there were some rainy days all I wanted is to go in my room but rather stayed out in the rain than going in that room. I saw four roaches and the beds were dirty. Other than that the food was great. Shows were ok . Somewhat boring. Beach was awesome. Pool it was alright. Wouldn't go back again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: audiogalNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar is very clean, has a nice beach (not large) and clean pools.
