There is plenty of seating by the pools or at the beach, but if the hotel is full that may not be the case. There are no Palapas at the beach, but there is a shady area. The catamarans were in good shape which is not the case at all AI resorts. The food is OK/mediocre at best. Anyone who says it is wonderful has never had a really good meal!! I think that because the resort is on the smaller side there is not as much variety as you find in the larger hotels. Dinner and breakfast are only served in the main buffet. Lunch is served only at the poolside/beach restaurant. (another reviewer implied that there is nowhere informal to eat when you are by the water, but that is not true. You do need to put on shoes, but a bathing suit and a cover up are OK). You may go to the Riu Tequila or Riu Yucatan for breakfast or lunch, but not dinner. You will find basically the same food quality, though perhaps a little more variety, at these somewhat larger hotels (I looked). I ate at two specialty restaurants: The Steak House (daytime waterside restaurant dressed up at night) and the Jade Asian restaurant in the lobby. The Steak house was pretty bad though the steak was tender. The Asian restaurant was a bit better. (self serve buffet). The drinks are OK (we are not big drinkers) . The wine at all of these places is so-so. The bread is fresh and quite good. Surprisingly there were some very good desserts including Carrot Cake and Chocolate Cake. Ice cream was yummy. Lots of tasty fresh fruits and vegetables. Mexican food at the buffet was OK but bland though there are a variety of hot sauces. The guacamole and salsa were both great . You will not go hungry in any case. The rooms are fine. The beds are hard in all of these hotels. The pillows are not great. The room is attractive. It has a dressing area, toilet and shower. The shower is roomy and has good water pressure. I felt that A/C could have been cooler, though we were never uncomfortable. There is shampoo but no conditioner so bring your own. If you want to go to the spa you will have to walk to the Riu Yucatan. If you want to go to sports bar or nightclub you'll have to go to the Riu Tequila. The service is excellent and all the staff try hard to provide whatever you need. I saw no one tip, but we did. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel for the right (modest) price.

Reviews.Title: “a real surprise for the pride. A clean, smaller, charming hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: shand3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week vacation at te Riu. The service was fabulous, and all the staff was cheerful. Not one made us feel like any request was too much. The hotel is very clean, with well kept grounds and not so big that you were walking all day from beach to pool to room and food. The buffet was way above average. Very well displayed, well cooked, excellent tastes, many choices, and fresh. the shopping area in playa was fun and it was nice to be able to wander safely in the downtown area and experience some great things. It is close to the ferry to Cozumel so you can expand your horizons by taking it there. The one BIG complaint I have is that the beds are hard!!! They have a mattress to put on them if you ask at the front desk. Do that right away. the beach is really nice. even though there are huge sandbags in the water in places to try and keep the sand ON the beach, not back in the ocean. so, ignore them, or play on them, whatever, they are there to stay. There were always plenty of beachchairs to choose from and yes, topless sunbathers, but oh well.... the airconditioner was quiet and kept up nicely so the room was refreshing. Although it did take a minute for the mustiness to go away after you opened the room. but that is life in the caribbean. I was not happy that the entertainment started so late at almost 10 pm. This is not a fancy five star but is a GREAT family relaxed resort! otherwise, we loved our time there, felt rested and looked after, and are planning a trip back asap!

Reviews.Title: “Good Times @ Riu Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: b3achl0ver
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riu Playacar with my boyfriend..this being our 1st vacation together as a couple. And we absolutely loved the resort! From the moment we arrived till the day we checked out it was just superb service from staff. I've had experience already with AI resorts and already know the drill...but my boyfried was a newbie at this. And he totally enjoyed it! Special thanks to "Juarez" our waiter at the buffet restaurant..nice gentlemen who kept us entertained with his tricks during dinner-time. As well as to "Alex & Adrianna" the bartending husband & wife duo who took care of us lovely with the "scooby doos & tequila slammers" (highly recommended shots)...I personally am not a fan of big resorts..Im all about the smaller resorts because I feel you get the attention needed & you become really familiar with other fellow travelers. Food was excellent! We didn't do any of the speciality restaurants..we felt that the buffet was sufficient enough for us...plenty of food (from typical mexican dishes to seafood, etc.) The nightly shows were nice & the entertainment staff were really entertaining (shout out to Victor on taking care of us during our nightclub outing). Beach area was nice & clean. Water was just perfect. Suggestion: bring insulated mugs to keep your drinks nice & cold. Room was nice & cozy...we got a kick out of the HUGE bed (which consists of 2 full size matteresses put together) As everyone has mentioned there is that funky humid smell in the room but I came prepared & brought with me some plugins which help out. We did 2 excursions...but highly recommend the "Tulum Adventure"...its a combination of ziplining through the jungle, repelling, snorkelling in an underground river in a cave and visiting the Tulum ruins. As far as nightlife...I recommend walking around 5th Avenue in downtown PDC for souvenir shopping. In addtion, we went to Coco Bongos & Dubai...both fun dance clubs. Another recommendation for a nice couples massage - 1/hr. $35 us each..at Beauty Health Spa between 1st & 5th Ave. You cannot go wrong with the ladies at this spa. So all in all, we had an excellent time out in PDC and what made it so much better was our stay at Riu Playacar. We will definitely come back! Happy Travels Everyone! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort for adults and teenage children.”
Reviews.Author: BeachSlug
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar is a nice resort. The landscaping is beautiful. The rooms were clean and nice. The food was good. The majority of the staff was very nice. The pool was somewhat small, but nice. The beach was nice, but it did have the giant sandbags surrounding it. The complaints that I would have about the resort is the typical cancun/carribean resort annoyances such as: 1) Having to have 'beach towel cards' to trade in for clean towels. The resort states that they will charge you $20 per towel card that you don't turn in at the end of your stay. We did have a towel stolen from a nearby chair, but luckily we found an abandoned towel later to trade in for a 'towel card'. 2) The speciality restaurants have limited seating, and you must sign up for these restaurants early the morning of the evening you wish to dine. Also, not all of the specialty restaurants are open every night. The other minor complaints that I would have are: 1) The shows starting times are somewhat late; 9:45 p.m., which is late if you have kids. 2) There are no waiters/waitresses to bring drinks to you poolside or beachside. 3) There is no poolside or beachside grill, so if you want to eat lunch, you have to completely dry off and have shirt, shoes, etc. 4) The kids play area is very tiny, and the kids activity program is poor. 5) There are many topless women beachside and poolside, which did not bother us, but some families may not approve. 6) The fitness center is actually 2 resorts away, which is some distance. 7). The drive to the resort is about 1 hour from the airport, and many resorts are much closer. But, again, a very nice resort for adults and teenage children. P.S. BE WARNED of the shops across the street from the resort. Our teenage daughter and her friend were falesly accused of stealing some cheap bracelets by a small shop owner. The girls had money and have never stolen anything before. The girls offered the shopowner to search through their stuff to, but she claimed that they could have hidden the bracelets somewhere. The shop owner changed her story that the girls stole 2 bracelets, then 4, then 6, then back to 4. The local mecixan police showed up and made the girls pay $60 for the 4 bracelets (that were no where to be found), or they would go to jail. The girls had bought bracelets earlier on the trip at these shops for $5-$8, but the 'stolen bracelets' were suddenly $15 each. I have not doubt that this is a typical ploy to get money from tourists. So, Stay Away From Those Shops!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: barterwork
Reviews.Content: This exceeded our hope and dreams! From the welcome smiles, and a fruit-drink, to our incredible room (yes, it has that caribbean funk smell, but that is everywhere), the staff at the RIU just made us feel as if we were the only guests. A super clean resort, great food variety and high quality, and the staff, from check-in to check-out, made us feel SO welcome! The resort employees are very good at making you feel welcome, and the whole Mexican travel industry we experienced is OVER the top! Everything... busses, travel guides, free water... these (guys) smoke the competition! Small things, like the raked beach sand, the towel animals in our room, the personal service from the staff at EVERY point of our stay, made this trip a truly enjoyable vacation. The sun rises over 20km of beautiful sun drenched warm water, with Cozumel in the distance. The beaches are rebuilding nicely (kudos to the Mexican government for a stand-up effort on beach restoration), and the entire (protected) area of Playcar is safer than where I call home. The local people can't do enough for you, so please, be civil and considerate. What you give, is what you will get! I can't wait to return... it's THAT good!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: myfamilyof5Ontario
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 10 days at the Riu playacar. This was our 4th all inclusive and I was pleasantly surprised. There were 6 in our group, my spouse and I, a 13 year old, 9year old, 7 year old and my mom. we booked last minute and got a great deal so we did not expect what we got. This is a small, clean friendly, basic resort with great food. The a la carte restaurants were OK but the Buffet was excellent, and usually I don't like them... My kids had a great time and were able to go all over as the resort is small, the staff is friendly and helpful. We were truly able to relax and you don't spend hours walking back and forth, plus you get to know everyone!The beach is great, the pool fun. If you are looking for fancy glitz and glamor and hoping singles this is probably not for you as it is small. if you just want to relax ,or have a family and don't want to worry about you kids this resort is fabulous. We had a great time! The location is great for excursions and the 5th ave shpping and Market...

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! Really is 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Lala064
Reviews.Content: Best holiday ever! The hotel was excellent, food good with a wide choice to suit everyone and really is 24hour all inclusive! You don’t have to pay for a single other thing, they even give you fresh beach towels every day. We spent no money except for going to Coco Bong the club which is amazing. We went with the entertainment staff which get you into the VIP areas and are not dodgy in the slightest (unless you want them to be). Look out for the sandwiches at reception when you come in from the night clubs! There constantly have day time activities on and hotel is right on the beach so you wont be bored. The evening shows are ok but only on for hour or so but afterwards I recommend going across the road to the Tequila hotel which as a small disco and is still in your all inclusive. Or wait in the reception bar and the entertainment staff will take you to Coco Bong or the club next door (can’t remember its name) which are both good! I would say slightly older people could go to Coco Bong as it has shows and entertainment on where as the other on is a night club just for dancing. Only bad thing I can comment on is that the air con isnt great but works and does the tick in your room but all other aresa at night can be roasting! Loved Mexico and the Rui hotels although Playacar is without a doubt the best one! Would definitely go back tomorrow! Two 28yr old females Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jraustin
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar was great. Aldo at the front desk was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but not what i wanted”
Reviews.Author: hamccormick
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our week vacation at Riu Playacar. We had 4 people in our group - 24yrs, 43yrs, 57yrs and 60yrs. This is a small resort. It has 6 buildings for lodging, the lobby which has the restaurant, bar, small store and area where you meet your travel reps, another restaurant down by the beach area, 2 pools (medium size) and another bar next to the stage for entertainment. My biggest disappointment were the rooms. I would compare the rooms to a Motel 6. Each room has double beds pushed together. We were told they don't have king size beds like we requested. This resort appears to be an older resort. My shower had a lot of rust around the drain. There is NO tub and towels had a mildew smell. The beds were hard as a rock and the pillows weren't any better. The employees of the resort are great. Very friendly, very helpful. Our favorite was Aldo at the front desk; Daniel and Alexx at the lobby bar and Isreal (one of the activity people). The beach is BEAUTIFUL. There are chairs to relax in and catch the rays. You have all sorts of non-motorized sports and you can also pay $$$ for other activities. When you're on the beach - tops are optional. It didn't bother me but just letting you know. They have daily activities starting at 10:30 each morning. Some include - stretching, water aerobics, horseshoes, learn spanish, volleyball, waterpolo, dance lessons and more. They try to keep you busy all day. One of your activity people is Isreal. He cracked us up. They work hard to make you enjoy your visit. If you want a list of activities, look on the board by the lobby restaurant and i think there's a small list on the front desk. I saw a tennis court and know you can visit the other neighboring Riu's for things to do. Al a carte restaurant is located in the lobby restaurant. They had Steak night - Mexican night and maybe Seafood night. We only did the Steak night. Weren't really impressed with the food but that's just us. You do get salad, soup, bread, steak w/ half potato, small piece of corn and small dessert. The pools were ok - one has a swim up bar and they do some of the activites from this one. And then a smaller one that attaches to it. Lots of places to sit and recline. Some have shade. The water wasn't crystal clear like I've seen at other resorts. The food in general wasn't anything to write home about. I'm a little picky of an eater. This is my 3rd year going to Playa del Carmen area. My first year was the Barcelo Tropical - 2nd year was Sandos Playacar and now Riu Playacar. For the price comparison, I'll be going back to the Barcelo. It is higher quality - better food - bigger resort. If you want a basic resort (no frills) close to 5th Ave for shopping or catching the ferry to Cozumel, or just staying on the beach this is for you. If you want a little more luxury and attention I suggest staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Most fun vacation ever!!”
Reviews.Author: KarenMissingMexico
Reviews.Content: I have been to Mexico many times and loved it but nothing compares to this trip to RIU Playacar. The RIU Playacar has the absolutely best entertainment staff ever. They made this trip my most enjoyable. All day nonstop and every evening - you wonder when they rest!! I laughed nonstop. The bartenders and waitstaff are friendly, amusing and attentive. I will definately return many more times to the RIU Playacar. Hopefully in the near future. I was truly sad to leave there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Kebab3112
Reviews.Content: Just retured from the Riu playacar had a wonderful holiday. The hotel is great. Very Clean and well presented and excellent location. Food is good quality ( I am a veggi and still got on ok) Entertainment is OK, but worth a couple of nights out in Playa Del Carmen. Taxi will cost about £2.50 each way. There is a great little resturant called "fusion" right on the sea front good value and great food and offen a band Ask for 10 and 6 and head for the beach and you will see it). Coco Bongo well worth a visit, go with the hotel reps as you will get you a private area.

Reviews.Title: “well worth a visit you wont be dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: sue1972
Reviews.Content: the food was delicious, with good variety. 3 other restaurants to choose from. the entertainment staff worked very hard and were fun if you wanted to get involved and took no for an answer if you didn't the rooms were comfortable, the only thing i could say is the toilet needs an extractor fan the mini bar was stocked every other day but if you ran out they would fill it up without any problems. if you like diving definitely go and have a word with Demetri a lovely Greek man with lots of knowledge & skill for trips i would definitely recommend emailing Bonnie & Ed at edventure tours they are absolutely fantastic. coco bongos is an absolute must, fab fab fab. The Tequila is also a fantastic hotel but we much preferred the atmosphere at the playacar but went to the Tequila for a more buzzing night out & visited the Yucatan for the gym

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! You will absolutely love this hotel and Mexico......”
Reviews.Author: de88y
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, staff, food, cleanliness, cannot fault a single thing. Very very hot during the day and at night too, humid. Good entertainment. Visited 5th Avenue to shop, not any cheaper out there to shop or eat though. Dont bother taking Pesos, everywhere takes American Dollars. About $5 to get taxi to town and same back. Did Captain Hook Galleon trip one evening was brilliant! We have been all over the world on holiday and fell in love with Mexico totally, definitely would go back in a heartbeat..... Dont forget your $45 Dollars to leave the country, and do not have extra weight in your case when leaving! they are very strict on it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at Riu Playa Car and will go back again!”
Reviews.Author: twitwi4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the RIU Playacar with our 19 year old and 4 year old sons. We stayed there from August 21-29, 2009 and had a a great time. At first my husband and I were not sure how this vacation was going to work for us because of our children's age but the staff made our vacation possible. We are already making plans to go back next year. We were very please with the hotel especially the staff. I would like to give credit to Jessica from the kids mini club. Jessica came to me the first day while I was at the adults pool watching my son and told me that they had kids activities from 10am-12pm and then again from 3-5pm. At first I took my son and stayed with him at the kids pool because I didn't think he would want to stay without me. From that day on he would wake up in the morning and after breakfast he would ask to be taken to his "teacher Jessica's" class and with his new friends. For the afternoon class she would take them to the stage and practice with them from modeling to dancing so they could participate on stage for the night show. All the little club kids would sit together in front of the stage every night to watch the show. While my son enjoyed his time my husband and I relaxed on the pool or the beach a close distance where we could watch my son play and have fun. My 19 year old son just didn't want to come back home. My son knows spanish but limited and I was just afraid for him to go clubbing by himself. Hugo and the rest of the pool animation guys made him feel comfortable and would go with him and everyone wanting to go to clubs after the night show. They went from Coco Bongo's, Dubai, Riu Tequila (accross the street to which we had access priviledges). The RIU ANIMATION TEAM work very hard to keep all age people active with tons of activities everyday on the main pool. They also have a separate pool where people that prefer to read or relax without being disturbed could go to. THE FOOD was excellent! The buffet had variatey of food and drinks. Real homemade taste to everything from pasta to mexican food. The open restaurant close to the pool had cocktail food. They also have 3 bars through out the hotel. You see staff is constantly cleaning from rooms, restaurants, pool area and beach area. THE NIGHT SHOWS are excellent entertainment. On Friday's they have a Traditional Mexican Day where they have a Mariachi trio at the restaurant and a live Mariachi Band at the Night show. A Dance group dances to a different theme every night. My best show was the movie theme dances where they danced to the Titanic movie. They also have other traditional bands before and after the show that sing to salsa, cumbia and merengue. THE ROOM was a good size with 2 full sized beds next to each other. It has a well stocked mini bar in the room that gets refilled every 2 days but you may call the receptionist desk at anytime you wish to get it refilled. My son loved to come to the room and find a different animal made out of towels. One day he cried when he forgot his Curious George in the room and when we opened the door, there in the corner of the bed we found that the cleaning people had made a monkey friend and sat them hugging next to each other in the corner of the bed. This made my day! So in all YES, I recommend RIU Playacar for all ages. All inclusive, Free transportation to and from airport, Great staff, Nice beach next to a beautiful turquoise water, Good food, Free water sports (kayaking, pedal boat, snorkeling classes, etc...), Tons of activies in and around the pool, Great night shows, Excellent kids club, etc..

Reviews.Title: “exelent and very clean”
Reviews.Author: martin,pritchard
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel Check in is very fast with no hassle Staff are very friendly and nothing is to much trouble The food is excellent wit a wide choice to chose from The pool is very clean The beach is also quite nice And the animation team are fun they work very hard and are very good at there job if you want to get involved if not they wont bother you

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this place to anyone thinking of going to Mexico...”
Reviews.Author: G-Man68
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say almost everything about th stay was amazing. Recommend the tip to Coba Temple, although hot dring day it is well worth the view if you decide to climb. Dolphine experience good, but video rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “A place you would go back to again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Dolly124
Reviews.Content: Chill by the pool in the mornign as it is so hot and you are next to the pool bar and snack bar. Hit the beach after lunch when it is slightly cooler as it is further to walk to the bar. Try the cocktails they are just great. The trips are expensive but you have enough to do at the resort so relax and flop and drop.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: bornamermaid
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, both in our 20's, spent 5 days at the RIU playacar. All of the staff at the resort were friendly, helpful, and very appreciative of their guests. The grounds were well maintained and clean. THe rooms were extremely clean and the air conditioner was definitely working!! It was quite and relaxing. The small size of the resort lent itself to creating a very cozy and relaxing atmosphere. We especially liked that we could use all of the facilities in the RIU Tequila and RIU Yucatan, except for dinner. Each RIU is different in its own way and you can hop from one to the other depending on your mood and interests. FOOD: The food was great. The breakfast buffet was the best. They have great natural fruit juices as well as an omellete station. Lunch was also great, including the ocassional BBQ on the beach. Snacks were available between all meals. The buffet dinner, in our opinion, was better than the only ala carte dinner (the steakhouse) we tried. The steakhouse was average, but we still enjoyred it because it was nice eating by the beach. The buffet had a variety of option even during theme nights. The service from the waiters was great as well. Even if you get hungry in the middle of the night you can get snacks at the sports bar located at RIU tequila across the street. POOLS and BEACH: Most people seem to linger in the pool with the bar where they have alot of activities held by the entertainment team. If you want to sit by a quiet and relaxing pool then you have the option to hang around the other pool next to it. However, you also have access to the RIu yucatan and Riu Tequila pools which seem to be more lively and louder. The beach in front of the RIU Playacar was amazing. There were plenty of chairs and it was never crowded. The water was always warm and you could swim with fishes. DRINKS & ENTERTAINMENT: We took full advantage of the unlimited access to the bars in all three resorts. The drinks were great and definitely not watered down. We loved the minibar in the room even though we never used it because we preferred to go get drinks at the bar in the lobby which was open 24 hrs. We also enjoyed the Pinata bar at the RIU tequila one night, as well as the sports bar there. The nightly shows were great at the RIU playacar, but we preferred the ones at the RIU Tequila. Since the RIU PLayacar seemed to become very quite after dinner and had little night life, the Tequila was the place to be after dinner. However, if given the option again we would still stay at the RIU Playacar because of its small size, cozy atmosphere, relaxing environment, and great service. We would recommend going to the Tequila for nightlife, but returning to a less crowded and more quite resort at the Playacar to get a good night sleep. Overall, we thought the location of the resort was perfect because it is a 5 min ride away from Playa del Carmen terminal. In addition, the little shopping center in front of the resort has everything you need (i.e. souvenirs, pharmacy, calling cards, etc). TRANSPORTATION: Before taking the trip I thoroughly researched methods of transportation from the airport. Even though private shuttles seem to be quite affordable because of the safety they offer, Playa del Carmen was very safe in our opinion. We opted for taking the ADO bus right outside the airport. The buses leave once every hour and costs 9 pesos, which is super cheap. The buses were super comfortable, fast, and safe. The bus left us right on 5th avenue at the ADO bus terminal. As soon as you come out of the terminal you see a cab stop where you can take cabs that are licensed by Playa. All of their cars are the same and labeled. From there you can take a cab for 50 pesos to RIU playacar. EXCURSIONS: We definitely recommend booking an excursion with Edventure Tours. We spent an entire fun filled adventurous day with a small group of people and a great guide for only 100 dollars (not including tip and lunch). They picked us up early at our hotel. We visited the Tulum ruins and had enough time to take a swim in the beach there to cool off. We were then taken to zip line and jump off a cliff into a natural pool with fish. They also took us snorkeling to the Dos Ojos cenotes. After that we had lunch at a great restaurant on the beach. After the beach the rest of our group went to snorkel with turtles, but we waited for them on the beach and took a nap on the hammocks. Being that the you have the option to customize the tour according to your interests we opted for not doing the turtles. The day ended with snorkeling in a lagoon that had a ton of wonderful and colorful fish. This was def the highlight of the day. For an extra 15 dollars we had the guide take our pictures with his waterproof camera, and were given a dvd with pics at the end of the day before we were taken to our hotel. This was def the best place to book an excursion with. We had wonderful expriences, great service, and found it to be very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Still LOVE the RIU playacar”
Reviews.Author: travilin1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our SIXTH visit at the RIU Playacar. We always have a great stay and the staff takes excellent care of us. I don't understand how so many people can write negative comments about this resort!!! The front desk is very helpful. We got upgraded to a junior suite for free when we checked in. We booked our vacation through Orbitz, and the rep was never in the lobby. The front desk was very helpful and called the Orbitz rep and arranged a meeting for us. We really enjoyed our room upgrade. The junior suites have much more room than the standard rooms, and they have a bathtub. The beds are a little bit hard and the pillows are a little flat. All we had to do was call and have more pillows sent to us, and there was no problem. Now for something a lot of people have questions about, the BEACH! We were very surprised on this stay at the RIU Playacar, we were used to the beach being a little smaller and having more sandbags with each visit, but the sandbags are working and the beach had built up a lot from our last stay!!!! The food is always great at the riu. All of the restaurants are delicious! I'd have to say the Mexican and the Asian are my favorite though. There are so many different options for food here, i don't see how you could go hungry here!! I defiantly recommend trying the banana smoothie they have at breakfast and the butter pecan ice cream at the dinner buffet! I wish I had some right now!!! The entertainment staff always has something go on, usually around the pool. We had a lot of fun playing games with the animacion staff throughout our stay. The shows at night we very entertaining. The animacion staff also organizes nights out to clubs in Playa del Carmen. All in all, the resort is incredible. My family and I have visited 6 times, and this visit certainly won't be our last. Ignore the bad reviews, the Playacar is an amazing resort. If you have any other questions about the Playacar, or Playa del Carmen, feel free to message me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast and so will you!”
Reviews.Author: bkmck
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must say I am shocked by some of the unpleasant comments written by some dissatisfied customers. This resort was basically everything I could have asked for and more. It was worth the price and so much more. Sure, this Riu might not be as extravagant as Tequila, Yucatan, etc. But I liked its quaint and mellow vibe. It captured the interest of all travelors: if you are with family, the resort is very family friendly and has tons of activities/shows for children to get involved; if you are wanting peace and quiet, you can definitely get that; if you want excitement and partying, they have activities and bars geared for you (not to mention that 5th Ave has night life such as Senor Frogs and Carlos-N-Charlies). The staff is very prompt and respectful. I was given help whenever I needed it, they refilled the fridge, towels, and anything else. The rooms were very clean; however, the outside of the rooms were not as clean as they could have been, but still nothing disgusting. The only negative about the rooms was the echoing. If you wanted really good sleep it might be difficult if someone is drunk at 3:00am screaming for about an hour (this only happened once so it was not an ongoing occurance). This was not only my first trip to Mexico, but also my first trip out of the States. I was given several lectures before traveling because it was just me and my female friend going together. Honestly, I felt more safe at this resort than I do sometimes in America. The staff is incredibly respectful and want to make sure you have a great time. Plus, I felt like I dived into another world...this area is so diverse with tourist so it was a lot of fun. Overall, if you dont have much money but want an excellent beach view, then this is the place to go. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: rosie0806
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with my partner between 13th - 27th November 2007. We had never been to the Caribbean before but fancied having a special holiday. We decided on Riu Playacar as at the time I worked in a travel agent and my manager had been a rep in the area. We were attracted to the fact that it is the smaller of the three hotels. Our room was nice and clean. I was a bit nervous about the beds after reading the reviews but was pleasantly surprised. Yes, they're not like your bed at home but they weren't a problem. I think the minibar was restocked every other day. The fridge contained water, different types of pop and obviously corona. Throughout our stay, all the staff were fantastic. We were told that we would get more attentive service in the restaurant if we tipped one of the waitors a higher tip to start with. However, we found that he then expected a higher tip every night and got a bit mardy to start with! Other than that, all the staff couldn't help you enough. The animacion team were brilliant and full of energy. One of the boys in particular took a shine to my boyfriend which I enjoyed winding him up about. They were always friendly, going out of their way to find out your name and getting everyone to join in the activities. It can get a bit annoying after a while but I found that pretending to be asleep when they were on their rounds usually worked. We did a couple of the trips available. Would recommend the night out in Cancun but I would have preferred longer in coco bongo rather than moving on to pat o'briens. We also went swimming with the dolphins, manatees and sea lions. It was an amazing experience and since then I love manatees. Everyone says how ugly they are but I don't think you can understand until you've met them! It was also nice to walk into Puerto del Carmen which was a lot bigger than I thought. It was nice to look around the shops and have a few drinks. Only went at night once as we figured we had already paid for the we could drink at the hotel! The miami vice drinks were amazing. Didn't think the drinks were watered down. The tequila definitely wasn't as I had to spend a day in the room with a hangover one day! We have discussed going back to this hotel, we are considering it for our honeymoon as we also got engaged on this holiday. Would definitley recommend for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Is Riu Playacar the perfect resort? No, but still a great value and a great time!”
Reviews.Author: adnicole
Reviews.Content: Before booking, I carefully read all reviews before deciding between all the hotels within my price range. I decided on the Riu Playacar based on Riu's reputation, and, well, the beach photos provided. I had an idea for what my friend and I were getting ourselves into and knew what to expect, such as: stay on top of getting towels and the minibar stocked, and the staff will do the same. They always took care of whatever we requested in a timely manner. We were also expecting a hot room, based on complaints about the A/C, and got the opposite, we woke up cold often. As far as cleanliness of the property goes, it is not immaculate, but the staff does work hard and any rust, etc. is likely a result of the ocean air. While the pool did seem to get a tad dirty, our room was always really clean. Overall, the staff, drinks, and food was good and we were never hard up for entertainment at the property or nearby 5th Avenue. For those of you who are young and looking for an affordable getaway with friends, this is a good place to go. There seemed to be something for everybody, regardless of age. If low-key is your style, it is quiet enough for you, if you like to party, the lobby bar stays open all hours and so does Playa itself. Also this is a small resort, therefore if you like a more intimate feel, this resort may be for you. All in all, we had a great time, and I would be willing to stay at the Playacar again. Could it have been better? Of course. Was it a bad hotel? Absolutely not. If you go expecting a good time with a couple quirks here and there, the staff is ready to serve you!

Reviews.Title: “The worst resort ever”
Reviews.Author: MemphisJal123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Riu Playacar because we had been to a Riu Resort before and had a wonderful experience. The Riu Playacar is more like a 1 star hotel than a 3 or 4 which I saw on the internet. First the man at the reception desk was rude then we discovered that there were no bellman. We had to drag our bags up to the third floor with no air conditioning. The room was smelly and the air conditioning didn't work. We asked them to check it while we were at lunch (which was terrible) which they didn't. When we got back we called again and they changed the thermostat. That did not make a difference. We went to the desk and spoke to the manager who assured us that it was working but that they could not lower the temperature any more because they had rules about that. We asked to be moved to another Riu property but they could'nt do that because the reservation desk was closed for the night! The room did not cool off all night. The next day I called our travel agent who switched us to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (which is wonderful). We were to pay the difference, which at this point was fine because we were so miserable. We later found out through our travel agent that the Riu Playacar had had so many complaints that they were going to cover the extra cost for our move. She also found out that they had had air conditioning problems for two months so the manager had lied to us. We are apprciative of the fact that they covered our upgrade but this resort should not be rated above a 1 star. In conclusion, The Riu Playacar had these issues: The food was terrible, room dirty and smelly, the drawers in the dresser were broken, the pool was dirty and was not cleaned over night, the receptionist was very rude when we checked in and the air conditioner did not work even when they said it did! I highly recommend the Riu Palace resorts. They are beautiful, clean, courteous staff and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable, smelly and boring. Go to RIU Tequila instead.”
Reviews.Author: daytripperyeahyeah
Reviews.Content: I'm the kind of person who's just as happy backpacking and staying in a bare-bones youth hostel as I am kicking back at a five-star resort. And yet I was so disappointed with this middle-of-the road resort. Aside from well-groomed grounds, a nice beach and some friendly/hardworking staff, I have nothing good to say. Our room was musty and moldy the entire time. I have terrible allergies, and woke up congested every morning. We complained; they sprayed the room; the smell lingered. Our showerhead was broken, and the shower didn't drain well. We complained three times, and they never fixed it. One morning two people from the front desk called our room three times from 7:30 to 7:45 while my friend and I were trying to sleep. They asked if our doorknob needed to be fixed. (No, no, no.) When we complained in person, they denied it, apologized and said they were probably prank calls. The food was absolutely terrible. My friend's regular diet consists of kid food (hamburgers, pizza, french fries, etc.), and even she was disgusted. I eat everything, and I never had a satisfying meal. The Tequila had the same food, but it was much better. The pool is old, dirty and badly in need of renovation. It is SO BORING. There is nothing to do. The entertainment is so-so. If you're in your 20s or if you have kids, go to the Tequila. The pool at the Tequila is great, there are lots of activities and the entertainment was so much fun. It's not on the beach, but there's a big golf cart that takes you to a nice-sized beach next to the Playcar. If you're on a budget and just want a fun, decent place to stay, please choose the Tequila or another resort.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. TERRIBLE RESORT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindseyc24
Reviews.Content: Hello my name is Lindsey Cansler and I recently traveled through US Airways to Playa Del Carmen, Mexico and stayed at the resort Riu Playacar. Needless to say this was one of the worst vacations I, my family, and friends have ever been on. When we arrived to the hotel they told us the check in time was 3:00 so we patiently waited for an hour until 3:00pm. When I went to the desk they still weren't ready for us to check in. In the meantime I see other people being checked in so I'm wondering why are we having to wait out in this heat. So while we're sitting and sweating to death and can't wait to get to our room with air conditioning, we had to wait for about another 30-45 min. Finally we get checked into our rooms and the first thing my mom sees when she gets to her room is a toilet pulled out from the wall with some man in her room trying to fix it. So we were told it was ok to check in and then my mom's room doesn't have a working toilet. The man just leaves the room and doesn't say what's going on. Then we all notice that none of the air conditiong (a/c) in all 3 rooms doesn't work. The next thing we notice is that all the rooms smell like a sewer the bedsheets smell like mildew. So I go back to the front desk to let them know what's going on. They let my mom switch rooms and tell us they will send someone to fix the air. At this point I call my travel agent Kasey Davis (Mann Travels, hickory, NC) to tell her what is going on. I couldn't stay on the phone long because it costs 99 cents per min to call home from my cell phone. We end up getting disconnected and I didn't get to speak to her anymore. Then the manager tells me he is calling US Airways because I want to switch hotels at this point. The lady on the phone was speaking Spanish which I do not understand. I asked her to give me someone who spoke English and then she hung up on me. So I guess the manager thought telling us he would give us another room with air the next day would make everything ok. So the whole first day was wasted trying to get a room without a sewer smell and a/c. So the next day we go back up to the front and they let us check out our new rooms before we packed up all of our stuff to move. The rooms were exactly the same as the ones we were in. So for 5 days we had to live with mildew sheets and no a/c and rude management who could have cared less whether we were satisfied. I wouldn't go back to this place if it was given to me for free. I don't know what you can do for me but something needs to be done or compensated for the amount of money we spent on our first vacation out of the country. Nobody should ever be referred to this resort

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: beach_ready_tx
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to the Playacar in the past two years, and it was wonderful. The food at the Playacar is the best of any resort I've stayed (including the Riu Palace Riviera Maya). I definitely recommend the night buffet over the gourmet restaurants. The gourmet restaurants are very good, but, you won't get anything there that you can't get at home. At the buffet I had calamari (sauteed and fried), oysters on the half-shale (with an incredible sauce), octopus, delicious soups, and, great fruits and veggies. The beach is large and not crowded. There is ample shade from coconut trees. Likewise, there is ample shade around the pool. The service at the bars was excellent. The staff does a good job of offering activities (water aerobics, volleyball, soccer, water basketball and more). The nightly shows are a little cheesy--but fun! The Michael Jackson Tribute had lots of people up dancing!! The resort is doing a major upgrade on its air conditioning and I had to change rooms when I first arrived, because the one I initially was in had a temperature of 84. After the move, I had no problems. The water pressure was good (as it's always been). The cleaning crew and the staff that restocks the mini-fridge were excellent. And, there were six single women for every single guy; what more could a boy want? I go to Playa 5-6 times a year, and I've never had a bad stay at a Riu. Also, the Playacar now has free wireless Internet in the lobby. It's very fast (I'm guessing G or N band)! Finally, if you're a diver, check out Phantom Divers in town. They are 35% cheaper than the folks at the hotel, and Charlie is the best Dive Master I've ever gone out with (and I have over 300 dives).

Reviews.Title: “Tristan,s dream holiday!”
Reviews.Author: LadyJEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family the first 2 weeks in July. Our ages range from 16 years to 69 years so we knew we had to find something special to suit everyone! I would say we are quite well travelled (we are the Patriach and Matriach of the group!) so it was down to us to choose the perfect holiday - taking into account cost / places to visit etc: We had visited Mexico 10 years ago and stayed at a Riu hotel so we sort of knew what to expect. We were not disapppointed - everyone had a wonderful time! If we were picky we would refurbish the rooms' but this is not a Riu Palace hotel and we didn't pay Palace hotel prices. The gardens were immaculate - a definite plus for us gardeners! We have never been to a hotel with better staff - every one of them were marvellous! In our view this is what makes a perfect holiday! Our grandson Tristan was one of our group. He has special needs and it isn't always easy for him to 'fit in'. At this hotel he had the most wonderful time of his life! The staff were amazing - including him in every activity and game and helping him out in the dining rooms and at the bar. On his behalf we would like to thank everyone, staff and guests who were also staying at the hotel, for making this a holiday he will never forget! Just as a foot note - we took lunch at the other Riu hotels and we had no problems!

Reviews.Title: “Funtastic”
Reviews.Author: ntsmom45
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my teenage daughter in July of 2009. There was a lot of activities to keep her busy at the pool while mom stayed at the beach. The nightly actvivites were fun as well! Service was awesome, at the bar and at the restaurants ( tipping makes everyone happy). The buffets were good ( different menus nightly). Shopping was across the street which is very convienent and the prices are fair. The beds are hard, but ask at the front desk for a foam mattress pad ( it will save your back). We will be coming back to see the staff as well as the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing holiday, faultless”
Reviews.Author: Fairy711
Reviews.Content: Firstly a lot of people have been saying how the air conditioning wasn't working well, this is not true our room was very cool all day long especially if you combined it with the fan. My fiance feels the heat and he used to come back to the room to get out of the heat for a while. This was out first time in Mexico and we have fell in love with the place. Upon arrival we were greeting by Aldo who was very pleasant, provided us with a drink and relevant information to get our holiday underway. The hotel is beautiful very picturesque and the staff are more than welcoming. The beach is amazing with its turquoise sea, you really feel in paradise. There is a good variety of food which was of a high standard and the room was very clean. As an all inclusive you expect good entertainment to produce a buzzing atmosphere and this hotel certainly delivers. Daytime and evening entertainment was superb and for those who don't like early nights you have to try coco bongo in Playa Del Carmen, it was an experience. The location of the hotel was good just over the road from the plaza shops and a 30 mins walk or 5 mins taxi ride to Playa del Carmen where you can buy your souvenirs cheaper. Overall the holiday was an amazing 2 weeks, would recommend this to anyone who likes to have a great hotel, buzzing atmosphere and beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to book my next trip to the Riu!”
Reviews.Author: Mexicofan2009
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this resort. My husband & I have been going to Mexico for more than 10 years and have stayed at various other resorts. We definitely rank this resort in the top 3 and this resort has become our Playa Del Carmen destination. It is a small resort and easy to get around. Not more than 5 minutes walk to the lobby, beach, pool or resturants. We were greeted immediately and given a welcome drink and our bags were taken to our room within 10 mins. The staff is freindly and helpful. The resort was about 40% full. We met people from all over the US & Europe. ROOMS: The Rooms are nice, with a stocked fridge and bar. They provide soap, shower gel and shampoo. AC isn't the greatest, but we found if you close the blackout drapes and kept the fan running during the day, we could keep the room comfortable. The beds are very firm, but we're used to that and had no trouble sleeping. The room was cleaned each day and the fridge refilled every other day. They made different towel creations every day which was a nice touch. FOOD: The food was really good. And we've eaten at a lot of different resorts, so we understand resort food. The buffet has plenty of selections every night and the food is probably one of the best we've had at a resort. They opened one ala carte resturant per night and you need to make reservations at the coffee station in the buffet resturant in the morning. We did the Steak resturant. It was well presented, and tastey. Don't expect a 2" thick fillet mignon, but I had the sirloin (rare) which was good and could cut it with a butter knife. DON'T BE LATE! These are timed dinner events and if you get there after they serve the 1st course, they may not seat you. ENTERTAINMENT: WOW! The entertainment staff work so hard! Hello to Hugo, Chuy, Isreal. There is always something going on... darts, horseshoes, ping pong, bocce ball. You can participate as much as you want to. At the main pool, there will be water aerobics, water volleyball, water polo, water games, trivia bingo, etc, etc, etc. If you want quiet, go to the quiet pool. The pool bartenders are excellent, quick to smile and join in on the fun! Watch out for water spray from the bar! They'll make the drinks to your liking, you just have to ask nicely. Ola to Santiago, Nelson, Polo, and Felix - they are the best! And our favorite La Cumbia Bar waitress - Adriana. Behind that sweet smile lurks a real prankster! The nightly shows are very well done. Do not miss the comedy night. I laughed so hard my sides hurt! GENERAL: In general, this was a good, small resort and we loved it. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place..Fantstic People..Fantastic Food..Fantastic Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: KEMP-KLAN
Reviews.Content: Great Holiday, Highly recomended.Fully inclusive as stated,optics in room fridge with beer and soft drinks..almost 6 hr delay in total on our flight,supposed to leave at 9am then put back to 12.00 when we got to airport delayed untill 2.40pm so was stressed when we eventually got there 9.45pm mexico time..approx 11hr flight..stress soon releived as booking in was easy and hassle free and free cocktail and restaurant kept open for us..FOOD:-Great food cant complain,a vast choice to much infact lol..quality of food was very good, we went to the yucatan to compare & there was no comparison the food at the playacar was far superior by quality and choice..ROOMS:-Found rooms a little tired, exraction fan in toilet didnt work atall & aircon is adequate but not brilliant,mosquitoes a real problem in room so suggest you take a repellant spray to use before you go out for the evening so when you come back you will have a mozzy free night.(top tip) before entering room bang on door & watch mozzies fly off or they will enter the room with you, the room itself is very clean and the maids take huge pride in there work so I must say our room was made up everyday to a high standard. Beds are rock solid but if you ask at reception they will supply you with a sponge like matress at no extra cost .....BEACH:-Beautiful, loads of sun beds and water sports,nobody hasseling you to buy there items, I spotted 2 people selling Jewellry,but they just asked and went no hassle atall, the sea is turquoise and so clear but always has life guards on duty..There is black sand bags around to stop errosion of the beach but these also stops the bigger waves crashing through so would say this is a safe beach but be aware of the undercurant hence the red flags,they will still let you swim with the red flag but not as far as you could...Pool:-3 pools all very clean,main one is activity so can be very busy this is also where the Jacuzzi is located & pool bar is,never found it a problem being served as always about 3 staff on duty,the 2nd pool is similar size very quiet,ideal if you want to read and relax as the staff dont go round this side to ask if you want to join in the games they just leave you to relax & enjoy 3rd pool is a tiny splash pool for the really young ones ideally situated next to the beach and the childrens playground..TRIPS:-Reps will tell you not to book with anyone else but with them,but if you want value for your peso/dollar you would be well advised to either cross the road and talk to the local people selling trips or for 50 pesos/$5 thats about £3.50 get a taxi to 5th Avenue and get your trips sorted out down there & save your self alot of money.5th avenue is Brilliant full of bars clubs expensive and not so expensive shops, great restaurants ask at hotel for a taxi its safe quick & reliable, by the time they put the phone down the Taxi will be there under a minute, brilliant service....or if you are feeling that energetic how about walking to 5th Avenue would take you about 25 minutes but in that heat I would personaly take the airconditioned cab myself...xcaret a must tour is an eco park where you can swim in underground rivers etc there is so much to do here will seriously need 2 days but as its only up the road from playacar its a real easy option...if excitment is your game try the speed boat tour and be james bond for a day its fast and furious and brilliant fun and a word of warning, when they take you to your snorkeling area there is no platform to get off, you just slide off your speed boat so no platform to get back on and trying to get back into your speedboat takes a little perseverance so not for the panicky or the person with no upper body strength but still a great trip...If you fancy the night life there is a barcrawl trip to cancun where they take you to 4 clubs the last one being the famous coco bongos where the film THE MASK was filmed...I wouldn't bother on this trip please dont waste your money, They pick you up outside your hotel at 7.15 pm it takes about an hr and a half to get there, its gone nine before you get in the 1st club which aint all that great, its not untill you get to go to coco bongos does it start to get good about 12.00am then by the time your are getting warmed up you have to meet back at the coach at 1.15am for your long journey back in the coach of another hr and a half....someone chucked up in the coach so the smell was just awful so i suggest this....Group of you all get a taxi for about 9.00 they do about 10 seater taxis all chip in....wont take an hr and a half in a taxi not they way they drive,Coco Bongos show doesnt start untill 10.30.... tickets for COCO BONGOS..sunday mondays tuesdays wednesdays are $50 u.s and thursday friday saturday are $60 u.s...or if you fancy the club and not the drive COCO BONGO has just opened a new club in playa del carmen a little smaller than the one in cancun by just as wild and did i mention all your drinks are included in that price aswell.....getting back to the hotel...The annoying bad bits:- ANTS EVERYWHERE AROUND THE POOL....little bleeders and they nip..Mosquitoes,i have never been bitten so many times..Lizards(IGUANAS) cute to look at but they are wild animals people so dont feed them,more important dont drop food in the open air restaurant as you may find them around your feet as they do seem to like chips lol..BIRDS..they have no fear and have a tendency to go for your chips or spaghetti in the open air restaurant lol....WINE...They seem to keep it way to long in a plastic jug so the majority of the time it has oxidised and only tastes good if poured on chips if you get my drift, so what we did instead of getting wine from the bar they allowed us to get it from the actually wine barrel it self that is located in the turgesa bar and restaurant and that was actually very nice....These are the only things i can seriously think to moan about but apart from those few trivial things its a fantastic place to holiday I would go again in a heartbeat....Almost forgot DONT!!....Whatever you do come here in the American Spring Break unless you are one of those who are on it as it can get exceptionally loud as the young Americans who cant drink over there come here because the drinking age is 18 so be aware and ask your travel agent when spring break is before booking this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but the air conditioning doesn't work”
Reviews.Author: pcnj
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar is a nice, smaller hotel. The service is great (entertainment, wait staff in the restaurants) and it has a great pool with the beach very close by. My only complaint is that the air conditioner did not work well and our room was not only warm but also very damp. I liked the hotel a lot but probably would not go back because of the air conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless - enjoyed every moment”
Reviews.Author: dominican999
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 29th June 2009 for 7 nights only, staff wonderful and extremely polite and helpful (even if you didn't tip). We only ever tip on the last day! Food and hygiene fantastic and plenty to eat and drink - all inclusive. Not one for the animation teams etc but that's just us, so we tended to stay in the top pool or on the beach most of the time. Very dissapointing trip to Chimin Itza, coach drive was 3.5 hours each way at a cost of $99 each, which th guide made no bones about saying that it didn't include tips and was expecting more than bell boy tips for the effort they put in (I think it's called a job over here!!). Anyway apart from the ruins the place is infested with flea markets which obviously they forget to put in the brochures, really made the day hard work, don't mind them earning a crust but maybe outside the seventh wonder of the world (unless thay were it). Maids were brilliant and they did a model of a different animal or bird out of the towels they refreshed everyday, and left on the beds with flowers and petals surrounding their creation. Apart from the mini bar fridge which was nicely stocked, the rooms also boasted an optics bar with brandy, vodka, whisky and rum. These they told us would be replaced or topped up every two days but weren't. I questioned this twice with reception, it was duly noted and then not actioned on. I wouldn't have minded if they hadn't made such a big thing about it on arrival. That said we would definately go back again, although I must say it was the hotel and staff that swung it for me and not the beach, would sooner be in the Dominican, hands down for that. So maybe a RIU hotel in the Dominican would be perfect. Anyway thanks to all the staff at RIU Playacar but where's my mini-bar optics? I had to go out of the room to get pissed, shocking!!! :-)) There are plenty of places however to get drinks, including the "swim up" bar in the lower pool, where the animation team worked during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing holiday, didn't want to come home!”
Reviews.Author: paamx
Reviews.Content: Date of holiday: 12-26 June Weather: very humid, sunny with occasional rain. Value for money: excellent So where to start?!?! Travel: We travelled from Glasgow airport to Cancun Airportwith thomson holidays. Luckily everything went without a hitch, no delays or anything. The only problem we had was a rowdy wedding party on our plane which was a bit testing as we were stuck with them for the full 10hours! We arrived at the airport and had to fill out little forms regarding swine flu and then it was straight to immigration. Ive flew to America several times so i assumed it would be as long and strict as it is there but i was wrong. I think we queued for 10mins and that was that. We had our temperatures taken and handed in the health forms and then went through to baggage area. I think we were just having some extreme luck because our cases were there as soon as we got there! When you get to customs you put your case through xray machine...make sure you do it one by one as they get a bit pissed off if too many people are trying to get their bags through. You press a button and they randomly select whos bag gets searched. My suitcase got searched. It was a bit of a joke to be honest as they opened the case, peered in and then let me go. Once through customs do not stop to talk to anyone. There are sooo many people trying to sell timeshares and as long as you dont stop they dont tend to bother you. After them you then have to deal with the guys who take your cases to your bus. We didnt get a chance to say no thanks and straight away that was us spending our money on tips (we tipped 2 dollars). The transfer from the airport took just over an hour and was fine although the driver expects a tip as well. Reception: The reception staff were lovely and when you go to check in you get given a cold drink which was rather tastey! You get a little leaflet with a map of the playacar resort and it has restaurant opening times on it as well. Checking in took us about 10mins. Oh and the best bit... you get your bags taken to your room for you, so no lugging your 20kg cases up 2 flights of stairs! Accommodation: We stayed in block 6 on the top floor. Our room was nice. 2 double beds pushed together, small table and 2 chairs, tv, wardrobe, ironing board and iron, hair dryer, shower, toilet and most importantly minibar! The beds are hard yes , but i found it quite comfortable so no complaints there. Our room was cleaned everyday and we tipped the maid $5 at the start of our first week and then another $7 for the rest. I quite like sittin on the balcony at night usually but theres no light out there so you can't sit and read a book. Worst complaint ever there but i was really struggling to find any faults with the accomodation which is unusual because i usually moan about everything! Pool and Beach: They had 2 pools. One was the quiet one and the other was the one with the bar in it. Guess where i was for the 2weeks? haha nah the second pool had games and stuff going on in and around it which gave you something to watch whilst you sunbathed. We always headed down to the pool around 10 and got sunbeds easily, although sometimes you had to settle for ones without shade but it wasnt that bad. The beach had sooo many sunbeds at all times of the day. The water is so blue and clear, it looks fake its that nice! The massive sand bags are visible but dont ruin the scenery at all, in fact i felt slightly safer that i couldn't float out to really deep water cause of them. We took part in some activities around the pool and beach because you start to feel bad saying no to the entertainment team all the time. I hate all that guff but i actually enjoyed taking part. I took part in aqua aerobics, water polo and water volleyball, don't think i've laughed so much in my life! We also took out some boogie boards to float around the sea on. The guys at the beach water sports area aren't so friendly and dont speak that much english. My boyfriend took out a jetski which are quite pricey but if you haggle with them for more time they usually give in. Food: Food was good. Im pretty fussy whereas my boyfriend will eat anything, but for a change there was soo much that i liked. The breakfast was definately the best meal of the day,ive never ate so much in my life! There was always food even if you turned up 10mins before it was due to shut. We didnt go to any of the a la carte restaurants because we found that the night after a restaurant the buffet one had same food as the night before. Entertainment: The guys work so hard. 6 days a week 10am-11:30pm and they still go out partying! Im not a fan of going to watch the evening shows that hotels put on but i decided to go anyways and they weren't that bad. Most nights they had dancers on and it got a bit repetitive but one night they had a Miss Riu competition which was hysterical and the entertainment team done a few comedy shows. We went out with the entertainment guys and other guests 2 nights in our stay. The first time was to Dubai club which cost $10 for women and $35 for men but it was an open bar and we had our own personal table and waiter. It was like nothing you see back here in scotland. Then 2 nights later we went to coco bongos up at 5th avenue. It was more pricey at $50 each but totally worth it.I didnt finish a single drink as i kept getting handed fresh drinks. Well worth a visit. Excursions: We only done 2 as they are quite expensive and we were having so much fun sitting around the pool we didn't actually want to go out that much. We done the Jungle Tour excursion. It was an hour journey to cancun and then we got our life jackets and snorkel gear and we were away. My boyfriend drove the speedboat out following our tour guide and then we stoppped for 45mins for a snorkel. I drove on the way back. It was so much fun, laughed the whole way back!I would recommend this to anyone, unless your scared of water. We done the Cancun Bar Crawl but didn't have that much fun as the nights out in playacar. It was too hot,too noisy and way too blackpool pleasure beach. 5th Avenue: $5 in a taxi or 50 pesos. Shops are slightly more varied and theres lots of food places and bars. We went out for our dinner on our last night to a place called fusion which is down on the beach. Amazing food and they have live music and you can sit on the beach and eat your dinner. We got starters and main course and 5 drinks between us and it came to around £35. There is a bar which we didn't go to but wish i had that has swings around the bar,looked interesting and fun especially after a few! General: We had one problem in the 2 weeks we were there. Someone had obviously had to much to drink and woke us up at 3am by shouting and being sick in the block we were staying in. i phoned reception and within 20mins the problem was sorted. The next day when we came back up to our room we had an apology note from Riu and a small bottle of tequila. It seems that the riu staff will do anything and everything to make their guests stay as good as possible. You could also use the amenities at other riu hotels which include a gym,nightclub,spa,sports bar........the list is endless,too much to do to be bored! Can't wait to go back to mexico and probably this hotel! Would recommend it to anyone, friends, relatives, strangers! haha It suits any age, im 19 and my partner is 21 and we had a blast but older couples will love it and the same with families.

Reviews.Title: “just ok -- would probably not go back”
Reviews.Author: northjerseygirl123
Reviews.Content: this review is almost a year late, but better late than never. i went to riu playacar last august with a bunch of girls for my friend's bachelorette party, and we were split up 2-3 per bedroom. pros: the buffet by the pool (in particular, the pico de gaillo) the breakfast buffet the lobby the bar in the lobby the location relative to the spa location relative to the beach the pool friendly staff/ bartenders cons: the bedroom sheets felt muggy themed dinners were not all that great watered down drinks the pool was so far from all of the rooms... i wasn't crazy about how the space was set up. no room service late at night overall, it was a nice getaway with my girlfriends, albeit we seemed to be the only all-girls' group -- everyone else was either part of a family or couples -- but i wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “One heck of a brilliant holiday!!!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireHolidaygirl
Reviews.Content: from start to finish, this was an excellent holiday. stepping off the plane, transfers, check-in, staff service, room, food, trips, entertainment....all amazing. The staff couldnt do enough for us. You wont be let down if you go to this hotel/resort...we loved it. Theres plenty to do or just relax on the beautiful beach..its a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time of My Life!”
Reviews.Author: mexic0sun
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel. the service was awesome the food was good and the staff was friendly. i would go back in a second. better then any other hotel i have ever stayed at. worth its 5 stars for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LisboaMonica
Reviews.Content: Just a few tips: Don`t miss: the AI - great; Xel-há (the most amazing water palce I`ve ever been); Mariachis; a walk along the beach at night; the hotel shows at night ; Chichén-Itza and Tequilla Bum-bum. A dive... Don`t go for ... missing mexico! I´ll be back, for the 3rd time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star, Resort is in need of some work. Will not go back!”
Reviews.Author: MrcleanMichigan
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the resort. The first time was about 3 years ago and was wonderful. This time we had a good time but they were curring back on services. Had to beg to get Refer in room stocked. No A/C and no response after 6 calls to the front desk. Not only our room but our friends rooms also, a total of 4 rooms with no A/C. Entertainment was very bad! This resort is maybe a 3 star tops. The pool was dirty and filters and skimmers were never working that I saw, not good with the amount of people in the pool. Broken chairs in the dining room, trim falling off building. Just seemed dirty and we never felt comfortable like we did the first time. Time to clean the place up guys. Live music and dancing would be a plus. Keep the place more for adults. Mr. Clean Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Had a Very Enjoyable, Relaxing Time at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: mexico4life
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Riu Playacar and it was quite enjoyable. My initial impression of the resort is that it’s lively and authentic. The lobby was an open concept with a bar and traditional yellows, oranges and reds. The path through the hotel buildings was well lit, open and the trees and plants were spread nicely without being overbearing. The hotel buildings were bright and the sun was even brighter. Service What really made the trip so enjoyable was the positive service we received all around from the moment we got there. Hands down every employee I was around was extremely friendly and polite. We had no problem getting service anywhere. I felt I needed to tip everyone because they were all so nice (of course I didn’t go that far). Each Riu Resort had its own entertainment staff of about 3-6 people that coordinated daily activities and handled the nightly entertainment. Activities included water aerobics, volleyball, bingo, bocce ball, free scuba diving lessons, drinking games and more. We didn’t participate in too many of the activities, but the water aerobics was fun. We went to the nightly entertainment two nights. One night was authentic Mexican dancing; the other was made up of dancers recreating scenes from popular movies. Rooms The rooms at the Riu Playacar were very simple and nice. It was musty at first but nothing an open patio door wouldn’t fix. The beds had foam padding for added comfort, beautiful tile flooring, tv, and a mini-bar with four types of liquor, beer, soda and extra large bottles of water. They stock the mini-bar every two days. We only needed to get water and soda stocked all week. They have 6 different buildings (each a different bright color) that have three floors of rooms each with balconies. The buildings are all conveniently located either towards the lobby and buffet area or to the pool area. Pools I would say the two pools at the Riu Playacar were the most simplistic compared to all five of the Riu Resorts we looked at. There was a swim up bar, but no tables/seats in the pool otherwise. It was hard to get a shaded lounge chair near the pool after 11:00 a.m., but we never really needed one anyway. The pools were cleaned at 8:00 p.m. each night, so night swimming was not encouraged. Food and Bar There were three bars that all opened at 10:30 a.m. The lobby bar stayed open then until 7 a.m. the next day, the pool bar until 5:30 p.m. and the entertainment bar until 12:00 p.m. Basically between 7 a.m. and 10:30 a.m. if you’re up for a cocktail you’ll need to take advantage of the mini-bar. The Riu 24-hour All-Inclusive concept was definitely in affect, we never went hungry or thirsty. The food was standard and nothing out of the ordinary. Rice, nachos, refried beans, fish, chicken or beef, burgers, hot dogs, pizza, fruit and desserts were served at every lunch or dinner. The breakfast buffet was the same every day with a wide variety of your standard breakfast meals. I would rate the food a 3.5 out of 5. It was very consistent and we got our fill. The breakfast and dinner buffets were served in the buffet restaurant in the lobby of the resort and the lunch and afternoon snack were served in a buffet/bar area near the pool and overlooking the ocean. They also had 3 ala carte options including a Steakhouse, Asian and Mexican. You just needed to make reservations during the morning for that evening at the breakfast buffet. This was very simple to do and it didn’t seem like it was hard to get reservations any of them. We ate at the Steakhouse one night overlooking the ocean and it was very nice. The ala carte restaurants had two seatings, one at 6:45 p.m. and one at 8:45 p.m. We only did one ala carte option because we didn’t care for the time restraints. Beach The beach was smaller and nice, but eroding like many others. Huge multi-ton sandbags lined the beaches of all of the resorts in this area. The sandbags kept our particular beach from getting many waves, but it was still very relaxing and beautiful. We had absolutely no problem getting a lounge chair. You could use a snorkel for free, as well as kayak and paddle boat when the yellow flags were up. There were also employees working off commission along the beaches to entice you to go parasailing and jet skiing. All-in-all we had an amazing time. We booked our trip with Deals2Cancun.com and everything went great from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Beautiful People”
Reviews.Author: Flappygodmother
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me start by saying how much I had been looking forward to my trip to Mexico, so when we arrieved at the resort my breath was taken away. We were the last people to be dropped off so we got to see a couple of the other RIU hotels and I think we got the better deal. The whole complex was clean and well managed and the atmosphere was ever so friendly. The rooms are set out in 6 blocks with good sized rooms. The mini bar and optics were regually filled although having the all inclusive option meant we didn't spend much time with a drink in out rooms. The pool and beach are all within easy reach, just a minutes walk from the room and there were no problems with getting a lounger be it at the pool or beach. I have to say the loungers round the pool are a little more comfortable than the ones at the beach, but we spent more time in the water that we didn't notice too much. The food and drink are second to none with excellent buffet selections, howvere the steak house was a little dissapointing with very limited options. We were going to try the other al a carte resturants but due to the swine flu outbreak and the dwindling number of guests only the buffet resturant was kept open ( though we were more than happy with this). The three bars all had a great selection of drinks and the cocktails were great, not drenched in alcohol, which is the last thing you need when you are in need of a refreshing drink. If I could change anything it would be the entertainment, the poolside entertainment was constant, which was good for those who like to always be doing something but when you just wanted to laze by the pool you felt you were constantly being pestered. The evening entertainment was better but not much variety. Overall the holiday was excellent. Good clean rooms and resort, excellent service and upbeat personalities from all the staff. I feel so much forthe staff who are not sure when they will next get visitors in so when you consider a holiday please bear this resort in mind, you will really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: zbevoman
Reviews.Content: Background: My wife and I have been to Cancun 6 times and the Caribe a total of 13 times. So we have considerable experience with AIs throughout this area. We have stayed at Iberostars, rius, bahias, secrets and a few others. The Good- The Riu Playacar is a very nice small resort. For those with walking problems this a great place to stay. The rooms are adequate, nice balcony, food above average for AIs and great friendly service. The pools are clean and well laid out, entire property is spotless and in great condition. The Bad- Not a lot, but some things that might affect your stay. We had a small problem with very small ants in our second floor room always near the liquor dispensers, maybe they had a drinking problem? The musty smell in the room was evident but acceptable for this area. A couple of maintainance problems; the lights in the bathroom all burned out at the same time, it took two calls to get them repaired. The toilet ran after every flush and you would have to jiggle the handle to stop it, again the repairman came after the second call walked into the toilet area and jiggled the handle and said it was fixed. Of course it wasn, we just lived with it. The ac never got cold, and neither did the minibar frig, the repairmen said, that was as good as it gets with these units, so again we lived with it. The only other small complaint was there is no quiet area at the pool area for someone who justs wants to read or nap. The non activity pool had dozens of kids who were just being kids having a good time ,but screaming and running isn't conducive for sleeping and reading. Nothing against kids, we have four with grandkids, but if your are looking for quiet keep looking. The Ugly- We arrived the last week in April, At the height of the swine flu problem. Of course the media reports made it sound like people were dropping in the street. Other than the occasional face masks our stay remained relatively normal.
