All the quests were of course very concerned and it did put a damper on our vacation, but we just tried to make the best of a very bad situation. My biggest concern was for the thousands of very very friendly mexicans who make their living from the tourist industry. After several hurricanes, the drug wars and now the swine flu you could see the concern on their faces worried that their jobs might be eliminated if the tourists don't return. So in summation, this resort is probably great for families with children, not so much for couples.

Reviews.Title: “great resort for kids”
Reviews.Author: triciae3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with our 2 sons ages 5 & 9 years old. This was our 8th trip to playa del carmen. We have stayed at the Iberostar Del Mar, Lindo 2x,Maya, Tucan 2x, & the Riu Palace. Check in was smooth & efficient. Alfonzo was very nice & informative. This resort was the best one for the kids. There are so many activities for the kids and the adults. My 9yo wouldn't go to the kids club at the Tucan because it was boring for him. Here the kids club was great! Jessica ran the kids club and really did a great job. The kids really loved her and all the activities she planned throughout the day. She actually seeks out the kids and tries to coax them to come to the club. That certainlly wasn't true of the kids club at the Tucan. You can see the kids club from the beach & the pool area which is a plus.The hours are 10-12:30. 3pm -5pm.There is a kids show every night at the theater around 8:30. The rooms were fine. The mattress felt very hard but was fine when you actually laid on it. The shower was slow to drain but we dealt with it. I left a tip in the fridge everyday and it was well stocked. They usually stock it every 3 days but will stock it more if you call or in our case leave a tip. The rooms are very noisy at night you hear everyone in the hallways. The housekeeper did a great job keeeping the room clean. The food was good always plenty. Breakfast was very good and you must try the strawberry milk. YUM!!! Lunch is near the pool each day. We ate at the steakhouse which was good. We had the ribs & ribeye steaks. They are not US quality but were good. The Service is very slow! The asian rest. states it is show cooking. Not true. It was a buffet and you could see them cooking behind the buffet.Almost like a pizza place. Not what I call show cooking. We actually ended up at the buffet afterwards. Reservations are for 6:45 or 8:45pm. The shows at night were ok. Typical of all inclusives. The staff work very hard & we enjoyed the shows we seen. The pool is nice. We stayed at the active or loud pool & enjoyed ourselves. Always activities going on. The crazy games at the pool each day @ 3pm are lots of fun! The bartenders are great. Boy do they work hard. We brought bubba kegs since the cups are small and they kept the drinks nice & cold. The beach was the best one out of the hotels nearby. Lots of chairs available any time of day. There is however no shade at all. We only went to the beach in the morning because of the lack of shade. There was also a red flag 5 out of 7 days. They also offer massage on the beach. This resort was not my favorite out of all of the one's I have been to but was for my kids. I wouldn't stay here if it was just my husband & I but with kids it was perfect. I would rate it a 3 star but didn't expect the Ritz for the money I paid. You should be happy with this resort. Feel ree to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: MilfordSB09
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation to Mexico and we loved it! From the moment we were greeted at the front desk until our last good-byes - all the staff was exceptional!! The resort was very clean and we were happy with our accomodations! Our room was located near the lobby, which was great! I'm sure having a room near the pools/ocean would be nice also but either way it's a quick walk from one end of the resort to the other . Our room was exactly what we expected! It was roomy, bright and clean! We had absolutly no problems with our room or bathroom! Everything worked just fine and was in nice shape! Yes, the beds are a little firmer than what we're used to, but we slept just fine! The food was very good-had a nice variety! The staff worked so hard at preparing our meals! Not only was the food good but they did a nice job with the presentation! The only thing lacking was late night munchies! You can visit the Tequlia for nightly snacks but that wasn't really convenient though. Also, the snacks weren't so great. Next time, I would consider buying and keeping munchies in our room. We enjoyed both pools and the beach! One pool is a bit quieter and great for young children and adults who want to relax! The other pool was fun for older kids, teenagers and adults who want interaction and fun with others! The pool and beach had plenty of chairs available. Just remember, you're not the only person/family staying there, so if you need several chairs together, get them early! The sand bags do take away from the view a bit but we understand why they're needed to preserve the beach. This is not the resorts fault! We felt safe while vacationing in Mexico! I was impressed with the secured location of our section of resorts! Can't beat the location! So close to shopping at 5th Ave., only a few minutes away and a $5.00 cab ride! There is also shopping right across the street! We did not feel threatened at any time! I know it's hard to meet everyone's expectations, but we were very pleased with our stay! The staff at this resort works very hard to please everyone! On occasion, I felt sympathetic for the staff for having to deal with a few rude/demanding guests! The resort can't control wildlife, the weather and nature! Come on people, this is vacation time! Enjoy yourself and have fun! It's easy to do here at this resort! We'll definetly be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff good, food not so much.”
Reviews.Author: bobsjunk
Reviews.Content: The food was ok, nothing to write home about. The hotel staff were very friendly and polite. The pool and beach were both great. The water sports people seem to work on commission and are quite pushy with the activities that incur additional cost. We were told daily that there would be no sailing, which is included. Our last day there we did see the boats out and were told that those were lessons being given by an instructor. I don't know how accurate that was as I saw one of the catamarans capsize no less than twice in a span of 10 minutes. The pool activities seemed to be enjoyed by all. The bingo is completely obnoxious and should be moved elsewhere, say to the theater area. The evening entertainment was quite good with live music and dancing. The tour people in the lobby are quite pushy as well. I feel as though I was lied to in the interest of making a sale, but have no way of knowing for sure. It just felt like I was dealing with a car salesman. Oh, and the ice machine, 3 floors down... with no elevator, didn't work the entire time I was there. Six flights of stairs and still a warm drink! :(

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: geo54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and had a good time. Resort is smaller so easy to get around. Beach is alright. Staff is great! Missing you Carlos and Izzy!! Had fun with water aerobics and crazy games. Lots of fun things happening during the day at the resort. Good drinks! You can specifically ask for Havana Club rum. Yum! Entertainment at night was fun. Loved the Michael Jackson show!! Positives: Great staff, Fun activities, Shower is separate from toilet and sink. Nice rooms with balconies. Alcohol in the rooms for the desperate. Great Buffets for breakfast and dinner. Across the street are shops but Playa del Carmen is just moments away. You can get better deals in town. Exchange money to pesos to get the best rate!!! Improvements can be made: I really was not impressed with the restaurants on the resort. The Asian is buffet style and really nothing too special. The steakhouse is a bit better. The steak was okay. Mexican was good (garlic prawns yum). The towels were never there before 9am, even though they were suppose to be there at 8am. Tips: Take lots of sunscreen and a hat. The sun is extremely hot down there! Pesos! Take a thermos cup for drinks as the glasses are very small. Shop in town at Playa del Carmen (things are cheaper there). Go to Coba as that is the only ruin that you can still climb. Also check out Coco Bongo! Awesome bar where you can dance on the tables. Lots of fun with impersonations, shows and great music. Ear plugs as the halls echo. Room spray as it's very musty!!! Tip the wait staff at the buffet as they work really hard for your enjoyment too.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lot of fun!”
Reviews.Author: bellemarley
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar is a great place to stay for families. We liked that there were two pools so our young children (5,3,16 months) could play in the quieter pool while the adults partied and did the games in the other pool. The beach was great, a lot of chairs but they do fill up quickly. Great sand and gorgeous water. The water was a little choppy but my kids did fine with their floaties and the baby was in an inflatable boat that we held on to. She loved the bobbing and fell asleep most times as soon as she got in. The sand bags were out far enough that it didn't matter they were there. They helped break the waves so my kids could play in the water. We stayed at a different all inclusive at one end of 5th avenue last summer and that beach had the sand bags right on the edge of the beach so it was very difficult for the kids to get into the water. Take your leftover bread and fries down to the beach to feed the angel fish. The kids had a blast and loved that the fish would swim around them tickling their legs. The food was good, a lot of variety. My kids loved the ice cream machine. There was always something kid friendly (fries, pizza, plain pasta, chicken). The room was nice. We had the "king" bed which was two doubles pushed together. There was still plenty of room for the pack and play that we requested for the baby. I couldn't agree more with everyone saying the beds were extremely hard. We never did ask for a pillow top and we still made it for the week. The room was musty smelling but we were there during such nice weather that we kept the balcony door open for fresh air (which does have a sensor and will shut the air off if left open). The staff is very friendly and do not expect tips but greatly appreciate whatever you give them. A few dollars here and there is not much for us on vacation but a lot to them trying to make a living. They loved the kids and would always stop for a high five and hello. This hotel was so nice for our family because there were so many other families. There was a nice mix of young couples and older couples as well. The shops of Playacar are across the street from the resort. Things were a bit pricey but not much more than 5th Avenue. We didn't want to take the time to go to 5th Avenue because we wanted the beach time, so we went across the street to look for treats but didn't really see anything new and exciting (this was our third trip to Playa Del Carmen) so we didn't buy anything. We did not do any excursions but you definitely had opportunities to take advantage of them from the companies in the lobby. There is also internet service in the lobby. It's nice to take your laptop down, sit in the comfy chairs and enjoy your beverages from the bar in there. I would definitely go back to this hotel, especially for the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel,booked through Thomson”
Reviews.Author: carol82Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after reading a few of the reviews however the Hotel was lovely. The staff couldn't be more helpful and the standard of the food was unbelievable. Every night there was something different to try. The room was very clean and comfortable. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to any member of my family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Piece of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: CindyKWarrington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar for four nights and had two rooms next to each other. The rooms were immaculate- never saw any bugs at all. We were in the building next to the lobby (lime green) and it was very quiet. There was wireless in the lobby so we could check email and do work in the morning. We stayed at the Riu Palcace Mexico a couple years ago which had more grandeur- but for the money, this was just as nice. The main difference was no gym and they did not serve drinks around the pool- and that gave us some exercise! The breakfasts were wonderful- expecially the sugar donuts. Lunch was also good-- the BBQ on the beach was nice- great corn on the cob and chicken. Dinners were just okay- but there was always pizza if nothing else satisfied us. We went to the Steak House one night and the appetizers were good- the meal so-so. There was chocolate fondue Friday night which was a treat. The chocolate martinis were good as was the Irish coffee at night. My husband enjoyed the Dos Equis- esp. the amber- more than the Corona that the other Riu served. The ocean was wonderful --even though the red flag was up, many people were in and it seemed very safe if you were careful. The black sandbags made me feel safer- a throwback to the jetties at the NJ shore. My daughters went across the street and got bikes one day- all you need to give them is $20 and your license and they let you borrow one and you get the money back when you return the bike. It is just a big loop to ride with a nice golf course to ride by. We went to FIfth Ave one day to shop and it was just okay. You could def bargain some good prices. All in all, our four days were very peaceful and relaxing. The staff were all very nice and were as accommodating as they could be. We did tip but they sure did not look for it. We all said at one time or another that this was a little piece of heaven. Apple Vacations were great- no glitches at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bnhappy
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late but better late than never---. After much deliberation we chose Riu Playacar for a large family vacation with my 87 year old mother, my kids and their families and my brothers and their families. Some of us were there for 2 full weeks, others for a week, we all overlapped for 3 days. Overall it was perfect. Those who stayed for 2 weeks got tired of the food, it starts to all taste alike after the first week. Plus, we were there over Christmas and I think they skimped before and after the holiday so they could feed us a 'special' meal Christmas eve. Unfortunately a few of our family members were sick after the 'special' meal. The rooms were great, always well cleaned, towel art, flowers, temperature easily controlled. We were right next to the evening disco and it was a great location. Easily accessable to pool and beach and a short walk to the dining room. A bit of a smell from the shower, they came numerous times to fix it but we could still smell whatever. As long as we kept the curtain closed it was okay. Since we had little kids, it was easier to spend more time at the pool than the beach although we took long walks in both directions on the beach every day. The best days were the first week we were there, before the crowds arrived (most of us arrived on Dec 13.) Some of the days they set up a fantastic lunch poolside---paella, barbeque, but once the crowds arrived these wonderful poolside meals moved to the patio with more banquet type food. My granddaughter had fun at the kids club but since she is a very shy 4 1/2 year old she wouldn't go by herself so one of us always accompanied her. But that was fine since a lot of other parents were also hanging around helping the kids every day The mini disco was fun at night, the kids loved dancing on stage. This is a great spot for families with kids, lots of things for them to do and lots of choices for them to eat. We always moved away from the noise at night, wanted to just have a drink and talk away from the loud goings on at the theater. The help was all wonderful. The guys at the beach seemed a little lazy at times, wouldn't help as much as they could have with the kayaks and catamarands. We went on a couple of snorkeling trips, once from a boat we rented as a family off of the beach because the hotel boat was full. It was great, they took us about 15 minutes away down near Xcaret where all the snorkel boats go and let us snorkel as long as we wanted. Had cold drinks to drink on the way home. Price was about the same or a little less than the one from the hotel but they let us stay as long as we wanted. Didn't see as many fish as I did last time I was in Playa, before the Hurricane. The walk to town was 20-30 minutes depending on whether or not we were pushing a baby stroller. We went in often, 5th avenue is a great place to people watch. I took my granddaughter in to have her hair braided and two days later every other girl in the hotel had their hair done too. I think we paid around $25, they looked really cute! Had fun poking in the shops on 5th Ave. There is a nice little shopping center across the street from the hotel. There is a kiosk there where you can check out a clunker bike to ride into town. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those with kids and those who want a hassle free all inclusive vacation. It was really nice not worrying about where everyone would eat. A couple of our relatives are vegetarians and they had no trouble finding plenty to eat. We booked our vacation through Apple and the one hassle was our transfer to the hotel. We arrived to Cancun airport around 3:00 PM and were excited that our plane was actually a little early and we would be there in time for a walk on the beach. By the time we waited for all the other people to board the bus it was probably 4:30 before we left the airport and then our hotel was the last drop on the list. We arrived at the Riu after 6 PM! If I had it to do over again I would take that free shuttle that I just read about on a different post or figure out how not to sit on the Apple bus for over 3 hours! The return from the hotel to the airport was better, we only made one stop and then went straight to the airport. Took maybe an hour. Oh yes, I almost forgot. When you check in they tell you about a Riu card that they will give you that gives you a discount on any activity you do that is not in the all inclusive. That proved to be great, gave us a discount on scuba diving (only fair, wouldn't bother next time), snorkeling, computer room, etc. You are welcome to email me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value for a 4 star, but not a 5 star !”
Reviews.Author: GrampaDuck
Reviews.Content: My wife & I [ mid -50s ] stayed 7 days here, with our 11 year old granddaughter & her 12 year old BFF. Trip from air port was about 45-50 minutes. Check in at 1:30 PM was fast, but didn't care for the location of assigned room [ Building # 2, ground floor, in back ] very near lobby but farther away from pool & beach area. Returned to see if we could get a room closer to pool & beach, & was resigned a new room, in the middle of ground floor of building # 5, along the front ,which was PERFECT for us, all this took place before 3 PM. We asked for 2 more cots [ 2 twin beds ], for the girls & the people placed these beside the 2 queens & put a chair out onto the patio. Even with the extra beds in the RUN OF THE HOUSE room, we STILL had lots of room. The noise was muffled, and did NOT bother our 9-10 PM bed time. Air conditioning worked good, coldest setting about 72 -73 degrees. Asked for more towels & bottled water & received them. We did not notice a musty smell until we returned home. A few mosquitos, but wasn't bothered by them. Didn't need repellant. Rooms were very clean & cleaned every day. Towels were replaced every day & water restocked every other day. We broght our own 4 cup coffee maker & coffee packets, as no coffee maker in rooms.. Shower was great, with lots of hot water. Buffet food was good. Only bacon at breakfast, no sausages of any kind. Same breakfast buffet every morming. Lunch buffet was the same as dinner the night before. The Steak House had a thin cut of meat, less than a 1/2 " cut, but some-how they were able to grill it medium rare, but good flavor . The Jade [ asian ] restaurant was very good, [ buffet style ]. Two pools, 1 quiet & 1 party pool. Most of the games, around the party pool were geared toward teens & up. Beach is narrow, compared to others in area, but plenty of sand. The large black sand bags, in the water, did provide protection for the beach & our kids. Lots of wind & fun jumping the 3-5 foot waves, near the shore. We walked the beach for a long way. Riu Yucatan is 3 hotels down from the Playacar, which has a nicer beach, larger variety of foods on the breakfast buffet. We visited Yucatan twice & saw monkeys in the trees, noticed more shade in many areas. Yucatan has 2 swim-up bars,as Playacar has 1, but the Yucatan had more people. Do NOT repend on NW WORLD VACATION / WORRY-FREE reps. for any help, as they only want to be tour salespeople. We consulted with them 4 times about our transport to the airport before departing for the airport & they still did NOT have a van for us at assigned departure time. They finally got us a ride 1 hour later. I was looking forward to a lot of shrimp, crab [seafood ] eating & I was very disappointed. All the staff, room, check-in, dining, cleaning & etc. were very nice & helpful, except for NW World Vacations/Worry-Free. If we go back, we'd try the Yucatan. All in all, Playacar was a good value for the 4 of us, for 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “beware of springbreak time”
Reviews.Author: lionsfan47
Reviews.Content: hotel and staff wonderful but do not go the last 2 weeks in march or the first week in april having 18 year olds getting totally hammered does spoil everybody elses enjoyment.At other times of the year very nice.Food is plentyful and varied.Make sure to take insect repellant to spray your room the mosquitos are many and nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Northumbrian39
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks here from the 11th to 25th March and the holiday was completely ruined by hoards of young Americans on their Spring Break. Although they were either with parents or chaperones they were out of control day and night ! Being an all inclusive resort they had access to alcohol 24 / 7, we felt sorry for the staff especially those tending the bars having to deal with these obnoxious youths. We chose this hotel from the Thomson brochure which advertised it as relaxing with lazy days by the pool , when in fact it was like an 18 to 30 holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, but very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oldman52
Reviews.Content: Hi Everybody, We’ve just returned from Riu Playacar, and maybe somebody will consider this feedback useful. First of all, we really enjoyed the vacation – ocean, sun, and wonderful time together with our granddaughter were priceless. The location of the hotel is very good, it’s quite compact and everything is close – the whole way from the lobby to the ocean along all 6 buildings (3 on each side of central alley) takes 2-3 minutes. The small shopping center is just across the road from the hotel entrance. The food selection (but not taste) is good, and the buffet style restaurants are very convenient for staying with a child – much better than any kind of meal ordering system. The hotel has all kinds of motorless water equipment for rent at no charge (sail catamarans, canoes, windsurfing) – the same way as most of all inclusive hotels in this area have. Training for sailing is not expensive, too, as well as jet ski rent ($65 for 45 minutes, as far as I remember). Now about the problems you will encounter in this place. 1. All beaches on all resorts in this area are destroyed with the huge bags with sand put to the water to protect beach sand from been taken away by sea. They look ugly, they are very dangerous when swimming with waves, and some of them are on the ocean floor in the swimming area – I had to go to the emergency after hitting toes over one of them. It’s stupid and ugly way of saving money on sand on my opinion. These bags are the reason why we will not go to any resort in this area again. And we heard about the same decision from many people we got acquainted with in this hotel. 2. As I’ve already mentioned, the food selection is good, but cooking is pretty far from perfect. Also, feeding is organized very poorly and there always were the big lines for main course food. Sometimes there was not enough of food, and we had to wait until they cook more. 3. There is really no food between breakfast, lunch and dinner in this hotel – there is a buffet next to the beach where you can find something, but not sufficient for a hungry person. The room service at nights is also absent – if you are going to go somewhere early in the morning, you have to let them know a day before not later at 4 pm etc. 4. The hotel is terribly understaffed – the people are working very hard, but there are not enough of them to do the job. It’s everywhere – in the restaurants, bars, cleaning team, entertainment etc. 5. Entertainment for children is terrible – almost the same every day, unprofessional, and even abusive for little ones – the games they play on half hour evening “mini disco” have one winner among sometimes 20 or more children attending them, and the little ones of course don’t have any chance to win. So, we had a lot for tears from our granddaughter (she’s 6). I think you agree that it’s not very nice to hear from a little child who was supposed to enjoy the show “I am zero, I am nothing, I can never win…” It’s just unprofessional to have this kind of children entertainment. 6. Understaffed cleaning team is working hard to keep the rooms clean, but the rooms are just terribly worn out, especially plumbing stuff. I am posting the pictures with cracked sink and rusty shower tab. Also, the drain in the shower didn’t work well, and we had to stop water several times during taking shower to allow water in the tab to drain. A plumber who was sent to check the issue told us that it’s as it should be… So, the only thing I can tell is that this is the worst hotel we’ve ever stayed in this area (we can compare with Iberostar, Sandos Playacar, and Catalonia Tulum which is a bit more to the south – we stayed in those last years). The five stars shown on the main entrance are some kind of joke – it can hardly worth 3. But again – all these problems didn’t prevent us from enjoying this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS stay in paradise”
Reviews.Author: goldengirl09
Reviews.Content: We spend a great week during Spring Break. Excellent place, excellent Staff, good food. We are definitely coming back next year. Check in was the best thing ever (I travel all around the world) Food really good, a lot of flavor. Excellent rooms

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Harry_HoundEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 16-30th March 2009. We had an absolutely lovely holiday, this hotel is excellent. Staff are helpful and polite and do as much as possible to make your stay a pleasant one. We found that being able to use the other RIU hotel facilities within the resort was an excellent idea. We used the Yucatan and Tequila on an evening for drinks as the playacar’s bar was slightly smaller than we would like. The hotel has an excellent beach and 2 swimming pools, we found the quieter one more to our taste but there was nothing wrong with the lively pool. Food at the hotel was of a very high standard, the all inclusive drinks were also very good and included branded drinks. Rooms are spacious with a curtain dividing the bedroom from the bathroom. There is plenty of storage space with suitcases etc. Rooms are cleaned on a daily basis and we did not experience any problems with the room. We did not see any of the evening entertainment so I can not comment on this but the daytime activities were there for you if you wanted to join in. I would highly recommend this hotel if you would like a more laid back experience of Mexico rather than the lively Cancun area.

Reviews.Title: “CLUB 18-30”
Reviews.Author: gillywatkins
Reviews.Content: advertised as a relaxing holiday,the truth is it was far from that,it was spring break, what Thomson did not tell us,it was like club 18-30 ,they youths had the run of the place they had the swim up bar pool to them selves,they also took over the other bars,they made a load of noise all night,spitting etc,we complained,the hotel gave us another room ,why i don't know that was just as bad,no security guards walking around to check on them,the entertainment was bad,the management who run this hotel should be ashamed of them selves,there were a lot of complaints,but no apology from the manager,it was catered all for the youths,it was a waste of a lot of money,but on a good note, the staff are the best i have ever met,so so friendly,(unlike the manager) the food was wonderful plenty of it,the rooms very clean,and Thomson rep Clare was so helpful, she is great girl thanks Clare Gillian and Andy

Reviews.Title: “Nice food”
Reviews.Author: ToldoWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: But unfortunatly its impossible to get even slightly tipsey on the beer and spirits from the bars. It was a bad time to go in March has the place was full of young unruly Americans on their Spring break. For some reason they were the only guests who seemed to be affected by the weak booze, they were well gone on a couple of the beers.Very strange.Overall the Hotel was very good, the staff were excellent the facilities were by and large very good. Minus points The entertainment was not up to much but they tried their best.The ice machines on the ground floors of blocks 4,5,6 did not function for the entire two weeks of our stay. But you can get plenty in the bar area. Minor repairs did not appear to be carried out,for example the handle on our balcony door was falling off but only poor repairs carried out. Our biggest problem was the flight out we went with Thomsons 193 from manchester due to fly on the 8/03/09 but we had a 24 hour delay due to engine problems i understand this is a common problem with the thomsons long haul flights. But all i can say is that if the hotel could sort out the weak booze we would visit this hotel again,perhaps with another carrier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - A great family location”
Reviews.Author: WisconnyPlayaboy
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple, the Riu Playacar is an excellent value! The rooms are good sized. If you've been reading reviews, you have seen that the rooms have an odor. True. Just take along an air freshener. It takes care of the issue. As for the bed size and hardness, they are small and firm. Solution: Ask for an extra single bed. It fits in the room no problem. And also ask for extra matress pads that helps make the beds more comfortable. They were more than happy to accomodate. This resort is the perfect size. We went to the other properties and found them crowded and congested, especially the Riu Tequila. The Playacar is smaller and friendlier with great beach access and staff that will work hard to make your stay pleasurable. The food is very good with a large variety. Do the buffets get old after awhile? Yes, but you can get creative with many of the offerings. It actually was fun trying different combinations of the wide variety. I strongly urge you to try the free Scuba lesson. Its a blast and much easier than you might think. Had I known earlier in the trip, I would have pursued certification while at the resort. Day trips: If the waves are high and rough, stay away from Deep Sea Fishing. A few in our party were very sea sick. I recommend the Mayan Adventure. See Oliver in the lobby. That is one fun trip! Rappeling, Snorkeling, zip lines and Tulum. In all, our family had a great time and will return to the Riu Playacar. Hats off to all the staff for making our trip a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, we had so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: Ria_CO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Riu Playacar March 20-26, 2009 with three friends (18 and 17 years old) and my friend’s mom and grandma. It was our spring break and we had 15 friends at the Riu Yucatan. We loved the Playacar: our trip had its ups and downs, but the hotel was wonderful and we had so much fun there. Like anywhere, there were hiccups here and there, absolutely nothing unmanageable or in the way though. Rooms: There were four of us staying in one room and we never felt too cramped (except I felt bad for the maid because every day we somehow managed to make it seem as if a tornado came through our room before she came in and saved the day). It was two double beds pushed together and without having to ask, they brought in a cot. The beds were a little hard, not as bad as I expected from reading previous reviews, and the bathroom was a good size. The only issue was the smell from the drains after we showered or ran a lot of water. It was pretty gross… someone came up and poured something down all the drains and it helped a little for the first day. Whenever we walked by the Riu Palace, that same smell was overwhelming there. However, our friends at the Riu Yucatan said they did not have a smell in their room. The building was very pleasant, with the little courtyards and greenery. Also, we were on the third floor—no elevators, but for how much we ate that was probably a good thing. We saw some ants and we all got a few bug bites (our friend at the Yucatan got her legs covered in bites, so we felt lucky for our few). Remember, don’t close the outer door leading to your room and the one next door—you will have to get someone to come up and unlock it. That happened multiple times to us. Food: It was good, but not gourmet. It was what I expected for an all-inclusive place. My only complaint is that they didn’t have bagels for breakfast—they certainly had everything else. I loved their cheese selection and the fruit juices in the morning. Lunch was probably my least favorite of the buffets, it had the least variety. The guacamole?? We ate our weight in it. We ate at all three restaurants—the Mexican was probably my least favorite, but I just didn’t like the kind of steak I got at it, the appetizers were good. The steak at the steak house wasn’t amazing, yet I still ate two. We never felt any need to go into town and eat, we were perfectly content with the food at the resort. I was surprised how good the fruit was and our friend’s mom could not stop raving about the rice pudding. Drinks: I am under 21, so I’m not about to be picky when a drink is set in front of me. They weren’t strong and we preferred the margaritas our friend’s mom made, but we could have tequila boom booms all night long! The pool bar closes pretty early, which sucked because that felt like the place where the teens could really chill and not be in the way. We all liked drinking at our hotel more than the Yucatan because it didn’t feel like we were disturbing the peace quite as much. The beer was meh, I didn’t try the wine, the strawberry margaritas are muy bien, and I think I have had enough tequila to last me quite a while. And to the reviewer before me—I apologize, the spring breakers at the bar was probably us. Beach: All of us agreed that Playacar has the best beach. We walked along the beach every day—if you go far enough past the hotels, you reach a beautiful stretch of open beach that is wonderful. Yes, there are the sandbag things, but they were least in the way at Playacar and fun to climb and jump off of. Kayaking was fun, I wish I had tried jet skiing and wind surfing as well. There was always a beach volleyball game going and everyone was happy to let another join. It was difficult to get a lounge chair on the beach between 9 and 2, so we had to resort to the pool sometimes. The shady spots were great and there were always plenty of sunny spots. Pool: I never went into the pool, but I laid by it several times and hung out by the pool bar frequently. In the afternoons a volleyball net would get set up and people would play water volleyball. It is two medium size pools with a narrow connection between them—one is the active, fun, louder pool and the other is quieter and laid back. There are shady spots with lounge chairs, and I never had a problem finding a place to sit. Entertainment: I did not sit down and watch any of the night shows, but while I was at the bar or hanging out with people in the area I would watch from a distance. They were fun, mainly dancing to popular films and such, and there was a lot of energy. I also didn’t participate in any of the day time activities, even though I meant to do the shooting one. It seemed like if it wasn’t at the pool or they didn’t advertise it, not many people showed up to it. The entertainment crew looked like fun and I kind of regret having not participated in anything or getting to know them. The People: It’s spring break, so naturally there was a young crowd. I really liked our crowd of people—adults and teens—more than those at the Yucatan because people got to know each other and everyone talked and mingled, while at the other place it was an older, more reclusive crowd (even if it was more crowded). I never felt like our hotel was crowded or empty, it felt like the perfect amount of people. I was also a little surprised how many Europeans there were. I really liked that it was a smaller resort, I believe that had an impact on everyone’s nice attitude. Town: If you walk, it’s about 15 or so minutes and don’t miss out on the ruins to your right when you walk there. Our group walked around town for over three hours and we still didn’t feel like we hit half of town—it was a little overwhelming. There are some beautifully decorated restaurants and the nightlife doesn’t come alive until after midnight, but don’t miss out on the clubs (especially Coco Maya and Blue Parrot, located right on the beach. Coco Bongo has a $50 cover charge, it didn’t really seem worth it). A taxi ride is $5 and the cab drivers are lots of fun—we got on great with all of them and they have fun music in the car to listen to. Town isn’t as cheap as I thought it would be, even with haggling. Grounds: Even though Playacar is a smaller resort, it is absolutely beautiful. Not quite the jungle-like feel like the Yucatan (they have monkeys there, which I’m terrified of monkeys so I didn’t mind we didn’t have wildlife to that extent), but very well-kept, green, and so pleasant to look at. There’s lots of color, yet it isn’t loud, and I enjoyed every moment walking around the resort and seeing the grounds. Staff: Between locking ourselves out of the room (once to the point where the silver latch on the other end somehow locked), blowing out our electricity because we had too many blow dryers going, breaking red bands (don’t lose it! $100), and everything else, they were just so wonderful and willing to help. Thank you to all the staff members who put up with us and were so happy to do whatever they could to make our stay great. Safety: With everything going on in Mexico right now, we were a little worried about safety coming to visit, despite it being Playa del Carmen. We went to town with a group of people and no one ever had a problem, four of us girls walked around (never straying more than 10 minutes from out hotel) at night with no problems, nothing was stolen, and although we did our best to keep valuables in the safe, every now and then we would either leave the key to the safe in the room or leave out an iPod or phone or passport or keep it open… we never felt a hint of discomfort in our safety. Police patrol the beach on a regular basis as well. I would definitely go back to Playacar—it was so much fun and a great place for our group to stay, relax, and enjoy ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Adults Only”
Reviews.Author: lpecni
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Riu Playacar for four nights: Accomodations: Room was good, maid service excellent, balcony had a spectacular view. The air conditioning barely worked, we complained and got no resolve. All of our close smelled of midew when we returned. Food: wonderful! I cannot say enough some of the best food ever! My biggest complaint is that they advertise no spring breakers and there were a ton of them! Loud, and took over the bar area to the point you could not even get a drink. Entertainment: I don't know what has happened but the entertainment has gone down hill, there was really nothing and what they did have was very poor. As always the people are welcoming and friendly. Not to worry it is very safe there.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar: great value, great service and great location for two moms and 2 daughters.”
Reviews.Author: xioma56
Reviews.Content: My friend and I, and our 18 year old daughters just came back from Playa del Carmen. Stayed in Riu Playacar for 4 nights. We all had the time of our lives! We were looking for the best deal we could get since we were in a very tight budget, and we were very satisfied with this hotel. Yes, there is a little of everything that other reviews mentioned: the beds are hard, a few mosquitoes, the food wasn't gourmet but good, the drinks were weak, but these things were totally manageable. The staff was very friendly and always willing to please us and accommodate us. The grounds are kept immaculate, and the rooms are very clean. The buffet had variety, good for all tastes. One night we dined (previous reservation) at the Mexican Restaurant, and we found the Buffet better and more fun. The night shows are impressive (don't forget you're not in Broadway), and night life for our daughters was just right. The routine at night for them was having drinks at the bar (Enrique, the bartender was sooo sweet and fun!) during the show ending at around 11 pm, going across the street to sister hotel Riu Tequila that is included , the bar and disco are open until 2:00, and if you wanted to keep partying, you could get a taxi to 5th Ave. for $5 (5 minutes away) and continue at the Blue Parrot. Location is perfect since you are very close to 5th Ave (20 min. walk or 5 min. ride), but is quiet and private for the beaches. The hotel is good for a family, as well as for couples, or like us for parents with young adults. We noticed a few groups of all women. There's always something for everyone while is fun and safe. I would recommend this hotel to anybody! You get great value, great service, and great location -nothing luxurious but pretty. If you are expecting luxury, go next door to the Riu Palace. Tips: watch your hotel towels at the pool! Our first day at the pool, my daughter's towel disappeared and found out that the hotel charges you $25 if you don't return your towel. Fortunately they didn't. If you are arranging for a private transportation from airport to hotel, do it one way in Cancun-express ($75), you can't take a taxi at the airport! You can return to the airport with a taxi from the hotel for $50. Have pesos to pay for a taxi, if you use it enough times you can save some money. They charge you 50 pesos or $5. The rate when I went was $1= 14.5 pesos. Taxi to the airport 600 pesos or $50. You do the math. If you like ceramic, go to 5th ave, (10th st & 5th) second store from the corner going north, doesn't have a name (the name is "Los Espejos de Paola" but is not posted). Sebastian has the best ceramic from Puebla, "talavera" dishes, great variety, great quality, and very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For ... And Don't Get What You Don't Pay For”
Reviews.Author: babspeapod
Reviews.Content: How we selected this place: My BF and I were on a budget and wanted to find something <$900/person, all inclusive with RT airfare from Philadelphia. Obviously, most places were easy to rule out based on price. Also, he doesn't like huge high-rise hotels -- the Riu Playacar has a smaller, manageable feel to it. I have mixed feelings about this place -- and I've travelled all over the world both luxury and budget. The grounds, the beach and the pool area are beautiful and impeccably clean. Once you get into the room and are looking for comfort and pampering ... well, things start to slip. Here are 10 observations and tips -- the good, the bad, the ugly. 1.) Beds/Pillows: The beds get an "F" for comfort. They're hard as rocks and the pillows are about 2" thick. We had a "king" room, but it was 2 full-sized beds pushed together. Horribly uncomfortable. To quote my BF "I can't imagine why anyone would buy a bed like that. It's as hard as the ground." Bring your own pillow if you're picky about where you rest your head. 2.) Bugs -- Before we went, I read mixed reviews about bugs rumored in the rooms. More of the reviews seemed to debunk the myth, so I booked our room but was on the lookout from Day One. (We brought no food into the room.) I saw a few ants and mosquitos, but nothing else .... until the last night. Then, a roach crawled out from under the bed. I freaked, only to find out my BF had been spotting them and killing them all along -- mainly near the bathroom and the mini-fridge. If I'd have known this, we'd have been outta there. The mosquito thing -- bring bug spray for the shows at night if you're prone to attack. I got over 30 bites on my legs in less than an hour during a show one night, and had to get medication. 3.) Other aspects of the rooms - Nicely appointed with TVs (mix of English, Spanish, and other language channels), balconies, liquor dispensers and mini fridges. Stand-up shower had great water pressure. Ask ahead of time for more towels and more bottled water. 4.) Bathroom products -- They do not supply hair conditioner or body lotion, and it's very expensive in the gift shop and stores. Bring your own. I called the front desk to request this stuff, and they informed me they don't have it. They give bath "gel", a shower cap, hand soap and shampoo. The room also has a blow dryer and an iron. 5.) Hotel Services -- There's no disco, no fitness center, no jacuzzi, no business center, and no spa as some of the web/print material suggests. You have to go to another resort (which is NOT just an easy walk next door). If having these things conveniently accessible is important to you, I recommend you either pick another place or mentally prepare to have to go out of your way for these hotel services. 6.) Food - Both of us thought the food was excellent. There's something for everyone, and we also enjoyed a nice dinner at the steakhouse. I generally hate buffets, but will admit that I thought some of the buffet food was excellent -- even delicious. The carrot cake was to die for. 7.) Nightlife - Once dinner is over, there is a nightly show at 9:45pm. If you want to do anything other than go to a show after dinner, you'll have to leave the resort. Now, that's not a bad thing. It costs 50pesos for a taxi to 5th Avenue, which has many blocks of bars, restaurants, shops, etc. If you want a resort with a party atmosphere, you've picked the wrong spot. This resort is good for families, older couples, or people who are looking for low-key. 8.) Service - Front desk was fast w/check in/out. Pool bar service was fast but not too friendly (especially considering we were tipping quite generously); Restaurant service was great; Bell stand gets a taxi in <5 mins (BTW, tipping is not customary or required .... we just happen to be tippers.) 9.) Theft - We had no issues with theft (which concerned me based on previous reviews of places in mexico). We used the in-room safe and had no problems. I also took my very nice camera to the pool during the day and had no problems. 10.) Drinks - Alcoholic drinks were not good. You can serve yourself to Dos Equis on tap or 3 kinds of wine (red, white, rose) from barrels. Other than that, all of the drinks are very weak and sugary. Not good at all. Would I go back? Maybe, but probably not. I think I'd be willing to pay more for better quality and more services. But it I needed a vacation on a budget again .... I'd consider coming here again. I'd recommend it, but with some disclaimers and tips for preparation.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: WarmItUp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Riu Playacar March 3-6 then moved to Riu Palace Riviera Maya for 7-10. Knew upon booking Playacar from reading reviews that rooms were not updated but we were hoping would be better. Stayed with husband and 2 kids so room seemed quite cramped for 4 and beds were small-not queens but doubles, not enough drawer space, sink faucet was drippy. We were in building 6 (pink building) and it was indeed loud at night until after 11PM from the show. Overall the grounds were beautiful and pools/restaurants were pretty nice, nothing fantastic but not bad. Our favorite was the Mexican restaurant - can book each morning at breakfast time, Asian food was good, but another buffet but at least in smaller restaurant atmosphere. Standard buffets were okay-I never went hungry by any means but wasn't excited about food either. Never used the kids club because no one was there the few times I wandered over and was never informed of schedule. We visited the Riu Yucatan and Riu Tequila and enjoyed spending time at the Tequila pool during the day both an easy walk, within 2 blocks. Nice shops directly across the street and Playa del Carmen was indeed close by, took the $5 taxi ride their and walked back which took maybe 20 minutes. We accidently wandered onto the Riu Palace Mexico grounds looking for the Yucatan and were so impressed I went to inquire at the desk if we could move over, they directed me to inquire with our travel agency. We had asked upon check-in at the Playacar if any available suites and told no, but upon mentioning concern about our room to the on-site Funjet rep, he spoke with desk staff and since they were overbooked later in the week they offered us opportunity to move to Riu Palace Riviera Maya in a few days-we gratefully accepted! We loved the Palace, much nicer rooms, nicer grounds, better drinks-smart marketing move on their part because we could not be satisified with Playacar level in future now that we've stayed at a Palace. So beware, don't visit one of the Palaces if you don't want to be dissapointed in Playacar. Playacar was about 1 hour drive from Airport. We went on the Alltournatives Maya Encounter tour to Coba, ziplining and rappelling into a cenote. The kids (ages 6 & 9) said ziplining was their favorite part of the trip-rappelling into cenote was trickest part and you'd have to know if your kids are adventurous enough to handle it. Be aware that they didn't serve lunch until after 2:30 so eat a large breakfast and take a snack with for after Coba visit. My other tip is if you have kids don't forget to pack Children's Tylenol or Motrin-my son got a fever and I had to search mulitiple stores for an equivalent and then couldn't read Spanish and doses were based on weight in kg so was confusing.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: BACKTOREALITYUsa
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st time to a RIU resort. The 1st night we got a room in back with no view at all & a few items didn't work well. We simply mentioned it to the front desk & the next day when folks checked out, we moved to a different room with a Garden View (Much better). The rooms are not that fancy but we were only there to take a shower & sleep. I did notice mosquito's in some locations but was not bitten one time. There were two pools, one for the roudier crowd & one if you prefer to sit back & relax which I enjoyed. We had trouble finding chairs on the beach day 1 but after that no trouble at all. There is a wonderful breeze off the ocean so be careful. You may feel like your not getting hot but I can guarentee you'll leave red (ha). The ocean water was getting warmer & warmer each day that we were there - not too bad. This was definitely worth the 3 1/2 star rating it receives. I normally stay at 5 star but was pleased with this hotel. The landscaping is beautfil & I definitely recommend walking down to the sister hotel RIU Yucatan. It was very nice. There are shops directly across the street & we also took a $5(US) cab ride to 5th avenue to do more shopping. We actually went there 2 days out of our 7 night stay & still didn't hit all the shops. The staff is very accommodating. We booked through Fun Jet & the rep there at the hotel (Omar) was very helpful. If there is something you don't like, simply mention it & I'm sure they'll accomodate.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Playacar, Nice place with hardworking staff”
Reviews.Author: RBH0960
Reviews.Content: Statyed at the RIU Playacar for 7 nights March 3-10. The staff and service was top notch. Everyone really tried to please. The room was nice, a little damp but that may be the case for all rooms in the region (this was our first trip.) I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the place. The bed was hard but the hotel provided an extra pad and that did help. The food was pretty good. There was a huge selection but it was the same every night. It wasn't gourmet tasty but it was edible. The grounds were well manicured, clean, and pretty. The beach was nice and was one of the larger ones in the area. Only saw two shows but they were pretty good. We enjoyed our stay. We booked our trip through Worry-Free Travel and was very impressed with that as well. Our only really negative experience was with the Worry-Free Rep at the hotel "Oliver". He was really helpful at first but once we had purchased our excursions through him (he gets commission on these) he was no longer very helpful. In fact he really copped an attitude when we requested our money back on a fishing excursion that was not going out due to rough waters. But, even "Oliver" didn't really diminish our enjoyment of the facilities. He is not an employee of the hotel and shouldn't deter anyone from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “First trip away...and would definately go back =)”
Reviews.Author: J0lene
Reviews.Content: The service was up and down. Certain areas were fab and others definately need some work. Our check in was fast with no problems. The staff were friendly to us when we arrived at 0130 in the am, we were so excited to finally be there. Alberto, our cleaning guy, was fantastic!!! You only get two one liters of water in your fridge for every two days...so stalk up when you see the cart down the hall..as we learned on the last two days of our trip. The room was great, all you would expect for being at the carribean sea..who stays in their room anyhow,, they were very clean. The alcohol dispensers were ok, I didn't really care for any of the booze in my room, but my friends next door had different brands that were much, much,, much,, better!! The Night life is great, the shows are mezmorizing.. we just loved it so much. We went to all of the 3 hotels and the service at all were fantastic! Your beach is beautiful, one of the best on the strip. Our travel agent told us to purchase our excursions thru her, and we couldn't find her so we went to the people right beside the front desk, and it was definately worth it. It was cheaper to buy through them (approx 13$ american), we went to the guy right beside the path to the rooms. The buses were clean and safe. The driver and the other guy explained everything and were very helpful. There was no need to feel leary about using these guys. We went to playa del carmen a couple times, didn't find that the shopping was very cheap, but it was a great time. We went to Senor Frogs and had a wild time!! The service there was far beyond what we expected! The food was good, a bit repetitive, but good enough! All the hotels have the same selection, which kinda made us sad because we thought we would get something else but no such luck. They were all the same. Bring some good shoes if you plan on walking around lots, my first time here, and I didn't realize how much your feet swell... needless to say, I wasn't wearing my dancing shoes around the clock! My date is a light sleeper, so this hotel was great. It wasn't the party scene, but it was only a short walk to the party if that is what you are looking for. The traffic was light into the night. Oh Yeah, one more thing,, the calling cards we bought from Walmart in Canada didn't work in Mexico,, so if you have little ones at home that you need to call, make sure to get the proper calling card, as the hotel charges an arm and a leg,, as well as,, 2$ per each time you use the phone to call with a calling card! We would stay at a Riu hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Third Stay at the Playacar.....just as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: Bartor
Reviews.Content: Travelled Feb 9 to 16th. As the title says, this was our third trip to this resort. This time, however, was for our wedding. That in itself should suggest what we think of the Riu Playacar and its staff. Here's the low down on what to expect. Rooms: Are spacious enough for what they're being used for. They are cleaned daily and the bar fridge is serviced every second day. If you need something for the fridge on the non-serviced day then simply call the front desk and ask them nicely to send you up whatever you need. And of course please remember to tip the person for their service...that goes for the chamber maid as well. Food: There are three a la carte restaurants and a buffet. But don't cringe at the thought of buffet food for a week. There is a massive selection of really good food here.....for both the meat-eater and the vegetarian. Try the banana milk at the morning buffet, so good. The breakfast and dinner buffets are served at the main buffet off of the main lobby. The lunch buffet is served at the Turquesa restaurant which is located beside the beach and pool. On occasion they serve a barbeque meal at or near the pool as well. Service & Staff: Incredible! Each person that we have interacted with over the course of our three visits has been wonderful. Special thanks to Management - Helena and Sebastian; Front Desk - Claudia, Aldo, Jorge, Gilberto and Juan Carlos; Chamber Maid - Maria; Bar Servers - Osvaldo, Benjamin and the rest of that crazy crowd; and of course all the fabulous folks working their collective behinds off to ensure people have a great stay. Beach & Pool: Despite the beach decay that has been taking place for the past little while, and the sand bags placed in the ocean to help slow that decay, the beach is a wonderful place to relax, tan, swim and enjoy the sounds of the water. For those who prefer having a few beverages throughout the day, while soaking themselves, then the pool bar is a great alternative. Be forewarned however that when you least expect it you may receive a spray of water from the liquid dispenser behind the bar....courtesy of one of the bartenders of course. Activities & Entertainment: There are plenty of activities available on the resort. The Entertainment Team have a variety of games etc that they do each day with folks at the resort....such as: Air Rifle Shooting, Darts, Ping Pong, Water Polo, Water Aerobics, Bingo, Dance Lessons etc etc. Lots of fun and very interactive team. Down at the beach you have access to a variety of water-related activities. In the evening the resort puts on a stage show. Each night is different. If you're only going to see one, however, do yourself a favour and go see the Mayan Show. If you happen to enjoy watching dancers than you'll want to see some of the other shows as well. Tours & Other off resort happenings: There are plenty of half and full day excursions available if you want to see things off the resort. The trip to Xcaret Park is worthwhile. They have a show in the evening that'll blow your socks off. The Tulum Ruins are also a fairly short distance from the resort. You have a few choices when it comes to travelling to any of these places. You can get an authentic Mexican experience by taking the Collectivo van to your destination (this is the way many locals travel - A trip to Tulum Pueblo (town) cost us approximately $2 each - 1/2 hour to 40 minute drive). A private van can be arranged through the front desk (round trip to the Tulum ruins costs $120. The driver waits for you for whatever timeframe you've pre-arranged....you also don't pay until he/she drops you back at the resort). BTW, the entrance fee to the ruins is $5. If you'd prefer to have an arranged or guided tour then talk to the folks from the various tour companies located in the lobby. If you're into shopping then you can either walk 30 minutes or a 5 minute $5 taxi ride down to 5th Avenue with several blocks of restaurants, shopping and night clubs. It's definitely a tourist trap area but it is worth going down. You'll find some good deals and you'll also be able to haggle. Everyone stands outside their stores and asks you to come in. Some are more creative than others in what they say to bring you in....like one guy who uses the line "we have the best and rip you off for less" Bonus: When you stay at the Playacar you have access to three of the other resorts in the Riu complex: Lupita (with the golf course, fees apply for golf), Tequila (across the street...this resort has the disco), and the Yucatan. Conclusion: This resort and its staff are wonderful and we highly recommend it. We cant wait to go for the 4th trip! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “5 apple deal was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: michael94
Reviews.Content: We opted for the 4 apple square deal and this was the hotel we got. We were alittle apprehensive about not knowing where we would be sent, but aso felt like a adventure would be fun, we were limited on vacation time so we said what the heck. Well we had a great time many of the reveiws do have some common truth, { musty-reservation problems, etc} , However this hotel also has a great staff, good food. and a better oppurtunity to mingle and make friends. This was our first time to Mexico, During our stay we were offered a random selection to stay at the riu palace mexico. We gave it a try it is a gorgous hotel and the food is better, not sure what the price difference would be if elected however people dont mingle as much, had more fun at the smaller hotel. We would definately book a apple trip again they saisfied us, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “I´m Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: pst7300
Reviews.Content: Perfect for famely with children.Casual and nice. Good food and drinks (known labels), nice staff, Best part of Bech in Playacar. The Children loved the Mini Club and Mini Disco. The Entertaiment was OK ,and the animation team was not overkill, fun and games. Playacar shopping center ( pharmacy ,ATM ++) just across the street. Could walk or take a Taxi (almost for free) to Playa del Carmen. Beds and room OK, get an extra top if you want a softer bed. Got an offer to upgrade to the RIU Palace (no extra charge)

Reviews.Title: “great beach and pool”
Reviews.Author: SJE83
Reviews.Content: The best part of the RIU Playacar is the beach and the availablity of chairs. We had no trouble getting chairs at the pool or beach. We heard at neighboring places you had to put you towel out at 7am. Didn't care for the solicitors with cigars, jewlery, etc on the beach. The beach frontage was better than neighboring resorts. Rooms were fine, we were not it it much. Didn't have any theft issues and were greeted with different towel animals daily. Don't stay in buildings 5 or 6 as they are noisy. The food was good. The Asain restaurant was not so good. I don't understand that it says dress is formal for dinner, men wear trousers. Dress was casual. I didn't like the fact that you had to make dinner reservations at 7am. Service was good, but don't expect to be waited on. You have to go to the bar for a drink, no chairside service at the pool or beach. The service people are pleasant. The entertainment was cute. The host is entertaining, better than the one at the Tequila. We went to the Tequila, only to see the same show at our place the next night. Acoustics weren't so good there. The Yucatan looks very nice, more jungle like and the Palace is more contemporary, not as much greenery. We took two day trips, one snorkeling with Mystic snorkeling, which was very good, and the other with Alltournative: Tulum, zipline. It too was great. The location of this resort is great. A short walk or $5.00 cab ride to town, or shopping right across the street. We walked every morning and saw the resorts streetside. It is a very safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: rubygreta
Reviews.Content: Rather than discuss the superlatives of the Riu Playacar, I will discuss some of the criticisms found on this site. 1) - The room is musty - There is a simple solution to this problem: open the sliding glass door and turn on the ceiling fan. Within a few minutes we smelled nothing. If still concerned bring a Glade Plug-In. 2) - The beach was small; there were not enough chairs - The beach is GORGEOUS. It is not small, there are plenty of chairs, plenty of shade, and you don't have to sit close to anyone if you choose not to. The blue water was the perfect temperature in February. 3) - The sandbags on the beach were an eyesore, they polluted the water - The sandbags look like large boulders. They are actually attractive. And the water is crystal clear. 4) - Bedbugs and roaches - There were no bedbugs and no roaches! 5) - Front desk was not friendly - Front desk, and all the employees, were extraordinarily friendly, despite the language barrier. 6) - The buffet was mediocre or worse; same food everyday - The buffet was incredible. Sure not every dish was wonderful. But with such an incredible choice of dishes, who really cares? And the buffet changed everyday. 6) - Thin walls, lots of noise - We heard absolutly nothing from our neighbors during a sold out week. 7) - This is not a 5-star hotel - That's right, it's not a 5-star hotel. According to Trip Advisor it is a 3-star hotel. So don't come here if you are expecting 5-stars. But this is probably the best 3-star hotel you will stay at. 8) - The pillows are thin and the beds are hard - This is true. But you can bring your own pillows. Not much you can do about the bed. But between my excessive eating, drinking, sunning and touring, I probably could have slept on the floor. 9) - The Japanese restaurant is lousy - Correct! Solution to the problem - don't eat there! So enjoy your stay at RIU Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an all inclusive holiday”
Reviews.Author: Miss-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly place. My only complaint (which was partly my fault) was that we had a gold chain stolen from the room. Please use the safety box provided and put everything in...I mean everything! Good choice of food although I found the entertainment team a bit irritating. Still humming the annoying 'follow the leader' tune some 3 months later! Beach is not spoiled by the sand bags, they just look like huge whales. Make an effort to see the ruins at Chitzen Itza. You will have a fab time!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: cdyak49157
Reviews.Content: I just returned home today and I am ready to go back. I had on of the best times I've had in a long time. I read many reviews of this place after my wife booked it and before we left and i was a little concerned but i had no reason. As far as the complaints about the rooms, they were fine. Yes, there was a smell in the rooms but ater the first hour I didn't even notice it again. The beds were very hard but I like a firm bed and we were so tired from the days activities it was not much of an issue. The staff was great, lots of fun and freindly as you can get. The food was fine, not great but fine. The lunch selection was limited and the same every day. The Asian restaurant was not good at all. The steak restaurant was good and the main buffet was good. We walked the beach in both directions and agree that Riu Payacar has with out doubt one of the best in the area. The pool was good as well. The place is kept very well and always clean. The night time entertainment was weak but we were mostly too tired to stay up late anyway. The best part of this place is its size. Its not too big that you get lost and its small enough that you get to meet people and develope freindships which to me is important. We were only there for 5 days and by the last day we were walking around calling guest and employee's by name. I would go back and most likey will.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say, it's a Riu”
Reviews.Author: Snowflake
Reviews.Content: Jan 31, to Feb 7, 2009 This is my second time with the Riu chain, and we were not dissappointed. The first time at the Playacar but not because we booked it. We orginally booked with the Lupita but when we arrived at their front desk the Senorita was excitted to tell us that we had received a free upgrade. And not just a bigger room, but to the Riu on the beach. whaahooo. And not only we were getting a free upgrade but they were paying for the cab ride to get there. Which was waiting for us as we spoke. The rest of our vacation stayed at par with our good fortunes. The Playacar had our room, safe keys, towel cards all waiting for us, which was at about 11:45pm. The maid had left a note that if there was anything we needed -just ask. By the time we returned back to our room after the beach the next day, she had 2 more pillows and diet - sorry - pepsi light in our mini fridge - everyday too! The room was nice and clean, tv, a/c, ceiling fan, safe, shower, digital alarm clock, (iron and board I didn't use)1600 watt mini blowdryer, everything worked fine. The shower had a european shower massager, with lots of hot water and excellent pressure. The resort has a simple, yet pretty layout. 3 buildings, 3 stories high, on each side of the walkway to the beach. The main buffet at the top, and the beach, pool, theatre and snack bar at the bottom. It's not too big and not too small. A comfortable, downtoearth feel to it, with the Riu touch to everything. Painted ceilings, big chandaliers, bed lamps on the walls, 4 liqour bottles in your room, mini fridge, tree toparies. The pool was a fair size, but man was the water cold. I suppose if the weather that week wasn't on the cooler side, I would have enjoed the cool dip. I think there were just enough chairs for everyone who wanted to be there. At least they couldn't fit anymore around the deck, Lots of trees and huts for shade. Swim up bar, with extra table and chairs on deck for drinks and a game of cards. The beach has grown since the sand whales went in. So there's lots of room on the sand, and in the tree line for chairs. We were on the beach at around 9 or so, and were usually the first few there. I only found towel savers there once, maybe twice. But then again, the weather was cooler that week, so maybe there wasn't a mad dash for the beach. It was red flagged every single day, one yellow flag one morning. The waves were fun, but the lifequard was always making sure you weren't much past your waist. We fed the fish right off shore some bread, and the kids had fun being swarmed by these white silvery little fish- otherwise we never saw them. Pelicans were always around, diving in the ocean here and there, on the other side of the sand whales, catching their meals. The beach snack bar had good food, hamburgs, fries, hot dogs, a variety of pizza, ice cream with sprinkles, fruit, cold cuts and cheeses, salads, desserts, a nacho table with dips and chips, and melted cheese etc, popcorn, cooked veges, chicken and pork, pop, beer, ice, coffee and cappacino machine. The main buffet also had the above, for breakfast, well anything and everything. Yogurts, cereals, eggs, pancakes- sometimes with chocolate inside, sugary donuts, buns with chocolate inside, juices, bacon, sausage, ......MG isn't no wonder I alone gained 6 lbs. The entertainment at night was okay, a good mexican show, and mariachia show was good. And you could go to the other non Palace Riu to have breaky, lunch or do the shows there, so there's plenty of variety - if nothing else but just to do the same at another resort. They also had airgun, darts, volleyball, tennis (nice new rackets), water fitness, beach games to get you off your butts for a few minutes. I never found the staff to be pushy or overaggressive to get you to join in. Or the music too loud. The odd time someone would come around at the beach to sell silver chains, or parasailing $50/pers on etc, but even a no nod was enough. Oh - massage on the beach too - $59/hour. We took a cab to 5th ave. $5us each way. Or you can walk. Lots of tourist doing that, or bike riding. 25 mins or so they say to walk it. Good shopping for souvieners, Mcdonalds was on at least 2 corners. Places for a drink or twooooo. Ferries to cozumel. Little Cathlic Church. Beach for swimming. Glad we went. Across the little street at the Riu, there is also a little shopping mall. Internet is a little cheaper there, $3/half hour. $8/hour at the Riu. It's in behind the plaza at the Kodac shop - (I think that's what is was called - you'll find it easy) Couldn't complain about anything except the weather and the red flags. But what can yea do. I loved Mexico, and all the staff seemed geniunely happy to serve or help you. whistling while they worked. And could speak perfect english. It's funny to watch them wait for you to speak so they know what language to reply in. I did have the foresight to ask the tour operator to make sure we were on the "new" resort pick up list for the return home. Good thing I asked, because the Riu didn't tell them we had been upgraded to a different hotel-----altho a longer stay would have be excepted :)

Reviews.Title: “Service - Great, Rooms - Not So Great!”
Reviews.Author: yrhgrb
Reviews.Content: The hotel common areas (pool, dining areas, etc.) were clean and very nice. The staff was great. Everyone was friendly and on top of clearing plates and getting drinks. We had an issue with our toilet in the room and within 5 minutes, someone was there to fix the problem. The food was very good. You have your choice of three "full service" dining specialities (Steak, Asian or Mexican) or the buffet for dinner. If you don't like your chosen full service dinner choice, you can always go to the buffet after. You do not have to dress up as stated on the web site. You will not be out of place with shorts on. If you want to use the gym or spa, you must go to one of the "sister" Riu hotels down the street. The hotel is just under 2 miles to downtown Playa Del Carmen and was a great walk through a nice neighborhood. The room had a musty smell to it. If you don't get a suite, you don't get a tub (just a small shower with no light fixture). The beds are hard. We had a standard room and there were 2 double beds pushed together to make a king bed (but they are separate beds). The suites have a queen size bed and larger balconies - same musty smell though). There are 2 small wicker chairs and a small table in the room but not very comfortable. We stayed in one of the buildings closest to the pool and entertainment area. We heard the microphone and music in the room during the day and every night at 930pm, they have live entertainment that runs until 11pm. it is very difficult to sleep while the entertainment is on stage. We went with a larger group and everyone had a nice time. We spent most of our time by the pool or doing other activites because we weren't fond of hanging out in the musty room. If we return to Playa Del Carmen, we would stay at the Riu Palace in hopes of a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, fantastic location and service.”
Reviews.Author: venusvext
Reviews.Content: We visited Riu Playacar from February 8th through 15th, 2009. We are seasoned travelers to the Mayan Riviera, one of our favorite vacation areas. Check in took about 15 minutes. During the wait we were greeted with juices and smiles. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Our initial room was on the ground floor level. It was very musky and smelly and we soon were moved up to a second floor room which was ideal. Rooms aren't as swanky as some of the newer resorts but they are comfortable and pretty spacious. Each room features a bar with four hard liquors and a daily replenishment of beer, water and soft drinks. The balcony is a nice place to sit and relax with a snack after a day in the hot sun. We had lots of fun feeding the birds from there. Walk to our room was quick as Riu Playacar is one of the smaller resorts in the area. The complex consists of six three story buildings so wherever you end up staying it's just steps from the beach, pools or restaurants. It's very convenient. The grounds are green and lush, filled with flowers and trees. Another perk is the small shopping plaza across the street from the resort. Whether you want to grab some Starbucks, buy last minute gifts or get medicine, the mall is open until about 11pm daily and is a nice post-dinner activity. If you feel more adventurous, walk (about 20 minutes) or take a 50 peso / $4 cab ride to the center of Playa del Carmen for more shopping, dining and nightlife. The main swimming pool was big, clean and consisted of two smaller pools. The water was refreshing but not too cold. The swim-up bar was popular with rowdier crowds who enjoyed drinking, dancing and smoking in the pool. The lounge chairs filled up pretty quickly around the pools but since we like to sleep in and prefer the beach anyway, we had no problems with finding chairs by the sea around noon. Even though the beaches in the area have noticeable eroded over the last year, the Riu Playacar beach was one of the nicer ones in the area. Ever since a drowning accident at the beginning of the year, the Riu lifeguards were particularly attentive since the waves were high and easily pulled the swimmers in. There are three bars at the resort: at the lobby, by the pools and by one of the restaurants close to the beach. The drinks are mediocre but if you ask for the top shelf liquors, they can be much better. Even though this is an all-inclusive, the bartenders and staff really appreciates tips. We brought $100 in singles and tipped all over the resort. Food was one of the best highlight of the entire experience. Whether breakfast, lunch or dinner, everything was fresh and there was [plenty to choose from. The cooks and servers made sure that all items were quickly replenished. There are three restaurants at the resort but we actually enjoyed dinners at the buffet much better. The steakhouse restaurant was good, the Asian one was forgettable and we never made it to the Mexican one. If you choose to dine at one of them, unlike at some other resorts there is no drama with getting a reservation. You simply ask one of the servers at breakfast. Over all our week-long stay at Riu Playacar was a great one. It's nice to stay at a smaller resort for a change. We didn't have to worry about anything. If we ran out of drinking water in our room, room-service was at our door within minutes. At nights the grounds were calm and quiet. We highly recommend it for romantic getaways and family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: MLTWashingtonState
