Reviews.Content: Walls ARE thin...bring earplugs...if you forget them, they sell them across the street. Other than that...trip was awesome. If your paroniod about being ripped off..use the safe and keep the do not disturd sign on the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: ChiefRockford_IL
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday, and I can tell you that we WILL be going back to the RIU Playacar! Very clean, very friendly! Nice size not to big. Food was Very good. The staff was very helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: simms2009
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar was dissappointing on many levels. The beach is small and there aren't enough chairs for the many guests. The food was terrible and the beds were horrible. I would not recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: scoobyWisconsin
Reviews.Content: The few good aspects: good food quality; generally clean resort; smiling friendly staff. But, way too many problems / issues. Our accommodation requests for a top floor, two beds, nonsmoking, quiet area, were not honored. Had to wait at check in for another room with two beds, but the other requests were never addressed. Power out issue once. Cold water out one day. The late night and very early morning noise level from garbage trucks , vehicles and staff from the adjoining resort were unacceptable (for anyone). Some requests made to housekeeping, and the front desk, verbally and in writing, were never acted on. For example, the vanity light burned out which left us showering in the dark (very carefully) and unable to use the vanity area (luckily, I had packed a small flashlight). TV reception was terrible. Requested a couple of extra pillows the first two days, which never came. The buffet lacked variety of choices from day to day ... repetitious. The final negative was the sighting of a cockroach in a clean plate cabinet / dispenser in the buffet. The buffet staff and front desk were told, which I assumed would lead to some sort of action or effort to rectify the issue ... nothing. We’ve been traveling to the area for many years to resorts which I would rate from a 4 to a 6. The Riu Playacar should be down rated to a two or three (depending upon the rating source), but nevertheless will NOT be on our list of return sites.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Repeat Visit is in the Future”
Reviews.Author: Goldenmomof3
Reviews.Content: My son & his fiance planned their Feb 3, 2009 wedding @ the Playacar along with over 50 guests. The booking was done through Sunquest. What a great choice they made. We were met by Sunquest personal in Cancun for our bus ride to Playa del Carmen. One word of warning - be careful of the people who bombard you at the airport with an offer to carry your luggage as they're scam artists with the goal of lightening your wallet. There were reports of charges up to $70 US for carrying your baggage only a short distance. The bus ride was air conditioned and cold beer was offered at a cost of $3 US (no all inclusive yet!) As well, tipping is expected for the driver and the hosts! Our arrival @ the hotel at about 12:30 pm was basically unorganized and most rooms were not ready. We had a Jr. suite & our room was available. Most of the wedding party were left to wander the resort for the next few hours while rooms were readied. Some guests were assigned rooms but needed to move the next day. The bride & groom did not receive their room upgrade to a Jr. Suite but they were ok with the regular room. We only received one key for the room which presented a bit of a problem when we lost our key. The front desk clerk told us that there wasn't a second key & we were to contact the maid when we needed to get access to our room. Yeah right! We contacted the hospitality manager who told us to get a key from the front desk - told him that they wouldn't help us. Within 2 minutes, we rec'd a call telling us that they had a key for us but it would be $20 US!!!! Hubby went to pick up key, refused to pay & was given 2 keys???????? Lock your valuables in the safe as there doesn't appear to be organization in this area although there were no reports of theft. The front desk clerk was very upset that we had reported this situation and that he had received a notice from his supervisor about poor service. The rooms were clean and well stocked with bar including bottled water, soft drinks, mineral water and beer. There are no kingsized beds but (2) queens made separately & pushed together. It was reported that the beds were hard but we enjoy a very firm bed - others complained about this. The sheets were a bit pilly but we're used to very high grade sheets. I had read reports that the rooms had a musty smell so packed Febreeze - our room was fine but I did notice that other rooms had "that" smell so passed along the Febreeze. My daughter & hubby travelled with their 4.5 month old son & requested a crib - the crib was not used as it definitely didn't come up to Canadian standards (spacing of rails was very oversized & we didn't consider safe). The water in the rooms is NOT drinkable although I brushed my teeth with it and NO problems. In fact, I didn't hear any reports of intestinal issues On the EXCELLENT side - the food is excellent & very plentiful, the bar staff will make you anything & ready to suggest new choices, there is always something going on (if you want to do the organized activities), the entertainment staff are encouraging & very friendly, the evening shows are great & the layout of the resort is easy to get around and very attractive. The staff were also more than helpful for any requests regarding the baby. We participated in the morning beach exercise (more of a stretching/ Yoga but wonderful for the travel aches and a great start to the day), beach volleyball and water aerobics. Great way to meet others & wear off some of the extra calories consumed. By the way, the food consumed in Mexico has NO calories!!!! Regarding the food - there are LOTS of fresh fruit, veggies & low fat food choices including grilled fish choices. Dinner choices include the a la carte Mexicano, Steakhouse & Asian choices and the buffet. We tried all & not impressed by the Asian - overly sauced & not a la carte but buffet style. The most favoured choice was the general buffet - lots of excellent choices including seafood and an absolutely wonderful dessert bar (my favourite - sweet potato pie!!!!!) and you don't have to book your seating time - leaves your schedule totally open. Although it is an all inclusive resort, tipping IS expected. We left a tip for the maid on the first day & superior service was given compared to those who didn't tip. Bar/restaurant staff are included in this so make sure to take along smaller US$ bills with you - Canadian $$$ is not appreciated! We travelled by taxi ($5 US each way) into town for some shopping. It is a bit intimidating as the merchants are a bit aggressive. We were advised by our Sunquest rep to go after 6 pm (shops open till 10 pm) and offer 1/2 of the requested price then start bartering. I bought some great silver jewellery pieces but really shopped around before buying. I paid $120 US for a necklace with a pair of earrings thrown in but other shops offered the same piece but for a min $300 US. Liquor is also very cheap - 40 oz Kahlua for $10.60 US and tequila for $13. We also noted that the duty free in Cancun has excellent prices for liquor but not as good as town. The beach is great with sand resembling light brown sugar. The "bags" in the water are not the most attractive but didn't cause any problems - actually protected us against the heavy waves experienced. Other resorts had minimal beach access due to the bags. While we were there, the red flag (stay out of the water due to strong waves & undertow) was out 4 days and access to sea kayaks, boogie boards, catamarans, etc was not available. Yes, you can walk forever along the beach front! There is also lots of shade available both on the beach & around the pools - lots of lounge chairs available as well! The wedding was very organized and staff were great! An absolutely beautiful event (I do understand that flowers were quite expensive) Would we go back - most definitely. We didn't have time (due to the wedding to visit any ruins or other sights. We were there for relaxation and definitely got that! Also we met some absolutely wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kickerssoccermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got engaged at the Riu Maya Riviera Palace in January 2008 and loved the Riu. We were to stay at the Yucatan, but got upgraded. Although I loved that hotel it is a lot fancier than the Playacar. We had 16 of us along on our wedding trip from Jan. 8th 2009-Jan. 15th 2009. I enjoyed this hotel more just because it seemed to be more relaxed. The food was great the rooms are nice. People always say there is a musty smell "hello we are on the ocean" open up your door for 10 min. and it goes away. Staff was wonderful and the entertainment staff was awesome!! Thanks to Adolpho, Carlo, Carlos, Aaron, Chubakka for everything. Meet the entertainment staff, they work really hard and are very interesting individuals. I did not see much of the theater as we were on the go. Try the Steakhouse because it was fantastic. Now for the really fun part, the wedding. My close friend set up all the travel arrangements and worked with the wedding coordinator on everything. As far as I know everything went as planned and did not hear of any problems. To have a wedding in Mexico you really do need to be ok with the Spontaneity of it all. If you are someone who needs to know where, when, how and why and will need everything in its place this is not for you!! I really let everything take it's own coarse and it really did work out wonderfully. I was really nervous because we did have rain our last half of the trip and 15 min. before our beachside wedding it started to sprinkle. We did have the choice to go to the beautiful Riu Palace chaple, but we risked it and the rain held off!! I found my dress right across the street at the shops (many to pick from!!) and Terry found his shirt in town. We all went downtown to Bad Boys for some drinks after the wedding. Thanks Char (bartender we know from home) and Captain Dave (owner) for having us. Then back to the hotel to have our reception at the Steakhouse. The food was wonderful and the staff was so nice and attentive. I really couldn't have asked for a nicer place to have my wedding. It was just an amazing and fun time that I am ready to go back. I have no complaints. Not everything can be perfect, but we really did not have any issues. I added some pictures, but I was in a hurry. If I can I will try to change some of these.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation in a smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melate
Reviews.Content: We loved the fact that we could see the beach from the pool area. The hotel is the perfect size...not too big and not too small. We could walk to the beach without exhausting ourselves (we are mid 40's and in pretty good shape) We will never go to another super sized hotel like Iberostar again. My feet cant take it! Everything was within one city block. Good points: liquor bar in room with actual booze, large size water bottles in the fridge, fun shows, one of the better beach areas considering the erosion and sand bags on the other beaches, Starbucks and shopping area across the street, Playa Del Carmen within walking distance, we could visit the other RIU's for lunch, disco, drinks, awesome bar staff in the main lobby Negatives: the beds are hard, the guacamole wasnt up to standards---too much lime, the entire hotel lost plumbing for a couple of hours (obviously not within their control), rain

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here.”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Sartori_2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property Jan 18-25, 2009. 35 minute ride down from the Cancun airport. This resort is 1.5 miles south of Playa del Carmen. Can walk to 5th Avenue in PDC which is well worth the trip. Great shops, restaurants, clubs, etc. $5US cab ride if you're lazy. Anyway, RIU treats you very well. Check in went smoothly. The property is situated in such a way that you walk down a pathway towards the beach with the lodging on your right and left. There are 3 bldgs on each side. The two closest bldg to the beach (#'s 5 & 6) are too close to the loud music and activites coming from the entertainment shell. Ask for rooms in blds 1,2,3, or 4 if you are going to bed before 10:30. Rooms themselves were just fine. Room safe should be used at all times. Maid service very, very prompt and good. Tip a $3 or $4 dollars a day......they're worth it. If items in fridge are not to your liking, leave a note indicating what you want. They'll comply. Food in all the restaurants and buffet was excellent, as was the service. Lobby usually bustling with activity, day and nite. Any questions about tours can be answered by reps available in the lobby most days. My wife and I played golf and, while expensive, we thought it was worth it. One thing though, the golf course with which the RIU is associated with is 1/2 hr drive away but they will take you there and pick you up for free. The course is the beautiful par 54 El Manglar. The Playacar Golf Club across the street from the RIU is $130 twilight rate but if you agree to the 2hr or so timeshare presentation, you can get your golf for 1/2 price all week. It's a very upscale course. Or just go over and use their driving range for pretty cheap. Overall trip was very good. Would recomment any RIU in the area. There are 5 of them and you have access to all but the Palace Resorts. Check out the Sports bar at the RIU Tequila accross the street. There is also a great not so little shopping center right nearby too. We pd about $1400 ea for this property, which inc. airfare.

Reviews.Title: “Man Drowns at RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: ReginaShine
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago tomorrow I witnessed a man drown at the Riu Playacar in Playa Del Carmen. I have not slept more than two hours a night since. I have many issues with this event that I need to share with you before I am able to let this go. There are many "lifeguards" sitting on top of towers pretending to know something about life saving in this area. Be warned. THEY DO NOT KNOW ANYTHING ABOUT LIFESAVING. The "lifeguard" swam out to "rescue" the man that was struggling in the water without ANY life saving device--even though there are at least four that I could count on the beach. Not surprisingly the rescue was unsucessful in waves as tall as my house with a dimwit with no life ring as the rescuer. There were red flags out that day--danger these flags mean stay out of the water. DANGER DANGER!!! The man that drown was a 73 year old man who should not have been swimming in the big waves and likely got on the wrong side of the sandbags(meant to keep the beach from eroding) I never saw how he got to the wrong side of the sandbags only that he could not get back to the shallow side. Many tourists attempted to help the initial rescuer while his boss from the playacar stood on the beach and watched. (with a little radio in his hand) He never got a backboard...got an airway...got a defibrillator..put towels down to lay the man on when they brought him in from the ocean, (let me guess--they've never seen anyone drown here before...) When we finally did get the man to the beach the Riu staff were useless. The lifeguard wanted to simply turn him on his side and pat his back. The man was lifeless, pulseless not to mention entirely blue. We initiated CPR. It took RIU over ten minutes before we had a venti mask. They NEVER HAD an airway or bagger. They got us a backboard after we had been doing CPR for 15 minutes already. The ambulance arrived after at LEAST 25 minutes. The ambulance driver never assesed the pt at all. She pronounced him dead without ever glancing at him. The management of RIU was more interested with removing the nuisance than with trying to save his life. I am horrified. I feel absolutely ill. I have never felt so helpless and frustrated. I felt there were many things that contributed to the untimely death of this man. 1)Sandbags--many times throughout our stay at PDC we saw people stranded on the "wrong" side of the sandbags--I'll bet there has been an increase in deaths from drowning in the area since the placement of the sandbags--we will likely never know as these things are not publicized. 2) Rescuer without any rescue aid and from my vantage point no rescue knowledge--I was shocked to realize that the RIU employee initially assisting me with this man had seemingly no knowledge of CPR. Three other nurses and a doctor and a firefighter (all tourists) attempted to resusitate this man for 25 minutes. 3)No equipment to aid in his rescue: no airways,ambubag, backboard or an AED--it is 2009 people!!! 4)THE DOCTOR FROM THE PLAYACAR NEVER ARRIVED ON SCENE--NOT EVER!!!!!!! 5)The ambulance took aver 25 minutes to arrive and even then carried faulty equipment and untrained ambulance attendants. I still feel awful for leaving this man's wife in the hands of that cold heartless ambulance attendant and the guy with the radio from RIU. I can only pray for her and her family. Travel safely with your families and be aware that you are on your own in Playa Del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - don't listen to the complainers!”
Reviews.Author: jwtreseler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu Playacar and had a fantastic 7 day vacation - 6 of us including my husband, 2 children (7 and 9), and my parents. Booked through Expedia - very helpful, no problems. Upgraded to suites (6212 and 6213) upon arrival - huge rooms but next to nighttime entertainment. We thought it would be a problem but we were all so tired that we fell asleep and it didn't bother us - usually over by midnight. I will say the shows didn't start until almost 10pm each night which got a bit late for the kids. That said, don't miss the 8:30pm mini disco - adorable! my favorite part of the trip. Food - excellent. (We have stayed at 4 all-inclusives in the Caribbean). Lots of selection - yes, a few of the same things every night but sometimes it's nice to have just pasta, salad...We tried the Mexican rest. one night - wouldn't do it again. Main dining just as good. Kids definitely didn't like it. fun to have nachos, popcorn available for snacks. The girls loved the smoothies and the bar staff was very kind to them. Beach - decent size, sort of crowded but what we expected considering there are about 15 resorts right there. I loved walking on the beach each day and if you are a runner - definitely hold off until 4-5 pm and run along the beach - another highlight of the trip. The caribbean was warmer than the pools (unheated but the kids swam in them) and bring some rolls to feed the fish - really fun! The fish swim around you and nibble at your fingers - the girls thought that was awesome! Don't swim out past or play on the sand bags....not smart. Kids club - a bit lacking compared to other places we have been but Chely was wonderful. Very sweet and kind to the kids. The girls loved being on stage every night and even participated in a show (Grease) the last night. Arts and crafts and games each day. Rooms - Hard to complain when we got upgraded but I would agree with prior comments about hard beds and a bad odor. That said, we were hardly ever in the rooms awake and I slept great every night. My parents (in their 70s) also slept fine. We requested cots for the girls as the "double" beds are really a just a bit bigger than singles. They slept fine, too. We locked our valuables but never had any problems. we left a tip ($3-5) each day and the staff made cute towel animals. The rooms are very clean as is the whole resort. Anyone who complains needs to lighten up a bit. Animation staff - Adolfo , Carlo and the rest were great. Always tried to get you to join in but weren't too pushy. They were always smiling and definitely got to know who we were. My husband wanted a CD of the music they played each night at the mini disco and they happily made a copy. Other stuff...Although expensive ($150pp) I recommend the 1 hour swim w/ the Dolphins through Dolphinus. The girls did it but my husband and I just watched and we wished we did it. An amazing experience. You are with 4 other people in the water w/ the dolphins for 1 hr...kissing, hugging, foot push ride. Only 15 minute ride from the Riu. The girls painted pottery at the beach. Again, I wish I did it - they touch it up for you (if you want) and then glaze/fire it...ready the next day. Wish I could remember the name of the Expedia guy in the lobby - he was awesome. AA lost my husband's luggage for 24 hrs and he was a big help. Also booked the Dolphin trip and return transfer. We would definitely return to this area as it's nice to shop across the street as well as WALK into town (took 20 minutes and very safe). We didn't use any of the other Riu's but you do have access to 3 others.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Playacar somewhat seasoned traveler review”
Reviews.Author: sleslie31
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the RIU PLayacar in Mexico. Let me start by saying that we are pretty seasoned travelers. We’ve stayed at all classes of hotels. From roach-fest’s to the Four Seasons in Kona, HI. I’ll share with you my thoughts for those planning on going there. The Good: This place is small. With that said, the staff really takes the time to get to know you. I didn’t feel like an occupant. I felt like a guest & they were happy we were there. Check-in & transfers were a breeze & well organized. The front desk people were very nice- Especially the girl with reddish hair (didn’t get her name). I think she is from Holland. This is not a place for someone snooty or someone pretending to be high class. It is laid back and everyone there – guests included - wanted to relax, be a little silly & have fun. Dining: The dining staff were great. If you sit in the same area for your meals, the waiters will remember your drinks and remember your name. They work tirelessly and hop on things right away. They paid individual attention to the kids that came through, making them feel special and welcome. The food was superb. Remember that you are at an all-inclusive environment. Some reviews said the food was the same all week. Not true. There is a different food theme every night. Then on top of that, they provide alternates that are the same. Like your basic pizza, pasta, burgers, salad. There was always something new to eat if you wanted to try it. The dining room is indoors and beautifully decorated & clean. I can say out of the 5 all-inclusive resorts we’ve done, the food was by far the best here. I will note though that it is a little dressier than other AI resorts we’ve been to. They enforce the ‘no muscle shirts’, etc at night. As for the specialty restaurants, we only did the Japanese. It was good, but if I had to do it over again, the main dining room was just as good. Pool: There are 2 pools. One is quieter and one has activities & the bar. There were plenty of palapa’s if you wanted shade. There were plenty of chairs & towels. The bar staff were great. Even when kids came up over & over for frozen smoothies, they made them just as friendly. Beach: Wonderful beach. By other reviews I thought it was going to be small and crowded. It was actually quite large. There are sand whales there, but that’s the same at all of the resorts. Please be careful to not swim past the sand whales. Even if you are one of those impervious men who think you ‘can handle it.’ The waves that crash you into the sand whales can, and have proven to be deadly very recently. On the lighter side; Lots of topless for the men. My husband was happy (Yes, American) If you have smaller kids, you may want to have a talk before the trip. My kids are about as embarrassing as they come & they were fine with it. We always just remind them that people do different things all over the world. Animation Staff: Excellent. They get to know you & your name. They work probably work 14 hours each day and NEVER run out of smiles. They get you involved and participating in games & activities. However they don’t cross the line like I’ve seen some animation teams do. If you are a loner, they will respect that too. To me the entertainment staff makes a big factor in the visit & these men/women were great & great with the kids too. There were a lot of kids there to my surprise (for January). Before we got there my kids said they were too old for the kids club, but they ended up loving it & begging to go. I don’t think a REALLY little kid would benefit from it. There isn’t a nursery like some places. But anyone between 3-10 will like it a lot. The Bad: The only thing I can really think of that stunk were the beds. Yes they are hard and the pillows are flat. But, we were so tired at the end of each day we didn’t have a problem. I think all Caribbean resorts must get the same beds from somewhere because they were bad in the Dominican Republic & the Bahamas too. The rooms are just fine. Not fancy by any means, but fine to live in for a week Now when I say that, I am comparing them to the Four Seasons, Kona & some of our less-than-adequate hotels in the past. The rooms here are very clean. Yes I did smell the sewage people talked about one day. But it was just about an hour & my husband didn’t even smell it. There also was that musty smell. But I have found that is the case in all Caribbean countries I’ve been to. It is such a warm & moist environment. I don’t think it can be escaped. After the initial smelling of it when we first got there, I didn’t notice it the rest of the time. In all this place is a great value for the money. My older son actually had tears in his eyes when we left. They said it was the best place ever. EVEN better than the Four Seasons, Kona. And it’s not $1000 a night! My suggestions: Use the Collectivo’s. If you aren’t familiar with them, read up on the internet. It’ll save you tons of money on travel expenses. From Playacar, you’ll need to take a taxi to the hwy. & that’s only a few dollars. Watch out in Playa Del Carmen. Everyone wants to make a buck & that’s how the bacon is brought home. Even Burger King ripped off my husband, charging him $6 for 2 medium cokes. His fault  There are no prices on the board & they guy said “I charge you what I want.” Wal-Mart isn’t worth the trip. I thought there’d be great tourist stuff deals, but not. Even the suntan lotion isn’t that much cheaper than in town. Don’t swim past the sand whales. IT IS DEADLY. There is shopping across the street, but it isn’t much cheaper than the hotel. Playacar is an affluent area with a lot of money. Go to town for stuff. Bring big cups with you. The drink glasses are cafeteria sized. We forgot ours this trip and hated it. Relax & don’t have unachievable expectations. Your vacation is what YOU make of it. If one small error in plans ruins it, you were probably looking for a reason to be upset anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great short getaway”
Reviews.Author: jvv123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have been to the Carribean side of Mexico several times and really just wanted clear blue water and a warm place to get away. We were very pleased with the RIU Playacar. We had access to all the other RIU hotels except for the RIU Palace. We've stayed in several all-inclusives and thought the food was good and believe it or not, the Asian restaurant was the best. The staff were all very friendly. We never had a problem with noise except for one night when a group came into town very late and were very loud. We called down to the front desk to inform them and rather then taking care of it immediately, they asked us to be patient, as the group just arrived from Spain. The noise didn't stop for 20 mintues. That was the only negative experience. The beds aren't particularly comfortable but we weren't expecting much. The airconditioning leaked one night but was promptly repaired. Having a minibar in the room was a nice touch and they refilled it every 2 days unless you requested otherwise. We used a shuttle company to get from the airport, which cost us $50 per person round trip and next time will just take a cab for an additional $10-15 dollars because it took quite a long time to get to the RIU. Just make sure you give yourself enough time to get back to the airport (at least 1 hour 15 minutes). The beach is very calm and nice but can be quite crowded. We would just walk to the other resorts and many times just pulled the chairs away from the crowd. Playa del Carmen is a quick 5 minute and $5 cab ride. The gym located at one of the other RIU's is small but nice. We also went running several times and the bike/pedestrian sidewalk is an easy out and in (we also ran to Playa). Since the whole community is gated, it's very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Premium Food!”
Reviews.Author: sanjerino
Reviews.Content: My wife,19 year old son and myself arrived on New Year's eve. We were treated to the finest meal I have ever had in my 58 years on this earth! Unlimited lobster tails,glazed Peking duck and anything else you have ever heard of. Actually the food for the whole 10 days there was just super. The place was clean,excellent service and friendly faces. This was our first all inclusive ever and may be our last. Although I throughly enjoyed all the hotel had to offer, after going into Playa del Carmen in the evening and seeing the fabulous places to eat,all in an open air setting, we spoke of other trips where we just rented the room and experimented each night at a new place.My wife said Playa seemed just like New Orleans at night; only clean and not rowdy! Musicians roamed the streets and people were in a party mood.I think the idea of a different place each night is still the most interesting for us. The only rip off was the snorkel tour that was arranged with an agent in the lobby. There were no fish,no fins,broken down boats and it was $130 US each. We went to the two other Riu's and they were also both very nice. We had great weather and a fun time. We did rent jet ski's next door at the other hotel and that was fun also. Be ready for lots of topless; I almost said be on the lookout but rephrased it.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Inclusive for the price”
Reviews.Author: oddtree
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here with no complaints. The staff was very friendly and the food and drinks were good. Nice pool with swim-up bar. Not too much room to swim around at the beach but the water was nice, and there seemed to be plenty of beach chairs. The location is a long walk or $5 cab to the main Playacar area. We never bothered going to the other Riu resorts since this had everything we wanted. Not the most spectacular all-inclusive I've ever been to. Sandals Ocho Rios wins that honor - but we booked 4 nights here for half the price as there, and it was quite a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Food”
Reviews.Author: XZJ
Reviews.Content: My mom, two kids and I just returned from nine days and 8 nights at the Riu Playacar, and the food and service were so wonderful that I've joined TripAdvisor to spread the word. We're usually very active travellers--lots of day trips--but we wanted a lazy vacation at the beach this time around, and this place was perfect. I'm leery of all-inclusives because the food is usually mediocre, but the buffet food here was great. Fresh, original, with a great variety to choose from. In fact, the regular buffets were better than the restaurants that required reservations (though the open-fire grilled chicken at the steakhouse was great). The resort was clean and well-maintained, and the people working were intelligent, kind, knowledgeable, and efficient. The only downsides--hard beds, very noisy show every night (if you don't want the noise, ask for a room away from the pool. All rooms are nice in terms of being close to the beach and pool and having a balcony, but we were right by the pool and so right by the noise), and not much for snorkeling right outside the hotel, but the kids (6 and 10) loved boogie-boarding and swimming. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “It Was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kimberleey1
Reviews.Content: What a great time!!!! The staff, especially Aldo at the front desk and all the bartenders (Antonio, Polito, Jose, etc...) were fantastic!! Everyone always smiled and said Hola which was very welcoming. The food was not the best food i have ever had, but it was good !The rooms were very nice. I had read all the reviews about the beds and i'm not sure if i was exhausted or drunk by the end of the day, but every night i slept like a baby.The rooms did have a musty smell, but you are in a warm humid climate...it went away after you were in the room for a few minutes. The grounds were very well kept and clean. The beach was great too! I don't understand people complaining about the sand whales. They are there to protect the beach so we can enjoy them for years to come. The beach and water was very clean and beautiful! So all in all, for the price and quality, I would go back there in a heart beat!!! Hasta la vista baby!!!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “great trip but rooms stink”
Reviews.Author: paris77777
Reviews.Content: Had a good time,good hotel but it's true rooms absolutly stink and i got food poison as well on christmas eve....The buffet is ok the first days but then its always the same.....But apart that hotel is good and the place and trips were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Kristine57
Reviews.Content: My 17 yo son and I went for spring break of March 2008. We had a wonderful time. The check in and check out process was simple. The food was very good with plenty of different variety at each buffet. We made reservations for the Asia and Steak restaurants and the food was also very good. The employees were constantly cleaning. Our room had a musty odor when we would enter but opening up the patio door for 10 minutes got rid of the smell. The beach was average size and you could always find a beach chair any time of the day. We only hung out at the pool only one day because the wind was blowing sand everywhere. There was entertainment everynight. They were not high production shows but I really did enjoy them. The activity staff (English speaking) had many activities during the day with many people participating. There are shops across the street from the hotel with very reasonable prices and the town is a 15 minute walk. There were spring breakers at the hotel with no problems from them. I did notice there were single parents bringing a teenager or two.

Reviews.Title: “we love rui and the people who work there”
Reviews.Author: UsaHappy
Reviews.Content: oh my gosh why do people have to complain . Your in mexico and why dont people work for 2.00 a hour lets get real ... The Rui is the most wonderful place my family of 28 go.. We have been to mexico 10 times this is out favorite place.. The food is the best. we have learned to respect mexico and they will respect you. we act rude they will follow because we are human. lets all be thankful and not compain about the things we are so lucky to have

Reviews.Title: “No longer a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: MexicoLovers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from Dec. 22 to Dec. 29 2008. Four of us, my wife and two daughters and we had two rooms. Although the location would still classify as a 5 star any other category would definitely not be of 5 star quality. This was our eighth trip to the Mayan Riviera. We have stayed at the Barcelo twice, the Palladium twice and an Iberostar three times. All of these other hotels would rank above the Riu Playacar in every category except location. The food and service was very good but not 5 star quality. The hotel and rooms were clean but are definitely beginning to show states of needing work done. Many things were not working early in our stay and never were fixed. Bathrooms at the beach restaurant had numerous things not working. Ice cream machine and drink machine stopped working and were simply covered up. My biggest concern was the smell of the room. It has a musty almost mouldy smell that was difficult to adjust to. I can still smell the scent on my suitcase and clothes. The air conditioner in the room had a three speed fan on it, but the temperature dial was not operational. (both rooms) Therefore if the air conditioner was left on all night, it got rather chilly in the room. Also my wife and I got food poisoning at the hotel on Christmas Eve. In talking to others later in our stay, we found out of at least 30 others who encountered a similar problem. If you want a close stay to Playa Del Carmen and a decent hotel the Riu Playacar will do. If you want true overall 5 star treatment go to the Iberostar Tucan-Quetzel or the Barcelo near Puerto Adventuras.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at the RIU PLAYACAR”
Reviews.Author: lisatoddwolf
Reviews.Content: Okay so this review will mostly be about our wedding experience, for those looking to get married at the RIU. But of course I will add our whole experience in as well. It may be long, but full of advice :) Quick background: I will start off by saying we really enjoyed the resort. The people were very, very friendly and we didn't venture far from our original resorts to the others. The food was great all breakfast, lunch and dinner. We met fun people there and really enjoyed our stay. The beach was nice as for the pool areas. Yeah you may hear the beds are hard, which they are a little tough, but not that bad! As for the wedding, there were some great things about it, but there were some bad. The good news, the bad can be prevented after reading this review. My husband and I had never been to this resort before, but we knew we wanted to get married in Mexico. We got to the hotel on a thursday, was married that Monday and left on Saturday. So we had 10 days to spend at the place. 12 of our close family and friends joined us for our special event. So for the good, the bad and the secret advice for anyone wanted to get married there. First the good: Our location for our ceremony was on the beach at 5:00PM and the reception followed at 6:45. It was beautiful. All day the spot is blocked off so people won't lay there. The ocean scene in the back, the white chair covers and flower were great. Although we did not mind at all, its not entirely private. You will have on lookers during your ceremony, BUT the staff does a great job to keep the far enough back where they are not intruding. My bouquett was absolutley gorgeous, and it was the one included in the wedding package!! (by the way, we got the royal wedding package) Our wedding photographer, again included in the package, was wonderful. We could not have asked for better pictures. Our package only included 12 pictures, but we ended up buying all 75 cause they were so beautiful. I got my hair done at the local spa in the resort and they did a good job! My sister and I both really liked ours. The reception after was so pretty. We chose the steak house which was nice cause we were some what away from other guests and by the area we got married. The chairs had our white covers on them and the food was great. The timing was perfect for pictures after the ceremony, a drink or two and time to eat! After dinner we decided to hit the town and ended up at Senior Frogs in playa del carmen. Everyone went and it was a blast. I recommend going off site to keep the celebration going, especially if you are ready to have a good time with dancing and drinks. Okay now for the bad: I asked my wedding coordinator months in advance to send me how the ceremony would go, in which she did. I did not like the vows that were going to be said so I wanted my own, which the wedding coordinator said would be fine and she would pass it along to minister. So I emailed her our owns vows/ring exchange vows that we wanted. I brought them with me to Mexico and she even made a copy of them again so the minister would have them. So along comes the moment, I walk down the aile and am standing their with my husband. The minister starts, and it was clear he did not know what he was doing. The time came where I assummed the vows would be exchanged. So the minister flipps through a binder for a couple minutes as we stand there waiting. and then the time comes to finally say our vows/ring exchanged, BUT they were not the vows that I had given to the wedding coordinator. The vows I said and my husband said were completely different!! Needless to say at that point I was upset. Then during the ceremony he made us sign the wedding certificate and take a picture, then he proceeded on. Not only was our vows completely wrong, the minister had no idea what he was doing and it frankly was an awful ceremony. If it had been in the states, I would had been mortified, but it was Mexico so what do ya do!! Actually as for the wedding itself, that was the only big deal that went wrong. I guess to me vows mean alot when getting married, so I was very upset about the whole thing. As for some of the stuff you pay for in the wedding packages, not so good. For one, they decorated our bed a day too early(no big deal), we never recieved our complementary gift and the breakfast in bed was not good at all. All it consisted of was dry toast, fruit, meat and cheese platter and coffee. So basically the wedding packages are pretty expensive for what you really get with them. All in All it was a beautiful wedding at a pretty location. Our pictures were great, the food was good and we were in good company. Advice: # 1 and most important Make sure your ceremony goes exactly how you want it to. To do that, you must be in constant contact with your wedding coordinator, but more importantly see if you can get in contact with your minister. As you read, our minister pretty much ruined our ceremony. So if you want a special touch into your ceremony make that very clear and talk with your wedding coordinator as soon as you can when you get to the resort. Negotiate with your wedding photographer to get as many pictures as you want for a better price then your wedding package says. They are contracted in so have nothing to do with the resort. We were able to get a great deal for our photos by doing this. If you don't want to pay for extra flowers, we went down town playa del carmen and bought flowers and made my bridesmaid flowers for $2.50! We also picked flowers from the resort to put in their hair :) If you are not happy with some of your wedding stuff, complain. My dad complained about our minister and we got $300 back!! although we can't take back our ceremony, atleast we got some money back. We had a great stay at the RIU and even though there was some bumps in the road, we would recommend it to anyone. If you have any questions or want to see more pictures I'd be more than happy to share!!

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: MMarsh6115
Reviews.Content: The food is inedible (even the specialty restaurant that we tried), the beds are rock hard, the beach is small, and the whole place is very noisy. When we complained to the manager, he was very defensive, and told us to go stay somewhere else, so we did. Also, upon arrival, we were only given one key, and were told to come back later and they'd make a copy (they use old-fashioned metal keys). The copy didn't work, so we had another one made. That one didn't work either. We stayed 3 nights, then moved to the Iberostar, which was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar - The Working Man's Paradise”
Reviews.Author: saverguy
Reviews.Content: These people go out of their way to give you a lot for your money. On the positive side, the food was very decent and well presented and plentiful. We stayed next door at the Wyndham last time and my biggest complaint was the bad food. The main dining room at the Riu Playacar serves lunch and dinner and has a beautiful patio area very similar to outdoor eating at a good restaurant; we never had a problem getting a seat. Lunch is served very close to the beach and pool vacinity so there is no need to go far to each lunch. One day while on my way to lunch I saw the staff coming down the path with a wagon carrying a Paella Pan that was about 4 feet wide. They were on their way to the beach to serve Paella to the guests! Also, at least a few times a day the staff came down with large trays of beer and tropical drinks which they don't do at the Wyndham. The pool was large and beautifullly landscaped, with lots of shade if you wanted it. It had a swimup pool bar, which the Wyndham did not. The place was in general far superior to the Wyndham and when you calculate that the Riu provides free shuttle service to the hotel from the Cancun Airport, the price gets closer. However, if you are looking for a sophisticated Club Med type atmosphere populated by people from Los Angeles or Manhattan who travel often to St. Barts or St. Martin, this is not the place and I would say none of the Riu hotels in Playacar are. They do not attract that type of crowd. I have very few criticisms of the Riu Playacar, the staff went out of their way to make it fun. Each room's fridge is always stocked with bottled water and Corona beer. The beds are a bit hard and the rooms basic. If there was any disappointment, it was that this year there are huge sandbags in the water to prevent further erosion to the beach. They did not have that last time I was in Playa. Some people used them as a slide. I plan to go back again and would recommend the Riu Playacar to anyone who understands that they should not take the four star rating the hotels give themselves too seriously. All and all it was a terrific value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good times at Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: ssaa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at the Riu Playacar. We booked it through the Riu website, it was a package deal that included our airfare, hotel and transfers. FLIGHT: We flew Frontier, the flight was on time and the bags were out quickly, so full marks to Frontier for that. Only irritation: no food for free, not even the nuts or chips. You could buy a sandwich, salad or snacks. On a international flight I except some food....oh well. TRANSFERS: Cancun airport was clean and quick, we were done and out with our bags in under 25 minutes. Our package included transfers, so we found the Riu rep in his blue t-shirt waiting just outside the exit. Had to wait almost 30 mins for the van and other travelers to show up, and then we were on our way to Playa Del Carmen (PDC). The ride takes about an hour, there was some construction, but almost no traffic at 5pm local time on a Thursday. CHECK IN/OUT: Was a breeze and they handed us our welcome drink. The lobby is open and airy, v.tropical. Service was friendly and warm. You could leave your bag for the bellhop to deliver, but we decided to just roll em down to our room ourselves. Check out was equally quick, we checked out at noon on a Monday, I don't know if the weekends are busier. ROOM: We were in building #5. The Playacar is the smallest Riu in PDC, with under 400 rooms divided into 6 small buildings. Our room was on the first (ground) floor. There are no elevators, so I was glad to be on the first floor. The room was also big, huge bed (2 doubles pushed together), the furniture looked in good condition. It was not luxurious or opulent, but it was clean and functional. We had a balcony, but never used it. I only noticed 3 things: the curtain liner was torn in places, the shower light would not work and the sink had no drain cover (don't let your rings fall off). Minor stuff, really, did not hamper my enjoyment of our stay at all. It is humid, and you can sometimes smell the dampness, but hey, you're in a jungle by the beach! Overall, I was satisfied with our room. The in-room bar was neat, but never used that either. The room had an ironing board, a hair drier, a dresser with 2 drawers, and a small fridge stocked with soda and water. TV had some english channels, we didn't really watch any TV, except for the weather. The mattress is v. firm, ask for a mattress topper if u are used to a soft bed. The towels and sheets were in good condition. The bathroom has a marble shower; separate toilet;a large vanity and one sink and a large closet with a safe in the dressing area that is separated from the room by curtains. HOUSEKEEPING: We had requested a roll-away, and it was already set up when we got our room. The room was cleaned well everyday, no complaints there. We got cute towel animals everyday as well. Asked for additional blankets/pillows, didn't get them right away, had to call back, and then we got them. THE BEACH: I love beaches, and this one was pretty nice. It was only a few minutes walk from our room (building 5 and 6 are closest to the pool/beach, but farthest from the lobby/main buffet). We had plenty of trees for shade, the sand was soft and wonderful. During our trip the weather was a lot cooler than normal and it was also very windy, the waves were choppy. On days that the sun did come out, the water was wonderfully warm. You could walk up and down the beach. We walked to the Yucatan and back. The big 'whales' are there, but it's no big deal...they don't really hamper your enjoyment of the beach. This was my first trip, if you've been there before, u might notice how the beach has been changed/damaged. But for first timers like us, it was still a great beach. I've been to various beaches - hawaii, florida, e.caribbean - and enjoyed this beach as well. Lots of chairs were always available. POOL: We didn't use it, they are not heated, and it wasn't warm enough. Lots of chairs were always available. The bar was fun, the drinks were pretty good. TOWELS: So they give u a towel card, and each person gets ONE, which u exchange for a towel near the pool. You will NOT get extra towels. So if you must have more than 1 towel for the beach or pool, get your own. If u lose the towel or card, it's a $20 fine, so keep those things safe. FOOD: Lots of variety, decent quality. B'fast was great, the smoothie bar was delicious. Lots of fruits at all the meals. The nacho bar was awesome. Overall, the food was pretty good. Desserts were mediocre. DRINKS: Free! Not top shelf, but still yummy. Alcohol flowed freely, lots of Pepsi products, juices, and an coffee machine for cappuccino, hot milk, milk coffee, espresso etc. They had bottled water in the room, which we carried around town/excursions. SISTER RESORTS: If you stay at the Playacar, you can drink/party at the Yucatan and the Tequila. These other resorts are huge, much larger than the Playacar and seem newer. The disco is in the Tequila, and it's freezing cold in there, but it was fun on Friday night. We went back on Sunday, and it was dead! The Pool bar at the Yucatan was great fun, J cruz...u rock. It was really cool to walk around and enjoy these other resorts. Can't go to the Palace hotels since they are considered a different (higher) level. ENTERTAINMENT: We saw the Mariachi band at the Playacar and the 'Ideal Couple' show at the Yucatan...both were fun. EXCURSIONS: you can book your excursions at the hotel lobby, lots of reps are available. They were not pushy. We just took the cab to PDC and took the 'colectivo' to Tulum and back. It was safe and cheap. Stopped at Hidden Worlds to do a quick $10 jungle canopy zipline. MISC. TIPS: If you're shopping, always bargain, a lot! Take lots of $1 and $5 notes for the cabs/tips etc. Exchange your $ for pesos if u want to shop a lot, we spent under $50, everyone accepts US$, but the exchange rate was 10 pesos to 1USD, instead for the 13 to 1USD that a bank would give u. For a little shopping, we didn't bother to exchange our USD. Playa Mart is like Hilo Hattie in Hawaii, all the possible souvenirs under one roof, good prices and good exchange rates for USD. CONCLUSION: I miss it already, it was tons of fun, they make sure you're having fun. I hope I can go back soon. A great vacation destination for friends or for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Mexicofan2
Reviews.Content: Let me break down my review into categories: Service - We got to the hotel after traveling for many hours and was told by reception that they lost our reservation. After about an hour, they came back to us and told us they had taken care of everything. They gave us a 3rd Floor (highest floor) ocean view bedroom. The balcony was as large as the room and it had our own loungechairs. Food - We tried Jade, the Japanese restaurant, and was not impressed. It was the same food from the buffet. The buffet is large, and the food is great (not gourmet, but great). By the end of our 4 days there though, it did tend to get monotonous. Their Mexican dishes, however, are some of the best I have ever tasted. Pools/beach - we stayed next to the ocean. Yes, it has big black sand bags in the water, but after a while, you don't even notice they're there. The water is clear blue, and you can have boogie boards, canoes, and kayaks all for free. The pools also looked fun, however, we only went in for a few minutes the one day. Entertainment - We caught a few nights of their entertainment. The mariachi band was amazing. I may buy their CD. The Michael Jackson impersonator was funny, but not entertaining. The one night was dance lessons and seemed very family/kid-oriented. They do work tirelessly during the day to make sure you are having fun if you want to. Room - the bed wasn't too bad, and the maid service and mini-bar people made sure everything was stocked and clean. Travel - the hotel picked us up from the airport and dropped us off. An hours drive. They use hotelbeds.com. They use vans, not nice buses like Apple vacations. Deal with it. Alcohol - The drinks are in small glasses and they are made with well liquors, not top shelf. But you can get as many as you want, so stop complaining. As well, only beer is Corona (no Dos Equis). A few tips: 1. There are mosquitos! Bring along bug spray and anti-itch creme! 2. Go into Playa del Carmen. It's only a 50 peso taxi ride to 5th Avenue (roughly $5 USD) and its worth it. You can exchange for pesos at the front desk. 3. Go to Xel-ha and Tulum. Believe me when I say, you will not regret it. Tulum is breathtaking and Xel-ha is the best place I've ever snorkeled in my life (and I've snorkeled throughout the Carribbean) 4. Try to mix up where you eat for breakfast/lunch/dinner. You don't want to get sick of the buffet at Playacar. 5. With Playacar, you get entrance into Tequila, which has a nightclub there named the Pinata. Age range there is between 30-50. Not a place I would recommend for people in their 20s, or people on romantic getaways. 6. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun time....”
Reviews.Author: ObieoneMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: The resort was well laid out,....with the rooms in 6 buildings located between the main dining area and the pool/beach. Food was pretty good overall, better than expected. We really liked the Japanese restaraunt. The staff was very responsive and went out of their way to help you or serve drinks. The pool was big and the bar conveniently located. We liked the nightly entertainment shows too...kind of corny but fun. On the down side, the drinks used basic liquor and our whole group thought the alcohol was watered down. Not that we are heavy drinkers.. ..but it was pretty obvious. The beds were very hard and we had to ask for a cushion, which they delivered promptly and it worked well. The drink dispensers were not used by any of our group....as you really spend all of your time near the pool/beach or the restaurant. The beach was really screwed up though...with big sand bags all along the beach due to the beach erosion. So if you're going there for the beach, I'd recommend another area. Nonetheless, we played a few volleyball games with other beachgoers which was lots of fun. Overall, it met expectations considering the value pricing here...but we'd probably try another all inclusive next time with a better beach.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for better - great value”
Reviews.Author: Clud_Hupkins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a long Thanksgiving weekend at the Riu Playacar. It was our first resort vacation and our first trip to Mexico. We were so pleased with the professional and friendly service we found everywhere, at Riu Playacar, with our coordinating travel service, Lomas Travel, and our excursion company, who took us to Xel-ha and Tulum (booked thru Lomas). We consulted tripadvisor before booking our trip. It was difficult because so many places had a real mix of rave reviews and negative reviews, so I hope the following is helpful - 1. Food. I'm not a total foodie, but I do appreciate a nice meal prepared well using fresh ingredients, and Playacar totally delivered. I don't think you can expect better all-inclusive buffet food. A big variety of choices, we never went to one of the specialty restaurants because we enjoyed the changing options at El Porche (and sit outside on the porch for the best breeze!) Was it gourmet? No. But it sure wasn't Ryan's, Ponderosa, Cracker Barrell, etc. Much of the food options were prepared continental (European) style, which was a nice change. 2. Safety - We felt totally safe here. The reception people emphasized at check-in to use the safe in our room. I had never used a hotel safe anywhere before (traveling around US, Europe and north Africa). Because they strongly recommended it, we followed their lead. No problems - no one was tempted to take anything of value from our room. We even left a couple dollars on the dresser for the maid after our first night - when we returned it was still there. Lots of people left their bags on the beach as they went to swim. I never leave my bag unattended, anywhere, ever. To me, if you leave your bag somewhere, be prepared to say goodbye to it and its contents. This happens in your own grocery store as easily as it does in Mexico. 3. Accomodations. Yes, the beds were very firm and the pillows thin. If you're like me, being out in the sun all day, even just lying around, wears me out. Unless you have chronic pain or discomfort anyway, I bet you'll sleep like a baby. The towels were not new but they were big and very thick. There was hot water and great water pressure in the shower (what I really notice!) There was a little bit of a mildew/damp odor, but - guess what - you are in the jungle! The rooms were clean and stayed that way due to the thorough housekeeping service. The staff was very friendly. The entertainment/activities staff worked tirelessly - they were there by 10 every morning with the same crew putting on shows at the resort until 11 pm or later. I would recommend this place to couples, but even more so to young families. There were many young kids (but my no means did we feel we were at a kids camp) who were clearly having a ball. We booked through Funjet, had a direct flight to Cancun, bought non-stop transfers (shuttle to and from airport) with our package - I would highly recommend this - no hassling around with taxi drivers and other "helpful" service providers. Buen viaje! This is a good way to get your first taste of Mexico. Do go to Avenida Quinta in the town of Playa del Carmen. A nice walk, good shopping and people watching.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING UNATTENDED !!”
Reviews.Author: ssr1512
Reviews.Content: The food was good and plentiful. The pool could do with a clean The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms were very smelly - i am still trying to get rid of the smell from our clothes and cases now we are home. The beds are very hard, as are the pillows. But, the rooms were cleaned each day. Maybe pay a little extra and stay at the Palace - they have just had new beds delivered !! BEWARE - DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING UNATTENDED - my little boys shoes were stolen, taken off by the pool and walked away by themselves!! his sunglasses were also taken when he took them off one day, my nephews jumper "disappeared" from behind the stage. The pedalos were not in use due to being broken. The sea can be a little rough for those with not much confidence. (Although i think we were getting a little of the Cuba tornado so don't know if that made a difference.)

Reviews.Title: “fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: magYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Our 5th time in Mexico but our 1st at this hotel.Loved the location,although the huge sandbags along the beach were a bit of an eyesore and made for an interesting journey when we took long walks along the beach.Make sure you obey the red flag and DON'T swim when it's flying.There was quite a large rip tide in between the sand bags and we saw one man have to be rescued so TAKE CARE. The hotel was very clean and the rooms spacious and comfortable.Not the grandest hotel we have stayed in but certainly the friendliest by far.All the staff were fabulous,so relaxed,friendly and helpful it made our holiday.Nothing was too much trouble for them.I'm vegetarian and when we booked the speciality restaurants they organised a special meal for me which I really appreciated.The buffet food was among the best I have experienced in Mexico,the choice was excellent and my meat eating partner was also impressed! My only negative would be the quality of the wine which I thought was poor. If you walk to the very far end of the beach way past the last hotel it is a quiet ,beautiful spot and good for snorkelling when it's calm,but please be cautious as we had our bag stolen from the beach which was a big shock to us as it didn't seem like anyone could gain access from the jungle at the back. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Resort ok - but our room smelled.”
Reviews.Author: tmomma65
Reviews.Content: The resort and staff were fine. Pool, beach and grounds were well maintianed. Food was standard all inclusive, nothing spectular. Our biggest issue was the room. It has a moldy smell. Our cloths ended up damp and having an odor when we returned home. It is a shame that this cannot be fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out the staff are untrustworthy”
Reviews.Author: AlwaystravellingKent
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely- i want to give credit where it is due, but sadly the staff let us down by stealing my mobile out of my room. Firstly just a few words abouth the hotel- wonderful setting, food out of this world- the best we have ever had- and we have stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels. The rooms are basic but drinks are provided and topped up regulary. Entertainment was also good, with different shows on every night. Unfortunatly, when we returned from a day trip to cancun, i discovered my phone was missing, no forced entry to the room, and it had just been taken off the charger where i left it. This really upset us as the holiday was going so well. Sure, i should have locked it in the safe, but we were in a hurry to get out the room and had not done so. You just dont expect this to happen in such a lovely hotel. Security came to the conclusion that a member of the maintenance team had gone in and stolen it, let in by one of the maids. Nothing was done after that and i spent the rest of the holiday feeling uneasy and not wanting anyone near our stuff. The hotel is wonderful, shame some rotten thief is working there- i seriously hope they sort this out if they want to keep a good reputation. You have been warned- lock EVERYTHING away!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: KeengolferNottingham
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a week celebrating a 50th Birthday in our party of 11. Food Pretty impressed with the food overall, would be easy to pile on the pounds here, drinks quality good, as in proper Ron Barcadi and Smirnof vodka etc Staff All great, work really hard. If you want noise and party atmosphere congregate round the pool and pool bar area, for peace and quiet hit the beach Mixed feelings The only thing that ruins the stay is the room quality!! Beds are circa Butlins 1970, rock hard cheap mattress' with a plastic cover, 2 of the cheapest, thinnest and hardest pillows I have seen, (ear cramp became a recurring theme through week!!), and our biggest issue the overpowering stench of mould/mildew in the rooms, which we put down to the rooms not being directly in sunlight, but one of our party moved rooms and the new room which faced the sun was just as bad. Summary Everything would be great, weather, food and service would be easy to recommend apart from the depression that hits you when you open the door to your room and the smell hits you!!! They are upgrading RIU hotels around this one, wait and go to one of the other ones, as this one in need of a soft furnishings overhaul Such a shame!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: DCFC66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, the food is great, the rooms are nice and clean and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, friendly place.”
Reviews.Author: Ste_CUk
Reviews.Content: First visit to Mexico and to all inclusive. Check in well organised and bell boys on hand to take bags thankfully after 12 hour flight! Generally very good despite the rain. Plenty of good food in the buffets and although we were there for 2 weeks the 'special menus' on a regular basis helped to keep things interesting. Note that the restaurants have a set menu and are not worth visiting more than once. Staff were all excellent, really helpful and attentive. Grounds are well kept, with cleanish pools and nice beach at the end of the hotel. Minus points? Well the rooms are decent but nothing special (although the towel animals are a nice touch) especially for 5 star. Entertainment is basically a dance show every night with a quickly wearing ice breaker before hand (basically embarassing games on stage but some people enjoy that so fair enough). We stopped going after a few nights. Resort is also about 30 mins (or 50 peso taxi ride) from town so shopping needs planning and the atmosphere of the hotel is not for the livelier youngsters. Overall really good value and we definitely intend to go again. Be warned though there was lots of rain in October.

Reviews.Title: “A very good, solid choice!”
Reviews.Author: carribeancruising
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a GREAT 5 night stay at the Riu Playacar. We travelled with a small group of 5 couples, no children. We do this "friends tour" annually and this was our first visit to Playa Del Carmen or a Riu property. With that being said, we would return to both! As many of the other reviewers have mentioned, the people are very friendly and accomodating. Truly some of the hardest workers you will find! The grounds are very green and lush. The beach is raked daily and there's still a nice soft sand beach. The "whales" aren't the most visually appealing objects you can find, but they serve a real purpose and do not deter you from a nice swim in the clear blue water. The rooms are very clean, albeit more basic than I had expected. The furnishings are fine, but I found the amenities somewhat lacking. I hope that Riu catches on to the fact that many guests are now carrying on vs. checking luggage and provide some lotion, better shampoo, conditioner, that type of thing. Being this is my only true complaint, we considered ourselves lucky:-) The food is excellent. We only ate at the buffet restaurant and enjoyed the variety and presentation of the food. We didn't find it to be repetitive as others have stated. Again, a great experience. I would stay here again and would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a Go you wont be disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Calfasaur
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel met by a friendly receptionist (Aldo, useful chap to get to know!) he checked us in no problem and gave useful tips whilst we drank a cocktail. Bags taken to our room by porter. Room a little tied but spacious and cool with own mini bar :-) Got changed into bare essentials (Shorts) and headed out to check out the place. Like others I stayed at the RIU Tequilla two years ago and was meant to be there again this trip, but because of referb was offered PLAYACAR, glad. Reception area - Big spacious and cool breeze blowing through, has a small shop selling some essentials, a little pricey. Shops accross the road not bad usual holiday nicknacks. I would recommend a trip into town by cab about $10 (£5/6) to Walmart, hudge shop with most stuff including car tyres?? cheap to (Products not the Tyres) The reception has a bar staffed by barmen with unbelievable memory and fast to. There is comfortable seating and you will find most Holiday Reps hang around here in the morning. There are toilets which is handy for the bar. Off of the reception area you will find the main restaurant and the Chinese Restaurant called JADE, worth booking (the waiter has a few tricks up his sleeve which i still cant do!) Accomodation - There are 6 blocks of various colours situated either side of the main walk way to the beach. Each block contains approx 36 rooms. Stairs to top floors. The rooms are cleaned every day by very capable cleaners, they even make different animals out of the towels and put them on you bed! Mini bar is refereshed every other day, but ring ALDO (Remember him) if you need something it will be delivered. There is no light in the shower so a little dark but not really a problem unless you dont like the dark, and have just watched Psycho. Rooms have a safe (USE IT) We never had any problems but better safe than sorry. Each room also has a TV (not much for Brits to watch but hell didnt care) Theater and Theater Restaurant - Theater, Not much happens here during the day other that Rep orientation meeting and some where to run to if it rains or just want some shade and relax, you can even watch show rehersals. There is also a bar serving alcohol and coffee. Again bar staff just as cleaver as those in reception. the shows at night are very entertaining by both the performers and Entertainment staff Excellent. Restaurant - Serves lunch which is very good lots of different things. In the evening it sevres Mexican fare and Steak Dinner both need to be booked the morning you want it. Pudding show is quite good with the waiters and FIRE!! yes FIRE in little serving cups :-) and alcohol Pool area - Spacious with plenty of beds and no German towels Yippeee. You recieve towel tockens on checkin, the can be exchanged for swimming towels, if your towel gets to wet you swap it for another or if you have had enough get your token back. There are two pools one mainly for swimming and the other for playing and fun and games (will come to the later in a moment. In the swimming pool the is a ramp for those who cant use ladders. This also serves as the training area for you FREE yes FREE intro to Scuba Diving this needs to be booked in advance and worth it. The fun pool boasts a pool bar and again great staff with excellent memories. Here they play Water Polo, Volley ball and have entertaining games such as Iron Man, Belly Flop contest and water Basketball. This is also where you will find the entertainment staff a real good bunch who are there to make you stay fun, if you dont want to join in they will leave you in peace. Near the beach the pool is perfectly placed, it also has a toddlers pool. Oh i nearly forgot there is a Jaccuzzi too. The Beach - Some have moaned about the sand bags, however it did bother me as i didnt think they are that bad, if nothing else they arent bad for playing on and slipping into the sea (Just dont wear white swim wear!!) On the beach there are Sailing boats Kayaks, body boards and wind surf boards all free. If you head for the palace a 2 or 3 min walk along the beach there are Jet Skis at $60 for half an hour again need to book. There are plenty of sun beds some of which get hijacked by other different hotel guests. There is a Massage hut on the beach to they did have an offer on of $54 for a full body rub for an hour. THE BAD BIT !!!! - There wasnt enough no smoking areas, all the bars allow smoking, infarct it would be easier to say the only place you are not aloud to smoke is in the main restaurant or litterally your bed. Trips - I highly recomend Xceret stay for the evening show real good, Xhal Ha a bit better than Xceret in my opinion but worth the trip, Coba, Jungle Boat tour (You drive your own boat to a reef for snorkling then back again. My son can recommend the Cancun Bar Crawl especially Coco Bongos!! Thouroghly enjoyed the stay would recomend it to anyone. Staff, Guides and reps couldnt be more helpful. BW

Reviews.Title: “riu playacar”
Reviews.Author: mexicoisfab
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Playacar we had 11 nights and everything was fab except the weather, unfortunately it rained every day sometimes only for a short while but usualy for much longer periods, it was extremely heavy rain and the grounds were very flooded the poor staff worked like stink mopping e.t.c God they work so hard for a low wage and very little time off! please give the ones that look after you a little tip at the end of your stay if every one did it must improve there wages. the rooms were spotless and a diffirent towel animal everyday, the food was excellent can't think what people have to complain about there was something for eveyone and all of a very high standard,the animation staff also worked hard at entertaining everyone especially during the rain in the theatre, the shows were good although a bit cheesy and camp the mayan show was brilliant and so was the mexican band sorry can't remember there name but they were really good, The beach was lovely and i saw NO sunbed reserving YIPEE how refreshing that was for a change there were plenty of sun beds we moved ours to where we wanted them on the beach the sand bags were no problem in fact they made a nice little cove the red flag flew for 3 days due to bad weather and rough seas there were a lot of stupid people some with very young children who ignored it and eventually a member of the beach staff had to stand gaurd

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Destination”
Reviews.Author: Holiday027
Reviews.Content: Booked as a family of 5.....children 16,13 and 7. Booked Riu Tequila originally....but informed closing for refurbishment. Glad as Playacar location on the beach a WINNER. Holiday was fantastic!! Location superb..on the beach..what more do you want. Everybody really enjoyed the hotel, food and location on the beach. The hotel was very clean, staff very friendly, food great with lots of choice. 3 seperate restaurants for a change from the main buffet restaurant. Children enjoyed day time activities provide by entertainment staff. Evening entertainment good also...just dont expect to much...I never have done at any destination. Overall a great hotel, great food, great location. Expected an excellent,modern well run hotel...Got it! Linked to the Riu Tequila & Riu Yucatan.......but book Playacar!! Not as big and not as busy but still a great hotel. 45 minutes from Cancun centre/airport. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but beware of the staff”
Reviews.Author: fixflip
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days, and it was great. The main buffet was wonderful, and all the resturants were great...They had great service and the activities were interesting and fun...The pool was great, but there was no hot tub...The beach area was not as good as in Cancun....The only real negative was some of the staff would come on to you and your party...It made my girlfriend very uncomfortable...we would not go back due to this part of the staffs...which was the intertainment staff...all the others were very considerate and helpful....oh if you are looking to get in a good workout while you are there...the gym really is not very good...They also kept the room clean and the mini bar was keep up except for one day...we called and they took care of it for us.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: aftonlad
Reviews.Content: We went to Riu Playacar in May, first time to Mexico and a first for All Inclusive. Would have to agree with all the other positive comments for this hotel. Food was really good, 2nd week filled in a survey at our table made some observations not really a complaint regards the potatoes being cold at the A'la carte. Within 2 minutes the head chef and one of the management came to see us and stated they would sort it out. All the staff were great, smiling and very helpfull. Place was spotlessly clean, maids were even outside polishing signs and the lamposts!! Walking into Playa Del Carmen the residents in the local houses etc were friendly and always said hello, " I've lived where I am at the moment for 20 years and some of the neighbours don't speak" The beach errosion was a problem with a few guests didn't bother us, would be a bit gutted though if going out to be wed on the beach and the sandbags in the wedding photos. Playacar being the smaller of the RIU, wandering around the others and having a drink or two we felt the Playacar was more friendlier and the staff had more time for you. A big mention for the lobby bar staff especially Felix. We had a great time and met some friendly people who came from all over.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: travellover7218
Reviews.Content: great place. very clean. food was great. staff was excellent, very professinal and fun too! rooms are average but nice and very clean. beach was great. no problems. great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: boycex5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the riu playacar sept 28 thru oct 5 08. We loved it! The staff were all wonderful. The food was excellent, The rooms were adorable, The beach was beautiful. I can`t wait to go back next year. My husband and i went with our 2 boys 11 and 13, There was something to do for everyone. The maids were great at making little towel critters the kids loved! The booze is not watered down at all, So many food choices, picky eaters will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: columbusTyneandwear
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from the Riu Playacar and had a fabulous time. I have never stayed in a hotel with such a fantastic choice and selection of food. There is a lovely buffet in the El Porche Restaurant with a vast selection for breakfast e.g including smoothies, cheeses, cereal, fruit juices, bacon, sausages, omelettes, every variety of egg, toasts, jam, fruit and yoghurts. Dinner included a full selection of spicy mexican food, italian selection, salads, soups, carvery with amazing cuts of beef and lamb and enough choice to satisfy the most picky of eaters. We also sampled the 3 waiter service restaurants. The steakhouse menu was 5 courses, ceasar salad, a selection of fried onion rings, vegetables and spicy chicken wings, soup, a selection of steaks etc, and cake. We drank the rose wine throughout the meal and found it very nice. The Mexican restaurant had a selection of starters and we had a lovely steak but again there were a choice of main meals, followed by desert.
