The Asian restaurant had a wide selection of cold and hot starters including sushi, then a buffet selection including chicken kebabs, beef in a fantastic sauce, spring rolls etc. During the day there was a buffet lunch with a wide selection available and occasionally they had an outdoor barbecue with salads, jacket potatoes and various meats and it was pleasant to have lunch outdoors. There were also lovely touches like cocktails being served next to the barbecue in pineapples and coconuts. One day they even bought cups of chopped melon around the pool for everyone. The Service was impeccable from reception to waiters to cleaners. We had occasion to ring reception a couple of times because the mini bar or the optics hadn't been restocked and they sent someone immediately to resolve the problem. We had phone calls every other day from reception asking if we had any problems and asking if everything was okay. We went to Playa Del Carmen a few times and it is a nice resort but it does feel a bit like running the gauntlet down 5th Avenue which is the main area for bars, restaurants etc. Everyone is shouting for your attention and it resulted in us not going into shops rather than encouraging us and I would imagine they actually lose trade because of their incessant behaviour. We spoke to a lot of people who said the same thing and that they would rather pay a bit extra in the hotel and the shops over the road, than go to Playa and be hounded to purchase. We actually told one of the guys that it was putting people off and he replied that everyone else was shouting at the tourists so he felt he had to. We went to the Blue Parrot and it was a good experience but a lot of sand on the ground so be careful which footwear you have on. There was a fire show which was pretty good, about 5 people eating and dancing with fire. Be aware that if you see any entertainment in Playa you will be expected to contribute as they constantly come round collecting. We even had someone come upstairs in a restaurant who had been singing downstairs asking us to put something in her collection pot. This is something we aren't used to in the UK because if a bar has a singer or band on they pay for it not the customers. We went along to the Yucatan a few times and that also seemed like a really good hotel. Their entertainment area is bigger and seemed to have more of an atmosphere. They also had 2 sit around bars near the entertainment and one of the bar man I think called Alfredo was fantastic entertainment and made sure everyones drink was filled as soon as they had finished. The Yucatan also has an airconditioned disco upstairs open until 2am and they had a vending machine open all night where you could get a sandwich, hot dog or hamburger if you fancied one. Back to Playacar and you are given a card for your towels and there are usually a few books there to swap, so if anyone is a reader you might just want to take the one book and swap it over. The Entertainment was pretty repetitive on a night mainly being the same set of dancers, scantily dressed females and quite camp guys, but they did put their heart and soul into it. There was a mariachi show on one night and they went down a storm, brilliant musicians and an excellent singer. We travelled with Thomson Holidays and the flight from Newcastle was 12 and a half hours going as we had to refuel in Manchester. Although we had paid for meals it was actually 5 hours into the flight before we received anything to eat so I suggest if anyone is travelling from Newcastle they take snacks with them. The food is highlighted as being designed by Aldo Zilli on the Thomson flights and all I can say is I would be ashamed to put my name to them if I was him. Horrible grisly meatballs on the way out and chicken with some rubbery substance which could have been pasta or an omelette on the way back! The entertainment package is worth upgrading for £5 as you get a choice of about 60 CDs and 10 films. All in all a fantastic holiday and I would recommend the Riu Playacar to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Been Twice Already and I'd Go Back Again....”
Reviews.Author: RizzBits
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Playacar about four years ago and then decided to go back this year again and take my best friend with me. I enjoyed it just as much this time as i did the first time. The staff if so friendly and so accommodating. No matter what you need or what questions you have, they are right there to help you. The food is terrific and there is no shortage of choices. No matter what your taste, you can find plenty to enjoy at the buffets and in the smaller lunch restaurant, not to mention the midday barbeques around the pool and special events at night. The property is perfectly maintained. Immaculately clean (only littered with the handful of Paca that run around in the late afternoon and early evening), and very well manicured, the atmosphere is lovely. The rooms are comfortable. We stayed in a regular room with two queen sized beds. A word of warning: if you like a soft mattress, you may want to try and get yours from home through customs because the beds are very firm. By firm i mean hard. Other than that, the room is nice, the bathroom area quite spacious, the balcony has room for two with a table, and the best part is that every day the maid leaves happy little towel creatues and i have to say that every day it brought a smile to my face; just a simple thing like that. I will go back to the Riu again, i'm certain. I love the friendly people, (many other tourists vacationing are so pleasant and friendly...), and the staff is just as wonderful. For an all-inclusive vacation to a nice, warm, sunny place i would reccomend the Riu. It's a great place to get away and relax with a smile all week long.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding…”
Reviews.Author: OnBudgetTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Riu Playacar with my daughter in July 2008. The hotel was very well maintained and very well managed. The room was very big and the ceiling was high. It had a small but very useful sitting area, balcony, huge closet, liquor dispenser with 4 huge bottles of strong alcohol. The shower/toilet area was separated only by a decorative curtain (no door), though the toilet did have a door but not the shower (the shower had a plastic curtain). Two swimming pools were busy but we always were able to find a free spot. Beaches in this area are still recovering from hurricane. No one beach is in good condition. As an alternative you can walk ~30 minutes down the shoreline until you reach wild unmanaged beaches. Those beaches are excellent. Don’t trust the hotel’s map that shows Riu as a complex of several Riu hotels on a nice green territory. There are some other hotels in-between so you cannot easily go from one Riu hotel to another. Hotel Tequila was so far away across the road so I even did not want to spend time checking it. The hotel’s staff was very friendly and professional (except for the reception desk). We had an issue at check-in. They gave us (me and my daughter) a room with one king bed and when we came back to the reception desk asking for two beds they said we could separate the bed into two smaller beds. Only after they personally came to the room and realized that a king size bed cannot be split unless you cut it with a saw, they gave us another room with two beds. Telephone calls from hotel were very expensive so we used a calling card (10 USD for 40 minutes) and a payphone from a shopping center across the road right in front of the hotel. Cell phone calls to and from US with T-Mobile were 1.5 USD a minute. Do not use 1-866 number for calling hotel room from US. It is not a toll free number (will cost you about 2 USD per minute or more). We made only one trip during the week. We went to see Maya’s ruins in Tulum (40 USD per person). It took about 1.5 hours to get there, about 1.5 hours there (~45 minutes of guided tour and ~45 minutes of free time) and 1 hour back. There were no changing rooms at the beach. Reserve more time when you travel around. Traffic was not smooth there. For example, it took us 2+ hours to get from the airport to the hotel, though the way back was less that 1 hour. The food was excellent and selection of food was very good. Two buffet restaurants served international food. Three specialty restaurants served local Mexican and Asian food. The food was the best part of our vacation. It was a very nice barbeque and coconuts party with live music and dancing at the pool on Thursday and a seafood party on Friday. The night entertainment was good too. I give 5+ to this place for excellent food and service. Beach lovers would better search for another place.

Reviews.Title: “A Vacation Must”
Reviews.Author: RozaRay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Playacar from Aug 31 - Sept 14 and had a wonderful time. Since this was our first trip to Mexico, we were nervous about choosing the right resort. Upon arrival were were treated with cocktails and the staff were more than willing to accomedate us. Yes it is true that the beds are hard, however for the amount of time that you are in your room, you seem to forget about the sleeping arrangements quite quickly. Anyways kudos to the staff and especially the awesome Entertainment Team! Serjio, Jorge, Pablo, Annie and Paulina all need raises and were absoulutely awesome! The daily activities around the pool keeps you busy but relaxed at the same time so it is not overwhelming. The night shows were wonderful as well. I definitely recommend people to go to this resort and experience everything that we did. Thank you Riu Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: kazza1966
Reviews.Content: Myself and husband and friends stayed at the Riu Playacar from the 6th to 21st of Sept 2008. We couldn't find a fault with any of the property. The rep's Jon and Wendy were great. We went on the pirate boats in Cancun which was a terrific evening,well worth the money paid. We also went on the Cancun bar crawl which included entrance and drinks in Coco Bongo's this is a night not to be missed. Back to the hotel. The grounds are well maintained and the rooms are kept spotless, cleaned every day. The pools are a must and there are plenty of sunbeds no matter what to time you arrive down there. The beach is white sand with crystal blue Caribbean Sea, really didn't want to come home would have quite easily have stayed another 2 weeks. No complaints on the food, especially the a la carte Steakhouse. The staff would ring our room on a daily basis and asked was everything ok. and to see if we needed anything. Have stayed in 2 Riu hotels in the past, the hotel Riu Merengue in north of Dom Rep and the Riu Naiboa in Bavaro. No complaints regarding these either. Would definately return to this hotel. There is also a iron and ironing board in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KnRluv2travel
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Riu Playacar. The hotel is very comfortable, service is very good, food is great. But we did find on this visit that the hotel is starting to look a little 'tired'. It needs a face lift. It is rated as a 5 start but I would be hard pressed to say that it is a 5 star today. On our first visit several years ago, yes, it certainly was. The rooms are clean, but could use some refurbishing. We love this area of Mexico and will certainly go back, but unless the Riu does some updates, we will be looking for another newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun vacation, great place”
Reviews.Author: 0po98i
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 4 years old boy at Riu Playcar for 5 days over the Labor Day weekend. It was a truly nice, and enjoyable family vacation. Although I am not a seasoned Mexico/Caribbean vacationer, I've been to Cancum (hotel zone) once, and Punta Cana DR once before, and with that said, I think Riu Playcar was the best. Two things within resort that I'd give an absolutely superior grade were accommodations, and dining. Room we've stayed at (4107) was REALLY nice, clean, comfortable, and absolutely nothing to complain about. Food - SPECTACULAR. For sushi lovers, there's an elegant Japanese restaurant/buffet "Jade" where you have all-u-can-eat sushi. Otherwise buffet "El Porche" should fit all your needs. Very clean and well kept, with ice sculptures, great fruit designs/decorations, friendly staff, and fresh, tasty food. I've heard a lots of complains about food quality in AI resorts, and even experienced it while on previous trips, but not while staying in Riu. I don't have an iron stomach like some people, but I was eating in a large quantities since it was so tasty, and was absolutely fine. There's also a Steak House restaurant, which we didn't try, but heard it was good too. Few words about the beach, and large sand bags laying on it. If these bags would bother you, than you should pick different destination. It's not the problem of this particular resort, but rather Playa Del Carmen in general . Every single resort in the area that I've seen has these bags since several hurricanes/tornadoes in the past wanted to steal all the sand. Many vacationers, including myself indeed found these bags very entertaining. It was good diving place, or you could lay/sunbath on it and get a water splash from time to time as waves were hitting them. Other than that, beach is very clean, and the water is unbelievable ( type of "Corona commercial" clear when close, and turquoise looking from far away). Very good entertainment throughout the day and every day different show in the evening (we've seen Mayan, Moulin Rouge, Michael Jackson). Staff nice and friendly, working hard to make all guests happy. Overall I think we spend around 30 bucks on tips, but I think these people well deserved it for their hard work. Greetings to the nice older couple from central Illinois, whom we meet while in Riu, in case they ever read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wyleecujo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The rooms were nice, fridge was always stocked. The food was average, not bad, but not gourmet. I was a little disappointed with this night life, the bars were open, but nothing to do, at some other hotels that I have stayed at there was a disco or something like that to have fun. I loved the beach, it was a short walk from the room and plenty of chairs lay out, but there was only one pool, and it was too overcrowded. We went for my husbands birthday, and they made a big deal of it, he loved that. First early in the day someone knocked on our room door, when we answer they sang Happy Birthday and gave him a bottle of tequila and a bowl of fresh fruit, then the sang to him during dinner, and again later in the evening when we were sitting at the bar. I was satisfied with the hotel overall, but I would have liked it alot more if the food was better.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: koko4life
Reviews.Content: Three of us went to Riu Playacar for 4 days…and had a very relaxing vacation. General: The resort is clean and small enough to enjoy. The décor around the resort is outdated and certainly needs an upgrade. Mostly European visitors. Check in and check out is fast and efficient. Everything (dinner, lunch) opens and closes right on time...on the dot! You can visit Riu Tequila and Riu Yucatan – they're both along the same strip and a very short walk away. There's a small shopping area in front of the Riu Playacar with souvenirs, shirts, jewelry and knick knacks. Rooms: For three of us, there were two full size beds thrown together and a cot. I didn't expect to have a cot for the third person considering the cost per person to stay there. Again, the décor is outdated – reminds me of 70's motel-type décor. The rooms are muggy and smell of humidity when you first walk in. If this bothers you, ask the front desk to come spray the room. The room didn't smell again after we had it sprayed. The beds (as others reviews have noted) are hard – be sure to ask for a mattress pad when you check in if a hard bed isn't your thing. There's a safe in the room and you get the key during check in. Plenty of towels and hangers are in the room. There are no Beach: We are definitely beach people. The beach was amazing! There are some sandbags but nothing intrusive – most people were playing on them and having a good time. The water was turquoise blue and warm – there weren't any harsh waves. The beach or the sand are not rocky – we didn't need our water shoes at all! There are plenty of chairs – we got out early to get our chairs but there was no need, I hardly ever saw anyone not able to find a chair. The chairs need to be replaced though – most are broken and the headrest doesn't stay up/down. There are palm trees for shade and the area closer to the beach does not have palm trees if you want to tan or lay out in the sun. The last day, we took a walk along the shoreline of the beach and determined that Riu Playacar had the best beach – most other resorts had intrusive sandbags and therefore a smaller area available to swim in. People don't harass you to go parasailing, buy things, etc. once you say no so that's nice. Towels – get them by the pool area – you give them your towel card and when you return the towel, you get it back (be sure you return it by the time the towel hut closes or you have to wait until the next day). Food: Lots of variety. The food areas open and close right on time! Most of it was good – you found the general thing that wasn't tasty or appetizing but overall, we could always find something we liked. The specialty restaurants are definitely worth visiting. The steakhouse was the best – it was a sit down dinner and the waiters were attentive and great. The Asian was good too (good sushi) – this was buffet style. We left a tip for the waiters - they did such a great job! Downside to the food – it is NOT 24 hours as advertised. If you want 24 hours, we were told we had to go to Riu Tequila – don't know how true that is because we never went. But if you wake up early or are a late night person or have kids that eat a lot and want a snack – bring your own! People don't know how lines work when it comes to the food on the buffets. Nightly Entertainment: It always seemed empty but the other RIU resorts were always more lively and packed during the night shows. Pool/Jacuzzi: We didn't try the pool but there were people enjoying it. We tried the Jacuzzi one time and it was cold so we didn't try again. Check in/Check out: Was a breeze - quick and efficient. Even got a cocktail at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hevfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu for a fortnight early August 2008 - and loved it. Fantastic location, right on the beach in a safe area. Would rate hotel about a 4*. Most reviews have covered everything but would say top tips - request a mattress topper immediately and then the beds are fine. Also you have liquor dispensers in the room - leave a note for the staff with a small tip and they'll change the bottles to your favourites. I only tipped housekeeping at the end of our stay but they left towel art on the beds every day. Found the food excellent, lots of variety - and entertainment staff brilliant. No pressure to join in - but they're your best friends if you do! Reception staff dealt with queries adequately - but they could learn to smile a bit - my daughters found them very intimidating! Bar staff throughout hotel seem to really enjoy their jobs and are really friendly and entertaining. I would add that some of the shows are repeated if you have a two week stay - and the dance shows are the same dancers, doing same dances it seemed, just wearing different outfits. Hotel itself generally very clean - but room towels could do with replacing - a bit threadbare and tatty. Seen no bugs at all, other than a few ants on our balcony. Beach and sea is gorgeous - erosion a real problem and the 'whale' sandbags are a real eyesore for anyone wanting a dreamy tropical view (I've attached a photo). That said, everyone loved playing, diving, swimming off them so there is a plus. One disappointment - for an all inclusive, food stops at 10.30am until luchtime, 3.30pm until dinner, and then 9.30pm. If you wanted any snacks on meals in between, you had to travel to the Yucatan hotel, about a 200 yard walk. Not a big problem as food is plentiful at mealtimes, but I just found it unusual for an all inclusive. Pottery painting hut on beach is great fun for all ages, very therapeutic, inexpensive and make great gifts to take home. Would recommend hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: PLB1954
Reviews.Content: We travel to different resorts in Mexico (north and south of Cancun) every year. This year we selected Riu Playacar which was rated a 4 star. Understanding the ratings in Mexico are different than the US, we learned to never go below a 4. We were still disappointed in this resort. The beds felt like boxsprings with a cover over them, there were no views of the ocean from the rooms, the food and drinks were nothing to write home about and there was not complimentary lotion in the room. The beach area had NO umbrellas and the quality of the beach in general was not great. The entertainment is meant to satisfy kids under the age of 10. And to complete this experience, we had to get up at 4:30 a.m. to catch the shuttle back to the airport. All in all, I would not recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: CJames37
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I get to stay at a lot of All-Inclusives. This was my first stay at a RIU property however. The hotel is busy right now due to the RIU Tequila being renovated. They're running about 99% full even in the off season. Check in was fine, but rooms were not ready tell after 3pm. They did take our luggage and give us our wrist bands so we could start enjoying the hotel. Rooms? Not very nice and the bed was very hard. We were on the 3rd floor and didn't have a view. If you use the room safe, you have to keep up with 2 keys along with beach towel cards. Food? Very good. For an All-Inclusive, the food was some of the best I've had. Buffet had a great selection and I thought it was good. We only signed up for the Steak house and could only get the 8:45 seating. Again, good, but nothing special and it took a long time. Because of that, we missed the show. Swim up bar was fun, but the pool was very warm and it was tough to get a chair around the pool or the beach. The beach is still a mess and not very nice. Over all, if you get a good deal, I think it's a nice place. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Has its ups and a few downs”
Reviews.Author: RVer1
Reviews.Content: We went to Playa del Carmen to the RIU Playacar August 2-7, and celebrated our 10 year anniversary. Our travel agent booked us through Apple Vacations. We had to wait outside for our Apple transport from the airport for over an hour to begin our drive to our hotel, and had to make a few lengthy stops on the way. We were welcomed at the front desk with a tropical cocktail and check-in was fairly quick in spite of being questioned several times about my electronic (printed) travel documents. We only had about a half hour to get settled before our scheduled meeting with "Jimmie" from Apple Vacations to make our tour arrangements and schedule our return to the airport. When we met with Jimmie, we scheduled the only tour we wanted to take, which was to Chichen Itza. The resort itself was nice enough, but expect nothing above 3 star ratings. There are no beach view/front rooms, which was disappointing. The open air foyers echo and are quite noisy. There are some VERY loud birds that get to sqawking before 6am every morning. We didn't mind the beach, or lack there of it, in the least. We always found somewhere comfortable to be and the water was blue and beautiful. The huge sandbags did look like beached whales, but they were fun and quite challenging to climb on, and they are serving the purpose of regaining the eroded beach. We did spend most of our time during the day at the RIU Yucatan, or out and about. The Yucatan had better daytime entertainment and we enjoyed the setting there better than Playacar--you could be close to the bars/entertainers and still see ocean everywhere. Their lunch seemed comparable to Playacar's, so it really didn't matter where you were for that meal. We also visited the RIU Tequila, but it was just really muggy and hot, (across from the beach)--we didn't get why people think it's so great, but to each their own. The staff at Playacar was friendly, the drinks were often lacking, the food was okay, entertainment was pretty decent. --The staff: front desk were fine, the bartenders were friendly and hilarious, people were constantly sweeping/cleaning, our room was adequately tended to daily, we were promptly brought requested items for the mini-bar, the waiters at the reservation and buffet restaurants were very good --The drinks: yes, they were plentiful. However, there were some frequent miscommunications--we asked for a White Russian, got a glass of Zinfindel. Asked for 2 Pina Coladas with Bacardi, got a Pina Colada and a Rum and Coke. Don't forget to specify premium liquors though--we had some very funky tasting Margaritas and Daquiris because of cheap booze. They also used way too much of some of the syrups--made the drinks taste disgusting. (We found MUCH better drinks down at the Yucatan!) The food: we found that the buffet was as good as anything. There was a lot of variety, and they did it up with melon and ice carvings. We did the Asian one night--it was good, but we were disappointed that it was buffet. The sushi there was decent and the fried rice was probably the best I've ever had. We did the steak reservations one night and loved the beachy location. The atmosphere was nice, but the food was just okay. I had the "ribeye" and it was at least half fat/grissel. We didn't try the mexican, but the display of what they serve looked appealing. Again, the buffet suited us fine--if you can't find anything to eat there, you're probably just too picky and would do better to go into town and choose what you want. Our room: Very strange at times. We requested a king bed, but had 2 beds pushed together. Very difficult when we wanted to snuggle. One of us would have to "hop the divide." The hotel sent a little basket of fruit and a note to our room for our anniversary with of all beverages, a bottle of cheap tequila :) The liquor dispenser was a new one for us--there are literally 4 fifths of alcohol in your room! We only had a few drinks in the room, but it was nice when you're getting changed or taking a break. The mini-bar had sodas, big bottles of water, and 3 Coronas in it. They didn't stock it everyday, but I called the front desk twice to ask for more beer and water, and they brought it up quickly. The guy who cleaned our room was such a sweetie. The first 2 days we had towel art, and one day we even had confeti--that was a new one, confeti in our bed! We tried to get most of it into the trash can before bed, but still ended up with it scattered from one end of the room to the other. It took forever for us to get the room cool, and if you walk onto the balcony to search for some kind of view, the air turns off. There's no light in the actual shower, and all the light switches in the room are strangely located and a puzzle to solve. Oh, I almost forgot--the top cover/bedspread on the bed is literally a lined curtain. I actually felt the backing of the curtains and compared it to the bedspread and it was the same. We took these off after we discovered soft blankets in the overhead of the closet. Apple Vacations Rep. at the hotel: I know this isn't the hotel's fault, but I have to mention the rep who set up our Chichen Itza tour. He told us to be in the lobby at 7:50, and after sitting for over an hour, we found out that our tour had left without us at 7:30. He had given us the wrong time!!! After a lot of hassle with Apple (having to stay in our room waiting for phone calls, etc. for hours) we were set to go again the next day at 7:30. Again, we sat and sat and were then told that it was rebooked, but "for another day." We were leaving the next day and never got to go on the one tour we wanted to go on. After contacting Apple, they did apologize and sent us 2 vouchers for a future trip, that we can never use because they depart out of cities 1,000 plus miles from us (It would cost more to get there than the hundred bucks off). Thanks for nothing Apple--if you can, choose another company!!!! Also, I hope Jimmie, the rep at Playacar, is now down at the docks trying to sell time shares. He was a jerk. Overall, we did enjoy the RIU Playacar and our stay in Playa del Carmen. Some came thinking it was a five star resort for some reason. It is NOT a five star resort, but if you're not overly fussy and up-ity, you'll enjoy yourself. It would be better with some service (food/beverages) at the pool and beach. It is only a 5 minute, 5 dollar cab fare into town, so be sure to go in and spend some time. We took the ferry over to Cozumel for the day and really enjoyed it a lot. We also heard that Zel Ha and Xcaret are both really nice...we were just too busy trying to get to Chichen Itza and all the other tours had already left by the time we found out we were left hanging! Next time maybe we'll get there, but it will probably be from a different resort than RIU Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “These is the real true about Riu playacar”
Reviews.Author: jirafitas
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar is not all what it is cracked up to be. I was disappointed in numerous ways. I worked for a market research firm dedicated to helping its clients better understand the needs and preferences of their customers. & have been traveling to Cancun in the past 10 years stayed at many other resorts in the Cancun & Riviera Maya & nothing compare to the Riu Playacar, unless these is the only place you known or you live similar like the hotel these is the worst Resort in the whole place. Pool area I was disappointed that the pools are overcrowded with very hot contaminated water, we got ear infection after the 2nd day we stay there, also you need to have cards to get a beach towel, and not enough beach chair or umbrellas to protect you from the sun. Other hotels have a waiter/waitress at the pool). But at Riu you either had to get in the pool or walk around to get a drink. Food: The food was buffet style is OK the workers are amazing to please you the only problem is the roach infestation they crawl everywhere. And for the other restaurants you need to get up at 7am to reserve for the steak, seafood or Mexican, also there are no coffee pots in the rooms. Entertainment: These is the only thing I like about Riu we went to one show The Maya show it was very good . The entertainment crew works very hard day and night to keep everyone happy and entertained. I thought they were excellent. Room: The beds are hard. Plus I ended up getting bitten by bed bugs while I was there as well... The room we stayed in was in need of a good deep cleaning, there is going to be some mildew, but the ceiling in our shower definitely needed to be cleaned & repair. The grout in the rest of the room (especially the bathroom), also could have used a thorough cleaning. Additionally, our shower did not drain properly which left us standing in about 4 inches of water each time. The beds are pushed together to make one large bed with one headboard. If you ask for 1 king size bed, it's a smaller room with a much smaller bed. Do you like to be woken up by loud and rowdy people & buses coming in & out from the next door hotel because the walls are so thin you hear everything and you end up not getting any sleep? be careful of hard beds, & thin walls you hear everything if you want to rest, plus the musty smelling rooms. Bath Towels: Time to get some new ones. The ones we had were raggedy and faded. Definitely not the towels I'd put out for your guess unless they are homeless. Riu Playcar really needs to re-upholster their outside restaurant chairs. Sometimes I didn't want to sit down because of all the mildew. (Yuck!) Beach I was incredibly disappointed with the beach erosion. They lost a lot of beach there. (Not like they had a lot to begin with). Then, they have, as mentioned in a lot of other reviews, a lot of huge sand bags on the beach and in the water, the bags make the water smell so bad like sewer There was also quite a lot of seaweed to swim thru, making the experience a lot less enjoyable. Security mayor problem with security rooms keys are actual keys and not key cards. Room number is printed right on the key so doesn’t loose it? The Safe box is also operated with a key. I accidentally forgot my room number and I opened someone else room. Terrible place would NOT recommend it even to my worse enemy thinking of traveling there, the Riu Playacar is very old and definitely not a 5 star resort is more like ½ star resorts.

Reviews.Title: “WOW.. voted best holiday ever by whole family!!”
Reviews.Author: n0rthumbrian_lass
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending two weeks at this hotel and enjoyed every moment. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. The rooms were cleaned every day (loved the Towel Art) and the mini bar and optics replenished every other day. The food was fabulous with special theme nights a couple of times a week and the waiters worked their socks off but always had time for a bit of chat and banter! The entertainment was well....entertaining....some nights it was just the entertainments team and audience participation some of which was hilarious and other nights there were professional shows put on. The beach was much better than I thought (after reading some of the previous reviews) the 'whale sandbags' were actually good fun, most people used them as to jump or drive off or for sunbathing. They also attracted fish, so if you went snorkelling early you'd see lots of colourful fish swimming around them!

Reviews.Title: “Good time!”
Reviews.Author: beach_babe777
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children, ages 10 & 12, stayed at the RIU Playa from July 29-Aug 3. I will elaborate on several aspects about this trip: Staff~friendly bar and wait staff, check-in/out staff not so friendly but did not have to deal with them but three times, pool staff and activities were fun and included water balloon war, aerobics, water contests with kids, etc.... Always open chairs around the pool and beach. Room~clean, fridge was stocked pretty well....did have to request for an extra stocking mid stay, beds were good Beach~pretty good~lots of sand barriers but the kids loved jumping from them for the tide to wash them back on. Food~Very good...lunch was pretty much the same everyday, but the resort was really good at changing the "theme" for supper. Ate at Carlos and Charlie's in Playa del Carmen and it was pretty good, but a little pricey for what you get. Great staff there and fun atmosphere. Shopping~lots of fun on 5th Avenue; be ready to negotiate with the small stores closer to the beach. Other stores were too expensive. Other vacationers~some European's need to realize that going topless is not alright all over the world. My son definitely got a surprise and my daughter was in complete shock! I was expecting thongs, but not really the topless aspect (especially the women who had no business being topless)! This did not happen last year in Cabo San Lucas. Overall, we had a great time and the kids really enjoyed themselves as well.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: ProudColoradoGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first vacation with no kids! My husband got sick the first day and was sick the rest of the week but over all we liked the Riu Playacar. We didn't mind the beds at all (most people said they were hard but they were fine for us). The rooms were very nice with the exception that I came back with a lot of bug bites on my legs (these happened while I was sleeping). The refrigerator was stocked but we were dissappointed that they would only put 3 beers in there for 2 days. We ended up going to buy some at the pharmacy since sometimes we wanted to hang out in our room instead of at the lobby bar where there were a lot of rude people. We were greeted at the hotel desk by very nice people and any time we needed anything, they were very friendly. Jose our bartender at the lobby bar was MORE than accommodating! We never had an empty drink glass and we tipped him very well in appreciation. I was dissappointed that at the pool, there was no one to come around and take drink orders (at the other resorts I have stayed at in Mexico, we always had a waiter/waitress at the pool). You either had to get in the pool or walk around to get a drink. Also, I really didn't like seeing all the topless women at the beach. There were a lot of little kids that were there looking at those women (and I am not a prude but little kids do not need to see strangers that way). We went to 5th Ave. every night and that was a lot of fun. We needed to get away from the obnoxious, rude Europeans at the hotel. They had very good restaurants downtown (needed a break from the hotel food). I would recommend the Casa Adela restaurant on 5th Ave. They had the best lobster tail I have ever tasted! Over all it was a good trip and we have decided Playa del Carmen is our favorite place to visit in Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honymoon - would go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: claire-marie80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon in August 2007. A wonderful trip, can’t believe the bad reviews - some people are very overly fussy! We stayed for two weeks and could not have had a better honeymoon despite the fact that we were evacuated a day before the end of our honeymoon due to hurricane Dean - now the hotel we were evacuated to in Orlando was a different story entirely! If I’d wanted to go to Orlando I'd have paid to go - to a better hotel I might add! However, the Riu Playacar was top notch, could not fault it at all. Food wonderful, plenty of variety. Do as many trips as you can. Only thing that I would complain about if I had anything to whinge about was loud noisy Americans, but I suppose that goes with the territory. I would go back to the Riu Playacar tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “complaint”
Reviews.Author: littlemantexas
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this resort on july 20 to july 25. are major complaint was the front desk and staff the front desk people were not friendly and did not want to help or answer any questions they acted like it was to big of an effort. when we checked out they took our keys and pool cards all they said was ok and walked away. did not make any attempt tosay did you enjoy your stay thank you for coming or hope you come back again. other resorts we stayed at were friendly and were helpful and smiled and made sure you would like to come back again. there were some good points the food, pools, beaches, rooms were great. they just need to get friendier staff

Reviews.Title: “Made Great Friends at Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: madisonsteel
Reviews.Content: July 13-19 Service: The service was top notch from the time they greeted us till we left the property. We even accidentally threw away our towel cards on the first day and expected to pay $20 per towel and they front desk gave us 2 more no charge. We did tip the maid, at dinner, and at the bar. Food: They food was great the first few days, but by the third day I was over the bland food. That is Mexico though and you just have to find something to eat. It was the best I have ever had at an all inclusive, but we ate dinner off the resort the last few days. Room:The room is basic but accommodating. The beds are hard but no surprise there. You really are not in the room very much. Entertainment: I only went to one show Grease it was very good though. The entertainment crew works very hard day and night to keep everyone happy and entertained. I thought they were excellent. Excursions: We went to Cozumel for dinner one night and it was great. We ate at Carlos and Charlies and had a magic show by Kiwi. This was so much fun! We also went to the fire show at the blue parrot and this is not to be missed. It started at 11:30 though and not 11. All in all it was a great trip the best part though was we met some amazing people that made the trip one of the most memorable ever!

Reviews.Title: “Philly family loves RIU”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinkerwinnermom
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to Mexico. I went to Cancun for Spring Break in college (1996) and to Puerta Vallarta years ago with my husband's company. This was by far my favorite vacation. We took my 5 year old and 7 1/2 year old and we had an absolute blast. I don't want to write too much so I will sum it uo\p (my hubby will write his own long review tomorrow-- I am sure). Here it is in a nutshell: Place is gorgeous. Beach is great, water is see-through turquoise and purple. Pool is awesome with sooooo many nice people and bartenders and activities. Most importantly, food is INCREDIBLE. We met a lot of nice people from all staes (we are from PA) and all countries. We went to Mexican dinner and Asian and while they were good I think the BUFFET is all anyone needs. Food is FANTASTIC. If you cannot find something you like ---you don't like to eat. I swear we all gained wieght (who cares) due to the sheer abundance of incredible eats. The workers there are phenominal. I was so sad to leave after 8 days. But it's ok. I met so many nice families (2 of which I have emailed and called since I got home). Go here! You cannot go wrong. We loved it. I would go back in a heartbeat. Food is great, drinks are great (bar in room) and the water activities are awesome exercise. We loved the photographer who came around with exotic animals and took pics we had to buy to bring home. I paid more at home for pics that were averaqe. Wait till the end of the week and strike a deal and purchase all the pics of your fam for not too much, it is worth it. I am in love with this place and hope anyone who is on the fence about trying this resort realizes you cannot go wrong. I am sad to leave. I have to say that I think the fact that this plavce is not huge totally helps. You meet people and enjoy saying hi etc.. but it is all non commital. It is a nice place and In hope you give it a try. Amy

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews... I'd probably go again...”
Reviews.Author: playacargirl
Reviews.Content: Went to Riu Playacar with 13 year-old son. We met a friend in Cancun who also stayed with us at the hotel. This was my second time at the Riu Playcar (first time was pre-Katrina in 2005). Although I definitely had more fun this go-round, due to participating in more activities (scuba, deep sea diving, swimming with the dolphins, etc.), this time around, I definitely had more complaints about the property than I had before. Room: Yes, the beds are still hard. Pretty sure I ended up getting bitten by bed bugs while I was there as well... The room we stayed in was in need of a good deep cleaning. Obviously, due to the humidity in Mexico, there is going to be some mildew, but the ceiling in our shower definitely needed to be cleaned. The grout in the rest of the room (especially the bathroom), also could have used a thorough cleaning. Additionally, our shower did not drain properly which left us standing in about 4 inches of water each time. Bath Towels: time to get some new ones. The ones we had were raggedy and faded. Definitely not the towels I'd put out for company. El Porche Buffet Restaurant: Special kudos and thanks to my man Tomas for helping me out by providing me with some special bread for my "wheat-free" diet due to an allergy. I'm still waiting for him to e-mail me the recipe. I appreciated his taking the time to walk me thru the entire buffet selection letting me know what things were off limits and those which I could let loose and enjoy. Yes, eating buffet got a little old after a couple of days. We did eat at one of the specialty restaurants once while we were there--the Steakhouse... Unfortunately, due to my allergy, I couldn't eat much of the appetizers. Upon learning of my allergy, however, they arranged for some of my special bread to be brought down from the other restaurant. Again, I appreciated them catering to my special needs. The steak was good as was the salad. I wish I could have eaten the baked Alaska. It was fun to watch them light the liquor on fire and put on a show before they lit the cake. Wish I had taken my camera for this. BTW--they did bring me some plain strawberry ice cream so I wouldn't feel left out. (One additional comment about the restaurants...) Riu Playcar really needs to re-upholster their outside restaurant chairs. Sometimes I didn't want to sit down because of all the mildew. (Yuck!) Beach: I was incredibly disappointed with the beach erosion. They lost a lot of beach there. (Not like they had a lot to begin with). Then, they have, as mentioned in a lot of other reviews, a lot of huge sand bags on the beach and in the water. There was also quite a lot of seaweed to swim thru, making the experience a lot less enjoyable. (I was even more disappointed when I took a stroll down the beach to the Sandos Hotel and saw how huge and beautiful and clean their beach was. They also have hammocks and a whole lot more chaise lounges. Their showers also actually worked. Problems: Had an incident while we were at the hotel on our last day. I let my son go back to the room to get some rest while my friend and I stayed at the pool for awhile. After about an hour, I went to check on him. No signs he'd even been in the room. After three hours of searching for him, with the help of the Playacar police and all the available hotel staff (thank you), it turned out he had entered the building on the wrong side, counted doors, and gone into the wrong room without realizing it. The problem with this is, both our room keys opened this other person's room. Therefore, one has to wonder about security. Thank goodness my son turned up before I had a heart attack. I really appreciate the prompt attention the hotel staff provided in looking for him (including putting out an announcement over the P.A. system at the pool), but honestly, this whole thing could have been avoided if they had more secure doors on the rooms. I would guess this may be the reason for the numerous thefts previously reported by other guests at this hotel. Hopefully they actually fix it... Other than the above, we all really enjoyed our time at the Riu. Customer Service at the front desk, all the restaurants, and also the bars was phenomenal! I feel like I made friends while there and would definitely like to return if not just to see them again. After seeing the Sandos, however, I might consider checking them out too. NOTES: If you get the chance, definitely eat dinner at La Parilla Mexican restaurant in downtown Playa del Carmen. It was the best. Xel-Ha was great too. Definitely better than Ixcaret.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic tropical beach!”
Reviews.Author: mabeljones
Reviews.Content: Second time in Mexico and probably not the last , riu playacar is a fantastically well run hotel with superb standard of food , and cleanliness which was so expertly carried out , that it just goes to show why so many people prefer riu hotels. sadly our only complaint is that Thomson holidays promised us a superb tropical Caribbean beach, or so that's what we thought we had paid £2,700.00 for!. IT HAS GONE ! unfortunately and sadly, the beach is eroding , and has bean for the last 2-3 years. It is so bad that from the Iberostar hotel right the way up to Playacarmen , where I might add you could at one time walk on powder soft sugar white sand, is now completely awash with what looks like thousands of beached whales. How could we possibly renew our wedding vows on a beach full of giant black sand bags . These things 5ft high and 10ft wide, black and white and are as inconspicuous as an orange elephant! These would have looked great in our romantic Caribbean photo's , as we gazed in to each others eyes . The Mayan people were as always very friendly , always ready for a chat or quite keen to teach you a few words of Spanish, . This place is well worth exploring , culture is truly a wondrous thing , sadly mother nature will always have her way. Just beware of the travel operators , nothing is ever as it is portrayed in a brochure!.

Reviews.Title: “a Very good choise”
Reviews.Author: FernandoR
Reviews.Content: we had a 7day vacation on this Hotel, and in general its quite good, unless there was NO BEACH. the goods were>Location - just near the city of Playa del Carmen , a 5$ taxi ride, with lots of this to do. Rooms - large beds and clean room, Hotel Facilites-Not too many just enough. The Bads > No Beach-if you like to tan on the ocean, you need to go near hotels, walking along the beach. Eat-only 2 restaurants and no club in the resort, you will need to go to the other hotel nearby. Overall it´s was a good experiense of you are not a high end person.

Reviews.Title: “amazing time in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: jemimajem
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i have just returned from an 11 night stay at the Riu Playacar. we had a great time, and came back wishing we had booked longer! The hotel was a great choice - we visited the Tequila (heard that this is closing in August for a refurb), and although it was nice and a good alternative for a night out, we liked that the playacar was smaller and more intimate. We had read reviews before travelling and i was getting a bit worried about comments on valuables being stolen - i am always cautious wherever i stay, but we never had any trouble or problems during our stay. We kept valuables in the safe and kept our suitcases locked with any other valuables when we were out. Rooms - We stayed at building number 5 which was close to the pool area and beach. We had a ground floor room with a balcony which was nice. The rooms were quite basic, but cleaned daily and had everything we needed including a minibar that was stocked every other day with bottled water, beer and soft drinks. They advise you not to use the tap water, even for brushing your teeth, we used the bottled water which we found fine - they will always re stock if you run out. following other reviews about the beds being hard, yes they were, but i find this on most holidays. The day we arrived i phoned reception and asked for some mattress covers - the maid arrived soon after and put them onto our bed, and these made the beds more comfortable. The only thing we found, and heard others mentioing it round the pool was that the towels in the room smelt of damp. They were changed daily and sometimes smelt ok, but for the majority of the stay they smelt a bit funny - certainly did not ruin the holiday though! There was a slight smell of damp in the room, probably related to the air con, but again nothing major (although when i returned home and opened the case, all of my clothes had that familiar smell!). Food - there was so much choice and variety! There would be themed nights in the buffet, and lots to choose from. There also some speciality restaurants, we tried the steak house and the asian restuarant, this was our favourite. For these the they two sittings, 6:45 and 8:45, and you book at breakfast for that evening. Location - we were about an hour from Cancun, and a five minute taxi ride ($5) to playa del carmen. It was nice to be able to walk freely out of the resort to local shopping areas. Playa del carmen 5th avenue has lots of shops bars and restaurants and makes a nice change in the evening. We went into cancun on the Thomson bar crawl it was nice but very very busy - we liked playacar as it was quiter but still had the nightlife if you wanted it. Staff - all staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and could not do enough to help you with any queries you had. In particular the entertainment staff or "animacion" team worked so hard - they were there early mornings and for the evening shows - there was always lots of activities going on around the pool to get involved with if you wanted to. Weather - the day we arrived there was a storm and i was worried there would be no sun for our holiday! this soon lifted and we had many days of sunshine which was nice. we did a couple of trips - the captain hook dinner cruise was fun, and a snorkelling trip where we swam with turtles, sting ray and baracuda! The beach has eroded quite abit as others have mentioned, however if you walk along further there are some nicer bits. The sea is lovely, really clear. The pool area is also nice, the pool bar is busiest but there is another pool which seemed to be quiter. We would definately return to Mexico, we had a great holiday, cannot fault it all - we met some lovely people which made the holiday even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Visit”
Reviews.Author: rsumms
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen, Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico: A great place to visit! The Hotel was just what I was expecting from the other reviews that I had read. Our room, the resturaunts, main building, pools, and grounds were kept very clean. The people working at the hotel in all positons were always very friendly. Our room was very nice and clean. The air-conditioning worked well for those of you who need it cool in the evenings. The in room mini-bar was nice and was kept with bottled water al the time, although we did not use it much since it was an all inclusive we stayed at the bars socializing. The matress was hard, but again as stated in other reviews, we asked for and revieved right away a matress cover which did help a little. The two pools were very nice, never overly crowded, including the pool bar. Just as I read in the reviews, there was not much music or pool games. This hotel is for the person who wants to be secluded without a lot of people or being bothered with noises. There were a few children but not many. Everyone we met there, guests, were also very friendly. The resturaunts were nice. the food at the Steak Resturaunt was alright, better steaks in St. Louis. The Asian Rresturaunt was great. I did not think I would like that type of food, but it was wonderful. All the buffets were good also. There was a large variety of food at breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I wish someone would of told us of the beach. We were told two years ago Wilma, hurrican, came through and took away 100 feet, approx., of beach front. They are trying very hard to replensh the beaches and have these giant sand bags to keeep anyomore beach from being eroded away. They were still nice and you can walk them with a little patience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: sioDevon
Reviews.Content: Returned from Mexico 2 weeks ago and had an amazing time! The riu hotels are brilliant! We stayed in the playacar area, just less than an hour down from Cancun which is an ideal location as you are within easy access of all the trips/sites, but in a much quieter more beautiful area. When we got there it was raining, which i wasnt too surprise about as we had chosen to go at the start of the rainy season! But from then onwards it was sunny and boiling hot all day. We stayed for ten days, it only rained on the first and last day, so we were quite lucky for that time of year! The hotel itself is beautiful, and right on the beach, with huge pools and a swim up bar! In terms of beaches, so far ive been all around europe, north africa and to some of Australia, but Mexico's beaches were by far the best ive seen, beating bondi! If youve been to the caribbean/indian ocean i suppose you are used to it, but the beaches are pure white sand and actual green blue sea, its beautiful. Anyway, the service is excellent, and there is no pressure to do anything like you find in other places, no one will hassle you to get involved with anything if you dont want to. There are loads of free activities and watersports, windsurfing, trying scuba diving, kayaking, all free! Also tennis courts, ping pong etc. I usually go half board, so this was my first all inclusive holiday, and i loved it! Alcohol is all included aswell, like all alcohol, any cocktail you want, or just anything really. The food was good, for me places like Egypt and Tunisia have more vegetarian food, but my boyfriend loved it, and i never went hungry! As for trips, they all sound amazing, normally im tempted by one or two, but this time i wanted to go on them all! We went to Tulum whihc has a very very beautiful beach and lots of Mayan ruins. Th tour feels quite long in the heat but the guides are brilliant. We also went on dolphin discovery where you can swim with manatees and sea lions as well which is really fun and a bit different, and we went ona speed boat trip wihich is amazing. You ride your own speed boat through the mangroves and then go sonrkelling on the World's second largest reef! you could easily spend 2 weeks lying by the pool/beach with free alcohol and get a really good tan, or you could go on all the trips, i would recommend taking extra money for them as otherwiise they charge more to convert it and so on. Only bad points were mosquitoes. Definitely take loadddds of repellent as thye just get everywhere! And id leave dolphin discovery till teh end of the holiday as you cant wear suncream with the dolphins, so we got burnt! Other than that we had an amazing time and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Monkey....the drink!”
Reviews.Author: Mirella79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from June 1-8th. We flew Skyservice. Flight was fine, a bit of turbulance. Otherwise fine. We arrived at 10pm at the hotel. Before we officially check-in they had food waiting for us at the buffet, which was great! Rooms are nice. Nothing to be WOW!! about. Average, clean and well kept. Beds are pushed together to make a king, a bit hard, but I don't mind that. Shower area nice, and clean, seperate washroom area. Although if you are a light sleeper, you can hear everything very early as 5:30-6am. Food: Buffet breakfast and dinner is good. Lots of varitey, and theme nights. A la carte dinner is nothing better than the buffet. We ate the steakhouse, it was good, but no big deal. Didn't bother with the Mexican restaurant, as they served that everyday, for dinner, and we didn't bother with the Asian. Although we did sneak into the Riu Tequila for dinner, much better food and more variety. We managed to go there twice, before we got busted....hahaha.. You can only go there for breakfast and lunch. But its worth the try if you can!!! Pool/ beach: Pool is nice, plenty of room, expect it can get crowded when they have pool activities; such as aerobics and water polo. There are plenty of chairs to choose from, but the huts are usually all gone by 9am. The beach on the other hand was disappointing. I did hear that there was still some damage to the beach due to hurricane Catrina, but I didn’t realize it was that bad. Don’t get me wrong the water is beautiful, but there are huge sand bags in the water….they looked like beached whales. Also along the shore too, there are sand bags too. When you walk in the water it is very rocky, but as you walk in further its better, but there still are some pretty big rocks, so be careful, I must have stubbed my toe at least a dozen of times. Also you can’t just walk from your beach chair to the ocean, it’s like a little hill that’s about 4-5feet down. The hurricane just ripped these poor beaches apart. It’s not that bad, if you walk along to the other hotels, some are worse than others. At first it is disappointing, especially if you have been to other amazing beaches, but you make the best of it and have fun. After your first day, they don’t even bother you anymore. They are trying to restore and re-build the beaches, but it’s going to be another couple of years before it’s complete Grounds : The grounds are nice, not a huge resort, the lobby is a fair size, just average. The Lobby and grounds at the Riu Tequila are much bigger and better, but I guess that’s because its across the street and is not on the beach, so they have to make up for it. We also visited the Riu Yucatan, as you can go there too. Again, nothing special, and the buffet is not good at all, in comparison to the Tequila and Playacar Activities and Entertainment : We didn’t stay at our hotel for the entertainment. But did watch a show at the Tequila. It was o.k, a lot of dancing and nice to watch…but after it was all the same stuff…. We ended up going to Fifth Ave. You must go there for shopping. Tons of stores, bars, restaurants, pubs, cafes ect…It is sooo nice there. Especially at night. Feels like your in your own little town. Everyone just walks the streets and browses. Went to a nice restaurant called Casa Aqua. Excellent food, just pricy. Its only a $5 cab ride. Departure and Check Out : Our departure flight wasn’t till 9pm, so we spent most of the day at the beach. If you want late check out, its $50US extra, only if your room is not booked for the next people to check-in. In my opinion it’s not worth it and no need. They have private shower areas in the lobby next to the bathrooms, where they provide soap and shampoo and a towel. So that’s what we did. They hold onto your luggage in a secured room that is locked, so need to worry about your luggage. Check out was easy and very fast! Conclusion Riu Playacar is a nice hotel. If you are beach person you might be a bit disappointed, if you don’t care for the beach and don’t mind a 5mins walk/ 2min shuttle ride to this beach from the Tequila. I would say stay at the Tequila, as its overall appearance is much nicer, and food is better. If the price is good, book, if not then I would reconsider. Yes it is nice, but I wouldn’t go back again, as I know there are better hotels out there. It’s an older hotel, so it’s not like the recently new Riu’s in Aruba, or Los Cabos. We paid very cheap, so overall I had a great time, and you will too, if you really make it a good time!

Reviews.Title: “a credit to mexico!”
Reviews.Author: loulouSouthport
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from 10 days in mexico, we stayed at the rui playcar, the hotel is amazing! we really didnt know what to expect as we have never been to mexico before. When we arrived the staff were really friendly and we even got given a cocktail when we checked in.A Very warm atmosphere. We had our bags taken to the room, the room was a nice size, very very clean, seperate toilet, shower and a little dressing room area with curtains sepparating the room from this area.Comfortable beds, a safe and the room had a great balcony with a couple of chairs to chill out on at night or in the morning. The room also had optics which was really fun! choice of vodka,rum,brandy and of course the famous tequila! also a fridge with pepsi, orange, 7up, corona and water. The fridge was re stocked every 2 days. Food was fantastic, good choice of food, good variety each day, different themes, waiters were lovely. Iam quite fussy with my food and i didnt have a problem eating, i was very satifised every day. There are 4 types of restaurants buffet style, mexicano, asian and steakhouse. We ate at the mexicano twice it was lovely, you get a choice of mains with buffet style starters and a great pud, i was stuffed! The food was excellent. If you want to eat at the themed restaurants just book with one of the waiters at breakfast, they give u a time slot and tell you where to go. The pool area was lovely, 2 large pools one with a swim up bar and jacuzzi and the other with a volley ball net and a disabled ramp. There was plenty of sunbeds for everyone in the sun and shade. The hotel also had a towel service so you could get fresh beach towels everyday. The bar by the pool offered a great variety of drinks for everyone, we really enjoyed the cocktails they were delicious! The beach was nice although the sea could be a bit rough sometimes, again lots of sunbeds and water sports to do. There was plenty of things going on during the day at the hotel, the entertainment staff were wonderful, kept us ammused each day with a good variety of games such as horseshoe, boules, shooting, aqua gym, bingo and kayaking in the pool!!!! The night entertainment was very good, the hotel bar had shows on each night for the whole family, again a good variety of fun. The hotel in general was fabulous, very clean, beautiful kept gardens with lots of wildlife to see. We had a great holiday and have some very happy memories!

Reviews.Title: “Riu at its best.”
Reviews.Author: Trishak
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we checked in , first in the hotel but last to get a key, younger tourists ( ladies) got priority over the older clientele. First impresion was that the entrance was not as stunning as other Riu hotels that I have stayed in. Showed to our rooms, disappointingly all the worries that I had (read reports about) before travelling regarding the damp smell in the rooms were unfortunately correct. It really was appalling. We returned to reception, were showed 5 more rooms, but only one was marginally better. No Thomson Rep in resort , they were all at a meeting! , no telephone number to contact them neither at reception or in the Handbook..not good representation.,so we had to contact Thomson in London. at cost to us of £20+. After 5 hours the rep arrived, we had to sleep in smelly rooms for the night , then were up-graded to Suite rooms the next day. If you can run to the extra cost its worth doing the rooms are fantastic. From then on the Managemant could not do enough for us, it was obvious that they are trying their utmost to support the 4* rating awarded to this hotel. The food was top notch, at least 5*, I have travelled widely around Asia, US, Africa, UK and the Caribbean, the food has surpased most of the 5* resorts that we have stayed in. Sushi, Smoked Salmon, beautiful cooked joints of Beef, Lamb, Pork, Mexican delights, fresh fruits and salads and the best Juices and smoothies that I have ever tasted. Our rooms were cleaned daily and the beds were comfy, but although we tipped our cleaner we only got a couple of the lovely towel art , shame. Optics/ fridge was topped up every 3 days, however they will top-up in between if you ask..politely. In fact anything you require in the room will be done quickly. and with a smile. We were saddened to see that the beach had been eroded by the waves and the recent tropical storms, in fact we had a storm during our stay, and 3 palm trees were lost. We had not visited since the Hurricane 'Mitch' struck Playacar, 10 years ago, it seems sad that every storm erodes the beach. It was too rough to swim for most of our stay, but the pools were good so not a problem. There is two pools, one we found quieter, (the top one) and the pool bar - pool with jacuzzi, where most of the games are played. Try the aqua - aerobics they are fun and it works some of the food and drink off. !! The animation team are enthusiastic but not pushy, if you want to sit close by and watch...thats ok. You don't get dragged to take part. The dance and Mayan shows were wonderful, and the Mr & Mrs hilarious. But wear your Mossie repellent in the evening they are vicious. The Ice sculpture is good to watch, and try to guess what creature he is creating. Very clever. The BIKINI/SARONG outdoor show is very good, while the men are watching you can spend his money...I promise you he will not notice... Reception staff especially Wim are very helpful, anything you are not sure about they will do their best to help/ find out for you. Please if you have any problems however small do ask , they really know their stuff. Medical, tours and trips, local taxies or buses. Sailing lessons are available we found out and they issue certificates in English, so they are valid in Europe too. If you get a Riu card, you get 20% discounts from any of the shops or the water sport centre. Earn points to spend on future visits from your stays at all Riu hotels. If you visit I would like to ask you to say Hi to David and Rafael in the dining room, they are great and made our dining a real pleasure. I was'nt made aware of any of the issues rearding stealing in the Hotel, in fact the opposite, someone lost their purse in the ladies loo in the swimming pool, it was handed in at reception, with monies intact. and a bracelet was found in the dining room and handed in by staff. But you have to be sensible wherever you go and use the safe, thats the beauty of All-Inclusive you never need money. Wear your valuables then lock away, like at home, don't leave in full view. Okay summing up:- +Great holiday, fantastic cuisine, Well run hotel, Suite rooms fabulous. Friendly helpful staff. Weather wonderful. - Smelly rooms not good if you are asthmatic, but complain don't suffer. Beds firm but ask for waffle toppers. We all had a great relaxing holiday. ps ..swim with the dolphins, and visit Tulum the dragons! are huge... Any questions e.mail me and I will try to help. Trisha

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ChgotoCancun
Reviews.Content: Wow! I will try to be thorough without repeating too much of what has already been said about this wonderful resort (though hard, because what has been said is exactly how we feel about the Riu Playacar). Checkin: The front desk couldn't find our reservation. I thought about calling Cancun.Com (loved Cancun.Com!) and have them deal with the front desk. But, the front desk, told us (it was only noon) our room wasn't ready. "After you finish your welcome drink, I will give you your wristbands, then you go enjoy the hotel. Leave your bags here, they are safe and come back in a couple of hours to get your room, don't worry about the reservation". We didn't worry because they were so nice at the front desk and we got back everything was fine. The Resort: My first impression was wow! Wide path full of palm trees on each side, birds chirping, breeze blowing, which led us to the pool (and the pool bar). Though it was noon, plenty of loungers still were unoccupied, with no towel to reserve them. The pool appeared to be a nice size, though when later used (wading, floating-much later in the week, kids playing water polo and football), it was a little on the small size. No matter, it was glorious! The path continues from the pool to the beach. Again, no crowds. The waves were gentle that first day but rough thereafter. I was awed by the beauty of the beach, I read so many reviews about the beach being "gone" that I was surprised how nice and big it really was. We then went onto the Tequila to see it's pool and sports bar. The Tequila's pool had a rock waterfall and a little larger. The sports bar was a nice touch. No beach access though. Room: Room 5225 - Building 5 closet to the pool and beach. Second floor, great location! This is a small resort, so no matter where your building is, it is close to everything! We got to our room and we found nothing to complain about. Plenty of storage, nice shower (large step and a little slippery when wet) and plenty of space on the vanity. I found it odd to have packets of shampoo instead of bottles. Large closet with enough hangers for us and the safe, which was easy to use since you needed a key (don't lose the key!) to use it. We had room in the closet for our three bags, though there is space on a dressers to stack them. The TV had many English statiions and a remote. The balcony was a nice size and had two plastic chairs and a plastic table. Our clothesline was bent so we couldn't use it. No musty smell in our room at all. Our mini fridge was filled with Pepsi (no Pepsi Light), bottles of Corona and huge bottles of water. The Optics held brandy, scotch, vodka and Jose Cuervo tequila. We sat on the bed and it was hard!! We went down to the lobby and ask for a cover and extra pillows and they arrived before we got back to the room. One more thing, we never heard our neighbors or any cleaning carts. We did get our morning alarm of chirping birds each and every morning. What a wonderful way to wake up! Food: The buffets were delicious! Breakfast had fresh bread that you could toast and great preserves, fresh fruit, eggs, bacon (everyday), sausage, juices in all different flavors and omelets to order. The servers were quick and we had coffee and water on our table before we sat down with our plates. This buffet was served just off the lobby in air conditioning. Lunch was an outdoor affair with some of the stuff left over from the night before, but the food from the night before was so delicious, that we were glad! The grouper at our first lunch was outstanding! Salad bar fixings and guac, pico and chips were in abundance! There is a Corona tapper to get your own beer. For dinner we did the buffet mostly and we were glad! We loved the food. Once we had fresh grouper, once we had duck the next night was sushi (not bad!!!). We did try the steakhouse (outdoor dining with a beautiful view of the ocean), I loved my Rib Eye! We then tried the Asian restaurant and the same sushi was there and outstanding spring rolls (I got sa few of those!). The dinner buffet and Asian restaurant (my husband wore nice shorts and closed toe shoes) were both off the lobby in air conditioning. We had to make reservations at breakfast the morning of the night we wanted to eat at the speciality places. Easy to do and no problems getting reservations either time. Pool/Beach: Lovely! The atmosphere surrounding the pool is so full of greenery and foilage, giving it such a intimate atmosphere. Though the loungers are fairly close, it appears that you have somewhat amount of privacy. We always had a papalpa. I did drop my towels off before breakfast, ate and came right to our spot. We relaxed and then head down to the beach and watch the burn off of the clouds every morning. Every morning, it was cloudy and the then the sun would shine. Only 2 days out of the 9 were there, were more than partly cloudy. The first day the surf was smooth and then more and more breezy and rough. In fact the 2nd to the last day we were there a storm hit during the night and took away part of the shoreline and three palm trees! It was so sad to see. I talked to a Riu manager and he said the shore will come back. After watching the surf and the burn off, we go back to the pool. The pool (I thought) was a little small, and the water cool at first but it quickly feels warm as you get use to it. There is a jacuzzi, but it's an extension off the pool so the water is cool. I brought a little MP3 player with a small portable speaker and listen to our music while we relaxed on our loungers. Then the music at the pool would begin and the bar would open (no pool or beachside bar service) and our day of fun would officially begin! By the way, you can get drinks in or out of the pool. The swimup section was always quite full but the same people didn't stay for hours at a time. Entertainment: We only saw one show and it was the dance show. We loved it!!! I can't comment on the other shows. We either went to bed early, sat by the pool and had a couple of drinks in the dark (very nice) or sat in the lobby for a nightcap. If I had to write down some observations and tips they would be these: 1) Bring lots of sunscreen, the stores across the street sell it for $27 (US dollars) a tube! 2) Careful of the floors in the buildings if you are wet, they can be slippery. 3) The glasses are small, bring your Bubba mugs. 4) I didn't see any floats in the pool, brought mine but didn't use it. 5) Bring your MP3 Player with a small portable speaker, you will enjoy your music before the music starts at the pool. 6) Don't lose your hotel key in the ocean like my husband did, it will cost you $20. 7) Put the ceiling fan on at night. I think the air conditioner gets somehow remotely used by the resort because it gets warmer in the room at night. 8) Ask the bartenders for more liquor in your drinks if you need, they gladly will accomodate. 9) Bring a watch with the date (sometimes we lost track). There is a clock, but no calendar in the room. 10) We packed aqua shoes, but never needed them. The beach has no rocks or little pebbles to hurt your feet. 11) The staff works hard! We were left towel sculptures everyday. We tipped a $2 bill each morning and left it on the pillow. We also tipped the bartenders a $2 bill every few rounds. 12) Our minifridge was filled every 3 days instead of 2, but we didn't mind. Call the lobby if this isn't enough. 13) You can use the internet for 20 min. for $3 in an air conditioned room off the lobby. 14) Don't even brush your teeth using the sink water. I tried to mentioned everything that I would have wanted to know. I hope this helps you decide to stay here. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Vacation At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Finchykins
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Riu Playacar, and it didn't let us down. Our group of six were greeted warmly and shown immediately to our rooms. While the rooms are beginning to show a bit of wear and tear, they are kept extremely clean. The beds are a little hard, but after a day of fun and sun, I like that. We slept great. We had no problems with theft or any of the like, but then we didn't leave any valuables out. Why tempt? The grounds were amazing, the pools kept very clean. We spent most days at the pool bar, but lounge chairs were plentiful. Speaking of the pool bar, Alex took great care of us. Drinks were plenty strong, and the service was great. Other bartenders and barbacks were equally friendly. We visited other Riu pool bars(the Yucatan, and the Tequila) and felt ours was definately the cleanest. We did meet some great guests at some of the other resorts, so we still had a nice time. The food was everything we remembered and then some. Seriously, if you can't find something good to eat, you have a problem. The options are varied, and everything is kept very fresh. The guacamole is phenominal. We didn't eat at any of the themed restaurants this trip, but have tried them all. Our favorite is Jade, then the Steakhouse, then the Mexican. We were fortunate that on our last night, there were many Oriental offerings at the main buffet, including sushi. It wasn't the best we'd ever had, but good. The service (at breakfast, and at dinner) was very good. We tipped, but we work in the industry, and eveyone works very hard. The entertainment staff was great. We went to several shows, and the Animacion team was friendly, but not pushy when recruiting for activities. If you wanted a more relaxed atmosphere or less crowds, the other side of the pool is definately the answer. The beach has definately been affected by the hurricanes and erosion. The first and second year we went, it was spectacular. Last year was very sad. You couldn't even walk up or down the beach to the other resorts. While the Playacar had one, there were NONE at the other resorts. This visit, it seemed they stole some of the Playacar's to build up the rest of the resorts. Bad for the Playacar, but good for the whole resort community, I suppose. It was still beautiful, just not as much, and a little rocky. We didn't do any excursions this trip but as a collective group, have done the Dolphin Adventure, Xel-Ha, and the Mayan Adventure Tour. Email me if you have any questions.
