We did go into town (highly reccommended) for a few drinks, and then to a bar/lounge called Alux. It's in a cave, and very cool. We didn't eat there, but it was a neat experience. The service was also very friendly. We took a $5 cab ride into Playa, then a $5 cab ride there, then a $5 cab ride back to the resort. Check it out. One last thing. There is a new management team at the Riu Playacar. This new team is doing a PHENOMENAL job of being on top of things. Over the years, we recognize many of the same employees, and love that continuity. Not sure how the staff feel about being scrutinized, but as an outsider, new management is dong a great job. It has made a noticeable difference. Hope that next year, they haven't gotten too big for us;) Please email me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: KSgirl80
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at the Riu Playacar. This was our first time in Mexico and wasn't sure what to expect. We had a great time. The beach at the Playacar was the best beach in the area. The staff was incredibly friendly. I was a little nervous after reading about room break-ins but we didn't have any problems. We were also careful to keep all of our valuables in the safe and never left anything of value unattended. We traveled with a group of 300 and I didn't hear about anyone having any problems. The food was okay. It is pretty much the same food everyday even at the other resorts. However we ate at Jade (the Asian restaurant) and it was great. One thing we didn't like was that the hotel says 24 hour snacks which is great except for there really isn't much to choose from. The resort is really relaxed and quiet. We never had a problem getting a chair by the beach or the pool. Overall we were pretty impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your purse!”
Reviews.Author: TrixColorado
Reviews.Content: Beach great. Food fantastic. Beds terrible. Entertainment crew obnoxious (hound you to play stupid games). Biggest issue was security. We had three incidents of theft (two of which were most likely from staff members)...phone stolen, another guests purse stolen, and caught one of the staff members digging in one of our purses for money. Liked the resort but was left with a very bad taste in my mouth about trusting the people there to take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: EnglandPhoebe
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from 2 weeks at the Riu Playacar Hotel. This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The location is excellent, right on the beach which is beautiful, pure white sand and crystal blue water and a 25 minute walk away or a $5 taxi from the resort centre which has lots of shops, places to eat and bars. The food was gorgeous, really good quality and lots of variety, something for everyone. We ate in the main buffet every night appart from one night when we ate in the Steak House at the hotel. To be honest the buffet was much better so was stuck with that. Everything was really fresh and lots of it - not good if you are watching your weight! The staff are very friendly and efficient and cant do enough for you, they are really good and really look after you. The rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortable, excellent air conditioning, fridge re stocked every 2 days with soft drinks and beer and also a free minibar. Cant say enough good things about it, try a Miami Vice cocktail - fab! What is also good is you can use the other Riu Hotels (appart from the Palace) so you get a bit of variety. You have to eat your evening meal at your own hotel but can use the pool, beach and bars at the others as much as you want. Out of all of them though I think the Riu Playacar is the best. There are lots of beds around the pool and on the beach, never a problem finding one whatever time you go out. You dont need to be up at the crack of dawn to get a bed. Sometimes the evening entertainment wasnt great but that didnt really matter, some of the shows were really good. I noticed a lot of people have commented on trip advisor about the sand bags on the beach, yes they are there but the beach is still amazing and if you walk along it away from the hotels at the end there is a long stretch where there are no sand bags at all, it is beautiful. The weather was really hot and sunny for the full 2 weeks we were there. Cant really add any more than that but GO - you will love it! Joanne and Mark England

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar--"simply" wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Virginia7
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Mexico--each time at a different resort and they all have something special to offer. So rest assured we are well versed in Mexico vacations and I know what I am talking about. We even got married in Mexico 2 years ago because we love it so much. The Riu Playacar was delightful in it's initimate atmosphere and truly adoring staff. It's only 300 rooms so it is simple and relaxing. Here is a rundown of our experience: Beach--one of the best so far. The water was a bit rough at times but there was no seaweed as found a bit further north in the Riviera Maya. Small but beautiful. No problems finding chairs at any time of the day. Pool--great fun! Lots of fellow travelers and a great place to meet people. Pool activities were also entertaining and the activities crew was hilarious. No problems finding chairs or shade. Restaurants/Food--I would classify as better than ok but not excellent. The buffet was good and an excellent variety. The reservation process was sort of a pain as you could only make reservations that day for the evening and there are only 2 times available (645 and 845) but it was never booked. The Asian was the only thing I would classify as not good. The Steakhouse was very good and the Mexican was my favorite. Staff--always friendly and helpful and extremely hardworking. Please tip your bartender and cleaning lady. Rooms--yes, the beds were hard--as we have found in every hotel we stayed at in Mexico except for Secrets Excellence (now just Excellence Club, I believe). But after a few cocktails or a long day of excursions you get used to it and don't mind so much. Ask for a mattress pad. Can't guarantee you'll get it but they do their best. We were on the 3rd floor and there are no elevators but other than having to get your luggage up and down--it's a great way to work off all the food! Plus it's a very short 3 flights. Overall we had a great experience and I miss all the friends we made. Hey to Erin, Chris, Kendra, Brett, Eric, Emily, Ashley, Kristin, Chris, Lauren, Greg and Michelle. And thanks to Oswaldo our pool bartender who makes the greatest pineapple tequila thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: FRF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Playacar from April 21-28, ’08. Trip was booked online through FunJet.com. This was our 37th trip to Mexico or the Caribbean. Check in went smooth. We were in building 5, room #5224. Buildings 5 and 6 are centrally located. Julio was our housekeeper and did an excellent job. There is a well stocked mini bar. Never had a problem with water pressure or running out of hot water. The staff works very hard at keeping the resort spotless. All the employees are friendly and willing to make your stay a good time. The food was tasty. We never had a problem finding something different eat and the number of choices is unbelievable. There was a BBQ at poolside or at the beach, 4 of the days we were there. We are early risers and we usually staked out our spot next to pool by 0700. The majority of guests began showing up about 0900. Mother Nature has taken her toll on the beach at the Riu and surrounding resorts. We used to walk the beach into Playacar, but I don’t think that possible anymore. All said, it was an enjoyable time. We will be happy to answer questions. floydr@wowway.com

Reviews.Title: “Hard Beds”
Reviews.Author: chuckles20
Reviews.Content: Drinks were good, food got tiresome and the beds were hard. Staff was great and the weather was HOT....most women were beautiful and the men were not. Flounder, chuckles, prescious and Papi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: slrv9
Reviews.Content: I recently took a large group to this hotel for my company Columbus Travel. I have seen this hotel a few times but was pleasantly pleased with my stay. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The food was excellent compared to other similarly rated hotels that I have stayed at in the area. The location is great. Playacar is a nice quiet area near Playa Del Carmen. This hotel has a good beach and pool area. The rooms were nice and clean. My only complaint about the rooms would be the beds. They were fairly hard. I also was there during spring. There were a few evenings where the hotel had to quit the kids down. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: trixieMN
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive trip to Mexico (besides a cruise). We were very impressed with the Hotel and would definately stay again. We walked to the other RIU's and liked the smallness of the Playacar. The location of the Playacar was perfect...about a 20 min walk to 5th Ave and also cute shops right across the street and about a 45 min ride to/from the airport. Food was excellent, never made it to the restaurants, but the buffets were very good. I find it hard to believe that some people cannot find anything except french fries/pizza. Oh well. Great fresh pasta bar and my husband loved the shrimp and oysters they had a few nights. Rooms- smaller than what we expected but still roomy. Rooms were always super clean. Beds weren't nearly as hard as we expected (from reading past reviews). It's definetely firm but not bad at all. We were also on the 3rd level which wasn't a big deal w/the stairs (we need the excersice from sitting/eating/drinking all day:)) Pool - seemed the place to be for the entertainment/action. We mainly sat by the beach and never had any problems getting a chair. The beach was more quiet. All the workers - on all levels - work very, very hard and work very long hours to make your stay enjoyable and always have a pleasant personality. They were fantastic!! Drinks - never had to wait too long for a drink and the drinks were by no means weak. Different bartenders obviously mix the drinks different. Overall we had an excellent experience and can't wait until we can return again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Choice”
Reviews.Author: HappyHusker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple recently stayed 5 nights at the Riu Playacar. We could not be more pleased with our choice in hotels. Granted, we had originally decided to stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, but ended up at the Playacar due to my inability to book the correct place. What a fabulous mistake that ended up being. The Playacar is much smaller than the Palace and that made for a better time for us. You get to know the staff, and they get to know you. We even got a phone call from the front desk after being there for a day to make sure everything was ok. Reception also stopped us a couple of days later to see if there was anything we needed, or a special way we wanted our mini fridge stocked. The food...excellent. The service...phenomenal. I really can't stress enough how enjoyable the awesome service made the trip. The rooms and grounds were always clean. Never a problem getting a chair at the beach or pool. Shopping across the street or a very, very short cab ride away. This place ALWAYS has something going on, so if you get bored it's your own fault. There is no pressure to join in on everything though, so if you choose to lounge by the pool you are completely able to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahz_92
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say, Hotel Riu Playacar was absolutely amazing. The weather was good. In 14 days we had about 2 hours of rain. The staff are extremely polite. If you ask for room supplys at reception they will get you what you want within 24 hours. The food for breakfast, lunch and dinner is all very good with all different things to try. Everything is very clean, just don't drink the tap water! The room is always cleaned very well and we sometimes got animals made for us out of towels and flanels! The evening entertainment is very good and the shows vary every week. I think the best thing about the Riu Playacar was the entertainment staff. They made the holiday very enjoyable and tried to involve you in as much as possible but wont force you to take part in anything you don't want to. Some of the activities that were on while we were there were darts, ping pong, and air rifle shooting. All in all I would love another stay at Riu Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: CDN_Alberta
Reviews.Content: I really have nothing bad at all to say about this resort. I have stayed in playcar and other islands as well, and I only go to 4-5 star places. I would rate this resort up there aswell. It's a small resort so you see a lot of the same faces, and get to know a lot of people there. The staff was so friendly! Especially the animation team, they work so hard, and are great people. Don't be shy to join in on the activities! The beach has been washed away a bit, but you can still find a spot to lay in the sun. I was always sleeping in, and I still got a chair by the pool and beach no problems. The food was awesome! Lots of different types to choose from, I loved the tacos! And for those that complain about the food, I think you should stay home honestly. The beds were like any other hotels beds in any other country! (even first world countries) So, again those that complain, just stay home don't travel. Playa del Carmen is a 5 dollar cab ride, so going into town doesn't cost a lot. I would recommend this hotel for sociable people, (single/couples/ with kids) it's easy to talk to people in such a small community.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: holidaymad01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Playacar 6th - 21st April (Travelled with Thomson). Hotel was excellent and very clean. The staff were always friendly and very helpful , we were looked after very well. Rooms were always cleaned to a high standard. I had read reports that the beds were too hard, but did not find this the case. The buffet food resturants was always of a high quality with plenty of choice. The a la carte resturants were excellent and we used these on a number of occasions. There are 2 pools which were always clean and never seemed over crowed. Pool with the bar could get a little loud at times, but this was not a big issue. Not a problem finding a sunbed. Never a problem getting a sunbed on the beach either. The beach was OK but a little smaller than expected, this was due to erosion caused by last year's hurricane. Thomson rep was very helpful and the trips we booked were very good and well organised and excellent value for money. I Would recommend the trip to Chitchen Itza if you want to see Mayian ruins (even though it was a long journey).The tour guide that was provided on the trip was very knowledgeable and made the trip more enjoyable. I would also recommend Xel-Ha if you like snorkelling. The Playacar is smaller than it's sister hotels "The Yucatan" and "The Tequilla" and does not have as many facilities (but you can use their facilities and are both within a 5 minute walk.). However I feel that this was a benefit as it was a lot quieter and had a more friendly feel. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a relaxing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very enjoyable time here...”
Reviews.Author: jrfoster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Mexico, staying at Riu Playacar. Had a terrific time! It was about an hour ride from the airport, and pulling in the entrance, it was clean and well-maintained. Check-in was a breeze, and a room was ready for us even at 11am. We were in Room 3318 - beware there are no elevators! Rooms are average, nothing fancy but comfortable. Beds are hard, but in a good way, I always got a decent nights' sleep on them. Seemed weird to sleep on two separate beds as a couple though, but you adjust. The food there is very good, I enjoyed the buffet and the foods were a little different each day, with the exception of breakfast, it was about the same each morning. Only ate at the SteakHouse but it was awesome, and it was nice to be waited on. Be sure to get up early in the morning to book a restaurant for that evening as they fill up quickly. They pulled out a grill to BBQ on the only day it rained, that food was awesome also. Drinks were plentiful and service was fast most of the time. I'd say the resort was not very crowded, I never had to wait for a chair at the beach or the pool, but the pool was definitely more crowded than the beach. The staff was friendly and tried to get people involved in the activities such as water polo, bingo, ping pong, water aerobics, etc. You would not be bored at this resort. Shows were all good, you can see shows also at the Riu Tequila and the Riu Yucatan. Please take the time to visit both of these other resorts as they are a short walk away. The first night we were there, we had drinks and we were feeling a little tipsy and got pulled onto the stage for a game called "The Ideal Couple" OH! Beware if you are not athletic or competitive!!! We did some risque games on stage but how funny it must have been- or so it seemed from the photos my parents took! We won in points but lost in audience favorites- boo! But we won neat sun visors from the resort and we have a few bruises from our competitive nature! The only complaint I would have is to listen to your travel agent reps there who are selling you trips. They warned us not to book trips off the beach and to book with them. Well....we had already booked a $35 snorkel trip from the hut at the beach through Scuba Caribe. We told the manager that two of us could not swim, myself and my father, and were assured this was NO PROBLEM. All went fine at first, we were taken to the boat by jet ski. We took a long boat ride to a nice place to snorkel, we were told one hour but when we got there the men said only 45 minutes. They could not speak any English, just a tiny bit. So snorkleing was beautiful, saw many beautiful fish. Upon our return to the resort, we idled and anchored about 100 yards or so out in the ocean, on the other side of the bladders they have set up due to beach erosion. We were told by the two Hispanic operators to "swim, swim" and we tried to explain we did not know how and it was too rough and too far. Nonetheless, we were forced to try to swim back. I struggled in the surf until I got cramps in both feet, my husband lost a fin, and my parents' belongings were put into a garbage bag for someone to swim back with. My father nearly drowned. He was hit by wave after wave until he gave up and could swim no more. He was thrown on and off the bladders in the ocean. His glasses were broken too. Finally a nice Mexican man swam out and retrieved him. What a horrifying experience. I do NOT recommend anyone book a trip from Scuba Caribe unless you are a good swimmer, or unless you clarify beforehand the specifics of your trip. After much complaining we were refunded our money and sent to a nearby resort for a complimentary massage, so yes in the end we were compensated. I'd like to say this swim shop is not owned or operated by Riu Resorts, they rent space to these people. This was through no fault of our resort that this happened. All in all though, the trip was awesome and the resort nice. Take the time to see the other resorts, go into town to shop, and take the 40 minute ferry ride to Cozumel for the day- it is only $22 round-trip and worth every penny to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker018
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from April 11 th to the 18th. Overall we had a nice stay. The staff were awesome...it broke my heart to see how hard they work. The food at the buffets was very good..lots to choose from. The drinks were good and strong. We didn't go to the a la carte restaurants...heard they were nothing spectacular. The evening shows were a little cheesy but that's typical of resort entertainment...good for a laugh. The beach was nice...didn't have any problem finding chairs. There are sandwales to keep the sand from eroding...it's sad to see the damage that's been caused by the hurricanes but it's not enough to ruin a vacation. The water is a bit rough some days but can be fun if you're into it...definitly entertaining to watch people negotiate the waves. The negatives were the paper thin walls...we had a lady who liked to yell at her teenage daughter on one side...people who liked to slam there doors on the other and above us was someone who paced back and forth heavy on their heels. I guess if we had had enough to drink each night to pass out maybe it wouldn't have been an issue...oh well..lol. The musty room smell came a close second..we had to wash everything when we got home even the clothes we didn't wear. Again..not a vacation breaker. We didn't spend any time at the pool but it looked to be very lively...always a lot of people around the pool bar. If you like a quiet pool experience there was a nice side for that too. The other nice thing was how close to 5th ave it was. You could take a 5 dollar cab ride or it was a nice walk (20 mins). The street you walk down is quite nice..lined with other resorts and vacation homes.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation so far”
Reviews.Author: DrLisa36
Reviews.Content: Went to the Riu Playcar April 5-12. My mother (age 64), my two kids (ages 2 and 5), my husband and myself. It was one of the best holidays we have ever had. I'll be brief. The food was excellent. the buffet was better than I've seen before. Lots of choice, great tasting. No problems with lineups, getting a table. We went to the Mexican restaurant and it was just ok. the Buffet was a much better bet. Yes, the beds are hard. the beach has sandbags. oh well. The staff was great. very friendly. the evening shows were typical of the caribean. a little cheesy but fun. the only disapointment was the "kids club". it was a shack near the beach. only one kid there when we showed up. no real structure. lackluster supervision. the "minidisco" at night for the kids was the same each evening. but this didnt take away from the holiday at all. In general, i would highly recommend this resort and may consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Fiurst trip to Mexico”
Reviews.Author: TechSarge
Reviews.Content: My wife; myself & our cousins & spouses went to Mexico; we arrived Mar 31 thru April 7 2008. we were in room 5202 The 6 of of us have traveled before to the Dominican Republioc; this was our first trip to Mexico. We stayed at the RIU Playacar. It's easy to see why RIU has a 5 star reputation. Upon arrival on the bus, the resort grounds were spotless. Once inside one had to be awed by the marble and the graphics painted on the ceilings. The furniture was inviting looking and the interiors was "clean as a whistle." We arrived at the resort at 10:00 as,m,; our rooms were ready. We were promptly taken to our rooms, we changed quickly and went for a short walk before lunch. The rooms were clean, practical, we had a liquor dispenser in the room and a well stocked mini fridge. There was a large area with a walk-in closet; sink and the shower and a separate bathroom The food was amazing, you could not go hungry, something for everyone. All meals the rest of our stay were like that; if you went hungry you are just to finicky. The bed was very comfortable, 2 double beds pushed together, gave a good nights sleep. The staff; what can I say about the staff? They were fantastic, couldn't do enough for for the guests. Very friendly, courteous, helpful. There English was pretty good, and if you tried to speak Spanish the were helpful if you weren't sure or using word incorrectly. The animation team worked tirelessly to get people involved in sports & games. Management was was top of the line. The staff were happy in there work, doing little extra things for the guests which equals effective management. There are only 2 bad things about the whole trip 1) we only stayed one week, we should have stayed 2 weeks. (we'll know better next trip) 2) We read some of the reviews on RIU Playacar which made us wonder if we were going to the right place. But after being there the people with the negative reviews ie beds hard, not enough food or variety, staff was surly I say to these people stay home you shouldn't be traveling. To all my friend Wim Bracke, Jay Jay, Susie, Alexandra, Dalberto, Anne, Aldo, Claudia, Gilberto, Polito, Frankie, KiKe, Luis, Miguel and the hundreds of other staff we didn't meet. Thank you for making our stay at Riu Playacar an enjoyable one. We will be back. Ken & Patti Oshawa, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: starbaby78
Reviews.Content: I visited during the tail end of spring break. Overall this was a great resort! Check-in was hassle free, the bellman and front desk staff were very curteous and service oriented. The rooms were very basic and somewhat dated but very clean and spacious. The layout of the resort is fantastic- everything within the resort is within a couple of minutes walking. The beach is one of the best in the area. I was able to secure chairs at 7:00 a.m. without any trouble. The food was very average buffet food. The snacks and make your own espresso bar were my favorite!The resort definately had moments that resembled a "spring break" atmosphere but it never got too out of control. I would recommend this resort to anyone looking for something close to Playa with a decent beach at a great value. It's fairly upbeat so if you're looking for a relaxing getaway this wouldn't be my first choice. With regard to the reviews pertaining to theft... I slept all 4 nights with my sliding glass window open without any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Treehugger67
Reviews.Content: We came home April 6th form our 8 day vacation at the Riu Playacar. Everything was great! Everyone has different expections I guess, this was our first trip to Mexico and we couldn't have been more happy. Even some of the guests told us that compared to other destinations we really spoiled ourselves for a first time vacation! Especially with the plaza and shops across the street and the beautiful community of Playacar and Playa Del Carmen so close by. No boredom here, always something to do - if you don't mind leaving the resort. The only consistent comment I've read so far is about the beds. We prefer a harder bed so that wasn't a problem for us, I think we had a foam cover on our mattress as well. The staff was always smiling and friendly. Actually they locked our balcony door for us when we forgot. Senior spring break was a bit much but as the week progressed they weeded out and things got quieter. The food was excellent in our opinions - I thought there was something for everyone and very tastey. The Steakhouse was mouthwatering and the Asian Resteraunt was very good as well. The BBQ at the beach was a nice change of pace too. I would recommend this place and would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: Callistto
Reviews.Content: The best holiday I have ever had! We stayed (2 couples) at Riu in March for 14 nights and loved it! I dont understand why people complain about the food, it was great and choice was very good. We even put on some weight. Beds were nice and hard (very good for my back), pool was big enough and beach fab. Rooms simple and spacious. Staff lovely and hardworking. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “broken into the first night”
Reviews.Author: mageedah
Reviews.Content: Lock your balcony door, put everything in the safe and take the key and safe key with you at all times. We had an intruder hop onto our balcony and enter our room through the sliding glass door which I had not properly locked at 4:30 a.m. I was glad I was awake. I called the hotel security. They responded quickly but didn't seem that concerned. Never heard another thing through the rest of our week.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: PMann
Reviews.Content: It's been a long time since our visit to the Riu Playacar, but I do remember some of the important details. We were there during Hurricane Rita, but it was in Cancun so all we experienced were large waves that rolled in at an angle because the storm was sucking everything North. ROOMS: I loved the in-room bar, it was part of the all-inclusive (nice touch) The beds were horrible! It was like sleeping on a box The rooms were nice overall The shower was great with the detachable shower head. I used it a lot to get the sand out of my crevices. POOL: Big, always crowded, and the water is warm because of all the people. You have to get up early in the morning to save a pool chair BEACH: Wonderful! White Sands Beautiful, clear water FOOD: Not bad They had 3 restaurants to choose from which all served different foods, so that was nice DRINKS: the most important part of any vacation glasses were small drinks were severly watered down I know they're free, but come on... Overall, the trip was relaxing, the resort was very nice, the staff was friendly

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love it!”
Reviews.Author: SherriSue
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st time we'd ever been to Mexico, and decided to try it as it was much more affordable then Aruba, that we'd traveled to previously. What an enjoyable experience we had. The staff here was totally amazing ~ treating us like royalty all the time, and seemed to appreciate being tipped. The room was spotless and we tipped to show our appreciation there every day. The food was great and even the pickiest of eaters could find something they liked. We loved the bartenders as they were always conversing and joking with the guests. Thomas ran the buffet area excellently with a remarkable staff! The grounds were beautiful and well groomed. We would totally go back to the Riu and can't wait to do it. The 1 and ONLY complaint that we had is in the brochures and online it said "no spring breakers." The clientele was just what we'd wanted until the last 2 days where spring breakers did come in. They took over the pool area and did some littering and played some uncalled for pranks. We didn't appreciate this and know that the hotel wants to fill the rooms, money is money, but they need to not advertise that they don't allow spring breakers if they are going to allow them. This resort is so nice that the rooms could be filled with guests every night ~ don't resort to the immature antics of kids away from their parents. This shouldn't resort to the "girls gone wild" antics of other places. We would HIGHLY recommend the Riu and WILL return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort; not a good beach”
Reviews.Author: fbmich
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are both very nice. The food is good. What the Playa community doesn't want you to know is the current state of their beach. They had two hurricanes in the last 3 years that for some resorts almost completely removed the beach. Literally several feet of sand is missing. I mean several vertical feet of sand. It is a real shame because you can tell that there used to be a nice beach at these resorts. Now you cannot really walk or run on the beach without having to traverse these huge black bags of sand. These things are approximately 20 feet long, 10 feet wide and 2-3 feet high! The beaches are covered with them. They are slowly rebuilding the beach by pumping sand and water back up from the ocean. I assume they might accomplish this in a year or so. Otherwise, we did have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, But Not For Everyone”
Reviews.Author: Wirbndr
Reviews.Content: If you are the kind of person who likes to stay in a place more like the Ritz Carlton, then this is not your resort. If a room on par with a Holiday Inn is fine with you, then you will feel more at home here. The staff could not have been more helpful and courteous. They smiled and interacted with us at all times. My children felt very comfortable. The beds were so hard that my joints actually ache after the trip. We asked for bed pads, and they did help, but not enough to get a good nights rest. The hallways are very loud as this is an open air type of resort. Very tough to get any meaningful sleep under these conditions. The food was very average, but the breakfast buffet was very nice. Plenty of choices for anyone. Lunch and dinner were not as good. Even the 3 specialty restaurants served part or all of their food in a buffet format. Drinks were excellent and plentiful. Bartenders were very friendly. The pool and beach are excellent! Plenty of chairs, lots to do, and there are activities scheduled every 30 minutes near the pool: spanish lessons, how to make cocktails, bocci ball, ping pong tournaments, dancing, water aerobics, shooting lessons, and on and on. The young people running these activities were great. The concierge from Funjet Vacations (Omar) was an amazing man. He will help you with your travels and schedule excursions for you. He greeted our family by name every day and made our stay feel more personable. Everyone here speaks some english, so don't worry if you don't know much spanish. Overall, this place was very pretty, but for my taste I prefer something a little more high end. I would probably try the Riu Palace, JW Marriott, or Ritz Carlton instead.

Reviews.Title: “a great time”
Reviews.Author: vincath
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the riu playacar from 3/10/08 to 3/17/08 and had a great time. I've stayed at rius in the past and was once again delighted. I have never had a bad experience at a riu. Check in went smoothly. We felt sorry for the bellhop who had to carry our bags up two flights. Myself and the husband of the other couple we went with helped him and gave a grateful tip. The rooms were spacious and clean. The mini bar ( a great feature of rius ) was full and kept that way our entire stay. They fill it every other day and if you leave a short note of what you prefer, you will find it there when you return to your room. A small tip wouldn"t hurt either. Our maid did a wonderful job of cleaning our room. We were very appreciative. Food was very good. If you can't find food you like here then you better make more money and go to a much more expensive resort. We had all our breakfasts, half our lunches and three dinners there. For the rest of our meals we ate in playa del carmen. We truely enjoyed our stay at the riu. The staff is very friendly and always willing to help. It's a very clean hotel. So in short- A clean, relaxing, peaceful resort with freindly staff, good food and no shortage of alcohol. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: xplq
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Playacar March 6-13. The first couple of days were extremely windy and subsequently there were huge waves and little beach area to enjoy. Later in the week it calmed down a bit and there was adequate beach to relax in the sun. Overall, the resort was enjoyable. No problem at check-in. Do be aware that there are no elevators in the three story buildings so if you have difficulty with steps, request a first floor room. Yes the rooms are dated but were kept very clean throughout our stay. We did notice some mosquitos in the room during the week. The buffet restaurant was very good. There were a couple of nights that were exceptional and others just OK, but that can be related to personal preference, I'm sure. We did not try the specialty restaurants. Funny thing happened when we did make a reservation for the Mexican restaurant and showed up at the correct time. They said that there had been a mistake and that the Mexican restaurant was closed for the night because the buffet had a Mexican theme night going on. Since we were wanting this type of food anyway it worked out just fine. The buffet was great that night. We did enjoy using the exchange privileges with Riu Yucatan for lunch one day and that was very good also. Breakfasts were excellent. Service was always great whether at restaurants or at the bars. No problem there at all, even during the busiest times. The pool area is beautiful. There was nearly always a chair to be had and you could find shade if you wanted. The plants and flowers around the pool were immaculate. This is one of the prettiest pool areas we have enjoyed. But yes, people do reserve chairs early by leaving towels etc, and some never show up until very late in the day! Pretty good martinis but not always consistent, even from the same bar. Other drinks were also inconsistent, but usually exceptable. Wonder if this was an ongoing problem as we saw lots of drink glasses nearly full just left to waste. Although the rooms could use a bit of updating, we enjoyed the resort overall. The smaller size was a plus. I would return again, although there are many other resorts in the area that I would also like to try. The only other Riu we had experienced was a Palace and there is definitely a difference. But one should expect that. I almost forgot a very important thing..............the restrooms were kept very clean too, a huge plus!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most under rated resort in Playacar”
Reviews.Author: sunnyOregon
Reviews.Content: We are going back to the RIU this May 1st 2008. This place has the best beach and staff in the area. The resort itself is small a BIG PLUS. I love this place. Lordis was awsome and everyone always had a smile. The only negative thing is the bed are hard. I bring a matress pad ($14.00 at Walmart) as a carry on and leave it when we come home. L&S Blanton Troutdale OR

Reviews.Title: “Good place but beds are horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: muddyskip
Reviews.Content: 13 people in our group stayed at the Riu Playacar March 3-9 2008. The hotel is very clean, front desk staff very helpful, and taxis always right outside the resort. The rooms were very clean and cleaned everyday and a folded animal towel was on the bed everyday. The beds were unbelieveably hard as well as the pillows. We had 6 rooms in various parts of the resort and all of the beds were hard. The beach was nice although two days before we left a strong storm came through and washed away most of the beach ( see the picture). The buffet was good, had lots of choices. There were three resturants which you needed reservations to eat at. Reservation times were 6:45 and 8:45 pm. You needed to call before 1200 noon to get a seat. We found we needed to call at 9 am to get a seat. A Chinese, Mexican, and steakhouse. The Chinese was good as well as the steakhouse. We never tried the Mexican, could never get a reservation. The only complaint we had about the Riu Playacar was the beds. Otherwise a very nice and clean resort!

Reviews.Title: “Gave Riu's a second chance”
Reviews.Author: deuceDePereWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Riu in Peurto Vallarta last year and having some issues we thought we would give them a second chance. Upon arrival and check in to our third floor King. Be prepared to haul your luggage up the stairs{no elevators}. Room was clean and comfortable. Bathroom tubs are narrow and slippery BEWARE! We saw a man being carted out because he slipped in the shower. Room was kept clean and mini-bar restocked daily. We always left a buck or two. It does help!! Nice towel art!! Food was great but you can get sick of the same thing over and over. The 3 specialty restaurants were ok. I would have been fine with the buffet any night. Steakhouse was #1 Mexican#2 and Asian#3. Don't be afraid to walk into town and try the local places to eat. Pool water was cold but refreshing when you get to warm. The bartenders work very hard and don't be afraid to tip! My only concern was our last day and the pool was invaded by spring breakers. This resort is to nice to have it overtaken by them. Glad I gave them the second chance but will look elsewhere when booking The Riu chain!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: ChampMN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from 5 nights at the Riu Playacar. We had a great time although the weather could've been better. Unfortunately we had a couple days of only clouds and strong, cool wind. The rooms were very clean. We didn't see one bug our entire trip. Basic decor, nice bathrooms. We had a shower/tub combo and a big thick edge to step over to get into the tub. Not a problem for us, but could be for others. Maybe they have rooms without this type of set up. Honestly, we didn't think the bed was bad. I slept great! We have a memory foam bed at home, so it's not real firm, but I thought our bed was fine. They do a great job of keeping the entire resort very clean. Ok, I am a very picky eater so I'll try and not bias my opinion of the food. My husband thought it was pretty good. Thankfully they had pizza and french fries for me. I was sad they didn't have more Mexican type food daily. I also have a nut allergy and they were super curteous and willing to cook me anything I wanted to avoid any nut contact. I didn't feel that was necessary and found things to eat. LIke I said, thankful for pizza and french fries. They also have excellent bacon at breakfast. We hit a bad spell of not so good fruit, but the day before we left the fruit was excellent. The staff is amazing! Always smiling, wanting to make your trip very relaxing. Please, please tip these wonderful service folks. They are very appreciative and deserve way more than they're paid. The bartenders are fun and seemed to be mixing up all sorts of drinks. Definitely walk into town. It's a short walk, about 20 minutes at a leisurely stroll. Nice houses to look at along the way as well as Playacar Ruins. We walked during the day and night and we felt safe at night. Lots of traffic and other walkers along the way. When you tire of the resort food, there's tons of choices in town. I will say the Riu Playacar has the best beach by far. The erosion is really sad and a lot of the resorts in town barely have a beach, at least not a nice swimming area. Riu Playacar swimming area was amazing!!! We swam out to the big sandbag and perched for a while, basking in the sun with waves splashing over us. Pure paradise!! No issues with the safe or missing money. My husband left his expensive watch out a couple days not even thinking about the risk and everything was fine. Not that I recommend you do this as stuff goes missing in the states as well. Perhaps we were lucky? We are looking forward to a yet to be planned return trip!!! Oh one last thing, we booked our hotel directly through the Riu website. They included free round trip transfers through HotelBeds. Smooth process, no complaints. Also, check-in was super easy!

Reviews.Title: “Travelor Beware”
Reviews.Author: daniel_dan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 weeks at the Riu Playacar at Chirstmas. The food at the buffet was ok, but the 2nd week of Christmas, it cost double and the food got worse. All of the resturants were horrible....The beds were hard, but we did ask for a bed cover and that helped. The beach was beautiul and the grounds to the hotel were beautiful. Our Chrismtas vacation was spoiled by the theft in our room, not just our room, but our safe. When you check in you are given a safe key. They say that is the only one. When we were violated, that key was in my purse as we sat eating dinner on our 2nd night. The rest of the trip was pretty much over as we couldn't go on any excursions as all our money was stolen and we didn't bring credit cards. I wrote a letter to the Riu Corporate, that is why this review is sow late. I wanted to get a response from them regarding our problems since the actual Management didn't care that this had happened to us. But, the Corporate office at the Riu, said in a letter to me basically: That you should be prepared in your daily travels to be ripped off. So, Travelor's BEWARE especially when you travel to the Rio. Disappointed from Denver

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: carneynb
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect vacation, the weather was sunny everyday and in the 80's and cooled of just enough at night,the resort was even better than we expected and it had the best beach of any in the area, do not put any stock in the bad reviews in this site, they sound like people who just like to complain about everything.The staff were the best we have ever seen, very polite and anything you might think about asking for was done instantly and with a smile and a thank you, something that's hard to find in many places today. Here are a few of the main things I feel I need to comment on to help others who are looking for a perfect place for a vacation. The first thing was at the airport, we had our transportation to the resort set up with Lomas Travel which was great, large very clean airconditioned motor coach and a great guide with info on anything we asked him. Check in was fast,we were served our welcome cocktails and before were were done we had our keys and directions to our room and a briefing on the grounds and told to let them know if there was anything we needed so they could make it right. The rooms were very clean and spotless everyday, that was impressive, the food was great, fresh fruit and seafood and everything you could imagine, the buffet was so good we didn't even go to the other restaurants at the resort ,and the wait staff was very impressive as were all the bartenders on the grounds who we got to know by name, which helps when it gets busy, they say tips are included but bring some singles to leave every once in a while, they give great service and don't make much money,so they really appreciate an extra dollar or two and really remember you We booked a few trips with Omar, from Lomas Travel in the lobby, he was very helpful and told us what to avoid and what was really worth seeing, you have to go to Xcaret park, it is a 1 or two day trip, there is so much to see and do, like snorkeling through underground caves and great Mayan history, also a day trip to Tulum to see the Mayan ruins is a must The pools were big and clean and the shows each night were great On our third day we told each other that we are coming back next year if we can wait that long

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - second time back!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel17Minnesota
Reviews.Content: I love the RIU properties. I have been to this one twice and RIU Tequila once. They have awesome food, excellent service, clean rooms, great entertainment. No complaints about anything. This is my favorite all inclusive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great place but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: jr1992
Reviews.Content: Description of our week long stay. Positives: -The help is EXCELLENT!!! All the employees were very attentive and quick to action and as polite as can be. - The location is wonderful. I walked around a lot of the places in the area and I think this one has the best beach area. The sand, water temperature, current, and activities available are all wonderful. They have many different activities that you can do for free and others,like jet skiing, that are available at a reasonable price. - The food is unbeatable. They have a buffet that is open most of the day and the selection and quality of food is amazing. It was way better than I expected and the best of any place that I have stayed. They also have restaurants(all of which we went to) that you can make reservations for which are also free with your stay and their food and service is also great but I don't know if they are worth doing over the buffet. - The weather was wonderful. There were two days when rain rolled in but it only lasted a few minutes then quit. Negatives: -The beds were as hard as a rock. There was a Walmart very close (less than $5 cab ride) where you could get the egg carton padding to help solve this problem. -This one is really picky, but the only beer that you could get for free is Corona. -The only big problem that I had was the shower temperatures. They were AWFUL! The temperature would not stay constant at all. It would be freezing, then burning hot, then freezing again. If you went at a time when not many other people were showering, the temperature consistency was OK but if you went in the morning or before/after dinner time, it was horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, but beware of sidetrips”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaMillergirl
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at RIU Playacar and overall the trip was wonderful. The staff is unbelieveable. The beach was the nicest on the strip, great food, entertainment. Yes the beds were hard and a little ackward with two separate sets of sheets but hey, we were not freezing in Minnesota. The only problem that we experienced were the trips that we booked through NWA Traffic in the main lobby, his name is Oliver (red shirts). Friends booked a golf trip and he told them that is was all inclusive, well they got there and there was no beverages, a 12 pak of Corona was $47.00 and clubs were $25.00. Also we booked a deep sea fishing charter through him at Cap't Rick's in Puerto Adventures for the day which cost $850.00, he also told us that there would be plenty of beer on the boat, low and behold Cap't Rick said that it was illegal for him to have alcohol on the boat supplied by him, once again we spent $120.00 for 4 cases of beer (there was 8 of us). We asked Oliver several times about the boat and each time he assured us, yes all inclusive, our lunch consisted of 1 sandwich, we saw some chips on the counter and ate those though. We would go back to Playacar in a heartbeat and book our adventures on our own next time. Julie Miller, Minnesota

Reviews.Title: “In RIU love”
Reviews.Author: 117marissa
Reviews.Content: The RIU Playacar is a perfect little getaway in a great part of Mexico. Playa del Carmen is a quite and beautiful place to stay. The RIU Playacar was very clean and well cared for, like all RIU's are. The food was great and entertainment was also. The pools and beach are beautiful and clean. There were workers everywhere picking up after people, washing floors and cutting the grass or trimming the shrubs. The resort is one of the smaller ones which is something you may consder when looking for a quite and peaceful getaway. You didnt have to wait for food or drinks. It was a wonderful vacation and we would definitly return. The room we had was newly renovated and very, very nice, not to mention clean. The staff we're very polite and helpful. Every morning you we're greated with a kind "hola!" Great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “My opinion”
Reviews.Author: pfchangs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from one week at the Riu Playacar. Overall, we were impressed. We had an incredible vacation. Here are some tidbits that I think some may find helpful. The service was fantastic. The employees are all very efficient, friendly, and helpful. We were very impressed with their desire to make our experience a good one. We thought the food was pretty good. It was a little on the greasy/buttery side, but that is to be expected in Mexico! They fry about everything. The staff during lunch and dinner was very helpful. We give the shows mixed reviews. Some were exellent, while others left a lot to be desired. We felt like a couple of the shows were very distasteful (certainly not for kids). Some of the dancing onstage was very suggestive and we felt like we were attending a strip show more than anything else. We were quite disappointed by these shows. We were not forewarned in advance about the risque nature of the shows--thus we ended up walking out of two of them. However, the Mexican themed shows as well as a couple of the other ones were very good. The other negative aspect is the second-hand smoke. You can't sit anywhere at the beach or elsewhere without it affecting you. We estimated that well over half of the visitors were regular smokers. The beach was nice. I don't know how it was before the hurricanes/erosion, but we were pleased with it after reading so many negative reviews. It certainly seemed to be the best beach in the area compared to hotels three up and down from them on the coast. The other hotels had lots of whale bladders without much beach. We didn't walk as far as the Sandos, but we liked the Riu Playacar's beach more than others in the area. The rooms were nice enough for us. We asked for a couple of extra pillows and slept well. The beds were a little hard, but we didn't mind that at all. The maids do a great job every day. I give this hotel a thumbs up, especially because of the accommodating staff. We really enjoyed our stay. A couple of other things--we found it cheaper to book tours in Playa del Carmen at the stands rather than online or at the hotel. We found a Chichen Itza Tour for $40 per person --one that was nearly identical to other similar tours going for $80-$110 at the hotel. Also, we took the collectivo to Tulum which was $3 per person each way--very economical. We also found snorkeling tours in Cozumel to be cheaper buying on the street. Last observation--we would highly recommend getting out and seeing the culture around the area for at least a couple of the days. You can find enough activities at the resort to keep you busy, but we found it good to mix it up by visiting surrounding areas some days and relaxing at the resort on other days. This resort definitely is a great place to stay and makes for a nice base for a Riviera Maya vacation. We enjoyed our stay. We would recommend it for couples/singles without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: dobskier
Reviews.Content: The Playacar is the smallest of the resorts in the Riu area on the south side of Playa del Carmen. It is located close to town— $5.00 (US) a carload taxi fare to town or 20 min walk. The Playacar has eight three-story buildings, but no elevators. If you can’t do six flights of stairs, this probably isn’t the ideal resort for you. The reception, restaurants, pool, beach, and rooms are all very clean and nice and they have an excellent beach. The Riu Resorts are like McDonald’s, but not in a negative way. Rather, you know what you are going to get no matter where you are. The food is good to outstanding, the resorts are always clean, and the help is always polite and efficient. We have stayed at five different Riu Resorts, and while they have all been good, the Riu Palaces are the next level up, not only aesthetically, but in many aspects. The help will do anything within reason to make your stay pleasant. Of course, all resorts have a good and bad side, so let me address some observations that I’ve made… The price of your Riu vacation includes all tips. The people working for Riu make an average of $5.00(US) a day. Because of this, even an extra dollar or two can go a long way. I’ve found that if you want excellent service, all you have to do is tip often, and to anyone who merits it, starting the moment you arrive. The guy that loads and unloads the bus? Tip him; he works very hard and most people ignore him. Tip the bell hop at least a buck a bag. I hear people complaining that their bar and towels aren’t restocked enough. Our housekeepers get $5.00(US) a day from us, and we have always been supplied more than what we need. You want top shelf drinks? Know which bars have them and tip the bartenders. They will remember you. At the specialty restaurants, tip everybody… when you come back, the service gets better. Hint: Take along a big pile of singles. There is a weird smell. Naturally, it’s the tropics. The environment is much more humid and nothing ever dries out, so don’t worry about it. My room over looks the resort next doors’ kitchen and there is a lot of noise. You know what? Somebody has to get those rooms, so just deal with it. With the patio door closed, you hear very little. Did you travel this far to sit on the balcony? The bed is hard. Yes, and the pillows are too small. Just ask for a couple more pillows and get used to it. Beds in the Palaces are softer. The food is sub-par. If you can’t find something decent to eat at this resort, you should be staying in town and cooking for yourself. The resorts offer a very varied selection of foods, from local to American-style, and you are sure to find something that suits your fancy. If anything, try dining at one of the specialty restaurants that offer more specific entrées. All the chairs are taken. If there is a particular chair or spot on the beach that you want, you need to do this. Get up at dawn. Go to the beach and take a morning sunrise picture. On the way there or back, just throw your stuff on a couple of chairs and you’re good to go. Come and go as you see fit. It’s first come, first serve, just like everywhere else. You snooze, you lose. Towel issues. You get a card to get a pool towel, so don’t lose it (or your towel) because it will become a hassle. People like having more than one towel, so keep an eye yours. If you are saving a chair and only use it a tiny bit, it becomes obvious to everyone who is using the pool/beach area and your towel may “disappear”. Europeans. The people from continental Europe and Russia may seem loud and pushy initially, and may seem to look down their noses at Americans (especially when in large groups), which can be irritating. However, their impressions of Americans are surely similar to the impressions we get of them, and I’m sure you’ll find upon talking to them that many are eager to chit-chat and get to know people from other countries, or even just practice their English. There are many nice Europeans. Weddings. I’ve never set up a wedding at a resort, but have observed a few. The more laid back the wedding is, the better it will turn out. Things move a little slower in the tropics. If you have your ceremony at 1:00 pm on the beach, it will be sweltering hot. Be aware that everyone sun bathing on the beach will be part of your wedding. That includes the 300lb hairy guy in a speedo or the grandma standing there topless. It happens. My advice is to have the ceremony at earlier in the day when the sun is coming up and the beach is almost empty. It will be much cooler, quieter, and private. Riu resorts are a great value and a fun place to spend a week or two to experience a different location and culture while still enjoying the comforts of a hotel-like atmosphere and the luxury of an all-inclusive resort. I would gladly return to any of the Riu’s I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: trharts
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 other couples stayed a week at Riu Playacar Dec. 1st thru Dec. 8th. It was our 11th stay at Riu Playacar. This was the 3rd visit for one of the couples and the 1st for the other couple but not their last. They have asked to be included in our yearly stay at Riu Playacar. As always we had a great time and had nothing to complain about once we returned home. Front Desk: Check in went quick and smoothly as well as the check out. The front desk staff was very efficient and we were enjoying the sun in no time. Rooms: No problems with our room. Everything worked in our room and the room was clean. Yes the beds are hard but we were informed that something was available to make the beds softer. My wife likes the hard beds so we did not try it. The fridge in the room was filled every other day with bottled water, soda and beer. The housekeepers were always very friendly and polite. Bars: The resort has 3 bars. One in located in the front lobby and is opend from 9am to 7am (only closed for 2 hours!). Another one, La Cumbia bar, is located next to the theatre/show area. The third bar, our favorite, is the pool bar. This seems to be a favorite, with people waiting for it to open at 10:30am. The bar staff are always enteraining and ready to serve up your favorite drink. It's amazing they are able to keep smiling with the fast pace they must keep. Beach: The ocean keeps cutting away at the beach, but the beach in front of the Riu Playacar is one of the better ones in the surrounding area. Food: Breakfast buffet is served in the main dining area, our favorite is the omelets. Be sure to try a smoothie. Lunch is served in the open air restaurant close to the beach. There is a salad bar and numerous hot food items along with dessert selections. Dinner buffet is served in the main dining room with open seating from 6:30 to 10pm. There are 3 specialty restaurants which you need to make reservations for. They include the steakhouse and the Mexican restaurants by the theatre and the Asian restuarant next the the main dining room. Enterainment: The entertainment staff starts mid morning and finishes their day after the evening show. They host a variety of activities throughout the day which include; morning stretching, water aerobics, air riffle shooting, darts, boce ball, water polo, beach volleyball, Spanish lessons and bingo. Staff: The entire staff of the resort all seem to have a good attitude and enjoy their jobs. The management team of the Riu Playacar need to be commended for the excellent job they are doing. After returning home to MN we really miss the warm weather and white sand beaches. Can't wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of transfer/taxi problems, VERY IMPORTANT INFO”
Reviews.Author: ROBTIMM
Reviews.Content: There is apparently some sort of territory war going on between the taxistas and companies providing hotel transfers, namely Gray Line. Search for a thread I began on playa.info titled "problems with Gray Line transfer and taxi drivers union" . It doesn't seem to matter who you book with, we booked through NWA WorldVacations. They all farm transfers out to whoever, for us it was Gray Line for the ride to the resort, and some no name for the ride back to the airport. Even more exclusive resorts than Playacar do the same as their guests were on the shuttle vans with us. Get something recommended by those who know, read the thread. As for the resort itself, the staff was for the most part excellent. The meals are nothing special, we would have liked some good Mexican food. We got some as soon as we got back to Atlanta, (just kidding, we had some downtown), but there was very little at the resort. We had Thai one night, yuk!, but duh, what were we doing eating Thai in Mexicao anyway. Seafood was VERY limited. That didn't bother me so much, but my kin had a hankerin for some. There is plenty of variety, you certainly won't go hungry. Yeah, the beds are hard as a rock, the rooms are musty. Our toilet was slow to go down, and there was a leak in our ceiling; they offered to move us but we weren't there for the room. There are no elevators, avoid the upper floors if you have a problem with that. Our room on the backside of building 5 faced a big chow hall on an adjacent property. Trucks carrying water, food, garbage, etc were constantly beeping while backing in all hours of the day and night, slamming doors, etc. Most of the time when we heard them it was time to get up and get a Bloody Mary anyway. The beach is adequate, but don't expect any long walks, you can't get past the property on either side. The long sandy picture depicted on their PDF brochure is no more, it has been eaten by mother nature. If you want to hang out on a more interesting beach, go downtown. A long beautiful sandy beach follows along 5th avenue, the strip where all tha action is. If we go again, we won't be staying at an all inclusive, we will stay in a motel in Playa. There are plenty of restaraunts recommended in the playa.info website that are far more interesting, and in the end provide a more fulfilled experience. Please when you're in town, DO NOT PATRONIZE THESE TAXISTAS, they bite the hands that feed them. p.s. when drinking Maragitas, ask for El Jimador, it is far more liver friendly than Cuervo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Biggerstaff
Reviews.Content: Was totally impressed by the staff at this hotel. The boys in the dining area were always friendly and helpful - even after a full day of working. We'd see the same guys right from breakfast at 7 am to late dinner hours. Always a smile on their face and very pleasant. The food was excellent - usually we would be glad to come home after staying in Mexico to have a decent meal, but at the Playacar we were sad to leave the food! Rooms were average, but very clean. The only problem we had was getting the mini bar filled. So, pretty minor. Due to hurricanes in the area, most beaches have been damaged. The Playacar was probably the best on the strip, having at least some sort of beach left to sit on. Great service, great food, decent beach. We were glad we took a chance coming here!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: aldenontheroad
Reviews.Content: I want to start out by saying that I read a lot of reviews before we went on our trip and I was very concerned about all the negative reviews that were posted. So much so that my girlfriend was getting rather irate at all my nay saying before we got there. Once we got there though I realized it was much better than I expected, and I can't see how people wrote such horrible reviews. We had an amazing time at the Riu. Yes, the beds are hard as rocks, but if you request a mattress pad when you check in it should be fine. Besides, odds are that you'll be so tired by the end of the day that you won't notice anyway. The breakfast was great and the lunch was fine but with any buffet you get tired of the same food every day. We ate most of our dinners in downtown Playa so I can't give an honest review of the specialty restaurants. The beach was nice, but as most others have reported, if you don't get there early to reserve a spot you'll have a hard time finding one later in the day. Yes, there are a lot of Europeans but that was good for us, we like to get exposed to other cultures. Some other reviewers said they were treated rudely, but as long as you don't act like the "ugly American" (ie: loud and pushy) it's not a problem. We were embarrassed by how some of the other American tourists were acting at the swim up bar but we just ignored them. The rooms are not the most sound resistant because of the tile floors so it will start to get noisy around 7:30-8am when other people start heading out for the day. We were usually up by then anyway. The entertainment staff was amazing, Joseph, JJ, Laura, and the others were very energetic and always eager to please. If you see any of them dressed up in a cow outfit it means they got to work late and are hungover so try and take it easy on them! The bartenders were just as amazing, they work their butts off so be sure to tip them occasionally. I saw a lot of people ordering a ton of drinks but not tipping these guys anything. Say hi to Polito at the lobby bar, he's a great guy. So is Aldo at the front desk. Cab rides to downtown Playa are only $5 and you can take a bus to other cities for around $7 so transportation is not a problem. For anyone looking to get out and experience a little adventure I recommend the Alltournative Eco-tours. There are travel agents every morning in the hotel lobby that you can book these through. We went on the tour where you ride in a Una-mog (it's the first generation of Humvee made by Mercededes). The trip consists of a roller-coaster like ride in the Una-mog, followed by swimming in the underground caverns, sea kayaking, and snorkling in the ocean, plus some amazing Mayan food. Highly recommend it!! My only negative comment is about the rooms. Since it is a humid climate, the rooms have a musty smell. Not a big deal but my girlfriend has bad allergies and I think there were a lot of mold spores in the air and she was sneezing and was stuffed up for acouple of days. So if you have allergies start taking Clariton about two days before you get there and you'll be fine. Also, pack lots of sunblock because no matter where you go in Playa, they charge an arm and leg for it. Have fun and don't worry, it's worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Holiday”
Reviews.Author: chrisrumpelstiltskin
Reviews.Content: Best holiday I've ever had. The Yucatan peninsula has many fascinating relics of Mayan culture; the beaches were gorgeous; the sea was lovely and warm (in January!) and there was some very good snorkelling. We went with Thomson, and elected to take their trips. We had heard that it is much cheaper to arrange them in town, but wanted to be sure the trips would be of a high standard and we've learned to trust Thomson. We didn't regret our decision. The tours were all on luxury coaches, with interesting and informative guides, and lunch was included on their full day trips. We did Chichen Itza, Coba and Tulum and would highly recommend all of them. Snorkelling was arranged through the hotel's aqua sports centre (Scuba Caribe) and, again, well organised and all round just peachy. The Hotel Riu Playacar itself is right on a good beach, and the pool is a good size for swimming. The hotel and grounds are very attractively laid out and beautifully kept; spotlessly clean at all times. The hotel is all inclusive. The food is delicious with plenty of variety available pretty much throughout the day, and there's an excellent range of drinks and cocktails at the bars. All the staff were just lovely - so pleasant and helpful and genuinely welcoming. We don't normally bother with hotel activities, but found ourselves drawn in occasionally because the Animacions team made everything so much fun. Top marks to them for energy and commitment way beyond the call of duty. We enjoyed rifle shooting, Spanish lessons, salsa dancing and pool aerobics. Evening entertainment was a mixture of Animacions team and outside entertainers brought in, and was all very good. Particular favourites of ours were the Mariachi band and the Maya show - both absolutely excellent, try not to miss them if you get chance to see them. It's also worth going into Playa del Carmen for at least one or two evenings. There's lots of live music in bars, plus strolling Mariachi bands, and we thought it was much more atmospheric in town at night than during the day. Oh yes, the beds are blooming hard but what the heck - we slept anyway and I was so happy and relaxed I couldn't have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesTina
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Staff was super friendly. Buffet was nice. The fact you can go eat at all the nearby Riu hotels was a bonus. (The food is pretty much the same but it's nice to see other hotels and their beaches). I highly recommend it if you like all inclusive hotels. By the way, if you get stopped at the airport by agents who want to show you their spa, I don't remember what it's called now, make sure you don't go. It's such a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: LewisSouthWales
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and a great country! The food was excellent, lots of variety and the alcohol was free flowing! (corona my fav beer was included in the all inclusive deal) The hotel sits right on the beach and the pool gets alot of sunshine. I would reccomend walking to playa carmen and visit the silver shops, lots of bargains!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: JDB3404
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Riu Playacar with our entire family, including younger children. We booked our package through the Riu web site and it included airfare, airport transportation and accomidations. When we arrived, we were checked in immediately and taken to our adjoining rooms. The grounds were very lush and the buildings well maintained. The rooms were just a step above basic accomidations and as other reviewers have pointed out, the beds are hard. However they are clean and kept clean throughout your entire stay. All of the staff are very hospitable and were very pleasant the entire stay. The food is great here and the buffett has a large selection and is very good. Compared with other all inclusives I have stayed at in Mexico, the food stands out at this resort. The beach and pool area are very nice. There are many European tourists, so tops for females are optional. Definately a new "adventure" for my children. By the pool, there is no wait staff so you will be getting up to get your own drinks. There was a swim-up bar which was usually crowded with loud, drunk Americans. The resort does not offer any tour arrangments which was a bit of a bummer. However, we made our own and were dropped off at the resort after the tour. There is a nice shopping plaza just across from the hotel which had prices just as good if not better than on Fifth Avenue in Playa. Generally, we would probably not book here again. A little too basic accomidations for my travels. However, I would not have a problem recommending it to people who want a clean, nice place to rest with great food.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to start off.”
Reviews.Author: beach_babe5612
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about 2 years ago(in april) It was my first time going anywhere tropical! It was my first time on a plane. I did'nt really know what to expect. this vacation set how i was going to view travelling out of the country. and wow it has set the standards high. I went with my parents and boyfriend at the time. We got there early mourning(before check in time) but the staff were friendly and just told us that a room wouldn't be ready for a while and that we could leave our luggage and look around/have a drink. So we walked down to the beach(a short walk from the lobby) and wow. I felt like it was paradise. the beach is AMAZING. with lots of palm trees and just breath taking views/water.We eventually got our room and all of our luggage brought in. and we headed straight for the beach. The two places to eat are the main restaurant(across from lobby) for breakfast and dinner and the open buffet style for lunch) .(You had two sit down dinners that you had to reserve . they had a steakhouse one and a sea food one)they had amazing selection and enjoyed the pasta bar they set up where you could pick what kinda pasta u wanted and they cooked it for you. my favorite part was breakfast they had SOOOOO much to choose. & the ommlette bar was to die for and the fruit smoothie bar was delicious! We went on a snorkling trip. and atv/speedboating excursion, and it was wellll worth it.This is a very nice hotel. the rooms are very well keept and the staff is there the second you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Audela
Reviews.Content: My friends and I (a couple and single woman) went to The RIU Playacar from the January 7th-12th. We booked last minute through the hotel website and arranged our own airline tickets. Transportation: We took a taxi to get to the hotel which was about 50 minutes away from the airport. We were able to negociate down to 70 US$ for the 3 of us. To get back to the airport was about 45$. Mentally prepare yourself for the Mexican driving...Picture a 2-line racetrack with lots of cars, speed bumps and 140 km/h ride! Check-in/Check-out: Fairly simple and quick. You get room keys, towels cards and a safe key (free of charge). You get a map and some explanations as to where you can go within the RIU complex. Basically, you can go to all RIU's except the 2 Palaces. Rooms: Our room was in Building 5 (one of the two closest to the beach) on the floor level. That was great because it meant no stairs to climp up every time we went back to our rooms. We had a patio with 2 chairs and a small table. The room was OK. Nothing fancy but very clean. 2 double beds. Quite small to sleep as a couple in it. The mattress was hard but that how I prefer it. The pillows were VERY thin and we had no problems getting 1 extra per person. Each room has a small fridge stocked with Pepsi, 7-up, orange crush, bottled Coronas, club soda and 3 large bottles of water. The fridge is restocked every 2 days. Each room has a liquor dispensor (rhum, tequila, vodka and gin). The room has a TV with the major channels (CBS, ABC, NBC, BBC, CNN, etc), a hairdryer and an alarm clock. We found the air conditionning hard to adjust to a comfortable temperature. It was often too cold. We would turn it off and it would quickly get stuffy. Thankfully, the room also had a ceiling fan. The bathroom was great although our shower wasn't draining properly. Nothing we couldn't live with! The grounds: The property is well taken care of. There are lots of beautiful trees! The six buildings all have a different color. There is a main path that takes you from the lobby to the beach and the buildings are located on each side of the path. The restaurants and buffets: There are 2 buffets restaurants. El Porche is located in the lobby which serves breakfast from 7:00 am to 10:00 am and dinner from 18:30-22:00. El Turquesa is located near the beach and pool. It serves a continental breakfast from 10:00-Noon and lunch from noon-16:00. At dinner time, El Turquesa converts into 2 specialty restaurants, the Mexican and the Steakhouse. The Asian restaurant is located in the lobby next to El Porche. We looooved the buffets! They were beautiful, excellent quality and offered something different every night. We tried the Asian restaurant one night (Sushi was great!) only to discover that the next night's theme at the buffet was Asian and got the exact same options as the night before. Bars: There are 3 bars. The pool bar; one side is a swim-up bar with stools in the water, the El Turquesa bar near the beach where you eat lunch and the lobby bar. You can get all kinds of drinks. Local and international. They have a drink menu. Mojitos, daiquiris, differents martinis, bloody marys, rhum and coke, sangria, etc. Pool: Has lots of lounging chairs but you have to get up early to get one. People put towels on them to reserve them. By 8:00 am, a lot of them are already gone. There's lots of shade all around it. The pool is big enough and rarely feels crowded. The water is quite cold. Definately colder than the ocean. Beach: Unfortunately, recent hurricanes wiped beaches away in Playacar. It looks nothing like the pictures you see advertised in the magazines. It's tiny and feels crowded with all the lounging chairs all lined up BUT after walking down the beach and seeing others hotels, I have to say the RIU Playacar is one of the few resorts that's still has a beach. We were very fortunate. The water looks great. We did step on a few rocks in the water but as soon as we were a bit farther out, it was great! Entertainment: We went there to relax, so we didn't really participate in any activities except water aerobics which was hilarious. But there were lots everyday. Rifle shooting, darts, salsa and meregue lessons, water-polo, iron-man, water olympics, ping-pong, yoga, stretching, etc. The entertainment team seemed nice and they left you alone if you weren't interested. We went to 1 evening show and it was entertaining. Excursions: We took to all-inclusive day trip to Xel-Ha and Tulum for about 120$ each. Leave at 7:50 am back around 18:00. Xel-Ha is a beautiful natural lagoon where you can snorkel and do all kinds of stuff. Tulum is a site where you get to see Mayan Ruins. (Beware: if you want to film with a videocamera, you need to pay a federal tax of 3,50 US$).
