The all-inclusive Xel-Ha trip included transportation, lockers, towels, snorkeling equipment, lifevest, all food and all drinks (including alcoholics). If you want, you can also swin with dolphins for 137$. We loved Xel-Ha and Tulum. We would definately recommend doing both. My friends also went snorkeling to Turtle Bay where they got to see sea turtles and they also snorkeled in cenotes. They were very impressed with their tour. (74$ each, 8:45 am-15:00) Playa Del Carmen: From the resort, you can walk to Playa Del Carmen (30 minutes walk) or take a taxi ( 5$). There's all king of shopping and restaurants even a Subway, McDonald's and Burger King. That's also where you can catch the ferry to Cozumel Island. Overall, we loved our experience in Playacar. We enjoyed RIU Playacar personalized service and attention to details. The food was wonderful and the resort was beautiful. We will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “good time and value”
Reviews.Author: IRREVOCABLE
Reviews.Content: ... We arrived at RIU PLAYACAR the day after Hurricane Dean, which thankfully tracked south, had passed through. We were just looking to relax away from home before the kids went back to school. The room was average and the beds were hard. Now thats the only thing that I'm mentioning that wasn't so great. Otherwise everything was great. The food was good at the buffet and in the restauraunts My wife particularly enjoyed the Asian themed restauraunt.. The beach was clean and we had no trouble getting chairs at any time at the beaches or pools. I'm sure some of that was because many had cancelled their plans to stay there because of Dean. We found that the staff was very nice and accomodating. My children enjoyed their stay as well and enjoyed participating in the daily activities that took place for guests and loved going on stage to get the awards at the nightime show.

Reviews.Title: “More than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: writesimone
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed at the Riu Playacar for 6 nights the week before Christmas and absolutely loved it. The food was great and breakfast was my favorite. They have fresh squeezed juices (watermelon, pineapple, strawberry, canteloupe, etc.) and the buffets were varied enough so that you never get bored. The fresh salsas were also out -of -this-world. They have theme restaurants that you have to make reservations for and we tried all three---Steakhouse, Mexican, and Asian. Unfortunately, none of them could compare to the quality of the buffet. Sounds weird but it's true. For example, the roasted duck from the buffet was hand carved and was 10 times better than the one offered at the Asian restaurant. Try the themed restaurants if you must but we found ourselves back at the buffet after going to the themed one. Tip: if you take the earlier reservation at 6:45pm, you can still go to the buffet before they close at 10pm if you didn't like the earlier food. We also loved the all-inclusive bars. We had been excited about the in-room liquor dispensers but the bartenders were so great that there wasn't any point in drinking in our room. All the cocktails we had were really good. Another tip: you can ask for premium brands like Beefeaters or Jim Beam instead of their generic brands. Just tip the bartender a couple bucks and he'll remember to use the good stuff the next time you come up. The bar in the lobby was by far the best. They also had a swim up pool with stools where you can sit in water while you drink. But considering the copious amounts of alcohol being drunk, I figured that would be the most piss-infested area of the pool so I stayed away. While there, we checked out the other Riu properties like Lupita, Tequila, and Yucatan. We were glad we chose the smaller property because it felt a bit more homey. With less rooms, we felt the staff got to know each guest better and we were able to connect with other guests more easily too. When we visited the other places, they were so big (which is great if you like bigger resorts) but didn't have the cozy atmosphere of Playacar. Overall, we had an amazing time both in the resort and around Playa del Carmen. We've recommended this place to family and friends and we would certainly consider staying here again if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a great holiday!”
Reviews.Author: brisbane18
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the riu playacar from DEC-26TH-2ND JAN, booked a fairly last minute deal with thomson flying from london gatwick. I found this hotel a lovely place to stay, the staff were very friendly and couldnt do enough to help you during the stay. the rooms were a good size and nice and clean with a good view of the beach and pool from our room, the only thing i would say about the rooms is that maybe that could be modernised slightly, but thats just a minor quible! the food was great, plenty of choice for everyone, as was the beach, plenty of water sports and sun loungers! this was second visit to playacar first time was summer 2005 when i stayed at the iberostar tucan which i enjoyed slightly more in terms of atmposphere but i ceratinly would stay here again with out a doubt and for anyone who is thinking of visiting playacar then consider staying here it s great base for a excellent holiday, another thing, thomsonfly have really done well with there new long hual service the 33 inch leg room, seat back tv's is much apreciated on a 10 hour flight, they are certainly better than they used to be, cancun airport has also improved scince my last visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CoolRabbit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from Dec. 25-28, 2007. this was a last minute trip booked on the spur of the moment. we were not disappointed, this resort is wonderful! It is one of the few resorts to still have a beach (the last hurricane wiped out most of the beaches in Cancun and Playa Del Carmen). There always was plenty of food and drinks available (yes, drinks were watered down but they tasted great!). The hotel staff is incredible, every single person greeted you with a smile and hello. I liked the two huge pools, at no time were either pool ever crowded. There was plenty of space for everyone. Get up early to get a beach chair! On the beach, the resort provided kayaks, catamorans, snorkel equipment, etc. for free to be used by guests. The room was very spacious. I like a firm mattress so I loved the beds. The rooms were stocked with softdrinks, bottled weater, and alcohol as part of your all-inclusive. I highly recommend visiting Xcaret (only a $12 cab ride to the south) while you are in the area - incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!!”
Reviews.Author: PlayaChic22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Playacar 12/16-12/21. We did a short trip bc we did not know what to expect being our first time to this resort. The rooms were a good size for 2 people, i believe the beds are 2 queen size beds together so it makes it a HUGE bed. We have back issues so the hard mattress was not an issue. We actually slept like babies every night. Every room has a balcony... and the balcony is a very good size. The room was humid but it didnt bother us being we are from houston... and it is always HUMID here! The resort was small which we prefer. The food was excellent. It was sooo good we never went to out to eat out of the resort. We did try the steak house, it was ok. I think I didnt enjoy it too much bc i didnt feel good at all that night, but my husband loved it. The buffet is excellent and it is a different them every night... mexican, oriental (sushi-pretty good!), and international night. They serve steaks, fish, lobster, ceviches, etc. You name it they have it. Breakfast was our favorite... The beach was fantastic and the water gorgeous!! Just get there early to get a good spot... Over all the place is very clean, the staff is very nice!! The food, the beach, and the rooms were excellent, i felt at home.... there was a few negative things here and there but things we can live with... this is not a luxury resort. We felt safe, which is very important to us. I was a little worried after reading so many negative reviews. I will be going back around the same time since we had great weather too!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Mexico_Germany
Reviews.Content: December 26, 2007 It is with great pleasure to report what a fantastic time I had last week at the RIU Playacar, near Playa Del Carmen, in Mexico. I originally booked the trip for seven nights and extended my vacation with an additional night. This was my second time staying at a RIU resort and my first stay was at the RIU Jalisco in Riviera Nayarit, four years ago. The ambiance at the RIU Playacar was fantastic and the entire staff at the RIU was very helpful and courteous. Ultimately, a special ‘Thank you’ goes out to the Animations Team who with their daily activities around the pool made my stay very enjoyable. I very much liked the team’s enthusiasm and the fun they provided each and every day. I also enjoyed the nightly reception the Animations Team provided at 6:30pm with the opening of the dinner time at the Restaurant, El Porche. Each night there was a different theme and a lot of thought was put into the nightly performances. At last, I always looked forward to 9:45pm time when the Animations Team announced their daily winners on stage. I have to say the team made each presentation very special for the winners. Sometimes, birthdays were celebrated in a special way as well. After the nightly 10:00 pm show the Animations members routinely invited people to do the Conga-line which concluded with the RIU song. That truly was one of my favorite things to participate in and I looked forward to it each night. Once again, I am very impressed with my stay at the RIU Playacar and look forward visiting the resort hopefully soon in 2008. Sincerely, Monika Miraldi Saint Charles , Illinois / USA -- A very happy vacationer. --

Reviews.Title: “Great place, no regrets”
Reviews.Author: CathyManning_Iowa
Reviews.Content: Just got back from being at the Riu Playacar from12/15 to 12/21. There were 7 of us. Mom, dad, 3 daughters, 2 son-in laws all in their 20's. Everything was great. They have the best beach of anyone in the area. Great service on the whole resort, from very clean rooms to them bringing you drinks on the beach. Food was excellent all the time. We were very satisfied will everything. Staff is excellent. Everyone is friendly and always cleaning. Drinks were very good. Yes, the beds are hard, but not a major issue.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_Michigan
Reviews.Content: This was well worth the money. For an all-inclusive the food was decent, the drinks were tasty and the service was outstanding. The employees at this resort truly go above and beyond the call of duty to make their guests happy. The rooms were average and the beds were hard. But the overall stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Riu”
Reviews.Author: Ttrifik
Reviews.Content: My girlfiend and I stayed at Riu Playacar because we've been using Riu hotels in the past. but this hotel I would rate 2 stars because it was like a motel 6 beach resort...the bed were very hard to sleep on, the restaurant wasn't that great and you didn't have much option..the beach were rocky and small... But the best thing about Riu they gave us a promotional stay in Riu Palace next door...we book for Riu Playacar and only stayed for two nights then we moved to Riu Palace...the place was gorgeous everything was great and the best thing is we only paid for the Riu Playacar..we definately took advantage of the deal that they offer us..hopefully our next vacation in Ocho Rios, Jamaica will be the same as our last stay with Riu

Reviews.Title: “An honest review”
Reviews.Author: cheeseheadinparadise
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep this review brief, to the point and as helpful as possible. Our family of 4 returned yesterday after a week at the Riu. My husband and I are seasoned travelers and we've stayed in all-inclusives, condos and regular hotels all over the Caribbean, and this was our first visit to Playa del Carmen. Rooms: The good--spacious, clean, separate toilet area, good location, mini bar & fridge. The bad: beds (hard & two separate doubles), view (an access road & wall), noise, mosquitos, theft (my son thinks someone stole $20 from his shorts, which were in his suitcase) and temperature (the air conditioning couldn't keep up with the heat so it was difficult to sleep). Service: The good--Almost everyone was polite and friendly. No complaints except for the maid. Our kids thought she/he didn't like them! Besides the theft, my other son found some of his clothes in the shower, wet and covered with vomit. He was ill one day and he thinks she cleaned up the bathroom with them! I did see a male employee going into a room in the middle of the afternoon and couldn't see a reason for it. He didn't have a cart with towels, beverages or cleaning equipment with him. Hmmm... One day our door was left open after being cleaned. It was a good thing we kept our valuables in the safe. Pool/Beach: The good--the bartenders at the pool bar did a good job keeping people entertained and I can't believe the booze is watered down. All of us had the hangovers to prove it! There are 2 pools, an activity pool with the bar (fun) and relaxing pool. They're nice and cool but not too cold like other places I've been. The beach was one of the nicest in the area due to erosion and the water was warm. The bad--you had to get a chair early (8:00 was typical) or you were stuck with a broken one. If you're a prude you'll hate all the topless girls. Lots of cigarette butts and vendors. No beach bar or service. Food: The good--Everyone liked the food, no complaints. We were there for Thanksgiving and we had turkey and mashed potatoes. Every night was a different theme in the buffet. The steakhouse restaurant was ok and the Oriental was good. We had Mexican night in the buffet so didn't try the Mexican restaurant. No one got sick from the food. The bad--We're from Wisconsin and missed our cold milk and Coke. I just can't drink luke warm milk with my breakfast! Call me picky! The drinks were fine although you have to ask for the brand you want or they'll give you the house brand. Entertainment: The good--we didn't get too involved in the activities but our boys did and had fun. If you win at one of the "tournaments" during the day you go on stage at night to get your prize. The show dancers were pretty good. We only went to 3 shows. The bad: the show starts @ 9:45 so that's kind of late and after the show there's nothing to do except drink at the lobby bar. You have to go down the block across the street to the Riu Tequila to the sports bar (they charge for all the games & internet) or disco. We were advised not to go into town at night. Ambiance: The good--it was casual and safe. The bad--WAY too many Europeans. Of course some were nice but the majority were pushy and rude. I have too many examples to write. Before we book another trip we'll check to make sure it's geared towards Americans. We won't be returning to this resort because there are so many more out there. The area is very pretty and interesting so we might try another area in a few years. Hope this review helped!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: rubyq
Reviews.Content: I am prompted to write a review on this resort after seeing some of the less than stellar reviews lately. We travelled last November and had a wonderful experience at this hotel. Granted it is small, but with acess to larger RIU properties down the beach and across the road, you were free to move to a more activities-centered resort if you wanted more action. Our service was exceptional. Guest services sent a bottle of champagne for our anniversary, and in general, from the moment of check in to check out, staff went above and beyond expectations. The Japanese a-la-carte was excellent but would have to say the other a-la-cartes were simply average. The setting on the beach is beautiful however the food was not that good. Clearly the RIU chain is known for their buffets and throughout the day & evening they were excellent. We enjoy eating at a la cartes but the buffets here were simply better. This resort is easy to manoever given it is quite small, and for people looking for a quieter vacation, this hotel is for you. The rooms were very clean, the washrooms spacious (no tub though) and the liquor dispensers handy for an evening cocktail before heading out to dinner. The exceptional service, cleanliness and fantasic buffets but this resort above average. Please feel free to PM me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “average...about a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: escape_the_cold
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Playacar from October 27-31, 2007. Check-in was fine. We arrived around 1 pm and were able to get into our room right away. Room keys were actual metal keys with the room number printed on them, not the most secure set-up! Room: We stayed in a king room in building #2 (closest to lobby), 3rd floor. Room was small with a king bed, dresser, and a small round table with 2 chairs. Even with only 2 people we felt like we were tripping over each other. Bathroom was nice and large. However, there were little ants crawling all over the vanity for most of our stay. The room was clean, but starting to show some wear and tear. Liquor dispensor had some Mexican brands of vodka, whiskey, and rum, plus 1 bottle of Jose Cuervo tequila. Our mini-bar was stocked daily with bottles of water, plus soda and beer. Beach: Nice, small beach with plenty of lounge chairs available. Lots of palm trees provide some much needed shade when you're ready to take break from the intense sun. Food: We were pleasantly surprised with the food at this resort. With the exception of the lunch buffet, we thought the food was very good for an all-inclusive resort. There is no 24 hour room service or food available late at night, so keep that in mind if you want to eat after the bars close... Overall: It was an average 3 star all-inclusive resort. We liked the proximity to Playa del Carmen, about a 5 min cab ride. It was OK for the price, but next time we'll spend a little more to upgrade to a nicer resort.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Resort-but not a '5 Golden Apple'”
Reviews.Author: Sunny520
Reviews.Content: We went to the Riu Playacar Nov. 3-Nov. 10, 2007. It was a very beautiful and small resort with in my opinion the best beach of all the resorts in the area. The staff was great, the shows at night were wonderful, rooms were very clean (but need an elevator to the 3rd floor!), but we will not be returning due to the fact that most of the beach in Playa has eroded and it is very hard to walk anywhere down the beach because there is no shore left- it has sandbags/rocks lining it or water is going right up to the hotels. Other travelers have said you could walk the beach as far as you wanted to a few years ago, so we were not expecting the lack of beach. We had a good time at the Riu Playacar, but were a little dissapointed in its '5 Golden Apple' rating. It seemed just like many '4 regular Apple' hotels that I have been at. The specialty restaurants were the only way to go as we felt the buffet for dinner was not good. I was expecting better food for this rating (more seafood, steak, etc.). We have been to a '6 Apple' and WOW what a difference, we were thinking this would just be a step down from that, but that was not quite the case! We had a good time though, but find that traveling within the US is now cheaper than coming to Mexico and we can get better food in the US for less $ as well as souveniers and such-that were terribly overpriced in the town (5th Ave.) as it seems to be more of a tourist trap now than the old Mexico that I have traveled to in the past where you can barter, etc and don't have to pay $10-12 just for a hamburger and fries in town or $9 for a bag of Chex mix at the Cancun airport!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: LondonBananamamma
Reviews.Content: Came back on the 5th of Nov, after a week stay here. Could not fault anything at all. Food was excellent, accomadtion was excellent, felt extremly safe at all times and would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Everything as it should be.”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier47034
Reviews.Content: Our group of 16 people mixed men and women, ages 28 to 69 visited this hotel from Nov 4-8. We found almost everything great. The grounds are impeccable, the buildings are clean and in good repair. Maintainence is ongoing. The only problem was with the hot water. We did find out that all you need to do is to turn on the faucet and go drink a beer, and presto the water is hot. The food is exceptional for what it is. It does get boring, but hey what doesn't? All in all Very Good. This is my second time at this resort and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Mexico626
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful but the service was not so great. They don't have 24 hrs room service. They only carry Pepsi products, very limited on the selection of liquor they have in stock. Food was very tasteless. Their room keys are a nightmare. They offer only a 24 hrs Sport Bar that you have to pay to use the pool tables and air hockey. Nothing to do after 11pm at the hotel. Some of the staff would be great others just did a bad job. Beds are hard and Showers don't have lights. While we were there the water was off for 2 hours in the morning. I wouldn't return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: AshfordBan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from Riu Playacar and I can only praise the hotel & its staff. All are friendly and very willing to help. A nice touch was the way they encouraged us to use a few words of spanish to greet each other. By the end of two weeks I think we were getting there! The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Like others have said the beds are firm, but we always slept well. We also liked the numerous 'animals' the cleaning staff constructed from the towels each day. We always had clean towels (and face-clothes!) and a stocked mini-bar and had no security problems. The food was also great with something (no many things) for everyone. We tried all 3 of the restaurants and liked them all. However in the end we prefered the buffet for choice and the ability to control portions. It is easy to overeat at the hotel. I had a birthday whilst I was there and although we did not tell anyone I received presents from both the desk staff and the PR Team. Another personal touch. My husband dived with the resident dive centre run by Scuba Caribe and found them very professional, helpful and friendly. We also went on a couple of organised trips which we booked through the hotels resident advisor - much better ythan either Thompson or Grays (based in the small plaza opposite) in terms of advice, personal touches and price. We hired a car from Thrifty - also based in the hotel - and found the service good, the rates competative and the car itself exactly what we wanted. Driving is much slower than at home because of the roads but I would strongly recommend this for a long trip, like going to Chichen Itza rather than choosing an orgainsed coach trip. We stopped off at Valladolid and had a large lunch for 2 plus coffee for 58 pesos (£2.50). A great bargain and a different experinece.W e stayed at the Hacienda Chichen (and would recommend it) so were able to visit Chichen Itza at 8.30am. There were then very few tourists so we were able to appreciate the atmosphere of the site and get some great pictures without lots of people in them. It was nice to leave at about noon when it was getting very hot and filling up fast. Finally I would recommend the sea trek at Xel Ha. A great experience for a non-diving partner of a diver!

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: carlaenid
Reviews.Content: Riu Hotels are usually top of the line, but the Riu Playacar is just plain bad. The food is greasy and flavorless, the rooms have hard beds, no lights in the showers and prone to mosquitos. Spend the extra money and go to a nicer Riu hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no problems at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: moxiempls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Riu Playacar in mid April '07. I should have written this sooner! I am surprised to see that there are a fair amount of negative reviews about this resort-I was nervous after I booked the trip, and then read so many reviews here by unhappy guests! (I have been to PDC once before, stayed at the VivaMaya.) We really enjoyed our stay; our beach was one of the nicest in the Playacar resort area (gated area where most of the big resorts/AI are). We walked up and down the beach, and due to the tropical storms, most of the beaches at each property had sand bags, and lots of erosion. The drinks were rather weak, and all the frozen drinks tasted really sugary. But the Corona on tap at all times was great! You can get it whenever you want. And of course the minibar in the room was nice too, along with the liquor dispenser (terrible low grade tequila and other alcohols, but hey, its in room). Our beds were quite hard, but you more or less can deal. Yes, there tends to be a general mustiness, however, in the 3 times I have been to Cancun, and 2 x to PDC, this seems to be something that is just a given in a tropical moist climate. ( The only place I didnt experience that was the Marriott CasaMagna in Cancun, and we could only afford to stay there one night!) Basically, for the price, which is somewhat high but average, this is a nice place. It is not luxury, or high end, but once you have been to a couple of these resorts, and done more research after each trip, you will find the complaints, and raves, to be similar at all places. Everyone experiences something different. I would be glad to visit this place again. I highly recommend taking the free intro scuba lessons in the pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: BongoBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Riu Playacar on September 22--29, 2007. We loved it here! It’s a small place but that is what we look for and what I prefer. Some people complained that the rooms needed updating. My room was fine and very clean. How much time are you going to spend in your room anyway—you’re on vacation! If you are going to stay in your room that much time to care, stay home! As to the food, I loved it. I have stayed in other all-inclusive resorts and the food didn’t compare. Try the ice cream—yummo! The wait staff and the entertainment staff in the pool area were very friendly and hilarious. The beach was absolutely beautiful!! Already planning my next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: JamBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar in Playacar, Mexico. We had a lovely time and really did not want to come home. Hotel was clean and staff friendly. Entertainment: evening shows were very good and to a high standard. Entertainment staff friendly and tried to get everyone involved, although it was a bit werid being in minority of being British, and people not understanding us. Only problems we did encounter was with the room:- our room door had been left open 3 days on the trot. Once we had reported it to Reception they immediately sent someone up to apologise. This was caused by the door not being closed properly after the maid had cleaned our room. The other time was when our toilet wouldn't flushagain they sorted the problem out immediately. Overall we had a fantastic stay at this hotel and recommend it to anyone wanting a nice relaxing time on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back to a Riu”
Reviews.Author: amyrachel
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed in Mexico and the Dominican Republic at an Iberostar so maybe my view is a little tainted but I felt this was the worst place I have stayed so far. I chose this place because of its size and price and I guess that is what I paid for . First of all the place is clean, the staff is great and the food was good. No complaints there. But it is very small, the beds are rock hard and they don't like to pass out washcloths for some reason. There were 11 of us on this trip and most of us had to call for a washcloth everyday. We asked for foam mattresses for the bed and received them immediately, but they didn't improve the bed any. The absolute worse thing about this resort were the guests who have no regard for children or people trying to sleep. THERE WAS ABSOLUTELY NO PLACE FOR YOUNG CHILDREN TO SWIM WITHOUT ENCOUNTERING WOMEN RUNNING AROUND TOPLESS AND WITH STRINGS UP THEIR BUTT!! No where! No designated area for them or for us. And when we asked about a place to take our children to swim, we were basically told there was nothing they could do. Iberostar's policy has always been that the women could not go topless at the pool. Only at the beach. So we were able to choose there. Anyway, it made for a long boring vacation for our children. My relatives stayed in a building where the guests made so much racket every night, they didn't get much sleep. So while I am sure they (those making the noise) were having a great vacation, my relatives didn't get much sleep. My advice - this place is not for families. There are a lot of better resorts out there.

Reviews.Title: “stay someplace else”
Reviews.Author: curt979
Reviews.Content: We went to Riu Playacar for our honeymoon. We have been to mexico 6 other times, but never to playa del carmen (or anywhere in the riviera maya). We were greatly disappointed with our experience. We told them in advance we were on our honeymoon and were told we could have an "ocean view". We were also told there would be champagne or wine waiting for us in our room. When we arrived, we were disappointed with the fact that we had a wonderfull view of nothing but a tree. Also, no champagne or wine (not a big deal for me, but my wife was disappointed). Also the rooms were clean, but needed some updating badly. The towels were worn, in fact one had a hole in it. The room itself had a horrible musty smell to it. Now every resort in mexico we ever stayed at had this same smell. Usually it is minor, and you don't even notice it after about 15 minutes or so. The smell this time never improved. The food- horrible. Worst buffet food I have had at any all inclusive The staff- well we called three times to have an Iron delivered to our room. We finally gave up. It never was brought. The pool- dont know. We left before getting a chance to use it. We arrived to the resort at about 6 pm on Monday Sept 24, by 11 am the next day we had checked out and decided to spend the rest of our week at the Riu Cancun in Cancun (about a 45 minute cab ride north). We are glad at that decision. The Riu Playacar is a dump when compared to all the other resorts we have stayed at in mexico. For only 145 extra US dollars total, we were able to stay at the beautiful RIu Cancun. I would highly recommend the Riu Cancun to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanGuy
Reviews.Content: First of all, after reading some of the previous reviews about this Hotel I was a little worried, but I think some people are impossible to please. Once I got there, all my worries went away-- it is a beautiful place... is it a 5 Star Resort?--NO, but who said it was? I've traveled all around the Riviera Maya, Hawaii, etc. and Is it the nicest resort I've ever stayed in, NO... but you also don't pay the same rate as a 5 Star Resort, so what do you expect? Good Value for the Price Overall we had a great time at the resort... we had nine people in our group all in our late 20's & early 30's, some single, some married... and we all made the most out of it! I will confirm that the beds are pretty hard but who cares-- after a few drinks you don't even notice. The food was pretty good, breakfast was the best! The steak house was good, as well was Jade(Oriental restaurant) The topless women at the beach and pool was a bonus(especially for my single male buddy's)! I like the location of the resort, you are 5 minutes from Playa and can be on the Ferry to Cozumel in 10 minutes... And only an hour to Cancun. You can walk to the other 2 Riu resorts just down the road. I probably wouldn't stay here again, not because of disappointment in the resort, but because I like to have change each time I go on vacation. Us as Americans were definately the minority, there were a lot of Europeans that stayed here-- and most of whom don't like Americans for whatever reason... but that's okay we still had a great time with them. I would recommend this Hotel to someone, but I would definately let them know not to be expecting a 5 Star Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Wasen't bad”
Reviews.Author: Alicat76
Reviews.Content: Well this was may second time in Mexico and my last. This place is just not for me. For some it's probably a great place to vacation but I did not enjoy it as welI as I would have liked. My husband and I were on our honeymoon at the Rui Playacar in August of 2007 and we had an alright time. It wasen't the experiance I was hoping for and it didn't meet my expectations. When we checked in,we were greeted warmly and had our bags taken to our room. When we arrived in our room we soon discovered that our toilet was not working well and the following morning the toilet was backed up. Our T.V was not working either. The shower was a whole different story, if you had any sort of hip problems you probably were not having a shower,it was so hard to get into and it looked like you were going to fall through the tub. The next day we had a new T.V and our toilet had been unplugged. Unfortunatly the next day our toilet was plugged again,and another trip to the front desk. My husband and I were on a day trip to Xel-Ha that day and when we came back we had a new toilet,great, until I realized that my I-Pod was taken from our room.Yes I should have had it in the safe,my fault, but still! So far,not too impressed. We soon realized as well, that if it rained it would leave a large puddle of rain water at the front door, we were on the third floor. As for the food, it was alright, very fresh and lots of variety,but the same things everyday.The Steakhouse was excellent, we ate there twice. We didn't here anything good about the Mexican or the Asian so we didn't eat there. The beach was ok too, kind of small but was fairly nice. The evening entertainment was alright. The first night we were there it was great but it seemed to get worse as the week went on. Over all it was alright,not fantastic but not horrible,would be a nice family vacation,but wasen't the honeymoon I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Let the Traveler beware...”
Reviews.Author: funinfalmouth
Reviews.Content: This will be short and sweet. For those travelers who have rated this resort so highly, I have to assume that they have not been at other 5 golden apple resorts in the Riviera Maya. This resort is at best a 3 star resort. It is basically a "bare bones, no frills" resort. Come on, what other 5 star resort uses towels that are virtually rags??? My husband and I stayed one night at the Riu (Sept. 8th), checked with the hotel's Apple Rep the next morning, and by 1PM were in a TRUE 5 golden Apple Resort called the Palladium White Sands. Check it out for yourself on line. Currently the price is the same for a week's stay this Spetember at either the Riu, or White Sands. There is no way to begin to compare these two resorts. Please save yourself the headache of finding out once you get to the Riu that you were misled by people who have nothing else to compare this property to. If you don't mind a very basic, nothing special place for a vacation, then the Riu is the place for you. If you have in the past experienced a luxury resort, with exceptional food, service and for the same price, then you are going to be VERY disappointed with the Riu Playacar. It absolutely does NOT deserve a 5 "Golden Apple" rating. Had it been rated a 2, or 3, I would pay more credence to the reviews that some people have given it. But let's be honest here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Stizzy
Reviews.Content: I'm 24 and my Husband is 29. We have never travelled to the ocean before, so I read allot of reviews before booking, and found that the Riu Playacar had great reviews and they did not let us down. Rooms: Yes, the beds were a little hard but that was the least of our concerns. Our room was cleaned every day and towels were replaced. We had a safe and never had a worry about security in our room. Our room was in the last building and overlooked the pool area and ocean! It was amazing. The shower temp was a little wonkey but when it's PLUS 100 outside, does it really matter?? he he. Food: The food at the Riu's was great! A little repetative, but you had access to Riu tequila and Riu Yacatan also. It was also nice to go into town anyways and experiance the authentic food in the heart of Playa Del Carmen, that's only a 5 min cab ride. Pool: The pool was nice and clean the whole time, and the pool bar was fantastic! Ocean: The water was a little kicked up due to Hurricain Dean brushing the beach the week before, but none the less, it was BEAUTIFUL!! Do try to go Parasailing when you are there, you will have the best view ever of the Ocean! Staff: I can not say enough about the staff at Riu Playacar! From the entertainers to the bartenders and waiters, they are all amazing. They are up at the crack of dawn and work well into the night to make sure everyone is having the time of their lives. If you get a chance to go to the bar at night make sure you meet Ozwaldo!! He is hilarious! I hope you enjoy your stay at the Riu Playacar as much as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: RollTideAlabama
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay for the price. Clean rooms. The food could use some improvement, but anyone that has stayed at an all-inclusive resort before knows the food is not always above par. The steakhouse was the best restaurant there. The entertainment crew tries to get you invovled in activities there on the resort or you can just sit around and relax. Be sure and see Alex at the bar!! He was the best!!! Would recommend this stay to anyone. Overall A!!!

Reviews.Title: “warning, check out bad reviews first”
Reviews.Author: glmorrison
Reviews.Content: We had a girl trip planned for Aug.29-Sept.2,2007. We had read the reviews and felt pretty good, for this was just a girl trip not a honeymoon, so our expectations were'nt high. All the bad reivews are 100% correct. I can't begin to imagine all the good reviews are true. Sevice was horrible, pool was dirty, food was terrible. The rooms smelled and the beds were hard as rocks.The staff, mainly front desk, was rude. I could go on and on I really just want to warn people , DON'T STAY THERE.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel lovely people”
Reviews.Author: wmcblues
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in mexico, there was an excursion for everyone. the riu playacar is not luxurious but the place and the staff make you feel very much at home. friendliest staff we have met always sharing a joke and took a great ammount of interest in learning some scottish words. the food was good with plenty of choice the beach was great, the rooms were well stocked with branded international drinks. the entertainment was sometimes good sometimes a bit boring but the they really worked hard to give us some fun. the excursions were fantastic and very cheap. chichen itza is fantastic and an exhausting day, xcaret is amazing and as full as a park can be of things to do. dolphin discovery and swimming with dolphins will long stay in our minds, but the altournative jungle tour made the most lasting memory for us. kayaking to a reef in a secluded bay snorkelling,brunch in a hammock. driving deep into the jungle in an old army vehicle and then going snorkelling in underground caves was a fantastic day. some jungle dwelling mayans then made us a meal in the heart of the jungle. this was a superb finish to a great day.Shopping was cheap and of good quality, plenty of silver. taxis were cheap, the weather was great the one rain storm that came our way was even good drinking wine and watching the blue lightning. all in all a great holiday, great memories, and the mexican people helped make this a great holiday. as did our new found friends Joe and lorraine

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the very very ugly (they steal your stuff)”
Reviews.Author: JTFBrussels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, was concerned about some feedback I read on this site, unfortunately, all of the bad stuff is 100% correct: Good: Beach was nice, no real issues with erosion or hurricane. Layout of the place is good as well. The breakfast is great, every option including pancakes, fruit, eggs, etc. Bad: Drinks all come in tiny cups so you end up going back and forth all the time. The coke/sprite, and frozen drinks are all premixed, so you never sure what you get. If you are coming from Europe where everything is bottled and opened in front of you, it is a big big difference and I found myself a bit ill due to all the syrup from the coke drinks. The beds are horrible. They are hard, covered with some sort of plastic sheeting underneath. The sheets are old. They sqeak and the headboards bang against the wall. Put simply, the beds I had as a kid at summer camp would be a huge improvement. The blankets are not washed, neither are the beadspreads, so everything feels a bit unclean. Ugly: THEY WILL STEAL YOUR STUFF!! We read the earlier reviews and tried to lock everything in the minisafe in the room. Unfortunately, the safes do not hold EVERYTHING you own. The first day, while going to play tennis for an hour, they stole a pair of 250 euro sunglasses from the room. We filed a report with the mgmt, but they responded back after one week, saying we waited to long (the report was done the very next morning but they did not get to it for five days). No apologies, nothing, just a comment saying they did not have money behind the counter to reimburse us. The rooms do not have key cards, so anyone can quickly copy your key and have full access. You won't be able to lock everything. . .they will take shirts, hand cream, etc. After checkout, we were required to put our luggage in the storage room during the afternoon. This is when someone went through everything and took things like jewelry, shirts, handcream, perfume. It was as if they had time to go shopping in the luggage room. They clearly tried all the facial products and left the bag a complete mess. We only discovered it as our flight was canceled and we had to go immediately to another hotel, otherwise it would have been difficult to detirmine if the airline did it. CLEARLY THE HOTEL HAS THEIVES ON THEIR STAFF. In total, about 700 euros worth of goods were stolen. Thanks Playacar. Lastly, there is AN INSECT PROBLEM! At least every other day, a giant ROACH was greeting me when I went into the bathroom in the morning. One was sitting on my girlfriend's head when we left the room for dinner - disgusting. There also appear to be either BED BUGS or fleas in the beds, I am not sure which. My girlfriend was covered in bites by the end of the trip and we could see the tiny insects all over the sheets. The insects jumped when we tried to catch them. Would never stay here again. There are better, safer options for the money. Unable to sleep well, unable to drink well, and staying with thieves made this trip miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 1/5-4 star, best beach in area, great food& staff”
Reviews.Author: matunuckgirl
Reviews.Content: We (2 families) stayed 8/4 to 8/11 and we were very pleased w/ouu stay. We booked through Funjet and had a problem w/our first flight out of Boston. Our travel agent informed Funjet of our delay and we were assured that our transporation (Lomas) would be waiting for us when we arrived. Well, after many hours later, and very tired and hungry, we arrived to find no transportation.. One of the kids started to cry, and we were thinking, this is not a good way to start our vacation! We got a hold of Lomas and they arrived and we were on our way. We arrived at the Riu with many other peole who just got in. A bit chatoic but the front desk got us checked in and we were able to make the buffet with ten minutes to spare. Food: terrific, much better than expected. the Mexican food was the best and we really liked the Mexican themed night buffet. The steak house was very good- rib eye was very tasty. Asian restaurant- I did not care for it. Fried ice cream was good Staff- Riu has a wonderful staff. We were very pleased with the staff- excellent. Rooms- a bit smoky but our maid really did her best to give it a good cleaning. yes, there was a musty smell but we just kept the ac on and the fan going. beds- hard, we got the egg crate as soon as we got there. we left our maid a $2-3 tip every day and we came back to find surprises every day which delighted the kids. We used the safe for our valuables and had no problems. Beach: very nice compared to the other hotels in the area. we are beach goers so this was important to us. topless, yes, some, it seemed as the week went on, more and more. We ate lunch at the Riu a few hotels over (the Tequila?) and liked our hotel better. We prefered our hotel as it was smaller and less busy. pools- nice, although I don't think topless should be allowed in the pools, but that is just me. shows: We liked the Mayan show the best. We found that by the time the shows started(10 pm) , we were too tired to enjoy them after a full day. We would have preferred if they started the kids shows earlier and the adult shows around 9 pm. Xel-Ha- great day. we got the all inclusive package which allowed for food, drinks, everyone enjoyed the day. worth going. Maroma Paradise- big rip off!!!!! a catamaran snorkel adventure is how it was described to us- what a joke! a horrible bus ride from hell to the place, a ride on a cat that was powered, 2 stops a few hundred feet from each other, nice fish, damaged reef from the last hurricane, and then "snacks" at the restaurant, which consisted of chips and a small saucer of refried beans and sodas. It was very expensive for 8 of us and compared to other snorkel trips which we have taken all over the Carribean, this was the absolute worst. It took up the whole day for a few hours of fair snorkeling. We couldn't wait to get back ti the hotel to eat and have a few drinks after this turkey of a tour. Overall, this was our first trip to a Riu and we would consider booking with this hotel chain in the future. We all had a great, relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Playacar great as usual from London, Ont”
Reviews.Author: LoulouLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband as I just returned from one week at the Riu Playacar from Aug 25 to Sept 1, 2007. The beach was fabulous and they are working hard to repair the water sports building that was damaged in Dean. The grounds are spotless. Vendors come by on the beach often but are not pushy and a polite no thanks and they go away. The food was great with lots of choice. If you can't find something to eat then you are too fussy. The front desk service is beyond great, they call several times during your stay to make sure everything is alright. The rooms are extremely clean but the towels and the bedspreads need to be thrown out and new ones purchased. I would use them as rags to wash my floors. They make the rooms look dirty even though they are clean. The towels especially are very worn out and make you feel like you are in a 2 star hotel. Other than that, I have no complaints about the Riu Playacar. Fabulous holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: bic73
Reviews.Content: This is the worst resort we've ever been- no much more to add. Food was horrible, rooms are old, dirty and mantainance very poor. Bathroom ridicolous. Overall enviroment is sad and with poor illumination!! Personnel is barely trained. Moreover beach is very short- despite the promises of tour operator and Riu chain. Playa del Carmen is a great place to spend an holiday and it's plenty of good hotels; just think it twice before going to RIU PLAYACARl!! Worst of all is that in Spain they sell this hotel as a 5 starts and this is simply a joke- or worst. We spent here one night and then we changed hotel for a better one (not difficult).

Reviews.Title: “The Most Beautiful Woman in France”
Reviews.Author: NavyGeorge
Reviews.Content: We were guests during the two middle weeks of July, 2007. The hotel was spotless, room service was far above our last three trips to the area at other all inclusives. The resturants were well operated, the staff going far beyond what that had to do to serve you. The food was always fresh and well presented. Bars had the best of all drinks, and the men and women tending the bars spoke very good English and French, and so on. The pools were always clean and well maintained, however after lunch they started to warm up. My only two gripes were the beds were harder than I was use to,(but I got use to it); and I meet the most beautiful woman in all of France and I never got her address. She and her older traveling companion collected sea shells on the beach in the mornings and lounged at the far back of the pool in the afternoons. They flew back to France on the 23rd of July. I hope to return next winter to the Riu Playacar when it is a bit cooler. The hotel staff made the difference between a good stay and a great stay. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: chimerical
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my trip on August 15th 2007, I was there August 4th through August 15th and had a wonderful experience. when we arrived the check in was smooth and withouth any problems, the rooms given to us were great, located in building 6, the pink one right by the pool. I wasn't surprised by the recomendations made by our concierge, concerning loosing the keys, or towel cards etc. It is a normal practice anywhere to be charged if you loose the keys. We had no problems with the safety box or the doors etc. As for the smell in the rooms some people had complaint about, I have to say it is due to the high humidity, remember the caribbean is 85 to 90% humidity of course, so just turn on the A/C or open up your sliding door/window and the smell will just go away. Sometimes the power will go out but only for a short period of time, but that is part of the experience of been in a different country in a small town, if you don't want that just travel to New york or elsewhere. In the afternoons by our room's window we got serenaded by the most beautiful bird songs you have heard. Tons of birds on the trees will start singing and it was a reminder of the beautiful place we were in. The food at the Hotel was amazing, specially the breakfast and dinner buffet. There was something for everyone, the meat eaters, the vegetarians, the high protein eaters, the high carbohydrate eaters etc etc. There are so many options to go by that I couldn't believe anyone would complain about the food. The selections of fruit and healthy food is amanzing!!!!! The staff at the hotel was great, everyone from the lady that cleaned our room to the waitress and waiters, the bar tenders, etc etc. I can't say much about the animation staff since I spent most of my day sightseeing and wouldn't come back to the hotel until night time to enjoy the buffet. I got to see some of the shows and they were good, very entertainning. Just what you would find in a community college production. My family and I never had any problems of missing items etc as some of the reviews stated, in fact one of us lost his sunglasses at breakfast and one of the waiters kept them and returned them to us later on. I really loved this place, and the Cheff is the sweetest, kindest person ever, he would do his rounds and go greet people at the tables and ask for feed back, one time he prepared something specially for us. The food presentation was beautiful and I enjoyed so much that I am working on a blogsite so that anyone who is curious about the food can see for themselves what is all about and satisfy their curiosity. We also got to meet the general manager of the hotel and she was amazing, very nice and concerned about our stay if we needed anything, if we wanted anything else etc etc. Overall it was great. As for the sunbathers, yes a lot of people go topless, so what? isn't it worst what teens see on the videos etc on television? of course the complaint comes from people from the USA. In Europe is a normal practice to bathe topless on the beach. If you have kids talk to them, eveybody has boobs!!!!!! Hope this helps, I will be posting a link to the blog pretty soon take care

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday choice - you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDi-Pede
Reviews.Content: Aug 1st to Aug 15th 2007 We have just returned from a very enjoyable 2 week holiday at Riu Playacar. Booked through Thomson, we have been very pleased with the resort accomodation, food, service and excursions. We received a welcome drink on check in. The information we received about the hotel was clear and informative. Our room, (in the pink block, by the pool) was very clean and housekeeping attended every day.There were no unpleasnt smells as some reviewers have reported and our towels were perflectly ok! The food was very impressive. A wide choice, fresh - excellent quality. The waiters and waitresses can not do enough for you. They are welcoming, courteous and helpful. The El Porche restaurant can feel a little busy at times but this is a small point. We enjoyed all our meals. The beach is small and has suffered some erosion but this is not a problem.The sea was an amazing colour and warm. The beach has less shade than the pool. The pool is often busy and many people do reserve their sunbeds at 7am then not sit on them until 2pm! If you want shade you need to get down to the pool before 10am. We thought the entertainment was rather repetitive. The entertainers work really hard, but the shows follow the same format with a different theme. The best night was the Michael Jackson Show. We really enjoyed that! One negative point: BEWARE of theft of keys from any bags you leave at the poolside. SEPARATE your safe key from your room key. Room keys have room numbers etched into them so if you lose your key, you could lose stuff from your room. Our friends did whilst we were there.They lost their camera, binoculars, mobile, jewellery they had bought. KEEP your keys with you. Hang them round your neck or round your wrist.This was such a shame they made the mistake of keeping the keys together and they were taken from pool side from a bag.Don't let this put you off the resort. It is amazing. The staff are well trained, polite and hard working people.Just take precautions and lock your stuff away. We would definitley go back to the RIU Playacar. We found it less busy and less hectic than the RIU Tequila and Riu Yucutan.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't return to the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: twirler324
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at the Riu Playacar. We were looking to just get away for a relaxing week, and we did get just that. Let me start this review with the background knowledge that we have only stayed at one other all-inclusive resort. Of course, it was a couples-only, and is rated as a 4-5 star hotel. Please keep this in mind while you are reading this review, and put that into perspective... Check-in: We arrived at about 4:30, and were immediately given a room...and a drink! The man at the desk was really making a big deal out of the room he was giving us; I guess it was because it was in the building closest to the beach and pool area. He gave us the key, two towel cards, and a lock for the safe. In addition to this, he explained the restaurants times. A bell-man followed us to our room with our bags. The room: We were in building #5 which (as mentioned earlier) was close to the beach and pool, which was GREAT! There were two double beds pushed together, which we weren't prepared for. The mattresses as others have mentioned were hard. Just to the right of the beds was the bathroom...there was a vanity area a sink, the closet, mini bar area. There was a separate area with a door for the toilet. The shower was like an alcove. It was very dark in there, with no light. It would have been a nice size shower, but the bottom was set up in an odd way. There was about an 8" lip around the actual area where the water drained. The water drained very slowly, which was a pain after rinsing off at the beach with all the sand collecting at the bottom. The shower head was moveable, but didn't stay in place easily. The water pressure was nice, but the temperature was another story. It seemed that if people next-door or above us were using the sink, toilet, or shower, the temperature would vary from really hot to really cold, without warning. All the rooms had a balcony. The safe was free to use for our stay, but if you lose the key, you had to pay $50. We did not (thank goodness) experience anything being stolen as was mentioned in previous posts. We left the maid $2-3 each day, with a little candle on the last day. Each day (except for 1) we had a towel animal waiting for us on the beds. We noticed that if my husband slept in and the room wasn't made up in the morning, it wouldn't get done until after 4pm when we were often getting showers and getting ready for the night which was inconvenient. One big disappointment was the mini bar area. We were told it would be refilled every two days. Even though we did not use the liquor there (rum, vodka, tequila, and gin), the fridge had 3 bottles of water, 4 bottles of Corona, 2 7ups, 2 Pepsi's, and one orange soda. On our trip, it was only filled on TWO days. On Monday, and again Thursday when we called because it was still empty at 4pm. This was a disappointment because it was nice to have the bottles of water vs. a little cup from the bar areas. The beach: The beach was beautiful when we arrived on Saturday. By Wednesday, the beach had eroded, and was much smaller than when we first got there. The sand bags to the right of our hotel (at another Riu resort) were very exposed. While it was nice to have the area of palm trees at the top of the beach, it would have been nice to also have the palapas right on the beach for the option of shade next to the ocean. The Riu next door had these, but their beach was smaller. The two days we were actually on our beach were Sunday and Wednesday. On these days the water was very choppy which did not make for good off-the-beach snorkeling. I had heard about people bathing topless here, but wasn't prepared for the amount of people whom did this. I would say about 6/10 women we saw were topless. Didn't bother us, but we did notice some children pointing...so it would probably be important to talk to your children about this before you went (explain this practice is acceptable in most countries). Occasionally, there were vendors that would try to sell sunglasses, bracelets, necklaces, but with a simple "No, gracias" they would move on. There were plenty of beach chairs, but some were broken and could only be left in the laying down position...check them before you choose one. Each night, they were lined up again. We never had a problem finding a chair here...the pool was another story. The pool: The pool was nice to relax in after a long day at the beach, but have fun trying to find a chair this late. The practice here seemed to be that people would put their towels on the chairs to save them for when they were done at the beach. So, many times, the chairs would go empty until very late in the afternoon. This was a bit frustrating. The pool bar was always so busy. One thing I would have liked to see was that children would not be able to sit at the bar itself. We often didn't even go over because there were children all around, and no where for us to even get a drink. There were two pool areas. It would be nice if one were designated as the "children’s pool area" but I can understand why it wasn't done this way. The towel shack is near the pool areas. When you want a towel, you turn in the card...you can get a different towel throughout the day, or even keep them over night, or the whole week. As long as you have the correct amount of towel cards when you check out at the end of the week, you will not be charged $20 per towel. There was music by the pool, and it seemed that many activities were planned to take place there. The restaurants and food: The main buffet was good, but it got old pretty quick. It seemed to have the same food every night for dinner. We liked breakfast here best. We ate at the buffet for 3 nights, and that was PLENTY! This buffet is not open for lunch. The only option for lunch is "Turquesa" or the restaurant near the pool/beach. Lunch here was again the same foods each day. After 3pm, you could only get snacks from here. This consisted of popcorn or round nacho chips with melted cheese. It would have been nice if they kept the salsa and guacamole out with the nachos during "snack time" for those who don't eat lunch until later. Dinner times didn't open until 6:30 at the buffet. The earliest reservation dinner time was 6:45 for Jade (Asian restaurant), The Mexican restaurant, or the Steakhouse. There were two reservation times, 6:45 or 8:45. The reservations had to be made each morning between 7-10:30. Reservations are to be made inside the buffet restaurant at the drink area (we were NOT told this when we checked-in). Even if I didn't get up there until 9:30, there were plenty of reservations available. We ate at all three of the reservation restaurants. We noticed particularly at Jade the dress code was NOT enforced. It said no shorts allowed...not true. There was a man in his early twenties right in front of us who was admitted that was wearing a t-shirt, shorts, and a hat. This was a little bothersome because we made the effort to pack nicer clothing because of this. We thought it should have been enforced better. This restaurant was a buffet with what was more like Chinese food than anything. There were a few "sushi" rolls, but my husband couldn't even bring himself to call it sushi. It was more like the rolls that you buy at a grocery store...imperial crab meat, rice, etc. The Mexican restaurant had a buffet for appetizers like salad and soup, nachos, etc. There were mostly seafood entrees (which I do not eat) so I ended up getting a steak. This disappointed me because I would have liked to have something more "Mexican". The steak house was the best of the three reservation restaurants. There was no buffet, and the service was great! Activities/entertainment/service/staff: I believe the activities were the downfall to this resort. When we checked in, we were not given a schedule of activities. There is a chart posted of activities outside the buffet restaurant, but it has NO times listed! By the time we realized other people had a paper schedule with times, we only had two days left of our stay. When we did get the schedule, there were no locations listed! On Wednesday morning, a woman next to me was approached on the beach about "stretching" that would take place in five minutes on the beach volleyball court. The woman who was sitting close to me and I walked over to wait for it to begin...and it NEVER did. No one showed up on the beach to do this! Not sure if it ended up taking place somewhere else, but I just went about my day. I was surprised to see how hard the animation team worked, and the long hours. I do have to say, though, that we were never approached by these people to join in. Throughout the week, it seemed that they had their "favorites" and only catered to those people. I was disappointed that we were not approached for joining in things since we had no idea where or when they were supposed to be taking place! The nightly shows at La Cumbia were OK. They were different each night, and sometimes a bit "cheesy". Don't get me wrong, I know they worked very hard, but we were not impressed. The staff at the restaurants and bars were WONDERFUL! They not only got us drinks at the bar, but entertained us as well! We did not go to any of the other properties of the Riu, so we can't compare to them at all. Services: We were disappointed that there was not a listing of services in the room. If the spa information had been listed somewhere, we may have tried that out. There was no information about this. We would have also liked if there were an "orientation" of some type which told of the services, activities, etc. A nice touch would be for the Riu resorts to come together and have a shuttle service from the airport for their guests. Even if it weren't free of charge, I would have paid $20 or something like that instead of the $60 each way from the airport! Check-out: We were scheduled to be picked up at 1:45 for our flight, but had to check-out at 12. By the time we checked out at noon, the luggage holding room was over packed, and there was luggage all over the lobby that people had just left for the day. It is a bit ridiculous that we had to wait in the open-air lobby for almost two hours. There was a "hospitality room" which was basically a bathroom that had 2 showers in it if we wanted to use the beach or pool until it was time to leave. It would have been nice for there to be an air conditioned room or area where people who didn't have a lot of time to wait to hang out. By the time the shuttle arrived for us, we felt like we needed another shower before we even got on the plane. When we did check out at 12, the man took our key, safe lock, and towel cards. He did not say "I hope you had a nice stay," "Thank you," "Have a nice trip," NOTHING! He just waved his hand at us as if to say we were checked out and we could leave. The front desk is the only area that we did not receive good service. I am sorry this turned out to be so long...I had not planned it to be. But, I hope this helps some of you before you go here. Feel free to contact me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rowdy00
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Riu Playacar and could not have been more pleased. I have to be very picky to find fault with anything. After reading a couple of reviews I was a little concerned about the food but that turned out to unfounded, the food was GREAT. The staff was very friendly and quick to respond the only time I had a request. To put it shortly the hotel was far better than I expected. What didn't I like? Well the bed wasn't the most comfortable I have ever slept on and I drink a lot of water and had to ask for more a couple of times since you must drink bottled water. I will stay at the RIU Playacar again. Paul Werner Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “third time here and just as great”
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the playacar and was sad to leave.This is the third time here and it it beats all other resorts out. I have been to Cabo,Punta Cana and Cancun and they just cant compare.Not only is the staff the best but the food is outstanding. The buffet has such variety that there is something for everyones taste. We ate at the steakhouse and it was very good. The only negative is that the beer on tap has very little alcohal in it .We couldnt figure out why no one got abuzz all week until the last day when we asked at the pool bar about the beer and was told very little alcohal in it. we met another couple from the Riu Riviera Maya and the said the same thing about the drinks. We were told to ask for Corona. Our Apple rep talked us into going to Isla Mujeres for the day. what a mistake.2hours to get there and 2 back.Not much to do there unless you want a dolphin swim(200.00). If you cant have a good time at this resort you might as well stay home. w

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic * * * * *”
Reviews.Author: twinny03
Reviews.Content: this place is fantastic, from the waiters to the weather, the staff to the sea, everything about the place is amazing! we stayed right in the middle of the resort which was an ideal location, in the center between the pool an main reception. the room was cleaned every day before 9am, everything was spotless and the towel animals were a brialliant touch the restaurant was brilliant, the waiters were on there feet all the time, constantly cleaning the table, bringing over drinks as soon as you finish one, greeting you on entrance to the restraunt and also when leaving. the pool was brilliant, people were always going round cleaning both pools and monitoring the water levels etc. the staff at the playacar were out of this world, they made the place what it is. the games through the day were brilliant, volleyball, aqua gym, darts, shooting, football, were they got everyone involved....BIG SHOUT OUT TO SEPPI, OSMAR (MARQUEZ) ISREAL AND TRAVIS (absoulty brilliant people) the night time entertainiment was excellent, a different show for the 14 days we were there, the animation team always on there feet, making you laugh, getting you involved, making the whole night entertaining....FANTASTIC also the dancers and the micheal jackson show......was that really him???? haha overall a fantastic holiday and would defo return, the whole place was AMAZING big shout out to the reading boys josh, graham, mark!! also courtney, charlotte, chris, natallie, jenny and carla, josh, stu and sue!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Greatest”
Reviews.Author: Calvink9
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, a very good experience and will go back again soon. I recomend this hotel too everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Third time back to RIU and still great”
Reviews.Author: travlin1
Reviews.Content: My mom, dad, and i went to RIU playacar for the third time on July 24 and stayed for seven nights. This was our third visit to RIU Playacar in three years and each year gets better and better!!!!!! First off the location is really great. there is a shopping plaza across the street and you are a short cab ride from playa del carmen for more shopping. Room: We had a fantastic Room! We called alex at the main desk a few days in advance to request a ground floor room near the beach and facing the main walkway. Our room was clean by 9 in the morning each day we were there. We tipped the maid a dollar or two every day and we got more towels and towel art in return. Beach: The beach isn't the biggest but it's definitely the best of the other hotels beaches in that area. Apparently, storms were causing erosion and sandbags had to be put in to build the beach back up. There are no sandbags as you go into the ocean at Riu, but there is a large one on the right side of the beach. You can walk around the sandbag if you want to walk the beach. Pool: We didn't spend a lot of time at the pool, we prefer the beach. The pool is kept very clean and has a pool bar. The pool bar was fairly busy but we didn't have to wait long for our drinks. There are technically two pools, but it's really one pool separated by a bridge. Water volleyball and free scuba lessons are held in the smaller pool. Food: The food is great. There is one buffet and 3 other restaurants: Mexican, Asian, and a steakhouse. We weren't very fond of the Mexican but the Asian and Steakhouse were excellent! Our favorite restaurant was the buffet though because they have a wide variety of foods and beautiful decorations every night. Fernando was our waiter at the buffet and he is the best! He would always greet us by name and had our table reserved for us every night with our sodas already on the table. Make sure to sit near table 115 for Fernando, he truly is a great person and loves the guests. Breakfast was always great. there was all different sorts of foods (fruits, cereal, potatoes, pancakes, french toast, quesadillas, and eggs, TONS AND TONS OF EGGS) The peanut butter at breakfast is to die for! It was some of the best peanut butter me and my dad ever had!!! Entertainment: Words can't describe the entertainment staff, outstanding is an understatement. They sweat their butts off for 14 hours a day and will do anything to keep you entertained. There are games throughout the day and the winners get a prize a 9:45 in the show theater. It's almost impossible to not become attached to these guys. The shows at ten are amazing. The dancing is terrific and the guys are hilarious, they really interact with the audience. One night my mom and I were picked to go on stage and dance with the guys, i don't know how they can stay up there for hours at a time, me and my mom were sweating buckets, and were were only up there for 15 minutes! It's really hard to not become attached to them, and they're all sad to see you go. But we'll hopefully be back to see Domingo, Travis, Caesar, Isreal, and Osmar again next year! We had a wonderful stay and have absolutely NOTHING bad to say about the RIU playacar! One things for sure, You will never be bored there! Hope you all have as much fun as we did!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lost for words!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lollypop959
Reviews.Content: The Riu playacar was absolutely GREAT! I went with my family and when we arrived we were very pleased with our welcoming. While we were checking in we were given cold drinks that were great and the lady who helped us was very nice. When we got to our rooms we were surprised because the rooms looked even better than the picture even though it was the same rooms we viewed online (the standard room)! The rooms were very cool with a fan and air conditioning; which was great because outside there was hot beautiful weather (we went from July 5 to July 13), a comfortable bed and a TV with all kinds of channels including a few in English with popular shows. The mini bar in the room was very nice filled with soda and beer. After settling in we went to lunch, which was a buffet and ate GREAT food. So excited to continue on with the day we went to the beach, which was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!!!!! Clear water, nice smooth waves, and lots of beach chairs. After swimming a little we took some of the best naps of our lives on beach! The pool was great and I loved the swim-up bar and pool activities (don’t worry for you who are not too thrilled about all the pool activity and music, there is another pool which is usually almost empty and quite). The staff, but especially the entertainment staff, is F-A-N-T-A-S-T-I-C!!!!! Nice, hard working, and are glade to be doing their job. The evening performances were so good and funny that I was sad when they ended and couldn’t wait for the next nights show. One day we went of the resort to see the Myan ruins which was easy to get too because tour buses are just across the street with great drivers and many people on the bus. Also if you cross the street there is a market everyday and a few small stores. The staff is so talented and speak so many languages, yet knowing a few fraises like please, thanks, hi, and bye in Spanish might help you for the few people who speak only Spanish. But trust me you will not have to worry about communicating. The jet skiing at the beach was very fun but you have to pay some money. We never got to parcel but I hear it was great. May I suggest that your bring a deck of cards because it is a really fun activity to do during times when you don’t know what to do, like after dinner at the theater before the show, when everything is closed. Opps I forgot to mention the all inclusive part is great because you can eat whenever you want with unlimited great food. When our stay was over I was so sad and couldn’t stop looking behind me as we drove from the resort to the airport. In other words I had the best vacation ever and want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A review on the the good, the bad and the weather!”
Reviews.Author: CT07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar for our 2 wk Honeymoon at the end of June into the beginning of July 07 and we would rate it as a 4* hotel. Overall the Riu Playacar was very nice. It was clean and the food was very good (although by the 2nd week you may have to be a bit "creative" with what you're putting on your plate) and the staff couldn't do enough for you! A special mention has to be given to the cleaner we had! Every time we entered our room after a lazy day on the beach we'd have a creature on our bed made entirely of towels - like swans, armadillos, teddy bears, dinosaurs! So funny and a really nice touch. There is also good entertainment staff at the Playacar. Being Honeymooners we weren’t into the organised games and events etc, but the staff don't badger you to join in and left you to yourself. We liked that, as at some hotels you can be hounded to join in! My only gripe about the place is if you are unlucky to have noisy neighbours like we did! Unfortunately sound amplifies in the apartment blocks themselves and the doors are rather thin!!! Also if your neighbour smokes then you can end up smelling it in your toilet which is a little unpleasant… The Weather - was great! It was the beginning of their rainy season, but we only had 2 days of rain out of the 2 weeks we were there. Apart from that it was sun, sun, sun (with a little cloud hiding it every now and again). Also worth noting is that it does cool down a bit in the evening (by the sea) which we found quite nice! Playa Del Carmen itself was, I'm sorry to say, totally charm less!!! I'm glad that we were "cocooned" by the all inclusive Riu as Playa had nothing there to endear it to us! I would definitely use a Riu hotel again, but we weren't enamoured by Mexico as a country (which was disappointing for our honeymoon) so maybe we'll try another destination... PS: Those travelling from the UK - TAKE NOTE!!!! When leaving the UK most travel operators let you leave without having to pay excess baggage if you are over by a small amount. However you'll get stung on the return! We were over by just under 5kgs between us and we had to pay about £50 (1kg=£10)!!! You also need to have CASH for your departure tax. We ended up paying £50 excess and £50 tax just to leave the country - it was a bit of a nasty surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Good time and service at Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: taupo95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar June 29-July 4, 2007. We had a great time and loved how friendly all of the staff were. I will agree that it would have been nice to have more wait staff to serve drinks, but this didn't diminish our experience too much since this was our first all-inclusive vacation. We had similar problems as another reviewer about housekeeping: one day our room was cleaned and all towels removed but not replaced, our water wasn't replaced daily as they said it would be (in fact one day they removed our lone bottle of water we'd left in the fridge), and one day we came back to our rooms to find we had no doorknobs on our doors. While it was annoying to have to call to get these issues resolved, each was resolved quickly and with apologies. One thing we would HIGHLY recommend is the Lomas/Funjet travel assistance group. We booked a shuttle with them for transport between the airport and the resort, then found out they have an on-call representative stationed at the Riu Playacar to assist with booking tours and giving information on local sites.
