We had Omar and he was wonderful. Extremely informative and seemed to have our best interests at heart. To top it off, he told us to talk to him first if we had issues with the hotel and every time he saw us he would ask how things were going and if we were enjoying our stay. When we mentioned to him some of the above issues, he jumped right on them and the hotel staff really got moving to fix everything. Other issues we had included the minibar - it's stocked only every other day and they give you items that don't exactly mix with the liquor they put in your room (national brand tequila, gin, rum, vodka). The following is what was provided in the fridge: 4 Coronas, 2 Pepsis, 2 orange sodas, 2 club sodas, 3 large bottles of water. The water is supposed to be replenished daily but ours wasn't always replaced (in fact one day they removed the one bottle we had left in there). You could get other safe water at every bar and restaurant, so we often ended up taking our empty bottles to the bar to refill them. Also we emptied our already near empty vodka dispenser on day 2 and it was never replaced, nor was our friends' liqour dispenser replenished in their room. We had no issues with theft as desribed in other reviews, but having read those reviews, we took luggage locks with us and locked up most of our stuff in our luggage every day. The issue with the doorknobs was just plain weird. We were told there was a problem with the locking mechanisms and they had to remove them for maintenance, but we had not had trouble with them at all. Of most concern is that they didn't tell us they would need to be working on them - they just came and took them, leaving us with no way to get into our rooms until we figured out you could stick any long slender object into the door and unlatch it, so anyone could have gotten into our rooms. We went to the other resorts in the area and were pleased to find we had picked the right sized resort for us. Riu Playacar is relatively small compared to the other Riu's but our beach seemed to be one of the most expansive in the area. It was not very crowded and the only time we had to wait for a drink was at the pool bar (which did have a lot of children sitting at the bar, making it difficult to even order drinks there). The food was delicious and we highly recommend the Mexican restaurant. Breakfast was always great and we had the same wonderful waitress every morning. They love children there and dote them with attention, so if you're traveling with kids this is a great place to go. Overall our experience was positive and we would return in a heartbeat. However if you're looking for a full-service luxury resort, this probably isn't the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: peashooterz
Reviews.Content: Our overall vacation was good. The first room I was assigned was horrible. The room smelled like someone's basement and the tub was rusted. I complained and was moved to an ocean view room which was great. The room smelled much better and the tub was not rusted. I found the staff to be very nice and accomodating. The food was very good but after a week gets a little tiring. For the price, all inclusive, you can't really beat it. My biggest complaint would be the beds, the mattresses are extremely hard. If you can get past the hard beds its a good deal and a lot of fun. If you go, take a zip line tour (Salvatica) and check out the Mayan ruins. Both were a lot of fun. In addition some of the European women do go topless so that's bad or good depending upon how you look at it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Riu Playacar is Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: texas_girl66
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that we have been to Mexico for the past 8 years in a row. We never stay at the same resort, just because we like to try new places. I just like to say that so you know that I do have something to base our stay on. Upon arrival our check-in was smooth and quick. There was no line, nor did I ever see a line at the reception desk. We arrived well before check-in time but our rooms were ready and available. We booked with another couple and our rooms were side by side, just as we had requested. Something I really liked at this resort was the way when you book two rooms there is an outside door that opens into the center of the building and then each room has a door, so if you want to close the outside door and leave the two individual doors open you can. We didn't bring our kids this trip but thought that would be great when bringing them. The walls were also very quiet. At night we heard no outside noises at all. The staff at this resort is wonderful all the way from the cleaning staff to the entertainment staff. Our room was kept very clean and well stocked of drinks and towels. Everyone that worked there was very friendly and always spoke to you and smiled and seemed truly happy. The buffet is wonderful! We ate at the buffet every meal that we ate there except one time, which we ate at Jade, the Asian restaurant. As was typical, Jade was just as wonderful. The entertainment staff worked extremely hard to keep you having fun. I personally normally steer clear of getting all involved in the games and everything but they are so personable that you become friendly with them and enjoy playing all the games with them. There are three bars on the grounds. I don't know the exact hours but the lobby bar stays open almost 24 hours. It's crazy! Their drinks are very good and they are very attentive about getting your drinks to you quickly. Once again always smiling and joking. Check out was crazy easy. We simply walked up and handed them our room keys and towel cards and they said thanks, hope to see you next year. lol I obviously have nothing bad to say about this resort, it's smaller but very fun and active. We actually met some people that were staying at the Riu Palace and they had come to our resort to use some of the water sports rentals. The beach at the Playacar was much better than at the Palace. They ended up staying at our resort the rest of the day simply because they liked it there more. As we were leaving we heard that from another couple as well. If you prefer the beach/ocean and the pool area then Playacar is for you. Another cool thing about the Riu's is the fact that you can go to any of them to visit, other than the Palace. The Tequila has a really cool sports bar and a cool disco. The Yukatan and the Tequila both have really cool bigger pools but we only went by there to check it out. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Riu Playacar, Viva Mexico:)!!”
Reviews.Author: Plodej
Reviews.Content: First of all I have to say that all the negative reviews need to be taken with a grain of salt, because everyone has different expectations. Some people are just too spoiled...a little more humility folks:) My wife and I arrived in Cancun on June 2, and it was indeed extremely hot and humid (33C, 100%). The trip to Playa del Carmen took less than 40 minutes. Upon arriving at Riu Playacar we were greeted by an extremely friendly and smiling staff (Robert, speaking Polish, English, Spanish, French and Italian!!). Even though we arrived around 10am, we were given a room and immediate access to all of the hotels amenities. The room was great, although one could not help but notice a slight scent of humidity. No biggie, it's Mexico in June, rainy season with humidity hitting 100% almost everyday. The pool was awesome, cleaned everyday, clean towels whenever you wanted one. The only complain would be that the pool closed at 8pm. The beach is rather small, but that is due to extreme erosion from the Carribean Sea and last years hurricane Wilma which hit the coast pretty hard. The food was great, lots of fresh fruits, salads, good selection of meats. One thing though, the pork chops were dead literally....:) again no biggie, considering the variety of other food available. The restaurants are great although I'd suggest going to buffet dinners since there is a wider selection of dishes. The best we had was the Mexican Night on Friday before leaving. Amazing food, amazing service, tequila, wine, monk fish, taquitos, enchiladas! The staff was amazing, always smiling, always making every effort possible to please, courteous. The night before leaving we had a cleaning guy come in to collect dirty towels, he shook our hand and wished us a great last day and a safe trip back home. Absolutely first class! The guys working at the pools, El grupo de Animacion, were a handful:) Funny guys, always sweating their butts off to make people feel comfy and coming up with things to do. One thing is certain you WILL NOT be bored at Riu Playacar. Again first class! Overall, we had a wonderful time. Nothing bad to say about the hotel or staff. One thing is for sure, June through early September is definitely the hottest time in the Yucatan: hot and humid. All in all we definitely recommend Riu Playcar!!! Have fun, relax and enjoy your time off!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: bozlem
Reviews.Content: We have have just returned from our two week holiday in Mexico at the Riu Playacar. When we got off the plane the hummididty was realy high and it was over cast, i suddenly remember thinking oh my goodness what is the weather going to be like as we are both sunseekers. We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by the receptionists who was very helpfull and quickly explained roughley where everything was. Our rooms were very good and we were both pleasently supprised to see a mini bar and optics on hand in our room, this was all inclusive and was topped up every two days which was brilliant, this included bottles of purrified water bottles of soft drinks and on the optics there was four brands of alchol, excellent, this was emptied very quickly as the larger here is very good. The temperature of the room was lovely and cool, this included air con and an electric ceiling fan which had three different speeds on it, we left them both on for the whole time that we were their. The weather was brilliant lots of sun but at the same time a brilliant breeze. The pool had plenty of sun loungers and the beach was lovely. One of the pools has built in access for a person who is disabled which i thought was a very good idea. Very easy access around the complex for everyone. The only thing that we did not like was having to see the hotels photographer walking around with Parrots and Iguaners so that guests could have photographs with them, you could visibly see that the animals were not enjoying this and was cruel to see, this was ashame to see on our holiday, i suggest that anyone travelling to this hotel stays away from photographs with these poor animals. The food was fantastic we ate like kings, i am normaly very wary of eating chicken, fish and other types of meat but i can honestly say we ate everything that we could try and no problems with a dodgy tummy. The Room Maids were brilliant very pleasent and cleaned the rooms every day. Shopping at 5th avenue is a womans paradise great designer shops, so expect to take plenty of money. Be prepared to barta if you have a bit of patience some of the shop ownwers will come down, We have have both come back with great sun tans and would definetly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Isis30Ca
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from Riu Playacar late last week. Although I was a little bit skeptical before I left, especially after reading some of the postings, I was pleased to see that I made a very good selection. Having been in the Yucatan Peninsula before, I was not completely surprised by the architecture or comfort, but Playacar is a great destination with really neat architecture. Arriving in Cancun, it’s always a hassle, but this time, choosing Best Day travel as the transportation mode to Playacar area, made our experience more enjoyable especially thanks to our driver, Victor, that gave us good advice and pointed out couple of interesting places to visit during our stay. When you get there, the hotel is located right across the street from the little arts and crafts market, which made it very convenient for the evening stroll and last minute shopping. The architecture is really nice and the lobby is quite charming The staff at Riu Playacar and Robert in particular, have really helped in making our stay so much more enjoyable. The grounds are very well kept, and the beach access is not bad in comparison with other hotels in the area. Rooms are very clean and the minibar is continuously replenished. I would say that the only drawback is the reduced number of restaurants to choose from on the property. A total of three restaurants on the grounds are available during the day, but unfortunately only two open for dinner. One is “El Porche”, which is absolutely great and the other one is Jade offering Asian cuisine. On top of that you, for Jade you need to make reservation in the morning. Overall, it was a very good experience, great atmosphere, beautiful grounds and great entertainment especially at Riu Tequila. Looking forward to go back, maybe even later this year.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar--great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeephound
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Riu Playacar, along with 3 other couples, ranging in ages of 35 - 42. Absolutely wonderful. Check in was fast and smooth--Melanie and Victor were wonderful ! Beach: Very pleased with the size of the beach. especially after reading several reviews. Plenty of room on the "lower level" for multiple rows of lounge chairs and plenty of room on the "upper level" for either sun or palm trees. Rooms: Were very clean, no musty smell, nice size, beds were firm but with a call down to front desk, an egg crate was brought up and it was perfect! Food: Wonderful---great variety at buffet. We ate at the steakhouse and asian restaurants. We enjoyed the Asian more, but both were fine. Pool: plenty of room in pool, even when aerobics were going on. Entertainment: We went to several of the shows in the evening--it was alot of fun and the dancers were very good. Staff: Wow!!! At your beck and call! Very very courteous, eager to please you--always a smile. Not one time did I see a frown on any employees face. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Content: we just arrived back from riu playacar after spending 2 wks. there.we had an excellant time from beginning to end. the property is small but that's what we likeand all the help was excellant.we stayed at aquamal last year and this was 100% better. the room we had was the 5th bldg. and bottom floor facing the walk way to the beach and it was great .the beds are hard but we ,ve had that before so no problem and you can ask for egg crates.alot of countries like hard beds.we ran the air the whole time as being by a beach you will get a musty smell we had air fresheners with us so no problem. this happens in the u.s.a. when living by the ocean. the food was great always plenty to pick from and we ate at the other resorts near by .we ate at the asia and steakhouse for a change but they can't compare with ours but they try hard. the buffet was great with a good variety of food. the pool and beach are great did pool arobics and morning streach most days and walked every morning outside the resort very safe and beautiful.go early as it gets too hot later. make sure you have flip flops on your feet by the pool or else you will have burnt feet. we did a few excurtions and loved them all. good shopping across the street and playa del carman good food and sights. office staff always helpful'very clean and great vacation. we would tell any one to do this the riu's are great.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: chelsea_vette
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to the area and our second stay at the RIU Playacar. We also stayed at the RIU Yucatan on two occaisons. Upon arrival at the resort, check-in was fast and freindly. I would have to agree with others that the food was excellent, in fact both my wife and I found it to be better than our other visits. Lots of variety and very fresh and tasty. The resort itself is very clean and manicured. Our room was cleaned daily, with towel "art" left on the bed. Refreshments were re-stocked every 2 days. No complaints here. The attitude and work ethic of the staff is what really makes this place. Everyone is freindly and pleasant to deal with. A few dollars tip here and there means alot to these folks and they deserve it. I only wish that some guests would "spruce up" a little at dinner time. Baseball caps and sloppy shorts at dinner don't cut it as far as I'm concerned. The only other thing that could be better is the storm damage on the beach. It is much smaller than it used to be. The manager told me that it will be repaired and widened in the coming months, which will be a big improvement. All in all a great place with excellent service and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Theft at RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: pam0324
Reviews.Content: I placed a review upon returning from RIU playacar about APril 20th of this year. While there, at first, I noticed a couple of things missing. Small things. My grooming kit had a couple of things taken out of it, (it had been brand new), and then one day, a small purse was gone, (maybe I forgot to pack it?). I came to my room one afternoon to find a cleaning man in the room, (the room had been cleaned that morning) only to tell me he was there to "leave more towels", but alas, No more towels were found. What I did find though, was the small cosmetic bag that I had my medication's in was on the bed and open. The last day, I noticed my watch could not be found, and still hasn't been found. My 9 year old's Echo sneakers were gone as was his Adidas bag. I kept what I could locked up in the room safe, but who knows if If they have keys to that also? I was really angry when I came home and a couple of days later, while putting away all of our things, finally realized that all of the stuff I thought maybe I misplaced or packed away, was probably stolen. AND I TIPPED the housekeeping staff on leaving!! Aside from the stolen things, we had a great time, but if you go there, dont leave ANYTHING valuable around!! How someone can steal from you and then 5 minutes later look at you and smile to your face is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Aside From The Theift”
Reviews.Author: RustyDusty
Reviews.Content: This resort was a great resort to travel to. But I think I would reccomcent choosing a different resort in the same area. The beach was nice, rooms were decent and the booze flowed like the water. The shower and tap water were a tad on the smelly side (not potable), some of the rooms A/C were not working, and with only one restaraunt (besides the one you need to make reservations for) got repettitive after a few days. For this resort, All inclusive does not mean All inclusive. You must bring cash for internet services, phone, snorkle, skuba, parasailing, etc. And its not cheap. A 10 minute parasail ride costs 35 bucks american per person, just an example. There are tours you can take but again, not cheap. There is only one dinner theatre on the resort which does the same thing every night. After the 3rd night, you are looking for something new to do, which is outside of the resort, and again costing you more money. The thing which suprised me the most was the amount of thieft happening. Our own room was a target. We had clothes, money, and jewlery taken from our room, and when we brought it to the attention of the manager, we were given a bottle of booze. Which didnt make sence anyways since it was an all inclusive resort and the booze was free anyways. We noticed on several occasions that there would be a soft knock on the door and then an employee from the resort would use a key to enter the room. More than once a day also. In all, we had about $200 of missing items, which was exchanged for a $5 dollar bottle of tequilla. We went to this resort for a wedding and we were not the only room out of 10 who had things missing from the rooms. There is a small safe in the room, but not big enough to fit 2 suitcases. Please use caution if you are to choose this resort. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Litty_12
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I vacationed at the RIU Placar the week of April 21st. We absolutely loved it! The staff works so hard to meet the guests needs, entertain them, and make lasting memories! THE ROOM - The room was very nice. We stayed in Building 1 on the ground floor along the main walk way to the pool. We were worried it would be high traffic, but it was perfectly fine. House cleaning kept our room stocked with towels, shampoo, and left us cute animals made out of towels. They also stocked the mini bar and fridge every other day with drinking water, pop, Corona, liqour, etc. If we ran out before, we just called the front desk and it was delivered right away. Many reviews of this hotel said the beds were hard and the pillows were flat. Our beds were firm, but I still got a good nights sleep and just used 2 pillows which was fine! FOOD - I am always worried about how the food is when I go on vacation because I am the world's most PICKY eater!!! I couldn't get enough and probably gained a few pounds! The buffet was awesome! The food was always fresh and there were numerous options so it never got boring. We ate here every night, but one, That night we ate at the steak housewhere you had to make reservations. It was nothing spectacular. The steak was ok, but was cold by the time we were almost done eating it. We both preferred the buffet. Lunch was available at the Turqueza restaurant by the pool and was also good. They also had a pool party and BBQ by the pool. The waiters and bartenders really work hard to please you. We did tip them at the end our our stay and they were very appreciative. ENTERTAINMENT - The entire RIU staff works so hard to make sure the stay is memorable - they work 6, 10 hour days!!! To start the day, the RIU Animacion (activities group) planned games (rifle shooting, bocce ball, water areobics, volleyball, etc.) which were fun and the winners received prizes. And it also didn't hurt that the guys are extremely good looking!!! They also took the time to get to know the guests (and remember them thoughout the week) - one employee, Israel even had lunch with us. There was also an employee who played with the kids - dress them as pirates (make up and all) and had balloon sword fights, etc. At night, they same staff would take guests on stage to dance and present awards, etc. Again, the kids could do the hokey pokey, play games, etc. At 9:45, the themes show would go on. These were mostly dancing shows - Grease, Latino, International, etc dances. Although it was a little repetitive, the dancers were working thoughout the day to perfect their routines. On Friday night, they had a Mariachi band which was very good. They also had a house band a couple nights where the employees were ask the guests to dance. After the shows, there was open dancing or guest would go to the disco at the RIU Tequila (sister resort) . BEACH - it was a little small because the hurricanes erroded the beach, but it was still beautiful and well maintained. The resort next to the RIU (I believe the Wyndam) didn't have a beach at all! Overall, this place is a wonderful place and I would gladly go back to it or any other RIU resort in the world!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfu”
Reviews.Author: alcebar
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed at Riu Playacar fr. Apr. 8-9/07; the place is so wonderful and soothing. We both loved the atmosphere like walking down the pathways with all the plants, flowers and trees.We also like the room bec. it has the accent of the mexican culture. My daughter who is 18 just love the room decor; she calls it my jungle room. The staff are great and very helpful. Though the beach had some erosion but it`s still great. The food is excellent. we would go back again. But, we only stayed for 2 days bec. we got a upgraded promotional stay to Riu Palace riviera Maya. The riu palace was so nice and elegant but the atmosphere is sure different. We did not feel we were in Mexico ;it`s more like we were in any other western hotels. We miss the riu playacar`s atmosphere bec. you can feel the culture. My daughter wanted to go back there but it`s too late and anyway we may as well enjoy the upscale hotel for such a price. Riu palace is so nice . we stayed at the suite room with a big balcony facing the ocean. The room has a marble jacussi tub, nice comfy bed and all marbles.It`s beautiful. We had a wonderful stay and great vacation. The people are wonderful. julie,B.C. Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: reen32ie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Riu Playacar last week with some friends from work and we really enjoyed the place. Although the hotel was full, it never felt crowded. The beach was beautiful, yes a bit small, but that's to be expected given the storms they have been through. There was always a chair and your choice of sun or shade. The cleanest place I've ever been, they are always cleaning!!! I spent less time by the pool, there was less of a breeze and they played silly games in the afternoon which isn't something I really enjoy - but it was certainly something many others enjoyed. The staff was incredible. I work in the service industry and it never felt like they were helpful only if you tipped them. In reality they seemed to enjoy there job, whether they got an extra tip or not, and they all deserved extra tips for doing such a good job with a smile everyday! The food was good and lots of variety, and the fresh fruit I am missing now! The rooms are okay, beds are hard but you do get used to them. The shower and bath area is very nice and spacious. The musty smell was gone after the air was cranked and an air fresher was used (plan to bring one). If you want to go on any excursions it's best to go across the street and book with gray line tours, it's cheaper and very well done. Ask for Manuel if you do the Tulum tour, he's fantastic and made the trip wonderful. Don't forget to bring bio-degradable sun screen as many of the excursion require it. Swim with dophins, it's so worth it!! I would definitely go back to Playacar, great value for the money! If you looking for 5 star, spend more money and go somewhere else this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Life was great at the Riu Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: Julie-K-Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: My sis and I just got back from the Riu Playacar yesterday and we had a wonderful time. The resort was fully booked eventhough it is now officially low season, but the staff handled everything very efficiently. The only problem that we had was that the door to our room stuck so badly that we couldn't get into it several times. Each time, we'd have to trek down to the desk and have a bellboy come up to open it for us. Finally, after the third time, someone came up and completely replaced the lock for us. After that, it worked fine. The food was just dandy. Some of the stuff was a little greasy, but if you looked around, you could find healthy, fresh, delicious choices. (Try the oatmeal or rice pudding for breakfast. They are made from scratch and wonderful!) We did eat at the steak place one night and it was okay. I personally found the buffet to be just as good and with many more options. Bar service was great! I told the bartender (at the main bar near the stage) the first day there that I am pregnant and can't have liquor. He seemed to take personal pleasure in coming up with new n/a drinks for me and remembered me each night. As for some of the negatives that I've heard on here, yeah, the rooms can be musty and the beds are hard. This is the tropics. It's to be expected. Turn on your a/c for a while and the musty smell should clear right up. The beach is small, but it's always clean and there are plenty of chairs available. One hint for those planning on travelling here: Check out the Gray Line Tours located across the street near the little mall. They are more reasonably priced than the ones that you can get in the hotel lobby and the staff is extremely well-prepared and educated. If you can get on a tour to Tulum with Manuel, I highly recommend it. Really nice kid who knows more about the ruins than I've ever heard before (this was my third trip to Tulum, my sis' first) and he has a great sense of humor that keeps everyone laughing the whole time. I would definitely go back here. They treated us very well and Playacar is one of my favorite destinations.

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY Rui Playa car”
Reviews.Author: Portgirl
Reviews.Content: We were told it was a 5 star resort. It sure is not. Front desk and bar star were excellent. Our pillows were hard. Our view was of service road for the staff. After 10:00 not much to do at our resort. We would have to walk over to one of the sister resorts. Not good. Snacks after diiner you would also have to walk over to the sister resort unless you wanted burnt popcorn and cold nachos. I would not return to that resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderul Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Riveraman
Reviews.Content: Let me first start out by saying the RIU Playacar was great. We went down April 8-15th. It was 88-95 everyday. We were all 27-29 year old couples. When we arrived on Sunday we were all welcomed with a drink and wanted to have all our rooms together since there were 3 couples. They put us in 6th building closest to the beach. It is the Pink one. That is the one I would recommend to everyone. Number 5 is close to the beach but we heard people complaining that the busses and workers were loud on that side. We were on the third floor with the high vaulted ceilings. The rooms were not musty and were very clean. The fridge was stocked with beer, pop, and water. There were 4 bottles of booze on the wall. The towels were new and soft. The balcony was inviting and fun to sit on when waiting for all the girls to get ready for dinner. We loved all the restraunts. We never did the asian one though. It was hard to get reservations. So we took turns sending people down at 7 to make them. The pool and the pool bar were great. We spent 4 days on the beach and 3 days at the pool. It was so hot on the pool area you had to be in the shade or in the water. When we first arrived at the beach it was very large and then it started shrinking throughout the week. On the last day it started to come back. There we all sorts of things to do everynight. We went to the other sister hotels each one night and then to 5th one night. It was a 5 dollar cab ride to 5th and well worth it. Our hotel had a show or an event everynight that we all enjoyed. The entertainment staff was great. They always had something going one and made it fun to be there. There is one thing that I would recommed. We got large insulated mugs to get our beer and drinks in before we left. We got them at walgreens and everyone wanted to know where we got them. The cups they give you drinks in were small and did not get them cold for very long. The only complaint we had was no room service in that I mean no meals. We knew that coming in but in the last 2 trips we had that and did miss that service.

Reviews.Title: “riu excellence”
Reviews.Author: tropicalbay
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with lots to do but also able to relax if required.We found that having 2 good size pools allowed us to have noisy and busy times but also to have a nice quiet relax when we wanted to.The only problem with the pools was that, due to the amount of plants near,you often had to swim with bugs and leaves etc.The hotel rooms were a good size,even with the extra bed for our son.They were also clean but did smell quite musty on times.Another downside of the rooms is the fact that the beds and pillows were like rocks.The restaurants were very clean and provided an excellent menu.The staff at the hotel were all very friendly,but maybe this was because they all expected a tip for absolutely everything they did!!!!!The fact that it was their job to do what was required didn't seem to matter,they just held their hand out in expectation!!This was very annoying and often refused.The nightly shows that we saw were very well done but they did start too late if you had children with you.The beach was disappointing as it was very small and the steps provided were made from sand bags,so not really safe.Also on the beach were huge sand bags trying to hold back the loss of any more beach.We know this has to be done but they have not done a good nor safe job of it.Outside of the hotel there are a dozen or so small shops,but just a few minutes away is the plaza of Playa del Carmen which really surprised us.There were ample shops,bars and cafes etc and we also found a Walmart which sold absolutely everything from decent beer to hair straighteners and even car tyres,all at amazing prices.Back to the hotel,one major issue we had was that the staff who cleaned the rooms often had water bottles to carry their cleaning fluids around.We found this to be hazardous to children,who could recognise the bottle labled as water and take a drink!!!!We reported this three times but it never got resolved!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Whew!”
Reviews.Author: cozy1
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four senior girls with their moms as well as one complete family with a 13 year old son. We all had a great time. The resort was beautiful and the staff was outstanding. We were there April 3-8. The beach was my main concern before traveling. If you have already booked and are concerned, relax! Right now the beach certainly is not as big as the resort pictures indicate and it is not as big as some to the south, but it is very nice. As you sit in your chair, you will have a wonderful view. You can, though, see big black sandbags in the water at each resort to the left and right, but you have to look for them. They are not distracting. No sandbags in the water at our resort. The two levels of beach reminded me of natural sandunes beaches . Actually quite natural looking instead of sculpted. Of course the beach can change daily! We walked the beach twice to the south. The walk was a little challenging in parts (we had to walk on the upper level of the RIU Mexico beach) but got easier as we went on. The assistant manager came around twice during dinner to see how our trip was going. We couldn't think of anything to complain about when we saw her. We had six rooms total. Three had no musty odor,. Two had a slight odor that decreased as time went on. One room was way; too strong and we had to contact the resort. Now I understand why there were varying reports on this forum concerning the musty smells - the rooms varied . We felt that the musty smell factor may have been due to how little the guests before us used the air, how long the room stayed closed up, where the room was located, etc. I would recommend contacting the resort if you feel that your room is going to really bother you. On the room towel subject. I think they got new ones. Ours were fluffy brown towels that looked very new. I believe another poster reported the change during their stay. The thin beach towels didn't bother me. Beds were firm but were on boxsprings. We were in Mexico. We slept fine. I was the mom in charge of finding a reasonable but beautiful resort to accomodate different families. The rooms needed to be clean but not luxurious. The grounds needed to be small enough so that we could find each other easily. We wanted a variety of guests on the resort . It went very well. Whew!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place!!”
Reviews.Author: nikkib72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a week stay at the Playacar and we had a very relaxing time. We arrived at the hotel at 11:00am and check-in went very smoothly. Our room was ready and we were ready to explore the resort within the hour. The grounds were beautiful with groundsmen working round the colck. Our building was closest to the lobby which meant we were the farthest from the beach and pools. Some might view this as a problem but the few minute walk to the beach did us both some good. Our room was very clean. Neither of us noticed a musty smell and with the ceiling fan and air conditioner, the room was always comfortable. Now for the BEDS!! Yes, they were firm, yet we had no trouble falling asleep. The food was good, and we did go to 2 of the three specialty restaurants (Asian and Mexican). The Mexican was served in Turquesa, which is the place where lunch was served daily. We were a little disappointed with this meal. Jade, the Asian restaurant was located in a beautiful room decorated in a traditional asian motif. My boyfriend, who knows a lot about sushi, taught the sushi was mediocre, yet the meal was a welcomed change from the buffet. The storms have taken their toll on the beach. What was once a large beach is now a multi-level one. There was plenty of room and we got a chair everyday. The water was beautiful and very refreshing. The shows were okay. The Mayan show was the best one. The staff throughout the resort were helpful and friendly, especially the bar staff. If you plan your trip during spring break (March/April) beware of high school spring breakers. Lots of 17 and 18 year old kids who lack bar manners and volume control. We would definitely go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Plyaycar is Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pjkin4
Reviews.Content: My friend and I ditched the husbands and kids for a spring break getaway to Mexico. From the moment we arrived, until we left 5 days later, we throughly enjoyed our stay at the Riu Playacar. It all started out right with the open air lobby with a cool drink ready for us at check in. We had a room on the second floor with a view of the pathway to the ocean. The rooms were very clean, a bit musty smelling due to the climate but I didn't notice it after the first day. Beds were firm but I like them that way. I slept great each night. The grounds of the hotel were immaculent and beautifully landscaped and maintained. The pool and beach areas were amazing. They were never over crowded and beach chairs were padded and always available when you wanted one. We loved the swim up pool bar! The views of the ocean were awesome. We enjoyed the food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. W did the buffets and could always find many good choices. The hotel staff were very hard workers. They met every request with quick action and seemed happy to help. My only complaint was the smoking. People were smoking everywhere and it also seemed to seep into our bathroom from the vent above. But I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “A great all-inclusive experience!”
Reviews.Author: heathergot2
Reviews.Content: After making the mistake of staying up past midnight the night before our trip reading through other trip advisor experiences, we were expecting problems at the Riu Playacar - not to worry! We traveled with another couple and here is what we think: Pools - crowded as was expected but we were always able to get chairs. The pool bar was never too long of a wait. Two of our travelers took scuba lessons in the pool and saw things like toilet paper floating around so there wasn't much swimming on our parts after that. Beach: Always could get a chair - lots of choice for shade or sun. Lots of beach on the "upper" part, not so much on the lower part of the beach, but who cares? We enjoyed that area very much. Food: The buffet was fabulous. We quickly found favorite smoothies, desserts and main dishes each day that we came back for the next day. We ate at all three restaraunts. They were all booked by 7:30 or earlier each morning, so you had to get up early for a reservation. Still, portions were smaller and the menu was limited and the same all week. We sometimes had dessert at the buffet afterwards. Overall, we were very happy. Room: Whoever complained about the towels was a little petty perhaps. Our room towels were abundant, fluffy and large in size. The pool towels were a little well worn, but again large and served thier purpose. No musty smell for us, though we sure were looking hard for problems after reading other reviews. The only complaint was our TV didn't work, we called the front desk and someone was "coming right up" to look at it. No one ever came. We finally got that working then the remote didn't work - same problem reporting to the front desk and no one ever came so we just forgot about it. Trips - We took the city bus to Tulum for $3.50. The bus on the way there was air conditioned with a movie playing. On the way back, no air, windows didn't open and flying pests, but we survived. We rented scooters on Cozumel - very fun!!! The ferry was very rocky and they were passing out puke bags. On the way back we rode on top in the back and it was much better. Downfalls: The fitness room was at the Yucatan so we had to walk there. It was small with only a handful of machines and was packed uless you went mid afternoon. The disco at the Tequila smelled like sweat and puke and was filled with spring breakers who looked like their major in college was pole dancing. A plus for the guys in our group, not so much for the wives. Hints: The town was a $5 cab ride or a 30 minute walk. The "booths" towards the ferry dock had cheaper necklaces, knick knacks etc than the first ones towards town. All in all - great trip and for sure we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: tina22
Reviews.Content: After having read several of the reviews of the Riu Playacar, I was slightly apprehensive about the resort. The "common thread" through most of the reviews was a musty smell in the rooms and very hard beds. Let me begin MY review by saying that this was probably the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in. True, there was a musty smell in the room but the climate is very humid and the resort is right on the beach so with all of that dampness, I doubt that this could be totally avoided. As for the hard beds, that is also true. However, I was pleasantly surprised at how comfortable they were. I have had lower back problems for many years and my back did not bother me at all while we were in Mexico, which is rare. This would be a strictly personal experience, since everyone has their own comfort levels. The one problem we encountered was spring-breakers. The first night there, around 2:00 a.m., the occupants of the adjoining room came back from partying. They were laughing and talking loudly, slamming the door, etc. I was willing to wait it out for a bit to see if they settled down but they then turned ont he TV (very loud) so I called the front desk to advise them of the situation. Within 5 minutes, security came and talked to the people and there wasn't another sound from them. Two nights later it started before midnight (a completely different group of "kids"). They were all over the resort, coming and going at intervals until around 5:30 a.m. My husband spoke to them twice to ask them to be quiet but they didn't speak English and either didn't understand or didn't care. We spoke to the front desk the next morning (along with some of the other guests). The manager got involved and by later that afternoon, the room was vacant. After that, we had very quiet nights. Other comments included the lack of beaches. The entire area had been heavily damaged by hurricanes so the beaches have been eroded. However, they were very clean and usable. We tend to be busy with other activities and don't spend all day every day at the beach or pool so this was not a big issue for us. The afternoon pool-side activities were different each day and anyone who wished could get involved. Again, the pool was very clear and clean as was the surrounding area. There was always someone picking up glassware, dishes, etc. and generally keeping the area neat and clean. We ate at the buffet most evenings but did try the 3 sit-down restaurants. Actually, the buffet posed no problem since the variety of food was so large and every meal featured something special. Of the 3 sit-down restaurants, our preference was the steak house. It was very good but we didn't want to eat there every evening. The Mexican restaurant was o.k. and the Asian was our least favorite, although the food was good. Our overall impression of the Riu Playacar and surrounding areas was excellent. The cleanliness of the entire area was outstanding, the friendliness and helpfulness of everyone from restaurant staff to taxi drivers was helpful and reassuring, the tours were worth the money - informative and enjoyable. What more can we say than we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Badgers07
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I just got back from the Riu Playacar. We stayed there the week of March 18th. What a nice place. Close to the beach, pool area with swim up bar, entertainment every night at 9:45 p.m. There is some erosion of the beach by the water however you could walk forever on the beach to the right of the motel. Heading toward Playa most of the beach is gone. Some of the hotels had enormous sand bags in front of the them to keep what beach they had. You can walk to town on the sidewalk and it takes 25 minutes one way. Food was good in the buffets and 3 specialty restraunts always a good selection and very fresh. Room was nice when we arrived but it had a musty smell . We opened the door and patio door at night and turned the air on during the day and it was fine. The beds were hard though. Our bath towels were very soft. Activity Staff did an excellent job, JT, Deago, Irsrael and the gang worked hard all day and night making it a fun stay for everyone. All in all a very nice family smaller resort where everyone was friendly and was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Carribean Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: xelhasun
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a very relaxing vacation at the Riu Playacar Mar 18 thru 25, 2007. Overall it was a very pleasant and relaxing stay. We arrived on sunday and were greeted at the door with a tasty drink and were check in ASAP. After reading many of the reviews on the property we were well informed on what to expect. Overall it was a pleasant vacation Rooms: As in many reviews, the rooms were a bit smelly and smelt mildewy, However after an air freshner and the ceiling fan was cranked up, it was not bad at all. The beds again are really hard, but after a couple nights We were use to them. I would request a room in building five or six closer to the beach. We roomed in the first building on the right, and faced the Resort next door, where all the staff came to work, it was rather noisy all day and night with alot of noise, and buses coming and going dropping off the stafff, along with goods coming in, had to sleep with the door shut at night and still heard alot of noise, the worst was the buses coming in and the back up alarms blaring away when the were leaving. Food: The food was average I would say, Overall it was fresh but you could tell what what fresh and what was not. I wait staff was very friendly and went out of there way to accomadate you. We tried the Steakhouse, Asian, and Mexican resevations as well, they were pretty good however the Steak house was the best. The bar staff was very accomadating, and you always had a drink in your hand. We ate at the Yucatan and the Tequila, It was better food we thought. Beach: The beach was not the greatest, however it was peaceful and had beautiful clean water. We spend alot of our time at the Riu Yucatan Beach, it was much larger and easier to find shade to lounge in. And had better activites to take apart in such as beach volleyball which we really enjoyed. We took the ferry to Cozumel, and it was a rather rough ride but a good experience, We rented a jeep on the island and drove the whole south side of the island and checked out a few beaches, it was pleasurable. XEL-HA is a must, it was the highlight of our trip and well worth the trip, there is so much to do there, make sure you set a whole day aside for it, you will enjoy it! It was also a blast to hit downtown playa on 5th Avenue, lots of shops and restrurants to choose from for some good grub! I would recommend the Riu properties to anyone traveling to Playa, But I would definately stay at the Tequila or Yucatan next time

Reviews.Title: “Where's the beach gone?!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire-lass79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Playacar with my boyfriend between 26th Jan - 6th Feb. Overall we had a fantastic, relaxing holiday! Accomodation - we had a lovely top floor apartment next to the beach and pool area. Rooms were well tended and cleaned every day, with fresh towels and fridges being restocked every other day. Word of advice,keep the air con on at night,otherwise you will get bitten! The Mozzie's don't like the cold!! Food - Absolutely fantastic. HUGE choice! Great selection of food, but the best thing for us was the Mexican food! 100% authentic and really, really good!!! I still miss it now! There are a few speciality restaurants, steak, chinese and mexican. We went to the Steak house twice and the steak was beautiful! The chinese was ok, if you like sushi, and fancy a change from Mexican. We didn't even go to the Mexican as you could have it every day in the buffet restaurant! You have to book these but we never had a problem getting in! Pool - we stayed by the quiet pool, the one without the pool bar. This one is much quieter and away from all the activities! The american's and canadians who seem to like to join in with all the activities can get quite loud!! Which is fine if you want to join in, but not if you want to just relax in peace and quiet! There is a towel hut where you can get clean towels from as often as you like. Staff - really friendly and helpful. They are genuine, not like in some other resorts when you know all they are interested in is tip's! Do tip them though, they deserve it. Although you will find the American's and Canadians tip a lot more frequently, but they are used to it! Trips - your tour operaters will try and get youto book trips through them but as we all know they can be expensive. Tip. there is a small shopping complex across from the hotel were they also sell trips. Try there before your welcome meeting,then you can compare prices and know whether you are getting value! We only went on one trip to Chichen Itza. This was fantastic and highly recommended.Make sure you take your camera,some sun cream and money (small notes).There are plenty of locals inside selling their wooden and stone carvings and are EXTREMELY cheap Weather - Great. Only 2cloudy days in 2weeksthere! Some days were unbearably hot, make sure you take plenty of suncream. You can buy it over there but it can be quite expensive! Beach- this was the only dissapointing aspect of our holiday. I was really looking forward to a white beach as described and photographed in most of the Mexico brochures. I felt really let down when on arrival there appeared to be a 6ft drop down to the beach. There has been someseverebeach erosiondueto strongcurrentsand waves following thehurricanes over the past few years.Thereissome beach butnot as muchaswe hadbeen led tobelieve. During the second week the beach waseroded even further, by another 10-20m and 2 rows of palm tree'sfellinto the sea, which Ithoughtwasreallysad tosee.Asquickly as the staff were puttingdown sand bags the beachwas justfalling into the sea! During our second week we juststayed by the pool. Overall a fantastic holiday,didn't want to come back and I would definately recommend it! BUT, if you want a beach holiday, then this is probably not for you!!

Reviews.Title: “You wont want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: perthelzack
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend just got back from Riu Playacar and it blow away our expectaions. After reading some of the reviews of the hotel we were kinda questioning the Playacar, but after staying there for the week we both agreed that it is one of teh best hotels we have ever stayed at. And we were used to 5 star hotels here in the states. The food was great we never went hungry. There was enough to drink. Lets face it, if you could find somthing you liked to drink there your to damn picky. And the staff was byond friendly and helpful. They did everything in their power to make you confortable. The rooms were made up everyday better that any other hotel that i was ever at. They organized everything in the room to a t, and everyday made a new animal out oftowels and sheets. Overall it was worth the money, and we will stay again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and the Staff was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: IowaJodi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple went to the Riu Playacar Feb 10-17th. Was a little scared about the hotel reading some of the past reviews, but put your mind at ease, you will LOVE the Riu Playacar. We got to the hotel around 2:00 that afternoon and we were greated with a drink and wonderful person at the front desk. This is our 4th all inclusive trip (3 times to the Cancun area and once to the Domenican Republic) and this was the first time we were able to understand the front desk people fully. The staff spoke very good English. We headed to our rooms to get our suits on right away and yes you could smell a musty smell but we turned up the air and turned on the ceiling fan and when we got back later that night we couldn't smell it any more. The food was good. We never had a problem finding something great to eat. We only ate one night at the buffet cause we made reservations everynight at one of the specialty resturants. Our favorite we decided was the Asain, then the steakhouse, and then the Mexican. But all three were good. We went two nights to the Asian and two nights to the steakhouse. Room services was good. Everyday we had a different "towel art" figure on our bed. We always had more then plenty towels and shampoo and soap. The activity staff was out of this world. They were full of energy. By the end of the week they knew our names (good or bad I'm not sure). They did everything from pool stretching, to water balloon fights, a beach party, to beer drinking contest, which by the way never go up against a Canadian! They will kick your but! The entertainment at night was okay. If you like to just watch people dance you will love it but if you want entertainment it's not there. We found out when we got back we should of went to the disco at the Riu Tequilla. I guess that is a pretty big party every night. Next time we will know. The only "bad" thing on the trip, if I had to write something, was the beach. To get down to the ocean you had to walk down a whole bunch of sandbags. Which wasn't that bad. We did stay at the pool 95% of the week. We talked to the manager of the resort and she said that the goverment was coming in sometime in March to help build the beach back up. So that will be good. As you can tell we enjoyed our trip VERY MUCH and would recommand this to anyone! If you have any questions you can email me at jpiehl@butler-bremer.com Hope this helped. Jodi Piehl, Iowa

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed It”
Reviews.Author: whitepinepoint
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at the Riu Playacar. Each year we have a "friends and family" tour with 20-30 of us ranging in age from infants to grandparents. When we booked this year I read plenty of these darn reviews so I feel obligated to write one, they are helpful. Here is our report..............FOR THE MONEY, this place is wonderful. Our highlights include the staff, incredibly great and helpful, top to bottom, housekeeping, kitchen staff, front desk, bar staff, everyone. In past vacations (some worse than others) unless you are tipping you tend to get the cold shoulder or painfully slow service. This place won't disappoint you on the service side. The entertainment staff is particularly friendly, and amusing, don't miss "the perfect couple show", hilarious. The food is great. The buffet is incredibly comprehesive and much better than any other facility in this price range that we have stayed at in previous years. I read reviews on moldy smell, no one in our group had any problem with that in their room, as a matter of fact we found the rooms to be quite nice. The mattresses are particulary hard and the pillows flat, I requested some extra blankets and pillows and they arrived quickly, again, the service is great. My wife mentioned about the tattered towels but honestly, perhaps because I am a man, I hadn't noticed this whatsoever, they worked fine for me. The beach did have an erosion problem from the hurricane, we were told. We still spent a lot of time on the beach area, the views are beautiful. With the Riu you can use the facilities at the Riu Yucatan and the Riu Tequila. We spent the day at the Riu Yucatan and went on their beach, it was PACKED everywhere as was the entire resort. This is the first time we had to stand in lines or felt crowded. We were definitely glad to get back to our resort which really didn't seem very crowded compared to our other trips in past years. FYI, a lot of Europeans stay at this resort so there is a lot of topless sunbathing. In all, our group was very satisfied and I would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactury, Wouldn't go back to a RIU”
Reviews.Author: BuzzWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We vacationed at the RIU from March 3 to March 10 and are 2 couples in our early 40's from Canada. Arrival: Excellent greeting by front desk. We were meeting our friends from Toronto and the hotel accomodated us with rooms side by side. Hotel Room: Satisfactory. The bathroom had ants and the towels were old, stained and stringy. The beds were hard and pillows flat. This didn't bother my sleeping as much as the loud music coming from the hotel next door. I did mention this to the front desk and was told this is a common problem, nothing can be done. Beach: The beach has been washed up so there isn't very much beach. We managed to find chairs and stay at our resort. You can walk down to the Riu Yucatan if you want more beach. The water is a beatiful clear blue. Pool: No problem finding chairs and sun anytime of day. The pool bar could get a little loud and was impossible to get a chair in the water, was always busy. Bars: There are three bars, all had excellent service. You must try the Tequila pops. Buffet Restaurants: There is one at the pool/beach for lunch and one near the lobby for Breakfast and Dinner. Both had excellent food and service. There was always plenty of food and variety to choose form. Theme Restaurants: The Asian is a buffet style, we weren't too impressed with the food. The Mexican was really good and glad we tried it. We did not go to the Steak House. Entertainment: Excellent Staff: They work very hard and kept you occupied all day even on the rainy days. Front desk, restaurant, bars and maids all provided great service and attitude. I did find the Riu entertainment staff could be selective to who they wanted to talk to, like the young girls. Overall, I would rate this resort a 3 star, not a 5 star. We have stayed at three Iberostars that were rated 5 stars and have never been disappointed. This hotel was rated 5 star and it does not compare to the Iberostar. For the money we paid we would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first trip to Mexico”
Reviews.Author: lilmamaMichigan
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from Playa del Carmen and we had a fabulous time. One night in the theater they had GREASE and it was great. The dining/buffet was incredibly clean, I am not a buffet person, but this was truly enticing. Alot of variety, even for us picky eaters. The staff at the pool was amazing, very friendly and not bad on the eyes. I would definitely go back to that particular resort. The rooms, on the other hand, the towels could have been 'newer' and cleaner and the beds/pillows a little softer, but all in all, it was simply a great time. -Sunburn - in Michigan-

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Toniinsd
Reviews.Content: We stay at Riu Playacar and it was a great experience. Food was the best we had eated anywhere. Service and resort were great. The only bad thing was the beds were hard, but asked for more pillows and they were delievered in minutes. They should not be 23rd on your list. Toni Milner Hermosa, SD snobhillsd@rapidnet.com

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, wouldn't go back (J&D Michigan)”
Reviews.Author: jmr59
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th all inclusive in Mexico & least favorite. STAFF: Very kind, friendly & helpful. Can't say enough. ROOMS: The hotel style buildings are old & outdated. Many rooms have a mold & mildew problem. The bed linens & towels are old, stained and worn (not pleasant!). The hotels are arranged in 2 rows facing each other, no view from any room. FOOD: Good, especially for buffet fare. Only one choice for breakfast & lunch. Dinner at the buffet was good but again only one venue. If you want to eat at any one of the 3 "specialty" resturants you have to be in the dining room by 7:00a they book up FAST, only 30 per seating (6:45 or 8:45). They divide the lunch buffet area into 2 sections to create the Mexicana & steakhouse with a commom salad bar. The Asian is a buffet. POOL: Nicely laid out. One with swim up bar & lots of activity. Another with a fountain (which was never on). Lots of chairs at both. Closest bathroom was located between the lunch buffet & the lounge bar. BEACH: Massive erosion problem. Lots of area for chairs but difficult to climb down the sandbags to beach. Impossible to walk either North or South of property. The surf was rough the week were there 2-5 foot waves, not enogh for boogie boards but too much to use the kayaks or other water toys. Very strong under tow. OVERALL: Very disappointing, none of the resturants, Bars or rooms face the ocean. You don't even know you are at an oceanfront property unless you walk down to the beach. The pool closes at 6:00 & there was no live music or anything to do before or after dinner unless you walk to one of the other Riu's. The show doesn't start until 9:45. BEST EXPERIENCE: TULUM! Don't miss it. The tour is well woth it.

Reviews.Title: “another great trip”
Reviews.Author: nebagamonbob
Reviews.Content: just returned from playa del carmen mexico. second year at riu playacar. returned because we had fun last year and it was the most reasonable priced trip we could find. this is a good hotel for the money. it is clean. the service is excellent. the food is very good. its a great location,1 hour south of the airport because of traffic. walking distance to town,shopping, and other riu resorts to share. the beach is not as big as last year,but is still there with plenty of white sand and blue water. if you need super luxury this is not for you. if you want a nice place,reasonably priced,i would recomend it. only dissapointment was a snorkling trip we booked through our nw agent. it was 180 for two people. it was too windy to be out on the ocean,but once they have your money there is no cancelling. many people were sick from the rough boat ride. since we couldnt snorkle or cook on the boat they took us to a small lagoon on the way back with nothing worth seeing. ran out of drinks,food was 2hours late. basically a complete waste of money. complained to agent as soon as we returned. said too bad. the hotel did try to help but dont think i will get anything back. lesson learned. you will meet many friendly people in mexico,but there are also many trying to take your money if you let them.

Reviews.Title: “great experience at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: timbostonBoston
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Riu Playacar and we were very happy with the experience. The hotel staff were very friendly and could not do enough for us. The food was excellent. We had three teenagers with us and there was always delecious food for them to choose from. We tried all three restaurants and enjoyed them all. The pool was great and the beach having suffered from some erosion was also nice with plenty of chairs. We loved the shows at night and the activity staff were wonderful especially RA who taught us how to dance Salsa and Marange. He was so pleasant and full of energy and became our friend. We would definetly go back but I have one request. Please add another beer to your selection. I got tired of just drinking Corona. TM

Reviews.Title: “Pool and grounds beautiful..rooms bad”
Reviews.Author: MaciJo
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from the Playacar. In my opinion the Playacar is the better out of the 3 Riu resorts (Tequila, Yucatan, and Playacar). The grounds were beautiful, Pool was nice and good entertainment. Didn't make it to any of the shows, but heard they were good. The food on the buffet was very good. Probably the best buffet in all of the all-inclusive resorts I have stayed at. We ate at two of the reservation restaurants, second seating. I think the buffet was better. The steakhouse fills up by 7:00 am so if you want to eat there you need to be in the dining room before 7:00 to make a reservation. The drinks in the bars were OK. They do serve a few top shelf liquors. Only Corona beer on tap. I've had better Pina Colada's, daquari's and margaritia's. They weren't bad. Just OK. They serve in small glasses, so bring an insulated mug. They do not have room service. All staff were friendly with the exception of the front desk. They were rude. Now my negative opinions of this resort. If you want a good night sleep. Don't go here. The beds are very firm. Riu is a european chain and I heard europeans like firm beds. So all Riu's beds are very firm. I could put up with the firm bed, but the pillows really were bad. Very flat. We complained about them after 3 days and they brought us fluffy pillows. Why wouldn't they have good pillows on our beds in the first place??? There is no mattress pads on the bed. I think that is gross. The sheets have stains and the maid does not change them daily. The towels in the rooms were really...bad. Raggy and dirty. It looks like they just dried them and put them back in the room. The rooms also have mold in the bathrooms. My husband has allergies to mold, so he was congested the whole time we were there. The ventilation system in the room is bad. It does not circulate properly so it does not get the humidity out of the room. So guess what?? Your clothes are always damp and so are your sheets. So if a comfortable bed and clean linens are a must. Don't stay here. If that doesn't concern you. Everything else about this resort was nice. I won't be returning though. I just felt dirty sleeping in the bed and drying off with their towels.

Reviews.Title: “Going back soon.”
Reviews.Author: Pruchica
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here from the 11th to the 18th of Feb. We were very happy. The beach was better than it's sister resort the Palace which was much more expensive. Food was good. It is located in a good spot outside of Playa del Carmen far enough that you escape the craziness but close enough that it's a $5 cab ride. It is right across the street from a little shopping plaza which was very handy. If you are going to do a tour I would recommend booking it at this plaze and try and talk them down. It works! Don't book from hotel lobby, it's more expensive. Also ifyou are trying to decide between the Chi chen itza tour or Coba I would recomment Coba, its half the distance and just as nice. The Chi chen itza tour was a really long bus ride. Horseback riding was fun too the cowboys are a blast. There are lots of activities you can do right from the beach that are fairly inexpensive. We plan on going back in June, we liked it that much.

Reviews.Title: “A holiday to be remembered”
Reviews.Author: the_picks_abroad
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico/ Carribean and we were pleasantly suprised by the whole experience even though we only stayed for one week. The staff of the hotel were fantastic with nothing being too much trouble, the waiters we found particularly accommodating. The Hotel itself was clean and the grounds were beautifully maintained. The rooms though were not up to the standard of the rest of the Hotel and were more 3 Star than the 4 stars Thomson rated it or the 5 stars Riu rate it. There was only a shower (no Bath) and a curtain dividing the bathroom from the sleeping area. We had requested adjoning rooms because we took our kids, to find that we were not together on arrival. A quick chat with reception soon sorted this out. Strangley two rooms shared a single passage way which was fine if you shared this with family which meant you could shut he outer door leaving the inner doors open but not so good if you were sharing with strangers. Having said that the food was 5 star with a wide variety of choice and range. The only thing missing was the champagne at breakfast that we are used to having at other 4 star hotels although the free minibar and optics made up for this. The activities and the animation team kept our kids 15,17 & 19 amused on the days we stayed around the Hotel. The only real gripe was the pool itself which we found to be the only area that needed improvement. The pool was constantly dirty with debris which included a range of bugs, plasters and straws floating on the surface and the floor of the pool littered with plastic beakers, sand and sodden leaves. Using the swim up bar was an unpleasant experience because of the amount of dead insects floating around whilst trying to enjoy one of the many cocktails on offer (alcohol was brand names and not cheap local produce appart from the tequilla of course). I reported this initially to the pool guys who then did absolutely nothing about it. I then reported it to the Hotel Management who tried to fob me off with excuses of weather (Winds) etc. I explained that having a pool at home meant the excuses given were not acceptable and that the filter system was simply not up to it. On our last day a concerted effort was made with the pool being properly vaccumed and the tiles washed and and the surface scimmed. However, my feeling is that this was only a small effort made because of my complaint and they would soon lapse back to their previous regime of neglecting the pool. Mexico is fantastic with warm friendly locals and a wealth of history and culture. Mexico is now our favourite holiday destination and it is our intention to return every year and inspite of the niggles we would return to the Riu Playacar whilst we have children. If you have no childrern I would go to the Riu Palace Mexico which we visited during our stay. Other things to consider are the trips on offer. if you are prepared to walk or take a taxi into Playa Del Carmen you get these trips even cheaper than the kiosks outside the hotel can offer, and they are undercutting the hotel and the tour operators by nearly as much as 40%.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: julestap60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from staying at the Riu Playacar. What a great stay. It was our first time at a RIU. We worried a little after reading some of the reviews, but realized quickly that some people have nothing better to do than complain. We didn't find anything to complain about. The rooms were clean. We loved the towel animals. If it gets noisy at night just close the outer door. We did and it was very quiet. The food was great. Always something different on the buffets. We never made reservations for the specialty restraunts because we were always happy at the main dinning room. We ate at the same table every night, so we had the same waiter. After the first night he knew what we wanted to drink and would have it ready. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The pool was wonderful. Always a place to sit. (without placing a towel on a chair at 7:00am.) The staff at the pool are fun. You can tell they love their jobs. New activities every day. If you don't participate you'll have a great time watching. Lots of laughs. The beach was smaller because of a storm they had in January. There were men laying sand bags every day to help stop the erosion. But still plenty of room to swim. And lots of chairs at the beach. The bar staff is great. Bring a mug from home. My husband had his drinks made in his mug and I always got ice for my bottled water. We had BIG bottles in our frig. Nice shopping area across the road. And a $5.00 cab ride takes you into Playa Del Carmen. We shopped at both. The resort offered us an upgrade to the Riu Palace at no extra cost but we declined. We liked the smaller resort. We will come back to this resort. We loved it here. Clean, friendly and warm sunshine. Have fun, A couple celebrating 25 years from WI.

Reviews.Title: “Tips For You From Our Recent Vaca!”
Reviews.Author: lainiebug28
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our awesome vacation at Rui Playacar just south of Playa Del Carmen. Overall, it was an excellent vacation. It was our first trip to Playa and it won't be our last...next year (because we are going back) we will be wiser. Here are some things we learned along the way. I will leave out the stuff everyone writes. I want to cover things I wish I knew before I left. AIRPORT TRANSPO: Don't fall for one of the overpriced "shuttles" that advertise on the web like Paradise Transfers. We got taken. Total loss about $40. Get a taxi instead. It's only $50 one way. Or ride the bus. DOLLARS vs. PESOS: Wait until you get there to take out/exchange money. You get more for your money purchasing with pesos. The ATM across from the hotel was easy. We got about $2,000 pesos for $185 - so it's worth it. HOTEL: Beautiful. The rooms are nice but our room was moldy and stinky. We didn't realize until we got home and were sick with coughs that we should have changed rooms. If your room stinks of moisture - change rooms ASAP. HOTEL STAFF: The best. They work very hard and deserve tips. Not everyone tips. We gave $2 or 20 pesos for meals (give directly to them) and tipped our maid daily. STRATEGIC TOWELING: You will need to be strategic when scoping out your spots (sun or shade). Some rude folks drop their towels on chairs at 9 a.m. and leave them there all day without using them. Get your spot early and if you are going to be gone more than 30 minutes, give it to someone else. It's only fair. BEACH: (See attached photo) Don't feed the rumor that the beach is gone. There is plenty of sand and beach - it's just changing daily and there is some sandbagging. There is still plenty to enjoy at this hotel and several others. BRING: Plenty of shorts and tank tops. You need to change way more than you think (this tip mainly for us girls who like to be cute at all times). Lots of sunscreen - one bottle will not go far so bring two. HAIR: Give up on trying to keep it straight. I flat ironed my hair and it was curly two hours later. Work with the weather and pull it back with a clip or scrunchie. GYM: There is an excellent gym you can access at the Riu Yucatan but it's a long walk (which is kind of a power walk workout in itself if it's hot). Go early before the heat. Treadmills, Elliptical and weights provide a decent workout. OUTSIDE RESORT: Go and check out town, Xcaret, Xel Ha, Mayan ruins, etc. but I don’t recommend eating food outside the resort. It’s risky. ALL INCLUSIVE: It's the way to vacation. For us wives and moms, just think you don't have tocook or clean at all. Drinks and food galore. I drank enough to cover my room charge! We are counting the days until next year! - end -

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar was fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: NikonDude
Reviews.Content: This resort had the most incredible staff......always a smile and always so polite.......I had learned a little Spanish before leaving, and was helped out with some words and phrases by almost all of the staff that I encountered. The food was amazing......I always chose the buffet for breakfast and dinner and had not one complaint. The grounds were always kept clean and never had to worry about any type of debris laying about seeing as I was barefoot most of the time. Carlos on the cleaning staff was excellent.....thanks for the extra cervezas amigo.....and Samuel and Fernando in the buffet dinning room were always on......handshakes, never had to wait for a drink, and always a smile. The resort is smaller, however it had a fantastic charm to it and felt more personal. I would definitley be more than happy to stay there again. I'll post some photos as soonb as I get them organized.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice vacation at playacar”
Reviews.Author: b3180
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5-night stay at Riu Playacar and had a great time. Prior to my arrival, I was very concerned about the weather and beach conditions. Here are my quick thoughts on the Playacar experience: Hotel -- The hotel was great. Very nice grounds and the service is exceptional. I stayed in a 2nd floor unit off a stairwell overlooking the garden, and the room was very nice (and not too noisy). The beds are firm (you might bring a pillow if you can), but the room was of high quality. Food -- Food is primarily a buffet setup; as long as you don't expect a fine dining experience, you should be happy. My biggest issue with the dining was not the food itself (I thought all meals were quite good and always fresh) but with my fellow guests (I suggest avoiding the peak lunch time crowd as it reduces your chance of getting cut off or put off by someone with less-than-graceful table manners. Beach -- The beach is essentially cut off at the main ground level, but then extends down a slight slope to the ocean-level beach front. The ground crew was working to add sand bags to make it easy enough to step down to the ocean. The beach was plenty big enough to accommodate people wanting to lay out there. The ocean was great. Pool -- The pool was nice and it was always easy to find a nice spot. The activities coordinators will recruit you hard to join is some fun, but they also know to leave you alone if you'd rather stick with a book. Weather -- Over the course of five days, there were some clouds and rain, but generally, the sun was out for most of each day (clouds tended to roll in around 2-4 p.m. and most of the rain showers lasted only 30 minutes. Overall -- The experience was very good and I will go back again. I walked down to both the Riu Tequila and the Riu Yucatan and these were also nice properties. Next time, I will likely spend one of my "lounging" days at the Yucatan to change it up, but really, neither the Yucatan or Tequila seemed a better choice to me.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar was awesome”
Reviews.Author: goingsouthsoon
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful with well kept grounds, lobby, restaurants and pool area. The price for the flight and resort was excellent. We were hesitant to book it at first but after enjoying ourselves so much after 2 days - we began asking ourselves when we could come back! The only thing we did not care for was the rock hard mattress. The staff layered blankets under the sheets for us and that made it better. After a few days, we didn't even notice it. Our room had a refrigerator with beer, sodas and several large bottles of water. That was great to have on hand and at no extra charge.
