Staff everywhere was wonderful, from the bartenders to the housekeeping staff. We especially enjoyed the waiters during the dinner. Some of them did tricks with the utensils and glassware. Their sense of humor and service made dinners an event each night. Our resort was one of the few along the strip that still had a beach area. So much of it washes away daily. The entertainment staff was great. Young adults, all good looking and lots of fun. They handled kids and adults very well. There were several shows, one of which was more like a high school musical, but all were fun. The food was very good and we were spoiled with so many choices all day, every day. Some of the desserts had a refrigerator taste but since there were so many to choose from, it was not a problem satifying our sweet tooth. We were able to visit two sister resorts a short walk from the Playacar but ours was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine, but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: kctravlr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day trip to the Riu Playacar. I will start with the good. Food- The food was much better than we expected. We mostly ate at the buffet which always had a Mexican dish. Overall, food was a little bland but there were ample salsas from mild to hot to add taste. Only ate at the Mexican specialty restaurant which was out standing. Service- Front desk, maids, and bartenders were very attentive. The dinner service at the buffet could be a little slow, and I often had to go get my own drinks rather than wait for them to get me one. Breakfast service was very good. The Bad- Beach- 3 weeks ago there was major beach erosion. Riu Playacar seems to have stabilized the beach, which is only about 10 feet to the water now. The beach is slowly coming back. You are able to use the beach and facilities at the Riu Yucatan, about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The beach at the Yucatan is very nice. Be advised the lunch buffet at the Yucatan was not as good as Playacar. Room- the beds and pillows were both very firm. The sheets and towels were clean, but often had stains on them and they were incredibly rough. We were in a first floor room, and the corridors outside our room were very noisy. Overall, a good experience. A smaller resort but not quite clean enough to try again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, okay beach”
Reviews.Author: Ductguy
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel from the cleanliness to the little towel animals they left on our bed. The hotel is small in comparison to the surrounding Riu's, which makes it nice. You do have access to two other (larger) Riu's if you want. The buffet was decent, we always found someting, but the specialty resturants were okay - 2 of the 3 were also buffets. Staff friendly, drinks good. Part of beach washed away by storm in early Jan. 2007, still chairs on beach and beach volleyball, but had to jump down approx 2-3 foot cliff of sand to get to water. Riu Yucatan's beach is much bigger, it is approx 5 min walk, and you have full access to it - but there are a lot of people there. Overall we enjoyed the Riu Playacar and would recommend it for a quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but beach all but gone”
Reviews.Author: hoheisel
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 1/28 to 2/1. Food - very good- at both buffet and restaurants Room - clean, well maintained. Bar stocked every day. Grounds- clean and well maintained Front desk/service- very helpful and prompt! Pool- clean, well maintained. Entertainment- didn't partake. Only real problem is the beach. You see the pictures online where there's about 25 yards of sand beyond the first row of palm trees. Well- the ocean is lapping at those palm trees now. I don't know if this was a result of Wilma or what. I hope they can get this fixed. Farther south, from the Riu Palace Mexico and on to the south, the beach is intact. But the beach is gone from the Hotel Wyndham Viva Maya Playacar and north.

Reviews.Title: “Playacar just OK”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukeeslick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RiuPlayacar from 1/17/07 to 1/24/07. We had reservations for the Riu Tequilla but the Manager there told us there was a pluming problem and only 5 more rooms were available and we would be upgraded to the Playacar. They asked us to go to the bar and have a drink while they printed out a document for us to sign and also took our emergency contact information and told us they would call them and let them know we were changing hotels. I didn’t think they would call our contacts and when we got home we found that they didn’t. We didn’t want a room on the ground floor and asked for a 2nd floor room thinking there were only 2 floors. There are actually 3 floors, the ground floor, the 2nd floor which they called the 1st floor, and the 3rd floor which they called the 2nd. There are no elevators. When we got to are room there was a little difficulty opening the door, to open the door you had to turn the key to the left then while turning the key pull the door knob towards you then the key would turn a little further at which point you had to push the door kind of hard to open it, (because there was a damping mechanism at the top of the door to keep it from slamming shut.) It can be challenging if you are carrying anything or have your hands full. We also noticed that they only gave us one key we later went to the front desk and got another key which barely worked, you had to fiddle with it quite a bit to get it to work, (that’s probably why they didn’t give it to us it the first place). We then went to have lunch, after returning to our room I noticed that the Air Conditioning was not working. I tried calling the front desk a few times by dialing 0 which kept on being busy. Later I realized by reading the Riu booklet in the room that to call the front desk you had to dial 813 or 413 that was after I walked to the front desk to let them know that the A/C working and was told it would be looked right away that was about 4:30pm, no one ever showed up so I called at about 5:45pm, no one still hadn’t shown up so we went to dinner and stopped at the front desk on the way and complained again and was told some one would be there right away it was now 7pm after eating we returned to our room a little after 8pm and there was a guy working on it he worked on it till 10:30pm and said he would back in the morning. The next 2 guys showed up to work on it, we went to the pool/beach and when we returned it was fixed. Our room number was 3307 which is the middle building facing the back of the property to the south of the Playacar, it had a good view of their employees hanging out, coming and going by bus, garbage trucks and what sounded like a car alarm that went of a lot of the time. The bath room had no tub only a shower stall. The shower head was a detachable design with a flexible hose, the best thing was that it was mounted on a vertical bar to raise or lower the height of it, I’m 6’2” and usually the shower heads are to low but you could be 7 feet tall and it would still be high enough to stand under. Every day there was a towel animal left on the bed. The mini bar fridge kept the drinks nice and cold, Usually they don’t get cold enough but this one worked great. One thing I didn’t like was that the bottles were glass and the floors are all hard tile if you dropped one there probably would be glass that would need to be cleaned up and with plastic you could drink some recap it and put it back to stay cold. The water bottles were plastic though. One the ground floor there is a ice machine, the one in our building didn’t work the whole time we were there. The building and grounds were always kept very clean all the time. I walked the beach quite a bit and at the Playacar there is some erosion, the beach has 2 levels, the first level is at the water level the second level looks like they had to dump extra sand one it to raise it up, you had to climb up or down a little sand hill to go down to the water or up to the lounge chair area. From the Playacar’s beach you can’t walk north towards PDC, the water comes right up to a wooden wall and the waves hit the wall pretty hard I didn’t see anyone try to go past it. At the other end of playacar’s beach you can get past the sand hill that has been built up by climbing over or walking in the water on the sandbags that are stacked up around the hill. The Riu Yucatan had a much nicer and bigger beach. The food at the restaurants was alright some things were good and some wasn’t, there was a beach cookout one day and that was good There is no drink service by the pool or beach if you want a drink you have to go to the bar and get it. Security was well enforced at the front gate, every time we returned via cab to the resort the cab had to stop at the entrance and you had to show him your wristband, I never seen that done before. Right before checking out I went to wash my hands and there was no hot water after about 10 minutes still no hot water. This seems to be a common problem in Mexico I think it has happened at least 1 time at every hotel I’ve stayed at in Mexico. Check out was very easy with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not the Tequila...”
Reviews.Author: Scarolann
Reviews.Content: We just got home from the Riu Playacar on Wed Jan 24th, we were there a week. We were booked for the Tequila as we stayed there for the past two years but they were overbooked so they moved us to Playacar & told us it was an "upgrade".....in my opinion it wasn't. I guess because it was on the beach that is why. As far as food & decor, it is very similar to the Tequila...yep same hard bed but that is not a concern of ours. We ended up hanging at the Tequila & the Yucatan for a day & ate dinner at the Tequila 3 nights because we knew most of the staff at the Tequila from years past. The kids club at the Playacar is nothing like the Tequila. Our daughters had a blast at the Tequila with the program that they had but really not that exciting at the Playacar for them...they did try though. The overall serv ice was good but once again not like the Tequila. I am not bashing the Playacar but my first choice is the Tequila for sure. The walk to the beach from the Tequila is no biggie. I liked the layout of the Tequila way better than the Playa & also the lobby at the Tequila is very "happening" if you will. Weather was GREAT all week with the exception of on half day of rain. i was concerned before we left for they were forecasting rain all week but con't go by that because it changes so often. Xel-Ha was great as usual but if you can get the tickets from hotel & get a taxi. We are not tour bus people. We rented a taxi van for 140.00 both ways & had a wonderful driver, he dropped us off when it opened & picked us up when it closed & the hotel can set up with it. They will try to talk you into the b us but it just isn't fun waiting around for people etc.....& you need ALL day there. If anyone needs any answers to anything please feel free to email. This hotel was good but Tequila is much better. My email is eigsti5@yahoo.com ........good vacation to all!!

Reviews.Title: “needs a facelift in places”
Reviews.Author: frederica
Reviews.Content: we stayed here over New Year 06/07 and were placed in a room right on a stair well . Hotel is badly laid out if you want a wee bit of quiet at times as the blocks of accomodation are ALL built around an " atrium " effect garden ( noises echo badly ) we had bad neighbours who banged & slammed doors all the time. The vegetation growing near the rooms there tends to make for Damp Musty smells in rooms especially as downpours are common .. I , in fact could swear our top covers were damp all the time & were made from rubbery material !! balcony overlooked busy walkway Never slept for 4 days. The shower drain was very rusty , basin chipped & walls paper thin. Luckily we got moved to riviera mayo Palace & entered another world. no way would I say this Riu rated like the rest unless your drunk mostly & don't notice. Staff were ok . Tiny lobby bar was frantic & noisy so forget a chat over a late drink. pool good . beach good until washed away by storms. sea not what I expected as red flag up most days .Long flight was only worth it for the Palace experience . Did not feel Mexican enough for us and Americans only mixed with likewise. We did meet few nice couples but usually we feel more rappore. Go here if you intend to indulge in the 24hr drink & do not mind inconsiderate noisy families left to own devices

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything!!! Already planning to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Whittg
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went on a mother daughter trip december 10-19 of 2006. By the best decision we stayed at the Riu Playacar!! This place is fabulous!!! There is not one thing to complain about, other than the beds might be a little hard, but drink a little before you go to bed and you wont notice!!! The staff couldnt be any nicer, and more helpful! The food is exellent, always a variety. If you dont like the buffets there are two restraunts you can make reservations for! You will never be bored, as the entertainment team always is doing something, during the day you have water aerobics, bocci ball, beach volley ball, darts, target shooting, bingo, dance lessons. At night the team puts on very funny shows, or if they arent they have shows that come in that are great shows!!! I give thanks to the Anamacion Staff- Israel, Gabriel, Vanessa, Peter, Martin, Ceasar, Sergio, Rolondo, you are all great!!!!:) Watch out, they will get you on stage for the shows at night!!! Talking for experience!!!:) I do encourage you to particpate, you will have fun!! The rooms are nice always clean, with your cute little towel animal on your bed everyday!!! Yes, they do have a slight musty smell, but how can it be helped, there is so much moisture in the air....you are rate on the ocean!! Also the grounds are always keep very clean, they are working from early morning to late evening!!! So, I would recommend this resort to anyone, dont listen to all of the people who have complaints on here..most likely they have nothing better to do!!! Because, this resort is the BEST choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JennyandDan
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar was awesome! The food was great, the service was outstanding, the pool, beach and views were spectacular! This was our first all inclusive vacation and we would strongly recomend it to anyone! The staff were always available and waiting to serve you, the rooms were cleaned daily and the mini fridge was filled daily. There were always staff members working on the landscape, and they were very friendly. There was entertainment every night and you could tell those staff really loved their jobs. The steakhouse was by far our favourite dinner spot, but they were all wonderful. The pool bar staff were always laughing and having a good time, and the second you set down your empty glass you had a new one in front of you. The only thing that we suggest to make this trip perfect would be to bring your own sheets or towels to lay down under you, because the sheets sort of feel like you are sleeping on curtains. That was the only complaint we had the whole week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “no ocean front rooms here”
Reviews.Author: tompammc
Reviews.Content: This resort was older but wonderful. We were a little disapointed there were no ocean front rooms as this is what we have been used to while staying in Cancun. We emailed ahead and asked for a 3rd Floor room next to our friends we went with. Like most Mexico resorts they tend to give you not the most choice rooms at first but were very accomodating and gave us "garden view" rooms on the 3rd floor by our 2nd day. There are no elevators but we felt like walking up 3 stories helped burn some calories from all the great food & drinks. But all in all the staff & beach & food (especially the guacamole & butter pecan ice cream) were wonderful. We went to the Michael Jackson show at the Riu Yucatan and The Disco at the Riu Tequila. Playa De Carmen was a nice walk with a $5.00 taxi ride home after going to Senor Frogs. Also a market across the street was very convenient. We found some great last minute shopping for souveniers at the Airport. Xcaret & Xel Ha were well worth the money. Also we had a couples massage on the beach we enjoyed. However the massage prices along with everything else is going up in Mexico just like everywhere else! We hope to go back to this area in October with our children. Maybe try a differn't RIU just for a change but for the price this resort can't be beat. Don't forget lots of small bills for tips & insulated cups to take your drinks on the beach or coffee to your room.

Reviews.Title: “I have already booked again for this year!!!!”
Reviews.Author: janete75
Reviews.Content: I went w/ my husband and 15 other people all ages. Ranging from 14-70!!!! We all had a blast. Matter most of fact this group travels together every year. Before this trip they had done a different cruise each year. But after our stay this past November, we all have booked for this November already! The beach is the best. Big beach w/ plenty of shade and sun. Atleast I think so. Food was good. It is buffet, but there are diffferent things all the time. And when u get tired of the buffet the chinese restaurant is great. the other two specialty are OK, not a big fan of the other two. Room service is good ONLY IF U TIP WELL. We usually tip at the end of the stay. However we noticed we weren't getting our room cleaned until we would call at 4 in the afternoon. So we started leaving tips on the bed, and all of sudden our rooms were kept up great everyday early. I don't mind the tips. they do not get paid much there and u get everything else for free Bar service. we gave our fav bartenders a good tip in the beginning and we always had our drinks waiting for us as we were walking up to the bar. Even if bar was surrounded by people. The spotted us coming and took care of us ahead of all the others. Hey u do what u can to have a pleasant stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Lovely Setting”
Reviews.Author: dsl24
Reviews.Content: We booked the Riu Playacar through a travel agent and had no idea what to expect other than warm weather. What we found was a lovely hotel and a group of wonderful Mexican hosts. From the woman who gave out towels at the pool to the terrific "Animacion" (entertainment) staff, we had a ball for seven days. Although some of the beach had washed away due to heavy surf, it did not dash our enthusiasm for this vacation. The food was excellent and plentiful, and the rooms spacious and comfortable. It was also nice to be among a real international crowd with Canadians making up the largest single nationality and then Americans and many northern Europeans (Germans, French, Dutch, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hollidays in nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brice_lu
Reviews.Content: We went in december 2005, with my wife and my daughter, we are french Service perfect, staff very nice, pool with bar, beach clean paradise .. We are coming back next Chrismas

Reviews.Title: “If you like crowded, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: Hippiegirll
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from December 2-9, 2006. We have stayed in the Playa Del Carmen area before, but at a much smaller resort. We looked at the pictures, read the reviews, and figured, why not? We met friends of ours at the resort for a week. We are accustomed to being able to be on the beach, without someone else's beach chair inches from us. This is not the case at the Riu Playacar. The beach on the property is fairly deep into the property, but very narrow. I didn't like the idea that the resort was sandwiched in very close with 2 other resorts. The first day, we thought the food was great, but we didn't know we would be eating the same thing for 7 days! There is buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. There are also reservation-only restraunts on the property, which feature Asian, Mexican, and a steakhouse. We recommend the Asian, which is very good. As for nightlife, there isn't much. If your idea of entertainment is watching people dance to recorded music on stage, then you will be happy. This is the only entertainment we saw, and it was every night. We were really hoping for a comedy show, or even a cultural show, but we didn't see anything like that at all. We saw American reviews, such as Grease, Showtunes, and the like. All in all, we have to give the staff credit for beautiful scenery, which was very clean and well-kept. Maybe it's just that we would like more of a relaxed, romantic resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: Rose&George
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple spent the week at the Riu Playacar from November 27th to December 4th. Our choice of accommodations is always a preference to stay at a RIU RESORT, we know we are guaranteed excellence service, food, accommodations, etc with a RIU. Being our 3rd trip to Mexico, once to Cancun, the other to Puerta Vallarta, staying at the Riu Jalisco. But the RIU Playacar in Playa de Carmen was by far one of the best. PROPERTY: Very well kept. BEACH: The beach was one of the nicest. Plenty of chairs and lots palm trees for the shade. The only thing they are lacking is a little “beach bar” to get a drink, rather than walking to the pool bar, but we did recommend this to Eric their Customer Relations staff, and the next few days there were guys bring down trays of drinks. POOL: Pool was very nice, pretty chilly. There are 2 pools, one had the swim-up bar and this is activities took place, the other section was very quiet and relaxing. There where plenty of chairs, and like the beach, had several areas with shade. SERVICE: The service was great! They bend over backwards to make sure you are looked after. Very caring, all around. FOOD: The buffet always had a huge variety and we liked just about everything. There are different food stations to choose from, always something for everyone. Specialty Restaurants: There are 3 (Mexican, Steakhouse, Asian). We ate at 2, the Steakhouse & Asian. Steakhouse was good, they give you plenty of food, so you don’t leave hungry. The Asian was our favorites, we ate there twice. ROOM: Very nice, ours was a king bed, overlooking the walkway with a nice view from the balcony, close to the pool. The only issue was we had tiny little bugs, like an ant, that were noticed around the washroom sink, nothing to complain about. The rooms were clean and a good size. For the amount of time you spend in your room, it is just to sleep, they were fine. NOTE: After our 3rd day were offered a special promotion from the front desk, that we could to go a stay FREE OF CHARGE for our last 4 days at the Riu Palace Mexico. We went and saw it beautiful place, talked it over and we TURNED IT DOWN, we like the atmosphere and treatment we had received from the RIU Playacar, that is how much we enjoyed it there. Looking forward to returning. George & Rose Wilson, Barrie Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good...Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: Conard10
Reviews.Content: To give you some perspective, my husband and I (both 30 yrs old) have traveled to Mexico several times…to both Cancun and Playa Del Carmen. We have stayed in many all-inclusive resorts, some considered a 3 star, others a 5 star. BEACH: The beach was large and very nice. As other’s have mentioned, many of the hotels in this area have lost most of their beach, but the RIU Playacar beach was one of the nicest beaches. There were plenty of chairs and lots of areas with shade. POOL: The weather before we arrived was rather cold, so the pool was pretty chilly…but very refreshing. There were 2 sections…one had the swin-up bar and was where the activities took place. The other section was very quiet and relaxing. There where plenty of chairs, and like the beach, had several areas with shade. Overall the pool was nice, but it wasn’t as clean as other resorts where we have stayed. What I found interesting, was that unlike most resorts that have very few areas of shade, it was actually more difficult to find chairs with sun than with shade. SERVICE: The service was great! Even at check-in…we were able to get in our room at 10am. We didn’t like the location of the first room and they let us move immediately. FOOD: We found the food to be very good. The buffet had a huge variety and we liked just about everything. The buffet restaurant by the beach was open all day….so, if you wanted a snack or a drink you could just walk in and get it. They had soft drinks and beer on tap you could get yourself…this was really nice!! With this said…BRING AN INSULATED MUG!!!!!! The cups are super-small…I can’t stress enough how nice it was to have a big mug. We really enjoy going into the town of PDC so we only ate dinner at the resort a couple times and didn’t try the Specialty restaurants. ROOM: Ok, I left the negative part for last. I want to first say that we are not those picky people who write ridiculous comments…but, the rooms were pretty bad. I was surprised to read the other reviews that said the rooms were great. I would first like to say that when we arrive they asked us if we wanted a king bed…of course we wanted a king! But, when they took us to the room it was horrible, very small and the balcony had a tall wall and overlooked a service area. We went to switch rooms and they said they only had a few king beds and those rooms were on the “corners”…so, I would say, avoid the king bed rooms. We then asked for a room overlooking the walkway….these had a much nicer view and were larger. But, there were bugs! This was the first time we have ever experienced this in Mexico. There were little tiny bugs in the bathroom area and tiny ants all over the room. The gross part was…I opened a soda, put it on the nightstand, and 5 minutes later when I reached for the soda there were ants all over it!!! That completely creeped me out. The TV didn't have good reception and was difficult to watch. The beds….well we are used to the beds being hard in Mexico, but these were really hard and the pillows were like rocks…and the bedding, well it didn’t make me feel very comfortable. Overall, we did enjoy our stay, but if you’re looking for more of a luxury hotel with a “more modern look”, this may not be the hotel for you. If you do choose this hotel…remember to ask for a hotel overlooking the walkway and bring an insulated mug!

Reviews.Title: “All that we expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: BigZee
Reviews.Content: Wow! We had a blast. The resort is all that we expected and more. The staff is amazing - we were treated like royalty. The food was g-r-e-a-t. We ate at the Asian restaurant twice - great for sushi lovers. The buffets always had a huge variety of foods and if you couldn't find what you were looking for.... then the problem was not with the chefs! Despite what we read about the beds, we found the rooms very comfortable - we loved the great "towel creations" that graced our beds each day. A great holiday - the staff at the resort made this one of the best holidays we have ever taken. The Michael Jackson show was amazing. I would definitely return to the Riu Playacar and would recommend it to our friends. - Geri, Manitoba, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jamesyboyz
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing stay. This hotel is on the beach and your room is only between 2 and 3oo meters away. No sea front apartments though. The food was amazing. There was something for everyone. This was the best all inclusive hotel I have ever stayed at with everything being the best quality. The drinks were not just the local varieties but good quality beverages. I would recomend the resort if you plan to stay in this side of mexico. It was a great idea to stay an hour away from Cancun as Cancun reminded me of Tenerife so it was nice to go there for the day and back into Playacar. There are lots of shops just outside the resort if you fancy a browse and haggle. They dont pester you in the shops like other destinations and leave you to browse at your leisure. The excursions were very expensive but are a must. It would be cheaper by far to walk out of the hotel across the road and book them at a stall. They are all run by the same company so you dont lose any quality. On each excursion you could save at least half the price by doing it this way. It was the perfect location for a honeymoon and offered everything you could possibly want at a hotel. Thank you to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: SIJEN
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the hotel Riu Playacar, we were a bit dubious at first, having read some of the past reviews. When we arrived we changed our minds, it was the best holiday we have ever had. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly and very hardworking. The rooms were kept very clean and tidy. Unlike other reviewers we found the beds to be comfortable. The food was plentiful with a good selection. We found the beach and pool lovely .There was a lack of shade on the beach but this was explained by our holiday rep. who said the trees had been damaged by the hurricane last year. We cannot understand the negative reviews we have read in the past, these people must be hard to please. We had a very pleasant and relaxing holiday and look forward to returning in the near future. Suffolk, England.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Advokaten
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 4 mth old daughter just got back from a fabulous week at the Riu Playacar. A few words about the best and the worst parts of our stay: ROOMS: Our only complaints with respect to this resort regard the rooms. The beds are hard. We considered bringing a down top with us and regretted that we didn't. Also, the accoustics in the hotel buildings are good/bad, depending on how you see it, and we could hear everyone coming home at night. FOOD: Not refined cuisine, but very, very good! We tried the new asian restaurant and also the steak house, but both agreed that the buffets were the best. There was such variety at the buffets (which were slightly different each day) that we never felt the need to check out the restaurants at the other Riu resorts. GROUNDS: Really nicely kept. Both pool area and beach were nice. There are no parasols at the beach though, so with a little baby we stayed by the pool. STAFF: The staff is the cherry on top at this resort. They work really hard and do so with a smile on their face.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: mn101
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just returned from the Riu playacar. We had a GREAT time!!! We were down celebrating our 19th wedding anniversary. After reading some of the reviews i was a bit nervous. Once there I realized that the negitive reviews must have been from people that are well...snobs! From the moment we arrived the staff was so helpful. They do a great job. Our room was perfect, cool clean and inviting. THe beach is awesome. Plenty of chairs, (no bar service on the beach, but hey get your lazy butts up and walk a few feet to the pool bar) speaking of the pool, it also was great. The bartenders work their butts off and as far as watered down drinks...forget it the bartender always told us to tell him when to stop. If your drinks are watered down it's because the ice melted. (drink faster) All in all it's a very nice hotel. The people that write negitive reviews are apparently looking for the negitive in life. Be happy and enjoy you'll have a great time hear.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our wedding”
Reviews.Author: riubride
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from Sept 30 to Oct 07. From the minute myself and our 22 guests walked in the door we were treated like gold. The staff at this hotel work their butts off to ensure you have the best stay. The resort is a little smaller then others in the area but we liked that. It was easy to get everywhere and you never had to walk more then a minute to get to a bar, food, ocean, pool, or washroom. The grounds are immaculate and everything is kept clean. Yes the beds are a little hard but you get used to them in a matter of days. Food was great and the buffet had great selelction every day. We tried all 3 restaurants. The Mexican was good everyone enjoyed it. The steakhouse was good although I thought the meat was slightly over cooked. We were also the first group to try the new asian restaurant. Everyone enjoyed it and I think after being open for a little bit it will definatley be one of the best restaurants they have. The Decor in the Asian restaurant is beautiful. Our wedding was great and no detail was over looked. All of our guests had an amazing time and they ranged from 15-81 years old. Everyone said they would go back.

Reviews.Title: “service service service”
Reviews.Author: jeff\Christine
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say other than service service service. If you were raised on a silver spoon at mom and dads go back home because the real world is not like that for most. My wife and I stayed at the Riu Playacar for 2 weeks on our honeymoon and we loved it. I always hear people complaining when in mexico hurry up and wait because you are on mexican time. Well this is not the case if you actualy take a look around everyone works so hard its not even funny. If you get bad service you probably deserve it. Try a little tipping sometimes and quit being so cheap all inclusive dose not mean you can be a [--]. Also a please and thankyou works well if you demand they will ignore you and I would too. Anyways the rooms were plain but nice. Airconditioning was like an artic fridge. Lots of water pressure in a large shower with a never ending supply of hot water. Lots of pop beer and water in the fridge. Refilled every second day but if you run out call front desk and they will get someone to fill it. Only ever waited 30 min to get stocked up again. For extra of everything in the fridge put a little tip inside of the fridge. The beds were hard and its nice to be back in my own but still slept good. You get used to the hardness after a couple days. Food at all the restrants was good. always a litlle something different every night. But after 2 weeks you do get sick of it. The key to lasting for 2 weeks of buffet is not to always take everything you can at once. try something different each night and quit being pigs. The pool area was a little small but not a big deal if you need bigger there is a big body of water just steps from the pool its called the ocean so get off your lazy butt quit complaining and try walking 30 extra seconds. The pool area is very nice and the beach is unreal how nice it is. Never had a problem finding beach or pool chairs no one realy played the towl game. The entertainment team was great always working hard 16+ hours a day. One night one of the crew took my wife and I to the Mummbo cafe drove us in his personal car got us a table in a packed joint had a few drinks with us and did not expect anything in return I had to force him to let me buy him a drink. While down in playa we celebrated our one month of being married so the manager of the hotel booked us a dinner in the stakehouse when we arrived they had a table on its own for us with champaing on ice they baked us a cake and put congragulations on it and even had the waiters sing a few songs for us. When we got back to the room we found they had decorated it. There was ballons all over the place and fresh flower pettles around the shower around the sink and on the bed. They also gave us a big bottle of tequila with a couple little items one was an ashtray painted with the name of playa del carmen and the other was a small perimad. The rooms were always very well cleaned. All and all we had a great time and YES I would visit Riu again

Reviews.Title: “Great - we loved it”
Reviews.Author: The_Henshs
Reviews.Content: We have been to other Riu hotels in the Dominican Republic and Jamaica, and this resort and hotel has been the best so far. It is smaller than most hotels and had a nicer, quieter feel to it as a consequence. The rooms are a good size, with the usual fridge and optics in the room. All have cable TV and air conditioning. There was lots of daily entertainment including, darts, horseshoes, shooting and water balloon fights in the pool - which was great fun. If you have kids, they will love this hotel. The entertainment staff were lovely and not "in your face". The food was the usual Riu layout, of cooking stations around the restaurant, there was usually a good selection and the salads were nice. The only downside, is that after 2 weeks the food does become a little repetative and I was craving a ham sandwich or a cornish pastie! Staff service was generally good, the only slow service we saw was the pool bar. I got the impression the staff were too busy eyeing the ladies to serve. Outside the hotel is lovely too. It's in a gated community with residential houses which are apparently owned by the local wealthy, according to our tour guide. There is a golf course in the gated area, but it's very expensive. Outside this area and into Playacar felt very safe, much safer than Jamaica. I would encourage you to take a trip to X-Caret to swim with the dolphins and manatees, it was really special and was a highlight for our holiday. Cancun is only an hour away and was worth a trip. If only to go on the pirate dinner cruise, and see the enormous Mexican flag, it's as big as a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Less amenities than other all inclusives, outdated aspects of property”
Reviews.Author: denverrocks
Reviews.Content: This was a cut below other all inclusives I have stayed in. The other all-inclusive I stayed at in Mexico was the Iberostar Playa Paraiso Lindo, which was far superior to RIU Playacar. To start off, upon our arrival to the hotel, we found out that our key did not open the door to the room since the door lock was broken. When we contacted the staff, they were very unresponsive when we requested it be fixed. When it was fixed, they did not install the knob fully and the knob came off as we opened the door. We had to push the doorknob into place ourselves so it would not come off anymore. The staff was also bad in that they did not restock our refrigerator with beverages very often, and that we had two pairs of the same liquor in our dispenser, two bottles of tequila and two bottles of vodka. We were supposed to have four different types of liquor. A picture of this is posted. Our room overlooked the service and maintenance area of the Wyndham hotel next door, so our view was not very scenic. A picture of the view is also posted. Another aspect that disappointed me was the fact the hotel only had 2 ala carte restaurants, which were Mediterranian, which was very good, and a steakhouse, in which my steak had a high amount of gristle. The third restaurant, El Porche, was the buffet restaurant and it had fairly good food, although some meat was gristly and fatty. The other all-inclusives I stayed at had at least 6 or more ala carte restaurants to choose from. The property was very small, and the entertainment, activities and atmosphere were not nearly as upbeat as other hotels. The hotel was also old fashioned in that you had metal keys to enter your hotel room, rather than the plastic cards most places use, and the safe was opened with a metal key too, rather than a keypad combination. For anyone traveling to Playa del Carmen, I would recommend the Iberostar hotels. If you choose to stay at a RIU, I would recommend the newest RIU Palace that opened earlier this year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Shelley72
Reviews.Content: Went to Riu Playcar for our honeymoon and we couldn't have asked for more. The service is second to none, the rooms are very clean with fridge stocked with soft drinks, water and beer at all times, optics of rum, vodka, tequilla and gin. Two large swimming pools with light entertainment throughout the day; learn spanish, rifle shooting, darts, bingo, etc. The food was plentiful with lots of different dishes to choose from to cater for everyone. Not too many Americans (thank goodness) as they do get pretty loud but lots of other different nationalities. Very friendly staff who are always there on hand and happy to help. Went on three excursions, The Dolphin Experience, 10 out of 10, fantastic, Jungle Crossing (snorkelling in Mayan underground caves), again 10 out of 10 and Xel-Ha an eco park, which in our opinion wasn't all it was cracked up to be. Scuba diving was fantastic. Don't expect late nights unless you go into town as the entertainment in the hotel stops at midnight. (Taxi's only cost five dollars and there are plenty of them). All in all, we thought the place was stunning and are saving up to go again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great service for a group holiday”
Reviews.Author: Canadianorganizer
Reviews.Content: I booked this property for a group in Feb./06 and we were all more than pleased with our week. We held meetings next door at the Riu Palace Resort and their staff were excellent in providing everything the group required . At the Riu Playacar we were welcomed by the friendly staff and our group dinners were reserved in advance by the Banquet Manager who was more than eager to satisfy all requests. The food was very good at all dining facilities and we enjoyed the evening stage entertainment and quickly learned to arrive early for seats as they were a popular event. The pool area is lovely to relax around and if too crowded you can always find a lounge on the beach right beside the hotel. The beach has lots of great sand to enjoy long walks and the exchange privilages with the other Riu neighboring properties provide a good variety for lunch around a different pool. I would certainly recommend this property and the Riu Palace to anyone!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun but if you are looking for Up-Scale Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: DallasTXTravelers
Reviews.Content: I love Playa del Carmen. The beaches are unmatched in the area and Riu Playa Car could not be positioned any better. The hotel is right in the middle of everything. Great beaches, town only a $5 taxi away, not terribly far from the airport. The only warning I will give is this hotel is what you pay for. I felt like I was on spring break the entire time. I was given a plastic bracelet to wear all week long so the hotel could keep up with me & also for security purposes. You have access to the Tequila as well (don't let your travel agent tell you the Palace is available for lunch & dinner purposes because this is not true). There were only 2 real places to eat at night other than the buffet- which was not bad at all. The steak restaurant was your traditional lean steak with lean flavor. The mexican restaurant was something I could get off the buffet but with a fun, less crowded decor. The staff is fun and very helpful. Almost every staff member I encountered was more than happy to help me with my Spanish and visa versa with their english. If I did not have a clean room or towels or a restocked fridge at the end fo the day, someone rushed right to my room to fix this. Tipping (as anywhere you go) helps with your quality of service. Night life is very active at this resort. The Tequila has a great disco open til 3 am. There is also a clubhouse with pool, shuffleboard & foozeball- open 24/7! The Riu has shows & liquior dispensors in the rooms every night. One night the Riu even brings in local vendors: jewelry, clothing, souvenirs. However, the rooms & atmosphere at Riu is average. I did not receive nearly the type of cleanliness, upscale accommodations & attention I have received when staying at much nicer resorts in the past (in the same area). The foyer sets the tone of the rest of the resort. The resort has no air conditioning other than in the guest rooms (which isn't great). Most of the guests feel free to pick up (AND put back down) buffet food with their hands and/or shove you out of the way in line. If you are looking for a Spring Break type atmosphere: the Riu Playacar is your place!!! This place was fun but expect what you pay for. I love TripAdvisor. This site helped me plan my vacation. I knew ahead of time exactly what I found when I arrived on my vacation. Since this site was so helpful to me, I wanted to help others planning their vacation with my honest review.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: ria1234
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for 3 nights with my daughter thru Apple Vacations. We have previously stayed in the Riu Cncun and Iberostar playa Maya. The hotel is clean, not too large, and the staff is very friendly. The beach is great, but could use some palapas for shade. The pool was clean and not too crowded. Many topless europeans there. I only used the buffets, which had a nice variety of foods. my daughter went twice to the kids club and had fun there too. Overall, a family friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Riu 'The Best'”
Reviews.Author: babsinthehouse
Reviews.Content: What a great experience at the Riu Playacar. August is blisteringly hot in Mexico, but that aside the staff of this hotel went beyond the pale in making sure we were comfortable and had a good time. Five of us travelled, 3 adults and 2 almost adults (23 & 26 yrs old). The hotel offered enough variety to keep us all entertained. In particular the entertainment staff were amazing. I've never encountered such hardworking, friendly young people in my life. They left you alone if that's what you wanted and encouraged you to join if you showed a bit of interest. Lots of variety all day long. The food was first class. We tried the reserve only restaurants but always returned to the buffet. The rooms were very nice, but be aware of 2 things. Nothing stays dry there (humidity) and don't leave ANY food in your room (lots of tiny, tiny ants). I would return here in a heartbeat. Oh, by the way, if you do get sick in Mexico you best have traveller insurance. It is blindingly expensive to receive medical treatment (cash on the spot). I landed with a case of pneumonia and my husband fell and injuried his back ($1,000.00 USD). By the time we were diagnosed and medicated. Expensive but very professional and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “All my worries were for nothing”
Reviews.Author: Girls4fun
Reviews.Content: 4 females (Two 40 year olds/ Two 19 year olds) returned Aug 19 from 1 week at the Riu Playacar. Perfect smaller resort with the use of larger Yucatan and Tequila resorts. We read many reviews before booking so thought we'd better do our part to add to this helpful site. Our opinions are based on having stayed in many AI resorts throughout the Carribean. In the Mayan Riviera area we have stayed at the Barcelo, Bahia Principe Akumal, Copacabana, Gala and El Dorado. Transfer to Resort - Smooth and uneventful Check in - My compliments to the front desk staff. Very quick and accomodating. On arrival we asked for our rooms to be next to each other and as close to the beach as possible, which they were gladly able to do. (Bldg #5 third floor was great) Beach - (always our first priority) was gorgeous. On the same strip as the Gala and in our opinion the best area. Never a problem getting beach chairs for the four of us. Our one pet peeve was the people who created their own shade by unending a second chair to create an personal umbrella. The resort could use some palapas for shade so this wasn't such a problem as it sure takes away from the views if you're not in the front row. (Lots of topless sunbathing if that is an issue for you.) (Lots of boats and a very busy beach.) Beach Activities - We took sailing lessons and found the staff informative and easy to understand. The younger two in our party had a blast on the banana boats, boogie boards and parasailing booked at the beach. They also booked through the resort for the dolphin swim, sailboat cruise and snorkelling and had a great day! Pool - Looked great but we aren't pool people so can't really comment. Tons of activity in the afternoons and all seemed to be having a lot of fun. Was not over crowded and there were always lounge chairs and shade available when we passed by. Pool Bar seemed to be a hit in the heat of the day. Food - Buffet included lots of variety including fish, seafood, chicken, pork, beef, pasta, pizza, varied Mexican dishes, salads, vegies, fruit, desserts............the usual. More selection than many we've been to. We had no problem finding something to eat. There is an open air section in each restaurant so we could always be outside. Servers were attentive and we even got a few napkin folding lessons. Rooms - Beds are as hard as rocks. If that's a problem they have blankets and mattress pads available and I would request one and save your back as it does help alot. The fridges in our rooms were well stocked and any requests for extras were filled immediately. Phones worked without issue which isn't always the case in Mexico. Maids were great, sheets and towels changed every day. FYI there are blowdryers and alarm clocks in the rooms. Bars - 4 females had no problem getting drinks prompty and premium liquor was the norm. We found the bartenders entertaining and joined with them to create some real fun. Nightly show - Tried to attend one show but didn't last so can't really comment on them. They were always well attended so couldn't have been too bad. Staff - We found that every smile or "Hola" to the staff was returned. There was no problem with speaking English and if you were polite they went out of their way to help you. We did witness some very rude people that didn't get very far with that approach.........We just stood back, snickered and thought good for you. Grounds - Beautiful, clean and well kept. And in that heat you couldn't pay me enough to work that hard. Shopping - There is a bank and a dozen or so small shops right across the street from the lobby. Exchange rates are better than the resort offers. Store prices are typical resort prices but handy if you forget something or don't feel like going into town. Clientele - More Europeans than Americans/Canadians during the time we were there but not sure if that is the norm. Weather - We do not usually travel to Mexico during our summer months but with University students it was the only time we could go. Would I recommend it?? You bet!! Hot is great no matter when you go. The humidity didn't bother us at all. FYI - Our other notable excursions we would highly recommend. Took the ferry to Cozumel (45 min ride) and rented a jeep ($55 usd for the whole day) to tour the island. Great fun without the hassel of being on a tour. We snorkelled and saw pools and pools of fish including baracudas, swam in the crystal clear waters on the east side of the island where the beach is totally untouched. (A MUST SEE) The Blue Parrot Restaurant - Playa Del Carmen Serves a variety of food and great wines but their sushi is the best we've ever had anywhere........and we've eaten A LOT of sushi. The restaurant itself is a wonderful experience with individual treehouses over water pools. Located right on 5th Ave near the north end. To check it out before you go check out www.blueparrot.com (under beach club and dining) They also have a cool "on the beach" nightclub and hotel down on the waterfront. Hope this helps even one person to make their decision easier or reduce the stress of a decision already made. No worries, be happy, everything will be just fine!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: andrea9179
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, just returned from a week-long vacation at the RIU Playacar Resort in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. Everything about the resort was great. Our room was clean and surprisingly very cool. We had two queen beds and although the mattresses were firm, they were comfortable. The shower was nice and had great pressure. The mini-fridge was stocked with bottled water, corona, pepsi, 7-up, and orange soda. It was restocked every morning when the room was cleaned. We also had 4 liquor dispensers in our room with tequila, vodka, gin, and whiskey. Other amenities - ceiling fan, safe, two tables and a chair, t.v., extra blankets, dresser, and phone. An iron was available upon request. The resort had 4 different places to eat (two restaurants and two buffets) and 3 different bars. The steak restaurant and mexican restaurant required reservations. Reservations were made the morning of at the breakfast buffet next to the front desk. Reservation times were 6:45 p.m. or 8:45 p.m. The food was excellent at both restaurants. The food at both buffets was good as well. They had all kinds of great mexican dishes as well as hamburgers, hotdogs, french fries, fried chicken, salad bar, soup, fruit, vegetables, ice cream, pasta, pizza, etc... The cooks did a great job of keeping the buffet tables clean and full of food. The buffet by the pool also had a snack area with nachos and cheese, popcorn, and coffee. There was a small bar by the front desk, a larger bar (that usually opened in the late afternoon/early evening) by the two restaurants, and the pool bar. The pool was nice, especially the swim up bar. The pool as well as the lounge chair area was very clean. There was at least one person at all times picking up empty drink glasses or sweeping the concrete around the pool. The lounge chairs with shade were usually taken by 8 or 9 in the morning. But there were plenty of available chairs in the sun throughout the day. Water aerobics was offered each day as well as all kinds of activities around the pool (dance lessons, bingo, volleyball, soccor, ping pong, etc...). The bar drinks were good...especially the frozen drinks made with real fruit. Corona is the only beer available. And for those of you who like Southern Comfort like my husband, that's not available either. The beach was amazing...by far the best beach in the area. It had the softest sand and wasn't crowded like Yucatan Resort beach. There was always a chair to grab, even in the middle of the afternoon. There were plenty of motorized sports available like jet skiing, parasailing, banana boat, etc... We also had access to the RIU Yucatan and RIU Tequila Resorts. The Tequila was across the road from the Playacar and the Yucatan was a short five minute walk. We were able to eat at their breakfast and lunch buffets, as well as order drinks at the bars, but we didn't have access to the dinner restaurants. There was also a nice shopping area across the road from the Playacar. It had jewelry, swim suits, sunglasses, T-shirts, pottery, picture frames, etc.. Overall, the experience was wonderful. We would recommend this resort to anybody interested in visiting the Playa del Carmen area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Fantastic Holiday.”
Reviews.Author: gemmaelizabeth
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from two amazing weeks at the Riu Playacar and I have to say that I'm shocked at some of the comments that have been made about this fantastic hotel! The hotel itself is spotless and well cared for. Our room was lovely, cleaned everday with new sheets amd towels, the flowers etc left by the staff are a lovely gesture. The mini bar is restocked every 2 days but if you run out of anything, just ring reception and they'll sort it for you (if you can't wait for it to be delivered then you can collect it yourself from reception!!!) The reception manager rang our room many times to check we were ok and if there was anything they could do for us. There was plenty of food and a wide variety, again the staff were extremely helpful and you only have to ask nicely and they'll sort you out!!!!!! Yes, the restaurant does get hot at night but if you locate yourself under a fan you'll be fine...(what do you expect when there's cooking going on!!!!!) The bar staff were fantastic, we only had to show our face and our drinks would be waiting...I can personally recommend the Cosmopolitan!!! Again, if you ask you can have imported brands. There are two pools, one with the bar and a quiter one which is where we based ourselves. There is always a variety of activities going on to suit everyone and the animation team work hard to keep you entertained...if you don't want to participate there's no hassle either!! The pool was cleaned several times a day but you can't stop leaves falling from the trees!!! There are plenty of sunbeds, though it can be difficulut to find a place with sun and shade. There are big huts which is great for the shade but not so good when you want to sunbathe. There was no problem with the towels, you could change them several times during a day if you wanted!! Overall, I am unable to falut this hotel. All the staff work exceptionally hard to look after you, you don't have to tip them but they certainy deserve it. I had a super holiday and would go back in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: nickati
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar outstanding!! We just got back, 07-29-06 from a one week stay at the Riu Playacar, and boy it was great. I had read some other reviews and some people did not care for it, I have been going to Mexico for over 15 years, Cancun, Akumal,Cozumel,& Playa Del Carmen. One thing to remember when you are there you are on Mexico Time, Slow down and enjoy your stay, If you are not happy go to the front desk and ask for a change of room they will do thire best To help you ,But remember the hotels are always booked. To get back to the Riu I had a great stay the food was outsatanding and the beach, Well what could I say GREAT!!!!!!!!!! I will be going back and We my wife and me Truly were taken by the calm peaceful and wild pool games Soon. nickati@comcast.net Nick & Kati

Reviews.Title: “Not a riu fan but was ok”
Reviews.Author: Veeke
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in April 2005. I'm not a huge Riu fan but my friend eventually persuaded me. Check-in: Was smooth. Dutch girl at reception gave us all the information we needed; location of restaurants, opening hours, etc. Room was available right away. Room: Our room was ready and was ideally located near the pool (light blue building). Didn't notice a musty smell. The bathroom was a bit odd with no door but a curtain instead. I like to have the choice between bath and shower which was not the case here. I thought the room looked a bit dated. The beds were firm but I had no trouble sleeping in them. Restaurants: The buffet restaurant was nice. Food was hot and tasty. It gets a bit repetitive after a couple of days but what else can you expect when you are in an all inclusive resort? If you want variety and Michelin star food go to a 5star BB and eat à la carte. Getting reservations for the speciality restaurant was quite an ordeal. Eventually got one for the steak-restaurant. Was good but nothing to be wowed about. We never had the chance to try the Mediterranean restaurant. They also should consider making it a totally non-smoking restaurant. Bars: Cocktails were below average. Have been to Iberostar in Cuba and DR and unlike here cocktails that ought to be made with coconut milk had actually coconut milk in them. As 2 single girls in their late twenties we never had trouble getting waited on rapidly. However, we did notice that some people had to wait quite some time to get drinks. Pool and Beach: Both were clean. Never had trouble finding a lounge chair by the pool. Being able to find one at the beach (in the shade) came close to a miracle. Entertainment: Daytime: darts, water volley, bingo, soccer, beach volley,... . If you don't want to participate they won't hassle you. I was able to read by the pool without being bothered too much. Night time: Went to almost every show. Before the actual show the animation team organise funny games. They do try hard, and its quite entertaining in an American pie sort of way. The shows performed by the Riu ballet are entertaining. We saw Chicago, Michael Jackson show,... . They also invite outside groups who bring you the history of Mexico in an amazing show. We also went out with a couple of guys from the animation team but it was just not our kind of bar. I have nothing against cockroaches, they have a right to live, but I just don't want them near my drink. Went to the disco at Riu Tequila a couple of times but the music was old and boring. If you have a couple of drinks you might have fun. Maybe we were just too tired because of jetlag. Excursions: Xcaret: Fantastic! We swam with dolphins and it was worth every dollar. Have bought magnificent DVD of this fabulous experience. Would do it again without hesitation. We also swam in the underground river which was a very refreshing experience. There is also a small zoo. At night there is a show which shows you the history of Mexico, the different national dances,... Mayan adventure: Was great. Don't do it if you are not the adventurous type and if you are acrophobic. Chichen Itza: A must. Don't miss it! Protect your head as it is a HOT place to visit!!! Guests: The people who visit this hotel are mostly Americans and Canadians. For the Americans who have a problem with nudity, didn't see too many topless women and thongs. For other Europeans: didn't have too many problems with Americans. We were particularly fond of that one American (George) who was as gorgeous as the real George Clooney. ;-)) Some Americans were loud and didn't have any education but that was just a small minority and some Europeans are no better so just try to get along. What bothered me most was that there were loads of people who carried jugs around with their favourite alcoholic beverage as from 10AM on. Hellooo, can you spell alcoholic. If you want to get drunk, fine with me, but don't bother others because you are a lousy drunk. Didn't pay too much so all in all it was an okay trip but next time I'll probably go to an Iberostar.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for a Wedding”
Reviews.Author: AmandaL
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding here in June 2006, with 43 of our friends and family. It was a wonderful place for a beach wedding. The wedding coordinator and public relations manager were extremely helpful. The location was beautiful and perfect. Our family and friends all had a great time and found something they enjoyed doing while on their trip - from a 10-month-old to my grandmother. This is a rather small resort, which was perfect for a group to get together and not feel lost in a big place - you were always able to run into someone you knew. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And the towel art was adorable in our rooms every day. The only negative is that we like to sleep in and almost every day someone would come to clean the room or replace drinks or something - we learned that if we hung the do not disturb sign on the door when we went to bed at night, we were not bothered the next morning. The beach was awesome, and the pools were relaxing. We watched the basketball playoffs in the sports bar at the Riu Tequila (which is included with your armband), and we took cabs every other night into town to find local places to eat. (We walked the first night, but took cabs after that.)

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky Marketing, boring food, Very Average!!”
Reviews.Author: Moose513
Reviews.Content: We chose Riu Playacar because on the website it stated "We serve domestic and imported beverages" We thought Great we can get american beer! Wrong. When we got there all they had was Corona on tap. When I asked the mgr. he said well the liquor is imported and laughed at me! We arrived on Sat and by Mon night our fridge (water) had not been restocked. I called the desk & was told someone would bring water by between 7-9 p.m. 10:30 and a knock on the door we are awakened with the water boy! The first a.m. an employee just walked right into our room without knocking! Imagine our surprise. Luckily we were still covered up under the covers! The buffet food is very repetetive. We found the trash cans around the property to be overflowing most of the time. The pool was dirty by noon with trash floating in it and the swim up bar was not large enough to accomodate the size of the resort. The GOOD things about this resort were the beach was Beautiful! There was never a problem getting a lounge chair. The steak house restaurant was excellent. The room was clean and did not smell bad. However, we had so many problems with Playacar that I insisted that we be moved to their sister property the Riu Palace. It was like moving from a tent to a motor home! I guess it is a lesson learned in you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding at the Riu PLayacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got married at the Riu Playacar on Monday, July 3rd at 4:00 on the beach and it was absolutely perfect. I was a bit nervous because the coordinator did not communicate much before the arrival at the Riu. I had to coordinate as much as possible on my own and put the details together once I got there. I did not know what exactly to expect, but the Riu went above and beyond my expectations to met all of my wedding needs. The resort itself is beautiful- the most immaculate and lush landscaping I saw at the Playacar hotels (I walked through several.) The beach is gorgeous and pool with swim-up bar was a great place for my 37 guests to get to know each other. The food was great in the buffets- there was a huge selection and the menu changed every night I was there for 8 days. The service was the best part. From the time I stepped on the property, the entire staff knew I was the bride (guest of honor) and made us feel like celebrities. They truly have fun with, and care about, their guests and were able to make my dinner reservations to my requests for both the rehearsal and reception dinners. The wedding coordinators are wonderful and made sure to get the flowers, cake, music, etc. that I wanted. They even contacted my DJ ahead of time to give him my song list and he burned a bunch of music for me. They also got me a hurricane and other needed supplies. The best part for me was the photography. I was weary of having to use their contracted photographer, but Julio Paredes and his wife, Monica Luciano, were absolutely amazing. They stayed with me for 5 hours through the dinner and dancing. I purchased the largest package for $990 and they created and entire DVD video of the ceremony, a slide show with music of 400 photos and printed all 400 photos out for me in an album. Not only was their time and care appreciated, but the quality of their photos was stellar. Every shot was breathtaking and I am so happy to have this documentation of the event. The only thing that is too bad is that the hotel takes 1/2 of all their income as a commission. Be sure to tip them extra under the table, becuse they deserve it! The staff at the front desk worked hard to accomodate many small needs. They upgraded us to a suite for free and gave us another room to just sleep in at night when our AC was not cooling down our room enough. The Entertainment team was hysterical and the nicest bunch of people you will meet. The housekeepers work so hard and keep the rooms spotless- give them a small tip and you will get cute towel animals on your bed. Overall, the wedding was picture perfect, and all 37 guests had the time of their lives. We will definitely be back and I would recommend the Riu if you are looking for a destination wedding. Please feel free to contact me at nmeyers@vt.edu if you have further questions about getting married here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed just returned from a week at the Playacar and found it charming. The rooms were very clean, although the beds were a bit too hard for us. The food was wonderful, anything that you could think of they had, plus the wait staff was so friendly. The one thing that I was personally disappointed in was the fact that the beach didn't have a single unbrella or thatched unbella that other resorts have offered. We hope to visit again soon! KB

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar-heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can i say about the Riu. It was an unforgettable experience. Definitely the best vacation i've ever been on. Beautiful resort, beautiful beach. AMAZING staff. The waiters and staff in general always made us feel at home. The animation team made the days AND nights unforgettable. Delicious food. Great customer service. By the last night of my vacation, i did not want to go back home. I am currently back in toronto planning my next vacation to the Rui Playacar! SEE YOU SOON MEXICO! ; ) -Yan & Yet, Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: blonde1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Riu Playacar and I have mixed emotions.There are some good and some bad comments.(I had stayed at the Royal Porto Real in February for a couples trip, this was a family vacation.) Pros: Small resort, easy to keep up with the kids Seems to be kept clean Bargain price Cons:No room service!!! I can't believe no one else ever mentioned this fact.This is HUGE for my family. We loved having fresh coffee delivered in the mornings,or late night snacks.(also no little coffee makers in the room, or irons either.) No BATHTUBS!! Also can't believe no one has mentioned this,especially people with small children!! Rooms musty,yes, I know all rooms in Mexico may smell a little this way, but the mold around the air conditioning vent was Gross. Also killed multiple mosquitos inside the room, and we did not leave the doors open!! Lobby bar atmosphere-awful, not comfortable or tropical, bright and loud. Food choices are lame!!! My largest dissapointment overall was the food services.Only 1 place for lunch every day same exact food(outside by pool). Only 2 ala cartes(really just 1 location for both at the lunch location (OUTSIDE).Buffet is okay, but same food EVERY night. No beach drink service, no beach bar, only 1 pool bar, always crowded. Having said all this, we did have a good time, but this is my analysis: This is a good BASIC BARGAIN AI, but that is it!! I can't imagine going back here when there are so many more choices in AI's that offer so much more in all areas for about the same price. BTY, would recommend the Royal Porto Real to anyone,although it is in a totally different price level!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just returned from a one week stay at the Rui Playacar, and it is by far one of the best hotels we've stayed in, definatly 5 star! Dont believe any of the bad reviews, some people are far too negative! No need to get up early for sunbeds as there were plenty on the beach spare through out the whole day. Staff were always friendly, always wanting to help. Hotel was spotless, staff cleaning 24 hours a day! Rooms were basic, minibar refilled every 2 days! and food was amazing, so much on offer!! Overall was an amazing holiday, best all inclusive ever!! Miss it already :o(

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: LacrosseMother
Reviews.Content: Four of us just returned from the Riu Playacar. Since two of us have visited Cancun, we did not know what to expect from Riviera Maya. Upon arrival, we checked into our room, checked the grounds out and of course the restaurants. Just by eating lunch, we knew that we were going to be happy with the meals. Loved the Riu Playacar. The rooms were big and spacious and always clean. Never smelled a musty smell the entire time we were there. The crew there from the reception desk to the bartenders to the entertainment staff were excellent! Always made us laugh. Shows were good and entertaining. The bartenders were very polite and pleasant. Say hi to Miquel and Spanky (Lobby Bar and ask for the Kelli drink). That seemed to be my daughter's favorite, but still don't know what it was, but she said it was very good). Miquel made Kelli her drinks and they were very good. Weather was perfect, had about 30 minutes of rain in 2 days. Pool was very nice and not crowded. Beach had plenty of lounge chairs. The Steakhouse dinner was great. The ribeye steak seemed to be our favorite along with the ribs. They give you plenty of food so you won't walk away hungry. I enjoyed spending my time at the hotel. Didn't need to really go anywhere else because they kept you entertained. Went to 5th Avenue for a $5 cab ride, but wasn't real impressed with the Carlos and Charlies there (no way did it compare to the one in Cancun). Shopping was okay, but enjoyed shopping more in Cancun. Overall, I had a great time and would return in a heart beat. Daughter likes more of the nightlife scene which we didn't find there. Went out one night with the entertainment crew to the Mambo Cafe. It was okay, $27 for entrance and open bar, but would only allow you rail drinks. Couldn't get anything special. The band was good and kept everyone dancing and then the DJ would play when they went on break. The Riu Tequilla has a dance club there, but when we went there, it was Karoke night, and no DJ for dancing. Not knowing what to expect from the reviews I have read, I was glad that I went and enjoyed every minute of it. JJ, Fred, Adrian, Sergio and Cesar kept you on your toes. Try the salsa lessons, lots of fun. There is plenty to do right at the resort, so you don't have to leave for fun. Drinks were good and meals were good too.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Video Treasure Hunt @ RIU Playacar on July 5, 2005”
Reviews.Author: BuenaVida
Reviews.Content: We had our beautiful & unforgettable wedding ceremony & celebration @ the RIU Playacar on July 5, 2005. I reviewed more than a handful of hotels and travel provider in Playa del Carmen and after all my searching, I chose the right one. I knew the Mayan Riviera was the perfect place for us to get married and I would highly recommend a beach wedding to anyone think'g about it, especially @ the RIU Playacar. Wedding photographer took amazing photographs..."if anyone knows anyone that was there during the week of July 5, 2005 and by destiny happen to record our wedding ceremony, please, please contact me ASAP as a video of our moment is priceless to us and we would love it if by some crazy chance u or someone u know might". There was a great crowd of guests sharing our moment with us and a handful of videographers surrounding us...it was great. Check out our pix! The RIU chain and name is a guarantee for a great location and good food. All the important factors that make an amazing vacation. The accommodations are clean and comfortable, food was delish-nice variety every evening. We had our wedding dinner at the Steak House of course. The set-up and food was perfect. If I had to do it all over again, I wouldn't change one thing! Swim up pool bar was quite the spot for those wanting to take advantage of the free Coronas and variety of drinx available. The beach is exactly as you see it in the travel brochures-clean and soft beige white sands, picture perfect turquoise waters and subtle waves to enjoy for everyday your there. No complaints at all! If your not just a Beach Bum, the Mayan Riviera has endless things to see & do both day & night. Take a 5 minute cab ride to 5th Avenue for amazing shop'g boutiques, a day trip to Cozumel for unforgettable snorkel'g, eateries & shop'g, excursion out to the Mayan ruins of Tulum, try to go swim'g there too (don't go to Chitzinitza-too far & no beach), if your willing to spend more than US$50-$100-check out the many one-of-a-kind eco parks in Mexico like Xel-Ha, Xpu-Ha and Xcaret, for those that like their Tequilas & Coronas for partying definitely take the crew with you out to downtown Cancun-if there is one disco u go 2, it has to be Coco Bongo (u can also bring ur camera too-just don't 4get it there after all the drinx). Coco Bongo is US$45-entrance, a great show and all u can drink if u can make it thru the crowd to the numerous bartenders. In btween the week u can also party it up at the RIU Yucatan disco, only a 2 minute walk or crawl from the RIU Playacar-yes all u can drink here too & if u get out of the club on time u can enjoy BBQ munchies to soak up all the tequilas too. Honestly, if I could only go to one place every year, I would choose Mexico-Cancun or Playa del Carmen. There is soooo much to see and do thru all times of the day...and most of all if you love your turquoise waters like I do...Mexico is the place to take a perfect vacation, and maybe have a perfect wedding! If anyone has any questions regarding the resort, especially planning to get married @ this resort, please do not hesitate to contact me. Btween the family & frienz with us for our wedding we have over 2000 pix and would be happy to share some more pix of MX with you ;)

Reviews.Title: “We gave Riu Playacar a B+”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rui Playacar from 5/25-5/28. We arrived at the hotel 6 hours late due to being mysteriously bumped off our flight in Mexico City (We will never again fly Aeromexico). Back to the hotel... Our check-in process was quick and simple. Our room was beautiful. The first thing we checked was our bed (two twin beds side by side) for bed bugs. Our bed checked out okay. The A/C, lights and water were all working properly. The pool was great and not overcrowded. The bartender at the pool bar had my drink ready to go within a few minutes regardless of the time of day. The beach was also great and not overcrowded. We easily found chairs/recliners. We did notice that the hotel did not serve drinks on the beach. The restaurants were fantastic. They provided a variety of food to suit everyone's appetite. Every night the hotel provided live shows. Grease was our favorite. The staff was outstanding in every respect. No complaints here...As for internet access, the hotel has a small room with about 6 PC's. It's not free. It cost something like $6 dollars for 30 minutes. We recommend taking a tour. We did the half day trip to Tulum. They gave us a guided tour of the Mayan city. Also, we spent an hour on the beach. It looked like a scene from the movie castaway. We enjoyed having the ability to visit other nearby Rui (Yucatan and Tequila) hotels and having the same access as Rui Playacar. Rui Yucatan blew us away when we saw monkeys in the trees... Really cool!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar Gave Us the Bext 2 Weeks of Our Life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Riu Playacar is heaven. My husband and I were there from May 20-June 3rd, 2006. From May 20th-27th, we had 66 guests join us on our trip for our wedding in Mexico that week, and we stayed by ourselves for a second week for our honeymoon. The hotel staff - especially Natalia in public relations - gave us a stellar welcome. Even though our entire group arrived before check-in, within an hour of arrival, we had all settled into our rooms. My husband & I received a free upgraded room, over looking the pools and the ocean and the theatre, as a special gift for getting married. The rooms were gorgeous, immaculate, and the cleaning staff did a wonderful job. Everday we had a new little animal on our bed made out of towels and blankets. It was a very nice touch. Every day was fantastic - the entertainment crew was an amazing group of people. Israel, Fred, JJ - thank you so much and thank you for your friendships.
