And thanks guys for also reinspiring my husband & I to take up volleyball again! Every person in our group - ranging from ages 10 to late 70's - had a wonderful time. The main pool with the swimup bar was alive and energetic, however the other pool was quiet and we could curl up for a nap or read a good book. Water was clean, great temperature, plenty of shade available around the pool. And the bartenders were amazing, thanks especially for Alberto's special drinks! The beach was lovely. Plenty of lounges available. Water was beautiful. The food at the resort was to die for. The only problem was that all the buffets gave us TOO MUCH to eat! The service from all the waiters and waitresses was excellent. We ate at both of the a la carte retaurants - Steakhouse and Meditteranean - and they were delicious. This was out dream wedding, dream vacation and dream life come to fruition! We are already planning our 1 year anniversary trip back to Riu Playacar next year with our troop!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks at the Riu Playacar. We had a fab holiday we went with our 4 year old. She could of done with more company her own age, however the animation team and the childrens reps could not of done more to make her have a happy stay. We loved the Riu Playacar and felt really sorry to be leaving. The rooms were excellent we certainly didn't have any bed bugs. Our room did smell a bit musty the first night but once you were in there for a day you either got used to it or it got better with fresh air circulating because of the fan and opening and shutting the door. The food was excellent and I would say it only became repetative if you weren't prepared to try something different. The animation team were excellent and worked extreamly hard I did not find them to pester you to do the entertainment they would just ask if you wanted to do the activities and if you said no they went on there way I never felt pressured once and would strongly disagree that this hotel was like "Butlins". The Riu Hotel band were- well what can I say they made me cry I don't think I have ever laughed so much they really should stick to salsa numbers Bridge Over Troubled Water and Eric Claptons- You look Wonderful Tonight were just too much !!! The mini disco well my daughter loved it and I think the animation team deserve a medal for doing that every night. The beech was lovely, white sand and fantastic blue and terquoise sea. In fact the only thing I found disapointing about this holiday was Thomson our tour operator. The planes need some rows taking out and some seatback tvs putting in. I feel that thomson are a very greedy company especially their trips they wanted to charge us $270 to go to xel-ha we ended up paying $160. (they wanted to charge $70 for our child whos entrance was free!!!) I think if you are booked to go to this hotel you will have an amazing holiday if you are thinking of booking go ahead I am sure you will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow!! I have stayed at over 20 all inclusives and for the money by far this was my best experience! the food at the buffet was incredible with many options that were all recognizable and tasted good. No one in our group got ill or sick in any way. The service was perfect at every turn. I can say nothing negattive about my stay. I strongly recomend that you stay at any of the RIu resorts along the yucatan pennensula!! I also dove one day and saw some incredible reefs!

Reviews.Title: “Very good as usual.”
Reviews.Author: Xebeche
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in Riu Playacar. First time we visited it in 2004, so I can evaluate the damage Wilma hurricane did to Playa Del Carmen/Playacar villaghe and Riu Playacar and particular. I can say that damage in resort areas is not as significant as I have expected. It looks like thay have fixed everything by now. Some palms have lost few leaves, several bushes ,which formed a good shade in 2004, are not present, but in general it is still same good old Riu (and Playacar village). By item: 1. Food. To me food is great. You have a pretty simple choice for a dinner: a buffet and a restaurant which requires a reservation. Some people here complain about a necessity to make a reservation. Well..It will take you about a minute if you wanna do it:) Food variety in a buffet significantly exceeded our requirements. Wine is bad practically everywhere in Mexico, so it is bad in Riu. There were a lot of other kinds of good alcohol other than wine. 2.Rooms. Very clean. Beds are hard as in every hotel in Mexico. However it is not that hard that you can't sleep well after many hours of activity. I didn't notice musty smell other reviewers complain about. Before going to Riu I read a couple of reviews regarding bedbugs and decided to talk to Riu management. Here is their reply: "We have read the same comments on the website, but we did not received any complaint here at our hotel. For your information we have been through all the rooms and have not found any bedbugs at all. The whole hotel is desinfectated every month and all the beds as well as the bedsspray's are desinfected as well. We have a certificate to show you if needed." NO bedbugs. NO any traces of bedbugs. I am well familiar with these insects. 3.Service is more than just great. Mayan people work very hard. 4.Pool. Personally I hate pools so I didn't even try a temperature of water in it. Pool's area looked rather crowded, it is true. However most "pool" people looked pretty happy anyway. I can say that those who looked unhappy are unhappy anywhere in the world. Staying unhappy is their life motto. 5.Beach. It is gorgeous. _Plenty_ of extra sunbeds, since most guests prefer swimming in the pool rather than in the sea. Shade is poor, but people manage to build nice "cabanas" using two extra sunbeds and a towel. You'll figure how to do it out pretty quickly after arrival:) However, it would be nice, if management could provide guests with sun umbrellas. It doesn't cost a lot of money, but it makes a lot of sense under Mexican sun. Alex

Reviews.Title: “Really missing the Riu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Riu from May 20 - 27th. We had a fabulous time!!! The food was great, ate mostly in the dining room, and once at each restaurant, the steakhouse and meditteranean.......the rooms were clean, didn't really notice any musky smell as others have indicated, as long as you have the ceiling fan circulating it's fine! The service was great, all the bartenders, waiters and front desk people were very helpful and friendly...... The nightly shows were good, the 2 best nights were the dancers, they put a lot of effort into the show! We took a $5 US cab ride to 5th Avenue, which could have also been a 20 minute walk....if you want to see miles and miles of shops, cafes, and authentic restaurants, check it out... Took advantage of the canoeing, sailing, tennis, volleyball that was offered on the beach... They have photographers that take your picture on the beach, and then post it in the lobby between 5pm -9pm, with your choice to purchase or not....this was a great idea, bought a few photos, especially the one with the iguana on our heads.... The beach was gorgeous, always plenty of chairs, were beach lovers and not fans of the pool, so it was really relaxing, especially when you just want to lie back and read a book, however if you want action, music and activities then the pool is your best bet.... Weather wise, it was pretty cloudy all week and it rained all day our first day there, which was slightly disappointing, however the animacion staff ensured they provided games and activities to keep our minds off the weather! One last thing that would have been nice to know was, they actually have a shower stall in the lobby bathrooms, we checked out at noon, but our bus didn't pick us up until 4, so it would have been nice to know that we could have showered before our departure, instead of using the cold showers by the pool.... All and all it was a really good relaxing trip!!!!!!!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Back Butlins”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a holiday full of screaming animation red coats and tightly packed pool to pool sunbeds along with the" we will not leave you alone" attitude this is the place for you. Save yer money..blow it all in Butlins and you will have a better holiday (and the whiskey is genuine Scotch).

Reviews.Title: “Sunbed hell”
Reviews.Author: lilyk_7
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two week holiday to the Riu Playacar all inclusive hotel in Mexico. The hotel was very nice, the rooms were clean and the staff worked hard to keep the hotel looking good. The problem we did have with the hotel is the overcrowded pool area and beach, the sunbeds were reserved very early in the morning by guests, you had to get up a 8.00 am to put your towel on a sunbed, otherwise you wouldn't get one The beach area was a little better, but still busy and with not much shade. The evening shows were good, the animation team kept everyone busy in the day with bingo, volleyball, dancing lessons etc around the pool, which made for a noisy busy pool area, not conducive to relaxing with a book. There's not much to see outside of the hotel, except a few shops within a few minutes walk. The nearest town of Playa del Carmen is a half hour walk away or a 5 dollar taxi ride. If you want a holiday where you can relax by the pool then avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i miss it already- Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and my friend are are in our 20's and we enjoyed our stay very much. We mostly stayed on the beach, which was great, very pretty & clear! The food was very good, differnet tasting than american, texan american more specificly, but good. Oh yeah they do only have one kind of beer, corona. The staff was the best part of it all, we really enjoyed hanging at the bar and getting to know everyone. Spanky, M. Angel and others...(george, he's got such a great smile) the waiters in the restrant are fun too are all great at what they do. Over all, excluding the heat & bugs, it was worth every pretty penny- bring bug spray, and don't bother dressing up for things your hair won't stay cute for very long!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: bcangel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 8 nights at the Riu Playacar. The room and the hotel grounds are very clean and the staff is great. The pool bar was fun and they had activities there most of the day. The beach started having erosion 2 days before we left, almost a 2 foot drop down to get to the water. Also, the sand was infested with sand fleas. We and bunch of other guests had welts all over our lower legs from the bites. The food is great and there is always alot to choose from, however the meats were always cold. We had to have them throw our burgers and chicken back on the grill to get them warm. The nightly show was good, however the Riu Tequila across the street has a show that we thought was much better. The Tequila opened a new sports bar but beware, it is filled with 10-17 year olds all the time drinking their virgin drinks - definitely not a place for adults to relax and watch the game and have a drink. Spend some time in the lobby bar, Alex is great and Benjamin at the pool bar is terrific. All in all, we had a good time. We would definitely go back if it wasnt for the 2 hour AppleVacation bus ride it took to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time...beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Can_we_go
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to Playa Del Camen area about 10 times in the last 4-5 years. Every place I've stayed has been wonderful, each in it's own way. The Riu Playacar was a very nice hotel for the money. I've stayed in better looking rooms but you pay more too. The grounds are lovely, food was wonderful, room.....just OK, but that was OK with us. If you want 5*, stay and pay for 5*, if you enjoy beautiful surroundings, good food and fun, then this place fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, great resort”
Reviews.Author: Kelly90210
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at the Riu Playacar. Went with 3 friends all in our late 30's, and we had a blast! The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and accomodating. The Playacar does not have as many restaurants and amenities as the other Riu hotels, but it is close to the beach, and we enjoyed the more intimate atmosphere. The beach was never crowded, and it's a short walk to the pool/bar area and the hotel rooms. The food was great! Always a large variety to choose from at the buffet. The fruits and vegetables were fresh and tasty. The buffets were better than the Steakhouse and Meditteranean restaurants. All in all, this was a great resort for Mexico. I'm surprised to see negative reviews about this place....it's Mexico...you have to expect musty rooms and hard beds. That's just part of the Mexican charm!! The beautiful beach, spacious and clean rooms, extremely friendly staff, and fabulous food more than make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice-but listing not accurate”
Reviews.Author: Heartland
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Rui Playacar April 27th, had a wonderful time, beds are hard, but liveable, rooms were cleaned every day, beware of bugs, I got bit up, but my husband did not, made a lot of wonderful new friends. Only complaint I really have is the drinks and food, we were told there was international beers-not true, all they served was Corona, on tap in the bars, they did have bottle beer in the rooms which was nice, but one of the reasons we did pick this resort was because we were told they had international beers, they did not! Restaurants-the steak house was terrible-only three or four dinner choices, you could not order what you wanted, we ate the buffet after that, that was very good, different choices every night. When they say food available 24 hours a day-this is not true! Would have like to be able to order a sandwich-all food available was buffets. You can use the other hotels, but they have the same menus. Overall though, we did have a good time-beach is absolutely beautiful and we loved the pool-get your chairs early!

Reviews.Title: “NOT Staying Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Playacar and I wish I'd read the reviews before I went. My biggest complaints are as follows: 1. Musty rooms with cheap and soiled sheets, towels, showercurtains. 2. Beds as hard as wooden planks 3. nylon coated bedspreads with cigarette burns on them 4. STRONG chlorine smell coming from water in the shower. 5. Mildew in the corners of the shower. 6. Bedbugs! 7. Drinks served in plastic reusable cups, no larger than 4-6 ounces 8. Bottom shelf liquor, one choice of beer (Corona), really bad do-it-yourself coffee machines 9. Limited choice of restaurants, the two on this property were actually in the section where the lunch buffet is served in the afternoon, divided in half , (Mediterranean and Steakhouse). Both had limited menus (4 choices) and were far from what you would expect in a 5 star resort. Not worth the trouble of booking in advance. 10. No spots in the shady areas by the pool unless you wake up at 6:30AM 11. No spots for shade on the beach as most of the trees were damaged by hurricane. 12. Beach was pretty, but the water was really wavy....good for surfing , not swimming. 13. I could go on and on....overall, if you like being part of a herd, with low expectations, then go to the Playacar. If you work hard, and expect a little more from a vacation...find somewhere else to go! Its a shame that they bill this resort as 5Stars, especially with the Riu Palace 2 doors down. There is obviously no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - Check for bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Came for a wedding. The price seemed kind of steep, so I figured I'd indulge on the all-inclusive food & drinks. The buffets were the same everyday and mediocre- much of it seemed pre-packaged/frozen, with some good authentic choices. The staff was great, wonderful bartenders. Our room was decent except for my first and unexpected bedbug infestation I only realized at the end. I've travelled Europe and Mexico and never thought to look for bedbugs in a place like this! Considering what they seem to be paying the staff (not much) they sure try to take advantage of tourists. The two options for dinner that you must make reservations for were mediocre at best. The seafood side was ok, even a culinary open-minded person would find the mix strange and/or unidentifiable. I was hoping to get my money's worth with crab and lobster- none. The steakhouse looked so promising, but they bring the food out at the same time for everyone and so you'll never get it cooked at the temperature you asked. The beach was beautiful. I liked the mix of many Europeans as well as Americans. In the end, a good experience with a great staff but no delivery on what they appear to promise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had the best time ever! They have great food, entertainment, a beautiful beach with plenty of chairs. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. The RIU Playacar is only approx. 45 minutes from Xel-Ha Park, Xcaret, & Tulum. We did Xel-ha & Tulum. Xel-Ha had great snorkeling for fish, but did not have the coral that you can see in the ocean. Snorkeling at Xel-Ha was easier than the ocean which is great for beginners. It also has other things to do when you get tired of snorkeling. The Play del Carmen town is much nicer than Cancun. The vendors will heckel you to come to their store, but once you are inside, they leave you alone and allow you to browse without pressure from them. We have stayed at the Moon Palace which is north of Playa del Carmen, and south of Cancun. The only advantage with the Moon Palace is the mile long lagoon pool, but the beach is not as nice at the Moon Palace. If you are a beach/ocean type person, the RIU is the better choice. We had 6 kids with us, ages ranged from 12-17. All had a great time, they felt safe at all times, and we were comfortable letting them wander about the complex to enjoy themselves. The Playacar is also smaller, which made it more convenient to all events, dinners, and pool/beach areas. It also made it easy to find people in your party when you needed to. If you prefer a larger pool, the RIU Tequila is a short walk from the RIU Playacar, and has a nicer pool, but is not on the beach, so the pool area fills up fast. You are able to use the Tequila, Yucatan, and Playacar with the all inclusive wristbands. Given the choice, the RIU Playacar is the place to go with family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Breakers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the 7th time we stayed at the Riu. Either the Playacar or Tequilla. This was the first time we encountered "spring Break" kids. The resort was perfect as always. Food good and beach beautiful. Two groups of high school kids were there. It became obnoxious at times. Drunk kids in lobby, shouting and hollering in the early hours of the morning. A very relaxed dress code in the dining room. The worst of it was the foul language. This has always been a "family" resort and the four letter "F" word was flying. No doubt the "breakers" are only there for a few weeks in March so it should not reflect on the resort. Great place but be cautious for booking in March.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Stewie3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RIU Playacar at the end of March 2006 and had a great time. In 2005 we were married there. We had a room on the top floor which was kept very clean. The maid service was excellent. We would go down to breakfast and by the time we got back, our room had been made up already. It helps to run the fan and the air conditioner-that takes care of the must smell when you first arrive. Food was good-however my husband and I did get sick the last 2 days there but in 2005 we were fine and did not get sick then. So.....it could have been anything! Entertainment team was excellent. Always trying to get people involved but took no for an answer if you didn't want to join in. We also ate at the Steakhouse. EXCELLENT! A great place to go outside of the resort is a cave bar in playa del carmen called ALUX-pronounced (aloosh)You will not regret it. It is an underground cenote. You can have a drink or eat there. Bring your camera. It cost about a $4.00 taxi ride from Playa del Carmen. There is a website for it but I don't remember

Reviews.Title: “Loved every second of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Karen_ThunderBay_ON
Reviews.Content: Mexico and the Riu Playacar were more than we could have hoped for. We were told the best time to go was in March, and the weather did not disappoint. We were a group of 6 adults. The beach and ocean were beautiful. Played volleyball on the beach and took several walks to view the other resorts. There are always empty loungers on the beach throughout the day although there is not much shade. There is no bar service on the beach but we had no problem walking up to the pool bar to get our drinks. The pool and swim up bar were great. The loungers by the pool go fast. We only sat by the pool once as it is quite hot by the pool (we all preferred the beach as it was a lot cooler because of the breeze). We were always able to get a towel at the pool in the morning. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The beds are very firm but we didn't mind. The rooms do smell damp at times but this is because of the hot, humid weather. The drinks were wonderful and I think we tried every drink known to mankind. The food was excellent. I can't understand why people complain about the food. There are only so many things that can be added or changed in a buffet. The dinner buffet had a different main course every night. On our last night we had turkey, mashed potatoes and gravy. The steak dinner was exceptionally good - ate there twice. Yes, you do have to book this dinner in the morning but we were up by 7:00 a.m. every morning anyway so this wasn't a problem (didn't want to waste time sleeping). Had breakfast at the Yucatan and the Tequila while there. The food at the Yucatan didn't seem to be as good and is a much larger resort. Food at the Tequila seemed comparable to the Playacar but there are more families with children. Went to the disco at the Tequila as well, but it was jam packed with teenagers on spring break so needless to say we didn't stay. We were quite pleased with our decision to stay at the Playacar after seeing the other Riu's. The nightly entertainment was great and gave us something to do every night. The entertainers put in countless hours each day, are very hardworking and very friendly. We purchased a phone card from our travel rep. at the hotel but to use the phone card you had to go to the shopping mall across the street and use the pay phones. Finally figured out how to use our cell phone on the 2nd day. Our cellular service is with Rogers and it worked great. Took a taxi to Playa del Carmen ($5.00) several times, went parasailing, swam with the dolphins, the guys went deep sea fishing, saw the ruins at Tulum and took the ferry to Cozumel. There is so much to see and do in Mexico. After having read so many negative reviews on TripAdvisor about the Playacar, we were all a little nervous about whether or not we had picked the right resort. As it turned out, we picked the BEST resort. I would go back in a minute and we all hope to return next year at the same time. I must say that the only thing I missed was a good cup of Tim Horton's coffee in the morning and at night. My advice, just relax and enjoy all that Mexico has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Riu Playacar and had a great time. The food and entertainment was fabulous! We spent a lot of time at the pool and beach and participated in a lot of the activities they had available for us. If you want a spot at the pool that has an umbrella, you better get to the pool before 6:15 to reserve your spots. We spent an evening or two across the road at the RIU Tequila because they have an air conditioned sports bar with the internet available. We really enjoyed the evening shows they had. One night was comedy night and the other shows were professional dancers. The staff at the resort was always helpful and polite. The only thing I didn't like and it won't come as a surprise it you've read any reviews is the rooms smelled musty and the beds were like rocks. I did like the fact that they had a lot of American tv stations for us to keep up on what was happening in America. One other thing I didn't like was you're only choice of beer was Corona and nothing else. I will go back in a heartbeat. pg

Reviews.Title: “good times”
Reviews.Author: Ktown_girl
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday and our group had a great time. We went for a wedding and it was beautiful! The staff are great! We all thought the food was good. The only complaint was the room. Not terrible but it had a plumbing problem. We had to cover the shower drain as it had a bad smell coming out of it. There is a nice shopping centre across the street and you can go into town for $5.00 in a cab. We did that a couple of times. We never even used the other Riu resorts as we were quite content at the Playacar. I would definately go back. If you can't have a good time here you are too fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Beachbums83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Playacar February 10th through February 15th. We had a blast! The Playacar is average to above average accommodations. The staff and service we received were excellent. The bartenders, Nelson, Edwardo and Carlos were great and entertaining too. We enjoyed the beach everyday. Great loungers to lounge on. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was excellent all day long, every day. Too much to choose from. The other Riu properties were very close by and we had access to most of their facilities as well. We did walk through them but did not "use" them. The newest one, the Palace, was very grand. Of course, being brand new helped, but we felt it was too much for us. We enjoyed the more casual, friendly atmosphere of the Playacar. We did not hardly see anyone while walking through the Palace and their beach area, while the Playacar was one big friendly smiling face, with enough room for privacy. Yes, do walk into Playa Del Carmen (about a 30 minute brisk walk) to the shops on 5th Avenue. We opted for a taxi ride back ($5 USD). Would go back tomorrow if only I could.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu Playacar (march 18th) and had an absolute fantastic time. The Playacar is very clean and safe and the staff are abosulutly fantastic. We have travelled to several all inclusives and I can truly say the staff at the Riu are number 1. The rooms did have a woody smell, however as long as you kept the air and fans running, it disappeared. I think you have to expect this with the high humidity. We ended up in an end room in the second building (right in the middle of the resort) and we had a true kingsize bed. It was a little hard however we never had a problem sleeping. As far as the drinks go, the slushy drinks were all good and all you have to do is ask for the premium stuff and tip a little and your drink is ready for you as you approach the bar. For those who enjoy a dark beer they have it on tap, you just have to ask, and a dollar bill every once in a while goes a long way. The food was pretty good also. Breakfast and lunch were also great and dinner had so much to choose from, if you planned it right, you could eat something different every night. The steak house meal was excellent as well, but did not have time to try the other one. The entertainment staff were quite enjoyable, and tryed to get everyone involved throughout the day, Bingo at 4:30 everyday was a blast. If you go to this area, you have to go to Playa del Carmen. What a neat place with lots of shops and tons of restaurants/bars to enjoy. If you want to barter for some goods, go off to the side streets off Fifth Ave., as they are more than willing to barter. All in all our trip was fantastic, but would rate this resort a four plus, not a five star resort. We did enjoy the size of it, as it is small enough you got to know the other guest's and staff very well. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone, and was a bit apprenhisive after reading the last couple of reviews, but see for yourself, for the value, this place was great.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: WIRelaxed
Reviews.Content: RUI PLAYACAR is all right but not a great hotel. There was nothing terrible about it but nothing great either. halfthe rooms are on the back side of the hotel. Ask for a room looking out on the walkway. Our backside room looked over the service area of another hotel with hammer, welding, jackhammers, noisy buses all day long. Our room was not made up until 3 P.M. every day. I did not care for the food. All the salads were very heavy in olive oil. To get a lounge chair in the shade you had to reserve it with a towel by 7 A.M. That said the hotel was clean and the pool and beach were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with 2 other couples just returned from Riu Playacar (March 3-10). We had a Blast!! We arrived at the resort at midnight and were given three rooms side by side as requested. We stayed in the Green Building on the ground floor. We liked the location because it was close to the 24 hour lobby bar (where we spent most of our time at night)and the breakfast restaurant. The rooms did have a musty smell that we had read about from previous reviews, but if you keep the air conditioning on it's not as bad (but we needed the extra blankets). The walls are also pretty thin. There was always lots of bottled water in our bar fridge, so no need to worry about water. But the water temperature in the shower was hard to control, it seemed to be either really hot or really cold. The power also went off in the room a few times. The staff at the resort were really great. There were always people cleaning and the main desk called twice to make sure everything was okay with our room. Although, the lobby never had any change(1 dollar bills) for larger bills, so bring lots of 1 dollar bills if you plan to tip. There are NO RULES at this resort, we could do whatever we wanted (like go swimming in the pool at 2am the night we arrived!). The drinks were good with lots of variety (Banana mama was my favorite) and no long waits to be served. Alex and Antonio took great care of us at the Lobby bar. The beach was amazing, so beautiful and warm...better than the beaches we had been to in Cuba and Jamaica. And we never had a problem getting 6 loungers together on the beach. However, it was harder to get loungers at the pool, but we usually ended getting some. There was a photographer on the beach who went around and took pictures. It was neat, because there was no pressure to buy them. The pictures would be set up in the lobby each day after 5pm ($6.50) for each picture. They turned out really good. If I had to complain about something, it would be the food. It was the same thing every night and I was surprised that there were no Tacos served. The pancakes at breakfast were the best! We thought it was weird that the supper buffet didn't open until 6:30 and lunch was over at 4:00. So from 4-6:30 there was only cold snacks. It was also annoying that you had to book the Steakhouse restaurant the same day and quite early (7-10am). But the steak meal was excellent. There was lots of activities during the day and hardly any children around. The nightly entertainment was pretty good. I liked the interactive activities with people from the audience. The Michael Jackson show was good too. We went to the Disco (at Riu Tequila) a couple of times, but it was small and stinky. It was fun to walk to the other resorts and have a drink at different bars. The Yucatan also gives out subs after midnight at the bar! There is shopping right across the street from the Resort with some great stuff. We also took a cab ($5.00) to Fifth Avenue where there is 30 blocks of shopping and Restaurants/bars...lots of neat stuff...a good place to go for unique gifts and souveniers and most of the people will bargain with you. We went on one excursion to Coba. It was worth every penny ($104 US). We left at 7:30am and went to the Coba ruins where we climbed the tallest ruins, swam in a Cenote (underground swimming hole of fresh water in a cave-really cool). Then we went on a Zip line and did Rapelling, took a canoe ride and walked through the Jungle to see some monkeys. I was worried about seeing snakes in the jungle, but thankfully we didn't see any. The weather was perfect..hot and sunny everyday. The last two days it was windy and the waves were huge on the beach. It was fun to ride the waves, but all the water sports were closed due to the winds. Overall, we had a fantastic time. One final warning, be careful about bringing back wood. We bought a wooden mask on 5th Avenue and when we arrived back at the Halifax airport, they took our mask at Customs! They said there were bugs in the wood and it would have to be destroyed!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: kimsmith5
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5...2 adults, 3 kids so we booked 2 rooms at the Playacar. Read all the reviews so kind of knew what to expect. Yes, rooms are musty and even with the A/C they stayed musty. Rooms look pretty crappy at first glance. I even sought out the PR manager to tell her that first impressions are everything. The bedspreads are really bad and my first impression on walking into the room is "This place is a dump"...But... its really not. I was worried about the beds but we all slept fine even though they are hard. Rooms were clean but bring your own shampoo and conditioner...they provide tear open packets of shampoo and shower gel (no conditioner and no lotion) We did enjoy the food choices. The Mediterranean specialty restaurant was just average however. The Steak restaurant was pretty good. You have to grab pool shade early because there just isnt' enough shade. Beach was calm most of the week which disappointed us because we like some wave action. Then on the last day when it was rough they wouldn't allow boogie boarding or swimming...but you can't control the sea. We did walk through the other Riu hotels. The Palace was big and beautiful. The Yucatan was big and more casual. We liked the size of the Playacar due to the fact that several times a day we are running back and forth to the room to retrieve stuff. At the other 2 Rius' its quite a hike...at the Playacar it was much more manageable. I agree that if you are looking for a 5 star the Palace fits the description physically...it would have been too big and inconvenient for our needs as a family. All in all we were happy with our choice even though there aredefinitely things they need to work on.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But”
Reviews.Author: beachboy4550
Reviews.Content: Just got back. First the good. Great weather, beaches, and I liked the food. Waitstaff in the dining areas great. Food was well prepared, beautiful, and bountiful. Shrimp risoto,seafod Paella, good fish , chicken, pork, Great pasta bar, fantastic ice cream. Wonderful fruit and juices. The Michael Jackson Night was great. Good impersonator, good dancers. Now the Bad. This is not a 5 star hotel! For an all inclusive, this was our first one, only one beer, Corona, Booze was bottom shelf stuff, real rock gut. No diet drinks in the fridge, had to beg for them. No Tonic to mix with the gin or vodka. Had to beg for it. The beds are hard as rocks and the pillows are foam rubber pancakes. I'm used to the Marriotts superb down pillows and comforters. Little ammenities like a shower capp for the wife aren't there. Room was cleaned daily, but sheets changed every other day. I'm still not convinced that we didn't have bed bugs. I wouldn't go back to RIU or recommend it to my freinds. Also NO drink service o the beach or the pool area. I think waitstaff should available in these areas. We never saw one. Finally, the pastry chef knows how to make things look grand, but taste like cardboard.

Reviews.Title: “Try the RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: 1sttimerinCancun
Reviews.Content: Overall, trip was wonderful. I picked the right place as far as the beach is concerned. We walked all up & down the beach in Playacar and we had the biggest beach by far. That was very important to us. The room was very nice and there was no musty smell that I read about so much on Tripadvisor. The RUIs are very energy conscious, so the rooms are alittle warm when you first get in them, but once you put the fan and A/C on it's fine. If you open the balcony door the A/C automatically turns off and if the rooms aren't occupied all electricity to that room is off. The mini-bar was full stocked but the liquor in them isn't top shelf - but if you aren't picky I guess it's fine. They restock the mini-fridge every other day and it includes large bottles of water and soft drinks. The bathroom has a hair dryer and each day they provide bath gel and shampoo. Towels were soft and fluffy. A nice touch is that the toilet is in a private area with a door so if someone is using the bathroom the other person can use the shower/sink/etc. 2 Double beds and yes they were alittle firm but we both slept really well. The bar in the lobby is alittle too small but we would go up every evening and it was fun talking to people from all over. My husband is a beer drinker and he drank Corona on tap the entire time. We couldn't think of any place around here that has Corona on tap. I sampled all sorts of drinks and they were plenty strong and not made with cheap liquor. There was another Corona tap down by the beach in the Turquesa restaurant so even if the couple bars were crowded he could go there and grab a beer. The breakfast buffet was the best meal. Lunch was also good. The 2 sit down dinners were fair. The steak dinner was better - the steak was very good. The mediterrean restaurant was lousy. We walked out and went up the dinner buffet. That wasn't the best either but from what we gathered talking to a lot of people - most of the food at the all-inclusives is just fair. Lots of activities and my husband played volleyball every day - which he loved. The waves were great, but the water was alittle cool (I thought it would be alittle warmer). Flights were great - on time and I was very impressed with USA3000. They kept giving us food and drink the entire time. They also showed movies both ways. We visted both RUI Tequila and RUI Yucatan. We liked the Yucatan alot, but their beach was not as nice as ours. We would never stay at the Tequila, since you have to go to one of the other resorts to get to the beach. Another nice advantage of the RUI Playacar is there is a very nice little shopping mall right across the street. All sorts of little shops and outside vendors on cobblestone pathways. We went over there and shopped a couple nights.

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Peach117
Reviews.Content: We went in April of 2005 and it was the most awesome experience. The hotel, the grounds and the entire staff were wonderful. The food was probably the best I have ever eaten, much better than my last cruise. I will definetly want to go back if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: sgalla
Reviews.Content: We (two co-workers and myself) just got back from Riu Playacar. It was a dissppointment. We had stayed at one in Cancun two years ago and we were very happy. Felt safe to go to another one. The rooms smelled very musty. So bad that it infiltrated my suitcase and I have had to wash EVERYTHING. They DO NOT have wait staff by pool or beach. Even at the crappy hotels you would have someone to wait on you by the pool. The food was VERY bland. We were sick of it by day 2. It was the same every meal, every day. My friend set the alarm clock every day for 6:00am to make sure we could have chairs by the pool. You had to physically go down to the resturant every morning by 7:00am to make reservations for their resturant for that night. I don't know WHY you couldn't call. Never got an explanation. There are 2 bars; one in the reception and pool area. Very small. We finally went over to sister hotel, the Tequlia and thought it looked a lot nicer than our hotel. There food was the same but looked and tasted so much better. We could not visit the Riu Palace Riveria Maya. You were not allowed to even walk through. You could only have breakfast or lunch at sister hotel, not dinner. And the beds were terrible, ROCK HARD. On the plus side, the staff was very nice and helpfull. And it was very CLEAN. Thank God. Bottom line, we would NEVER, EVER stay there again. One more thing.Every day they had activities around the pool. They absolutly insisted putting hugh speaker right behind our heads and turned it up loud. I have NOTHING against music, I love it. But when it is 1 foot behind you and blaring so loud that you can't talk unless you shout, its too much. We were nice, we asked if they could move it to a neutral spot several times. They refused. It was so bad that every time they walked away from the system, my friend would get up and unplug it. Usually it would take about 45 minutes before they would come back and plug back in. She did it 3 times. That provided some entertainment value. Our advise: Even though it is not on the beach, we would stay at the cheaper, better Tequlia the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Won,t go here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip was 2/21/2006 thru 2/28/2006. Our stay was okay. The food was good, but the room was horrible. As soon as they opened the door, the smell of mold/mildew greeted our senses. The tile floor was always wet and we woke up every night soaking wet! We complained at the front desk and they put a blanket under our sheets. That was our best night sleep. It makes me wonder if they were wet from the hurricane like it got rained on and never can dry because of the humidity there. Also, I think mosquitos were breeding in there. They were buzzing around our ears at night. One morning I woke up with 3 bites on my foot. As for the beach..it was nice but the palm trees lost all of their foilage from the hurricane. Just tree trunks with sprouts of new leaves coming out. So don't go there looking for shade! You'll have to get to the pool early for a thatched umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding service at Riu Playacar -Bride Review”
Reviews.Author: BellaTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at the Riu Playacar in January. I'll start off with the positive, Funjet was great -our travel agent was wonderful and got all 30 of us there without a hitch. The bartenders,bellman were always wonderful and helpful. We did enjoy the food and the beach. The property is nicely repaired post-hurricane, very clean- flowers and vegetation look good. There is some construction going on next door. The hotel customer service was less than desirable- front desk staff specifically, very rude at times. Unfortunately we were there for our wedding, and the wedding service coordinator and staff were very uncoordinated and did so much wrong and then would argue with us and tell us we had not requested those items. Brides BEWARE!!! The Riu Playa del Carmen has one wedding coordinator for all of the properties and they are running 3-4 weddings every day, so lots of stuff gets forgotten, our orders were basically forgotten -they gave me 14 chairs for 28 guests???? Didn't have the flower petals for the flower girls, The wedding coordinator didn't even show up on our wedding day, her assistant did and she didn't know what was going on, luckily my wonderful husband was able to recognize the things that were going wrong - as I was in my room getting ready and couldn't double as a bride and wedding coordinator. It's too long to list all the things that went wrong, preacher showed up 30 minutes late, the hotel doesn't even bother to arrange area surrounding ceremony, I have topless vacationers in my Wedding Photographer $400 pictures. The hotel does not deliver on the items listed in the wedding package. I tried to do some follow-up with the hotel post our wedding/vacation and their response was a bunch of lies and excuses as told by the staff there. If you are looking for a basic vacation, Riu playacar is okay, the beds are really hard but other than that it's a decent hotel. However I wouldn't recommend using Playa Riu properties for your wedding. Playa is so beautiful and there are so many other hotels that offer wedding packages-Riu wedding services were SOOO disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The resort has a great layout and a nice atmosphere. The lobby bar is open 24/7. Food wasn't spectacular, but breakfast and lunch were good and convenient. Only a 5 minute ($5) cab ride to downtown Playa del Carmen for some great bars and restaurants. The beach area and pool areas were outstanding. Many of the resort "activities" were pretty cheesy, (water aerobics - pretty sure one of the instructors was a gigolo posing as an aerobics instructor, but another was definitely giving the group a good workout)but guests seemed to be having a great time. Rooms weren't spectaculur, but suited the purpose. Have to be careful of hard beds, thin walls and musty smelling rooms. Once you turn on the air, the musty smell subsides. Even with my negative comments, I would consider this resort again as it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned 2/23 from 7 nights at this wonderful resort. I, like many others, am always scared to go to someplace new not knowing for sure what you will find when you get there. Our trip was fantastic. We were there with about 12 other couples and had a fantastic time. The hotel was clean, yes the beds are hard but we slept well every night. The buffets had something for everyone. Most exciting was the beautiful pool and unbelievable beach. This hotel is perfect in size,not being so busy,likes others we visited. What topped it off was the genuine hospitality from the staff, what a great bunch of people - made the trip even more fun. Hope to go there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Mexicotrip2006”
Reviews.Author: fortpark
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to the Riu Playacar. It was our very first time to Mexico and we stayed at the Riu as it was recommended by our travel agent. It is a small hotel, no more than three stories high with around 300 rooms. No elevator, however staff was very accommodating when luggage had to be moved. We had been reading the reviews prior to going to the Riu, and we were not disappointed when we go there. The beds, were hard, however, we did not mind. You cannot use the water from the taps but bottle water was provided, along with drinks in the mini bar. We did find it very damp in our room, which was on the third floor, with a partial ocean view if you leaned over the balcony. The bed sheets were cleaned very day however; the bed spreads should also be maintained and cleaned more regularly. We would retire early and found that noise was sometimes excessive, mainly from other guests coming in from a late night. You could hear the entertainment going on in the area that it was being held, even with the doors to the balcony closed. However it stopped around 11:00 pm. The winds at this time of the year were strong, and various times had to move to the pool from the beach to get out of the strong breeze. The food was very good, and we ate heartily for two full weeks. The drinks were not watered down, but had plenty of alcohol in them. The place is beautiful, very well kept, staff always kind and thoughtful. Management went out of their way to make you comfortable. The security was good, as we noticed security around at all times. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for something small. I found the access to shopping, within a twenty five minute walk or five dollars American for a taxi. Hotels in the surrounding places were too large for us so we were happy at the Rui. Other individuals who were staying at the larger facilities wished they would have also picked the Riu. .

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Southern Delight
Reviews.Content: We, along with another couple, spent Feb.3rd-10th at the Playacar and enjoyed this resort. Getting there was another thing. We booked through Sunquest and flew CanJet airlines. That was a big mistake. We were to fly out at 6:15pm but did not leave until 8:40pm with no explanation for the delay. Once in the air, we were told, due to head winds, we would have to land in Charlotte North Carolina to refuel before heading on to Cancun. We finally arrived in Mexico at 4am. It took a long time to get things processed at the airport as a few flights arrived at the same time and not many working at that hour. We finally arrived at the resort, again due to the late hour, no welcome greeting which is understandable. We went right to bed due to exhaustion at 6:40 am. Considering it to be a 5 hr flight and no storms enroute, we were not impressed with the airline. No entertainment at all on the plane and one stewardess insisted I leave the blind up where I was sitting at the window so as to see out of in case of an emergency. I have travelled many times but never encountered that!! We cannot say enough about this resort, however. Very clean, food was fabulous and people were friendly and helpful. They couldn't do enough for us and for that we were thrilled to tip them well. I would go back to this resort in a heartbeat. They go the extra mile to help you. I needed to phone home and our rep. sold us Mexican phone card for 24 minutes - $10.00. I used a portion of it and saved the rest to use at the next resort we were going to. We could not get a two week booking at this resort when we booked in October, so we had to move on to another resort closer to Tulum. Now that resort does not come near the RIU Playacar. And, I could no longer use the Mexican calling card I had purchased. We found at the Playacar, the maids were continuously cleaning. Not so at the second, resort. The bathrooms at the pool at the second resort were seldom cleaned and actually to the point of being disgusting. There was no working soap dispenser and only 4 small cakes of soap for everyone to use. You would not see this at the Playacar. Little things at the second resort, made us feel it did not rank the 5 star as advertised but the RIU Playacar is tops!!! Bar service is another thing. More than one person working the bars at the Playacar so no waits, whereas the second resort, we more often than not, had to wait in a long line as there was only one bar tender. We made sure we tipped him well and gave him Cdn t-shirts, socks, and a cap besides for his efforts. Basically it was too short staffed at the second resort but not at the Playacar. I think more people should consider this resort as it is not highly talked about as the others. You will love it. By the way, you can charge your digital camera at this resort, not the second resort we went to. I am not a demanding person, nor do I look for things to complain about. But this two week trip cost us $6200.00 and we expected the same service in both resorts but found the second week was serverely lacking. Both resorts are gorgeous but if the service is not there, something is wrong. Would we go back?? Definitely to the Riu Playacar. I do know it would take a miracle to fly CanJet again!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was great!! ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Riu Playacar on Wednesday night, could have stayed longer. It is a small resort, but big in accomadations. The STAFF was wonderful, the drinks were wonderful, the rooms were wonderful, the beach was wonderful, the ocean was wonderful, the snorkeling was wonderful... DID I MISS ANYTHING? Questions, you can email me, or if you want to see pictures. wolfupnorth@yahoo.com Cherie from Michigan

Reviews.Title: “We'll be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: We just got back (Feb 18th) from 1 week at the Riu Playacar with our children (12 & 7). I was not sure what to expect as it was our first trip to Mexico & an all inclusive resort. Our travel agent recommended the Playacar and we could not be happier! The flight down on Skyservice was a little cramped but thankfully we are not tall so this was not an issue for us. Customs at the Cancun airport was quick and courteous, the bus ride was a little warm (I think the A/C was not working well but hey, we were in Mexico and not back home in -20 deg. weather!). We were greeted upon arrival at the Playacar with cold drinks and smiles, check-in was quick and painless. Our original room was located on the ground floor, I asked for a 3rd floor room and was easily accomodated. The room was clean and faced the central walkway with a view to the Carribean - nice! The overall quality of the room was good, the A/C worked well although we liked to sleep with the window open a bit for fresh air & to wake up listening to the birds singing. Cleaning staff were prompt and always available for any special requests, Joel did a great job! The food was fantastic, for the quantity they served the quality was outstanding, always a nice attention to detail (fruit carvings, ice sculptures, etc...) Our favorite was the breakfast buffet, the warm rice pudding was always on my list for breakfast. The staff were incredable, always smiling & helpful, even if they didn't understand english they would do what they could to help (reminder we are in Mexico!) The entertainment staff went out of their way every day, the activities and shows were terrific, special thanks to Sergio, Luis, Erik & Isreal for keeping our kids interest during our stay! My wife had her birthday during our stay, no mention was made to the hotel or staff and on her birthday, a 1 litre bottle of Agave, a fruit basket and note from the staff arrived at the door to both our suprise. To top it off, we reserved diner that night at the steakhouse restaurant (great steak!) and the host and servers showed up with a cake and a song for my wife. Talk about going out of their way! The beach was beautiful, the effects of Wilma have been reduced to new growth on the palm trees! The grounds are manicured and spotless what more can I say... We'll be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ive had on vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: toronto289
Reviews.Content: I recently went to the Riu Playacar and i had an amazing time. I found that it was great for all age groups. I went with people in their 30s\40s, mid 20s, late teens, and children ages 8 and 10. We all agreed that this was much better than any other vacation we have had in the past. The entertainment staff (animacion team) were all great, they really got you into the activities, but did not push you. The shows were very well put together. We especially enjoyed the ones with the audience participation. The entertainment team were all very sweet and were very quick to learn your name and to get to know you. We always felt incredibly comfortable and welcome. There was quite a selection at the buffets, the only problem that i can think of is that it was not changed up very much during the week, but there was more than enough selection to have something new each day. The food at the a la carte restaurants is amazing! the steaks were some of the best ive ever eaten, and the fish was incredibly fresh and tasty. The beach was amazing, beautiful white sand and clear blue water. There were a few people selling jewellery and cigars on the beach, but they did not bother you at all in fact they stayed out of your way and let those who were interested come to them. There is also a great selection of activities for everyone. There is a variety of sports, as well as things such as ping pong and darts. The guys who run these activities are also eye candy for the ladies. I am just hoping to be able to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “A Great week”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Mexico and before we left we read all the reviews on the Riu Playacar resort. After reading some of them we wondered if we were at the same place. We have stayed in other all inclusive hotels so here is our personal impression. We had a wonderful week. The hotel is smaller than the other Riu Hotels there, but that is what we loved about it. Close to the beach, pool, the main lobby and dining. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to provide great customer service. The food is good and yes, it does get alittle repetitive by the end of the week but that is typical of an all inclusive. However, everyday they added something new. The variety is awesome and you will always find something you like. Try some new things. If you walk away hungry it is your own fault. I am still missing all my fresh fruit for breakfast! The rooms were clean and you would always find towels made into swans ect. on your bed. Nice touch. Yes, the beds are hard. We put extra blankets on the mattress under the sheets and that helped. I slept fine. The pool area is beautiful with lots of chairs- kids were no problem. If you want to avoid kids go to an all adult hotel like Secrets. The swim up bar is nice. The ocean and beach are beautiful. It looks like the pictures. The town of Playa del Carmen is a lot of fun and a 30 minute walk or a taxi ride for four people for $5.00. Make sure you go- and eat when you are there. There are many good resturants. There are many excursions you can take- book them at the hotel. We went snorkeling for the day at a national park and had a lot of fun. This was one of our most relaxing vacations and we would absolutly go back and stay at the resort. Not one person we met last week or in our group had anything negative to say. Keep in mind that you are visiting in a different country with a different culture. It wont be the way you do things at home nor should it be. How boring!! If you want to have a relaxing vacation at a nice resort, with friendly, warm people then this is the place for you. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Mexican hospitality at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: MexicoChica
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on what we read on this very site and we were not disappointed. Though no hotel is perfect, and this hotel does have a couple of minor negatives, we thought the positives far outweighed them. First of all, I have never experienced service as attentive, friendly and fast as I have at this hotel - Mexico or otherwise. Every staff member we encountered had a cheerful hello and a smile. They ALL seemed to enjoy their guests and their work. In fact, the 2nd day that we were there the front desk manager left us a gift and a note letting us know who he was and where he could be reached should we need anything. He even called our room that night to make sure we were happy with everything! We thought the grounds were beautifully maintained. There were 2 pools - both very large. One was quiet and peaceful, the other a little more lively with a swim-up bar, music and activities. The rooms were spacious and very clean. There was a musty smell - common in Mexico and very obvious to those of us coming from other climates. I noticed that the smell was very strong depending on the humity. On the days that weren't quite as humid - we didn't notice it at all. The mini bar was re-stocked every 2 days and you can't beat the booze dispensers! (see photos from other guests) The sheets weren't exactly soft, and neither was the bed - another common Mexico occurance. The beach had tons of chairs and a small hut with 4 massage tables. I did notice a bit of beach erosion from the hurricane all over Playa - not just at our resort. But, if you've never been there before, however, you wouldn't know it. We still enjoyed VERY long walks on the beach. Plenty of room for everyone. The food overall was very good. I'm not normally a buffet fan, but I was VERY happy with the selection and the made-to-order quesadillas, tacos, and pasta bar etc. There was a very wide variety of choices and they change it up most every day. It's rare for an all-inclusive to have good food - but this one does. The dinner at the steak place was wonderful! The only reason they insist on reservations is that it is a 4 course meal that requires quite a bit of prep. Yes, the drink cups are small, but our group purchased insulated mugs from a gift shop near by and the bartenders are more than happy to fill them with whatever we wanted! They keep your drinks cold and require less trips to the bar. They even have waiters that bring gigantic trays of assorted beverages to people on the beach. I liked this resort because it was smaller and you could get to where you wanted to go quickly. We did have access to the other Riu resort restaraunts so if we were in the mood for a change we didn't have that far to go. Just across or down the street! And the service was so personal! I loved how the staff came to know us by name after we'd only been there a few days! Contrary to other reviews, there were not that many children during our stay. A few young ones here and there, but mostly 25-55 year olds - if I had to guess. ALOT of people from Europe. Yes, be prepared my fellow uptight Americans, there's a bit of topless sunbathing and some very tiny Speedos on very large men! There is also a wonderful, funny, energetic, entertainment staff on hand to make sure you don't get bored. Ladies, do yourselves a favor and take a salsa lesson from Isreal - it's a treat - trust me. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here. If you're looking for a spa-like atmosphere with 300 count sheets and luxurious amenities - this resort probably isn't for you. If you want wonderful, friendly, attentive service, a casual, relaxed stay, good food and great scenery, this is just the place for you. THANK YOU Saul, Gloria, Frankie, Luis, Carlos, Hanna and everyone else - we had a wonderful time! A few tips: there is a bit of construction going on next door - ask for a room on the inside near the main sidwalk or on the other side of the resort. The noise wasn't ever any louder than the blender at the bar, but if you think it might bother you - it's easy to avoid. Oh, and PS. people like to get started early around here so get your towels and use them to save the lounge chairs you want BEFORE you go to breakfast! No, there isn't an elevator, but there is a bellman to carry your luggage or get a room on the first floor- No steps! It's Mexico and you're on vacation - don't sweat the small stuff - just have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed...We actually left for another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: averageguy
Reviews.Content: I would describe the Riu Playacar as an "old style" all inclusive. Bad food options, tons of children, and not so clean. At checkout, we found the front desk personnel less than charming. We were told that dinner reservations could only be made at breakfast, and since we just checked in we would have to wait until tomorrow. So our only option that night was the buffet. We are accustomed to All-inclusives that offer at least 2-3 restaurants with no or flexible reservations. The last AI we went to was Dreams Cancun, which is in the same price range. We were given a 3rd level room. As we approached the building, the bellboy informed us that there was no elevator. My girlfriend and I are avid runners, so we are not simply Lazy Americans. But, I feel that a hotel that Apple Vacations lists as a 5 Golden Apple, should have an elevator. In their defense, the hotel manager offered to move us the next morning. It has very little options for dining. Lunch is limited to an outdoor "very average" buffet in a facility that didn't seem very clean. Sodas were available in a plastic cup about the size of a thimble. My girlfriend and I joked that the glasses reminded us of the milk glasses in Pre School. I am 34 years old; I prefer a glass that is larger than a half cup. Despite the cheesy rule of the strict reservations, I tipped the Maitre D so that we could get a table at one of the restaurants. In actuality, the Steak Restaurant and the Mediterranean Restaurant are actually just a bunch of tables in a closed-in eating area. The 2 restaurants are simply 2 different menus. While the service was pleasant, I'd like to have the experience of going to a real restaurant with real atmosphere. I think Riu can do better than that. The beach seemed nice. There were no palapas, but we knew that before we booked. The pool was packed with children, which is great for some but we prefer to stay at a distance. As far as the room, all Mexico hotels have hard beds and salty air. Other than that, it was fine. This hotel would probably be fine for a family with kids. But for adults, I'd say pass on this one. We were actually so disappointed; we stayed one night at Playacar, and moved to the RIU palace two doors down the street. We were given no credit despite the fact that both hotels were RIU. So in effect, we paid for two hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a destination wedding”
Reviews.Author: PressKids
Reviews.Content: A mid-December, post Katerina and Wilma hurricane wedding at the RIU Playacar was a memory-maker beyond belief for 57 guests who ranged from age 4 to almost 84 with lots of late 20-somethings and 50ish folks. The palm trees were a little battered, but the all-inclusive package worked well and the resort was just the right size for our group--big enough for privacy if you wanted it and small enough to find folks to join you for snorkeling, deep sea diving, para-sailing, hanging out, sightseeing, shopping, scuba and more. The food ranged from good to much better; more important, even those with the goofiest dietary restrictions (and there were more than a couple) found items at the resort they could eat...and enjoy. The wait staff was very accommodating and became part of the entertainment. We had an impromptu Thursday evening get aquainted gathering at the Porche that was very fun. (We thought about bringing Fernando home with us, but knew his family would miss him.) Rooms were spacious and pleasant with towel sculptures for added interest. The location was perfect for night outings to great places like Ajua (live entertainment that defies description), Agua, and a rehearsal dinner at the Blue Parrot, that, thanks to Paula, was fabulous to provide just a little change of pace. The beach backdrop for the ceremony was glorious and we didn't mind sharing it with onlookers. Mariachis and maracas added a special touch. The reception was later than most American events, but it was lovely and personalization didn't reqire worrying about imprinted napkins or the color of the mints. Post-wedding activities included day trips to Mayan ruins, including Chitzenitza as well as excursions to Xcaret, and every imaginable water sport. We're all missing the sun, sand, and our wristbands. As one 80+ grandmother said to the bride and groom, "We thought you were crazy to suggest this. We're so glad you knew what you wanted. This was divine and we wouldn't have missed this for anything!" Amen from the previously skeptical (but trying to be open) parents of the bride who would gladly do it all again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and great!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cinnie
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a relaxing vacation's. You want to see the sight's. No problem, someone to help you arrange that. Very safe. Food was great!! trip you will never forget. But the beds are really hard. Everyone working there are very helpful and polite!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ourreggie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 wonderful days at the Riu Playacar (Jan 7 - Jan 14). A group of 58 people went with us to celebrate our daughters wedding at Xcaret. All 58 people had exceptional times. The resort is beautiful. The beach and pool are beautiful and there was no shortage of chaises to sit on. The rooms are great. The food is excellent and has great variety. The entertainment is OK, but the entertainers work their hearts out to please. The service provided in the restaurants, bars, pool, beach, and rooms is unbelievable. These people work so hard to make sure your stay is wonderful in every way. They are so friendly and pleasant. They will do whatever they can to please. Unfortunately the same can not be said for the front desk staff. They are all very pleasant and will listen to your request, write it down and tell you it will be handled, but they will do nothing, your request will never get handled. When you followup on why your request wasn't handled, they smile and go through the same routine again, and again your request will not be handled. They never apologize or make any attempt at customer service recovery. If you need something done, talk to anyone on the hotel staff except the front desk staff and you will get your issue resolved. I would highly recommend this resort, as everything was excellent except the front desk staff (and they can be easily avoided)so as to not mar an otherwise incredible experience. If you're thinking about the Riveria Maya, GO it is GREAT! If you want to stay at a resort where you will have your expectations exceeded, stay at the Riu Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Amaaaazing time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time in Mexico, thanks to this wonderful resort. It was my first all inclusive tropical vacation and we really couldn't have asked for more. My cousin and his bride were married on this vacation, so the trip was a memorable one for sure! There were 83 of us (in our group) to be accomodated, and the Riu staff always kept up. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the food was delish and the whole atmosphere of this place was magical. We enjoyed ourselves so much that I've already told my boyfriend that we're going back there! Watch out Playa del Carmen, here we come!:):):)

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: sampatch14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the riu playacar from december 25 to january 8. we had an absolutely wonderful time there, the hotel and grounds were pristine the food was good and the staff were brilliant, what more can you ask for !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good resort but room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and five other family members stayed at this hotel to ring in the 2006 New Year. The staff at this hotel was wonderful. The food was excellent and the New Years Eve party was great. The only thing that this resort lacks are good shows to keep the guests entertained. The shows were very boring and the acting very poor. The beach was very nice but I don't understand why they don't have any umbrella's or beach hut's to get a break from the sun. Never the less, we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed here dec 26-jan2 06. Food here is great and the service is the best in Mexico. IMHO:>>> down sides..... well don't stay in the rooms that are looking out on the road. These are in the right hand buildings ( looking towards the beach) building these are the odd numbered buildings. the view is well BAD its a view the service buildings of the next hotel over and... much worse. the noise at ALL hours. If you can believe it they were emptying the trash a 2:00 AM for over a half hour. and its those trash compactor trucks so its very LOUD!! also every truck/bus backs up into this side street and they have those backup alarms that use a series of alarms that sound like a car theft alarm also LOUD!! all night long!!! A real problem that needs a wall built to reflect the sound. caused a real problem for me since I was looking for peace and quiet on the ocean:<<< also out going calls can be VERY expensive , extortionate so bring your cell phone. If you go to the mayan pyramids a couple of hours away. do it in the middle or end of your trip and take a BIG bus not a mini bus!!!!! the minis just arnt comfortable enough by ALOT. also by doing the trip later in your stay you will be more aclimated to the heat. Bottom line great service and food nice town!!! room was ok except as described above.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, daughter, her hubby and two children ages 3 yrs. and 16 mos. spent Dec. 18-25, 2005 at the Riu Playacar-avenida xamen-ha. We had adjoining rooms which were nicely located and very clean in the 'Pink' building which was convenient to the beach and the children's activites. The staff was extremely helpful, always cheerful. The food was excellent. The evening entertainment was first class. At the last minute we were bumped from another resort which had some electrical problems and feel that we were extremely lucky to have found the Riu Playacar. Definitely plan to return. Patti Tschantz Eastlake, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “awsome vacation”
Reviews.Author: Adam_Polanski
Reviews.Content: We were at the RIU from dec. 15 to dec. 22. When we arrived at the hotel we were greated with a tropical drink. The entrance to the hotel is quite beautiful. The lobby was decorated with colonial Mexican decor and had shiny marble floors. The resort did have a lobby bar but I would have to say that it was satisfactory compared to other hotels we've stayed at. This was a large let down because we always liked to have a few drinks in the lobby every evening. The resort grounds were beautiful even after the disastrous hurricane Wilma. The only evidence we saw after the hurricane would be missing tops on some of the palm trees, and the gardens not being as lush. But they were still beautiful. The food was amazing. Sometimes they even have special nights where they had a huge variety of special foods such as sushi and baby back ribs.The restaurant would be decorated with carved watermelons and ice sculptures. The beach and the pool were beautiful as well as the theatre area.Everything about this hotel was awsome other than a few minor things. We are demanding travellers and this resort really pleased us. So go out and enjoy the Riu PLayacar!I hope you'll enjoy it as much as we did! P.S. Go on the Tulum--Xel-ha tour. It was a great trip

Reviews.Title: “Fiu Playacar gets A++++++”
Reviews.Author: theroys
Reviews.Content: Returned last week from the Riu Playacar and we loved it. Resort was in fantastic shape, clean, beautifully landscaped, very nice rooms, air conditioned resturant, great food, unbelievable super friendly service. We have travelled once a year for the last 10 years to Cuba, Mexico, St. Maartin, Virgin Islands, etc. and this was by far the nicest resort we have stayed in. Food was very fresh and always something new every night. Did not get tired of buffet, although the specialty resturants were also great. Never had to wait for a drink, in fact once they got to know you at the pool bar, your drink was waiting for you when you got to the bar. Service was top notch. Check in was done on the bus on the trip to the hotel from the airport. Once we arrived we got a welcome drink and the key to our room and within 5 minutes of arriving in our room they brought in our luggage. Service was top notch from the front desk, resturants, bars and the wonderfully talented and helpful annimation team. We loved it and will go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “loved it! loved it! loved it! and going back january 2006”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and I went 5 years ago on our first real vacation together at this hotel and i am a very very picky person and i give it two thumps up!!! every thing was perfect. this past September we just got engaged and we are going back to the same place to celebrate and plan our future together. Hopefully that says something about the location. The water was absolutely breathtaking, white sand, beautiful and clean hotel, great food and drinks, staff was really wonderful. The one thing we really enjoyed is that there are so many outside activities to do. Dolphin Discovery, the ruins, shopping, snorkling, night club's, etc, etc. Hope this review helps someone thinking of going there. p.s the weather perfect

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Vacation!!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: jen1326
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riu Playacar 2 days ago and it was an incredible vacation! Hotel: Grounds were beautiful,minor damage from hurricane to tops of trees, very colorful and rooms were always clean. Didn't notice too much of a musty smell as some others had said. Mini bar was always stocked. Very impressed. Food: Excellent buffets... a lot of choices, Mexican night offered some delicious choices. All around impressed. A la carte restaurants however I would say were not so good. Steak house was better than the Mediteranean. I would recommend to stick with the buffet or if you are interested in going into Playa Del Carmen for a meal, (we went for one lunch and dinner) I would strongly receommend both the "Casa de Agua" or "Blue Lobster" Both were delicious and the staff were so welcoming and genuinely happy that you would come expereince what they have to offer. Beach: Beautiful, lots of loungers, and water sports. Pools: Large and sooo refreshing. Stayed in the pool with the swim up bar as it was closer to the beach and gave the most sunshine. Other pool was gorgeous with a fountain on the edge. Staff: So wonderful!! Hard working, always greeted with a smile and an hola!! The Anamacion team was terrific, always interacting and so hard working. Night Shows: Went to 6 out of the 7. The dance shows were really impressive. I have seen other hotels put on dance shows that were quite sub-par, but these dancers were awesome. Put on by a very hard working dance team and the choreographer did an amazing job both with the choreography and she herself was a beautiful dancer. Other shows were quite funny and interactive. Excursions: Go swim with the dolphins... what an expereince!!! Overall I did not ever want to leave. The weather was sunny and hot all day for 7 days. I could not have asked for more in a resort. I will definitely go back and recommend this hotel to travellers in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar was a vacation to remember!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! We went on a vacation to th Riu Playacar this past march. It was great! Our whole family had such a great time.
