One thing that was really great about the hotel was the fact that everyone was so friendly. Everyone stopped to chat and say hello. It was really nice and made you feel welcome. We had originally booked a junior suite. When we arrived at the hotel they didn't have one available so we took a normal room. We were offered an upgrade to the Riu Palace but declined it. The food was absolutely amazing. There were 2 restauraunts, the main buffet in the lobby and another smaller one adjacent to the theatre. We ate mostly at the big buffet in the lobby. It was very good. There was fresh squeezed fruit juce at breakfst which was great, but no maple syrup for the pancakes. Dinner was great, with both mexican and american food and many different kinds of meats and hors d'ouvres to try! Lunch was only served at the smaller restauraunt by the theatre. There was chicken, pasta, tacos and pizza as well as ice cream for dessert. We actually went on the kitchen tour in the large buffet and they made us great breaded chicken and showed us how they make these really neat carved watermelons that decorate the buffets. The beach was pretty nice. There are plenty of lounge chairs and a massage tent. There were equiptment rentals there too, hobie sailboats, paddleboats and surf/boogie boards. We went sailing on a hobie sailboat and it was very exhilarating, as the winds were very strong the week we were there. However, these winds created large waves with an undertow that A) caused the equiptment rentals to be closed some days B) caused the beach to erode a lot and a ledge of sand to form. There were jet ski rentals and parasailing places a couple of hotels down the beach so its pretty convenient. The pool was very nice. It was very large, it looked like one giant pool but was actually two seperate pools. This was pretty good because one end had a swim up bar and whirlpool so it was quite a bit busier. The other end was quiet, shadier, and had a fountain. Also the quiet end had a ramp to go in for anybody who might need that. The activities were fun for everyone. There were numerous sports tournaments thoughout the day and other activities to join. Some of these were ping pong, beach soccer, volleyball, shooting (i think) and bingo. The winners would get a prize (Riu t-shirt, visor, bag ect) and a certificate at the beginning of the evening show. The was a free scuba diving trial in the pool. I tried it and thought it was a lot of fun, because I've never tried scuba before. There was an aqua aerobics class each day in the pool and it was just as much fun to watch as it was to participate in! There was a show every night in the theatre. The pathways around the theatre were lined with vendors. THis was great to pick up some souveniers, especially these gorgeous paintings done entirely with spraypaint. As for the shows, they were mediocre. One of them, the 'cat vs. dog' one, was very fun. To go on trips such as Chichen Itza you had to walk down the street to the Riu Tequila to get on the bus. Because the buses came in the morning, breakfast was served for us there too. It would have been nicer if we could have gotten picked up at the marketplace across the street or at the Playacar, however. 2 nights before going home, we discovered that the bathroom plaster celing in our room was totally filled with water and was almost ready to collapse!!! The hotel was very good about it and helped us move rooms really quickly but it was kind of annoying considering the fact that it wasn't the room we had booked to begin with. Luckily, everything was okay, most of our luggage stayed dry and the ceiling didn't collapse or anything, but it kind of upset us. Despite a few problems, however, the Riu Playacar was a lot of fun, a great choice, and we would definitely return again. Our compliments to the fantastic chefs for the great meals, the maintenance staff for keeping the resort groomed and pretty and especially the hotel entertainer staff who made our week fun and memorable for years to come! Great job Riu!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: lb_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a trip to Riviera Maya, Mexico. We too, were a little concerned about the state of the resort after the hurricane, but would like to report that aside from the damaged palm tree tops and some debri that washes up the shore occasionally, the resort is just fine. It is pretty much the same as it was during our first visit at this resort in March/April 2001. The resort is family oriented, though not too much to do for the little kids. However, there is a playground, mini-club with art activities, mini-disco at 8:30 each night where they can just dance around. The room was clean, the minibar was replenished every 2 days, and the grounds were beautiful. Would go again!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar before/during/after Hurrican Wilma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from October 17-28th. We survived Wilma. The grounds of the hotel sustained most of the damage to the vegetation. The staff was great about cleanup and replanting fallen trees. Some of the rooms did sustain water damage, therefore, the hotel had musty/mildew/mold odors, and some drywalls falling in. The two restaurants closest to the beach did sustain water & wind damage to the point where, I believe, the equipment had to be replaced, because the restaurants flooded and equipment was knocked over into the water. The theatre area and pools were fine. The hotel was closing as of the 30th for a couple of weeks to do repairs, replacement and painting. The staff was great, they stayed on the property, bringing the guests food, etc., during the hurricane, while battling the winds. They are the hardest working people I've ever seen! The entire staff always had smiles on their faces, especially Ramiro & Freddy in the Main restaurant! They're the greatest!

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Wilma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are travelling to the Riu Playacar in January 2006 and we are desparate for some advise on the resort after Hurricane Wilma. If anyone can provide us with some information we would be very grateful.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade if you're honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar for our honeymoon. It was alright, but I wish we would have stayed at a nicer resort, especially for our honeymoon, and an adults only resort. It seemed kinda crowded to us. The rooms were clean, but the beds were hard...and we had 2 full-size beds that they pushed together for us, so sleeping was awkward. The drinks were good and the service was also good...the people work very hard there! The food however, got really old after the first few days and it tasted the same after awhile. We were expecting good Mexican food, but their Mexican food isn't like it is in the U.S. Neither of us like seafood, so that eliminated that. They did have a wide selection, but pretty much the same stuff every night. We didn't like the fact that we had to make reservations for dinner every night, and in order to eat at the steakhouse, you had to make your reservations at breakfast time the day of...you couldn't make it the day before. A lot of times, we wouldn't even eat breakfast...we'd sleep in, etc. We did eat at the steakhouse one night, and it wasn't anything to write home about. The beach and pool areas were nice though. The entertainment got a little repetitive though...the evening shows. We did go on a couple of day tours, and the buses were always late. All in all, it was okay, but we'd stay somewhere better next time, if we ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Had an absolute blast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would just like to say up front, don't listen to the negative reviews about the resort. Period. There were of course some things we did notice about the resort, such as hard beds (they really are plywood firm). This is not such a big deal, usually you are half in the bag by the time you go to bed anyways, plus it gives you a firm surface for your after hours...umm...activities. The wasps were terrible around anywhere that had booze. We went in August and I think it has more to do with the time of the year. Didn't see any tourists get stung though. Those are really our only two negatives. Now on to the positives. The food is out of this world. The buffet is spectacular to say the least. We both ate everything there and didn't get sick at all. I really can't say enough about the food. Yes you have set times and tables for dinner....but who cares? It's nice cause you get the same waiter every night and if you tip him a couple of bucks US every night your glasses never get more than half full and the plates are cleared immediatly. The evening entertainment is just that...entertaining. It's not Broadway, but its not meant to be. We took in the show every night, it was fun and humorous, and they actually had some pretty cool stuff such as Mariachi. Lots of ethnic mexican stuff, just what we were hoping for. Both pools are very clean. Didn't use the swim up bar much due to the wasps. Oh, very important, get yourselves some insulated large mugs so you dont have to make so many trips from your pool chair. You can find these in the shop at the entrance or in many of the stores in Playa del Carmen. The ocean is spectacular and there is a large beach with palms, very scenic. The ocean water is very warm and does not do much to cool you off. Yes there are butts in the sand along with other garbage but I didn't blame the hotel for that. I dont expect them to have 100 people on their hands and knees pick butts out of the sand. You hardly notice them. Not a big deal. Playa del Carmen is cool and only a 5 dollar cab ride from the hotel. We paid for the cab cause we went with another couple. You could walk it easy but we were on vacation. 5th ave is completely blocked to vehicle traffic and you can walk the street drinking ice cold cervezas ($1) while the women shop. MMMM ice cold corona's. Mostly touristy crap but a lot of good restaurants. We ate at the Blue Lobster and it was good. 2 for 1 happy hour cervezas. Sweet. The highlight of our trip was a day excursion to Cozumel. Do it. Period. We took the ferry (20 mins) from Playa and there were people lined up on the pier at Cozumel trying to rent you scooters and cars. We rented two scooters and snorkle gear and rode on the road that goes around the outside of the island. It was a riot. If we saw a place that might be good snorkeling we would just pull over and jump in. Saw some amazing fish. They have little restaurants overlooking the ocean on the road with decent food for a decent price. We stopped at a couple of those for a break. I guess when it was said and done we spent probable 75 bucks per person. Cheap. I felt sorry for the suckers who paid for their package excursion and didnt get to do half the stuff we did. We did a day trip to Xel-ha. It was alright. The water was very cloudy when we were there. Would rather have spent another day in Cozumel. It was an awesome trip that we will likely never forget. The resort is great. It is not perfect but worth far more than what it costs to stay there. No doubt about it....phenomenal value. I think a trip is what you make of it. If you show up and immedialty start looking for the faults, you will find them no matter where you go. Go there to have a good time and you will. Oh and as far as taking kids is concerned.......leave them at home. I did. Who wants to go vacationing in paradise with kids anyway....take them to Disneyland next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kip7210
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this hotel. I picked the BEST time to choice my vacation, not only was in Mexico but Wilma decided to check in also (lol). Yes, I was there during Hurricane Wilma, but even with that I cannot say anything bad about this hotel. The staff was more than professional during the 48 plus hours of the hurricane. I came to Riu Palyacar as a guest in a room and left with a feeling that I was leaving family behind. Part of that family was the staff that was warm and friendly before, during and after the hurricane. These people risked their own lives in order to keep the guests happy. They truly wanted to please the guests not only as a job but as a personal obligation to help others in the time of need. Anyone can do an outstanding job during easy times but when you have an extreme condition such as a hurricane and people put others before themselves, with little to no sleep, that is a sign of a great person. This Hotel is operated by a general manager that in my opinion is a fantastic lady. She left her husband and 1 year old child at her home during the hurricane without any communication with them, but still she gave 999% toward the guests of this hotel. ( yes I did mean 999% and this is not a typo) This is truly a first class lady. If you should, have the privilege of visiting this hotel just say hello to Maria Jose. A superior hotel can not be possible without a fantastic management team. This hotel is of a perfect size, not too big and not to small. Riu Playacar received minimum damage from the hurricane and will ready to accept guests within a week. Don’t let Wilma deter your plans of visiting this 6 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Go!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Playcar from September 26th to October 3th. Before we went, I read all the reviews wrote here about the hotel.... I was kind of worried because of some reviews I read..... BUT.......... The hotel is very beautiful, the room was very clean with a slight humidity smell but nothing to worry about. I spent 8 amazing days in the hotel, the food was excellent, each day you can find something different in the menu. I didn´t use the special restaurants because I was very pleased with the regular buffet. The place is spectacular, full of trees, flowers and also you could find some animals like if you were in the jungle (squirrels, reptiles, birds, etc). The beach is amazing, the color of the water and the white sand are like if you were in paradise. The bar service is very good also. Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having been back from our Holiday to the Riu Playacar for a month i thought it was about time i left my review about this Hotel and our Overall Holiday. Before myself and my wife went we must have read every review and website about this hotel and to be totally honest we went with mixed feelings about it. Having never been on an all inclusive holiday before and never having been to Mexico before we were a bit worried about it not living upto expectations, but believe me those worries were soon put to rest. Were do i start, the food was excellent, plenty of choice superbly presented, tasted excellent and service was great. Being in the food industry myself i have high standards and Riu Playacar lived up to them. The Bar service was excellent, no problems getting served and always done with a smile. The rooms were also excellent, very clean and tidy and with just a small amount of tipping you got your towels made into all sorts of animals. Even the small things impressed us like the gardens were always being attended to, maintence of the hotel was always ongoing, even one day saw someone painting the rubbish bins, and it's this attention to detail thats makes the hotel stand out. Believe me once you've been to some of the Spanish and Greek Hotels that call themselves 4 Star, then this attention to maintence is a big deal. Then there's the excursions and Diving, we went on a couple of trips while we were there, swimming with Dolphins at Porto Aventura was okay, but we were told afterwards that the Cozumel one is better, we went on the Fat Cat Catermeran excursion which was superb, great value for money and excellent snokerling.I also tried Scuba Diving for the first time, did it with Scuba Cariba at the hotel, superb training given and the dive itself was well supervised, if you are planning doing a dive while you are there it's well worth applying for the riu discount card before hand and getting 15% off the normal price. Then entertainment at the Hotel was very good especially the Grease show, we also went up to the Riu Tequila and the Yucatan which were also very nice, but much prefered the smaller Playacar. All in All a great time had and will definetly be going back in the not to distant future

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our honeymoon and first holiday as an all inclusive. Before we went I read plenty of reviews and although most of them good was concerned by some. Well after seeing the place for ourselves all I can say is WOW! We had an absolutely fantastic time, the hotel was in an ideal spot and had very well maintained gardens. The staff are constantly working around you, always with a smile despite the high temperatures. It really was like paradise and we had a truly amazing stay. Rooms..... we tipped our maid $10 a week and the room was thoroughly cleaned everyday with fresh towels which were made in animals. Yes, the drinks in the fridge were plentiful but to be honest we hardly made use of them as we were never in. Food..... this was excellant, there was so much choice, even after 2 weeks you could still find something new to try. Drink..... Basically you could have anything you fancied. The drink is not watered down at all, in fact quite the opposite. I loved the cocktails "Road Runner" was my favourite although the tequilla boom booms were very good, we have Fernando to thank for them! Beach..... Wow! white sand and turquoise warm water. As you stepped out the pool you were straight onto the stunning beach. Well worth a view at night. Entertainment..... I can't stress how hard the entertainers work, there are activities all day and a show every evening, they work non-stop. The magic show is a must! Our favourite experiences were swimming with the dolphins and scuba diving. Our instructor was Birdie, she was lovely and if you have never dived before she will completely put you at ease. The diving is amazing and really worth doing, great value for money. All in all we had the best holiday ever and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not believe everything you read! I read other people's comments before I went to Riu Playacar and I was very worried but there was no need to be it was excellent. The staff were very friendly, would do anything for you! The rooms were lovely, the beds were a little hard but thats the same wherever you go. The buffet was good, had a wide range of food. The steak house was the best, oh my god I have never tasted steak so good!!!! The swim up pool was great. I had read in someones comment that there were loads of bees, that is not true, you had the odd bee but come on you are in the sun there is bound to be a few bees here and there!!!! The only thing which I think let it down a little is that there were no umbrellas on the beach, you had the palm tress to sit under but you didn't get much shade, but you can't have everything. There were loads of unbrellas round the pool, so plenty of shade if thats what you want. It was my first holiday with my boyfriend and we had a fantastic time, would definately go back to the Riu Playacar. We visited the Riu Tequila in the evening it was ok but the night club was not good. The smell was awful! Overall I had a fantastic time and would definately recommend it to other people. Don't believe everything you read. Everyone has different taste!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with a few minor problems”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo38
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience in an all inclusive resort. The first impression was good, but After the check-in we went to our room. The room was OK (clean and neat) but noticed some smell of humidity or something. After a while the smell increased so we asked for a room change. The resort was sold out so they could not assign us another room, instead thet sent the maintenance guy with some deodorant, that neutralized the odor for a while. They said that we will be moved to another room the next day. We are still waiting ! Another minor issue: I had to ask three times for extra pillows and after 3 hours I had to go in person to the front desk ! The AC did not stop once the room temperature was reached. Since we were with our three years old boy, we had to turn off the AC during the night and use just the ceiling fan. Other than that food was excellent, room refrigerator was plenty of Corona beers and sodas, and also in you room you have Tequila (Jose Cuervo Reposado), Gin, Vodka, all replenished every two days. You can have lunch at the other Riu Resorts in the area (with the exception of the Riu Palace). Beach was marvelous and the two pools were allways clean. Waiters are great. And if you are a sailing fan (as I am) you have free catamaran rides (all you can sail!) which were in perfect conditions. Overall it was a good experience and probably would go back to the same resort (although I would try Riu Palace next time).

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected :(”
Reviews.Author: tiggerpurrrz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Riu Playacar on sept 11th 2005, this was our second trip to Cancun, we were there in 2003 for our honey moon, we stayed at the Barcelo maya beach resort and as far as that resort is concerned...go!!! it was truly amazing..a 5 star all the way..as for the Riu Playacar..we will not go back, first off the bed sheets were dirty when we got to our room, the towels were stained, there were bugs all over the bathroom, they are tiny but they were still there, there was only a shower not a tub..had to spend an extra $500 for the tub..each!!! not worth it. We travelled with our 10 month old this time..he did great on the plane and slept well at night with us..the crib they provided was too small, we needed extra water for the baby because of his formula..had a hard time getting water from them, you have a set dinner time and a set table for dinner....we didn't like that..we took early dinner 7pm..which is 8pm in Toronto...our sons bedtime..so we had a high chair brought to our room and we ate dinner at different times..alone which --- but we survived, the beach had garbage and ciggarette butts all over it, but the worst was when they sprayed pesticide outside your rooms and close to the entrance of the lobby....they said it was safe for us but come on....who wants to walk into a blue cloud of that especially with a child...no I do not recommend this as your paradise holiday...as I said earlier...go to Barcelo Maya beach resort in the Mayan Riviera...that's where we are going when we go back, the Mexican people are truly nice people but the Riu PlayaCar was not :(.

Reviews.Title: “We Will soon go back for the 3rd time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first time we went to RIU Playacar was July 2004. We loved it and went back in Jan. 2005, this time with 2 of our adult children. My daughter said if she put the best 7 days of her 22 years together, it would not match the wonderful time she had! The first thing I have to say is the staff at RIU Playacar are wonderful. They go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The grounds are beautiful. The breakfast and dinner buffets are incredible at the main restaurant. They have 2 specialty restaurants but we never felt the need to go, as we were completely satisfied with the buffet. The lunch buffet was fine also. The rooms are nice, with a balcony. Beds are hard but you wont even notice because you will be so relaxed and tired after the day you will sleep great! We made sure we tipped the maid every day, as well as leaving a small tip at meals and sometimes for the bartenders. Take a lot of small bills! They really deserve the tips. They don't make much money and work very hard. The beach is beautiful. Nice pool with swim up bar. Not overly crowded. It is also nice that the rooms are close to everything. I wanted a resort that was not going to have a thousand people and this fit the bill. We took the ferry to Cozumel, rented scooters and drove around the island. THat was fun. We went on the Golden Cruise and that was nice. Went to Xelha, that was beautiful. Went on the Capt. Hook Dinner Cruise, The show was awesome, but the food was not good, and it was way to crowded. I would not do that again. Dont even get fooled by the people who constantly try to sell time shares. They will do most anything to get you to talk to them. We are going back in November and I cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 2.5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Aug 14-19. We went on our honeymoon and I should have at the very least booked at the RIU Palace for a few hundred more since I heard it was much nicer. To be honest, this was my first all inclusive, so I can't compare it to anything. This resort would be fine for a family but it's not romantic in the least, and there's wall to wall people. It's geared towards the family crowd, and the food was virtually the same every night and we missed the only day they opened a second restaurant because nobody ever told us about it. The beach is pretty nice, and the water was perfect. The main pool was drained the entire week we were there. I read a great number of reviews saying this place was awesome. Sorry folks, it's not awesome. They do a nice job there but everything is mediocre. It's designed to get people in and get them out. My advice to honeymooners is spend a few extra bucks and go to a nicer, smaller place, without children. We booked trough Apple Vacations who was very impressive, and I'd go through them again in a heartbeat. In the end, I don't fault the resort. I fault myself and I fault many of the misleading reviews that I read.

Reviews.Title: “had such a great time and didnt want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the playcar and had a fantastic time. i have to say how amazing the animacion (entertainment) team were, working really hard during the day organising activities and then again in the evening for the show, they never seemed to stop! and even though they were on the go the whole day they never had a bad word to say, as they were so friendly, especially Erik, Rosie, Israel, Sergio, and others. So a big thanks to them for all their hard work, they made the holiday! A few days after we got there we experienced hurricane emily, but it all added to the excitment of the holiday and the atmosphere the next day was great, as everybody enjoyed helping out to get things back to normal. I would definately recommend it to anyone thinking about going there. We are returning next summer to do it all again!

Reviews.Title: “awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the riu playacar on our vacation ,can not say enough,the service was the best ,very attentive employees,I would like to mention an incendent,I think is well worth talking about. I had purchased a bracalet not real expensive ,went out that night had 1 or 2 maybe too many before going to bed reliazed I had lost my new purchase,I just knew I had lost it while out that evening. The next morning went out to the pool for a couple hrs after returning to my room ,I seen where the cleaning lady had found my bracelet and laid it on the nightstand,I was shocked ,I just knew it was gone for good ,it really made me feel very good about another part of the staff there, The bartenders were the greatest ,always had a smile....... The food was great ,can't wait to come back. Thanks Earlean,and Brandie June 2005

Reviews.Title: “Average Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rui Playacar from August 6 to 10th. The hotel is very beuatiful but is just an average hotel. Saw a little bit of damage on the trees from the hurricane and there was erosion on the beach, and a few other minor things. Overall the Rui staff did an excellent job of cleaning up after the hurricane. There were no bars on the beach, and the one by the pool had bees everywhere. Pools were small, and not very clean, most fountains were not working (probably because of the hurricane). The food was great, especially the steakhouse. However, unless you get up at 8am to make reservations, theres a good chance that there will not be any availability left for the skeakhouse due to very limited seating. Didnt like the fact you had to make reservations for the BUFFET, or the fact that we had assigned seats. This is the first time Ive experienced this. If you wanted a snack at night, you have to walk all the way to Rui Tequila because Rui Playacar doesnt have a nightly snack bar. Entertainment was ok. Plenty of activities, you can always find something to do. The room was nice for the most part, very clean, large bathroom, and it didnt smell bad as suggested in previous reviews. AC was fantastic, room was freezing cold at night. Beds were hard, pillows were tiny, flat and uncomfotorable. The shower was awful, it was next to impossible to regulate (freezing cold one second, 1000 degrees next second). The mini bar was great, restocked about every two days, and i liked the alcohol despenser which included gin, rum, vodka, and tequila. I liked the fact that they provided you a free in-room safe. Rui Playacar staff were great , always smiling and very friendly. I had a great vacation, but the hotel is average.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good, Not Great, Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJB-Ottawa
Reviews.Content: I was there on my honeymoon this past week... From August 8th to 15th, 2005. I have been at a few, maybe 4-5, All-Inclusive Resorts in the Carribean in my life and I would say this one was quite good with both positives and negatives. Here are my comments and ratings out of 10. I hope you find this helpful because I sure did find this site helpful when booking my trip POSITIVES: Beach- It was busy but beatiful. The Hotel had a great oceanfront and the beach was soft and sandy and the water while a little choppy was very beautiful and warm. 10/10 Pool- The Pool and The Pool Bar were great. The Pool was actually two pools together and was also nice and warm. It is true that you needed to be there early to get a good spot... But here is a tip since all the guests did it, get a towel before you eat breakfast and put it on the chair(s) you want and then eat and go down later. And Yes there were bees around the pool bar so be careful. 8/10 Hotel and Staff- The staff were very friendly and very helpful. Good english skills. The Room we had was nice, simple and clean. Just like the pictures you see in the brochures. Very Nice. 7-8/10 Bars and Entertainment- The access to the other RIUs was a great part of this trip. I would reccommend the RIU Tequila's Pool as It was better in my opinion... I would say the RIU Yutican was about the same. Nice to travel to the different places for drinks etc. The nightly entertainment was pretty good... the Micheal Jackson show was awesome!! 7.5/10 Food- Believe most of the posting that the food was very good. I wont repeat anything not already said... I thought it was great with great selections. 9/10 NOT-SO POSITIVES: Pool- Lots of activity, ie kids jumping around and games which can be good and bad. If you want a serene swim as a couple it can be hard to find. They also closed the pool on one side for 2 days for repairs which was unfortunate but not too bad. Hotel Rooms- The walls and doors of are room were perhaps the thinest I have ever seen anywhere I have every traveled . I could hear EVERYTHING like it was two feet from my head. Hard to sleep in etc. This was a BIG annoyance for me personally, it didn't ruin anything, but it left this resort something to be desired to say the least. Bars- Sometimes the drinks were very WATERED- DOWN. The beer would be good sometimes, and flat the next. It was NOT corona at the bars, some people seemed to think it was but was local beer. Drinks were pretty ok at best. Kids- For some this isnt a problem... for honeymooners it may be. Just be warned there are a ALOT of families with ALOT of kids. This isn't meant as a criticism just as a small peace of advice if you are looking to book for diffferent reasons. Overall- I would give this resort a B+ - I could recommend it... I wouldn't say its the greatest but it had a ALOT of great qualities. Me and my wife had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Booked another trip back 3rd day there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Canadians, you'll love it. Some of the Americans i met didn't really enjoy it. Im gonna leave it at this... we booked a return to playa cara our on our 3rd day there. Go.....

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Mexican Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBayReviewer
Reviews.Content: READ THIS REVIEW!!!! LOTS OF HELPFUL STUFF!!! Sister(20) and I(18) travelled to the RIU PLAYACAR from Dec. 28('04) to Jan. 4('05). I know you're probably thinking that that was a long time ago and wondering why I'm writing a review now. Well, I'm currently booking a trip to Cuba and realized just how much the reviews do help. So here's our wonderful experience. This being our first trip anywhere tropical, our minds were filled with dreams of palm trees, the aqua blue ocean and long lazy days on the beach. And the Riu Playacar more than provided. In fact it blew our minds! I'll break it down for you. Check-In: Was a breeze. You're greeted with a drink which tasted so good. In fact it might have been the best I had all week! You are given your towel card and shown to your room. All done very efficiently. Rooms: Were in Villa style accommodation and all very close to the beach and the lobby/main restaurant. Our room was on the ground floor and it was neat to be able to walk right out of the door onto the path to the beach, or lobby in the other direction. Room was clean and maid was excellent. She was so efficient that we never even saw her. We did tip her. Shower and washroom were clean and in good shape. It was fun to watch the Mexican version of MuchMusic or MTV...pretty funny. The only thing about the room, and this was not a big deal at all, was that the water from the sink smelled like sulfur or rotten eggs some times. But it's not like you're drinking the water anyways. Pool/Beach/Grounds: In a word...Imaculate. So georgeous and clean. And many lounge chairs everywhere. Pool is perfect temp. and so refreshing after a day in the sun and ocean. Swim up bar was cool and the other side of it you can walk up to and bring your drinks to the beach without getting in the pool. (drinks overall at resort are wonderful and plentiful/good variety) Do drink water during the day as it is so hot and you will get dehydrated with all of those Pina Coladas and Corona! Beach is breathtaking and the beachsand is awesome! The sun is blazing at 8AM and down by 6PM. Georgeous palms and like I said tons of beach chairs.(actually quite comfortable) Red Flags most of the time so we could not use the non motorized water sports. This didn't bother us because the atmosphere and the warm Mexican sun is what we were really after. Grounds are so well kept. Couldn't take a walk anywhere without seeing gardners and staff keeping the place absolutely beautiful. They stamp the RIU logo into the ash trays...that's how nice this hotel is. Food: SO AWESOME!! So much variety...really tasty. Buffet restaurant(El Porche) was amazing for breakfast and dinner. Everything you could want. The fresh squeezed juices in the morning were amazing. There must have been 10 different kinds. Beach restaurant(Turquesa) was good too. Food there for lunch and snacks. I liked the pizza, pasta station and nachos. The homemade salsa everywhere was so good! We went to the steakhouse which is actually part of Turquesa which turned into the a la cartes in the evening. My sister enjoyed it all right, but I got terribly sick...violently sick the next day. I ate the ribs. We went on the tour to Chichen Itza the day I was sick too so it completely ruined the tour for me. Throwing up in a towel the whole time...so embarassing. Met another guy who also got sick from the steakhouse. So just be advised. If anything looks under cooked DO NOT EAT IT. Service was amazing everywhere. Especially New Years Eve. So enchanting. They really went all out. If you're going during a holiday bring fancy clothes(and shoes). We were so glad we did. Everyone gets very dressed up. Entertainment: Awesome. So fun. Animation staff were so great and always had something on the go. Shows at night were good to excellent. A mexican folklore night with ancient drums, GREASE the musical, a magic show, an authentic mexican band(so good, the mariachi player was the cutest little man I've ever seen) and a show of dances from all over the world...from Africa to Brazil...Arabia, U.S.A., Argentina Italy and many more. So well done. the dancers are extremely professional. Disco was fun, but very dark inside(at the Tequila.) Tons of stuff to do at the resort. Let go and do the audience participation stuff. So many laughs. Tours: We went to Chichen Itza, Tulum and Xel-Ha, Cozumel, as well as into Playa Del Carmen. Chichen Itza would have been awesome if I wasn't sick. It was neat to see the way the Mayans live. They live in huts, but they have satellite dishes...Bizare to me. It was quite sad too. You stop at an authentic market, go swimming in an underground well(amazing) and see the ruins. I would not reccommend this tour for young kids and the elderly as it is very long and Chichen Itza is extremely hot. Though they do give you lots of water. If you go, enjoy it, just don't eat any slightly undercooked ribs the night before:) Tulum was the most beautiful place I have ever seen. The ruins are set against an expance of ocean so blue it blows your mind. It is well worth it and I recommend this tour the most. Xel-Ha was ok. It was beautiful and lush. But the lagoon doesn't have very good snorkeling. It was still neat though. But we could have done without it. Cozumel was cool, but the shopping is the same as in Playa Del Carmen. The ferry made both of us sick. You have to have your sea legs and a strong stomach. Playa Del Carmen is well worth a visit. It is bustling and colourful and full of culture. Tons of market style shops and also a more modern area. Exchange your money in the heart of 5th avenue as the rates are much cheaper, or just bring american money as it is widely accepted. You name it, they have it. Barder and you will get good deals on jewelery/crafts. Sarongs are $5. Try walking away and they will call you back with a cheaper price. It gets exhausting after a while and if you are not with male companions you will get hit on. And that can be very annoying. Oh well, it's all in the experience right:) It takes 20 min. to walk there and a taxi is $5. The vacation homes along the way are really something to see. I would recommend to do less tours than we did as we felt like we did not have enough time at the resort. One week just doesn't seem like enough!! I think I've covered everything. The RIU PLAYACAR is amazing, completely 5* in every way and you will enjoy yourself. It is worth every penny and more. My advice...pack a smile and the word "Hola" and you will have the time of your life. I hope this review helped. Enjoy your time at the RIU PLAYACAR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Playa del Carmen, we discovered our initial hotel was closed due to hurricane Emily damage. The Rui Playacar accomadated us relatively quickly. When we arrived at the check in counter, they greeted us with two cold drinks, which was extremely nice after traveling all day. Our room was very nice, we were able to control the temperature with the air conditioning and the ceiling fan. The mini bar in the hotel is included and restocked every other day. Yes, there are only four beers inside but we could just walk downstairs to the bar and get all the free beers we wanted 24 hours a day. Housekeeping did a wonderful job cleaning the room daily. The food is great and had such a variety. You could eat basically anytime of day. They serve breakfast until 10:30, lunch from 12 to about 4, then they have snacks and then you can choose to have dinner at either 6:30 or 8:30. We always chose 8:30 since we spend so much time and the beach and pool. Both the beach and pool are great. You could easily take drinks out on the beach and there is a pool bar which is very nice, and another bar across from the pool and the bar in the lobby is open 24/7. We spent many evenings in the lobby bar meeting and mingling with others, which was very fun. The whole entire staff is SO friendly and helpful. We loved our stay and would return to the RUI in a heartbeat. The other nice thing is that there are two other RUI's in Playacar and we could visit those hotels too, and that was included in our all inclusive. One night we walked to the RUI Tequila and went to the disco and bar and didn't have to pay a dime. We truly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Playacar for our honeymoon. A little nervous on the bus ride in as many of the other resorts in the area were severely damaged and some still shut down as a result of the hurricane. Have to hand it to the staff as the grounds at the Playacar were perfect. Very little evidence to suggest a Hurricane had just hit the week before. Staff very friendly. Plenty of English speaking employees at check in. We were disappointed in that we requested ocean front for our honeymoon and didn't even get close. We also didn't get our complementary honeymoon basket we were promised. We had to change rooms as the first we were given smelled very badly. We were accomadated eventually but they were not very happy. Pool and beach were fantastic, although you need to be at the pool by 8:15 in order to get a spot with any shade. Food looked so good on the first day and we were enjoying ourself immensly until day two when we got so sick (food poisoning) that we couldn't leave our room for the next 12 hours. Not very romantic. We had a tough time eating the rest of the week in fear we would get sick again which was too bad because the food was good. All in all it's a nice place and I'm sure I would have enjoyed it that much more if we didn't get sick. Good mix of old/young and euro/n.a's.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: bonniek014
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent the weekend at the RIU Playacar just after Emily came through the area. I was surprised at how clean everything was. There were no obvious signs of damage, other than the palm trees that had blown over and were being propped up. I saw trees with broken branches and most of the leaves had blown off. Other than that there was no structure damage that I could see. We didn't get too far from our resort, other than into town. I saw little, if any damage in Playa. My only complaint about the RIU Playacar was that for a "Fully stocked bar" we were only allowed 4 beers, every other day. There were liquor dispenser with Gin, Rum, Tequila and Vodka....but since neither of us are booze drinkers, this did not appeal to us. We really just wanted to throw down a few Corona's in our room from time to time. We finally had to bribe a guy to get us a 6 pak that we put in a plastic bag with ice, and smuggled it down to the beach! We ALWAYS cleaned up our area! The pool bar was great....lots of fun AND lots of bees! So if your afraid of bees, stay away from the pool bar! I was not at all impressed with the food, although the variety was vast...yet tasteless. Bland. I also would have preferred to be able to eat when I wanted to. Instead we had to make reservations for the buffet....for the BUFFETT!! If you got to the restraunt too close to the time of the next seating, you couldn't go in. The "specialty" restraunts were nothing to write home about. I'm glad I was only there for the weekend. As a travel agent, I look for the good and the bad in a location/resort. For the money, I don't think I would stay at this resort again. If I did, it would be to see the great lookig men that the RIU Playacar employees! Oooo-la-la those are some good looking men! Write me if you have any questions....I'm more than happy to share my experiences with you! Bonnie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied family vacation. Our family decide to take a vacation in Cancun all inclusive and with the recomendation of our travel agent picked the RUI PLAYCAR.We have never taken a vacation all inclusive before and we wern't sure what to expect. We were really in for a surprice.Service personel: All the employees of the hotel were very frendly and very helpful, and always SMILING. Grounds:well kept and well maintained. Rooms very clean and no musty odor. Room was what we requested close to the beach. The FOOD we can't say enough about. We took the late sitting and there was plenty of food and very fresh. The steak house sitdown meal was very good and the steak was excellent. The view for the late meal at the steak house was a view of the beach area. This was one of truely best vacation and look forward to returning. Higly recommended for anyone. PS. the reason we took all incluse so the kids would be able to eat all they wanted and plenty of slections for them (pizza; hamburgers; hotdogs and ice creams) Photos included.

Reviews.Title: “Good time in mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the riu playacar july 14-18 great time untill emily blew through just a word of advise do not take the BUS ride to see the Mayan ruins. It is about seven hours riding and 3 hours seeing the ruins. Very rough roads and a lot of jungle to look at makes for a long trip. Our bunch had arm bands that let you visit other riu resorts and we had fun going to the different hotels and swimming in other pools. All in all our trip was very good, and i would recommend playa del carmen and the riu resorts Bud H Ft Worth, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Factual Unbiased Review”
Reviews.Author: Jtravels
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar. I stayed there in May 2005. I am a travel agent and saw all 4 Riu properties on this visit. The Riu Playacar is lovely. I stayed in an oceanview room. I read a report earlier that this resort has no ocvws and elevators. Let me clarify this unfortunate review, they certainly do have oceanviews, gorgeous ones. There are no elevators, but the highest floor is 3. Not an unimaginable climb. Lowest floor are easily accessed for handicapped or challenged travelers. The grounds are lush and lovely, pool areas fun, and the beach was great. Rooms were typical Mexican style decor, very clean, no odors, and our balcony was huge. The staff is excellent, doing all they can for each guest. The food was good, absolutely what you expect of an all-inclusive resort. I would stay here again and again, I hope Emily hasn't done too much damage to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay... but not deserving of the rating”
Reviews.Author: ravenmom1
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I went to the Riu Playacar on June 30, 2005. We were a bit disappointed when we got there because the property is much older and after our brief stay, we did not think it should have been rated as high as it was (according to Apple Vacations). The rooms did have a very STRONG musty smell. One of the deciding factors for picking this hotel was that there were 2 pools. Well, one of them was closed being painted, repaired, etc. The food was okay. Last year we stayed at the Riu Cancun (in Cancun) and it was rated the same. The Riu Cancun was MUCH nicer. First, it is a much newer hotel. Well, on our second day we received a notice in our room saying that they would move us, AT NO CHARGE, to the Riu Palace Las Americas (in Cancun). WOW!! This place was SO much nicer. The Palace was absolutely beautiful After a few initial glitches in our trip up there (45 minute ride, at NO additional expense to us) and that our room was not ready... we got a beautiful view and a top notch room. What a difference. If you have the opportunity to go.... DO IT.... We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beach holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and our 2 children (boy 16, girl 13) spent 5 days at the RIU Playacar this summer. We had an splendid time. What an incredible value -- similar accomodations in Florida would cost 3 times what we paid. The resort is lovely. The rooms are clean and spacious. Service from the staff was better than a five star hotel in London. The grounds are well-maintained and provide a tropical paradise ambience. The food is plentiful. While it is not Paris dining, it is delicious, with a wide variety. The RIU Playacar is located within the Playacar development of luxury hotels and residences. It is a sheltered view of Mexico. Playa Del Carmen is only minutes away ($5 by taxi) where there is plenty of shopping and a more genuine feel of a Mexican city (pop. 350,000). We felt safe the entire time we were there. The Mexican people are delightful. I have found this to be true in every part of Mexico (not counting the border towns from California to Texas). They are hospitable and friendly. While my partner and I could have relaxed the entire time at the resort, our kids were glad that we took 2 excursion trips. Both were all-day trips. First, we took the AllTourNatives trip to Coba and the native Mayan village. Great time. Second, we took the Mayan Adventures snorkeling tour. Excellent. Both trips were in brand new Ford vans with A/C that seated appx. 12 people. The drivers were safe and the tour guides entertaining and very accomodating. We learned much about the natives and the environment of the Yucatan peninsula. I don't usually stay at a hotel or resort more than once. There are too many other things to see. I would not hesitate to recommend the RIU Playacar to anyone. It was one of my best vacation trips ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the rooms and bathrooms are clean and updated, the staff is friendly, the beach is clean and town is only a $5 taxi ride away. Negatives are that the resort offers no ocean views and has no elevators. The food is edible but stay close to a bathroom; the liquor is plentiful but the quality is on the verge of being moonshine. If you are looking for a luxury resort, this is not for you. However, if you are looking for a relatively inexpensive trip to the beach at an average resort, you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Super-deee-dooper!!!=)”
Reviews.Author: bedbug
Reviews.Content: We visited the first week in June. We were absoutley blown away when we entered the grounds of the playacar. When we got off of the bus from the Airport we were greeted by friendly faces and everyone saying HOLA and then pointed towards the bar for a welcome drink! We were given our key to our room and we were both soo very excited to get to our room to see what it looked like and to see our view. We walked in and we both said WOW! it was soo extremely pretty and well we were worried about the smell because we read soo many reviews saying the rooms were a bit musty from the ocean. Ours wasnt to bad, but we were prepared with airfreshers. We stayed 6 days and the first 3 where great but it rained almost everyday we were there. But didnt mind because it was warm and we just stayed in the pool and enjoyed the pool bar in the rain. We both highly recomend to book a snorkling trip thru Fun Quest(glass bottom boat) it is a fairly cheap trip (to cozumel) and they took us to 3 different reefs and OMG talk about beautiful. AMAZING!! I am scared of large bodies of water and well lets say i would of done this everyday if we could of. Totally amazing and absoutely beautiful and the tour guides were FUNNY and soo VERY friendly and helpful! it was like 38 bucks per person and that included our fairy ride over to cozumel. WONDERFUL wonderful! Now back to Riu. The staff was amazing and the enterainment crew were awesome. They so deserve recognition for the extremely long hours they work and all the fun they provide to not only the kids but all of us adults as well. We got many laughs from the silly things they would do, wether they were planed or some not planed they gave us many laughs. The towel girl at the pool was very friendly every single day and always had lots of smiles to give and a nice warm hello! One thing we read here and do also advise it is to take a insulated cup/mug for your drink. It not only keeps stuff from melting so very quickly but you also get more and they gladly fill your cup to the top! Now about the beach. We both enjoyed it very much but was surprised it wasnt a tad bit cleaner. There was alot of dibree on the beach and even after it was raked. The errosion was pretty bad but didnt take the beauty away from the water. Lots of waves while we were there because t here was soo much rain. This is really hard for me to stop talking about because we had a AWESOME time. Just a absoutely beautiful place full of lots of extremely nice people(Alfredo at the bar was wonderful). I so hope that you have as good of a time as we did! I could go on for hours but I will stop! Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lupert87
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the reviews to the Riu Playacar and decided to write my own. We were there between June 16 - June 20. My cousin was getting married in the Riu Palace and when we made our reservations only the Playacar was available. Rooms: Great! We were upgraded to a suite when we got there. It was fantastic! Even the relatives staying at the Palace liked it better then there room. We stayed just across from the pool so the entertainment at night was a little loud but my 1 year old and 5 year old were able to sleep right through the noise. I actually would walk out to the balcony to hear. Cancun is 2 hours ahead so by the time they were done was the time I usually go to sleep. Beach: A little small but awesome! The white sand and blue water was amazing when you compare it to the one here in CA. Weather: Hot but bearable. Food: I loved breakfast and lunch. I'm not much of a dinner person so I only tried the Mediterranean one evening and it was ok. Service: One of the best I have seen. Atmosphere: Great! Comparison to Palace: When we go back in a couple of years I would definitely stay at the palace rather than the playacar. It is much prettier. However if they were booked again I would not hesitate to stay in the Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “overall good”
Reviews.Author: gtrbt0101
Reviews.Content: room was nice, food was good -steak house was very good- visited the riu tequila and it was much nicer but not near the beach so it was very hot- all rest. are outside with no a/c at both resorts. can't say anything bad just didn't have a great time. stayed in playa numereous times this resort was one of the nicest. half european/ half american, canadian (love the canadians).

Reviews.Title: “it is a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: isdToronto
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed with a two-year-old at the riu playacar the last week of may 2005. overall, it was a nice four star resort. rooms: extremly clean, nice and tidy. the stuff changes the towels and cleans the room every day. the rooms have marble floors and they look almost luxurious. i read that someone was complaining about the AC. we did not have that experience. the AC was working perfectly well, that well that we had to keep it on "27" degrees in order not to be too cold. beach: beach is nice. it eroded a bit but it was not even close as bad as in some of the resorts in the area. riu playacar has a huge beach so the fact that eroded a bit was not frustrating. the ocean is amazing! just the right temperature! perfect. the only problem were the waves, which were a bit of a problem because we had a toddler with us, but, regardless, the ocean was unspeakable! food: the food was quite good. they had over 300 different servings every night and the main meal was different every night (turky, roast beef, salmon, stuffed pork, roasted chicken...). so i don't really know what the people who complained expected. if they came to mexico to eat pizza or stake, of course they would be dissapointed. the food was, ectually amazing. i read the reviews before we left, so first night i did not take the shrimps, i thought that i could eat them the next day, but since the manu changes every day, i could not get them later. so if one can not choose a different meal out of 300, then they should eat pizza in mexico every day. p.s. mexican section of the buffet was AMAZING! the only complain was a regular dessert section, in was not as good, but they specials every evening, which were delicious! staff: staff was extremly friendly, all of them! according to the staff behaviour, this is a 6 star hotel! they were all almost too polite! and you can give them tips(we did) but there is absolutely noo need for them to be servile. only if you want to give them. i asked the receptionist to give as a room close to the beach and offered a tip, she said that she deos not take any tips and gave as exactly the room we asked for! pool: there is one big pool, that is divided into 2. we did not go to the pool during the day, we prefere the beach. during the day the pool was quite fuul, esspecially the one with the bar. in the afternoon, the water would get a little dirty, but nothing to be conserned about. we went swiming in the pool at nights, that is the best time! there is no one in the pool or around it, the water is clean, perfect! p.s. the water in the pool was too hot. overall look of the resort: it is a very nice resort. the grass and all the trees are cut all the time, it looks very neat. i did not like the exterior too much, but it is a question of taste. i would prefere the jungle-like resort like reef playacar of iberostar tucan, but as i said, it is a matter of preference, not the quality of the resort. we went on a few day-trips. i would recomend to do that. we went a fwe times to playa del carmen. taxi is 4$. it is amazing! it has both the traditional mexican athmosfere and some of the modern-style botiques and restorants. all the restorants look great. we went to see tulum, it is worth seeing, esspecially since there is the most beautifull beach in the world where you can have a swim after the 50 degrees at the tulum ruins. we went to see xel-ha- you should go there. they have a lot of different attractions. the lagune has millions of different fish that you can swim with. it is a great place to go for a change. overall impressions: we would go there again

Reviews.Title: “Would Go back Tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Riu Playa Del Car was wonderful. My Husband i took a second honeymoon we stayed at the RIU Playa Del Car. The Hotel was absolutely beautiful. The grounds were immaculate. The staff was great. Food ala Food all you could eat and more. There were so many varieties of food from different cultures as well as the mexican infuence. Great Entertainment something different every night. I really enjoyed the Friday night show of the Maya Indian ceremony. The swim up bar was always a delight. The beaches were clean with plenty of chairs for everyone. Sevice from the staff was wonderful as well. No one could go wrong. Im ready to pack my bags for a second trip to the same place.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted with tequila sunrises, followed by a very fast explanation of how things worked, then off to our room. I read reviews that the rooms smelled so we took air fresheners however they didn’t smell at all so I have no idea what that was about. You need to make sure to tip the guy who restocks your refrigerator. They say they restock it every other day but tip him and he is there daily with a smile on his face. Also tip the bartenders and get to know one of them. I liked the women bartender. The whole time she tendered the bar in back of the poolside bar. Pool was not too crowded and neither was the beach. Beach was eroded but beautiful. Water was really choppy but that was good to us. We had a blast jumping over the waves and riding them on the boogey board or letting them take you towards shore. One day the water was really calm and it was pretty dull. Food was awful. The first day everything was pretty good, second it got tired some, then it just got bad. You have to register each day before 10AM to get a seat for the non-buffet diner. DO THAT! The lunch/dinner buffet gets old fast. We are from Texas but it was HOT and HUMID there. The rooms AC units are not up to par for that heat for us. At night with the fan on full blast, a thin sheet on and the AC running all day it was still not cold. The showers are AWESOME! The rooms are actually really nice to be honest. No complaints at all except for the AC but we like it freezing. Drinking gets old and you feel kind of trapped there. Go into town. You have to ride a taxi but it’s easy just go across the street and call one. In town they are everywhere. That takes up a day. Here is our best part of the trip. Go to Xel-ha. It’s about 30 minutes away and about $100 per person for the trip and full amenities there. It’s awesome. The food is GREAT! They serve Modelo but who cares right? The snorkeling is the real treat! We saw huge schools of neon colored fish, sting rays, etc. right there in your face. It’s amazing! Plus they have a lazy river, cliffs to jump off of, hiking, etc. etc. Plus huge lizards everywhere! Awesome place. We also went to Tulum was ok but we have an excellent tour guide. Get one or else it will be boring. You can swim on the beach, better than the Playacar’s and swim in the backdrop of ancient ruins. Overall we had a good time. The only things we didn’t like were the food, AC, lack of night entertainment (consisted of couples simulating sexual acts and taking shots).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbyu
Reviews.Content: We spent May 21-May 26, 2005 at hte Riu Playacar and had a great time. We were going for our 30Th wedding anniversary and I was a little afraid of some of the comments that I had read on this site but now I am so glad that we chose this resort. I will say that we did not have one problem with this resort. We stayed at the Riu Palace last year and liked this resort better(and it was cheaper) The food was exactly the same. The alcoholic drinks were the same. The rooms were almost the same except for the bathrooms. We did not have a smelly room or drain problems. Every one at the hotel was very nice and worked very hard. On our anniversary we went to the steak house for dinner and the workers made a special cake for us and came over to our table and sang. We really loved this hotel. It was smaller than the Palace but much easier to get around. The hotel is right next door to the Riu Palace and The Royal Hideaway(very high dollar) so the beach area is basically the same. Yes, I will say that last years hurricane did alittle damage to the beach but you can't blame that on the hotel. I did not have any troulble walking the beach or getting down from the palm area. The only thing bad I can say about this hotel is that they need to spend alittle more time cleaning the pool. It did have a little scum line around it. But we had so much fun at the pool bar we really didn't care if the scum was there or not. They have a few activities in the afternoon like water baloon fights, bingo, dance lessons and so on. I won a t-shirt one day because after the baloon fight I turned in the most broken pieces of baloon. This is a great way to clean up the mess. We only went to one show at night because we had seen most of the shows last year . The show we went to was fabulous. The dancers were like wathcing a Las Vegas show. The bar down at the show area is the best!!!!!!!! The bartenders really try to please you and they also are very friendly. They showed my husband a few tricks like holding a glass full on liquid with only 3 fingers. He is going to practice on that before he tries it at one of our next parties. Please give this hotel a try I know you will not be disapointed. We have been to Cancun 4 times and Playa 2 times and this has been our favorite hotel so far. We would go back in a heart beat. Loved it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At the Rui from May 26 - June 2. We have been to three other resorts on the Riveria Maya and it didn't compare. It was a nice relaxing resort, but pretty laid back. It only had two pools, but there was still room for everyone. Some people didn't consider others. Entertainment was not up to what we have seen at other resorts. The beach was very nice even though it was eroded and sandbagged. The water was very rough and choppy. There are six of us that travel together and we wouldn't come back to this resort. The food was exactly the same the entire week. The Steak House dinner was good. It wasn't a separate restaurant. They divide the lunch area into two eating areas, one Steak and one Mediterranian. Very limited seating. All in all it is a nice relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the riu!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i loved the riu! i just came back on my stay from may 14th to the 21st!It was the most beautiful resort ever! i loved the riu. The beach was really pretty. Every day around 12ish these photographer come around and take photos. The photo we got was like a backdrop but 10 times better! Also if the beach doesnt seem to fill up that fast... but if you want to go rite byt the beach make sure to go there right away. They pool on the other hand was really crowded. We got there i think at 830 one day and all the chair were filled up.. so if u like the pool go there quickly. The food was basically the same everynite. They had different meat dishes( roast beef., duck etc.) but the side dishes were basically the same as lunch(pizza, fries etc) They have a snack sation by the threatre, which had popcorn and nachos with cheese. The bar tender are really friendly(basically the whole staff is) and if u really want to impress them try speaking spanish(augwa haha is water in spanish) The animation team is really fun... and the games they have at the beginning of the show are entertaining to watch. Also there is no need to really go into playa del carmen since there is a little market rite outside with a lot of AIR coniditon shops( haha it does make a difference) Yea the only thing i would suggest is that if u arent really for loud people dont go by the pool around threeish since because of the open bar haha, yea but one yur firt full day i would recommend a spanish class to help u around your stay. Also they are soooo many activies like boche, horshoes,volleyball and ping pong. It all depends on the day u are there since some days they have a barbeque or a mexican party! yea so if u go hope you have FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great vacation--Thanks everyone at Riu Playacar!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 15th -20th 2005, and really enjoyed ourselves. We had an excellant vacation. Everyone was so pleasant. I liked the personal touch of being greeted with a drink at check-in. It was a nice touch and a great way to start our stay here a the RIU. The food was very good for an all inclusive. If you don't like the food, it's not there falut. There was something for everyone, lots to choose from. They really try hard to please everyone! We did eat one night at the Medeterian Restaruant. The food was very good, but it seemed to take a long time to serve! Not a problem since we had nothing else planned! The room smelled a little musty the first day, but like everyone says, it goes away when you turn on the air! Actually I don't think I would have noticed it if I hadn't read it here first. The staff was wonderful and sure go out of there way to please you. The room was throughly cleaned every day, and it was spotless, they made little animals out of the towels and blankets with fresh flowers. Another nice touch! The mini bar and fridge were great, I loved the bottled water, stocked every other day, but if you ran out of something, just call and they would restock (and they did). We spent the first day at the pool. Very fun, but decided to try the beach the next day! This is then the place we camped out for the next 4 days! The beach was beautiful. There were plenty of chairs, sun or shade, just choose your spot!!!! It was a little walk to the bar everytime you needed a drink, but hay a little exercise is good for you!! The nightlife was a little quiet, but that was ok with us, we did head over to the Riu Tequilla one night and that was a lot of fun. At the Riu Playacar they did do a Michael Jackson show one night and that was fun to watch! There isn't anything negative that I have to say about this hotel. We have traveled a lot and this was really a great deal for all that we got! The staff went above and beyond to please, the food was great, and the beach was beautiful, what else do you need!!! We'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Riu Playacar. I have to say that the hotel is really just a moderate hotel, but the grounds are beautiful, well kept, and the beach is gorgeous. The beach front was fairly expansive with lots of palm trees scatterered among the beachfront, which gave it a nice tropical feel - great weather and a wonderful breeze. The swim up pool bar is a refreshing break from the beach as there is no beach service at the Riu Playacar. The food was adequate - nothing gourmet. I was tired of the buffets after four days, but there was a nice variety. The two evening dining restaurants, the steak restaurant and the Mediterranean are in the same place and their menus don't seem to change from day to day. The food was fine though. If you are staying for 7 nights, you will probably get a little tired of them. I suggest taking a cab to Playa Del Carmen and sampling one of the restaurants there. It is a charming little town with alot of ambiance, and you can find some great little restaurants. The rooms were ok as far as hotel rooms go, nothing luxurious, but this is not a luxury resort. Beds are hard, room stays cold, bathrooms are spacious. I would recommend taking Mosquito repellant. I have been to Cancun/Riviera Maya many times and never had a problem with bites. This time, however, I got biten up good by Noseeums - tiny, little microscopic mosquito type flies that live in moist, sandy areas and breed in the ocean. You don't even know you've been biten until it's too late! All in all, I prefer some place a little more upscale, but I still had a relaxing 4 days soaking up the sun, looking at the beautiful beach!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went down from May14-21 and had a blast. Some friends got married and the lot of us had a very good time. The beach was nice, the pool could have been bigger for the amount of people who used it however that didn't stop us from using the pool bar daily. Joseph is part of the 'animacion' group and had to be the best employee at the resort, the employees were great and pretty much always had a smile on their faces. The food was great and you had a great choice of items at the buffet, they make great drinks and the service is fairly quick. If you are looking for a good club, hit up the Blue Parrot. All in all the rooms, service, pool, beach, staff, food and drinks were all above average and we had a very enjoyable time at the Riu Playacar....oh ya, sun for 6 straight days!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeDowningtownPA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the RIU Playacar for a week 5/7 -5/14 and had a great time. The entire resort staff were very freindly and hospitable. Rooms were large and did have a minor musty smell but no big deal just use a/c or ceiling fan. Beach and pool area are very nice and clean , plenty of lounge chairs at both but prime spots fill up quickly. The towel girl is a sweetheart remember to tip. Just a couple dollars here and there and maybe as you checkout is all and even that wasn't expected. Food was very good as well ,large selection at all meals and our waiter Salmone at the buffet was exceptional He'll even teach you some Spanish while your dining. We only had dinner at the buffet and were satisfied there so we can't comment on the two restaurants. the grounds at the resort are well kept and the layout is nice not too big not too small. The evening entertainment was good some of the shows were better than others. The shopping center across the street is worth a look as well as the RIU Tequila just down the street it has a very large pool but no beach. The town of Playa Del Carmen is about a 25 minute walk or a short cab ride away for about 4 to 5 USD. The cabs are right out front of the resort there a bit small but clean and comfy. The town is nice with plenty of shops and quite a few restaurants. If you decide to go to Cozumel on the ferry the ticket booths can be confusing but either one will get you there at about the same time and the price was about the same 32-36 USD round trip per person. Just a word of advice if you are subject to any kind of motion sickness take your meds before you go( we both got seasick ) and did not get to do much other than look for Dramamine for the return trip. We would absolutly recommend this resort to anyone looking to kick back and relax and we are already planning our return for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from May 9-16/05. I too read the reviews before going and was a little worried. But my concerns were not founded as the resort was just awesome. It was a perfect place for some very tired and stressed out people. The atmosphere was very relaxed & enjoyable. We couldn't have asked for better service. The staff was very courteous & helpful. The room was beautiful & spotless. The bar & fridge in the room was an added bonus. Always stocked with bottle water for our convenience. We always found a nice spot on the beach to lounge. I love the sun & my husband is fair skinned. We never had trouble finding a spot to accomondate us both, sun for me & shade for him. A nice feature was there was a wedding on the beach during our stay. The staff did an awesome job of arranging it to make in very special for the couple. It was a nice touch to end a beautiful week. I can't wait to go back next year. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Playacar from May 14-21 with 25 guests attending our wedding. The resort was beautiful, but the beach/water is what makes the vacation. Although there are signs of errosion the beach is picture-perfect. The food was very impressive. By far the best food we have had in similar all-inclusive resorts. The staff was very genuine and friendly. It is very easy to get good real-estate at the pool or beach. The club at the Riu Tequila is fun if you make it so. Otherwise, you may want to try clubs in Playa del Carmen (like the Blue Parrot). Some of our guest's rooms had a moldy odour, but apparently turning on the A/C took care of that. We had a couple of people lose some money and/or valuables. Be sure to use the safe, and don't hang nice clothing over the railing. For those conisering weddings.... The wedding coordinators meant well, but they were utterly disorganized. Get EVERYTHING in writing prior to your departure. Even if it is in writing, phone and confirm prior to your departure. We were told we could get married on the Tuesday (we arrived late Sat evening). The day before we left, we were told that wasn't enough time to perform the blood test and that we would need to "TIP" the judge to make it happen. Do NOT use the services of the resort hair dresser. Over priced and bad results. The trio band was quite good at the ceremony. The photographer was actually very nice and telanted, although a bit pricy. You will pay approx 8USD per picture (and you don't get the negative/soft copy). If you want a full DVD of high quality shots (150 pics) it costs 600 USD. We paid for the DJ to bridge the gap between dinner and when some of us went to a club. Worked out well. Be prepared for people taking photos and videos during your ceremony. It is not very private. All in all, a great and memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: mrf423
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at Riu Playacar, 4/19-4/26, and had a great time. The hotel is very pretty and we found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful, unlike some reviews I've read stating otherwise. Our room was clean and spacious and very nice, and I really didn't notice a musty smell at all. The pool area and beach aren't huge but we found them very nice, and we were always able to get seats and there were plenty of shaded areas. We also found that the buffets and dinner dining were good, but I admit I got tired of the same food after awhile and we did eat in Playa del Carmen one night. The hotel is only about a 25 minute walk from town and we made the trip several times during the week, though we did taxi back if it was late (mostly because we were tired-we felt very safe walking at any time). The shopping center across from the hotel is convenient but be careful and save main shopping for Playa, where there are better bargains to be found. Be sure to bring singles for tipping hotel staff, tour guides, taxi drivers, etc. We tipped housekeeping $2 daily and received wonderful service-they even made cute animals out of the towels! My only disappointment was that when we booked we thought that our RIU privileges were for both the Yucatan and Tequila hotels. However, we learned on arrival that the Yucatan hotel is closed for remodeling and only the exercise room was available (which was dirty and had outdated equipment). Overall, for the price this is a great hotel, and we especially loved the climate and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar April 23 - 30, 2005. We had read many reviews before we went. Smelly rooms, hard beds, average food and small pool. Last year we had stayed at the Iberostar Parisio Beach, it was huge. This year our group of 29 people decided we wanted a smaller resort. Previously some of our group had stayed at Riu Playacar and had enjoyed their stay. It is hard to please a large group. ROOMS: Yes the beds are hard, but you are so tired at night from swimming, volleyball, body surfing and walking the beach you sleep good. Our room 2218 did not smell(if it had we had air fresheners).
