The only complaint about the room is the KEY you need to carry with you to the safe and room. The towel animals were fun. REMEMBER TO TIP !!!. FOOD: Our group of 29 ranged in age from 8 to 43. Everyone found something they liked to eat. Breakfast to dinner was very good. Ham is not the ham that we americans are used to.Roast pork is our ham . The Pasta bar was very good, Many choices of pasta, sauces and ingredients. The steakhouse was very good. POOL: small but nice. The bar needs to open earlier though. Plenty of chairs but reserve early. Tip the towel girl. It was fun to talk to other people here. There is another pool nearby that has no bar and is quieter later in the day when people begin to get loud. BEACH: The surf had played havoc on the beach, it is still nice. There are plenty of chairs under palm trees for napping. Walk the beach it is fun to watch all of the different people. topless sunbathing is present but not as much as I would have liked. BAR: Corona is the beer on tap, Pepsi products and 7-up are your soft drink choices. SHOWS: Good The town of Playa Del Carmen is a little over a mile away. (4 dollar cab ride.) It is a nice place with shops that you can buy jewelry to junk. Make sure you shop around. If you like to cook buy Vanilla to take home, it is very good. Everywhere takes US dollars. We took 200 dollars in ones and 100 dollars in fives, this made it easy to tip and also it keeps you from having pesos as change. There is plenty for all ages to do and the rooms are close to everything. We had a great time and would return again. It is a very good value for your money. The workers at the resort were very freindly and seemed to not expect tips, but remember, a dollar or two makes them remember you and when there is a line for drinks they will remember who has tipped them.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 28 of my best friends and I stayed at the resort April 23-30 and had the time of our lives. The rooms were nice, plenty cool and well stocked. The beds were plenty hard, but my husband slept like a rock. The pool was a blast, and we loved the bartenders and also the towel lady. The food was pretty good, especially when they fed us sandwiches at 2 or 3 am. Next year maybe we will try the newly remodeled Yucatan. Overall, this was a great vacation for a great price. If you want less rowdiness, go to the higher priced Palace (some of the guests from there came over to party with us every day because it was boring there). If you go there treat Noella the pool bar bartender very good, and she will do the same for you I guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Riu Playacr”
Reviews.Author: bakkerhb
Reviews.Content: We have been in hotel Riu Playacar from 19th until 26th March 2005. We arrived around 15.00 hours and got a very warm welcome. The woman at the rece ption (as well as the manager from the hotel) spoke Dutch, and although we didn't expect a warm welcome in the Dutch language while we are in Mexico it was a nice thing, while we were in the plane for about 11 hours and a bus took one hour. We got an explanation how it works with the Riu-hotels, like the dinner times, one is at 18.30 hours and one sitting at 20.30. You gave your room number and you could eat the whole week at the time you reserved, or if you wanted a change the time to earlier or later no problem as well. You also had your own table so you don't have to look for a free table. And a separate smoking and non-smoking area. Also we got two towel-cards which we used every day. During the day you can use all the activities and meals (except diner), drinks from all the Riu hotels. If you wanted they even could arrange an excursion to the Palace hotel to show you around this great hotel. Sometimes they also offer you a possibility to book to Riu Palace in Cancun, so if you want a change take it. Before you book your Riu hotel ask for a Riu-classcard via their website. You are saving points each time you are staying in a Riu hotel (doesn't matter in which country or when because they have hotels all over the world). With the Riu-card you can also pay for telephone/fax etc. costs or have an upgraded hotel room. Go to ---- and see what has to be done. The hotel rooms are very good with hard beds (twin or double) but very comfortable, there is a refrigerator, an A/C which you can regulate yourself, separate toilet-room, shower (which is great enough so you don't have any trouble that the shower curtain will stick against your body), a liquor-dispenser with booze as well as a safe deposit box and of course a hairdryer. There is also a great balcony with table and two chairs as well as clothes-horse. In the room there is plenty of space to tidy up your room, although the lighting at night in the room could be a little bit more if you want a read a book before you go to sleep. The musty smell is a part of the tropical weather condition and when you use the A/C it will be gone very soon. The room has sliding French window and when you don't like the A/C on all night you open the window because there is a insect screen so no mosquito/other bugs will come inside. Especially for the European people who read this review: take an adapter which you need to refill your batteries from your digital camera, video, MP3 or GSM or raiser. In Mexico they have 110 Volt instead of the 220 Volt which we are used to. Also bear in mind that you need a triple GSM, a dualband phone is not working. I had my birthday (41 years old!) the next day we arrived and the hotel maid had made beautiful animals (which she did every night but this night my bed was completely full with it) from the towels and there were about 10 balloons with all kinds of faces hanging in room, which was a nice gesture. By the way we had room 223 which was on the second floor at the end of the building and we had only one neighbour and looking over the "Riu-boulevard" which leaded to the beach. The property of the hotel is very clean and it is one of the smallest of the RIU hotels in Playacar. Although the hotel was completely full you could not tell because lots of people go on a trip or do some shopping or stayed at the beach at Riu Palace or Riu Yucatan. At the property of the hotel were also a lot of animals, like birds, lizards, squirrels, cats (you don't see them in the restaurants) and a strange kind of marmot. The hotel has a great beach which lots of trees and chairs, although about 15 meters of sand has washed away, but there is still lots of free space (also without trees) to put your beach-chair. We are beach people so about the swimming pool I can not tell your much, although I noticed there were always lots of chairs. Although at the end of the day (around 16.00 hours) there were hardly any beachchairs left. The water of the swimming pool was clean and great, not too cold not too warm. There is also a great animation team which start around 10.00 to do all kinds of exercise, Spanish lesson, bow and arrow play, volleyball, waterpolo, dance lessons, bingo and at night there were always great shows. By the way learn of view words of Spanish before you go to Mexico and the people will treat you like kings. The restaurants are great. The main restaurant is where you have your breakfast and diner. In the morning they have great choice of bread. Do you like toast make it yourself or take another kind of bread. There also juices, jam, cheese, eggs, milk, plane yogurt as well as strawberry and peach, fruits, meat, even peanut-butter corflakes, tea- or coffee or croissants or cakes or sweet-bread. If you like a hot meal in the morning also that is possible. At lunch there if a buffet in the restaurant near the theatre. There is also lots of choice like hamburgers, French Fries, macaroni (just ask the chef and he will fix you your once choice), salad bar, rice, fish, meat, pizza, fruits, all kinds of pastry and of course ice-cream. Diner you can use at the main restaurant or the two other restaurants at the property, but for these one you have to make your reservation in the morning with breakfast at the bar for the same day. We only tried the fish restaurant. It was very good. Diner is also great and many choices. There is always fish, shrimps, meat, potatoes fried or cooked, vegetables, also a table where they cook macaroni at your own speciality. Lots of fruit, pastry, ice-cream and salad-bar with of course the different kinds of olives. And also for the one who like to have sauce there is enough like mayonnaise, ketchup etc. The drinks in the hotel are also great. There is a card which will explain what is in a certain drink. Just ordered it and try it, if you don't like it order another one. And for some who are diabetic there is also soda, diet pepsi, water. Of course red/white and rose wine, bear. By the way you must try the Mexican coffee, delicious. Across the hotel there is a small Playacar shopping mall with clothes, drugstore, all kinds of souvenirs. If you want to go to Playa del Carmen you can do that easily by foot or when you are tired just take a cap and it will bring your there for only four Dollars. Don't forget when you are going to Playa del Carmen by foot, it is warm/hot, your foot will swallow and it is about 20 minutes steady walk. Also in Playa del Carmen there are lots of shops, restaurants and bar. My advise is not to stay in the hotel for your diner every night but go out once and take and marvellous diner in one of the restaurants. Most of the times there will be a Mexican band playing all kinds of songs and music to give you the right feeling of Mexico. You don't have to exchange your Dollars you can pay easily with Dollars, only it is a little more than the Mexican pesos. The excursions you can book with your travel agency, but it is also safe to book this across the street or in the centre of Playa del Carmen. Take your pick and enjoy yourself. We took a local bus which is going from the Centre of Playa del Carmen to Tulum, which was a beautiful temple at the sea with beautiful views. When people ask me do you want to go to this hotel again, I immediately would say YES. Enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Average resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We did the 4 day/3 night deal from April 28 to May 1. This resort is average. The pool is small compared to other resorts and the beach erosion really takes away from this property. I think peopel were coming over from the Riu Tequila (resort is not on beach), so it felt more crowded. The Riu Tucan is still under renovation, so access to that resort is not availalbe. Food was fine and the rooms were nice and clean. The smell everyone refers to is typical of every hotel we've ever stayed at in Playa. FYI, eating in Playa del Carmen is a great option too. La Parilla is excellent and there is an award winning Mayan restaurant on a side street that is good too. We've stayed at Iberostar properties in the area and they are always great. If you are looking for a couples only with small crowds, check out El Dorado Royal Resort and Spa. We've stayed there too and it was great and private. Only draw back is it is a $30 round trip cab to town vs. $9-10 if you stay in Playacar resort area.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, clean but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: mygetaway
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from Riu Placar. Considering all the other choices, would not stay there again unless price was considerably more attractive. Staff great and food fine, but there were other problems. Went with adult daughters and their husbands plus my spouse. Close to Playa del Carmen if that's an attraction to you. Meals - Seatings at 6:30 and 8:30. Seems to be no reason to have to make reservations. Reservations means you have assigned seating each night. If you go about 7:30, you will be rushed because they want it cleared out at 8:00 and closed for a half hour. Silly practice and not what I experienced at other resorts. Menu stays the same. Only have two specialty dinners: steak and mediterranean. Only a few tables available for reservations. I had to get up at 7 a.m. to make reservations. Breakfast is the best. Again, staff is great and friendly. Other Riu's to use: The Yukatan is closed, so guests from the Tequila will walk over to Playacar to use the Beach and pool. Very crowded at the beach. Need to "reserve" pool spot or beach spot by 8.am. Trade in your towels the night before to get a clean towel out early on you chaise. Money: Bring $1 and $5 bills - plenty. Many places will not give ANY change either in pesos or dollars. Riu PLaycar has a sign that says change only in pesos. There were items we didn't purchase because we weren't going to give a $5 for a $2.00 item. They do not accept USA coins. Rooms: Musty smell Damp - Never had such a smell on my belongings when I returned. Rooms clean and water is very hot. Should have listened to reviews and brought room freshener. At check in, we were told about the musty smell by the staff. Clean otherwise. Alcohol: I tried one type of alcohol in the room (a dispenser) and it was watered down. Drinks are not very strong but taste good. Bartenders are friendly. Photos: We made a special evening appointment with the hotel photographer and got really nice pictures of our family down at the beach at sunset. We tipped the photographer and paid the usual $6.00 for the pictures. Shuttle: none available to town. taxi ride is etiher 4 or 5 dollars each way. Short ride. Beach: small and eroded. Water was rough. Very very windy this time of year. Pool: adequate, but crowded. Bar fine. There were very very obnoxious guests (americans, unfortunately) who were in a crowd of about 20 and who were loud, rude and generally not family rated. I wished someone would have told them to cool it. Never experienced this at a Yukatan resort and I've been there about 4 times.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special in the resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are in our early 30s and have a 6 year old boy, stayed at riu playacar from april 19-26, 2005. Before going on this vacation I had read others' reviws and found them helpful. We requested a room in a north building, on a 3rd floor, facing the hidaway. And we were given exacttly what we wanted after I slipped $20 to the reception person. We had to wait for about 3 hours for the room to be ready. it was a nice room, quite. but there is some smell in the room, luckely we brought the plug-in air freshners, which everyone recommended. they helped a little bit. we complained about the sewage smell to reception, they kept calling us and asking if everything was ok, but really nothing was done. if you keep the A/C on all the time, there is no smell, but it gets really cold in the room during the night. They clean your room every day. Remember to tip the cleaning pereson every day. The beds are hard, but the bigger problem for me were the pillows, which are flat and uncomfortable. There are palm trees on the beach, which we did not like, too small, crowded, bad beach erosion. We used Riu Palace beach. That hotel is much, much nicer. If you can spare a few more dollars, you better go to Riu Palace. That hotel is sobeautiful, much cleaner. In Riu Playacar there were a lot of senior citezens, like 65-70+. Not too many kids. Pool area was always too croweded, the kids pool smelled dirty. We used the pool at Riu Palace: much bigger, much cleaner. The food was ok. mostly all the same, boring. We had an early seating at 6:30 in the evening for dinner. Staff is nice, always smiling, trying to please you. The entertainment program is ok. nothing special. We could not wait to go back home. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you are on a tight budget, or this is a last minute decision. I would definitely stay in Playacar village, but would go to a different resort, like Riu Palace or Iberostar Tucan.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Riu Playacar from April 15 - 25th. Had an absolutely fantastic time. Kids 10 & 19, had lots to do, close to Playa del Carmen and convenient shopping across the street. The hotel was immaculate, our rooms had a musty smell like all resorts we have been to in the tropics, but the air conditioning took care of that. Service was fantastic in the restaurants, front desk, or pool bar. You couldn't ask for more. We have been to many other resorts in various countries and would come back to the RIU Playacar in a minute. The one thing I did notice was people not tipping. Please, Please tip your cleaning staff and dinner servers - they make very little $$$'s and work very hard!

Reviews.Title: “our fantastic trip April 21-25, 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Riu Playacar! We had a great time! We are in our early thirties---and we found there are things to do for all ages. We arrived on a Thursday afternoon and we were immediatly greated (the second we got out of our shuttle) by someone to help us with our bags. We walked into a beautiful open lobby and were handed a welcome drink. The people at the front desk were helpful and friendly. We got to our room and our luggage was already there waiting for us. The landscaping is amazing--the beach area is breathtaking--the pool area is beautiful--the rooms and all of the buildings are incredably clean--the buildings where you eat and where the entertainment is are decorated beautifully(marble, granite, tile, chandaliers, hand painted murals). We went there to relax so we did not do alot of the activities. We went on the afternoon snorkling tour(highly recommend) where they take you out on a boat about fifteen minutes from the resort. Lasted about 1 1/2 hours, my husband went parasailing, and we did a little shopping. If you want to shop, there are plenty of places to go. Right across the street is a little shopping area where you can find everything. Playa del Carment is about a 5 minute cab ride. Beautiful town. There are lots of activies going on through out the dayat the resort. Spanish lesssons, sand volley ball, scuba lessons, bingo, water aerobics, dance lessons, snorkling, (all free) just to name a few. We took advantage of the pool(with swim up bar) and the great beach area. We can't say enough about how beautiful the beach is!! Very clean, amazing white sand, incredable clear water. The food is great-----and I am a very picky eater! I had no problems finding something at every meal. The menu is always changing so you don't get tired of the same things. The drinks were great. If you want the better tequilia in your drinks you just have to ask for it. The mini bar in the room was great to have. We enjoyed it alot!!!! The entertainment was good at night. So much to see. They really have alot of activities for the kids that stay there. They really include the kids in many things. We really can't say enough about the staff. So friendly, so helpful, just great. As you can tell, we had a great time--we will for sure go back. We like this better than Cabo san Lucas. We would definatly recommend this to anyone!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent our Honeymoon at the Riu Playacar from April 10-17 2005. This place is awesome!! If you are used to staying at the Ritz then this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a relaxing yet fun vacation for a very decent price then this is the place for you. We booked out trip thru Apple vacations and they were the best. All of our transportation to and from the airport was taken care of which made it so simple. There was a Apple rep in the hotel everyday to take care of anything we needed, including booking any side trips we wanted to go on. RESORT: The resort was beautiful!! The landscape was done to perfection. The pool area was nice although there was a strange odor coming from some sort of pool house back near the kiddie pool. So we just sat on the other side and problem solved. You need to get down to the pool rather early to get a chair at the pool, but we finally realized all we had to do is throw our towels down on chairs before we ate breakfast and nobody would move them. The towels provided for the beach and pool are not bad, but if you have the room in your suitcase you can always bring your own. ROOMS: I will say that there is definately a musty odor in the rooms, but like all the previous reviews I read before going we brought the plug-in air freshners and a few candles and it was fine. The AC in our room was ok it could have been a little cooler but after being in the room for awhile it was fine, Also keep in mind that the sliding doors to balcony are connected to the AC unit so if you have your door open for air the AC cuts off. The cleanliness of the room was excellent. If you need you bar stocked just ask a few dollars to the guy who is stocking definately did not hurt. FOOD & DRINK: This place is set-up for drinkers so if your not a big drinker this might not be the place for you. You will not find Budweiser anywhere inside the resort so if you want something other then the Corona then you will have tyo go and get it downtown. The frozen drinks are fine and there are so many to choose from try them until you find one you like. Don't be afraid to ask for more alcohol in your drink if you want it. True there are only a few "top shelf" liquors but we are only comparing it to what we are all used to. Try something different you are after all in a different country. As far as the buffet and your reservations it was simple the day we got there we were in the lobby saw a man coming out of the restaurant we stopped to ask and in two minutes he had us booked in for the whole week at the same table. We had the 8:30 dinner seating but found the crowd to be far less about 9:15 there was still plenty of food left and we never felt rushed. SERVICE: What can I say these people were all very friendly and took great care of us. They all work there butts off for very little money so tips are really appreciated and they deserve it. BEACH: The beach is breathtaking!!! Plenty of sun or shade!! The chairs work just like the pool throw your towels on them early and they will be there when you are ready. All in all this is a great resort that we would go back to in a minute. The price was right and we loved everything about it. If anyone has any questions at all feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar - just say no”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In 3 words - DON'T DO RIU. Go to the Playa DelCarmen/Mayan Rivera but Don't stay at the Rius. Bad service, bad food, bad attitude! My husband and I went to the Riu Playacar for our first anniversary and were Very disappointed. The service is terrible! It started the first night when we arrived late, around 9pm, and asked where we could get a bite to eat. We were told the El Porche was open to 10pm so we rushed across the lobby to the restaurant - we grabbed a couple of cold pieces of pizza and received many dirty looks when we were told they were trying to close up.... FYI: the brochure says 'snacks until 2am', 'snacks' = hot water for tea or coffee and popcorn was all we found... After our cold pizza we went to look at the beach in moon light and were surprised to not see any beach cabanas or palupas. We asked the front desk if any shelter was available (We're both fair and I was 3 months pregnant which means direct sun is Not a good idea). The nice 'host' said "oh yes, in the morning all the beach chairs are set up and beach umbrellas are available". There is NOT an umbrella on the premise (there are a few palupas around the pool). You can lay under Palm trees but be very aware of falling coconuts (I'm not kidding). The Riu staff will say Anything you want to hear to make you go away (a fact that was displayed again and again). Then to bed - the Hardest bed I've ever had the displeasure of sleeping on! Pillows - I've used thicker tissues! Every morning we woke up sore and with a beaten feeling. The food is boring and below average (I'm being kind, my husband would have a few more choice words I'm sure...) There is only one non-reservation restaurant for dinner, El Porche - an out-dated Miami/Golden Girls inspired restaurant with very limited seating outdoors (I didn't travel to eat in a depressing interior) - and you have to decide on the early seating or later seating and stick to that schedule. We were told if you ever want to change from late to early or visa versa "no problem" (again - say what the guest wants to hear so they go away). So, one night we wanted to eat early rather than our usual late seating and you'd swear we had asked to be hand-feed off golden platters. ATTITUDE! Then my husband found a hair in his food...not a good night! The "2" reservation restaurants - are actually the same place (by the beach). 1/2 the room is the steak menu, 1/2 is the seafood and No you can't mix the two/order from different menus (regardless if one you loves steak but the other loves fish). Both were ok, but the menu does Not change; same appetizer, starter, entrée choices and same dessert EVERY night and the menu is also the same at the other Rius (the Yucatan and Tequila) you're allowed to dine at. Yet More Attitude: the night my husband found (a short and curly) hair in his "freshly prepared" food he complained to the waiter, who told us he'd speak to us boss...we waited...and waited...and waited...finally found the waiter and asked what was happening - nothing he said, he told his boss, that's it. We had had it! Ed went to the front desk, was shown to the manager's office. The manager listened, her response "well, if you don't like it here you can go and stay some where else"... UNBELIEVABLE. The worst customer service EVER. We didn't spend thousands of dollars to be treated like crap! There are more examples but I think you get the idea. I will never stay at a Riu and warn everyone I speak with not to trust the Riu name! We were in Aruba the year before for our honeymoon and stayed at a Wyndham - this chain I Would Highly recommend. My sister just came back from the Mayan (on our advice did not stay at any of the Rius) - they went to the Royal Hideaway (which we said looked beautiful from the beach) and could not Rave enough about the Hideaway - they said the staff in particular we Outstanding! Nice to know it's not the area - it was just the lousy Rius attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Hated to Leave - Would return tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two children (boy 16 and girl 13) from March 26 to April 9, 2005. This was our first trip to a sun resort since our honeymoon 18 years ago, and we loved it. The resort was everything we could have asked for. ROOMS - Check in was quick and painless, 10 to 15 minutes. We asked for adjoining rooms, and got them. We stayed in rooms 4208 and 4209, which are are the second floor of one of the middle buildings, facing the center walkway. The rooms each had two double beds, pushed together. This worked out well because each person had their own bed. Friends who we met there had one room for the four of them (parents and 2 girls 13 &11) and they were cramped for space. Check out was lightning fast (30 seconds)! We had no phone calls and turned in our keys, safe locks and towel cards and they said thanks, you're done, please come again (basically). Each room had a desk/bureau with three drawers and two nightstands with 2 drawers each. This gave us planty of room to put away our clothes and other stuff. There was also a large closet with a room safe. Each room had a small table and two chairs, a 20" color TV and a luggage table. One each balcony was two resin chairs and a resin end table. The bathroom had one vanity; the liquor dispensor with gin, vodka, tequila and rum; a mini-bar with pop, beer and water; a 4' by 4' shower with a handheld shower that could be adjusted to different heights; and the toilet which is behind its own door. The housekeeping staff kept the rooms spotless. We left $2.00 US in each room every day and we were greeted with some amazing towel designs, including mermaids, swans, elephants and babies. We left the rooms early, usually by 8:30, and our rooms were finished before noon everyday. The mini-bar was refilled every second day as promised. Our friends did have difficulty getting diet pepsi, but mostly because the person with the diet pepsi showed up at 10:00 pm as our friends were getting into bed. Regarding the various complaints we've read about the rooms: Yes, the beds are very firm and the pillows are thin, but by the end of the day we were all so tired we had no problems sleeping. We prefer firm beds anyways. Yes, the rooms did have a musty smell from the air conditioning, but it disappeared with 20 seconds of entering the room (at least that we noticed). The air conditioning worked fine, in fact some days we turned it down becuase our rooms got too cold. Our clothes did smell when we got home, but they all needed washing from the humidity, they came home damp. As for noise, we heard nothing, and I am a light sleeper! MEALS - The food was excellent! The breakfasts were amazing with eggs of every form, pancakes, french toast, omelettes, fruit, cereals, breads and other baking. They have a juice bar with 6 different juices, on top of your orange, pinapple, grapefruit and apple. The lunches were down by the pool and consisted of hot foods, salads, fruit, breads, burgers, hot dogs and pizza. There was pasta station with made-to-order pasta and self serve soft ice cream. The dinner buffets were in the main dining room. The entrees usually included two fish dishes; pork, chicken and beef; fajitas; burgers, hot dogs and pizza; the pasta station and a Mexican table. There was also a large salad bar and a large dessert bar. We ate at both of the a la carte restaurants, and they were both very good. The avocado appertizer at the Mediterranean was exquisite! The menus were limited, but the meals were excellent. As with most buffets, the food can get monotonous. Looking back, we think the problem was you take a little of everything every time, and thereby get tired of fish, chicken and pork every night. Trying sticking to one or two entrees per meal if you are there for two weeks. The staff in the restaurants were great. You do get an assigned table with an assigned seating for dinner, which suited us just fine. We liked it because you got the same waiter and they looked after you very well. Our only suggestion is that it would be nice to have a sandwich bar or station available for lunch. The breads were there, but some cold cuts, sliced cheeses, lettuce, tomatoes, sprouts etc. would make a nice change from all the other food. BARS - The three bars opened at 10:30 am and stayed open until midnight. The service was great and so was the selection. We had daquiris, margaritas, beer, mai-tais, screwdrivers, riviera mayas and just good old CC & 7. Yes they are served in small plastic cups during the day, but we brought the insulated mugs and they filled them right up. The drinks were not watered down, in fact some could use some watering down, and we never had a long wait at the bars. For those interested, they did have a dark beer at the bars, all you have to do is ask for "cervesa negra", otherwise you get corona. POOL & BEACH - The pool and the beach were amazing. Playacar is supposed to have calm water, but we had 3' to 4' waves for most of our stay. This was fun to play in, but as we found out, it covered most of our beach. Once the water calmed down. we have another 20' of beach in front of the hotel. The pools were great. We spent most of ur time around the pool without the bar because it was quieter and our kids are water rats. They kept the pools and pool area spotless. There was one fellow who spent all day cleaning leaves from the pool and other just sweeping and general housekeeping. They have lots of shade around the pool with these thatched umbrellas (palapas?) all over the place. They were building more all the time we were there. As for the beach, there are lots of palms to give minimal shade, or if you go behind the massage hut there is lots of shade. It also appeared that the erosion problem refered to in some reviews is healing itself. STAFF - The staff at the hotel are amazing. They are the friendliest and most fun-loving people I have ever met. We found them to be extremely helpful, although honestly, we didn't need a whole lot of help. They did arrange transport for us to Xel-ha, got us taxis into Playa Del Carmen and helped us with some minor issues. The animation staff were the best, friendly and they got you involved. We did air rifle, water volleyball, water polo, bracelet making, spanish lessons, scuba demo, bingo, and there was much more to do. GUESTS - Regarding the other guests, the only ones we had problems with were Americans, not all, but some. We realize you spent good money to get there, but so did everyone else. The ugly few were constantly butting in front of you at the bars, the buffet and even the front desk. Heaven forbid you give the person in front of you a foot of breathing space, because someone would push in, worse than rush hour! And the disrespect they showed the staff! You are a guest in their country! If I went to Texas or Florida or California and treated resort staff the way some did, I would get deported and Dubya would nuke Ottawa! Remember people, you're not at home, this isn't the Waldorf Astoriaand your not eating at a 5-star restaurant. Relax, enjoy and experience a different lifestyle. After all, that's what we're all there to do, and the staff is more than happy to help you acheive that goal! ACTIVITIES - As stated earlier, there are way to many to discuss. Just go and enjoy. Off the resort, we did go to Xel-ha. The kids swam with the dolphins, which was wonderful. The snorkeling however was every disappointing. The water was cloudy, the bottom sandy and we saw very few fish. Snorkeling down their river is also a little scary because your competing for space with the people floating down on the inner tubes. We also went snorkeling on a trip booked through the dive shop. They took us by boat about 15 minutes down the coast, just past Xcaret. We saw lots of fish and coral, very nice. Went to Playa Del Carmen twice. Shopping there is good. We had lunch at Carlos and Charlies - excellent! One note - the Kahlua in Playa runs aroudn $9 US for 750ml, I paid $13 for a liter at the airport. Do you own comparison shopping. Overall, would we return - yes! Would we stay at the Riu Playacar again - MOST DEFINITELY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've read all the comments about this resort (the good and bad ones). All I have to say is that this resort was great. If you are into partying crazy every day and every night, this may not be the ideal place for you. Its a place where you go to relax. There's activities to do and the staff is amazing. I would definatly love to go back again. P.s. If anyone has pictures from the resort and shows etc, I would love to see them or find postings of them. My camera broke and all the film was wasted.

Reviews.Title: “Fun trip - value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Oceanfish
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4/9-4/16/05 at the RIU Playacar with 2 other couples. We are in our late 30’s/early 40’s. This is our second trip to the Riviera Maya/Playa del Carmen area and our 3rd all-inclusive vacation and my husband and I agree with previous postings that it was a great trip for the money. We paid ~$2400 per couple (including air fare and transfers) through Worry Free Vacations. We never like to go to the same place twice, so we would likely not stay here again, however I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to friends. If you are looking for a very upscale, high class resort or a place with a lot of exciting nightlife, this resort isn’t it, however it is a great upper-middle class resort with value for the money. ROOMS: Clean, basic, lots of closet space – never enough hangers, so we brought some. Beds are hard but didn’t bother us too bad. Sheets and comforters are scratchy. There are some blankets in the closet that we put down on the bed and it made it softer. Bathroom area roomy. Toilet is separate with door from rest of bathroom. Large minifridge stocked every other day with 7up, orange soda, mineral water, 3 large bottles of water, 4 coronas, 2 pepsis. Mini bar had Jose Cuervo, and local rum, gin and vodka. If you run out, just call the front desk and they deliver more. The person who stocks the minifridge is a different person than the maid. Minifridge was usually restocked in the afternoon. We left a note of what we wanted. They have Diet Pepsi – called Pepsi Light if you ask for it. Floors are tile and slippery when wet. No problem with bugs, except a few mosquitos. Maid service was great. Brought a glade plug in, a small travel bottle of febreeze and a few drier sheets for drawers and the “musty” smell of the tropics never bothered us. Room keys are on regular key fobs (piece of square plastic) so we put one key on the safe key lanyard and brought another key lanyard along so we could each have a key around our neck vs. having to have a pocket. BUILDINGS AND OVERALL RESORT: Buildings 1, 3 and 5 are on theater side. There was some construction at the resort next door, so I suggest you try NOT to get a room on the south side of these buildings – they seemed the noisiest. 5 is closest to the theater, so if you like quiet, I wouldn’t recommend this one. Buildings 2, 4 and 6 are on north side of resort. We typically stay on the 2nd or 3rd floor at resorts, but stayed on the 1st floor this time and really liked it. We were in building 2, rooms 2105, 2106 and 2107 and they were quiet for the most part and close to the lobby. The resort was very clean, well groomed and the staff was constantly cleaning up. We never felt unsafe during the entire trip. We had no problems with theft. There are NO TIMESHARE salespeople at the RIU, which was a great. No workout facilities on site. INTERNET: There is a little computer room off of the lobby. $3 for 20 minutes of internet access. There is someone there to help you too since the keyboards are a little different than the US. BEACH: Yes, it has eroded but is still beautiful and plenty of room. You can no longer walk to the beach up to Playa del Carmen though, due to erosion farther north. You do need to go down and reserve a chair (throw a towel on it) fairly early as they chairs were mostly taken by 10 a.m. We stayed at the beach in the morning and the pool in the afternoons. There is no bar right on the beach, no beach wait staff service and no bathrooms really close by, so it is a little walk, but not a big deal and a way to walk off some of the calories! Some topless women. Speedos galore on men of all sizes too. SERVICE: Very good. We did tip a few bucks here and there and tipped the maid ~every other day, but really it wasn’t necessary. Staff works hard. Animacion staff very energetic and always something going on. LIQUOR: Corona is what’s on tap and in the minifridge. They also have 2 other beers at the bars – they are listed on the menus at the bars but I can’t remember what they are - something like Negra or similar? Ask for top shelf liquor by name. No Jack Daniels or Captain Morgan available that we could find. They did have Baileys and some other top brands, although I did hear people say they didn’t have any really high end quality liquors. They did have Jim Beam and a ton of Tequilas, etc. We didn’t find the drinks watered down – quite the opposite. If you want more liquor in your drink, just ask. The wine is not top quality wine and was dry, but is ok. The guys in our group drink Budweiser, so we went into Playa del Carmen one day and bought a case of Bud to bring back. There are several little mini marts in Playa del Carmen and you can find Bud and other brands for ~$1 a can. SHOPPING: There is a small plaza right across from the resort. Playa del Carmen is only a ~$4 cab ride (20 minute walk) north of the resort. We also went to Cozumel for a day and our friends said the shopping there was much better than in Playa del Carmen. Playa seemed to have a lot of little shops all peddling the same line of touristy goods and not very good quality. FOOD/RESTAURANTS: Great buffets. Something for everyone. Always many choices. But after 7 days, no matter how wide a variety, buffets get somewhat tiring, so you can always go into town for a meal. Lunch buffet was the weakest, but still lots of variety and good food. If you are looking for high end seafood, etc. you likely would be disappointed. My friends said the “fancy desserts” (cheesecake, etc.) weren’t very good. Steakhouse – ok; not Midwest quality beef but a nice change. Didn’t try the Mediterranean restaurant, but didn’t see anything too spectacular on that menu. One main drawback to this resort is you have to choose the 6:30 or 8:30 seating time and stick to it all week. The buffet can get to be a madhouse so we found if we waited until ~7:15 it was better. DRESS CODE: Men are supposed to wear slacks to dinner, but we found nice shorts were accepted in the buffet with a shirt with sleeves, which was great. HEALTH: Most of us got mild diarrhea at some point, but in all honesty that was because we ate and drank too much. The oily “foofy” drinks such as pina colada, Miami vice, etc. are great, but if you drink 10 of them it is to be expected that you will get a little tummy upset. No serious stomach problems though. POOL/BARS: Two separate pools – 1 with swim up bar and a separate one more for relaxing. We loved the swim up bar in the afternoons. Bring an insulated mug since the glasses they use are tiny. I don’t think if I had small children I would let them swim in this pool in late afternoon – it is a swim up bar pool and the bathroom is a little ways away, so you get the picture. Resort doesn’t have floaties but you can buy in the gift shop, in Playa, or pack one. Pool is shallow enough to stand in (I’m 5’3”). My husband was disappointed there weren’t any “theme” bars at the resort – i.e. no piano bar, sports bar but there were still plenty of options. SHOWS: Micheal Jackson show was good. Others we heard were not Vegas quality, but ok for something to do. Shows don’t start till 10 p.m. There is usually some type of kids show before the 10 p.m. show. EXCURSIONS: Xel-Ha was great. Get the all-inclusive plan – worth the money. We ate at the Mexican restaurant there and it was very good. We did “Discover Scuba diving” through the Scuba Caribe dive shop at the resort and had a great time. It was $130 per person and we got to do 2 dives and they take you out right from the resort. Be sure to be aware of their refund policy. One couple with us wasn’t able to complete the diving, but couldn’t get their money back. They did let 1 friend go on the snorkel trip instead though. If you are adventurous, you might want to go to Mezcalitos beach club on the far east side of Cozumel and try the ring toss game and get your picture taken at the “Naked Beach” sign….not recommended for kids. If you go to Cozumel and rent scooters, beware…driving is reckless and you are taking your life into your own hands. Our group rides motorcycles and said you couldn’t pay us to rent scooters over there! GENERAL COMMENTS: Bring comfortable shoes and light weight clothes that you can layer if needed. Visit mapchick before you go for tips and they also have great maps of Playa, Cozumel, Cancun, Riviera Maya. Take lots of small bills - $1’s, 5’s etc. for tips or buying stuff – no one ever seems to have change except pesos. LEAVING: Cancun airport – long lines, lots of waiting, they randomly pick people to search luggage by hand; outrageously high prices ($3.50 for bottle of water; $1.80 candy bar). Bring a bottle of water with you and eat before you get to the airport. Overall this was a great vacation and a great value for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeBeachbound
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this 6 days before we leave for our 4th year at the Riu Playacar Resort. We are so excited to be going back to "paradise." I've read so many reviews and can hardly believe what I read, the food is poor, the rooms smell musty, the service was not what you pay for, the pool is nasty, the drinks are watered down, yada yada yada! I can assure you this, if you are an average couple with a 70,000 to 80,000/yr income, who are not too good and snooty to enjoy life, then this is the place for you! I can only think these bad reviews are from people who are use to extravagant vacations with an extravagant budget. This is a fantastic package at a fantastic price. The resort is breathtaking, the sand is so white and the water so aqua. Everyone at the resort will bend over backwards to help get you what you need/want. The food is delish, morning, noon and night! The rooms may smell a little musty but remember where you are "THE BEACH!" they smell musty in Myrtle Beach and in Florida too. The service was awesome, as soon as you are done with your plate, someone is there to take it away. At no time do you see any of the workers slacking, they are the hardest working people I've ever encountered, my husband and I recognized that on our first trip. As far as the pool goes, each and every morning as soon as the sun comes up the staff is out cleaning, mowing, raking, and setting things up for YOUR enjoyment, not one time could I say the pool needed cleaning....maybe some leaves would blow in but that's about it! The drinks are fixed exactly as requested. My husband and I drink rum and coke, all you do is order it, they pour till you say when and fill the rest up with coke. TIP, TIP, TIP, REMEMBER, these people make $17.00 US dollars a day, they work long hard shifts, 6 days a week! They don't expect a tip, but appreciat it very much if you do. I can't imagine anyone having anything negative to say about this place! It is a "must do" vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Fun In The Sun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Mexico and we enjoyed it very much. The resort is very clean and the workers are all so cheery and willing to do anythign for you. The breakfast buffet is great: fresh fruit, made to order eggs/omelettes, great breakfast sausage, and about a million other things.. Lunch is a typical buffet, again, with more choices than you will know what to do with. The guacomole and tortilla chips come highly recommended. For dinner, you can either choose a buffet, or the Mediterranean Restuarant or Steak House Restuarant. The Steak House is great, with a wonderful show when they serve the baked alaska for dessert. The booze is pretty good. They have Corona on tap and the mixed drinks seemed strong enough. If you want high end alcohol, just ask for it. The bars don't tend to be too busy, and the drinks were quite easy to get. The only problem I ran into was a scam one night when I was walking on the beach. A guuy dressed in a security uniform told me I needed to give him 40 dollars to walk there. When I wouldn't give it to him, he tried to follow me, but I got in his face, and he backed off. Not trying to scare anyone, just be aware so you don't get taken for a ride, so to speak. Also, be aware of the nude European sunbathers, they can take you by surprise. Overall, the weather was great, the people were amazing, and we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomparable 'deal'!”
Reviews.Author: nmbonline
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 8 days at the Riu Playacar in May 2004 and had a great experience for the price! We went through APPLE VACATIONS and our entire all-inclusive stay with airfare out of Charlotte, NC, was less than $2000 for both of us! Wow! So you have an idea of our "tastes" to base this review on, we spend our honeymoon at Sandals/Beaches Royal Plantation in Jamaica, and have stayed in places like Spanish Bay at Pebble Beach. But we also have enjoyed taking weekend trips to Myrtle Beach and camping in the mountains. Here are the highlights: GETTING THERE: It is about a 45 minute ride from the Cancun Airport - through Apple Vacations (or others), they provide included transport in nice vehicles. EASY! CHECKING IN: Somewhat chaotic if a lot of people are checking in/out but they do serve a cold beverage. The staff was friendly. SCENERY: Breathtaking! It is a lucious resort with plenty of tropical plants and great landscaping. BEAUTIFUL!!! ROOMS: Unique with 12X12 tile floors and an bathroom area separated with a curtain. (Toilet area does have a door) The king bed is two doubles pushed together and is very hard. It wasn't great, but we kept telling ourselves, it was only $2000 for the whole package! There is A/C unit that is only on while you are in the room but when it worked, it kept it really cool. The balcony was great, but NONE OF THE ROOMS ARE DIRECTLY ON THE OCEAN. We didn't spend much time in our room, so it wasn't a big deal, but thought you all would appreciate knowing. STAFF: Fantastic! This was the best part of the resort. Everyone was so hospitable and willing to help us. In the morning, you give the great guys at the towel kiosk your "towel ticket" and they give you a towel. In the afternoon, you give back your dirty ones and they give you your ticket back. So you really get to know these guys and they are a ball of fun! The "fun staff" (the ones that try to get the guests involved with stuff) are great - they give you great suggestions on things to do in the area based on your interests. BEACH: It's as if you are sitting in a postcard! You can see from the pictures that people posted, it's a vast area with tons of palm trees to sit under for shade. The water is warm and gorgeous. And the sand is perfectly white and beautiful! BEACH ACTIVITIES: They had volleyball all day long and salsa lessons & Bingo in the afternoons at the pool area. There was always something to do if you wanted to do it. You can also use the sea kayaks and catamarans for free. Fun! You can charter snorkel trips from the resort too. We had a ball on our trip - the ocean was unusually rough, but it was such an adventure on the boat! Worth the money. My husband would probably add that another "beach activity" is people watching - the Riu resorts are very popular with Europeans which we thought was GREAT because it added to the experience - we met a lot of really fascinating people! Some women are topless and the men where tiny little things. No biggie to us, but thought you might be interested to know. OTHER ACTIVITIES: They had shows each night at the Playacar and the Tequila across the street. They were entertaining and everyone seemed to really enjoy it. There is a "disco" at the Tequila which was quite fun. The town of Playa is just a 5 minute/$5 cab ride away. There is very upscale shopping and great bars and restaurants equipped with mariache bands and all! FOOD: Available available for all meals is a buffet that was good. The lunch buffet is outside and has some of the best guacomole ever! Breakfast was great each morning outside! (It's also available inside in the A/C - no worries.) For dinner, you are assigned a table after you check in and you're supposed to sit there each time. Depending on how crowded they are depends on how strict they are.We tried the Steak House - wasn't great, but wasn't bad either. You have to have separate reservations for the non-buffet reservations. No big deal though. BARS: We thought they were great! We also didn't go to the Playacar to get 30 year old Scotch. :) We tried dozens of different fruity drinks, margaritas, and simple Rum & Cokes. We definitely tried plenty of tequilas at the different bars. The swim-up pool bar was great! Overall, it was a GREAT trip for the money. If we had spent $4000, we would have been supremely disappointed. But we didn't and REALLY enjoyed ourselves and have recommended it to tons of people. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “First Time Doing an All Inclusive, and Won't Again”
Reviews.Author: KimmyKay
Reviews.Content: Here is a summary that will hopefully help anyone considering an all inclusive trip: This was my first all inclusive vacation and first time to this area in Mexico. We agonized over where to stay since we read so many mixed reviews of too many resorts. So after taking the plunge, here is a topline of our experience: FOOD - moderate to poor. Expect buffet for all dining experiences with the exception of two nights in which you can get a reservation for a sit down meal. If you go on vacation to be waited on , this is NOT your place. Typical buffet food- pizza, spaghetti, cheeses, breads, salad bar. Do not expect any regional or authentic mexican food ironically! Thank god for tortilla chips and guacamole. No room service either. The only food available in between dining service is popcorn and a bad nacho machine - imagine a cheese pump nacho case from a football game. If you are looking for late night munching after drinking, forget it. NOTHING but the bad popcorn and faux nachos. BUT the breakfast buffet is GREAT. Tons of options and fresh fruit blended into smoothies. And there are awesome espresso machines that are self serve and serve great cappaccino's and latte's. We ventured downtown and found some great spots for food since we couldn't stand to do dinner in our place one more night. BOOZE - This is an area in which no one went into detail on the reviews and wish I had know the real deal. The only beer available is Corona ON TAP. And it tastes pretty bad. They do stock the mini bar with a few Corona bottles which is nice. There are no servers around the pool area or beach serving drinks - you'll have to get up off your chair and get your own drink. Very very few name brand alcohols - ONLY if you ask you can get basic Bacardi in the mixed/blended drinks. And there is Cuervo. If you are a Vodka drinker, you are out of luck. The only vodka available is Smirnoff or some scary local brand and it is grim. Bring an insulated mug for drinks - the glasses they serve drinks in are tiny. The blended drinks all taste the same , bad syrup-ey mixes without any fresh fruit in them at all. Also, no clubs or "disco's" on site. Any partying has to be done off site, downtown PDC or another Rui resort close by. SERVICE - GREAT. Everyone there was incredibly cheerful and very helpful if you had a question or special need. Definitely tip please! They work LONG hours and have to put up with a lot of crazy demanding tourists. Even on our last day, the front desk ran around to find us to let us know our flight was delayed. ROOM - I thought it was fine - although beds are harder than rocks. Ask for a north building room - much quieter . And our north facing room had a super private patio over looking the grounds without any obstruction of other buildings/rooms. BRING an air freshener - the plug in kind that runs all the time. Rooms are very musty and will quickly seep into all of your belongings. POOL - lots of sun space around pool. And big pool too. Tons of chairs - but you do have to get up pretty early to get one right by the pool in a area with lots of sun. They go quickly. If you are the type of person who will eat anything and doesn't mind lower rank alcohol, this could be a great destination and a great value. But if you are looking for a place to be pampered and served with great food and top shelf alcohol, then an all inclusive is definitely NOT the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen”
Reviews.Author: Yooper54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar and we were having a wonderful time until we discovered that money was missing from our room safe. Some of our money was left but most was stolen! After this incident it was hard to enjoy ourselves and feel safe. We notifed the hotel asst. manager of the theft, we were treated very rudely and they pretty much denied that it could have happened. He never apoligized to us - just denied it, defended his staff and said we should look elsewhere for our money. He insisted there was only one key but I am not convinced of that. How else could our money be missing. Beware and watch your stuff! It really ruined our vacation for the remainder of the time. Very disappointed in how we were treated. I had read several reviews prior to going and only a few stated problems with theft - now I know it's true. I can no longer recommend this resort or go back there. It's a shame that one bad apple ruined our outlook of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from March 12-19. We had read many reviews before booking and were a little concerned with the small size. However, we were more than pleased with our whole experience. Upon arrival we were pleasantly greeted with roses and drinks and our rooms were ready, even though it was only 1:30. The front desk staff was very accommodating and eager to help us get settled in. We had our 2 children (23 and 19) with us. Our rooms were very nice -clean, spacious, nice furniture, beautiful balcony! The rooms were a little musty at times but certainly not unbearable like some people whined about in their reviews. The dining rooms were nicely laid out and breakfast was the best meal of the day. The food overall was good and we had no problem finding something we liked on the buffet. The Steak restaurant was very good, but we didn't try the Mediterranean one. Lunch was O.K. The hand tossed pizza was excellent and they had lots of choices for kids. The pool was great and the swim up bar was never too busy. There was always enough going on but there didn't seem to be an over abundance of partiers around our hotel which suited us just fine. We went to the Tequila most nights for the entertainment - their stage was very nice. We ate at the Yucatan one morning for breakfast but liked the size of the dining room at the Playacar. The wait staff were wonderful and accommodated us each and every evening. We were supposed to have a table for 4 people, but our party was 14 people one evening and they had no problem taking care of us. We had a few minor problems with our room and they were there immediately to make things right. The beach has washed away quite a bit compared to some pictures we saw, but it was still beautiful. Our children had a great time. Some of their friends were at the Tequila and they went back and forth between hotels. We went into town to shop and it only cost $4 US for a cab. There are lots of shops in Playa Del Carmen and there was a plaza across the street from the hotel with lots of shops in it. We felt very safe and the staff couldn't have been nicer. We tipped but didn't feel pressured in any way that we should tip every person we came in contact with. We feel that for the price we paid we got a good value for our dollar. You could pay hundreds more and stay at the Palace but the average family would enjoy the Playacar. We would definitely go back. One word of caution - Friends of ours had their passports stolen at the Cancun airport and they are very careful people - so.... be very cautious with your documents!

Reviews.Title: “Another week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lovinparadise
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a family springbreak vacation at the Riu Playacar in Playa del Carmen. It was our first time here and we really thought it was a beautiful area. The town of playa del carmen has many shops and restaurants and very close to where we were staying.Only about a 2 minute taxi ride for $4.00. A fun place to visit. The Riu Playacar was smaller than most of the resorts we saw but it was on the beach and was very close to walk to from our room. We actually liked that it was smaller than some others we saw. Alot less crowded. There were no oceanfront rooms but we had a room on the first floor facing the main walkway near the beach. The room was nice and clean but what we didn't like and it was a problem was the shower and the sink drains didn't work well at all. We told the front desk the first night we arrived and mentioned it more than once. It never got fixed.The pool was smaller and also had a pool bar in it so it did stay crowded here. The beach was pretty with all the palm trees for the shaded areas and there were lots of chairs this was never a problem.Down by the water the beach was much smaller here. We were told that their had been beach erosion making the beach much smaller than it had been. We did notice a few times that some trees had fallen in the ocean. Also wanted to mention that there are topless sunbathers all over the beaches incase you have a young family and are not accustomed to this. We thought the blue aqua colored water was simply breathtaking. You can also look across and see Cozumel. We did go there also by ferry which was a 30minute ride from PDC. this was our first time at an all inclusive and we found it to be good and enough variety for everyone. Never got sick and really had no complaints. The staff work very hard to get all the meals ready for all of us. There were a couple restaurants and a buffet which was nice. The staff work very hard to have activities during the day and also to put on an evening show. It was fun. Israel and Joseph were very entertaining along with the others. All in all would go back to Riu Playacar. Lots of good things about it.Fabulous spring vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Babs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the RIU Playacar from 2/22-3/2 and had a GREAT time. Everyone who worked there had always had a HOLA and a smile on their face. We had a third floor room and we did not have a musty smell at all. We had a king size bed and a bathroom with a tub, but we never used the tub only the shower. Our room was 4310 and off the balconey you could just see the ocean over the trees. The food was good , ate alot of fruit. There was always alot to do at the resort. If you wanted to stay busy you could or just lay on the beach with a drink. We did one excursion, we did the coba-pec chen. We had a ball. The beach had some erosion, people that we talked to that had been there before said they lost alot, still enough chairs for everybody. It was so beautiful! We met alot of nice and friendly people there from all over. We are 41 and I don't feel it was an older crowd when we were there. When we were leaving it seemed there was more older people. I can't wait to go back next year! we are taking a bunch of friends with! I would reccommened this hotel to any one. Your vacation is what you make of it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we'll remember our stay for the rest of our lives, i have no complaints. we love riu!!! we loved the booze!

Reviews.Title: “Liked Playacar, RIU Playcar ok but CROWDED”
Reviews.Author: jenhammy
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar We spent 1 week at this resort and 1 week at Barcelo Maya Feb 27 to March 13. See also my review to Barcelo Maya. I liked the Barcelo better for many reasons, although I would definitely return to the “Playacar” area, just not to this particular RIU resort. Great time, we absolutely LOVE Mexico. We love the people, the service, the weather, the Mayan Riveria, the food. It is very interesting to go to two resorts in one week. They were SO different but both very good. We got married at Barcelo Maya on March 4 and spent our “honeymoon” at Riu Playacar the following week. I don’t consider the flight etc. to be a crucial part of the experience, but I know other travellers have complained. We travelled with Sunquest/Skyservice and were very impressed. Excellent service on board both ways and on time both ways. First let me say that this resort was VERY VERY crowded. Maybe it seemed more so after coming from the HUGE Barcelo, but it was quite a shock. Also, the average age of this clientele seemed older (55+?). Pros: Excellent food at buffet restaurant. Generally we found the food better than Barcelo. Better bar service also. Great to have the choice of 3 resorts to go to (Playacar, Tequila, Yucatan), we loved the atmosphere at the lobby bar of Riu Tequila and the shows. Fantastic activities staff. Location is great, you can walk to playacar village (1 min) and Playa del Carmen (10 min--$4 cab ride); Very clean rooms; mini bar in room was good; Shows were very entertaining; they seemed to have lots of variety and fun things for all ages. We were there on our honeymoon, so we kind of expected a bit of a to-do. The front desk staff were indifferent. We got balloons and a swan towel animal in our room. So finally on Wednesday, I decided to complain to the Sunquest rep. Not that I need another fruit basket and a bottle of tequila, but it is kind of the principle that Sunquest advertises that you get some kind of special “treatment” at the resort on your honeymoon. So the same day we got a mexican figurine, a letter and a bottle of tequila delivered to our room. Cons: Not great choices for a la carte restaurants, same menu for the whole week, not a lot of choices, not a great atmosphere. The resort in general was WAY too crowded. Compared to Barcelo, I did not find this relaxing at all, but I think the entire area (playacar) seemed crowded. Lots of drunk 40 and 50 year old people. We are 34 and were dismayed with the lack of “class” shall I say of some of the clientele—tank tops and cut off shorts at dinner? Please. Lots of smokers; Pool was dirty, needs a good cleaning and paint job, could have felt dirty due to the # of (intoxicated) people in it every day; small crowded beach, it seems that Playacar has experienced some beach erosion lately, disappointing. Very young crowd (18?) at disco. Riu Playacar has received complaints in the past about the safe etc. It is a very outdated system. Your room KEY (not card) has your room # printed on it, and you get a KEY (not a code) for the safe. We found this very surprising and a definite security concern. No robes, no coffeemaker in room. Had to call 3 times (3pm, 9pm, and 11pm) to get extra towels on our first day (after that episode the service was much better). In general the atmosphere of RIU Playacar was an older crowd and a definite weird mix of people. I don’t mean to sound like a snob, but I found some of the guests a bit trashy. We did meet some nice people at the RIU Tequila and liked the people/atmosphere there a lot better. It says clearly at the front door of the restaurant and in the brochure in the room that you are supposed to wear pants to dinner, but this was never enforced by the staff. I guess I expect since I am not in university on spring break that I wouldn’t have to sit next to drunk guys smoking in tank tops at dinner…but to each his own and everyone has a different idea of vacation. Maybe my feelings about this were enhanced because it seemed so crowded. Who knows. I think the RIU is a good company and we definately would return to a RIU resort, just not this one. It was way too crowded to be relaxing, felt like spring break for 50 year olds! I do like the Playacar area for sure, it is really too bad about the beach erosion was really sad. In general it was a 4 + star resort if it was 50% full.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was 'just right'!”
Reviews.Author: winnipegirl
Reviews.Content: Well, I've been home a week now and miss it terribly. I certainly would not want to write a review that would come off negative in any way because we were treated so well by all the staff and had an absolutely fabulous time. I think it is the staff that makes your stay so special here. I loved the size of the hotel-not too big, not too small-JUST RIGHT! We were so close to PDC, cab fare was cheap $4-$5-we went into town 3 times after dinner. This is a MUST! PDC is so incredibly beautiful in the evening. My concerns were: Lack of oceanview- We didn't get one but I think even if we had, there would not have been much view due to trees obstructing the views and distance. We had walkway view, it was lovely and quiet. Smells in room- we were on second floor and there was some odor coming from the shower drain. I kept it covered with a towel. You get used to it aftera while. Didn't affect our enjoyment of room at all. Hard beds-we put towels or extra blanket under our fitted sheet and it gave us just enough cushion to sleep comfortably. When the maids did our rooms, they left them there for us. We were travelling with a group of six and no one complained about bad sleeps. Condition of beach-as disappointing as it was to see the beach eaten away, we just pulled chairs down by the water or staked out front row (cliff-side) early in am. Still had fun boogie boarding and swimming. Be careful on the north side of Playacar beach (to the left) there was some hard exposed coral. None of the above affected our stay in any way. Everyone's different so what is important to one person may not be to another. Food-All six of us thought the food was fabulous! No one in our group had any issues with illlness. We ate at both the Steakhouse and Mediterranean-loved them both! The salmon at the Mediterannean was our favorite. I enjoyed the skewered steak/shrimp at Steakhouse. The meals exceeded our expectations. NOTE: you can not be late for specialty restaurants-6:30 or 8:30 sharp or else! We had a straggler and were told order now or too late! This was at about 7pm. They have everything timed precisely with the 2 sittings. As for buffet you can arrive late but you must be done by 8 pm for the 6:30 sitting and 10 pm for the 8:30 sitting. I found the latter timeslot was less rushed. Staff-the sweetest, friendliest you could ever meet. Too numerous to mention all. Israel (babyface) really stood out as he was always poolside encouraging us to join him for activities. The only negative experience was when we arrived and were informed that we were being bumped to the Tequila for 1 night. They did compensate us for the downgrade but we had several in our party coming at different times and we had to walk back and forth each time a new person arrived. Of course this was in the rain! Our feet were quite sore and we didn't get settled until dinnertime the next day into the Playacar. Kind of took 2 days off our holiday. We were upset that we were told to leave the Tequila by noon but could not check back into Playacar until 3 or 4pm. I think the proper thing to do would be let us have the rooms we were in until the other rooms were ready. On day 2 of our holiday, we were living out of suitcases in the lobby. This is the only reason that I rated this experience as a 4 out of 5. Otherwise it would have been a solid 5. The front desk was very apologetic and did try to make up for it during the rest of our stay. Sum it up-the layout of the resort is great-especially if you don't like hoofing it for miles and miles. Excellent size for seniors or those with small kids. Everything was top notch. I wouldn't go for a 3rd floor room myself-too many stairs. Check out all the other resorts have to offer-Tequila has neat character and pool area and Yucatan had the best beach. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not a five star resort...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Playcar for four nights Feb 4 - 8th. Most remarks we have read on this site to date have been true - based on our observations and taste. Specifically: 1) The rooms have a very musty smell and your clothes will reak quickly. An air freshener is a must. 2) The beds are very hard. Strongly encourage to request additional pillows because those provided are thin and don't provide much cussion. 3) The food was OK at best. I strongly encourage you to try the other dining options available at the RIU Tequila and Yucatan and frequent the one that works best for you. The steak house and mediterrian dinner restaurants at the Playacar we felt were better than the buffets, but require reservations. 4) The staff was extremely accomodating (maid service, front desk, bar staff, servers, etc.) and aimed to please. We never had to wait long for food, drinks, extra towels, etc. 5) The beach in front of the resort is falling into the ocean and it doesn't appear the resort is doing much to curb this such as sandbagging which many other resorts have done. If a spacious beach to play/lounge is a must, you may want to consider another resort apx. 1/2 mile south down the beach - especially if you have children. 6) The resort does have both a pool area and sandy area underneath palm trees which are very nice, but provide a lot of shade. We found ourselves constantly adjusting our chairs because we didn't get down to the beach early enough to reserve a chair with direct access to the sun. 7) Bring a large insulated glass. The drink glasses they provide are small. 8) Bring your tennis racket! The courts are in decent shape and we rarely had to share the court with anyone. 9) The rooms do have a mini-bar and fridge stocked with water, pepsi products, bottles of Corona, etc. Nice touch. 10) This is an older persons crowd. Stay elsewhere if you want to party till 4:00 am with teenagers and twenty somethings. 11) Lastly you will find women sunbathing with their tops off. Playa del Carmen attracts a diverse crowd globally so just enjoy the melting pot of cultures.

Reviews.Title: “Booked but bumped to another resort......”
Reviews.Author: GA Jule
Reviews.Content: After agonizing over where to stay picked the RIU Playacar due to size and cost - I now wish we would have just payed a little more, but hindsight is 20/20. We arrived and were informed they had overbooked and they had changed our reservation to the Riu Yucatan. Were told at first it was the same but larger and later that it was more expensive. When I was researching I chose not to stay at the Yucatan because it was larger, was about to get renovated and because the pool appeared to be very small for the size of the resort. I told them before asking for anything else, I chose NOT to stay at the Yucatan that I ahd booked for the Playacar. Basically they were like, "sorry, it is what it is. You can stay at the Yucatan". Not trying to be too pushy, seriously - I wasn't being obnoxious, I asked about if it was possible to upgrade us to a suite or the Palace which was the only other Riu we had considered since we weren't being provided what I had paid for. Was told, no, we can only send you to the Yucatan in a standard room. So at arrival, felt like I had been duped by travel agent or apple or the riu chain. Was disappointed. I will say, we were greeted with a drink promptly and the people were nice, but not very helpful or understanding. The apple rep was useless in helping us, didn't even try. I guess I am spoiled when you are bumped in the US they typically do something to comepensate you...upgrade, free night, something.... but it just didn't happen. I know, I was in another country, but still felt like I paid for something upfront and then was changed. I was only there for 5 days and decided to just spend my vacation enjoying the beach whereever I was rather than spend time on the phone with my travel agent or the apple rep. Happily, the property at the Yucatan was beautiful and they did put us next to our friends in rooms right off the pool. The furniture itself in the room was akin to a motel - but we didn't spend alot of time there so it wasn't too bad. I can't say what it was compared to Playacar, though I know the layout is quite similar. the beach at the Yucatan is MUCH better. Playacar erosion is like a 5-6 foot drop to the water - Yucatan is a sloping 2 feet, so it had that working for it. I saw a sign at the pool the second day we were there "ask us about upgrading to the Riu Palace in Cancun". That was never offered, had it been we probably would have taken it - because it was also one of our considerations. I just don't get why they didn't tell us that at the desk at check in. Especially since it was around 6 and too late for beach time or activities. I didn't want to sacrifice any of our vacation later which is why chose not to, just don't understand why wasn't offered. So if you book for the playacar, be forewarned, from talking to others at property they overbook and you really don't have much of a choice of where they put you. I will review the Yucatan over on its page. Other than the overbooking and dingy room decor at the Yucatan, I had no complaints though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Riu playacar was absolutely gorgeous. The beaches were beautiful, if u get up round 6:30 you can watch a swift, beautiful sunrise, just like the 1s in the post cards haha. Lots of Europeans, but not the snobby ones, they're very nice. I miss it soo much and i only just got back, im already daydreaming of the day i probably wont return.....the staff was incredible, pretty flirtacious, but still incredible. Then again everybody is flirtatious to girls in Mexico haha. There's one waiter in particular that is so nice and just brightens ur day-Jesus, if anyone goes there and sees him please tell him la chinita says hi. U all should go into the town of PLaya del Carmen, Xel-ha and Tulum. I miss the Riu Playacar so grievingly much...it was definitly a profound life changing vacation that i will forever cherish.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: ercjp1
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Riu Playacar Feb 1-8. I had read many reviews before going and admit that I was still a little leary about my choice. Don't get me wrong, I have stayed in Cancun many times and can have fun at a 2 star as much as a 5 star, but the couple we went with were used to a little more upscale and not so commercialized. That is why we chose to go further south this time. The resort was beautiful! Lots of fun around the pool or relax on the beach. Go topless if you want! Food was good. Nice choices at the buffets. Sit down service was very slow but food was good. The disco at the Tequila was great the first night we were there but not so busy after that. We never really ate or went to the beach at the other RIU's but did go see them and I was not disappointed in our choice. The other couple, they said they would go back in a minute! Did not see any shows except the Michael Jackson show at the Tequila our first night. Went into town for the first half of the Superbowl and then back to the hotel to watch the rest on the big screen down by the pool. We got tired of drinkin Corona draft or bottle from the minifridge so the last full day the guys went tok a taxi to Wallmart and brought back a cooler with 2 cases of BudLight. We were in heaven that last day by the pool. I think we could have sold them for $5 a piece if we wanted! Not that we all drink Budlight but that seemed to be the only American beer available. The week went by entirely too fast. My only bad experience was that I wanted to book a snorkel trip to Xel-Ha and our Apple rep said it would be too crowded and said we would enjoy the Mayan tour more. We spent most of our time in vans traveling to the three snorkel sites. One was in a cave and was quite interesting but the water was freezing. We spent at least 40 minutes between each of the three sites. Next time I will insist on what I want to do. One thing that worried me was the smell in the rooms that other reviews referred to.
