I did not think it smelled any different than any other resort I had been to in Mexico. It was damp and a little musty but I brought a candle and kept the doors closed when the air was on and had no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star”
Reviews.Author: need2hitlotto
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a very unique one. We booked a room at the riu tequila which is across the street from the playacar. They told us that they were overbooked and offered to move us to the playacar (which is on the beach). We took the offer so we could be closer to the beach. The riu tequila looks a lot better than the playacar, but we were not on vacation to look at lobby's etc. The room we received had a very strong musty odor, so we whipped out our air freshener and took care of that (not fully). The beds in the riu playacar are so hard and uncomfortable that my back was aching after two nights of prisoner style sleep. The food at the playacar is below average, not very good at all. The beach has sustained substantial damage from the hurricane season, so what you get is a lot of sand leading to the ocean, then a 3 foot drop to the ocean. Not ideal. The entertainment was pretty good. Don't expect a Vegas show. The guest consisted of a lot of southern Americans, candaians, and Europeans. Some of the guests are loud and obnoxious which lends to the sub-par hotel making the whole trip feel a little trashy. Thankfully a miracle happened; all the guests of the hotel were offered an opportunity to move to the riu palace Las Americas in Cancun for free. You were invited to stay the remainder of your trip in Cancun. It was AWESOME!!! The hotels, the beach, the guests, the food, the staff, the entertainment, the drinks, all were FAR better than the playacar. If you have already booked this vacation and have not purchased travel insurance, try to get bumped to the riu place Las Americas, you won't be sorry. I hoped this helps some of you. Also, please remember to tip the wait staff and maids of the hotels, they need it and deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Riu Playacar and had stayed 2/16- 2/21. Our visit was with 5 other couples and we had a great time. The staff is excellent! We were greeted with Mai Tai's and escorted to our room promptly. We definitely used our safe and had no issues with theft. The staff was very helpful in keeping our group in the same building. We stayed in the purple building closest to the Turquesa. Our biggest compliment is to the staff, they were absolutely incredible. Josef even climbed a palm tree for us and knocked down fresh coconuts, and opened them so we could have a taste! Sergio kept a tight reign on his animacion staff and they were great. Jesus gave us great service at breakfast each morning with an enthusiastic Hola and a carafe of coffee. These people worked from 7 AM through the dinner hour and late evening, tips were greatly appreciated and well earned! The "Grease" show was fun for all ages and we had a great time at that. The disco at the Tequila was fabulous on Thursday night, but seemed to cater to more of a local crowd on Saturday night. We also tried the disco at the Yucatan on Saturday and we were the only people there and they never dimmed the lights. One great thing was the burgers and hot dogs outside the Tequila disco at night! They are just to your right as you come out of the disco. The pools were a little cool, but that didn't bother us, it was a lot warmer than we'd have back home! The drinks were great and the bartenders were more than happy to accomodate any strength or any concoction you might ask them to create for you! Rudolfo at the Yucatan pool bar was wonderful. There are many activities offered each day and you can participate if you'd like, but you are not pushed into it by any means. The beach erosion was very sad, but it didn't keep us from getting sun on the beach. The one excursion we did was the Snorkeling Adventure. What a great day! Everyone had so much fun swimming with the fish, even seeing barracudas, and looking at the reef. Noah was our snorkeling guide and he would jump in the water and grab sea cucumbers for us to look at and starfish. It was fun. It was located directly next to a nude resort which gave us quite a laugh to see some naked buns out windsurfing! I highly recommend the Riu Playacar. We took our own insulated mugs from home and had people offering big money for them. They are great to have on the beach with you! If you are looking for an expansive beach, we did notice that the Iberostar did not have nearly as much erosion as the Riu, but the service that we received more than made up for it! Look for Toucans, and monkeys in the trees, and tell the cats hello!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star at all -”
Reviews.Author: FEB4
Reviews.Content: We just got back after a week in February 2005. We were very disappointed to find that the food in the hotel was absolutely terrible. The food was left until it shriveled up and looked very un - appitizing. We ended up going to the Tequila every day for breakfast and lunch, much better food there. You couldn't find anything to eat past 11:00 PM at night until 7;00 AM in the morning at this hotel. This was suppose to be 5 star hotel and I rate it a 3 as far as pool activities, food quality and professionalism with the staff. No drinks were offered down by the beach ever and you had to walk a distance to get your very watered down small glass. The beach front is smaller due to the hurricanes. This hotel is a very laid back hotel with no excitement past 11:00 PM. If you want to just relax and not make any noise, stay here, otherwise, I would not recommend it to any one who wants to have a little fun. The staff was pretty good but not professional. The aerobics instructor was certainly not certified and it showed as he tried to do some exercises from the 80's. We truly wanted a more fun hotel with great food and certainly didn't find it here. We tried to be friendly to some other people from Europe and other places, and they didn't want to be friendly at all. Not even a smile. Things are very expensive across the street at the plaza and we got taken because we needed certain personal products. I've been to other resorts in Mexico and found this one the most dissappointing of all that I've traveled. The room itself was nice but we got yelled at by another resident after coming back around 11:00 PM from a show and he said we made too much noise. We didn't even have a drink that night as we are not alcohol drinkers. People want it quiet all the time and if that's what vacations are about... we might as well give it up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Rating of Visit of 2/5/05 - 2/14/05”
Reviews.Author: StephFromSacto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from the Riu Playacar and I'm happy to share some thoughts from our trip. This is our 2nd time in Playa Del Carmen. We loved it in 2004 and wanted to return. We stayed at the Reef Club the first trip; wanted a step up in service and accommodations and definitely experienced that at the Riu. We arrived and were greeted at the front desk with delicious, cold fruit drinks. (YUM) A great start! The buildings are plantation style with three stories. A main walkway splits the two sets of buildings, at one end is the beach, the other is the lobby entrance. The buildings are painted in cool colors of green, blue, pink... and others. Palm trees and clean, well-manicured grounds are featured. The pathway seperates the "exercise" pool and the stage, then the buffet/restaurant area and the "drinking" pool (with the swim up bar). Continuing toward the ocean, the path becomes a large sandy area with hundreds of palm trees & beach chairs. Beyond that, BEAUTIFULLY CLEAR ocean and great views of Cozumel lights and large passing ships. Having been in pdc in 2004, we immediately noticed that the beach has disappeared at the Riu and other properties. What used to be a LARGE (40 ft?) expanse from the raised beach chair area to the water, is now gone. The water is starting to erode the raised beach area and the roots of the first row of palm trees are often exposed each morning. Neighboring hotels (the Allegro, Reef Club, others) had been almost entirely washed out. Their former beaches now have numerous (ugly) sandbags and staffs were constructing stairways in order their guests could get down to the water from their hotel. Many of those properties seemed to be teetering on the edge of falling into the ocean, and we witnessed a few palm trees that were uprooted and laying down. Eeek! We were told by staff at the Riu that this happens every couple of years. We also heard that it was the result of recent hurricanes. Drunk people were saying it was tsunami related. We walked on the beach in both directions and would recommend to beach lovers to stay at the Iberostar or other property SOUTH of the Riu Playacar as they still have lots of beach left. The aesthetics of the beach are trashed with the presence of printed blue and red rice sacks containing sand. We stayed in room 2117, the green building, closest to the lobby. Facing the north side (opposite of the main path) we enjoyed the building and our room. We primarily drank at the lobby bar (Alejandro is the best!) and it was an easy stumble home and to breakfast in the AM. The rooms are nice. We experienced two problems which were resolved while we were there -- our showerhead squirted water ACROSS the room into the closet, and our fridge stopped working. I asked our package sale person (Sebastian) to translate the issue to the staff, told the person who called to see how our room was and finally the issue was addressed on day 3 when I spoke to a person at the front desk. The fridge issue was resolved on our day 6. Maid service was excellent. Each day we were greeted with towel animals. I tried to leave pesos for the staff but the $$ was left untouched on the bureau. The in-room bar (four dispensable bottles of alcohol) went almost untouched. It's nice to have, but we just went to the always-open lobby bar for any hard beverage needs. The fridge's contents, water, pepsis and 7ups are awesome to have. Staff refills the fridges every couple of days. We'd emptied our fridge by day 4 and requested refilling. Maid service doesn't refill as they came and no beverages did; when I saw the cart of beverages at the next building I asked the gents to refill us and they were kind enough to do it immediately (on day 6). The bed setup in the room is unique. Two double-sized beds are in the room pushed together. Extra blankets were available in the closet. The one thing I noticed about the bed is that they have some kind of plastic liner under the bottom sheet. It can make the bed rather toasty, even sweaty. One thing we missed was the presence of a bathtub. The shower is decent sized, and water pressure is excellent. We just both like to soak. Having a patio facing away from the main walkway is great -- private, quiet and relaxing. We found the food to be very good. We adjusted to their policy of a set dinner hour by snacking on chips and guacamole at the lower restaurant that serves lunch nearly all day. We ate at the reservations-only, full service steakhouse which featured a multi-course meal that was good, not exceptional. I thought the steak was great, but their attempts to mass cook side dishes (ie twice baked potatoes) makes it less fresh. REGRET: No Mexican Coffees!!! We saw people having them made but didn't know how/if we could order one. We were never offered that. I say, ASK! Beverages were plentiful at the Riu as they should be. I'm impressed how many name brand alcohols they're using and the adeptness of the staff to handle so many people so kindly and efficiently. Their staff brought out HUGE trays of drinks for the people in the beach area. That was super nice too. REGRET: I wished we'd listed to previous customers and brought big insulated cups to enjoy the cocktails while sunbathing. It seems stupid but even if it's for water, it's nice to have help to keep it cold. Visitor ages at the Riu Playacar seemed to skew higher than other places we've stayed. While there were many families with kids under teenage years, I would say people in their late 20s were the youngest adults. Lots of Candians, French, German, Dutch and English folks. (and they're all lucky enough to be there for TWO weeks!!!) Americans seemed like a minority...that was nice. Children and parents alike seemed really happy at the Riu Playacar. Staff was fun and each day there were lots of activities. I enjoyed the daily water polo with "kids" of all ages. We took advantage of the Riu opportunity to view and use the other Rius. Though we didn't go to the Palace (we heard contradicting stories as to whether we're allowed), we danced and drank at the Tequila. They have a fun danceclub, though it can go a bit techno. The Yucatan looked AWESOME -- the facility was quieter and bigger. Peeping in, the room layouts seemed identical. We took two excursions and would recommend them both. TRIP ONE: We snorkeled at Point (Ponte?) Morelos one morning. The snorkeling was on a beautiful reef a half hour north of PDC. We were back by noon. WARNING: Though our package dude Sebastian didn't tell us, they require that you use BIODEGRADABLE sunscreen ($10/bottle) and charge you a couple bucks a head to get in to the park. BRING MONEY! TRIP TWO: XCaret. One word: Fabulous! We floated through the underground caverns, watched the dolphins, had margaritas at the top of the point (which is VERY windy.. a definite no-hairpiece location), saw numerous amazing animals... all terrific. The big thing is that you DO NOT need to go on a tour. $10 taxi rides take you to the park. It's $49/piece to get in (we bought it through the hotel in the hopes of avoiding the line. No, you still have to wait for the slowpokes to buy their tix) and you can be on your own schedule. The beach is beautiful, the whole place is a can't-miss. We actually took a bunch of walking trips downtown to Playa del Carmen. (It's a 25 minute walk to the southern most area of the downtown) We thoroughly enjoy strolling down the street there and enjoying cocktails in the open-air restaurants. We did note that "Americanization" has sprung over the last year. The shopping malls are more like the suburbs...there's 3 Haagen Dasz' and two Diesel Jeans places, a TGIFridays -- eek. I hope it doesn't change too much! We enjoyed the Riu Playacar and would certainly consider returning. As lame as this may sound, the two items I was diappointed by were the lack of bathtub and the plastic beds. If you're going, enjoy it! It's a fabulous destination!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: gourmetfaerie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar in June 2005 and had an AMAZING time. We wanted peace, quiet, a beach, lots of alcohol, R & R, and that's exactly what we got! The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were immaculate (though a little musty, but it can't be helped. It's the tropics after all. Some folks on this site suggest bringing a plug in air freshener). The food was okay. Nothing spectacular at all... but lots of variety. The grounds were on the small side: airy and lovely. The pools were always the perfect temperature and the beach was divine. The Riu Playacar beach isn't expansive but it was not at all overly crowded compared to the other resort beaches at either side of us, so that was nice. During our trip there was a promotion that offered us a stay at the Riu Las Americas in Cancun (a "6-star" resort). While the hotel was spectacular in every way, just over the top gorgeous and HUGE, we hated Cancun. Too noisy, too much city sounds, too much partying. We wanted peace and asked to go back to Riu Playacar as we far preferred its quaint and homey feel to Las Vegas style glamour in Mexico and they totally paid for the cab ride back to Playa del Carmen and our vacation ended where it had started. Riu is a really great chain and my partner and I will always think of our stay at the Riu Playar with fond remembrance.

Reviews.Title: “Stealing housekeepers and annoying pool staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my 9th trip to Mexico and by far the most unrelaxing hotel I have been too. 1) The outside of the 'palace' is impressive, but lacks the tropical feeling. Surrounding hotels that I have stayed at (ex: Ibero Star, RIU Tequilla) were beautiful and the RIU palace looked like a weak attempt at replicating a Washington DC tourist stop. The tiled hotel had 50 workers cleaning the floor (making it hard to walk), but why couldn't someone fix the sewage smells? 2) Sure it was nice that the housekeeping staff folded our towels into animals, but did I want them to GO THROUGH MY BAGS AND STEAL A CAMERA. My brand new, digital Nikon was taken out of my room. I approached the houskeeping staff and the management, and it seemed as if not a soul cared whether or not I had my memory card with 100's of photos. WATCH YOUR STUFF... ALL OF THE SAFE KEYS ARE THE SAME FOR ALL VACATIONERS. If the safe isn't saf, what is? 3) Lastly, if you are looking for a 'fun' and 'wild' hotel don't stay here. Cancun or Acapulco are much more entertaining. But that ISN'T what I was looking for. The hotel claimed it was 'spring breaker' free, and all I wanted was some quite beach and pool time with my daughter. Than why were the annoying pool staff bugging us (and the rest of the elderly/middle aged people staying there) to join water arobics and riffle shooting? Why did an old lady get hit in the head with a volleyball while a techno song repeated (daily) in the background about 'booty calls'. Not too classy. More like a trashy Las Vegas hotel. 4)Lastly I would like to say that I couldn't sleep for two reasons. A) The beds were hard but not horrid. B) The AWFUL music and night time entertainment drove me to insanity at night, I would have paid money to shut the off key songers up. 5) Don't order mixed drinks, they taste like perfume.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I were there in September (wife and 2 yr. old twins) and it was excellent. Staff was very good with girls and we really appreciated that, given that hotel/wait staffs could usually give a hoot about kids in US resorts. The staff kept our room in excellent shape and even made the girls blanketsw in animal shapes ( a different one every day) when the made the beds. I read another review in here about theft and problems...we had none. All of the rooms have safes and lets face it if you a dumb enough to leave a credit card at the frontof a hotel (freign or domestic) and leave valuables out in a room that has a safe you get what is coming to you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: q102briand
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the comments on the board about the Riu Playacar, my girlfriend and I were a bit nervous. We just got back yesterday from 4 days of 80 degree sunshine and one of the most friendly resorts I have ever stayed at. Yes the rooms have a hint of a musty smell (as do most every room in the region) but a glade plug in took care of that. The beach area is beautiful and the rooms were very clean. We liked having the mini bar and liquor machine in our room. The staff was the friendliest I have encountered in the region. Our tips? Take large plastic cups with you to the bar. The bartenders dont even blink when you give them a larger cup. Make reservations for the seafood and or steak resteraunts. Your dining experience is a little more intimate that way. My only beef was is that things in the gift shop on site were way overpriced. You can save yourself some serious $$ just by taking a 2 minute walk across the street to the shopping plaza. They everything from gifts to a mini mart. Overall we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JaneLen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful vacation at the Playacar Jan.25/05 - Feb.1/05. This was our first visit to Mexico and were not disappointed. The hotel was on the smaller side. Rooms were extremely clean and the grounds were gorgeous. The staff were all eager to please and all very friendly. We did not notice a musty smell in our rooms. Last year we stayed at the Riu Bachata in the Dominican and our suitcases still had the musty smell 6 months later. This was not the case on this vacation. Yes it is a long drive to most of the sites with all the stops that are made but now that we know, we'll do things differently next time. We found Mexico much cleaner than D.R. and felt safer. I had no problem walking into Playa Del Carmen by myself, leaving my husband by the pool. He hates to shop.....The vendors were not pushy and when you said No Thanks, they left you alone. The catamaran to Isla Mujeres was lot's of fun and the snorkelling was amazing. Some reviews stated that there was no action at the Playacar. We didn't find that at all. If you're a friendly person you'll meet alot of great people around the resort. If you're in your 20's, Cancun would probably have more nite life but for those of us in our 40's the Playacar was great. We met alot of great Canadians and Americans that were friendly and fun. I would not hesitate to recommend this resort. For the price it is definitely worth it. If you have any questions, send me an e-mail..

Reviews.Title: “What a vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday. Have never been to Mexico, have never been anywhere warm in January before. We left -30 Celcius to go to +28 Celcius and it was unbelievable. The Riu Playacar is a fabulous resort. Great people, great food, wonderful drinks.....The pool was beautiful and the beach with unbelievably clear water! Yes the sand was a little washed up due to recent storms and the pool water was a little cool, but they don't have heaters in their pools. As long as you were in the water in the sunshine, you were fine. I would definitely go back. We were there less than 24 hours and already wished we had booked the trip for 2 weeks instead of only 1. I do agree with the person before us, though, that hopefully the next time we go, we'll get a room on the north side due to some of the traffic up and down the service sidewalk on the south side. The only thing that I can honestly say that I wasn't completely happy with was the hard beds. They were a little too firm for me. As for the musty smell that people were speaking of, we just turned on the air in the room and the smell was gone. Their water has a sewage type smell, but one of the first things they tell you is to not drink their water. We just got back last night (to the ice age) and already I've watched our video and looked at our pictures a few times, and want to go back. When they say it's a 5 star resort, they're not joking. Check it out!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a holiday!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family just got back from a great week at the Riu Playacar. The weather is perfect every day, the ocean is warm and the staff are super-friendly. Are the drink cups small? Is the alcohol watered down? Who knows? But I can tell you this...order as many drinks as you want. They will be more than happy to accommodate your needs. The beds were a little hard, but nobody in our 10 person party had a bad night sleep once in our entire stay. As for dinner plans, we did the buffet most nights...but tried the ala carte once each. Make your reservations early or you won't get them. We booked our formal dinners right at 7 am both times. If you don't, there's a good chance you won't get reservations. You can only make them the same day you are going, and I believe booking starts at 7 am. Activites are great as well. You can do as little or as much as you want to. There's a team of activity co-ordinators that orchestrate anything from beach volleyball, water aerobics, fashion shows etc. Or...you can just plunk yourself down on the beach. But...get a chair early, as like any place there's a lot of early morning chair reserving going on. If you get there around 6:30, you'll see a beautiful sunrise in the morning. By the way, yes they could use a bar at the beach, but there's 3 in total, and none are that far. The odd time you'll see a Riu staffer bringing a huge tray of drinks down to the beach for whoever wants them (nice touch). Kids disco is fantastic! That happens at 8:30 every night before the main show. Anyway, people will always find something to complain about if things aren't perfect on their vacation. If that's the case at the Riu Playacar...just tell them and I guarantee they'll do their best to fix it. Have FUN!!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Resorts under the microscope now due to viruses and people getting sick”
Reviews.Author: DuckDuckMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week at a Riu resort called Riu Playacar in Mexico for our honeymoon. We were not impressed with the area or our stay. To make matter worse, I got violently ill the last night there. I almost had my wife call an ambulance. I have never been so sick in my life. And it was not from the food or water. I had been eating and drinking it (my wife too) for the entire week with no problems. After I was sick,my wife became very ill too. We assumed it was the flu, but now I wonder??? They (Riu) is having major problems with people getting sick at their resorts. The rooms are nothing impressive. Small and smelly. Beds are hard as rocks. I never got a good night sleep. All the tours are very expensive. Not a lot is free either. All the fun stuff costs major bucks. Expect Beverly Hills prices. Too many old disgusting French women with their tops off on the beach. Ever see leather with oil under the sun??? Gross.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacation at RIU Playacar for christmas and new year. We spent two weeks at the hotel, and had a lot of fun. The food was delicious, the buffets for christmas and new years eve were great! The staff was very friendly! It was a very clean hotel! The animation team were excellent. We went to Mexico 11 persons, with a variety of age from 1 to 71 years of age, and we all enjoyed the vacation a lot!!The whole staff were incredible eager to help us if we had difficulties with something, and they were always happy and smiling. The beach was nice and clean, and the drinks were very good, not waterd out..... We come from Norway, so it was a long flight, but we still would very much like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello Travellers. We are from small town Yorkton, Saskatchewan Canada, and we are not fussy/picky travellers by any means. Our reviews are of exactly what we thought of the place. Riu Playacar is a beautiful place to stay. The food was excellent, the ice cubes were completely safe, and the service was wonderful. No one was sick from food, etc. We took our children and they had a great time. The beach area is really nice. However the ocean was quite rough, and seemed to be a higher tide coming in. And yes, there are topless sunbathers. There is a lot to do within the resort and we found it to be just a super experience. Shopping across from the hotel is nice, but you are going to pay more than in Playa del Carmen. I have seen in previous reviews complaints regarding the smell in the hotel rooms. I have to agree, there was a very musty smell that absorbed into the clothes if they were hanging up in the closet. So do take an air freshener. The beds are a little hard and maybe ask for 2 pillows because they are a little thin. The towel art was really unique and the rooms were impecably clean. We strongly recommend this hotel to anyone considering it. You won't be disappointed :) Have a nice stay if you do go.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar the amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived via Westjet Dec 19, 2004, great fun airline on series 700 airplane. No problems at mexican imigration. Save yourself any hastles by having a passport. Smooth trip to hotel. Greeted by staff at Hotel, check in was a breeze. That same morning we were checked in and bellied up to the buffet, drink in hand. Lots of chairs any time of day, in or out of the shade, your choice. Food was so tasty, and staff could not to enough for you. You could order any type of drink either on or off their menu which was overwhelming. Nite life was fun with the professionals and the animation crew. We have done our share of travel and if there was one place i would go back to, it would be to Playa del Carmen and would stay at any of the Riu Resorts, after talking to other guests, they are all amazing. I could go on about things to do and things to see, but i know hotel accomodations are paramount in decision making of vacations. PS we are 52 and we took our 25 year old daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: Veryann
Reviews.Content: We spent a glorious week at the Riu November 6-13th. Beginning with our flight from Philadelphia, to the customs in Cancun, to the front door and check in at the hotel, everything was perfect. We requested an upper floor down by the pool and we were happy with our third floor garden view...in the pretty pink building...close to the pool, bar and Turquesa restaruant. The room had a slight musty smell upon arrival, but after opening the door and airing it out, it was fine. The room was big enough for us and the bathroom was huge. The mini bar had more than we would ever use and they kept refilling it as requested.. especially the diet soda! The room was kept immaculate all week. As far as the food, we enjoyed the buffet, tried the Steak House once and the Mediterranean twice. The ala carte retaurants were just about average but service and ambiance were nice. We did try breakfast at the Riu Tequilla and Tucan and that was fun. At all the restaurants, the waiters, waitresses and bar tenders were very gracious. The beach is just magnificent and there were plenty of loungers both in the shade of the palm trees and out in the open...your choice. It is one of the nicest sections of this several mile strip as there was some erosion half a mile up as you went towards Playa Del Carmen. You can almost walk into town on the beach!! About 1 1/4 miles. It is easier along the nice sidewalks that are shaded. You can take a Taxi for $4. Across the street from the hotel is a nice little group of shops offering just about anything you can find in Playa Del Carmen and for the same price. The shows each night were wonderful and such talent. We loved the Michael Jackson show and felt sad that we were leaving when they were doing Grease!! As far as things to do...every day there were all kinds of activities. We did aerobics, beach volleyball, stretching on the beach, bingo around the pool in the late afternoon. The staff was the BEST!! Always helpful, friendly and fun. It was sad to say good bye. We would definitely come back to the Riu Playacar. Next time I would bring a sweater as it gets cool at night at that time of year. I may bring a room plug in freshner too. If you like to read..lights are dim...bring a light bulb!! Have fun and check it out!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: RUI Playacar was beautiful and it was nice being right on the beach. The only negative was the food was okay but lacked variety, only a couple of things on the menu would change for lunch and breakfast was always the same. We went into town a couple of nights for dinner and shopping. The service was good and the people were polite. If your going I would recommend going to Xelha for snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went in december 2004. Me and my husband went for the first time to Mexico. The Hotel was beautiful!! The beach also!! Everything was so good!! The staff: SUPER!! Very nice people! Don't believe other negative reviews!! Go and see it yourself!! We had a fantastic vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: travel-326
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at Riu Playacar during peak week (12/26-1/2) with husband and two teenaged sons. After reading the reviews before we left, we were a little nervous. The hotel is on the smaller size which makes it very manageable for walking to meals, pool, beach, etc. We had two adjacent rooms and they were spotless, large, and well appointed. We found the beds firm but very comfortable - far superior to the ones you sometimes get where you roll into the worn out middle! One room did have a slight stale odor - again, hard to dintinquish the source. We did bring room spray and left the door open when we were there and it was fine. The other room never had the odor - so just ask to be moved if you find it objectionable. We were on the third floor which was extremely quiet and offered cathedral ceilings which made it feel very large. The beach and water were spectacular - swimming was great. The surf however prevented the staff from allowing water sports the entire week. The width of the beach is also rather lacking (seemingly at all the Playa resorts) so the chairs are rather packed-in but palm trees are interspersed which offer the chance to be out of the sun if desired. The pool was rather cool but many people seemed to hang out there, especially with younger children. There are topless women, many Europeans seem to frequent the area - so if that bothers you, be forwarned. The food setup could seem somewhat cattle-callish, however we found sitting on the outside terrace contributed greatly to our enjoyment of meals as it was much smaller and quieter than the general dining room. There is plenty to choose from, the breakfasts were the best. Dinners got somewhat monotonous but there was always a salad bar (I would bring my own dressing next time,) fresh fruit, soups and fantastic salsa and chips. The only thing we were extremely careful about was the seafood and some meats. It makes sense to use judgement on what to select and you will have no stomach problems. If you are particular about your choice of alcohol or wine I would recommend bringing some. Their high end vodka was Smirnoff and they don't offer the opportunity to order good bottles of wine. We missed that but the Cuervo Gold margaritas were good - you need to ask for the name brands. The entertainment is fun and totally optional. We went a few nights and had a good time. The New Year's Eve party was a blast. (two, live Mexican bands) The staff is extremely friendly and eager to please. The facility and rooms are spotless. If you are not happy and you don't speak up it's your own fault. Trips: we went on a Tulum/Xel Ha trip. Both are amazing destinations but were extremely crowded. We wished we were warned about the crowds. ALso don't take a tour there that involves a coach bus, ours stopped at five more hotels to pick up people resulting in a long, long bus ride instead of what should have been a quick one. A small van or cab would have been much better. Swimming with the dolphins was a great experience for our kids and the half-day snorkel trip is also highly recommended. Downtown: The Riu location is excellent in that you can visit the "Mexican street" across the street for a little shopping, or walk down to Playa del Carmen (20 minute walk) along clean, safe sidewalks to a really authentic Mexican town with tons of shops, restaurants, bars and the ferry to Cozumel. There was also a golf course that looked very nice which we did not have a chance to go to. We would go back again. The weather was spectacular every day, the people very accomodating and the beauty of the surroundings is really special. PS- Going AI with teens is highly recommended. They could come and go as they pleased, sleep late and eat breakfast late, etc. This made it a low stress time for all of us and as a result we really enjoyed each other's company all the more. The food and drink included vastly simplifies bill paying and eliminated discussions about whether someone wanted another drink or not. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Persistent moldy smell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week over Christmas and New Year's Day at the Hotel Riu Playacar just south of Playa del Carmen. While we encountered a problem with the hotel's smell, the same can not be said of the location, the staff or the service; they were excellent. The staff, whether working in the restaurants or attending the rooms, always worked industriously, professionally and enthusiastically. The facility itself, however, falls short. It has a major shortcoming: its rooms have a musty, moldy, sewer-like smell. I think the problem lies within the architectural design of the building. Either the plumbing lines, sewage lines or atmospheric moisture is seeping into the concrete block construction of the hotel walls causing moldy, foul and stale breathing conditions. We noticed a similar smell at the Riu Yucatan as well when walking through it, despite the fact that the workers scrub clean the hotel floors, walls and bathrooms, spotlessly. Thankfully, our stay was short, because we could not stomach a longer stay. We needed to have the doors open and the fan on to endure the week. Flowers and scent devices were put into the room to try and mask the underlying problem. This moldy musty smell problem was identified on an internet forum a year ago, and we had hoped the problem had been corrected, but it has not. As well, almost half of the fourteen people in our party encountered stomach and intestinal bacterial infections by the last half of the week causing us to miss at least 1 or 2 days of our six actual days at the hotel. At a cost of nearly $3000 from Calgary, this makes each day lost very expensive. Unless something is done to correct the hotel's smell, and money put in to improve the refrigeration and distribution of its food, we will never return to the Rius. All that being said, the beach is gorgeous, the staff are friendly and professional. The location is great; it's a 25 minute walk to delightful Playa del Carmen and provided you have a poor sense of smell and a strong stomach you will be quite happy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My whole extended family just returned from a 1 week stay at the Playacar (12/17-12/24), and we are absolutely enchanted and are counting the days until our return!! The staff was great - courteous and patient, the food was wonderful, the beach and pools gorgeous. The rooms were kept incredibly clean which is a challenge with all of the sand everywhere. The beds were a little on the hard side, but we had no trouble sleeping. I've slept on harder beds in US hotels. PLEASE do not let negative comments dissuade you from choosing this resort. We had read the positive and negative comments prior to our departure and went into it with an open mind....we were not dissappointed in any fashion. I think some people are just the type that would probably never be satisfied. The rooms do smell a bit musty -- we brought plug-in deodorizers which quickly solved that. I don't think we would have had a problem if we hadn't brought them. The air conditioning in all of our rooms worked great (close your patio door). We did leave small tips (20 pesos) each day and our mini bars were restocked usually daily, and most days we had a beautiful towel "sculpture" on the bed. We had no problem with the extra tipping -- some times we also did this in the buffet if we received really great service. If you look at the areas surrounding the resorts, you can see these extra tips are welcome, and the staff works SO hard. We thought that the buffets were terrific, and actually liked them better than the steakhouse, but it was a nice change. We only did this once and opted back for the wonderful buffets, where there is something for everyone! Breakfasts were our favorite! There are always American standbys of hamburgers and hotdogs at lunch, and there were many prepared fish/seafood dishes, which was great. We took the opportunity to participate in the other activities at the resort, Boccia ball, horseshoes, etc. LOTS of fun! The activity staff was a blast! The shows at night (esp Michael Jackson show and Riu Ballet) were fun and top notch! My only recommendation would be a bar nearer to the beach, but everything was very convenient and a short walk. This resort is smaller than some others which keeps it more personal, and convenient. The pools were a little on the cool side, but were very refreshing. We absolutely loved the Playacar and would highly recommend it to anyone - anytime!! Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good And Bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had never been to mexico before, so i can't compare the expierence to anything else. I liked the playacar alot. It was clean and the staff was very nice. The food in the main restaurant was good, but not great and they do serve the same things every night. The food in the outside restaurant was a different story. When i opened my bread there were aunts in it. As for the entertainment, the playacar's shows are really more family oriented, but you can go over to the tequilla that is a 3 min. walk for some good adult and young adult geared shows. The beach was great. Spots with alot of activity and spots with very little. Also, alot of topless european women and alot of european men wearing little boys underwear. We went in october and most the people there where european. Most the european women were nice to us, but the european men would give you dirty looks and say things after you walked by and were a good 5 feet from them. The only other bad thing i can think of is the location relating to outside activities. Swim with the dolphins was a 1/2 hour away and the major historical sites were between 1 and 3 hours away. Also i got the flu from swimming in the pool, but mabey thats just me. Id go again, but stay longer this time.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation I've ever had!!”
Reviews.Author: cobrodies
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip with my family to the beautiful Riu Playacar. We were there from December 17th through the 24th. We all had a fabulous time! (All 8 of my family members!) In my opinion, if you have younger children, mine are 6 and 9, you can't beat the all inclusive option. It was so wonderful to get up in the morning, have breakfast, then head to the beach. Around 1pm, we'd head up to the Turquesa restaurant and have lunch, then go back to the beach. Then around 4pm we would go up to the pool area. Several of my family members would participate in the extra activities. (ie; horse shoes, boccia ball, ping pong etc...) Some of us would simply jump in the pool and belly up to the pool bar and order a cold beverage. Whether it be a strawberry smoothie for the kids or a margarita for me, it was wonderful to just order what you like. The evening entertainment was, well, very entertaining! Every evening a very talented group of young men and women, put on a very nice show. From fun games for the kids, to having fun with the adults, they really do a great job. The Michael Jackson show was spectacular! I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but it was amazing! I think the buffets were quite good. Imagine trying to cook for so many people, from so many different countries. After the first day, you figure out what are your favorites and stick with them. The dinner buffet seemed to change 'main dish' items quite a bit. The variety was nice. I plan on returning to the Riu Playacar soon. Very soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Classic Destination for Adults”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar is what the Riu hotel chain calls a "classic" Riu hotel. This means smaller, quieter (no disco), no lavish evening entertainment. My wife and I have stayed there three times and are about to return. The staff are charming, very helpful and several have been there since the hotel opened just a few years ago. This is not a resort for anyone looking for a 24-hour party. Riu's "stay at one - play at three" option means that you can walk down the beach in the morning and have breakfast at the Riu Yucatan. Then, amble across the street to enjoy the pool at Tequila. In the evening, enjoy a lovely dinner (buffet or al a carte) at Playacar and then plan the rest of the night out. Both Yucatan and Tequila have discos, pretty good evening shows and a lively party atmosphere. When you're through with the dancing, the partying and the drinking - return to the civility of Playacar. It is a couple's paradise - leave the kids at home, and don't book into this resort if you're a major partier - it's not meant to be that kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not clean, the food was not always fresh and the same menu every day. Bathroom is only separated from the room by a curtain... Small room, matrass was covered by a rubber matress cover. This list can go on and on...

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to the bad reviews... It is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: sundreams
Reviews.Content: From an experienced travellor, this is a GREAT resort. I have been to all inclusives in Bahamas, Antigua, Dominican, and now Mexico, and this is up there with my faves of all time. I did read a million reviews on the resort before I went, and I know if you are reading reviews on this site then you are probably looking to make a decision on a hotel in this area...Please dont be mislead by the negative reviews... This hotel is great: Great atmosphere, Great location, Beautiful beach, Friendly people, VERY hard workers, Clean rooms / nice mexican feel in lobby and restaurants, Stunning Pool and lovely grounds, nice size as it is small enough to get around with ease, nightly entertainment is quite good, check in / check out was simple as can be, Safe beach / safe area (it is a gated area so all the hotels are within a gated community making you feel very safe to walk at all hours of the day/night, Within walking distance to all Rius and you can use their facilities. The rest of my review will clear up a few things that I have read in others, and also add information that I felt would have been useful when reading other reviews: 1. Some reviews say there are no alarm clocks in the rooms. There are alarm clocks in the rooms and they work great, as does the wake up calls! 2. Awesome place to do dophins : Discovery Dophins...Clean, long session with dophins, professional, fresh ocean location, not a small tank. 3. Cozumel: awesome place to do snorkelling...can take the ferry over for 18 dollars return and sign up once you arrive as there are many people selling guided snorkelling tours on the pier. 4. Tipping: many people didnt tip, but we did and they really appreciate it as you will see soon, they work extremely long hours... some times from 6:30 AM till 11:00 pm. Please tip them well as they are such great people. 5. Bring own cups: YES !!! their cups are very very very small... like i am talking kid size and plastic... bring your own bigger plastic cups and they will make your drinks in it no problem. 6. In comparison to other rius: this one is smaller, but I liked it better : Riu Tequila looked nice but is not on the beach, Riu Palace was stunning but very ritzy, Riu Yucatan was lush and pretty but felt very dark because of all the trees (even around the pool it always felt shaded), All are great to visit, but i LOVED the lay out and size and atmosphere of the Playacar... I am soooo happy I picked this one after visiting the others and spending time at ours as well as theirs.... 7. Internet cafe...cheaper accross the street instead of in the hotel itself.... All the rius have onsite internet however. 8. Food: Dont miss mexican night at the buffet... it is GREAT ! Buffet has food for everyone : breakfast has eggs cooked to your liking, fresh squeezed juice, fruit, cheeses, sausages... bacon... you name it... dinners have it all... seafood options, meats, veggies, pastas, cold salads... I did not find that i got sick of the food at all... it was all good....Tried the steak house and it was delicious... if you like well done steak, order medium as it will still come well done ! they like to cook their meat well i think!!! so knock it down a notch when you are ordering and it will come how you want it.... this dinner was like a 5 course meal starting with soup, then salad, then the meal, followed by baked alaska (flaming)... it was Delicious!!! 9. Playa Del carmen as a town : very beautiful... almost feels like a mini spain... great bars if you want to go there at night... 10. Age group at the hotel : all kinds... the week we went there were only a few kids... majority middle age, and I am in my mid 20's and I met several people my age to hang out with... I had a great time so dont worry, there are people for everyone of all ages there!!! 11. Time Share people: didnt come accross any and i was prepared to find hundreds based on the reviews! just be aware, but dont be over paranoid as I didnt find a single time share person. 12. Cancun airport: No problems here... it was smooth as can be for us.... 13. washrooms off site ... if you are doing day trips off the resort, be prepared, some of the washrooms you will encounter might be interesting...and many of them cost money if you are out side of the resort... like in cozumel... not alot... just a few cents. 14. Rooms and beds: yes, beds are hard but I slept great, ask for a room facing the walkway... building 3 and 4 are smack dab in the middle of the pools and the lobby/ restaurant so i would request these builidings if I were you as i heard that the buildings too close to the lobby were loud at night with lobby bar noise and that the buildings near the night entertainment could also get loud.... we slept great... no noise travelled through our walls... it was a wonderful, nice decor, clean room... towel art every day, restocked fridge, alcohol dispensers in the room... in room safe, TV with a few english channels, bottled water provided in room fridge and also at front desk, shampoo and soap and shower gel in small packets (we brought our own as we prefer to use a normal size bar of soap... your choice!) 15. Alcohol : if you want name brand alcohol, just ask for it... they have it, but you have to ask. 16. the smell that many talk about : does not exist at this resort from what i could tell, but you can definitly get a whiff of it as you walk up the main street past other hotels... it must be something in their sewers or something... but you dont have it at the playacar... see, it is paradise here!!! 17. When you get off the plane to go on your trip, dont lose the declaration form that you filled out... YOU NEED THIS TO GET BACK ON THE PLANE to come home ! 18. they are quite good at speaking many languages... we had no problems here communicating in english. 19. Dont pay more than 40 paseos to down town playa del carmen... this is the going rate... 20. Towel service was GREAT...big towels, trade them in if they get wet... no probs... No probs with getting a chair around the pool or on the beach...also lots of sunny as well as shaded areas at both 21. Facilities accross the street : complexes right across the street that you can get things you need... pharmacy stuff, cameras, internet, souviners, etc...though i am sure this stuff is cheaper down town, but if you dont want the fuss of down town, it is literally steps away. Areas of improvement that I saw : Only two things here... firstly, it would be great to have a beach bar... secondly, bigger cups at the bar... plastic is fine, but needs to be increased in size big time as they truely are kids size!!! Thats all for now... i took 3 disposable cameras and filled them all... it was just such a great trip... and I highly recommend this resort... If you like to have fun and enjoy a resort that is friendly with hard workers taking care of you, this is the place for you! Have a GREAT time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu”
Reviews.Author: Rathmannc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar last month and had a wonderful experience. Our rooms where clean, the frig was always stocked. The ground were beautiful and kept very clean, same with the beach. Didn't need to fight to get a lounge chair at the pool or beach, which is always a plus. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The food was very good. A small hint for those who might have trouble climbing stairs, ask for a ground floor room, they have 3 floors, with no elevator. We stayed for 10 days and look forward to another stay next year. This will be the first time we have stayed at any resort more than once, we felt it was great. P.S. The kittens & mother cat was a nice surprise. It seemed like most people enjoyed them, seemed a little like home........

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: docrthb
Reviews.Content: If you don't like this place, you won't be happy anywhere. Most beautiful beach I've ever seen, riddled with palm trees. Awesome pool, bars, staff. Best time of my life. Met and partied with many cool couples. Will definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Loved it going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Mexico. We had stayed at the Riu Taino in Punta Cana the year before and were impressed by the service so we thought we would give another Riu a try. We arrived Oct 23 to Oct 30 and we were imppressed from the time we arrived till we left. T The frist time we entered the room there was an slight smell, but we turned the air on and after a hour it was gone. The beds were hard and 2 doubles put side by side made a king which I did not like. You must lock valuables up in safe they give you. We had no problems and did not hear of any , but in just common sense. The food was great for all meals and staff was very helpful. The entertainment was great and the cervasa was cold and the daquiri's were great. There was lot's to do for everyone and if you like to sit and do nothing you could do that at pool. There were lot's of lounge chairs when we went and there werer always good spots shade and sun. Lot's to do and see and do. They gave helpful info to make your stay good and they gave teach you how to buy things when you go to town (take taxi). We will be going back and taking friends, beacause we were so impressed with staff, food and service. If you had problems they looked after it right away. Eg we needed extra towels 5 min later they were there. Ran out of bottle water they came within 10 min. I would recommend this to anyone and I will be going back as it was a great time all around.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time at the Rui Playacar-no complaints!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the RUI Playacar in mid August. We have been many places including Tahiti and this resort was excellent. I read alot of comments from this site before booking and at first was alittle nerveous but we decided to book. We liked the idea of it not being a mega resort. We enjoy smaller more intimate resorts. It was our first time to all inclusive as well. I can't say enough great things about the hotel, staff, dinning a beaches. The rooms were spotless, staff so friendly and helpful, the grounds were beautiful. We are booked in May 05 with five other couples and we can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first time at a RIU and Mexico. The resort was exceptionally clean and there is someone always freshing up with paint. The beach was crowded, its not the carribean. The kids (13 yr old girl, 10 yr old boy) loved body surfing in the huge waves. We only got to sail once due to the sailing closed because of rough seas, bummer. We enjoyed the activities, scuba in the pool, rifle shooting, bracelet making, volleyball etc. We enjoyed the steakhouse but service is slow, your on vacation, enjoy it. The buffet quality is good. Staff was all exceptionally nice. All the water and ice cubes are purified, we didn't get sick. Loved the massage on the beach. Met some nice people. Good quality for the price!

Reviews.Title: “At the Riu Playacar Five Times & Loved It”
Reviews.Author: keith5919
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for Cancun, forget the Rius in the Playacar area of Playa del Carmen. It's much slower paced and no, there aren't any buses running , BUT it's an easy 20 minute walk from the Riu Playacar to town, or a five minute taxi ride. Again, this is NOT Cancun. We are very experienced travellers having been to the US VI, Jamaica, Costa Rica, the Dom. Rep. and Mexico, as well as to Europe many times. The rooms at the Riu Playacar are immaculately kept and we found the buffet food far better than other chains we've stayed at, including the Barcelos & Iberostars. One downside to the food is the ala cartes. They are not worth going to in my opinion. We found the drinks very good and they do have top shelf liquors - you just have to ask for them, perhaps it's because they know us very well, but we were never given a "watered down" drink. The beach is beautiful here and unlike another reviewer, I think it's much nicer than Canun's beach since in Cancun I don't remember one palm tree on the beach. Here there are many palms and the water is much calmer than in Cancun. All the staff was very kind & helpful to us on our many visits and we look forward to going back to the Riu Playacar again. We have recommended this hotel, as well as the Riu chain, to our friends (at least 10 other couples have gone on our recommendation) and not one has regretted going.

Reviews.Title: “My First Trip Ever And I loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Dr.Martini
Reviews.Content: January10-January21 2004 I was a first time traveler looking to escape the cold Canadian winter. My father (50 yrs) and I (23 years) thought the Playacar looked great. As a young man I still love to party and have stay up late. We found the Riu complex great beacuse the evening Disco is located right in the complex so there was little worry as I left my father to his earlier night and headed out to party. My father is a long time traveler and he said the food at the Riu was a good as any he's ever had. I loved the nonestop drinks (including the Disco) and couldn't have been more thrilled with my 11 day vacation. The beach was great and it was nice having a Shopping centre across the street with currency, pharmacy, and a internet location (much cheaper then the hotel). We had a great time playing Volleyball and everynight at the Disco we got booted out at close. With 4 hotel going to 1 disco it was always busy and the Tequila never stopped. Be sure when you arrive not to take a transfer to the Palace. It was full of rich, snobs and everyone I spoke with was unhappy there. I was so pleased with the Playacar.Don't worry about any of the bad comments, as I said I may be a first time traveller but my Dad enjoyed it at 50 as I did at 23 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recomend you visit an alternative location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitewtr23
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Riu Playacar, October 30-November 6, 2004. I would not return to the area, nor the hotel complex. This area of Mexico is overbuilt and heavily populated with tourists. If one is looking for a Cancun, Miami Beach, Myrtle Beach type of vacation this would be the spot for you. If one is looking for something quieter and more relazing, as well as less cement/structures and more nature(what God created, not man) I would recomend one go elsewhere. I myself prefer the outer banks of North Carolina to the hustle, bustle, people and cement of a city located on the beach. The hotel had beautifully landscaped grounds. Due to heavy usage the hotel itself appears to be much older than it actually is. This hotel is located on the beach, but two other Riu's are not and as a result the hotel actually buses in hundreds and hundreds of guests from their non beach locations every half hour on the hour. One begins to feel as though they are beaching in a bus/train station. The pool is cleaned daily but one really can't tell. The heavy guest usage shows greatly in the condition of the pool. There was actually trash on the bottom of the pool that remained on the bottom of the pool all week long.Our room smelled very badly/musty. Though our clothes/luggage/ect. have been left in the garage to air out for the past three days they still smell sour. A lot of food is provided, but as is typical of a buffet the quality suffers when huge quantities are being prepared. The restaurant wait staff were under staffed and as a result you end up waiting on yourself a great deal of the time. The housekeeping staff was the highlight of the week. The towel animals and flowers were a very nice touch. The rooms were always cleaned very well. The noise level in the hotel was irritating. The evening show traveled through the complex making it difficult to sleep at night-11pm. The level of noice at the pool became a major irritant. The staff loved their microphones,speakers and whistles a bit to much. Though guest involvement was minimal at best with the pool/pool deck activities the noise/music/whistles blasted throughout the day making relazing, reading, napping, ect difficult. One began to feel as though they were in a club 24-7. I would strongly recomend Cozumel over this area any day as well as the Allegro complex located on Cozumel. Nature has been allowed to reign over profit in Cozumel at the Allegro.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation - Highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! The wife and I spend the week of October 23rd at the Riu Playacar. Just great. It was a first for me, in the Caribbean’s, so I was a bit suspicious. I had nothing to worry about. We were never really sick; only slightly one evening. After that, a Pepto-Bismol tablet before each meal did the trick. To much fruits to fast, probably. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and will do anything to help. Everything was great: service, food, entertainment, etc...Buffets were so good; we never went to the "à la carte" restaurants. The entertainment team was wonderful, especially Juan, Gabriel, José, Israel and Erick. Boy these guys made us laugh. They are funny, witty and very creative. They managed to have a lot of us participate in different games, shows, etc... So this place was lively and fun. The area outside the hotel is safe and the market in front is typically Mexican. Spent a day snorkeling with Aquatic Adventures. It was great, we were a bunch of Canadians and Americans and had lots of fun. There were quite a bit of Germans and a bit of other Europeans. They don't seem to have the same “beach ethics” as us, North Americans, both on the beach itself and in the water. It was sometimes annoying. Other than that, It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon except hide your Valuables”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the last post. Good food. Great location, the beach was phenominal. And tours of Tulum, Xel-Ha, and Chichen-Itza were breathtaking! We also took the ferry across to Cozamel to snorkle. If you want to go to Cozumel, take your cab (should be about $4 US)down to Playa del Carmen and take the ferry ($16.50/person both ways) and rent a scooter ($30 US) when you get to Cozumel. MAke sure you have your snorkling gear and visit the east side of the island. That is where the locals snorkle and surf, be sure to get a map before you leave. Don't take the tour guides right off the ferry as they take you in what seems to be dead coral. The stay was wonderful except for: We stayed with Riu Playacar for our honeymoon from Sept 27-Oct 11/04. I have to say that the resort, food, beverages, services as well as most of the staff were quite good, helpful and courteous. However, I wanted to let you know that I am unimpressed at the fact that my wife's gold chain and family ring were stolen from our room. The jewelry was hidden in our suitecase on the counter with the TV and taken by one of your staff as nonone else would have access to the room We. Covered and hidden in the suitecase so incase someone looked in, couldn't see it as a precaution would felt we shouldn’t have to take. We spoke with the manager, (I believe it was Gabriel) and he said that he would have the security look into it. About and hour later, we spoke to a girl at the front desk and she told us that there were more than a few people that complained about things being stolen. Which to me and many others, should not be happening in a 5 star resort! We realized they were missing the day we were leaving, needless to say this ruined our perfect honeymoon The value of the chain and ring are approximately $700-$1000, which doesn't include the personal value of the jewelry. As well my wife had an encounter with one of the head staff from the main restaurant. He seemed to have too much to drink that night after work and asked my new wife to take him up to her room. She laughed it off, however, I didn't. In a 5 star resort I expect professionalism from ALL the staff especially on the premises. Other that these incidents, we had a great honeymoon. However, with this happening, unfortunately, I don't think that we will be recommending ANY Riu resort or Riu Playacar to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned From the RIU Playacar. 10/3/04 to 10/10/04. Weather was steamy but expected, Arrived at 12:00 noon to the hotel, were greated with drinks at the lobby (non alcoholic) went to the rooms which were COLD , nothing wrong with the air, had to use the spare blanket at night. Room temperture must have been around 60 degrees. Plus the ceiling fan once adjusted kept the air circulating. I did bring small scented candles and used them for about 3 days, the room was musty but I can see why at this time of year, and the candles did the trick, I had read a review before I left about the clock situation and bought a small travel clock , it wasn't nessasary the rooms now all have clocks. Big Ones! Food was OK and as someone else said it's not a cruise ship, more like a Country Buffet or one of those big Buffet resturaunts in the States. The Buffet is actually better then the resturaunts. They had the same menu everynight and after trying the steak house once we never went back. There is no Bar service in either the resturaunts if you want a cocktail you have to get it from the outside bar and bring it with you, I did see someone tip a waiter 1 night and Tequilia shots were brought in for them. There is almost no service of any kind in the buffet dinning room. There are some waiters with Water and Coffee but they never came to our table and we always had to get up and get our own. We were gently reminded to leave at 8:30PM from the 7:00 PM seatings which we never got to till 7:45 so felt a bit rushed sometimes. There is NO room service, and you have to remind them what liquer you would like the bar stocked with. Watered down doesn't begin to describe the liquer... I can handle about 5 Vodka Tonics ( my cut off point) over a 4 or 5 hour period before I feel the effects. I could drink literally 10 in the space of 3 hours and not have any effect. If you go to town you can buy your own but it is way overpriced almost the same as in the states, You are better off buying a bottle from the Duty free shop at the airport or going over to Cozemel. Now to the pools , there are two and a wadding pool , Why is it that parents can be soooo rude as to bring babies in the adult swim up bar pool . There are enough pools in this resort to make a Family pool and adutls only pool , Management if you are listening you need to pay attention to this, this is my biggest complaint. Watching babies throwup or have Bowel movements in a pool is disgusting. They need to be wearing swim diapers and be in a Family pool not the adult swim up bar pool. No child under 12 should be in an adult pool. Now to the activities. I would recomend caution when taking part in the Parasailing / snorkeling that is offered off the resort. My friend was hooked into the harness wrong and was litleraly falling out of it at 100 ft up when they finally noticed the reeled them in but he was slammed into side of the boat, when they pulled him on board they repostioned the harness and sent him back up with out even asking him if he was OK. Now I saw other Parasailing with no incedents but I would have a plan to signal if you want down . The other thing the water was very rough and the driver of the Wave runner who took us out to the boat thought he was funny jumping waves and redlinning the the waveruuner. These aren't designed for 3 people but that is what they put on them and the person in the back was in danger, had they let go there death grip once they would have been tossed into very rough water. We went snorkleing that day too, in to open ocean. Again rough , my mask kept filling up with water and breaking , the guide kept yelling at me to put my face in the water and I had to yell back my mask was broken , He fixed it and I headed back to the boat myself , about 1000 ft This was not a good day to snorkel, I have snorkeled in Cozemel before and I think that's the better place to go. Also the water over the coral was extremmely shallow where we went and you were tossed into it often, many people got scratched up and swollowed alot of salt water. Even getting onto the boat was bad , we had to walk out to it and climb up the ladder, a wave came and slamned me into the ladder and I cut my foot , they gave me a piece of cotton to stop the bleeding. Now I have to in all honesty say we used poor judgement on this trip the water was to rough , we knew and we went anyway. We should have just waited for another day. Overall the stay was enjoyable , But things management need to work on are the pool , it was filthy by the end of the week and I mean at 7:30 in the morning when know one was in it. They should have bar service in the dinning rooms, and fans in the outdoor theater near the bar area. Change the Dinning room menus or at least have a choice each night of 3 or 4 things. On the rooms the only thing I can say is more dresser space is needed. thier was not enough draws for 2 people. Positive notes. The rooms were nice, clean and roomy, Yes the bed was hard but I don't have a problem with that. The staff is extremely hard working, These people put in 15 hours days and yet somehow remain gracious and curteous every minute of the day. I applaud them, I felt the few extra dollars ( maybe $25.00 total) I handed out in tips during the week was well earned by them. I truely apprecialted thier fine service. I liked the set up for the resort area itself, shopping across the street , 5 min cab ride into town.. safe envioriment, but I would not go back to this Hotel, I would however go to the one next door , for a little more money I would try the Royal Hideaway. It was more Adult orientated and much better food and liquer. So if your a family or first time travelers the RIU PLayacar would be Ok for you but if you've traveled and know what good food and accomedations are this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar is MY #1 Pick of all time!”
Reviews.Author: divingcowgirl
Reviews.Content: What started out as a really bad experience at the Occidental Allegro Playacar, we got our travel agent in San Antonio to move us to another hotel. She found a room for us at the Riu Playacar. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful! The first nite at the Riu Playacar I noticed the air conditioning wasn't cooling properly. So we asked them if they would have someone look at it the next day. They did put some freon in it, but it just wasn't cooling enough for us. We asked if they had another room that they could move us to. The next day, while we packed our bags, left them in the room and went to Cozumel, they were nice enough to move our bags for us to the new room. It was on the second floor and it faced out onto the walkway. It was a nice view and a spacious room. Very clean and the towel art was really neat. I was more than impressed with the beach and the pool area. The staff was friendly and more than happy to help with anything you needed. I would tell everyone to get a massage by Jorge on the beach. It's very relaxing and a nice touch in the morning, to hear the waves crashing as you get your day started with a massage. The food was plentiful as well as very, very good. This was my first experience with an all inclusive and that is the way to go. Especially at the Riu Playacar! We WILL be back and I more than recommend this 5 star hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Once again, we had a wonderful vacation in Playacar. Went there the first two weeks of September and boy was it hot. The Playacar village is such a nice place to be. I like the idea of not being confined to the resort. We liked taking walks outside of the resort and go sight seing. The resort itself was more than I expected. I was a bit worried that it would be a bit too snobby since it's a 5star but was happy to see that it was more laid back. The animation team is fantastic. Those guys never stop entertaining, especially Joseph. We laughed all the time. The check-in was so fast and easy. Later on that same night, they called our room to check if we were satisfied with it. A couple days later we got a welcome letter on our bed from the manager. They really try their best to make sure the customers are happy with the resort. The room was great. My husband loved the mini-bar filled with beer, water, soda water and pop. The alcohol dispenser was a perfect touch. The towel arragements were amazing. We got turtles, crocodiles, dogs, elephants, flower baskets, etc... I didn't know you could make so much with a towel. The layout and size of the resort is great. Not too big and not complicated. The buffet was very good. A good variety. Deserts are very good especially the flambe bananas. I had no complaints expect for the eggs in the morning. They seemed a bit watery compared to ours back home. This was the first vacation that we did not get sick due to the food. I liked the idea of dress code requirements but have to admit that at 115 degrees, the men didn't really feel like wearing long pants. My husband wore golf shorts some evenings and the staff did not say anything. The bars offer a good selection of different drinks. The alcohol amount in the drinks are just about right but towards the middle of the vacation, the bar staff kept pouring more and more each time. I have to admit that it doesn't hit you like it does back home. We never got drunk even though the amount we drank some nights. We had a blast with the bar staff. They are so friendly. The pools were great especially since the sea was rough the second week due to Hurricane Ivan. The beach was amazing. Alot of chairs are available and the palm trees provide the shade needed. The only problem with not having the pallapas is that you have to move your chair around during the course of the day if you want shade. All in all, it was the best resort we have been to and are definetly recommending it to anybody who want to have fun and relax as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I returned yesterday from 4 nights, 5 days (Sept. 18-22, 2004) at the Riu Playacar. We loved it and had a wonderful time! We liked the size of the Riu Playacar -- it's easy to get from point A to point B. The food is incredible. I don't know how anyone can complain about the food. Your options are unlimited. No matter how long you stay, there just aren't enough days to try everything. You absolutely must have a massage on the beach. We got a deal for 2 -- Swedish, Shiatsu, and reflexology for 50 minutes for each of us for only $90. Jorge is wonderful. The staff is very friendly. I can't say that about some of the guests though, but that's not the resort's fault. These people are on vacation and many, many of them would not even smile back, much less speak!!! We had no problems with smells or air conditioning. The towel art is a nice surprise when you return to your room. I highly recommend the Riu Playacar, and we will return. Any questions, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Playa Del Carmen and stayed at the RIU Playacar back in January of 2004. Let's just put it this way.....we are currently looking for deals online to go back to the RIU Playacar right after the new year in 2005. The resort is absolutely beautiful!! Many people always hold back on eating certain foods in Mexico. My boyfriend and I did not hold back at all at this resort. We ate everything!!! The food was absolutely fantastic. And guess what? We did not get sick at all! The staff was even better. We particularly had a really fun time with the bartenders that work down by the theatre. They made the trip just that much better. I read in several other reviews that people had an issue with the rooms being "musty". Frankly...I really have no idea what they are talking about. I always keep the air condition very low in any hotel room. Doing so during my stay left me with no "musty" feeling of the room. I would say that the only down fall is that there are no ocean view rooms. The resort is more like a small community. If you are looking to actually wake up and look out your window at a full ocean view..then this would not be the place for you. But everything else about the resort made up for that. The beach is enormous! I have never been on a larger beach at a mexican resort than this one. The entertainment crew was always a ton of fun as well. There are people of all different ages at this resort, which made it interesting. I would recommend this resort to any person of any age!!!! P.S. - If you go there...introduce yourself to "Carmen", one of the bartenders. She's a blast!

Reviews.Title: “so good we are going back for the 4th time”
Reviews.Author: mollyann500
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the RIU Playcar! So much so that we are going back for the fourth time in two years. The first time we went just the two of us. 90 days later we took our daughter, son in law, and grandson with us. Last November we went with my aunt and 3 cousins. The 14th of September we are taking our Moms for a week. The staff are great, the food is fantastic. The beach is one of the best in the world. We have traveled a great deal but find ourselves going back to Mexico and Playa Del Carmen in particular. The RIU hotels are great and we always look for them when we travel. As to that musty smell some have complained of..that is Mexico....when you are in a jungle is smells musty. I highly recomend this hotel to any one. For the money this is a bargin, nice rooms, good food, clean grounds, and a caring staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pkcasa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Riu Playacar two years ago. However hopefully our comments are still helpful.
