We previously stayed at the Riu Merengue in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic in 2001 and returned to the Riu chain b/c of our great experience. The Riu Playacar was a nice hotel but not outstanding. The best part about the hotel is its beach. The sand is pure white and clean, with many shade trees. The ocean is gorgeous. We saw many people doing parasailing and other watersports. The pool is also very nice. One part was more rowdy and had a lot of kids. The other was more quiet and filled with adults. The pool bar was great. We thought that the maid service/minibar was very good. We left a few dollars tip each day and a note the first day in Spanish to please leave an extra gallon of water and extra cokes and beer. After that we got just what we requested. The maid also left beautiful flowers and towel art several days. Aside from the maid, however, we were not thrilled with the staff at Riu Playacar. Whereas at Riu Merengue the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful (to the extent that we missed them when we returned home), at Riu Playacar they were somewhat indifferent and unfriendly. This was a big disappointment. Some might attribute this to a language issue, but I speak fluent Spanish so it was not that. The room is a typical Riu room with two double beds pushed together instead of a king. It's not ideal if you like a king, but it's not as much of a problem as some make it out to be. The room had a lovely balcony and the room has pleasing hardwoods throughtout. The walls were paper thin however. You could hear everything in the other rooms and in the hallways. This woke us up every day. The shower was difficult to work w/o getting water everywhere. The resort does not have the most attractive layout as it is basically long and thin. This means that almost no one has an ocean view and you don't get that casual, sprawled out feel that some other resorts have. On the other hand, it didn't take long to get from one place to another. We are familiar with the Riu style buffet and a la carte restaurant seating/reservation arrangement. Frankly we thought the food was not very good at all. It frequently was not chilled/warmed properly and there was a surprising lack of variety from day to day. After not having become ill at all in the DR, we both became quite ill for about 3 days at the Playacar. I suppose it could have been from a dinner in Playa del Carmen but I suspect not b/c of the lack of refrigeration/heating I mentioned. Luckily there is a convenient shopping plaza right across the street and they have a drugstore where you can buy any medicine you need. There were also swimwear shops there with a nice variety. The hotel's location is very good--just a few minutes cab ride from Playa del Carmen. Playa del Carmen is pleasant. There are lots of nice restaurants, shops and bars to choose from, albeit at high prices--practically American prices. Plus the vendors are clearly all collaborating in their prices. Even bargaining with them did not get great results. All in all we enjoyed our 5 days at Riu Playacar. But I wouldn't return there (although I'd return to Playa del Carmen) and there are other hotels that are probably superior (Iberostars, Palace).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the RIU Playacar on August 23rd, 2004. My husband, 13 year son and I had an absolutely fabulous holiday. I was a tad nervous having read conflicting reviews. Our room did not have a smell, our air conditioning ran beautifully and the housekeeping staff were very particular about the cleanliness of the room. We travel south every year to various tropical islands. This choice was absolutely ideal for our family holiday. Our son was kept busy participating in the beach soccer and volleyball activities, along with all the other amenities i.e. kayaking, sailing, boogie boards, etc. The food was terrific. Playa Del Carmen is a great little town. We felt very safe, the restaurants are many and very good. We had a wonderful holiday, met wonderful people from all over and enjoyed the Mexican hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at the Riu Playacar. I was there from 8-8-04 to 8-13-04. At first I was only going to go for three nights. I am so glad I went longer. Even 5 nights seemed to go very fast. There was so much to do. The staff could not have been more helpful. Phone cards were a pain, nut that has nothing to do with the hotel, that is Mexico! The beach was incredible. I read alot of reviews and packed everything people said to bring. Most of it was extra baggage I never needed in the first place. I never got tired of the food. The entertainment staff was excellent. They work very hard from sun up to sun down. Try the dance lessons by the pool. They were fun. Massages on the beach were cool. My room never had a smell, the air conditioning even got too cold-we shut it off twice! very clean resort. I could go on forever. E-mail me if you have any questions or concerns. I will be happy to give you all the information you need.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been reading the reviews for the past few months and can't quite figure out what all the complaining is about. We have been traveling to Mexico for years and tried many of the all inclusives. Of the three we have tried in the Playa Del Carmen area, the Riu has the best food. The only reason I do not give this resort an "excellent" is that you had to sign up for a set dinner time for the entire stay. All other all inclusives we have stayed at only require reservations for the specialty restaurants. The Riu demands reservations even for the evening buffet. One reason we chose an all inclusive is that there is no need for a watch. We can do whatever we want, whenever we want. Having to eat at a certain time puts a damper on that. Also, we had requested the 9:00 seating thinking that we may not always be ready to leave the beach and get ready for dinner by 7:00. Unfortunately, a few of the nights we were starving by 7:30 but just had to wait it out. There is no where to get a snack after 5:00 p.m. to hold you over for dinner. The Gala and the Iberostar have food service around the clock (There was always a snack available or room service, which was not offered at the Riu). The Riu is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are prettier than the Gala or Iberostar and far prettier than anyplace we have stayed in Cancun. Is is small enough that there is never a wait at the bar or at the buffets. The place is immaculate. Housekeeping starts working very early in the morning and doesn't stop until mid-evening. All were very friendly and accommodating. Another perk was that they only charged $1.00 to connect you to an ATT operator to use a calling card. Any other place we have stayed charges at least $10-$15/call. There are so many chairs around the pool and beach that we didn't have to play the towel game as we did at all other resorts (getting up at 6:30-7:00 to put your towels on your chairs). We moved freely from the beach to the pool and never had problems getting chairs. Regarding the air conditioning complaints I have read, these people were clearly not in our building. We were in building 5, 2nd floor. It was freezing at night. Not only did we have to turn the fan off before going to sleep, but sometime in the middle of the night, had to turn the AC completely off because it was so cold. The musty smell is all over Mexico - if you want dry, go to Arizona. We brought plug ins, no big deal. I was not as impressed with the Animacion team as some others on this board. I thought they were a bit lazy and one young man was very perverted. I am no prude by any means and was traveling with an 18 and 21 year old so it didn't offend me. However, if I had small children and they witnessed his pole dancing at the pool and his gyrations in his speedo, I would not have been very happy as this is a family resort, not adults only. The entertainment staffs at the other resorts were more outgoing. The staff didn't walk the beach and pool to get people involved as I have seen everywhere else. You pretty much just had to look for things going on (volleyball on the beach and in the pool, shooting range, bingo, etc) as they didn't come looking for participants. I thought they could have been a bit more interactive or at least posted a sign somewhere daily that listed what was happening. If you weren't at the right place when something was starting, you were just out of luck. In fact, we didn't find out that they played bingo every day until we were checking out and someone was talking about it because we must have been on the beach when it was announced at the pool. Overall, the trip was great. We don't ever stay at the same place twice - there are so many others to try - but I would not hesitate to recommend this to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Honneymoon stay at Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay at Riu Playacar (23/07-07/08). It was the best vacation i ever had. The room was verry clean, the A/C worked fine, the bar in our room was filled up every 2 days. We had no problems with the bed, they are not so hard as everybody said. We had an ocean view (building 6). The staff is verry friendly. The grounds are well kept, the floor in the reception can be verry slippery because they clean them all the time. There was one thing i didn't like, that was the animation team, they were constantly stripping and showing off (real macho's) We always went to the shows at the Tequila, They were the best i've ever seen! I love Playa Del Carmen Mexico!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The place was average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Playa de Carmen. with three kids, last year we stayed at the Palladium Grand Resort that place was fantastic!!I wanted to be closer to the town this year a 5 minute taxi ride and only 4 dollars. The Palladium wa 30 minutes by taxi and was 15-20 dollars. I thought the service at the RIU was fantastic. The animation team was good, but sometimes a little over the edge in my opinion we took 3 children with us 3, 10, and 15. The shows are average. The Palladium was 1st class with 10-12 dancers on the stage at a time. The riu rooms were stinky like sewer gas. I took aromatherapy spray which did help, and i put a wash cloth over the shower drain. I would rank the RIU a 5 and the Palladium a 9. I could go on and on but if you want to know anymoreor if you have any further questions send me an email. All in all i would not stay at the RIU Playacar again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Riu Playacar (July 19-26) and had an excellent time. The water was fabulous, the beach was the best I've seen and the staff was great. I wish I could have stayed longer! Everything was great so I will try and give you as many tips as possible. Snorkeling at the actual reef is not free, it's $50 for 2 people, but you can use the scuba equipment on the beach for free. Of course, there is not much to see at the beach and the water is more murky. Parasailing is a must though, and it will cost you about $70 per couple. If you want to use a Kayak or boogie board, it's free. If you want to do any water sports however, you must sign a release at the Scuba Shop (so they are not responsible if you get hurt) and they will punch a hole in your wrist band indicating you've signed the release. There will be a little hut set up on the beach called Scuba Caribe where you can check out all of the water toys. As many others have noted, the air conditioning is mediocre, but as long as you keep the balcony door closed and your ceiling fan is on high (blowing down), it is comfortable at night. I agree, the beds are hard, but it was no problem for us. I also agree the rooms are quite musty, but we were used to it after a day or so. I didn't even notice it by the end of the week. I think the Cancun Airport had the same exact smell. The resort is 100 yards from the Carribbean so this is understandable. You may want to bring an air freshener if you think it will bother you. The cups at the bar during the day are small and you may want to bring a larger insulated cup, but for us they were fine. The mini refrigerator is restocked every 2 days with Pepsi, Corona, Bottle Water, Orange Soda, and 7up. We thought it was very convenient that they give you towel cards at check in. There is a booth by the pool area with clean beach towels where you can give your card to them and they give you a beach towel so there is no need to bring beach towels. It would be a waste of space in your suitcase. If you lose a towel card, it does cost $20, so be careful. If you want to take any trips, there are desks set up in the main lobby represented by Funjet, Apple, or GoGo Travel, and they can arrange it for you. We went to Xel-Ha, and it was a great time. You can snorkel, explore jungle, swim with dolphins and much more. The Mayan ruins are also very nice. Tulum, Coba, Chichen Izta are all well worth the price. If you're staying at the Riu Playacar, you can also visit the other Riu resorts nearby. The Riu Palace is just 2 resorts down the street and the Riu Yucutan is next to the Palace. The Riu Yucutan has much more jungle canopy on it's property and is a larger resort that includes a Disco Club, and a weight room. The Riu Tequila is across the street from the Yucutan and is nice too, but has no beach so it's a little less expensive. You may want to check out the other resorts one afternoon. Also, there is a nice outdoor stip mall across the street from the Riu Playacar with plenty of gift shops, and even a convenience store with Pepto, film, water cameras, etc. All in all, I would highly recommend this resort, and we are already thinking of going back next year. In my opinion this is a great deal for the price. We paid quite a bit more to stay in Sandals in Jamaica and would rather come here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding on the Beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This review is well overdue, stating the simple fact that my husband and I were married at the Riu Hotel in May 2004. We actually spent two weeks at this wonderful resort the first week was our wedding and the second was our honeymoon. We travelled down with a group of sixteen people, what a great experience. When we decided to get married at this resort we found limited resources of information about getting married in Mexico. So this is truely for the new brides and grooms who are looking for wedding reviews. Before we arrived at our hotel, we had been corresponding with the wedding coordinator well over 6 mths (must let you know they seem to have a problem retaining their staff) we dealt with two. Anyhow we made sure that we followed up every week closer to the wedding date via email to ensure no problems would occur. We had requested specific building closer to the beach (building 5 & 6) and a suite if possible, since we were getting married and having our honeymoon there (building 5 & 6). All building have 3 floors, the first day they gave us a 3rd floor room in building 2 which didn't have a shower curtain, a flushing problem and the A/C didn't work. This is where we experienced our first problem, after calling front desk we were told that someone would attend the problem. We arrived at 2pm that day we had someone come by and put a shower curtain up but not until 11pm the washroom problem was not fixed. We also requested a suite ( they only have 4 I believe) which were all occupied. I found that the night managers who were inexperienced, it was better dealing with the day managers who were able to deal with the problems a lot quicker. We met with the wedding coordinator on Tuesday, our wedding was on Thursday that week. Here are some tips and things that we suggest you do if you decided to get married in Mexico. Select a date and time, you can select the place when you arrive. make sure that you have all documentation for yourself and your two witnesses. Ask when you will receive your wedding certificate (make arrangements) If you are getting your hair done at the salon, make your reservation with the stylist before your arrival via the wedding coordinator this rule also applies to your guests. Bring pictures (saves alot of time due to the language barrier) Make arrangements with the wedding coordinator about which restaurant and menu (you can get this from the wedding coordinator) you would like via email. Before you arrive you can select a package, once that has been done you will be requested to send back an agreement with your signature. You pay once you meet with the coordinator. When you meet the coordinator she will show you an album where you make select your location (which they decorate), flowers and cake. We chose on the beach under the palms (very beautiful) which provided some shade for our guests. Be ready for the crowd that seems to assemble during the ceremony (which is usually 20 min) who are all in their beach attire. Our photographer was part of the package (Julio, wonderful guy!!!) We were able to negotiate the negatives for a fabulous price!!!! Our wedding ceremony and pictures were at the Riu Palace, our Mariachi band, dinner and dance was at the Riu Playacar. So yes we all walked 5 min over to the Palace. (Bring your own cold water, unless you are staying at the Palace they don't usually give the guests any drinks, which was really silly considering how hot it was!) We arrived back to the resort (Playacar) after pictures to enjoy a Mariachi band (for an hour) and toasting with champagne). We enjoyed a outdoor sit down dinner with our guests (we had one and half hour to eat dinner) We cut our cake, took more pics and then proceeding to the pool to have our first dance ( they had lit it up) we brought a CD and player to play our first dance. I have to say the food was great, always a good variety. They had great mixed drinks, watch out for the drinks mixed with coconut (natural laxative). Tip: Bring an insulated mug They have a great entertainment staff, especially Sergio who kept everyone happy. Show every night at 10pm. You could also go over to Riu Tequila to the disco (which has A/C) Yeah!!! We found emailing our friends in T.O through MSN than phone calls (Watch out for this can get very expensive) If you call the neighboring hotel (Riu Palace) as we did you are still charged for this we were not aware of this. The internet cafe across the street was much cheaper, even cheaper in Playa Del Carmen. We went several times into Playa Del Carmen $4 US cab ride. Walked the route of cafes, restaurants, bars and souvenier vendors. We took the ferry over to Cozumel (watch out for those of you who get sea sick) Take a gravol before you go also anything with ginger does the trick. The ride is usually 30 min Cozumel is great for snorkeling and duty free shopping especially for jewellery. We found that snorkeling at the resort was not great, didn't see any fish. Cozumel was great for this, worth the nausea. Well I hope that this has been informative, please feel free to email me if you have any questions about the wedding or the resort, I would be happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: JackieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My daughter, 34, and myself were at the Riu Playacar 7/17-7/24. We went without husbands and could not have had a better time. EVERYONE working at the resort was wonderful! We did not encounter one rude or indifferent person. We especially enjoyed the animacion staff...very hard working and entertaining. The hotel itself is very clean and well maintained. My daughter, who is a picky eater always found something she liked, and the ice cream is the best! We were on the second floor and our air conditioning worked very, very well. A few nights we forgot to turn it off and had to use blankets, and this was in July! The beach is the best, with all the palm trees, soft sand and beautiful turquoise water. I honestly do not know how anyone could find any serious complaints about their stay at the Playacar. My husband and I have traveled quite a bit to Mexico and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. If you are thinking about going here, don`t worry...you won`t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to the Playacar in July for 7 days. The staff was great, the resort beautiful, and the beach was astounding. We made reservations for the steakhouse dinner one night, but found the food at the regular dinner to be better, so we did not do it again. The food was good, I am not a fan of buffets, but I enjoyed the ability to try a little of this and a bit of that. The only complaints I can name are minor. The air conditioning was mediocre, probably fine for most, but we like a cold bedroom for sleeping. The mattresses are very hard, as seems to be the case all over Mexico. The pillows were hard and uncomfortable. Small things really, we had a great time. One other thing, the shower area is separated from the bedroom by only a curtain, open in the middle. It didn't matter to us, but to some it might present some uncomfortable moments. There were plenty of lounge chairs at all times, wherever we wished to sit we could find available chairs. The rear third of the beach is covered with palm trees, nice to enjoy the beach and still be in the shade. Be careful not to sit under one with coconuts, they hurt. And yes, topless sunbathing is common. We took the ATV tour through the jungle to a waterhole. It was fun, and worth the money. We also took a dinner cruise on the "Columbus". Avoid this. The boat was overcrowed by about double, and the food (steak or lobster) was mediocre. It is way too far away and way too much trouble for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “how can anyone complain?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 13-year-old son and I just returned from a week at the Playacar. I cannot understand how people can complain about such a great hotel. Remember, you are in Mexico and this is not the "Ritz". Let me adress the biggest complaint I hear from reviewers here on this site, the air conditioning. If the sliding door to the balkony is open, the air conditioner will turn off. If the bathroom curtain is closed, the cold air will not reach the bedroom. Simple, leave the door closed, and open the curtains when you go to bed, set the dial to 17 degrees and you will be fine. The beds are hard, but we were so tired from a fun filled day that we slept like babies. The food is wonderful, we never got tired of the buffet because we did try different things. If you want to eat burgers and fries you will be happy as well, but this gets old fast. They served a lot of seafood choices, paella, jumbo prawns, breaded, and broiled fish every day, as well as a lot of mexican dishes and the deserts were out of this world. The animacion group was wonderful. I had fun just sitting at the pool bar and watch everyone have a good time. Juan was a delight.... Thank you Oswaldo for filling my glass up with the most delicious drinks as soon as I got there. The beach......breathtaking. We went snorkeling with Scuba Caribe for $30, a no frills, two hour trip along the coast with a group of about 7. Was better than the large tours you can book with the travel reps at the lobby. All in all this was our second trip to the RIU resorts in this area and we were extremely happy with the service and the hotel premises. To all the people that complain, stay home........or learn to appreciate what you have rather the concentrate on finding faults. These people work for minimum wage $120 a month, and always smile, and we appreciated their efforts with daily tips. Thank you Oswaldo, Victor, Wilberth and many more.....

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a family Vacation, and I am speachless. You cannot put into words the way to describe the food, the staff, the beach, the pool, the shows, activites...everything was perfect, actually perfect doesnt do it justice. I was reading the reviews about a month before I left and was starting to worry, but worry not, this resort was unbelievable. I would go again in a heart beat, and I would reccommend this place to everyone. The only thing I can suggest is Bring a Clock, if you want to keep track of the time during your vacation. ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect honeymoon trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In late June, my husband and I honeymooned at the Riu Playacar in Playa del Carmen and found it to be a wonderful tropical paradise where everyone was helpful and kind and the accommodations were fantastic! We could not think of one negative thing regarding our stay. The resort was absolutely beautiful and the people employed there work hard every day to see that the guests are well cared for. We would not hesitate one minute to return to the Riu Playacar and hope to do so sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “took the kids and got drunk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i decided to take my 19 year old step-daughter and her boyfriend on a trip. it was a surprise for my husband! we arrived and got great rooms near the pool. the resort is very pretty. it was average compared to other places i have been to. we got a great last minute deal and it was for the kids. the pool and beach was great. the food was very good. the drinks great and the grounds pretty. the shopping across the street was so nice! the playacar area is nice to walk. we all did the disco thing and lurked around the other riu resorts. overall it was a very pleasant vacation, even though it rained literally 3 days in a row ALL day. we just all got really drunk and partied. the liquor dispensor was awesome. i was a kid in a candy store. i would reccomend this place for a nice cheap getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon over July 4th weekend at Riu Playacar. Overall, it was a very positive experience especially for the money we spent. The staff was very nice and helpful. The food was good. We did bring the plug-in and the mugs and found both very helpful. Our complaints are the same as everyone else's...hard beds and practically non-existent air conditioning. We would definitely go back again...the beach was gorgeous, and we liked the location of the hotel. If you want higher quality, then be prepared to pay a high price. For what we paid, the hotel definitely kept up its end of the bargain. An added bonus for my husband was all of the topless women on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Americans never seem happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Seriously, i don't know what some of these reviewers expect on vacation. We stayed at the Riu for 10 days, last month, and throughly enjoyed the place. All services were of good quality. Was it Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous though? of course not. it's mexico for god's sake. The place was clean and the food was good, not excellent, good. the beach was beyond reproach. the water was 85 degrees and crystal clear. what more can you ask for? I think some of these people are just complainers and go on vacation just to nit-pick. it really makes the rest of us look exactly like them, ie, stupid, picky americans.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: willksc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stayat the Riu Playacar on July 8th, 2004. What a fabulous resort. I am a travel agent and I have been all over the world. I have to say that this is one of the nicest places I have ever stayed. The food was great! However... I am not a buffet fan. The restaurants were great! I did not find it to be a problem to get a reservation. We were with 9 people and got a reservation everytime we needed it. I do have a great restaurant to recommend in Playa del Carmen. True authentic mexican food with salsa dancing, music, and fun! Email me....it was great! The beds are hard.....it's Mexico! The grounds are beautiful.....Iguanas everywhere! The staff works hard!!! Thanks to Esvoldo at the pool bar! There are activites everyday poolside and the animation team works hard to entertain you. The sand was hot! It is July though....so wear your beach shoes! The only other suggestions I would have would be to take an insultated cup, glade plug in....I didn't think our room was very musty though. We stayed in building 5. It was the closest to the beach and pool. I honestly don't understand why this beautiful resort has gotten any bad reviews. They are crazy! Our entire stay was wonderful! You won't be disappointed at the Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: kelfly
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Riu Playacar over the 4th of July weekend with my 18 yr old daughter (mother-daughter bonding before college!). We used Apple Vacations / Allegient Air from Denver. This was our 2nd trip to Mexico; first was three years ago and we stayed at the Moon Palace. We chose the Riu Playacar based on reviews on the internet and comments from a neighbor who visited last year. The beach area is beautiful. Very soft sand, no seaweed (didn't return to Moon Palace due to excessive seaweed), crystal clear water, and ample loungers. The best thing we brought on our trip was $1.50 blow up float mats which we used to float around on the ocean for hours and hours. It was so hot during our visit it was impossible to just lay out on a chair, but the float mats were great. The scuba shop will fill the mats if you don't want to blow up yourself. We also brought mugs (great tip we received on this site!). The cups you get from the pool bar and other areas are the smallest I've ever seen. In that kind of heat you'll finish your drink before you ever get back to your chair. We always tipped the bartenders a dollar or two when asking them to fill up our mugs. All of the staff was extremely polite, friendly and helpful. Never ran into any staff that were unaccomodating. Our room didn't get made up until 4PM the first day, but was done by late morning later in the trip. The rooms were very clean, as was the entire resort. We had 3rd floor, building 3, but overlooked the back of the resort next door -- poor view. The air conditioning was basically non-existant, but we were only in the room to sleep, and with the ceiling fan running we were comfortable to sleep. (very hot though if we came back from an activity). I usually love the heat and thought it was strange there were no blankets on the beds. Definately didn't need them! We left all of our remaining pesos and around $5 US for the room steward when we left. (along with our mats we didn't want to deflate and haul home!) The food was OK and presented quite nicely. I just didn't like the idea of set dining times. Since we were only there for 4 days, I survived the buffet, but I think an entire week of buffet food (breakfast, lunch, dinner) would get a bit old after a while. There was a large variety, and we always found something we liked -- never went hungry! Having the shopping center across the street was very nice. We used the internet cafe at Donnelly's several times to check in at home. Only $1 for 10 minutes. We also walked into Playa one afternoon to shop and took a cab back. The Playacar area has some beautiful homes and the walk was about 25 minutes. We also took a cab to town for dinner one evening and ate at La Parilla. The food was very good. We took a snorkeling trip through the Scuba Caribe center on site. We paid the day prior for the 12:30 trip. They told us to show up at the same place the next day at noon to get our gear, which we did. The attendant then told us to wait by the picnic tables, which we did. It began to thunder and sprinkle and no one ever approached us about the trip. So at 12:30 I went to the counter to inquire if the trip was still on. I was told it was too late for the 12:30 trip, that we were supposed to take our gear and walk down to the Riu Palace to get the boat for the trip. No one ever told us that, so we wasted the entire morning, but were able to take their 2:30 trip. Make sure you verify where to go if you book through Scuba Caribe. I am used to snorkeling in the Caribbean islands (Curacao, St. John, Aruba), and seeing "live" coral reefs. While the area of Cozumel/Playa promotes having the 2nd largest reef in the world, I was very disappointed. No color to it at all -- appeared to be dying. The guides gave no instruction to those that never snorkelled previously. It is very shallow over the reef in the area we stopped and people were getting stuck in the reef, stepping on it to get out, etc. It is such a shame that no care or protection is taken. We saw some pretty fish, but the reef itself was a huge disappointment. We used the peddle boats at the resort and had a good time; also attended the Michael Jackson show which was quite entertaining. Not sure where I caught the "bug". I didn't drink the water and was careful about what I ate. Maybe I got something at the restaurant in town or the plane food on the way back. In any case, I've now been quite ill for almost 1 week and am being tested for girardia or samonella. Very limited number of english speaking guests during our first two days; appeared to be more later in our visit. Not a big deal to us, but may be to some that want to meet up with other's they can converse with. Overall, the resort was beautiful, the beach outstanding. I would recommend this resort to others that are looking for a great beach, clean facilities and a smaller resort complex. We had a very enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Playacar June 22-29 2004, I had read numerous reviews on tripadvisor, prior to our departure, and frankly I was concerned about what we might experience. I am pleased to say we all had a highly enjoyable vacation! The children ages 11 & 13 can't wait to go back! The room was immaculately clean, our bar was stocked, more frequenly if we requested it. Yes, the beds are hard, but we were so exhausted at night, it didn't affect our sleep, after the first night. The food was average, to my wife & I, but we weren't expecting goumet cuisine from an all inclusive resort. The kids loved the food, there was always a bountiful variety, so the they never got bored with the selections. The staff, from the desk clerks to the beach staff were very accomadating and courtious. Every staff person we encountered, was concerned if we were enjoying our stay. The kids just addored the animacion entertainers, especially Joseph. He would come down to the beach & play with all the children, play volleyball or soccer in the pool with them, he really went above and beyond, with all the children at the Playacar!! The resort was small & quaint, we ventured over to the Tequila & Yucatan briefly, we didn't see any reason to visit them again, not that there was anything wrong with them, but we had everthing we needed at the Playacar. Not everything was perfect, we didn't expect that, but ask me complile a list, and I can't really remember exactly what those things were. It was a"good deal" for the price, and we will be back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar - wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just read a review where the people were furious that their air conditioner didn't work to there standards - they complained loudly and didn't think the response was appropriate. Maybe if they had acted civil they would have gotten a better response. A group of eight stayed at the Riu Playacar in March and thought it was absolutely wonderful. The air conditioner in the room does not kick in if the sliding glass door is not shut tight, also you can control you room temperature with the thermostat on the wall. We had one problem where one couple had a room with a slight musty smell (with the air conditioner and the ocean you will have that some times) they were moved to another room the next day. They also said it wasn't that bad that they couldn't have stayed in it. The staff was exceptionally accomodating, whether it was the hotel lobby, the dining area, bars or room attendants. Our room was spotless as well as (we thought) the entire hotel. The food was the best we have encountered in our six trips to Mexico. To complain about air conditioning ruining a wonderful time to relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings is a problem within itself. It reminds me of the people who get upset because some of the people in Mexico don't speak their language -- imagine that!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort~!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to the resort 4/9-4/14/04. I absolutely LOVED the Riu Playacar. The beach was amazing--shocking turquoise water, white sand that doesn't get hot on your feet, and a nice combination of several days of big waves followed by a few days of very calm surf. The resort grounds were immaculate, almost constantly being cleaned and maintained. There were plenty of comfortable lounge chairs on the beach and at the pool at all times, and we were told the resort was at 98% capacity. The pools were very nice, great swim up-bar, great hobie cat sailboats at the beach, etc. The frozen drinks were delicious and the swim up bar had a great drink menu. Didn't feel the need to bring a huge insulated mug-in fact I thought people looked pretty goofy with them. It was good to get up and get a drink every so often. One day they served huge drinks in coconuts on the beach-I don't know if it was only because it was Easter Sunday but the resort went above and beyond our expectations. Our room was very nice-extremely clean and although the room wasn't freezing cold from AC, we were in Mexico--I didn't want to be bundling up under blankets after a cold Wisconsin winter anyway! I can't believe how many people complain on this site about AC problems on a tropical vacation. There are ceiling fans and it seriously did not impact our sleeping ability at all. Also, we went with another couple and they put us in rooms next to eachother with an outside door to shut to our hallway which was great-it was like having our own suite. The housekeeping staff and the restaurant staff were very nice aand accommodating nd I practiced my Spanish with everyone I could. The towel animals were great and on our last night I half-jokingly asked our housekeeper if he could make me an alligator and the next day there was a huge towel alligator on our bed with sunglasses and a hat on it. It made our day and I made sure to tell him so. We left him a nice tip at the end of our stay. The rest of the staff at the resort were very friendly as well, especially the European students working for the resort entertainment group as a part of their internships in hotel management. The food was really good-always lots of fresh guacamole and the breakfast buffet was great! The only problem with buffets is that it is easy to over eat! The town of Playa del Carmen was a nice 20 min. walk down palm tree lined streets or a quick $5 cab ride. There is a nice pedestrian district with lots of shops and some great restaurants. We had a wonderful dinner at a traditional Mayan restaurant that was recommended by the front desk at the hotel. If you like to snorkel, I would strongly recommend avoiding the funjet/Apple trip to Paradise Reef and going on a trip from Scuba Caribe right at the resort beach instead. The funjet trip was more expensive, and were told it would be a 3 hour trip and instead it was 5 hours, the last hour and a half we were forced to sit at a restaurant and wait for the bus on a beautiful day. It was the only disappointing part of the trip. I am dying to go back to Playacar next Spring-I can't imagine a better place for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Read This for a true Review on the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My children and I spend our vacation at the Riu Playacar in Cancun. The following are bullet points on the Playacar. 1. The Resort was beautiful, the grounds were full of tropical flowers and palm trees. The rooms were very, very clean. 2. The staff were tops. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and welcome. They exceed in helpfulness. 3. The food is incredible! There is a huge variety of foods and everything is fresh. Great!!! 4. The dining area is first rate. Every table has linen table cloths and the silver ware is set for you. 5. Have at it. The drinks are made with care and wine at every dinner is a must. 6. The clientel is friendly and mixed with Honeymooners, Families, young and old. 7. The beach is huge, clean, soft, and plenty of lounge chairs. The water is the Caribbean is right in front of you. The moon was full and lit up the sea, WOW. 8. Live entertainment at night, great fun! Note: Make sure you tip the staff, well worth it and they work for it! Hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Stay!”
Reviews.Author: djcoop14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on our honeymoon from June 16-23 and had a great time! I have been tracking this site trying to get information for about 6 months, and I can safely say that many of the low gradings come from people that NEVER went to the resort (other resorts that try to get the Playacar a bad score) or are UNBELIEVABLY picky. The last couple reviews with the Air Conditioning(could be possible, but did you do ANYTHING else on your trip? If you are only going to stay in your room to test the air conditioning, stay at your local Holiday Inn. If you travel to a beach resort, I strongly suggest visiting the beach and the 1 million + 1 things to do in the Yucatan.) As far as the person not having a room for a few days, I don't believe that story at all. I was in contact with the front desk with different questions everday, and every time they politely answered my question or resolved my problem. The front desk staff was beyond friendly (as was the same for the ENTIRE staff in all areas). I will not say that we didn't have room issues, but they were all fixed quickly. Our drain in the shower was not working well, creating a pool in the shower. We called on it, and within 2 hours it was resolved, no problem. We also called a couple of times about needing more water (you get 3 huge bottled waters, 2 7ups, 2 orange soda, 2 pepsi, and 4 corona bottles in your fridge), and they brought more water shortly. You also get 4 hard liquor bottles in the room (1 each of tequila, rum, vodka, and gin). Complaints about the bed hardness (we got used to it quickly...no big deal at all) and the AC (each room has a big ceiling fan right above the bed) are from probably the same people that complain about getting free gifts. Nothing is ever too good for them. We brought the big insulated mugs, and were pleased how well they worked. we filled them up before we went to the beach and they lasted all afternoon. Otherwise, we probably would have had to go back and get refills 3-4 times...My favorite drink that I concocted was filling my insulated mug with soft-serve vanilla ice cream, getting a small glass of orange pop, bringing it to the bar and having them blend it together with some shots of rum. It was an orange shake that tasted phenomonal on the beach. I also have read about getting up early to get beach chairs. There are ALWAYS chairs available, but if you want a prime spot, get up early, if not, don't worry. The meals...I compare the average meal (buffet style) to a U.S. casino buffet. A lot of different food with some changes everyday. I didn't like the taste of some of the food, but there was always something else that I could choose. We tried the steakhouse one night (you have to make a day-of reservation for that), and it was very good. Other suggestions: -bring lots of $1's, for tipping and making exact payments for things in stores as often they only give back change in pesos. -the cab fair to Playa del Carmen is $4 -Go across the street from the Riu Playacar to book cheaper day-trips...they are on average $20 cheaper. -Choose the 8:30pm dinner time (you could also choose the 6:30pm) as often the vacationers schedule makes it a rush to get ready by 6:30pm. -Guys, bring at least 2-3 pairs of pants. The resort has a rule about wearing pants for dinner and not wearing t-shirts. It is a bit more formal, which is fun, and it was very embarrassing to see many americans still wearing their swimsuit and tank-tops to dinner when it is obvious that everyone else is dressed-up. -The evening shows are all pretty good, and the Michael Jackson show was as good as I have read on this site. We did go one night to the Tequila to their disco, and although the club was smaller than I expected, it was fun for almost all ages (the music was newer dance, r & b, etc... so older couple may not enjoy it as much). -The only time we tipped at the resort was $1 a day for the maid (who was actually a guy). He did a great job cleaning and daily left a towel character that was really cute, and we always found ourselves excited to see what character would be next. We did tip our dinner waiter (you get the same one each night) Joswe (the best waiter of all time) at the end of our trip as well as our vacation host from Olympus Pablo. -If you know any spanish, try to use it. Even if it is only Cervesa (beer). That is their national language and attempts should be used to speak it...although most employees do know a good amount of English...they appreciate your efforts to speak Spanish. The nicer you are to the staff, the more they return that favor x 10. I think that is what many of the bad reviews were lacking. -Topless beach. Yep. New thing for me to see...about 1 of 20 women were topless (usually laying out) on the entire beach (about 12 different resorts). Nothing too big of a deal. I suggest for US guys to wear shades so you don't get caught peeking... -If you go down there and come across Francisco the bartender or Joswe the waiter, tip them well as I am sure you will see how great of a job they do. They work normally from 11am to 11 pm, (most employees work 12 hour shifts). -There are other things I could write, but this review is already way too long, but a saying they have down there is "Nobody knows you, and nobody cares!" Which means let go and have a good time. You get out of the vacation what you put into it. If you are a bump on a log and want someone always catering to you, go somewhere else. The recreation staff (Animacion team) is always trying to get people into activities and have fun. -One last thing: I can understand why some of the world does not like Americans. I observed too many people from the US being rude and drinking WAY too much. We tried to be a bit of an Embassador of the US...which really wasn't too hard. Simply being polite and not making fun of Mexican, European, or South American people isn't too hard, but you would be surprised at how many were embarrassing themselves and the US. I encourage anyone that has any questions about the Riu Playacar to contact me if they have any questions. We had a great time and had a great experience and would be more than happy to help you out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu. Stayed 7nights. The hotel was beautiful. We were put on a bottom floor when we arrived. We requested a 3rd floor. We were told they were full but to check back the next morning. The bottom floor room was very musty smelling. We were with friends and we had three rooms on the bottom floor. They were all very smelly. The next morning they moved us to the 3rd floor. No musty smell at all. Rooms were very clean and nice. Everyone was very friendly and could not help you enough. We did put our valuables, money, passports etc in the safe, but forgot to padlock our carry on bags in the room and our cell phone was stolen. We did padlock our other luggage everyday.The maids or towel boys did go through our luggage that was not padlocked. We did not find anything else missing. Just be sure and use the safe and padlock your bags. Our friends experienced the same problem with their luggage. The beach and pools were beautiful. The food was excellant. We never tired of the buffet. Cancun airport was a mess. Very busy. Some of our luggage was damaged when we got it. We believe they also went through it after it was checked. Zippers were missing on our luggage. We would go back to this resort. I think that you just need to be very careful with all your valuables at any hotel and lock them up everyday. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would never ever stay at the RIU Playacar ever again. We booked our vacation in November of 2003 for May of 2004 and EVEN AFTER CALLING TO CONFIRM OUR ROOM the night before - when we arrived in mexico we did not have a room UNTIL THE NEXT AFTERNOON! It was a very horrible experience becuase the the reception staff was very rude to us...they kept saying...go to the beach...we have a problem with your room but we cant tell you what it is...it was terrible. I was in tears becuase we were sunburned and wanted to take a nap and WE HAD NO ROOM FOR 24 HRS! They did NOTHING TO COMPENSATE US....it was a nightmare. We finally did get to our room 3pm the NEXT DAY. After we rested up we made the best of the rest of our vacatoin. I would not recommend this hotel becuase the rooms are not very clean... the knobs on the shower and sink are disguisting...my nails were black and goey from touching them.....the room smelled so bad, i thought one of the mexican rats had DIED in there...we couldnt even breath. The food was boring at the end the end of the week - no changes.... i would rate this 5 star a ONE star.

Reviews.Title: “Best Yet Cancun/Playa Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Playacar. This was my 3rd trip to the area, and the Riu is well deserving of the high ratings you see on this site. The food at the buffet was very good, and each evening there was enough variety to make the buffet well worth the experience. I had read some people were not thrilled about the steak or seafood restaurant, but we found the steak restaurant of good quality too. Because it has a bit more "romantic" setting, the steak restaurant is worth the effort especially if you are there for an extended stay or want a change from the buffet. Also, the cookouts on the beach were fun and tasty. Lots of meat options grilled fresh right close to your lounge chair was a nice option for lunch. The beach as many have noted is awesome, so I won't elaborate more. The hotel staff was quite friendly and responded to every request we made. Our initial room smelled overtly like smoke, so we asked for a transfer which occured within minutes. We also had to ask for wash cloths twice, one time it was addressed immediately. The other I remedied by finding a maid who assisted me. Overall they were very attentive to my needs. Why not an excellent rating then? I agree the in-room refridgerator should be re-stocked daily. It wasn't the alcohol that was the problem for us. It was the water bottles. Even though you could get it easily enough, the convenience of it being ready and cool would have been excellent. We learned a simple trick about the third day that an empty water bottle on the bed with a $1 under it would fill the fridge every time. The pool bar tended to serve the women first no matter the order you arrived which I found annoying (although I understood to some degree for courtesy). Most of the time though, you were served immediately as there was no rush at the bars. Last, the assigned seating for dinner seemed a bit too confusing for the staff as I observed tables being double assigned etc. This caused some minor inconviences for the guests involved. A few small improvements like this would allow me to rate this resort "excellent", but without a doubt I would consider returning to the Playacar. If you've booked here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I just don't get it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand how this place gets so many positive reviews from this site. There are so many absolutely wonderful resorts in Mexico, but this is not one of them. Okay, I am willing to concede that the beach there is spectacular. The pool area is nice, but only average. Keep in mind that this is in comparison to other resorts in the area. Here is what I experienced and can validate as true: 1. The lunch and dinner buffet food is not very good, but not terrible. I would say that you get what you pay for, but it's not true. You are much better off dining in town. We experienced wonderful meals in Playa del Carmen and they were very reasonable and much better than the food at RIU Playa car. 2. The service at the RIU is terrible. Yes it is Mexico, but if you advertise as 5 star you better be all that and more. Mini bar should be stocked daily not every 3 to 4 days. If there is a dispute, it should be resolved quickly. Ours involved stolen luggage and was never resolved. We were never given the room upgrade we were promised and they didn't care. You also need to figure out for yourself how to sign up for signature restaurants, rentals, etc. A more active and informative concierge would be helpful. 3. Yes, the rooms are a bit musty. I don't hold this against them. Our room was not that bad and it is the jungle. But, our view was of the next building over. You can't do any better for honeymooners? Come on. 4. Yes, the beds are hard. Again, I don't hold this against them. All beds are hard in Mexico. 5. The lunch area smells of stale beer. This should be addressed. Again, not worthy of the 5 star rating. Overall, I need to give this a 1 out of 5. If it was advertising itself as an average resort I would give it a 2 or 3. This is not a luxury resort, and unless they make dramatic changes, it never will be. I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Playacar. We were there from May 22nd to May 26th. Just needed a short getaway. Would I recommend this resort? Yes. It really depends on what you are looking for. Best things about it: If you are a lay on the beach type, you're in heaven. Beautiful grounds and very well kept. This place is clean, clean, clean. When I first walked into my room, I noticed that the floors shined. I assumed that it just looked clean. The next day I noticed that they mop the floors daily. They even pull out the beds from the walls and mop behind stuff. I was throughly impressed. Great customer service. I thought that a belt was missing from my room, it turns out that I left it at home (duh). They launched a full investigation for my belt. I found out that it is their policy to search all employees each night before leaving to make sure that things don't walk. The entertainment was fair to good. The Michael Jackson show was very good. The Playacar is smaller than the other hotels, and we found that we liked it better. They have a wide variety of food. It is eatable and decent, but we found that we were never looking forward to lunch or dinner. For most people, it is just fine. We're just kind of picky about eating really well on vacation. We always do cruises, and this was our first resort. So in all fairness, I'm not sure what to compare it to. We had a good relaxing vacation, but I wouldn't go back only because of our food preferences. Everything else really was great. On a score of 1-10, the playacar is a 7. The biggest benefit that I see is that you get so much for your dollar. It is an excellent value. Things to keep in mind. Bring American singles. Although not required, we tipped our housekeeper $2 per day. As I mentioned before, we received excellent service. I won't go into the details of the things that I requested, but they remembered everyday without being reminded. Bring insulated mugs, a clock, shampoo, soap. We bought a $10 mexican calling card to phone home. It's $7 per minute from your room. Yes, the beds are hard, but I found they were okay. There is a smell, but that's Mexico. After awhile it goes away. I bought plugs-ins and candles and only used the plug in. The biggest things to look out for are the timeshare people. These people are so slick. As we got off the plane, people who look very official approached us. (Keep in mind, everyone who works in the airport looks official.) We managed to get past all the people approaching us, but right across from getting our baggage there were people from behind the desk calling us over. We told them we wanted to get our bags, they said no you have to come here first. Asked for our baggage claim ticket, wrote something on it, and proceeded to smoothly tell us about the area and what we should do. Finally after about 5 minutes, he goes into why we need to go to a meeting at the Mayan Palace. We then realized that he was a timeshare guy too. (We thought that we were so smart.) On the beach they approach you, but they are very nice when you say no. Just a note: Many women on the beach go topless. Overall, we had a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar is the place to be.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from May 13 through May 20th. We absolutely loved it and would love to go back anytime. The beach is turly amazing, the food is great and plentiful and the staff is the most accomating that I've experienced yet. The rooms are simple and the beds are okay. There are no clocks in the room so we suggest bringing your own since dinner is at specific times (2 seatings - 6:30 and 8:30 pm). You are able to enjoy the Riu Yucatan and the Riu Tequilla as well. We found both had excellent bars (for the nightlife) and the staff was friendly as well. We highly recommend going.

Reviews.Title: “We just returned from 2 weeks at the Riu Playacar. ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Riu Playacar and had a great time. The beach and pool were very nice. We loved the food and the beds seemed just fine. The beds in Mexico tend to be harder than we are used to in Canada and U.S. We have stayed in numerous resorts in the Mayan Coast and this is as good as any. Calvin Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned After 7 Days - We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay on 4/28. This was our second trip to Playa del Carmen, the first to a Riu Hotel. We absolutely loved the resort. It was a beautiful place with a huge, spectacular beach. The food was better than we expected. Dinners were excellent, great variety and great taste. We ate at the "steakhouse" one evening and had a great time. The only minor issue we had was the lunch, food was good, the variety of selection could have been better over 7 days. Our room on the third floor of building 3 was very nice, very clean. We ran low on bottled water a few times, one call got our room restocked quickly. The nightly entertainment was better than we were prepared for, 3 shows were excellent. A few points: 1)Due to the insane amount of comments about musty odor we brought a plug in air freshener, which was a good idea. Our room had a slight musty smell when we arrived, but this was expected since the buildings are open air and you are in the tropics on the ocean. 2)We did bring 24 oz insulated mugs, which is a great idea for taking a cold drink to the beach, the bartenders are happy to clean them and fill them. 3)Bring lots and lots of sunscreen, we could not believe the number of fools that obviously did not wear enough or any and looked like lobsters their second day of vacation. 4) Topless sunbathers on the beach were fewer in number than our last trip, max was 10 at a time, which included my wife. We theorized the reasons for fewer were more Americans, and the internet. 5)Service and Tipping. The service from every member of the staff was outstanding. The bartenders move at the speed of light, never waited more than a minute for a drink. Contrary to many postings I have read which made it sound like everyone tips, we did not tip any of the hotel staff. I can count on one hand how many tips I saw people give to bartenders and dinner hosts over seven days. We believe in the all-inclusive system, we did not tip last time and got great service, and we got excellent service again this time. 6)Ask for "name brand" liquor with your drinks. Instead of Pina Colada, ask for Pina Colada with Bacardi, or Margarita with Cuervo. If you don't tell them what liquor you want, you get the house brand which is, uh, not very tasty. If yu have any questions just email us.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: KSH
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort! Great food/beach/drinks/staff/weather, etc. Only somewhat negative is comment is yes, the beds are a little "hard", but you get used to them. The manager said that may change next year too. Not that we went to them to complain about it - he just came around at dinner one night & was asking for comments. Did Chichen Itza a few years ago - highly recommend over Tulum. Not that Tulum isn't wonderful in itself.... The long bus ride isn't a big deal to Chichen Itza - well worth it. Did the zip-line/snorkeling in cave/underground river & biking with Altournative this time. Would do it again! Any questions, feel free to e-mail me!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: zgiant1
Reviews.Content: Riu Playacar is a very nice place for a vacation. We were there April 24 - 28, 2004. My wife and I are early 40's and left the kids with the grandparents at home. The staff was very friendly and courteous, always saying "hola" when you passed them. I would classify the food as very good and better than I expected. There was a wide, wide variety at every meal at the buffet and it was different every night we were there. The only problem was that I overate! I will say that they don't serve very much beef, but I stuck with the fish, chicken and pork and was happy. We made reservations one night for the seafood restaraunt and we were pleased with the food and the service. The breakfast and lunch buffets were also very good. They have a omelet station for breakfast and have a bacon, sausages, breads, fruit, fresh juices, etc as well as cheeses and cold cuts (very European). We walked one day to the Yucatan and it was the same lunch, but good just to be in a different place. The mix of guests was an interesting mix of North and South Americans and Western Europeans, especially Dutch and German. I didn't find anyone to be arrogant or obnoxious (except the drunk guy in the hallway at 3:00 am one night). We were glad we read some other reviews and we brought our own soap and shampoo. We didn't bring an insulated mug and were OK, but we spent more time at the pool than the beach, if you are going to be at the beach a lot, bring one for your drinks. Also bring some slippers or house shoes to wear in the room because the tile floors could be cool, especially after the maids cleaned them. We didn't do any tipping at all except a small tip for the maid. I saw some people tipping at the pool bar, but only a small minority, it wasn't expected, and nobody at the resort will hit you up for a tip. They give you "towel cards" to trade in for beach towels, so you always have fresh towels for the pool or beach. The only show we saw was the Michael Jackson show and it was pretty impressive. We took two trip while there (booked through our Apple Vacation reps at the hotel). We went on the "Snorkeling Adventure" where you go to a park and snorkel along a barrier reef. This is a full day trip. You snorkel in two different places, have lunch and relax, then go out one more time. It's "all inclusive" there and they serve beer and drinks, bottled water and the lunch was good. We also went on the "Zip Line" where you go into the jungle, swim and snorkel in the large sinkholes and birdwatch, check out caves, see a Mayan shaman, and then slide on these metal ropes over the jungle. This was a very different experience from the normal touristy stuff and if you are a little adventurous I would recommend it. This was a half day trip, but they give you lunch as well. Bring money to tip on the trips, not only is it expected, but the trip guides do a great job and you will want to tip them and be generous. Unless you are a total snob or extremely set in your ways and inflexible, the Riu Playacar is a great place to have fun in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Time of my life!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One week at the RIU Playacar nearly changed my life. As a 19 year old looking for some inspiration i found it. A place i'd like to revisit on my own, i'm sad to be home. I went down with my family for easter(aunts uncles grandparents etc.) and simply had the time of my life. The beach is bueatiful and the pool phenomonal. The staff couldnt be any more friendly or helpful. The bartenders work harder than anyone in the states. You can spend an entire week without leaving the hotel. Of course that wasnt the case as a four dollar cab ride takes you to downtown play del carmen, where you can enjoy the likes of carlos and charlies, senor frogs or the blue parrot. Whether its relaxation or party time, this is the place. Access to a few other hotels, some with clubs(all inclusive) make the trip unbeatable. If your thinking about the RIU, book your trip now!!

Reviews.Title: “I become ill reading these reviews!”
Reviews.Author: wadot46
Reviews.Content: I become ill just reading some of these reviews. People who think they are reviewing the RIU Playacar are quite frankly, telling more about themselves than the resort--and sometimes the picture is not pretty. My wife and I have stayed at the RIU Playacar approximately 10 -12 times and are booked for May 12-19. We have lived in Europe and traveled most European countries as well as Asia and of course most of our great states including HI and AK. We have also been on seven cruises. Apparently, most of the negative reviewers have never before ventured past the county line and at best, it was a first visit out of the good ole US of A. 98% of the negative complaints you read hear are totally unwarranted. These folks would not know a good beach, a nice room, quality food and quality service, even if it were biting them on the backside. All hotel rooms (regardless of cost), homes, stores, outbuildings and other structures in and around the ocean and humidity smell musty. Second and third floors are farther from earth so they don't smell so much but then people complain because they have to climb the stairs. The smell has never bothered us in the least and never will. If you want to avoid the musty smell, don't go near the beach or jungle or Mexico or the equator—just stay in your back yard. Mexican beds are hard. That's just a Mexican bed--they like it that way. We usually sleep far more there than at home. If you have to have a bed just so-so, stay with yours. Visitors at the RIU Playacar are comprised of about 80% Europeans, 15% Canadians, and 5% Americans. Anyone who has been to Europe knows that they like to wear less in the sun. Men don't seem to mind this (dah) and once American women realize the topless ladies are not a threat to their marriage, they don't mind it either. Sure, all people are not perfectly shaped and just like reviews, some are prettier than others—so what! Sometimes it's that 5% at the RIU Playacar that brings us to question the values of the "good ole American way". Once you travel outside, you understand that it’s not the rest of the world that’s different—it’s the Americans. Sure the RIU Palace and other resorts are nicer but you pay much more for it. If you must have a disco or, your arm band gets you into the Yucatan or Tequila (not Palace). The lady who said all the people from the Tequila pour onto the beach was wrong; that's at the Yucatan. We’ve been there all times of the year and never has it been crowded. The size of the RIU Playacar is great and anyone who's stayed at the Yucatan will certainly appreciate the fact that you don't have to "take a hike" to the beach. The buffets are wonderful for the 5th through 95th percentile guests. The complaints about the food are from the other 10% who find fault with their grandmother's cooking or consider McDonalds to be fine cuisine. There are some complaints about the dining “schedule”. All cruises serve dinner on “schedule”, that is you may choose to eat at 6:30 or 8:30 or whatever. You don’t have to wait in line to get reservations your first morning. Just show up at either 6:30 or 8:30 and tell the maitre d' how many nights and he will seat you and you claim that seat and time for the rest of your stay. Really tough isn’t it! Do remember long pants for men for dinner. All nicer resorts require this. If you want the most of everything in a vacation for the least amount of money, you will be very happy at the RIU Playacar, unless of course you don’t like your grandmother’s cooking. Just don’t believe the negative reviews—they go with negative people. For all those giving great reviews, keep drinking from the half-full glass! You’re welcome to email me with questions or comments.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ten of us ages 7-57 vacationed a week at the Riu Playacar and couldn't have been happier. The hotel was very clean and the property was beautiful. The food was excellent, choice of food was enough to make anyone happy.The staff and management could not do enough to keep us happy. We have never seen people work so hard to make a stay enjoyable. The beer was great however the drinks were very weak. All one had to do was ask for different/more alcohol and the bartenders did their best to remedy the situation. There were always enough available chairs on the beach and by the pools. We would return to the Riu Playacar in a heartbeat. It was everything we had hoped for and more.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For five girlfriends who can't agree on most things... celebrating their 50th birthday at Riu Playacar was heaven. Rooms were very clean, food was excellent, weather was great- and Rob and Juan did a great job with the "Animacion". We probably spent way too much time at the swim up bar -but it was wonderful - easy access to the beach , close proximity to Playa del Carmen - excellent wait staff too -always with a smile in the dining room and at the bars. It was a holiday to remember and it is hard to find a negative in this little paradise of the Yucatan Peninsula, which in itself is an exceptional place. We're planning our 55th now - and may even bring our husbands with us!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Lem1
Reviews.Content: My mom and I (I am 29 and she is 52) stayed at Riu Playacar in Oct 2003 and had a great time. Now I am comparing this propery to others I have stayed in Mexico (Marriott Cancun, JW Marriott, Cancun Palace, Sun Palace, Royal Solaris, Solymar, Gran Caribe (now Riu Caribe) & Costa Real as well as Riu Taino in Punta Cana, DR. For an all inclusive, I thought the food was good - I am not a fan of buffets and am quite a picky eater when I travel but I never had a hard time finding something to eat. Breakfast has cooked to order omelets along w/ donuts fresh out of the fryer along w/ cereal and plenty of sides and fresh fruit. Lunch was your run of mill buffet - burgers, fries, pasta, salad bar & pizza. Dinner offered 3 choices - buffet, Mediterranean (seafood) and steakhouse. We only ate at the seafood restaurant the night they had fresh grilled shrimp and it was great. You must make reservations for these 2 a la carte restaurants in the mornings at breakfast to get in. I don't eat red meat in Mexico so we didn't try the steakhouse. The buffet again had a ton of choices along w/ a dessert and sundae bar. The drawbacks here are no beach bar (you have to walk all the way to the swim up pool bar which is far if the sand is hot). Beds are hard but no harder than the Palace Resorts and I didn't notice the musty smell others complained of. We were on ground floor which I preferred so we didn't have to walk up all those flights of steps. Overall I enjoyed the resort and thought the shows were mostly pretty decent compared to others I have been to. They have an internet access on property which was nice and it only takes 5 min to get to Playa del Carmen (5.00 cab ride). The gym is at Riu Yucatan (a 5 min walk) and the nightclub is at Tequila property. In room refridgerator w/ beer, soft drinks, water and liquor was very nice and convenient. Food was better than in Punta Cana but no place as the quality of resorts that Negril Jamaica has in my opinion but still a good choice for Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two week holiday at the Riu Playacar. It was the most amazing and probably the best trip we have ever taken. There were six adults and two children in our group (ages 5 & 8). The children had a wonderful time playing on the beach, park and pool. The property was absolutely gorgeous and immaculate. The food was incredible. A big thank you goes to the Entertainment Team consisting of Jaun, Sergio, Rob, Flo, Jodie, Jessica, Alex, and the rest. They are hard working and always ensure that all guests have a terrific time at the resort. They are also very funny. We appreciated all the humour. We have no complaints. It was a wonderful and perfect holiday. We highly recommend this resort and we hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “not long enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our holiday was excellent not enough days, next year two weeks. Our room was clean and the maid was in every day, no complaints and our room never had a musty smell the food was good and never had a problem getting a good drink the bartenders were great. I would recomend this hotel to anyone it is a little small compared to the tequilla and the yucatan but it is nice and relaxing. I have never seen such a beautiful beach their was no problem finding a good spot on the beach.They had a couple of swimsuits shows by the pool very nice, I found the people there very friendly. Can"t wait for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation from a seasoned traveler”
Reviews.Author: jaythetravelguy
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday. Had a great time. My wife and I are 48, my kids are 16 & 18.Tips:1) Take bar of soap and shampoo.2) Size of hotel is a plus. Easy to walk between beach, pool, room and restaurants. Other Riu hotels had long walks between and long waits at buffet lines and bars.3) Take insulated mugs ($4 at Walmart). I would pour a beer from my room refrigerator into mug and take it to pool or beach and it would stay cold for over an hour.4)Did combo Xel-Ha/Tulum side-trips. Don't book in hotel ($94) book across street at strip mall($74) Both places were nice, but everything took longer because of logistics of picking up other guests. Might be better to rent car and go on your own. We ended up spending 2 hours at Tulum (Mayan ruins) and 3 hours at Xel-ha. Probably need 6 hours to do Xel-ha right. Snorkeling was great (more fish by the dam) and rafting was good.5) Entertainment was better at the Tequilla. You can go there since it is a Riu hotel. We did 3 nights at Playacar (Michael Jackson and Grease are best shows) and 3 nights at Tequilla. I didn't expect much in the way of entertainment, but it was probably the weakest point of staying at the Playacar.6) Food was generally good. Lots to choose from. My favorites were the bacon and omelets at breakfast and the oysters at dinner. Stay on the buffet line. We booked on night at the Steak restaurant and it was horrible. Maybe because we are from Kansas City where the best steaks in the world are from, but looking at everyone elses meals, I would give it about a 4 (out of 10) Buffet line is about an 8 or 9.7) smell in rooms: We were on first floor in bldg 3. We didn't have any smell, but our neighboring room did. So, check out your room when you first get there, and if you don't like it for any reason, get another one. They don't mind. I would recommend a room facing the walkway.8) Final comments: My wife and I travel extensively all over the world (over 50 countries) and I must say that this was my best trip to Mexico. Friendly people, clean, great beach, didn't get sick. Resort was excellent by Mexican standards. Riu Palace was nicer, but very large. I would recommend it highly. The all-inclusive deal wasn't my cup of tea, but it made things easier. Those who like to drink a lot and eat a lot will really like that aspect of it.

Reviews.Title: “Lil' Slice 'A Heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a wonderful, relaxing stay at the Riu Playacar. What we loved: The beach! It's amazing! I am a beach lover and this is some of the best beach/sand/water I've ever experienced. The weather made the stay great as well. The hotel is smaller but it is comfortable. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. Both of us are 25 and we found the age group to be a great mix. The shows at night are so entertaining and funny, you can tell the staff works so hard. The bartenders can make just about anything. Bring large insulated mugs if you want to sip drinks on the beach all day because the cups you get are small and melt fast in the 80 degree heat. Take the Xel-Ha excursion--it is so worth it. It is like nothing I have ever done before. Snorkeling in the most beautiful water pluse rope swings, cliff diving and floating down a river on a tube. The staff is so accomodating. And the one thing that I usually complain about at all inclusives is the food. But I never got sick of it! It is delicious. There is a swim up bar we rarely used because we didn't want to leave the beach. There are a few beach vendors, not many and they don't pester you. The shopping in Playa del Carmen isn't all that great. There aren't too many good deals and the restaurants are a rip off. We just stayed at our resort and had a blast. We visited the Riu Tequila and Yucatan and I think the Playacar was by far the nicest. I would reccommend this resort to anyone that wanted a nice stay at a clean, friendly resort. Also, leave a tip for the maid everyday, I think they appreciate it. There is a liquor dispenser in the room as well as beer, soda and water. We want to go back again! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Better than a Cruise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We completed our 8-day, sun-filled Apple Vacation stay on March 1. We really enjoyed the all-inclusive comforts of the Riu Playacar - the staff was very attentive and always working on making the resort neat and tidy. My wife and I agree with the majority of the reviews regarding the food, the wonderful beach, friendly staff, etc., so 'nuff said there.
