We offer the following tips (that you may have read before): We took our own full-sized bars of soap, since the Riu soap is the smallest we have ever seen (Thanks previous reviewers!). We also packed our own shampoo bottle to avoid dealing with the "rip and tear" packets. If the desk clerks mention an upgrade opportunity to the brand-new Riu Palace in Cancun, give it a try. We transferred free of charge for our final two days and it's a truly breathtaking property - well worth checking out. Beware of the tour kiosks / stands in Playa del Carmen - most are fronts for timeshare properties, especially the Mayan Palace resort. We got roped in with their "come and check out our new resort hotel" deception, and spent 5 grueling hours trying to "escape". Oh well, we got free tours and free gifts, so it wasn't a complete waste of time. Also, keep your eyes on your valuables (purses, pocketbooks, etc.) when going thru security at the Cancun airport. My wife let the security screener look through her purse while another screener checked her shoes. We were over the Gulf of Mexico before she realized that $80 in cash was missing from her pocketbook. Be vigilant, but have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a nicely laid out resort without the feeling of a "mega resort". This was our first experience with an all-inclusive resort. The staff was attentive and made sure that you were happy. The grounds were perfectly manicured. Enjoyed the diversity of quests from other countries. Initially, we felt more like a minority. Dutch, German, French and Austrians appeared to be the prevalent quests when we were there. Food was also diverse but I recommend the Steakhouse and the Mediterraneo as an alternative to the main dining areas for dinner. The steakhouse was a 5 course meal. The location allowed full view of the ocean and beach. We were fortunate enought to enjoy our time there during the full moon, which elevated our experience. Would recommend bringing a large plastic mug for the glasses hold only 6 oz of fluid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Riu Playacar and can't say enough about this hotel and wonderful service. The beach was great, the pool was always busy with tourists enjoying the sun. The rooms were great as well. I have read complaints about the rooms and smell, we did not experience any problems whatsoever. We stayed in building # 4 on advice from this board and that was a perfect walking distance to either the restaurant or the beach/pool. The staff was excellent, the grounds were impeccable and the food was always excellent. We walked to town one day it was probably a mile plus - later found a $4 taxi was easier. We went on Sun Trips and all transfers etc. were handled perfectly. The evening shows were a little funky but what the hey, it is Mexico. Will be going back in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went down to the Riu Playacar on a SunTrips vacation package the 12th-19th of Feb 04. We had a great time there and enjoyed the hotel. As one person stated, it is a small hotel and that made it enjoyable. Thanks to the previous visitors we made the selection to stay at the Riu Playacar. The facilities were not overwhelming as we had seen at other resorts and that was nice. We had the choice of using the other Riu properties in the area, and although they were very similar it was comfortable. The hotel is very close to Play del Carmen and the ferry port to Cozumel.Close to the shopping in PdC. There are special restaurants each hotel had each evening for which you must sign up. We were planning to go on Valentine's day and but tried the steak house on the Friday before. Ok, someone wrote a while back this was nothing to write home about and that was correct. The ribeye was one tough piece a beef. So after that we stuck to the wonderful buffet.The buffets were good and depending on how you pace yourself you won't get tired of them after 7 days.If your goal is a golf vacation and you are serious about the game, then Cancun is not the place to go, but if you enjoy the game and are willing to sit through a 90 min presentation by the Palace Resorts folk, then it is free. Although I enjoyed the 9 holes before dark, it was good. Now the people we played with were not happy with the course etc, Oh well. On the side, the pro shop is pricy.We talked to various groups and decided on Suntrips. We were pleased with the package. Not sure about the level of support once there and are on the tours. Some from the group took some Apple trips for the day because they offered more. Our goal was to be on the beach and take a couple of trips. The only downside was that the temp was lower than expected and it did rain more (5 out of 7 days). The locals were saying this was unusual for this time of year. We had a great time but that is what we wanted to make of it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I (8 of us) just returned on February 22, 2004 from 2 glorius weeks at the Riu Playacar. It was absolutely wonderful!!!!! The food was amazing, the rooms very comfortable and the pool and beach areas were absolutely awesome. I must also make a specific comment on the Anamacion team of Gabriel, Juan, Sergio, Job, Rob, Flo, Jessica, Jessie, Jodie and Camillo. They were fantastic, entertaining and did an amazing job every day. The entertainment in La Cumbia every evening was great!!!! There was never a moment of boredom. They should all be commended for jobs well done. They are some of the nicest young people we have met on our travels to Mexico. All the staff in the hotel including the waiters, bartenders, front dest staff, house cleaning staff, etc. were excellent. This is our 6th time to Mexico and the first time to Playa del Carmen and we would definitely love to come back. We had no complaints whatsoever and those people that did complain, well....... I cannot imagine what they are looking for or why they would even want to complain when on a vacation. The Riu Playacar is a wonderful resort and I would recommend it to anyone. Signed A Happy Canadian

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. The food was good, the rooms were clean and decent, the service was excellent, and the pool and beach areas were great as well. The only reason I would not go back is because there are NO rooms with an ocean view. This is what we go to Mexico for...the beautiful, warm, turquoise ocean. You have to walk at least 150 yards to even see the beach/ocean. I wonder what they were thinking when they decided on the design of this hotel? If you don't mind not having a view or walking to get to the beach, this is a great place to go.

Reviews.Title: “perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the most fantastic vacation at the RIU Playacar and it could not have been better other than we should have stayed at least 7 days, maybe 10. There were 9 of us in our party and the service was outstanding, all of the people were very nice and they helped me celebrate my 50th birthday with style. The resort was small enough that I felt safe and confortable and yet we were able to roam from resort to resort, downtown and up and down the beach. I have never been to a resort that was so clean and helpful. I am saving my money to take my children next year and am recommending this resort to all my friends. The food, drinks and atmosphere were A+.

Reviews.Title: “large group usa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Riu Playacar early February. There was a large group of us that went over 70 people. It was our third time we took our sons ages 22 and 25 with us they loved it. I would highly recommend seeing Darcey at the dive shop very helpful, ( he also told us where to go for souveniers and how to do some trips for less money) we had a blast went on three dives. Darcey and made it so much more fun and a great experience. There was some people in our group who never went on an all inclusive trip before and they loved it. We had ages of 14 to 66 and everyone would go back. This hotel is the smallest one of the Riu's but very nice, the staff work very hard to please you and want you to have fun. The food was always fresh and good. The only thing I owuld like to see there is more bars and maybe a place you could eat after supper for snacks. The RIU in Jamaica had an open 24 hour pizza place with salads. We were there last year and it was nice. People that look at thease places for mistakes need to lighten up and enjoy themselves! Go to MEXICO it is beautiful and sooooooooooooo much to do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times in different resorts in the Riveria Maya. This time a group of nine of us went including parents, brother, aunt and uncle, cousins and my fiance. We stayed at this hotel and we had a blast from the time we got there and until our unfortunate departure a week later. The five younger people in the group are ages 19-27 and we found a good number of people in our age group. The hotel grounds were kept up very well and were beautiful. The water and the beach were nothing short of amazing. The fact that Playa del Carmen was so close was another huge plus! The drinks were great (if they didn't put enough liqour in your mixed drink, then just ask for more). And you have access to free drinks in your room and they are restocked every day. The discos were fun too, especially at the Riu Tequilla. Usually not our kind of music, but hey, it was Mexico! The food was ok. I think the food would be my only complaint that I had. It was by no means terrible, but it wasn't the best I've had down there. Overall, the trip was fun and amazing! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT RESORT FOR ALL”
Reviews.Author: GreatEscapeTravel
Reviews.Content: Just came back from yet another wonderful vacation at the Riu Playacar. This time 10 of us went. An amazing resort with lots of good food, friendly staff, and a great time. Beautiful location and only 20 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen where it is easy to bargan for a good price. I can't wait to go back again. This time I am considering to take my two young children. They have a great "Mini Club" for kids. The Riu resorts are at the top of my list when considering travel. A must try for all!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a honeymoon at the Riu Playacar. We stayed from January 3rd through the 8th. It was the most beautiful place we have ever been. Everything was perfect. The weather was great the whole time. The staff and cleanliness of the hotel could not be improved upon. We will definately be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Open your mind”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm 20, and I went with my parents and 22 year old brother to Riu Playacar. We were told that the resort is fabulous, and a lot of fun for "the kids." Unfortunately, we didn't realize that "kids" meant 13-15 year olds, not people our age. The Playacar does not have its own disco , which further brought our enjoyment of the resort down. However, after the first 2 days, my brother and I began to open our minds a bit and met some people relatively close to our ages. We went to the disco at the Riu Tequila down the road, and had a blast! There are a lot of Europeans there, and it's so interesting to meet people from er the world, and have contacts for travels to Europe. The staff at the Playacar was also the most friendly of all of the Riu resorts, and were very interesting to talk to. The rooms were very clean, and I advise driking drinks from the bar, not the dispensers in the rooms. They do smell a bit like mold, but I think that's just the humidity. All in all, it was a great vacation, and I'd love to go back! Once you open your mind, meet people from all over the world and treat the staff like friends and not servants, your trip will be fabulous as well!

Reviews.Title: “4th time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I just returned from our 4th trip to the Riu Playcar. To me, it is the perfect place on earth. Yes, the rooms smell but we would not go back if that was a major problem. Some people complain about being in the first building on ground floor. We enjoyed the location and spent time on our balcony people watching. I would request that room again. The Europeans may be cool to non-Europeans but who cares. We are there to relax and have time together. Everything is great, love the "downtown" of Playa del Carmen and the restaurants are excellent. We will return to the Riu Playacar again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent Dec 29-Jan 5 2004, this place is fantastic. The food is great and plentiful, the beach is incredible. The hotel is spotless and they can't do enough for you. Yes the beds are hard, and there are topless women on the beach. But you get used to it pretty quickly. This place is paradise and don't let anyone talk you out of going.. No question my wife, daughter and I will be back. Plenty for a teenager to do also..

Reviews.Title: “You are in warm beautiful Mexico, what's not to love!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the RIU Playacar 3 times now. We love the people who work there and the service has been phenomenal all three times. I especially love the smell in the rooms. We've always stayed on the second floor of the buildings closes to the pool. It's that lovely moist air that we do not experience where we live. In some of the reviews there were complaints about it--but I guess it is all how a person looks at it. I for one can't wait to experience it the minute I walk into the room. My husband and I have travelled all over the world and we love returning again and again to this destination and to this hotel. I highly recommend this hotel and I look forward to our next trip to Mexico and the RIU Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Playacar, Playa Del Carmen, Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week at the Riu Playacar in the Mayan Riviera. We can't say enough about this resort! The food was great, the rooms were very nice and the whole resort was absolutely spotless! This resort is nice because it is not very large and you don't feel like you're constantly bumping into people. They had great shows at night and the staff was wonderful. The town of Playa del Carmen is very close by and it has great shopping and a great nightlife. We had absolutely no complaints and would recommend it to anyone. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: vvbChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We were at the Riu Playacar from Dec. 13th to the 17th and it was marvelous. The service we received was impeccable, the waiters, the desk personell, the maids were extremely friendly and efficient. Our room, though small, was comfortable. It is true that there is a musty smell in the rooms, but a candle and the air conditioning soon take care of the odor, its no big deal. We enjoyed the food, there was an amazing variety of foods at the buffets for all three meals. There was much to do, the pool, the beach, group activities, day trips to Playacar (4 dollars for the cab), shopping right across the street from the Hotel. I suggest you stop at one of the little shops that has sea shells, we found some unusual souvenirs there. We went to Xcaret one day - it was fabuous, but our major recommendation - bring your own towel!! We're thinking of booking again next year, same hotel, same time of year, we loved it so much. We booked through funjet and had no trouble. People should know, though, that when the van picks you up at the airport, you're with other people and depending on where your hotel is, depends on how quickly you get dropped off. We landed at 2:30 and got to the hotel around 5. Part of that was luggage and customs, and about an hour in the van. We recommend the Riu Playacar to anyone who is going there. Get ready for a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware-you just thought you had a Xmas Vacation Booked & Paid for”
Reviews.Author: astonalii
Reviews.Content: On Sept 24, 2003, my clients booked and paid for a 7 night stay at the Riu Playacar for Xmax vacation, Monday, Dec. 22, 2003, through Apple Vacations. After we closed Friday, Dec. 19, Apple Vacations called and left a message on voice mail that the Riu Playacar had overbooked and that our clients would not be able to go on their vacation on Monday. It's a good thing that we're open 7 days a week, or our clients wouldn't have known about this mess. Apple volunteered to put the clients up at a property in Cancun, but that was not acceptable to the client because he had been there and didn't like Cancun at all. It is so outrageous that the Riu management would wait until 3 days prior to a holiday departure to notify Apple and us. We will never again volunteer to sell Riu properties, and will only sell them after we advise our clients that they pull off stunts like this.

Reviews.Title: “The Riu Playacar is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: BobACrystalLake_IL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a four night stay (December 3 - 7) at the Riu Playacar and we had a wonderful stay. We are both experienced travelers, she is a Leisure Travel Agent and I am a Sales Manager, and we were totally impressed with the staff and service at this hotel. The resort has a small quaint feeling to it and is quite an impressive complex. The hotel was originally going to give us a ground floor room in the building closest to the lobby and we requested and were given a room in the building closest to the pool and beach. The rooms are large and well appointed with a mini-bar, refrigerator and safe. The rooms smell like any resort that is situated close to salt water and is located in a humid tropical environment. Once you have turned on your ceiling fan and adjusted your air conditioning, the rooms are very comfortable. The bars of soap are very small so you may want to bring your own bar of soap for showering. We were told that the guests were approximately 60% European, 30% U.S., and 10% from Latin America. Most of the staff speak fluent English and they are very friendly and accomodating. The guests are courteous but keep in mind that U.S. citizens are not the dominant clients here. The key to having a great vacation is being flexible and learning from your experiences. If you bring your children, be prepared to notice that the European women like to sun bathe without any tops on. There were a lot of children at the resort and the hotel has a professional recreation staff to keep them busy with activities. The food and drinks (alcohol) were very good. The buffets at breakfast, lunch and dinner had a large assortment and on Wednesday the hotel served the largest peel and eat shrimp that we have ever seen. Make sure that you have dinner at the steakhouse. For dinner we had: an assortment of hot appetizers, caeser salad, tomato bisque, rib eye steak with baked potatoe and vegetables, and for desert a baked alaska. The shopping center across the street is very nice and on Saturday night there were tables set up in the hotel complex on the path to the beach where you could buy hand made crafts. Playa Del Carmen is only a $4 U.S. cab ride away and is a fun place to shop. Cozumel is a $19 roundtrip ferry ride away fron Playa Del Carmen and has more of an upscale shopping environment. If you like to bargain and negotiate while you shop, the shops in Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel will be fun for you. We found that 50% off of what they quote you the first time on some items is a reasonable amount to pay. The Riu Playacar has: - Excellent staff and service - Great Location & facilities - Super food and drinks - The weather was great during the day and cooled off at night. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently returned from Riu Playacar (Nov 25 - Dec 1). This is an excellent resort. The rooms are spotless, food is delicious, and the pool and beach area are well-kept. The staff is very polite and attentive to your every need. They are even more attentive if you can speak Spanish! However, I do want to give you a word of caution. Out of the four adults in my party, we all became ill. I know "they" say do not drink the water. We didn't and still succumbed to vomitting and diarrhea. So, make sure to bring your stomach-relief medicine. Also, I do have to agree with the moldy smell in the rooms. Fortunately, it really only bothers you when you first enter the room. After you settle in, it is not very noticeable. I am from the US and noticed the majority of the guests during our visit were European. Their different culture resulted in a less than friendly demeanor towards others. Fortunately, I came with three other adults and 2 children and did not have to worry about connecting with other visitors. In closing, the moldy smell in the room and the standoffish behavior of the other guests would prevent me from selecting this resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A rose by any other name....”
Reviews.Author: goodspkr
Reviews.Content: After our first all inclusive experience at the RIU Cancun over Labor Day, we decided to try Thanksgiving at the Riu's in Playa del Carmen. I had heard and read that the beaches were better and it was more laid back than Cancun. We loved the Riu Cancun, but found the beach to be a little small for us. We love to take long walks on the beach. We again traveled with Sun Trips with no complaints. They have this down and their charter service, Ryan Air is quite good. Again we got to Cancun and went through immigration and customs quite quickly. Playa del Carmen is about 45 minutes to an hour from the airport. Last time it took us almost the same amount of time to get to the Riu Cancun because it is one of the last stops and the bus stopped at a lot of hotels. Our bus was fill mostly with people staying at one of the four Riu's there. The road we came in on cuts the Riu Tequilla off from the other Rius (you will have to cross the street if you stay at the Tequilla to get to the beach). It was dark, but the hotels were well lit and in fact had some Christmas lights already up on their trees. We checked into the Riu Playacar and went over to get a time for dinner. They didn't have any seating available for the early setting so we were giving a table at the 8:30 PM setting. THE ROOM. We were checked into room 1102. It was almost the closest one to the lobby area. The room was a normal hotel room, although these Rius are a little short on storage space. We did smell the "smell" you read about in many of these reviews. This was to become a major problem. It is not a musty smell, but really a swampy smell. It wasn't too bad when we checked in, but the second night I woke up and it smelled like a skunk was in the bathroom. It was coming from the drains. They sent someone over who drained the drains and it was pretty good--for about two more days. Then the smell came back. We moved at this time to room 3212. We again smelled was there, but not too bad. Tip #1. Your room will have an odor. If it is too bad, get to heigher ground (second or third floor). You may also want to bring some air fresheners or even some lemon scented drain cleaner. The room was kept spotless by the chambermaid. She would leave little (and big) animals made out of the towels and even the extra blankets. The TV's at the Riu Playacar did not have timers on them (unlike the Riu Cancun), but the stations were the same, so there are adequate english speaking channels. Again there were no clocks in the room and the soap and shampoo left a lot to be desired, which leads us to our next tip. Tip #2. Bring a couple of bars of soap, your own shampoo, and a clock if you want one in the room. The Riu Playacar only has showers in the room and the bathmat is about 12inches by 24 inches. I got out of the shower the second day there and the tiles had gotten wet. Zoom, I went down like a bowling pin. After I told the management about this, they sent up a rubber mat (like the ones you have in a bathtub or shower so you don't fall there). We placed it right outside the shower and it worked well. Tip#3. Watch your step in the bathroom. Wet Mexican tile is as slippery as ice. FOOD. We were really impressed by the food at the Riu Cancun. I would have given them a 4 out of 5. The food at the Playacar was similar, but I only would give it a 3.5 out of 5. You didn't quite have as much of a selection and lunch was someone boring. It didn't make any difference where you ate for breakfast or lunch, the menus were all the same. We did eat breakfast at the Riu Tequilla one morning. The facilities at the Tequilla were quite pretty and I thought their buffet room was nice. They had artificial flowers on all the tables and the paintings on the wall made for a very nice room. The Playacar was a bit simpler. Dinner, however, was very good. We had Turkey on Thanksgiving and nice cuts of beef most other nights. Jackie really like the seafood station where the shrimp were. I had grown quite addicted to the butter pecan ice cream at the Riu Cancun, but found they only had it about half the time at the Playacar. As always the wine, left a lot to be desired (at least the first glass did). Tip#4. I found that they didn't have bacon at breakfast (only sauage). We were eating first thing (at 7 AM). Once morning I went back in to get some juice and found they did have bacon. Apparently they weren't putting it out at first. I also found the station by the breads that had Mexican foods had the best cooked bacon (less greasy). The steak house/seafood restaurant. You can make reservations for the steak house/ seafood restaurant. These are side by side and are both open air. We ate twice at the steak house. There is a varied menu at both with each have about 6 entrees. You are serve appetizers first, then salad. then the entree, and finally dessert. We only ate there twice for two reasons. We found we got too much food and the buffet was really excellent too. Tip #4. You have to make reservations in the morning at breakfast if you want to eat at either of these restaurants. I did not see anyone rejected. I think they simply want to know how many to expect. Don't worry if you eat late. There will be room at the sitdown restaurants. THE BEACH. Here is where the Rius in Carmen del Playa shine. This was probably the best beach I've ever seen (and we have traveled extensively including many trips to Hawaii). The beach is huge. The sand is cool even in the heat of the mid day. There are ample beach lounges and you can sit in the sun or the shade. We prefer the shade (we catch the sun on our walks on the beach). As you walk from the rooms to the beach, you will find the shadiest spots to be on the right hand side. We liked being perhaps 20 feet in front of the massage hut right next to the fence. There are a number of trees there and after 9 AM you had shade all day. To the left you have the boats and the building for the watersports. You will have to fill out a release form to use the boggie boards, Hobie Cats, peddle boats, kayaks, etc. and once you do they punch your braclet. We used the Hobie Cats three times during the six days we were there. Once day we didn't feel like it. Another day there was no wind and on the third day there was too much wind. But sailing is fun and easy. The water temperature is amazing. When you are on the boat the water laps up and it is actually warm. The nights are relatively cool and early in the moring when we were walking on the beach, the water temperature was warmer than the air temperature. You can walk about a mile towards Playa del Carmen (left--south). At that point we could have continued further, but you had to wade out into some surf to go on. There are a couple of beautiful homes on the way (check out the one with the bedroom facing the ocean). Gong right (north) you can also walk over a mile. You finally get up to some rocks and there is an interesting path through the rocks which agains requires you to wade through some surf to go farther. If you like walks on the beach, you'll love this beach. Tip #5. They open reservations for the Hobie Cats at 9 AM. If you are there then, you will have your pick of times. Tip #6. If you want a massage on the beach, ask them if they have any "specials." Most of the time they do. Tip #7. Bring an insullated mug with you for the beach. We got two twenty ounce mugs from Walmart for $3.60 and it was one of the best things we brought with us. Just had it to the bartender and they will fill it up. Tip #8. You may be approached on the beach by time share sales people. They will try to get you to come view a property. We were offered two round trip tickets to Cuzomel, a Mexican blanket, a bottle of tequilla, etc. to visit one. Be nice, these guys are just trying to make a living. But if you aren't interested, just tell them thanks, but no thanks. SHOPPING. There is a nice little shopping area just across the street from the Riu Playacar. No real bargains there, but very handy. We used the internet cafe to keep in touch. Costs $1 USD per 10 minutes. Playa del Carmen is also a nice little shopping town. Again, you won't find the "best" mexican prices, but some nice shops and some interesting items. We did in fact find some "overpriced" stores, selling things for more than you would pay in the states. The walk to Playa del Carmen was a nice one. Just long enough to work a few caleries off. The bottom line. We wouldn't go back to the Riu Playacar until they fix the smell problem. However, in spite of it, we had a great time and will be looking for other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with RIU”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu Playacar. My husband and I went with another couple. We were there Nov 10-17-03, for 7 nights. Checking in, they didn't have our reservations. They put us in the 1st building on the bottom floor. The room was nice, but to have my balcony on the ground floor was like staying on the promanade deck of a cruise ship, everybody walks by your room. We told them we didn't like being there, so they switched us to the 3rd floor and it was much nicer. Although we left a tip for the maid every day, we always had to call for soap or towels or our mini bar. I have stayed in all inclusives in Mexico before, but I never felt like I was on a schedule. Don't like the way you have to have a schedule for dining and that for the majority of the day, there is only one restuarant open at a time. Also, only one bar open besides the pool swim up bar. Not good. I would not go back because they really don't have much to offer for an all inclusive, expect for nice rooms, but not all that great. I can say I was very disappointed and I don't think I will choose to stay at a RIU resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was excellent !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You will be amazed how nice the workers are at this place. It is extremely clean. The pool was so clean. The food was excellent. What was really weird was the amount of languages everyone spoke, there wasn't a time that we had to try and figure out what the other person was saying. It seemed that they all knew at least English, Spanish, French, and some even knew Jap & German. Very impressive place to stay. The only thing that wasn't real great was trying to make a call using a calling card that was a little difficult and did not work too well. I heard that a lot of people get bothered by time share sellers, we didn't see one of them there. At the airport the Rep from the hotel was waiting for us and took us right away so that none of the time share people could get to us. But other than that if you are considering this place look no further and just make the arrangements to come here. You will not be disappointed. When you do come don't forget to tip the helpers, (bus drivers, maids, waiter) keep in mind they make very little money are appreciative to what you give.

Reviews.Title: “Will not be going back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After doing some research and the fact that we love Mexico we decided on the RIU Playacar for our vacation. We went from 11/4 - 11/11. The resort on a whole was beautiful. Getting extra towels took two phone calls to the front desk and then we still had to wait awhile. We were very disappointed that the crowd seemed to be in the 50 -60 year old range. There was hardly any children for our 11 year old son to play with and not to many adults in our age bracket. (40)which was very disappointing. I was prepared for the hard bed but to tell you the truth it felt great for my back. The room did seem alittle musty, especialy after it rained.z9keep the AC on) It you go ask for buildings 4 or 5. They are right in the middle of the resort and easy to get to everything. We are planning our next vacaton and it will not be to the RIU

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon at the RIU-Oct 5-19 2003”
Reviews.Author: Loungechair2
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Bahia Akumel last year and having travelled to Punta Cana the year before...We hoped that our hotel senses were leading us to another fantastic location.......... ummm.....here goes....... We were married on the 4th and after the reception went directly to the Airport as happy newlyweds. We checked in with no problems but hoped that with our marriage certificate in hand...possible for a free upgrade....nope..would cost us extra$$...no thanks..just thought we'd ask. Unfortuately we saw the next pair of newlyweds ask for free upgrade at the boarding gate....they got it. We were quite disappointed having asked 3 hours earlier....oh well though....we were just happy to be going on our Honeymoon. The flight was fine but struggled for some leg room.. Arrived in Cancun , beautiful. Arrived at the RIU....small resort but very nice. I had previously emailed the hotel directly, weeks prior requesting 3rd floor and making sure they knew we were going to be there for 2 weeks and it was our honeymoon... Checking in...we were given first floor. I mentioned the emails....showed our wedding certificate...and was told to check out the first floor first and perhaps he could move us if we didnt like it. Well we didnt like it...... An hour later we were moved to the second floor. No view, no fruit basket(states in brochere all honeymooners receive this with tequila) YIKES WE THOUGHT!!! OH WELL...we said again...smiling at each other and looking at the 2 double beds...no king bed either. The room was ok....it did have the 'smell' but it wasnt overbearing. The shower (no tub) was nice and the mirror space area was great. Now the beds....hard hard hard........not so nice. The A/C was great but we never did have our pop and water re-stocked for 4 days....had to go to the front desk and ask what the deal was...they sent someone over within 30 minutes. Somedays we didnt have new towels replaced, which was annoying when I got out of the shower and EEEK..no towels. Another call to the desk...30 minutes later towels delivered. Housekeeping shows up at 0830-0900 daily...make sure you use your do not disturb sign if you like to sleep in.... But the noise generating throughout the building usually wakes you starting at 0800 anyways. Not nice. They have one buffet restaurant for breaky and dinner...for 2 weeks we thought this may be a problem...it wasnt, the food was always yummy especially the PRAWNS! We booked one night at the Seafood restaurant and was DISGUSTED. The food appeared to have been pre-made and sat under heat lamps...I was ill for 24 hours after that night. Not nice. I didnt hear anything good about that retaurant from others either. We decided NOT to do the steakhouse since being sick. The buffet was fine for us. The beach itself, sand and warm bluey green surf was breathtaking. Lots of loungers and beach volleyball. No bar on the beach, disappointing and unusual being at an all inclusive. ?? LOTS OF TIME SHARE PEOPLE AND VENDORS on OUR BEACH, very very annoying and disappointing. We kayaked, used the pedal boats and boogie boards available...fun and great exercise(we tend to eat to much on holidays) hah. We went to COZUMEL and rented a old convertible bug...herbie and drove the island stopping at various beaches and had a blast! WORTH THE 80.00$$. NOTE:Hubby normally gets sea sick on ferry's....the ferry to cozumel is not so smooth but he took some meds prior and was fine. We also went to XEL-HA booked thru our hotel...didnt do the TULUM part...thankfully as we needed all day to fully enjoy XEL-HA.. We also bought the all-inclusive drink/eat pass for 29.00 and WELL WORTH IT....the margarita's were fantastic! Xel-ha was awesome....the cave snorkeling and little inlets.....cliff jumping...tubing...great adventure. The hotel nightlife no good, the shows were boring for us(the Bahia Akumel was excellent for shows).....if you like a bar night, you can go to the TEQUILA property..heard it was fun. We used the internet cafe at the Tequila...only 6$ for an hour....good deal. We met another couple from Canada who was on our flight into Cancun and had a blast....although we learned from them that they had their travel agent put on their reservation:HONEYMOONERS....so they got the suite on the third floor for free when they checked in.....but they told us they werent honeymooners(married for 3years)....they also didnt have to show their marriage certif to the front desk!!!! SO IF YOU ARE HONEYMOONERS, MAKE SURE YOU MAKE YOUR AGENT PUT THAT ON UR RESO!!!!! urgh. Overall...what did we think..... we wont be going back to that resort... Personally we loved Punta Cana in the Dominican Rep. for it's culture and people. The RIU needs to get a handle on the time share vendors and upgrade the customer service levels. We are easy to please and aren't fussy travelers but the RIU wasn't up to par in our trip/hotel experiences. The room

Reviews.Title: “Too short!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went 09-06-03 to 09-10-03 and stayed at the Riu Playacar. The weather was nice..rained once, but it was brief and did not interfere with plans. It was hot and humid as was expected. We asked for a 3rd floor room to avoid the smells we had heard about. No problems with that, but realized there was no elevator. No biggie. The view........NONE! This was the single most disappointing thing about the way this property is designed. When I go on a tropical vacation I want to see the beach! At least some palm trees! Every room faces another building on this property. Even though we weren't in the room much, it's just the principle! I wouldn't come back to this hotel because of that. On the plus side...The rooms, buildings, grounds, and beach are very nice. I didn't like the beach being such a journey from our hotel room though! It was very clean and the water was the most amazingly clear water I have ever seen. Looks and feels like bath water! The rooms are clean and the landscaping is finely manicured. The fridge in the room is fully stocked with water, soda, beer, and there is also bottles of liquor in the room as well. NO COKE PRODUCTS! Another disappointment. I paid for all inclusive and had to pay for "Coke Cola Light" across the street, which is their version of Diet Coke. It was drinkable but took getting used to. I seriously don't understand how Coke and Pepsi allow this country to destroy the flavor of their beverages. I got a Diet Pepsi at dinner and almost puked on the first sip. It was truly the most disgusting soda I've ever tasted. I couldn't drink it. I would love to know why this is? Because I am talking REALLY REALLY BAD!!! No matter what brand of soda I had down there, they were all pretty bad. Diet, non-diet, it didn't matter. The mixed drinks were good to me, but I don't like the flavor of strong drinks. For people who want strong drinks, tip more or drink more! The food was great because of the variety, but we only stayed 4 days. If I'd stayed longer it would have gotten old. It was annoying trying to figure out the whole meal thing, but once we did it was okay. The Steak House takes reservations only, which is also annoying because I am not a morning person (especially when I'm on vacation) and you have to make your reservation around 7 am to get a seat. We almost didn't get to eat there, but did on the last night and enjoyed it. You might want to bring your own snorkeling gear...you only have an hour to use the ones at the dive shop. Buying them in Mexico is $25 and up when you can get them cheap (about $10) at your local Walmart or Target. There is quite a few water sport activities on site that are free. We did not do any of the ones that cost anything. Shopping across the street is very nice. I liked it better than going into Play del Carmen because people are way too pushy there and practically grab you and pull you into their stores. Once you're in there, you may not get out for awhile due to high pressure sales. You need to tell them to buzz off because you probably won't talk them into any real good deals anyway. They didn't have too many things I couldn't find at home there, and the prices are outrageous! I thought I was going to get great deals on silver and realized it was cheaper to buy it at home. I only got a decent deal on a hammock. These people are con artists and will rip you off whenever possible. My first purchase was put on my credit card. They took advantage of my naivity and charged me $75 for an item which was $7.50! I was pissed! Make sure you fully understand the pesos and check your receipts prior to leaving the store! Another tip is to pay for as much as possible with your credit card since American dollars are worth so much more than theirs. That's why they prefer you to pay with cash. Well, say you buy a $5 item and give them a $20 bill. Most of the time they will give you change in pesos..so you just got ripped off big time. The more you do this, the more money you are giving away. Some places only take cash, so bring some, but request change in US currency. Sometimes they'll do it for you, but don't expect it. Time share people are vacation killers! We were warned to stay away and did. Then we got suckered by a slick liar who told us he was going to sell us a snorkeling trip. We were on our way to the ferry to go to Cozumel when he stopped us. These people are extremely sleazy! In short, we had big plans for our day, but were winging it as we went. He knew we wanted to snorkel. Then he found out we were going to Xel Ha the next day but didn't have tickets. He said if we go have a drink at this hotel down the street he'd give us all inclusive tickets to the park for $14 each, including transportation. This was going to save us approximately $80 or more. We had already missed the ferry we wanted so we figured we'd make the next one at 1 pm. Then he finds out we're not married....here's the sleazy part...he walks us to a shop a few doors down, has the guy in the store give us sterling silver bands to wear (and got to keep), tells us to tell the people at the hotel we're on our honeymoon, then tells us he could get fired if we told these people what he was doing. Next, we're in a car going to this hotel. The guy springs it on us that this will take about an hour and 15 minutes, then we'll get free t-shirts and our tickets. I was angry because we were already on a time frame to go snorkeling. He then says it was too late for snorkeling tours anyway. I was already seething. Then he gets out of the car and we continue to this hotel that's supposedly "right down the street". We ask the driver how far this place is and tells us 20 minutes. I about came unglued! When we got there we were then advised it's at least a 3 hour ordeal....now I'm ready to start ripping people's heads off. The hotel is the MUYAN PALACE....VACATIONERS BEWARE!!! This place is beautiful, but wan't even completed yet. It was a time shire scam. When we told our guide we weren't interested he called the manager over. These people just don't take no for an answer, and by now I'm starting to have violent tendencies. You have to get mean and hold your ground. I think I scared the lady manager because I picked up my purse, slammed it on the table (and my purse is heavy!) and said, "WE ARE DONE! GET US OUR XEL HA TICKETS AND GET US A CAR TO TAKE US BACK TO THE FERRY NOW!!" I had a few other choice words which I yelled to her as well. This was a FOUR HOUR NIGHTMARE!!! We did get our snorkeling tour in, and it was great, but had we not been roped in like idiots by that sleaze ball we would have had a much better one, I'm sure. At least we met another couple on the boat who also had their vacation day robbed by time share scabs, so we felt better knowing we weren't alone in the idiot department. We had other tentative plans for Cozumel which were foiled by the time share crap because we lost so much time. Xel Ha was nice and was the only good thing we got from the time share losers. The bus had too many stops to make though, and we didn't get there til 2 hours after the place opened. Then they pick you up an hour before it closes...so we were ready and the bus was very late! We did get to swim with dolphins there which was a dream come true for me! I highly recommend this for $95 a person! WOW!!! Experience of a lifetime..truly amazing! In a nut shell, 4 days was too short of a stay. We were rushed and never relaxed. Stay at least a week. Don't be afraid of being rude to the pushy sales people, they're rude anyway. Take heed: Whenever you're asked what hotel you're staying at by sales people, run..do not walk! They are time share people! Alot of the people seemingly selling tours are time share people in disquise! Know this! They can destroy a vacation and they are everywhere you go. They all seem to work for that godforsakin' Muyan Palace too! Unless you have the time to waste on this sort of thing, or are genuinely interested in buying into it, stay away from them! As for the Riu Playacar, it was a nice hotel overall. You can also use the facilities of the Yucatan and the Tequila, but we didn't have time to. My only real complaint was the view (or lack thereof) and no Coke products. The people are friendly and are easy to deal with as long you know spanish and/or they know english! Lots of topless women on the beach, so this may not be for you if you're offended by that sort of thing. Just remember you're in a different country and it's a different culture than here in the states. We enjoyed our stay and for the most part, we just wished we'd taken more days off to spend there so we could have done more and been more relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “A great experiance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive holiday in Mexico 13-20 Sept, 2003), My husband, my little son , my daugther and I had a great experiance, the place was so beautiful, the sea was wonderful, the temperature of the water was incredible!!. The RIU is a so good hotel , the only problem for us was the are not many childrens to play with our childrens and the are not activities for childrens . And the food was always the same!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (newlyweds) just got back from spending 10 nights at the Riu Playacar. It was a great hotel. It was so clean and the food was excellent. There was always so much food to choose from. I was allergic to the milk and broke out in a rash so be careful of that. The people whom work there were very freindly. There were plenty of people and it was the off season, I think it might be a bit much during high season. We took our chances with the weather and it was nice, a little humid but not to much rain at all.We then went to Cozumel and stayed at a hotel out of town for three nights, wich I highly recommend. The snorkling was excellent, don't do the snorkling tour get a hotel that has beach access. There was great snorkling in front of our hotel. Also rent a car or moped and go around the island. There are bars were they have lockers and you can snorkle right there, it is right where the tour boats drop their snorklers. Again I can't say enough about the food and service at the Riu Plyacar. Sincerly, Erica Chodsky

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the riu Playacar and me and my wife loved it. we never stayed at an all inclusive resort in the carribean area befoe so we did not no what to compare it to,so we think it was a pretty good deal for the money. let me tell you me and my wife dont drink alcohol but if we did this would have been an even better deal because there was plenty of it, even in our room a fully stocked bar with beer and soda. the food was very good because we like buffet, we did eat at the seafood restaurant one night. the good thing about the Riu hotels in this area is that you have exchange priviledges with 2 other hotels and each of them have something good to offer,just walking distance away a gym, indoor massage, bar and shopping in the lobby, good entertainment at all the riu hotels including the Riu Palace Which is very elegant. Now to adress the sop called complaints of some of the other reviews we read, the beds were extra firm to me but my wife called them hard, ok for my back but for some like my wife she had to ask for extra pillows. the smell in the rooms was no problems but my wife said she did detect a little odor of musk so we kept the air conditioning on and there was no prblem because the place was very clean inside an out. all and all good deal for the money. please watch out for the time share people , just tell them to get the hell away from you like my wife and I did, they are snakes waiting in the grass and they are very pushy dont be afraid to curse them out, just get rid of them as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this resort in 2000 and the riu palace in 2001. this chain was by far the most popular and cleanest of any resort i have been too. There is no doubt some people have trouble with smells in the rooms and such but that is MEXICO not yhe rius. we have been going to mexico for quite some time and we have booked again at the playacar this nov 29th. The rooms are spacious and the food is awesome. The entertainment is good but not the best when it comes to variety. The pool is awesome and the staff were always smiling and friendly. The beach is large enough and far enough from the rooms to not allow noise to bother you during a daytime siesta. I think that this hotel is in the top 10 of all the hotels in the mayan region. A happy and satisfied customer who will be there in 2 months again YA HOO.

Reviews.Title: “Office Vacation Extrodinaire”
Reviews.Author: Seneca21
Reviews.Content: I brought my office staff of 13 people to this wonderful all inclusive resort on September 15th-2003 for one week. We all had a fabulous time. The food was absolutely wonderful..sometimes I thought we were at the Bellagio in Vegas. We never had a bad meal. Wide variety of fish, pasta, meats, fruits and veggies...8 types of fruit juices in the morning...it goes on and on... The beach was about a one block walk past the pools, but when we got there..the water was turquoise blue and crystal clear. It is all sand though....if you want a reef for snorkelling, you need to take a taxi a few miles away...maybe $6-8 cost. Entertainment was much better than expected...dancers from Mexico City were marvelous. The bar staff are friendly and will make you most drinks at your suggestion. Lots of activities going on. Maybe 10-15% Americans when we stayed. Lots of Italians..maybe 20% of the women on the beach were topless. I would highly recoomend this hotel. Very Good Value

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled You Can Do Betterr!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were excited to go to this resort. We go to Mexico every year and had never done an all-inclusive and thought we would try it. We also wanted to visit another area in Mexico. It was the absolute worst vacation we have ever taken. We were so disgusted that we got back and booked a Sandals vacation just to shake the bad feelings off. First of all the line you have to stand in to book the dinner reservation is long and then fills up quickly. We finally got a reservation and when we ate there the ribs were raw on the back side. The most important issue was the room that stank so bad that I tried to sleep on the balcony to avoid the smell. The front desk sent someone up and they said that the smell was normal. NOT FOR ME. I HAVE STAYED IN MEXICO EVERY YEAR SINCE 1995 AND NEVER HAD ANY SMELLS LIKE THAT!! The power went out and that is pretty normal for the area but I was highly offended when we were "lining up for dinner" and the doors were closed and the help peered out of the curtain and laughed at the guest. The lights are out and it's dinnertime. Everyone went to eat at the same time and the line was long and so was the laughter of the employees. We booked snorkeling and stood around waiting and waiting only to find out that not enough folks booked and so they just canceled it without telling anyone. It is out in the boon-docks and we gladly hired a cab to take us, wait and bring us back so we could go to Cancun and get a decent meal and get away from the hotel. I certainly believe that someone can't count. It is not a five star by any standard that I have stayed at. More like a Motel 6 with a beach that by the way, you walk to a long way. The units face each other, so when you go out on you balcony you just look directly into someone else's balcony and it's very close. Drinks are all watered in my opinion. When I call with all the problems and there were many more than mentioned here, the front desk had a very nice woman but absolutely nothing resolved. I called Worry Free Vacations when I got back and they could care less. Gave me an offer to go back! Can you believe it! Go back for 2 days. I found this to be the biggest low rent chain in my vacation history. Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “hard beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: beds were very hard,top mattress equivelent to box spring in USA standards. towels worn out, therefore nonabsorbent, needed many no clocks in rooms, female topless at beach and poolside. These are not complaints, just things to pass on.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing honeymoon at the Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Riu Playacar from August 31, 2003 - September 10, 2003. Overall, I would have to say that the experience was very pleasant.When we first arrived, it was pouring rain and my luggage got lost for a couple of hours but after that it was OK.I must warn people - look out for people at the airport that will offer you a Mexican blanket, tequila and breakfast in exchange for visiting the Mayan Palace hotel. These are people that will try to sell you timeshare. We got stuck and had to listen to a 1.5 hour presentation - it was like a bad nightmare.Other than that, I would have to say that I enjoyed my stay. The beach was quite beautiful and it was not overly crowded when we went. If you are offended by nudity, you will have to look the other way because the women are not at all shy about going topless. And it does not matter if they are thin or overweight, large busted or small, they are all proud to display their bodies to the world. The excursions outside of the hotel are nice but expensive. I would suggest going very early in the morning and doing it on your own in order to save time and money. I would recommend X-Caret and Xel-ha. They have great shows and snorkeling.The food is okay but not world class. People talk about a musty smell in the rooms. We did not have that problem but we were on the 3rd floor. So, if you can you should try to get a room on the 3rd floor. There is no elevator but that is the trade-off for having a nice - smelling room.I think that I feel in love with my husband all over again after visiting Mexico. I have sweet memories.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome & Aggrevating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, My girlfreind and I just returned from our first trip to Mexico and the Riu Playacar. We stayed from Sept. 6-10. I would like to address some of the other review complaints and tell you what I liked and didn't liked. First off getting there and checking in went very smoothly. We found the reception very friendly. Others had complained about the smell in rooms. Keeping this in mind when we checked in they assinged us a room on the first floor. We went ahead and asked them for one of the third since reviews said the smell was less on the that fllor. We had to wait an extra five minutes and they were able to give us one. If you go this route remember one thing ( NO ELEVATOR). Not a big deal to us but it could be to others. Also maybe there was one and we just din't see it. So ask first. Our room didn't have a smell at all and we also had candles just in case. The room was very nice. At first we found the room didn't have a bath tub. So that was disappointing. But the large shower with the removeable showerhead and endless hotwater was very nice. The room had a stocked mini bar and a refrig. with sodas, beer and bottle water. Remember on thing sodas in Mexico don't taste the same. Not disgusting but I didn't like them. The water was nice to have. The floors in the room were ceramic and could get slick. I feel a lot of this is due to the shoes you wear. I wore sandle and had no problem when I wore my tennis shoes it could get slick. But in Mexico everywhere you go they have ceramic floors. The only real complaint I had about the room was no view at all. We faced the back of the restaraunt. If you are in to sitting on the balcony and looking out this is not the place for you. It just gets down to the design of th resort. Almost all rooms face the other buildings. But you are not in the room that much. So just think about that. We did find the beds hard and also the sheets and comforter were rougher. It was not a problem to us. I was so tired at the end of our days the ceramic floor would have felt great. We found the rest of the resort very nice. The people our very friendly and they are constantly cleaning this place. ( Another reason the floors our slick) The place was spotless. Talking to others who had stayed at other resorts I feel we probally had one of the nicest beaches The beach was very clean and nice. It was awesome. As far as food goes I liked it very much (ALL KINDS) there our two restaraunts at Riu Playacar and you can use other resatraunts at the other two resorts. We never did visit the other two resorts. you have basically a buffet style resateraunt ( El Porsche) and a set down and they serve you (The Steak House) both our great. Steak house more romantic. The buffet a endless supply of all kinds of food. You can eat from 7am to 1100 pm. You can also eat at the Riu Tequilla and Yucutan we never did. We stayed 4 nights. I feel the food could get old if we would had stayed longer but at least you could go to other places. Also they weren't picky on the dress code. So never being at an all inclusive place we were confused on how things worked. Such as when you eat and when you can't . Even as I'm back home I'm still confused. So at first it was aggrevating. The people don't understand you and you don't understand them. We were told many different things so it was very confusing and aggrevating to us. They have rules on what to do as far as seating and times. But what it gets down to in a nutshell is this when we were down there it wasn't crowded in the hotel at all so we pretty much just walk in and sit where we wanted to and ate. I guess if it during the season where it is crowded it doesn't work that way. Also we found on the last night at the steak house you have to make reservation. We didn't know that but again it wasn't crowded and they let us in anyways. Overall no big deal but it was very stressful trying to find out what to do. There is representives at the facility at certain times that our with who you book your vacation through. So talk them. Ours spoke english and helped us. You can also book your excursion you want to do through them also. As far as the water sports. Bring your own snorkel mask and tube!! Yes it is free there but only for one hour a day and that goes far the boogieboards, windsurfers, hobie crafts and kayacks too. Also before you can use the hobie crafts whick look like a lot of fun you have to take an hour lesson that cost $35.00. So even though it is free there our catches to it. For a hint to buy mask and goggles there around $30 - $50.00. So get them at Wal Mart for about $10.00 and bring them. TRUST ME ON THIS! We did snorkel on our beach and saw a few things it was neat and we did use the boogie boards ( No waves though) and the kayacks were fun. You also can rent wave runners and also parasail at the beach. As far as excursions go. I really don't know what to tell someone to do. We were told buy people to do thing on your own. Its cheaper. The people at the hotel such as your representive will tell you to book through them. ( They make a couple of bucks) no big deal. So do your shopping if you have time. Saying this leads me to this story. They will tell you to stay away from time share people. Take thier word. DO IT!!! These people almost destoyed our vacation. First off we decided to wing it and do the tours on our own. Which really consist of going when you want to and find your own ride to get their. That is the big diffrence in a nutshell. We don't like following other people and going when they tell us and leaving when they tell us. When we went shopping the first couple of days we avoided talking to anyone who was trying to book a snorkel trip, xel ha, atv tours etc. etc.. On our third day we decided to go to Cozumel. Once getting their we would decide on what to do. Rent a jeep go snorkeling our do both. The ferry leaves every hour up to 10:00 pm. We were walking to the ferry aroudn 11:30 am to catch the 12:00 ferry. It takes about 40 minutes to get their. Alosn the last ferry back to Playa De Carmen come back at 9:00pm. Whild walking down to the ferry a man approached us and asked us what we wanted to do when we got over their. We told hime we were interested in snorkleling. So he invited us in to book a trip threw him. Being stupid we listen to him. We said what the heck we are going over there to that so while we have time before the ferry leaves lets book something now and save time. What a joke. We were tole that it was too late to go snorkeling and that the last trip left at 11:00 am and their was no other snorkel trips through anyone. Well we were planning to visit Xel Ha the next day so snorkiling at Cozumel was out of the question. Great. So he did tell us we could book Xel ha through him and he would save us some money. Xel- Ha all inclusive is $59.00 pp. He said if we visit a new hotel down the block and have a drink. We could purchase Xel -Ha tickets all inclusive $14.00 pp. So we said well since we can't go snorkling based on what your saying we have time. We'll go have a drink and just catch the 1:00 ferry to Cozumel. Hey all we have to do is have a drink and hey they just want us to wear the Free t-shirt they will give us when we get back to the US to advetise the new hotel. What is so hard about that right. Well the man finds out were not married. No problem he just gave us two sterling silver rings and told us just tell them your on your honeymoon so I don't get fired. So at least the rings were free. Should have been clue #1 but hey were stupid. nExt thing you know the guy puts us in a car just to show us to the street we we well get picked up for the tour to Xel ha the next day. No problem. Well when we get their he gets out and instruck the driver to take us to the Mayan palace down the road. We also asked him how long would it take. He replied we would be back in 45 minutes. Great Cool we are going to save $80.00 for 45 minutes and we get free T-shirts and we already got free silver rings too. Well after about 10 minutes of driving we asked the driver how much farther and he ssaid about another 20-25 minutes. Lets just say there was almost one less Mexican in Mexico. Well we finally arrive and were just going to tell them we our Honeymoon and we have people waiting for us so give us our tickets and get us back. WRONG!! If you don't take the tour you can't get the tickets. Well the tour is 90 minutes they say. So well we can't snorkel so they said, We already basically wasted an hour for nothing. Lets see the tour. They did give us a representive that spoke english and actully played hockey for St louis. So we explained to him our make believe story of how we just got married and we need to get back. No problem this will take only 3 hours and well get you back he replies. Well we eventually get thrrough to him we had an hour and not three. So he did start to hurry to get things going. He showed us the resort very impressive but not what I came to Mexico to do. Well we see it and now it is time to sell us on it. So we know were not going to buy anything. He does his presentaion and yes it the 30 minute presentation it does make since. But I say hey let me take it home and think about it. Nope can't do that You have to put $5300 down right now. Well have I got done laughing We told him NO!! Well how about $2300 NO!!!! We explain hey your a nice guy but we are in a hurry we don't have time to think about this were on our honeymoon etc etc etc. Well he let us know our honeymoon wasn't a big deal but the rest of our lives at their facility is. HA HA Ha. Well he finally calls the manager over to say. Can you believe this... We our interest in the package we just don't like how much money to put down. OH MY GOD WHAT PART OF NO DIDNT YOU UNDERSTAND. Well now the manager has to let you know how stupid you are for not signing with them and they are going to cut us a deal. Well in five minutes we went from a $69,000 package and $5300 down to a $17,900 package no money down and $109.00 a month. Well when my girlfriend had enough and did everything but choke this lady we were finally able to leave. Well I must say we did get Two T-shirts and purchased a piece of paper that says we could get two tickets for $28.00 did come true. So the next worry is will they show. But anyways we got back and finally were able to catch the 4:00 pm ferry. A whole day wasted. Pretty much the only thing we could due is just shop we we already have done the first two days. Well we take the ferry over their and. Well when you get off the lead you to a tourist center YOU THINK. Well it isnt its another Time Share trap. Once again I think someone is being nice and trying to give us a map of Cozumel. Well in about 5 seconds my girlfreind catches on this was a time share scam too and tell them to shuff it. We did find this amusing. Well 25 yard down the walk to Cozumel we were stop buy to young Mexicans who offered to take us Snorkleling. The also informed us we could leave right then for $25.oo pp cash. We said what the Heck and also another couple arrived who just got ripped off of their day at another time share joined in and said hey the day is shot why not. Lets just say these two guys turned our whole trip around. They took us out for 2 1/2 hours all the beer we wanted and three different reefs. It was incredible. On the last reef we saw a huge sting ray and also a sea turtle it was an incredible experience and one I will not quickly forget. I would of gave these two guys $100.00 for this trip. So a bad day turned out for the best. The next day we had to catch the tour bus at the shopping center located across the street of the hotel at 9:25 am. Well it did show and took us to Xel -Ha the draw back is you have to make a few stops to pick up other people. So we didn't get to Xel-ha until 11:00 am and the tour bus leaves at 5:00 pm to go back. So not alot of time. The park is open 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. But I will say for $28.00 total we got our money worth. The park is very neat. The all inclusive gives you lockers, snorkle gear, all the food you can eat and drinks, and discounts on the optional tours that our their. We also swam with the dolphins their $90.00 pp for 45 minutes. Well worth it. DO IT!!! The snorkling was ok at Xel HA not as clear as Cozumel but we did see the parrot fish (HUGE) and some other very large fish. I don't know if I would have been happy if I would have paid the $59.00 pp price. I would have gain another three hours but I just don't know. I would recommend the park. The entrance fee for non inclusive is $25.00 than you rent the snorkel and lockers and othe things. I forgot how much. The park is all natural and very very beautiful. The bus picking us up was late getting their and we didn't get back to the hotel until around 7:00pm. So to wrap the review up I would say this. As far as the hotel goes. I liked it. Would I go back probally not just because I would like a view and I like to try different hotels. This is nothing against the hotel. It was worth the money and we loved the people. We our not big drinkers anyways but i felt that most drinks were strong. Other reviews say weak. I don't know. they were free and good. You know if there weak drink more. Clean place, awesome beach. You can't go wrong for the money, I feel. The boggest complaint we had was no view no iron our board. We brought our own iron and used a small table with glass in the room to iron. ( Difficult ). You probally could get a nicer resort with more things if you shop around for the same amount of money or maybe just a little bit more. If you already have booked you still won't be disapponted. The location is great 1.8 miles from Playa de Carmen. You can take a taxi for $4.00 one way. I think it was $5.00 to get to the ferry. the ferry to Cozumel is $15.00 pp round trip. As far as Mexico goes. Beautiful water best I have ever seen. I didn't like people always bothering you to buy things and trying to sell you trips. Very Polite though. I only had one person ask me for some change to get some beer and when I said no he shook my hand and told me to enjoy my stay in Mexico. So the people were very nice. The shopping I wan't impressed with. Yes their things that you dont see here but really no big bargains. The shopping at the plaza across the street from the hotel is just as good as in Playa De Carmen. EXCEPT FOR THE HAMMOCKS get them in Playa de Carmen. Overall We did do some very interesting things. As the title says it was Awsome and Aggrevation. Being the first time to Mexico it takes a few days to get use to how things work. I would suggest any first timers to go for a longer stay. Right when we figured how things work it was time to go. Also ignore most of the people that talk to you and they will leave you alone especiall if you are in a hurry to go somewhere. As far as the excursions get on the internet before hand and read up on them there is a lot of choices and see you representive at the hotel even if you don't book through him he still has what the places offer. Be prepared for some hidden cost. Most places due take visa but a lot don't so have cash. As far as Time Share goes. Ours did pay off and we save $80.00 I don't know if wasting three hours and how mad we were was worth it. But if you stay for a week and can take three to fours hours out of one of your days and you can say NO to these people you can save some money on an expensive excursion so use your judgement. When you have 4 days your just rushing all the time. I'm not in a hurry to get back to Mexico but in realistic turns I feel It was a learning experience. I did things with my girlfriend that I feel our once in a lifetime experiences so it was a very special trip for me. I think if we were to go back it would be a much better trip due to we understand how things work. So if you can afford it spend more time and I feel you will enjoy a better less aggrevating trip. I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bandkvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar August 27 - Sept 2, 2003, What a pleasant experience. The staff was excellant, they all work so hard, please remember to tip. The food was good, shows were ok. The beach is beautiful, we enjoyed looking at Mars from the beach at night. Shopping was very close just across the street. It was very humid so it seemed wet and a little smelly but that is to be expected, it's tropical. We kept our ceiling fan running and burned incense, it was fine. The beds and pillows are a little hard, however the rooms are very nice and kept very clean. It was a great trip! We visited the Mayan Ruins at Chitinetzen, and we had booked a reservation in advance to swim with the Dolphins. Swimming with the dolphins was the best part of our trip! I highly recommend this, it's expensive but to us it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting vacation to say the least!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, we just got back from Mexico on Aug 29th,2003. This was our first trip to Mexico...The "resort" experience for us was not really our style. we took our two boy's ages 17 and 15. The weather wasn't the greatest, very hot and very humid. Unless you like just lating around all day, this place is not for you. shopping was nice across the street. We had planned on some outings, Tulume, Xcaret...etc. We were shocked to find that the prices were a total rip-off $400. US dollars for the 4 of us just to get into Xcaret-when the gal at the front counter said that this price did not include the swim with the dolphins (or practically anything else for that matter) We told her forget it and asked for our money back. We really felt like Mexico was a cultural experience, which is good and was nice for the kids to see, but they really are only "nice" to get into your wallet...I doubt they would be any more pleased with the US if we chaged them those prices to go to Disneyland or our National parks for instance. Also, the snorkling tour from the resort would have been a lot better if we wern't made to wear life jackets in five feet of water to snorkle. Trust us this was not a five star resort, and Hawaii is so much better.( your more "free" to be yourself there).. Just our experience? Hope you have fun...e-mail us if you have any questions or comments.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: laurielynn
Reviews.Content: Had a pretty good time at the riu playacar. I took my adult children with so there were six of us and three of us got sick. GI problems for about 24 hours. The food was fair. The drinks were fair. The beach was beautiful. The closeness of shopping was great. The room was nice. No complaints really. Would go back if the price is good. The shows were bad.

Reviews.Title: “How Could Anyone Complain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the friendly, attentive service, adequate and various food (even if not gourmet), clean pool & beach, lovely weather, fun and professional entertainment and overall cleanliness of the resort, how could anyone complain? We all know that we bought a moderate priced all-inclusive, and for my money I got more than I bargained for. The staff couldn't have done more for our family. The other guests we met seemed to be having the same positive experience. The guests were truly international and even this added a nice touch to an otherwise outstanding week!! I'm thinking the disgruntled honeymooner may be in the throes of having second thoughts about his predicament, but don't blame on the Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Riu Playacar Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sedonico
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from my second stay at the Riu Playacar (8/3-8/9). Once again I was extremely pleased with the resort. I can't understand how anyone can complain about this hotel. I traveled with five women ranging from 22-59. Everyone found the food to be great---I never heard a complaint from anyone. We were also satisfied with the drinks, and I never noticed them melting too fast. Someone wrote about the beach having trash on it---I didn't see any trash--not even one cigarette butt in the sand. The beach is probably the most beautiful beach in the Playacar development. I really didn't notice much of a musty smell. We did have a room on the second floor--maybe that makes a difference. The staff is great. Everyone is so friendly and will do anything for you. Playa del Carmen is a nice little beach town. There's plenty of shopping, and at night Captain Tutix is a great club to go dancing in. We also had a great time in Cozumel for the day. We took the ferry from Playa del Carmen, and then rented a jeep from Budget in Cozumel (55 USD). The beaches there are deserted and beautiful, and I hear that the best snorkeling is there. All in all, this was a fantastic vacation. I can't wait until I can go back to the Riu Playacar again!! If you have any questions, feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon hell too!! watch your stuff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please listen to me and DO NOT go to the RIU Playacar. I just got back from my honeymoon and the service nearly ruined our trip.We booked our honeymoon through worry-free vacations and were told this was a 5 star resort. Trust me this place is NOT a 5 star resort. Once we arrived we were told that he hotel was over booked and the room would not be ready for at least an hour; however, we could leave our bags by the front desk and get some lunch. We would not receive a honeymoon upgrade and the desk clerk made it sound as if we were lucky to get a room at all. The food at lunch was okay, but not great and certainly NOT gourmet, unless you live in a trailer park or something.Once we got back from lunch we were told that the room was ready and the bell boy would bring our bags up shortly.The room smelled a little moldy but not bad for mexico. Our view was terrible and faced the opposite building (how romantic). The bell boy did deliver our bags and we changed and went to the pool. Once we got back from the pool a note was waiting for us along with a bottle of extremely cheap tequila (how romantic). We then changed to go to dinner and decided to bring our brand new digital camera - our wedding gift from her parents. One problem... no camera. We had the camera in the bag in the lobby and now no camera!My wife got so mad. We ran to the front desk were they first accused us of losing it! They then got the security guard (who did not speak any english) to go back to our room. The guard looked through our stuff for about 15 minutes and motioned for us to stay in the room.
