We waited for an hour and he did not return!! Ever!DO NOT BOOK HERE!!!! WARNING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stop Complainig”
Reviews.Author: erniedfireguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and teenage daughter visited the Riu Playacar for 2 weeks recently, and I must say for a Mexican resort, this one tops most. For starters, your all-inclusive wrist band entitles you to eat, drink and play at two neighbouring Riu resorts only 200 meters away. This opens up certain other options. The resort is a leisurely stroll south along the beach from Playa del Carmen, past a half a dozen or so other resorts. We found nothing but the utmost care and attention to guest comfort and service, including a hospitality area for you to store your luggage and shower on departure day. Your wristband is not required to be turned in so use it all day even when you check out. The hotel itself is a statement to Spanish opulence with one of the grandest lobbies i've seen. Upon check-in you will be assigned a dining table which is yours for the duration. The food is nothing short of extraordiary, with a variety so vast that one could never even sample a bit of everything. Desserts, if you have room for them, are spectacular. There are several types of liquor bottles inverted in your bathrooms for ease of dispensing, all replenished regularly! In room safes, mini bars add to your convenience. I should think that the very few complainers forget that this is an emerging third world country and perhaps their lofty standards wouldn't be met regardless of where in the country they visited. This hotel is ranked 5 star and deserves every bit of it. If you plan to stay, make sure you email the hotel and be specific about your room. You'll want one facing the walkway, ground floor. The ones that don't face the walkway are in the rear and your view will be the next door resort's back doors and perhaps even the service entrance. I could go on and on so if you have anymore valid concerns or want some helpful tips, email me. One more thing....I've NEVER thought any of the drinks were weak! Bring your own tall thermal mug and you can have it as strong as you want! What do they care?!

Reviews.Title: “like it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got marrid there.it was nice and quiet.we had the honeymoon suite,which was very big,clean and did not smell nothing??the food was ok,cause i was not sick(this time) my problem is one night we were going out and when i open the door i saw someone on the roof??he hide when he saw me.so be careful and lock up everything,door,safe,patio doors.one other little problem,the guy by the beach who gives you the snorkle gear(for free) wanted my rayban in exchange??? so i send my husband and he did not have any problem getting it?? aside those we had a great time and meet lots of peoples.the water is always beautiful,the people friendly.one last thing,we go to mexico every year(always different places)and the coffee is always bad(starbucks need to get there presto)bye

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I returned from our vacation to the Riu Playacar 3 weeks ago. We had a fantastic fortnight in the sun, and we could not fault the place. The room was kept immaculately clean with beautiful displays of animals made out of towels every day. The food was plentiful with an enormous choice, so even if you are fussy with your food there will be something to please you. The staff were incredibly friendly and couldn't do enough for you. The beach was gorgeous and the pools were lovely. I would definitely recommend staying at the Riu Playacar, and I plan to return again next year!

Reviews.Title: “A vacation to remember!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive trip to Mexico (26 July - 2 Aug) and we are planning another on February. The only compliant we had were all the children and kids unsupervised by their parents running all over the complex. If you are looking for a resort that has limited ages or has activities only for kids this is not the place. Besides this the place is great and the staff Henry, Elizabeth, Nelson, Maria- and Lordus the Bartenders were GREAT and totally friendly and Edgar who was the busboy at the buffet and Erick the bellhop who always made a habit of treating us great.. My hats are off the the Apple Rep., Claudia and the staff of the Playcar. We also met several new friends from Switzerland, Wisconsin, Washington D.C. and several other places. All in all anyone who is thinking of going to Mexico this is the way to go. Elizabeth

Reviews.Title: “excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Family of 4, parents, 19 and 13 yr old girls. Excellent value for the money. Best endorsement is that we all would choose this area and hotel to return to. Airport, arrival, customs, transportation were not difficult. Playacar is a contained community, safe, convenient, laid back. Entire family enjoyed the hotel, friendly staff, closeness to activities. Hot and humid, which effects the rooms temp and odor. Easy to deal with - candles and fan running. Great staff - all spoke some English, prompt with request, helpful, friendly, caring. Any request made was met. Rooms are well laid out to have two rooms connecting by private hallway. Smaller facility allows for a more intimate atmosphere and less crowd. We visited other hotels in area and liked this best. Extras of waters sports were appreciated by teenagers. They were entertained. Breakfast and lunch buffet were excellent. We choose to eat in Playa at night and shop - very good places to eat. Hotel buffet dinner was good. Wine is limited. Suggestions to take lots of one and five dollar bills and tip everyone - well appreciated and gains small extra attentions. Take an travel type mug for drinks, glasses at bar are small. Guest are international, be prepared for different cultural norms - topless sunbathing - never found vulgar for anyone though. Great vacation, one vacation that we all disconnected from home for a true vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Rui Playacar not worth my hard earned vacation money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the Hotel Riu Playacar are misleading. Upon arrival we were greated with a delicious wine punch served in champagne glasses. But, I am afraid the it was downhill from there for the hotel. Our room, located on the first floor, was not only musty, (to be somewhat expected in Mexico), but it reeked of raw sewage. Traveling companions in other rooms complained of the same problem. The odor waifted up through the shower drain during the middle of the night, so we woke up to a most unpleasant smell. The beds are probably the hardest and dampest I have ever laid on in all my travels. (Notice I did't say slept on, because I was so uncomfortable I didn't get a wink of sleep the four miserable nights I spent there). And, being from a costal area, I am used to dampness. The food is very European and served buffet style. It was mediocre, not gourmet at all. But, you can make a dinner reservation to eat the evening meal resturant style, if you get up early enough to beat the others. The meals we ate when we did make a reservation were better quality. But, in the Riu's defense, there is American television in the room, the inclusive price does include alcohol (some resorts charge extra for this), and I found the grounds to be very tropical and well kept. The water is clear blue and the beaches were powdery. Palm trees lined the beach for shade and there was lots of fun and follicking by staff members. Overall, my opinion is that if you don't care what your room is like, and delicious food is not of the utmost importance to you, then this is a good place to stay. But, if you are like me, and like a posh, comfortable place to relax at night while the others are at the disco, then book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “NJ's rating, hard to handle”
Reviews.Author: stahrgazer
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the RIU Playacar on Sat. July 19th. This was our fourth trip there and it was great. I just had to respond to the NJ review. First I would like to sat that I have NEVER noticed the RIU being dirty. They are constantly cleaning. I will agree the beds are hard as cement, but you get used to them. As far as the musty smell.....YOU ARE IN MEXICO it's very humid and tropical, I guess we just don't focus on every little smell. It never has been a big deal. Again I agree with NJ about the butts on the beach. This last time was the worst I have ever seen. But not to the point that I wouldn't go back. I have contacted the resort with this concern. I have a hard time with the fact that people use the beach as an ashtray. But over all this is a great resort and they are constantly looking for ways to improve. I have a very hard time with the rating that NJ gave. Perhaps they are just EXTREMEMLY picky. It goes to show you can't please everyone. I would strongly recommed this resort to everyone. If you would like to read other things about any of the RIUs I would suggest visiting Rusty's unoffical RIU website. No I am not Rusty. But thanks for taking the time to read this.

Reviews.Title: “I just don't get it!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before we made our choice of a hotel I did all the research and read all the reviews. They were mostly positive other than the musty rooms. When we arrived 7/7/03 I thought I was in the wrong place. The hotel was not clean, the room (we had a suite) was so musty smelling. I was prepared with sprays and candles but it didn't help. The beds were like cement. The beach was beautiful but had a lot of cigarette butts and left garbage. The outside buffet was not very clean and the bar area smelled like stale beer. That evening we went to dinner in the main dinningroom. People were lined up and when they opened the doors they stampeeded in like cattle. The dinner buffet was better than the lunch although the tablecloths were dirty and stained. The next morning we went to the Apple tour people and told them we wanted to switch to another hotel. They were very helpful and we switched to the Moon Palace (and payed an $800 upcharge). I was just glad to get out of the RIU Playacar. We told our travel agent and he said he had 3 other familes booked there within the next few months. He is going to switch them to another facility.

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked, and paid for, a stay at the Occidental Allegro in Playacar, but when we arrived, they had no rooms. What a break for us! They checked throughoput Playacar, and finally found rooms for us at Hotel Riu Playacar! While upset with the Allegro for their booking deception, we were delighted when we saw the Riu Playacar. Great staff, lovely rooms, above average food, and immaculately maintained facilities and grounds. A friend and I were traveling with our three boys (20, 18, & 14), and we all had a wonderful time. The boys "discoed" at the Riu Tequila each night, while "the Moms" relaxed, swam late, and caught up on much needed relaxation. I would recommend any one of the Playacar area Riu properties to vacationers headed for the Mayan Riviera...and if you're into snorkeling, check out YALKU. It was fabulous, and we swam with the sea turtles!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a superb time at the RIU Playacar June 23-27. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Never once did we have any complaints. As far as the "musty" smell, the par for the course, if you are staying in the tropics. I guess you can't please everyone. The beach was lovely. We visited Cozumel, Tulum, Xcaret & Xel-ha. Very nice. The entertainment was great, the midnight snacks were awesome. The food was excellent. I can't imagine not finding something you wouldn't enjoy. We're planning to go back:). Oh yeah-if you are going snorkeling, invest in biodegradable sunscreen!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but musty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time in Playa del Carmen for us and 20-year-old daughter--we researched thoroughly and were well aware of the "musty" smell posters complained of--and they were right. We were armed with scented candles and air freshener and weren't really bothered by the smell until we got home and our luggage smelled for several days.... Why DO THESE ROOMS SMELL SO MUSTY? It's a fairly new property and you just don't see that complaint about other properties!! Due to the smell, I steered a friend with mold/mildew allergies away from this property. Otherwise, the room was immaculate, grounds beautiful, and the beach fabulous--great for swimming, plenty of shade at the pool and abundant chairs at pool and beach. The food was nicely presented but just average in taste, and the buffet system gets old, mostly due to the other guests who don't observe the dress code. Drinks were weak but tasty. No Coke products on property. The reservation system didn't bother us--we had the steak and the Mediterranean meals and both were ok. The staff was gracious and helpful. Good hotel for the price. Not sure we'll return to Mexico as none of us felt very good for several days after we returned to the US. If you don't mind the musty rooms and the all-inclusive system, and want a gorgeous, clean beach, the Riu is a good value!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fab! couldn't have asked for a better first time in playa del carmen. loved the pool bar and the catamarans, excellent staff: nelson, juan, saul, meredith, and the list continues. they made our trip what it was. the beach is amazing, the rooms were very nice, the housekeeping staff were so creative with our towel and blanket "sculptures," they always did an excellent job! the shows were cheesy like most, but very entertaining! we are going back this year to the iberostar tucan(we always like to try different hotels) and we hope that this trip is just as terrific as the Riu Playacar!

Reviews.Title: “No premium liquior!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your into drinking premium drinks, bring your own liquior. The drinks are made with the cheapist alcohol, and several times my vodka and soda had tequilla in it. I'm pretty sure they refill there bottles. If your lucky, and tip well, you may get poured smirnoff,wow!Anyhow besides the crappy drinks,the riu playacar is very beautiful and european. If you like to sunbath topless, this is the place to do it. The rooms were clean and we brought an air freshner just in case. Make sure to do the water aerobics, yes you feel like a dork doing it, but it's the best way to meet all the interesting people from around the world. Make sure you head into town. If you need computer fix and a round of pool,the tavern is a sure bet. It has good food and DRINKS, and sports on all tvs.

Reviews.Title: “ruined by rain!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: well, the place was gorgeous! ceramic tile EVERYWHERE! my boyfriend and i were there this past weekend. however, the rain ruined most of our plans to see the sites other than the resort! The grunds, rooms and restaurants we all better than we expected! The food was really great (loved the fries and guacamole) and the people were so sweet and ready to do anything for you. the room was smelly...but i am sure the rain made it worse. the lobby was breath-taking- really! We loved the mimosas! what a nice welcome to mexico! also, the shops were great! i would go back again... Anyone on their way there, u will l love it... but if it rains, look out!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool bar!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Play del carmen January 25 - Feb 1, 2003. OMG!! We stayed at the RIU Playacar, all I can say is it was fabulous! The hotel was always immaculate, the food was interesting. The steak house is well worth getting up early for a reservation. But the Pool Bar was the most fun! I met so many wonderful people from all over the world. I would definately come back. In fact, I am booking for next January soon.

Reviews.Title: “We loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Playacar in Playa del Carmen. We had no problems and loved it. Brenda and Waldo at the front desk went out of there way to make sure everything was okay. The entertainmant staff was great. Gabrielle, Roberto and Alfredo were very entertaining and very handsome. There is evening entertainment nightly. The grounds are immaculently kept. Our housekeeper, Fransico was excellent. Our room was kept in tip top shape. We left him two u.s. dollars daily. Most of the staff work for $4.00 per day, so the tips are greatly appreciated. Our room did have a musty smell, but you are in the tropics, that is to be expected. The beach area is very clean, bring lots of sunscreen the rays are strong. There are topless sunbathers, but after a day or two you don't even notice them. They primarly stayed in the beach area, however, a couple did come to the pool and swim. Our two kids were unable to swim in the sea with the exception of the first day. The red flag was up because of the under currents. The food was good and there was something for everyone. Some of it, however, looked pretty exoctic to me. We stuck with the basics, pizza, beans, salads. Breakfast was by far the best. We booked our tours through CancunVista (Martha) and had no problems there. We visited Chitchen Itza, it was a long day, but fun. The ATV Tour was well worth the $45.00. The bus was air-conditioned and had t.v.'s in them so we were able to watch movies. The X-Caret was fun, but very hot and humid. Our kids swam with the dolphins and really enjoyed it. It to is a long day, so if you are planning on staying for the evening show, go back to the hotel and freshen up and then return. All in all, we had a great time and would go again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport & town. The hotel itself has a good appearance & the grounds kept clean. The rooms are spacious & clean, but have a major mildew smell that was very difficult to deal with. Do not go to this hotel for the entertainment because it was horrible! As far as the food.. it was good, but by the end of the week gets to be the "same old thing". The best part was the beach. The water is great & the sand is like sugar. I would return to this hotel if I were to go back. It was acceptable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back on Monday 9 June 2003. This is the best Vacation that we have been on. The staff will go out there was to make sure that if you need or want anything it there for you. The beach area is really a great sight to see and be at. We did not go the the pool area at all just because I love to be on the beach. If there is one or two things that they really do need is a iron and pin and paper in the rooms. The food is real good but after awhile you want something eles. But it still was good. I just would not want to be there more than 5 days if i had to eat the same stuff. The temp is really hot there but i knew that was going to be the case. Just make sure that when it is time to leave that you be at the lobby on time. Beacuse you will find yourself still there LOL. If you want to use the staff for you land trips thats ok. But we use the taxi so that we could get a better ride and save some money, You can allway talk the taxi down to where you want to go. In other word there are deals to be made if you get out there and do it. Me and some of the other guys got together and went on a deep sea fishing trip. And we was to leave very early in the AM. Now this is what the staff did for us. (Gave us a case of beer and fix sandwiches for us to take with us since we was not going to get to eat before we left out. All i will say is that me and my wife had a GREAT time and we are going to go back in Nov or Dec.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: AMIBeachGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Playacar for our honeymoon in May. Here is a summary of our experiences:POSITIVES: 1. Service was EXCELLENT! Everyone (including the cleaning staff) greeted us daily and was extremely friendly. We received several phone calls from the front desk, calling to ensure everything was okay. 2. The resort is absolutely beautiful! The rooms are very spacious and clean. The grounds are well maintained, beautiful landscaping. 3. Great pool bar! We spent a lot of our time there. Francisco is the MAN! He remembered what we like to drink...we didn't have to ask.NEGATIVES: 1. I would describe PlayaCar as a mini-Cancun (except with older vacationers). If you like a laid-back vacation, this is probably not the place for you. While the RIU has a lively, festive atmosphere, which we enjoyed; we were hoping for a good place to just relax and have a few margaritas by the pool. The RIU was pretty crowded during our stay(May 5-12). The beach and the pools were always packed with people. Also, there are optional, structured activities every hour on the hour (i.e., water aerobics, table tennis, volleyball, beach parties)....which is good if you like that kind of vacation.SUMMARY: Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the RIU! It is a lovely hotel with great service! Because we typically enjoy a more relaxed vacation (especially for a honeymoon), my preference would be to go somewhere a little less crowded next time.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest beach in Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just wanted to go somewhere warm and we'd never been to Mexico. Going to an all-inclusive resort is a little like going to Camp for grownups, and not really our style, but we completely enjoyed ourselves. They have a gorgeous beach and friendly staff. We spent our days on the beach, played a little volleyball, and visited the town and Tulum. The food was fine. It's a buffet, you just find what you like. We got assigned dinner seating on the patio and it was lovely. Our room was clean and pleasant. We just kept the sliding-door open and the fan running to air it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GourmetLove
Reviews.Content: We were at the Riu Playacar from the 24th through the 31st. We were impressed with the beautiful beach, turquoise waters and impeccable service. We were on the 2nd floor and the room was musty. Noticed visible mildew on the ceiling and walls, but if you are not allergic then it shouldn't be a problem. Incense and air freshener helped. Plenty to do including paddle boats, hobby cat and kayaking. We are not drinkers so we can't say much about the strength of the drinks, but all drinks and food were plentiful and readily available. We ate at the steak house one night for a change and enjoyed the atmosphere and beautiful view of the ocean. The buffet did get repetitive, but the food was good overall. Staff was courteous and the grounds were immaculate. We got a great deal on this trip and felt it was worth every dollar we spent. Bring plenty of money for souvenirs, we spent a ton in downtown Playa Del Carmen and enjoyed walking in the evenings at the shopping center across from the hotel. Yes there is a large European crowd that does go topless. We had no problems or issues with being Americans at any time while on vacation. Recommend going to Xel-Ha for a whole day. Went on the Xel-Ha/Tulum excursion and found ourselves rushing at Xel-Ha, which is well worth staying at the whole day. Loved Tulum, but it was very very hot that day. Bring lots of sun lotion, a hat and cool clothing; I hear it only gets hotter in June and July. We had a great time but will be spending a little more for a different resort next time around due to allergies to the mildew in the rooms. Thanks for a great time Riu Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best vacations ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 days at the Rui Playacar, May 22-30, 2003. We had a great time. I read everything on this website and it was all helpful. The best beach I have ever seen in Mexico. The palm trees and the turquoise waters and soft white sand (never hot!) - fabulous. Indulge in a massage, we both had one on an afternoon it rained suddenly, under a grass hut on the beach, it was the ultimate in relaxation. The Playacar is the smallest of the Riu resorts in Playa del Carmen. I think much better than the Palace, Yucatan or Tequila - they are bigger and less cozy - so much walking. The Playacar has a nice intimacy. Not many kids the week we were there, about 50% Europeans, and yes - some topless. The staff is one of the best things as others mention. You can drink and eat practically non-stop, so who cares if the drinks are weak? Some of the evening entertainment is excellent and professional - some of it is comedy/lip syncing on stage with the animation team, hit or miss. It was VERY hot last week - didn't want to take any excursions - couldn't bear the thought of a bus trip to a hot place that might not have pina colada's available at a moment's notice! We did visit the town of Playa del Carmen twice, $5.00 by taxi, one afternoon to shop - typical touristy places, silver, pottery etc - had a cool cervesa at a bar on the beach. And then again one night - completely different vibe at night - should have gone more - all inclusive be damned! Ate at the Casa del Agua - great food, service and view of the street scene, Avenida 5, the pedestrian shopping street. Several bars with live music - it was fun. We also had drinks at a place called Alux - which is in the not so nice part of town - but is built entirely underground in a cave - stalagtites and mites - really cool too see without having to take an excursion. Here is a summary of the things every tells you to bring: -candles or glade plug ins for the rooms - although we really didn't need them in our third floor room. -underwater camera - we too tour guides try to charge you) -insulated glasses - brought them - but drank our drinks so fast didn't seem to be any point! -lots of one dollar bills - we tipped everyone a buck or two for the aforementioned great service. -SUNBLOCK. -long pants for the guys for dinner - not all do - but it looks nice - women tend to dress up a bit for dinner - cute sundresses, etc. -your own soap, shampoo and conditioner - they do have packets, but, you know. The rooms do have a powerful hair dryer. -walkman if you hate blaring disco music which they play at the pool and are trying to read. The two pools, one more quiet than the other, were nice, lots of chairs and choice of sun or shade. Overall I would highly recommenf the Playacar for the price. I would probably try something a notch above next vacation, in terms of restaurants and bedding. The beds were very hard and the sheets stiff and scratchy on tender sunburned skin. As fara as dining, I didn't mind the buffet's, I just hated the atmosphere in the main restuaurant - too brightly list and "cafeteria-ish". Ate at the steak house twice and the mood was much nicer there - I had chicken, and surf and turf - no it wasn't the best steak ever, but the other 4 courses were excellent. And the mood in an open-air restaurant by the ocean, with good service by far surpassed the main dining room. Too bad they didn't change the menu, or we would have been there every night. One last thing - it you fly out of Oakland on Suntrips, be prepared for the most horrendous two hour check-in process. Happy Vacationing!

Reviews.Title: “Hot in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Playacar for one week.As has been stated multiple times, the rooms have a musty smell, not terribly offensive, but definitely noticeable when you first enter the room. The key is to crank up the ceiling fan. Also, the A/C struggled to keep up with the intense Mexican heat. I wouldn't be overly concerned, you won't be spending much time in your room anyways. The rooms are centrally located between the main lobby and restaurant and the pool and ocean. I don't think there is a bad location to be had.The week we stayed the Weather Channel had predicted rain or shower everyday. We were horrified by the forecast. I don't know how they determine forecasts, but we never saw a drop of rain. It did rain and night, sure sounded like a monsoon. We did however see plenty of sunshine. Whatever you do make sure you bring a decent lotion with a rating of at least 25SPF. They don't call it sun country for no reason.The food at the buffet was good. Don't expect gourmet quality food, but it is of good quality and should not disappoint. I especially enjoyed the breakfast, those donuts really did it for us. Also, they will make omlets to order. There are two other options a Mediteranean and Steak House themed experience. The Med is all seafood, so make sure you are aware of this before going. The steak house is good but again don't expect a Ruth Chris steak. Lunch is held down at the restaurant by the pool. It is convienient, but at times I would have preferred the air conditioned main rest. One nice option is that you will be able to eat breakfast or lunch at the Yucatan or the Tequila. We stayed at the Yucatan before and really liked the Hacienda. Check it out. I really didn't care for the Tequila.The grounds are immaculately kept. Palm trees, ferns, exotic vegetation are manicured daily. The staff does a fantastic job keeping thing organized and clean. I doubt you will find a nicer group or harder working group. The beach is fantastic. What is great about the Playacar is that you won't have to e annoying how people tend to reserve seats by the pool and beach by throwing down their worldly possessions, and not being around for hours at a time. Oh well, don't sweat it there's plenty of room. The beach is drop dead gorgeous.There are two pools. One pool has a bar and tends to attract the same people day and day out. The serious partiers. While the second pool is much quieter and reserved for those wanting to chill out and take a nap. The drinks are plentiful and the bartenders do a great job.The entertainment borders on excellent. The Michael Jackson show was very impressive. Also, the RIU dancers (I call them the Fly Girls and Boys) are great too. To somewhat cheesy, drinking contests, bad skits, etc. Don't be discouraged the staff goes out of their way to accomodate. Remember that the staff don't make a ton of money so it really is nice to tip the maid and the bartender. We brought a stack of $1 bills. I doubt it will effect the level of service you receive, but it sure made us feel better.All in all I am giving the Playacar 5 stars. Realistically it really deserves 4 stars, since there are better resorts out there that will pamper you stuff you with better quality food and drink. However, for the money the Playacar is a best buy, we payed $1700 USD. Be assured that if you have booked a trip you will have a great time and you won't be disappointed. The great service, fantastic beach, and beautiful grounds should satisfy all but the snobbiest. For those people, there always is the Riu Palace or the Royal Hideaway which should provide a complete hedonistic experience.Cheers

Reviews.Title: “The Riu Playcar was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: rmo4673272
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Riu Playacar May 17-24. We had a great time and the Riu Playacar was a first class resort! I had read the other reviews on this website and found them very helpful. There was a slight musty smell in room when we arrived, but that is because they had shut off the A/C and ceiling fan after the last guests checked out. It was better after a few hours and no big deal. The staff was friendly and the grounds were very clean. The beach was great and the ocean breeze helped offset the hot temperature. The food was good to very good. There was a large selection at the buffet and the Steak & Seafood restaurants were good. While we there about 50% of the guests were American, which is a little higher than normal. We would highly recommend the Riu Playacar and the Riviera Maya!

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at the Riu Playacar and would recommend it to everyone. Everything was perfect for a relaxing, enjoyable holiday for all the family. We have NO complaints about the place at all, and we LOVE Mexico. If you're a diver, you too will love Mexico !!Our operator, JMC, could have been a little more helpful though.If you'd like to know more, or see some of our photos, please feel free to get in touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Playacar May 10-17 and had a great vacation. Apple Vacations made our first trip to Mexico easy and worry free. Our charter flight was three hours late due to six inches of snow in Denver but the Apple folks can't be blamed for that.The Riu Playacar is a small property with a very relaxed atmosphere. We liked the fact that there were few parties going on. Most people seemed to be interested in relaxing. If you want to party, I would suggest another property.The room did have a slight musty smell, as others have mentioned, but it wasn't noticable after the first day. And the beds are definitely firm but we certainly had no trouble sleeping on them.The food is buffet style and we had to try things to find what we preferred. Not everything was to our liking but there were many, many choices. The next time we go there we'll take very small samples of various food choices to determine which we prefer. Then we will go back and get our meal. I still managed to put on five pounds, so the food isn't that bad.The beach is beautiful and was never crowded. We were always able to find a lounge chair and a shady spot.Everyone on the hotel staff is very friendly. Francisco, our dinner waiter, was efficient and very funny. He helped me with my very limited Spanish too.All in all, it was a great trip and we will definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar We will be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon at the Riu Playacar on 5/9/03. We received impeccable service! The staff remembered our names, the rooms were cleaned daily (do bring candles as there is a musty smell), the grounds our maintained to a T. The food was average to above average, although you could always find something that you liked. We actually enjoyed the Buffet more so then the 2 theme restaurants. Claudia, Wilson, and Araya (sp) gave the best service bartending that you could ever imagine in the states. The only disturbing thing was that "Americans" get the stereotype as being obnoxious and rude, although some are I felt that the Europeans carried no manners whatsoever, and being from a resort town in Vail, they carried the same pushy "I want my dessert NOW" attitude as they carry here by pushing there way through the ski lift lines here.

Reviews.Title: “would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just came back may 4th. we were there from april 27-may4. we loved it! i did have negative thoughts with the postings that i read but i found them not to be true! the grounds are immaculate, the food was great (neither one of us got sick), the room did not smell musty. but bring your air freshners. we stayed on the 3rd floor and thought could have been the reason why. i do recommend bringing an alarm clock, there aren't clocks in the rooms. if you ever need anything it is brought to you. the rooms are very clean. we ate at the steak restaurant three times there and found it to be one of the best steaks we have eaten. the entertainment committee is just wonderful. they make you feel welcomed and the shows are great. if michael jackson and grease are playing don't miss them. also, bring a float for the pool from home because it is much cheaper than buying one there. they will inflate them for you. i just can't say enought good things about the playacar. if you need to email us and ask questions please do. also, they did not enforce men wearing long pants to dinner, most men had shorts on. it is very hot there and bring comfortable shoes. also bring a hat because your scalp gets burn from the sun, very intense.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Playacar!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Buzgal
Reviews.Content: The resorts best part was the bartenders at night at the pool bar. They were great! The rooms were smelly mostly because of the mildewed curtains.The food was awful and they changed are "assigned table" each night. They catered to the Europeans as if they were royalty and Americans were just a walking wallet. I would never go back and would advise against anybody else wasting their money there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and three of my girlfriends just returned from Riu Playacar, booked through MLT Worry-Free Vacations (May 1 through May 4). What a wonderful trip it was! We stayed Thursday through Sunday (not long enough!). The hotel was awesome. The people there were so friendly and right there to help if you needed it. I had read other reviews from here about the musty smell of the rooms. We brought an air freshener and that seemed to help. We never had a problem with getting clean towels, just asked for them (and left a tip!). If you get reservations for the Steak House or the Mediterranean restaurant, my only advice for that is MAKE SURE YOU ARE ON TIME!! We were 15-20 minutes late and they really rushed us. You can take a taxi into the town of Playa del Carmen for $4 and shop all day. Bring lots of money!!If you have time make sure you take a bus tour to Tulum (Mayan ruins) and Xel-Ha where you can snorkel, tube down the river, swim with the dolphins, etc. Totally breathtaking! I would definitely go back! Feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 days at the Riu Playacar Resort. Our family's first all-inclusive vacation and we found it to be absolutely outstanding. The staff was exceptional and went out of their way to help us at any time. The rooms were great and the musty smell was only apparent if you didn't run the AC or fan. Each adjoining room shares a common door into the hallway but seperate room doors. It was very nice for our daughters to have their own room. The cleaning each day was very good and the girls enjoyed the towel 'animals' left each morning on the made beds. We left a $1.00 each day for the room service as they really did a nice job cleaning. The food was great, and yes, you do reserve your seating at the El Porche' Buffet on your arrival. We found that the later 8:30 seating was more to our liking since the evening entertainment didn't start until nearly 10:00 each night. We ate at the Turquesa (Steak House) one night and found it ok. Was nice to sit outside. We had no problem eating at El Porche' the other nights since there was plenty of food to choose from. The beach is wonderful with a swim area, windsurfers, and Hobie Cats to sail. If you know how to sail, just tell them and forego the $35 lesson. Be sure to reserve a boat early for the next day because they go quick. There are plenty of beach/poolside activities to keep one busy : pickup volleyball, mini soccer, dancing, water polo, and many activities for young kids. There is no snorkling at the Resort but we were recommended a small lagoon called Yalku near the small town of Akumal a few miles south. It was only $6.00 compared to the astronomical prices of Xcaret and Xel-Ha and was quiet and calm. We took the Resorts snorkling trip for more money and it was good but the surf was high due to a windy day. Playa del Carmen is just a 20 min. walk away where you can enjoy night life and barter from the small shops.The night entertainment was great fun and the resort entertainment staff was absolutely tireless.Overall, if your loo Palace two doors down. If you want low-key, laid-back, beautiful grounds, great staff, and fun, Riu Playacar is the way.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of 11, which included 3 14 year olds, 1 16 year old, 1 18 year old, and 6 adults (5 women, 1 man). I had never been to mexico before, and was somewhat leery. I shouldn't have been. Everything was incredible.Our trip started with us caravaning up to Midway Airport in Chicago, about 3 hours away. We arrived with no problems, and got in the baggage check in line for Funjet vacations. The line was long, but went very quickly. I felt very bad for people next to us though, as they had forgotten their birth certificates and were not allowed on the plane. What a bummer.Boarded the plane and we were off. Nice smooth flight to Cancun. No food served besides chex mix and cookies, but only a 3 hour flight so no big deal.Landed in Cancun and got through customs very quickly. No problems at all. Was met at Airport doors by very nice luggage porter. He waited til all my group was together, then took us over to our ride to the Riu Playacar. It was a very nice air conditioned bus. Coronas were available for $2.00 each. It took approximately 45 minutes to get to the resort, but time flew by due in no small part to the chatter of our Funjet guide. Great guy.Got to resort and checked in smoothly. Just remember there is a $20.00 deposit for a 2nd room key. My room was 3316. That room is in the blue building, 3rd floor, and you can see the ocean from the balcony, which is not possible in most room. There was no musty smell in my room at all, even though I was expecting it and had brought candles just in case. One of the other rooms had a very brief odor, but it disappeared immediately. My room had a great ocean breeze, but the room across the hall, 3308, had no breeze and the only view was of the back of a neighboring resort. I guess I got really lucky.This was the cleanest place I have ever stayed. The staff works extremely hard to keep everthing immaculate, and yet everyone always has a smile on their face.The floor shows were terrific. Be sure to try and catch them when think it was the best I've ever had, I had no problem finding something I liked. We went to the seafood restaurant one evening. While the adults seemed to enjoy it, the teens did not. It was a little more diverse than most American teens are used to eating. I would not recommend it to anyone not willing to experiment. Never tried the Steak restaurant. Being from the Midwest, I can't imagine any place on Earth having steaks as good as we have here, so I don't even try them when in different places.A cab ride to Playa de Carmen in only $4.00 and takes only a couple of minutes. No big deal. Shopping is fun, and people watching even funner. Ate at a great restaurant on the ocean. Best food I had in Mexico.Funjet representatives were very helpful, and I couldn't be happier with them. I will definitely take another funjet tour, and I will definitely stay at a RIU resort.Was a nasty odor in the discos at RIU Tequila and RIU Yucatan, so I left. No big deal. Beautiful beaches and plenty of room. What a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Excellent, would go again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this hotel, it was wonderful!The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was very good and the drinks were great. The rooms were kept clean, with towel animals everyday. The safe key came with the room not an additional charge. The A/C worked great as well as the TV, although we didn't spend much time in the room. The beach is beautiful, as well as the pool. This hotel is a 5 star hotel no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned today from a week at Riu Playacar. The room did not smell musty, and towels were dry and plentiful. Anything we asked for was provided without delay. Food was very good. Lamb, chicken, duck, shrimp, and mexican dishes were delicious. Omelettes made to order, excellent french toast, and my favorite, fresh donuts fried up before your eyes. Unlimited drinks, including nonalcoholic tropical drinks were very good. My kids, aged 13 and 9, had no problems eating (this place even had hambugers, hot dogs, pizza and french fries. Also plenty of activities. It was like being on a cruise, only you were on land. One thing that struck us was that there people there from all stages of life--newlyweds, families with children, and older people. Staff was very friendly and entertaining. Some topless sunbathing by europeans, but after a few minutes, kids didn't even notice anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: penny1953
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu and had a great time. The accommondations were everything that you could want. The musty smell was only present when the ceiling fan was turned off. The tile floors were extremely slippery when getting out of the shower. Respond time was only a few minutes when making a request from the front desk. The food was great. I didn't find the beef tuff. The long pants for dinner rule was ignored by most. The head waiter told us he never turns down anyone for dinner in either location (buffet or steak house). The best tip was taking a insulated cup of your own for drinks. Had a ground floor room and found it to be fine. Best beach I have ever been on. Most of the shows were really good. Spent the day in Xel-Ha and it was great. I really liked the location in Playacar. Shopping across the street was nice and only two miles from down town. Really enjoyed the pool bar and drinks were great. I would recommend the Riu to anyone looking for a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the RIU Playacar and had a great time. I have to wonder about the few people who have written bad review for this place - they must be extremely picky - the kind of people who are never happy with anything. That said, I have very few complaints. Anyone who has done any research knows that the rooms supposedly have a musty smell - they do. If you came to have a good time you won't be in your room much anyway. Once you are in there a while you forget about it. The only other bad thing, is that they try to get you to sit the same place every night and at the same time - we never did. Although I think the head waiter was annoyed with us - but they never made us move. Also, the brochures say men are supposed to wear pants to dinner - most men I saw had shorts on - they may have changed that rule. The food was good - something for everyone. I personally could have lived on fresh salsa (excellent) and fresh fruit alone. It was not the "exact" same every night as some people have commented - the salad bar was the only thing that was mostly the same. There were always different entrees, fish, meats, etc. I'm not much of a meat eater, so I can't comment on the toughness of the beef or pork. I had some chicken in a tortilla and it was good. My friends liked the fish. Beverages - lots of fresh fruit juices in the morning (mimosa's once). One kind of beer - Corona. Most any kind of mixed drink. We especially liked the pool bar. I walked a good way toward town along the beach and I think the RIU Playacar has the best beach. It has a nice stand of palm trees to provide shade if you like and alot of beach chairs. The staff was very nice - they treated all nationalities with the same service and friendliness. The grounds were very nicely landscaped with all varieties of tropical plants.

Reviews.Title: “Good times...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Riu is a great place to stay. My girlfriend and I stayed in Playacar and in Riu Tropical bay in Jamaica. The resorts were very similar. We stayed in Mexico during the first week in march. we were worried about the smell in the rooms, but unfortunately we did not get to experience that. We did bring candles for the smell, but they came in handy latter. N-e ways... the beach, the service, and the landscape were great. The drinks were watered down, but we took the advice of another review. Spike your own drink! Also, bring your own lg mug for more boozing. The entertainment was horrible if your in my age group.(23-24) my advise would be drink, leave the resort, party, then come back and sleep. We would go out and come back by 2 3 am and the resort would be DEAD. Which of course isnt always bad. We meet some great couples that stayed there which made the experience fun. Hi TN!! If your bring young kids, watch out of the nudes..there out and about. tipping is not mandatory, but it does help slipping room service and stock boys a couple $$, it goes a long way. The bartenders are great. Try the 'flaming cockroach' ..good shot. (thanks TN) Ok good for now...need more info. send me an email.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort with well manicured grounds, very friendly staff, super food, and a gorgeous beach. I would definitely return here again.Having kids, food is a big issue on vacation for our family. Our children always found things they liked and they were able to return throughout the day for constant snacks! There was always a wide variety of fish, beef, chicken, salads, cheeses, breads, and desserts. We all thought the variety and quality of the food was very high, but then again we are not picky people. Sure, there were a few dishes that we tried and did not like, but overall the food was safe and quite satisfying. There were lots of activities at the resort. We loved all the water sports. For $35 they will help you learn how to operate a Hobie-Cat or a windsurfer. Then you can use those toys for free for the rest of the week. This was really nice for our family. We spent a lot of time on the water. We also took a snorkeling trip from the resort to a local cove. That was gorgeous and well worth it.The beach and pool are excellent. There are large palm trees on the beach that provide shade throughout the day. Plenty of chairs. There are also lots of activities and a swim-up bar at the pool area. Once again, very clean.People talked about all the European sun-bathers. Not many while we were there. In fact, most of the crowd was from the US and Canada. People also talked about the musty smelling rooms. No big deal. We ran the a/c most of the time and the rooms were quite comfortable.There are four RIU properties in this area. The RIU Palace is the higher-end property and is off limits for outside RIU guests. However, the normal RIU badge allows you to visit the other two RIUs RIU Tequila and RIU Yucatan. Some told us that the place to go for the drinking is Tequila and the place for a lot of activity and fun is Yucatan. Some said that the Playacar is the RIU with a little more quiet. It was perfect for us. Some members from our group went to the others and sest. They were all the most friendly and helpful. They were great with activities during the day. Waiters were courteous. We called maintenance once for our room and he arrived within 5 minutes. Desk personnel always had a smile and actually helped us work through a booking problem without a hitch! I cant say enough about the kind staff.We will definitely return to Playa del Carmen again and would look forward to returning to the RIU Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: travellingaround
Reviews.Content: We just spent Mar 21 - Mar 28 (got home this morning!) at the Riu Playacar. We thought it was above average, the staff were wonderful and very responsive to our needs. The beach and pool were great. The whole place was very clean, though we did find the musty smell that people have posted about. We brought air freshener and kept the fan running, that helped a lot. Also, the tip to bring an insulated cup was great. They had no problem filling it up (whether it was alcohol or soda). My kids loved the paddle boats, ocean kayaks, the sail boat and the for hire banana boat. We did not find vendors on the beach, which was great. There was plenty of shade by the pool or beach, so you could get out of the sun. We went to Tulum and Xel-ha, and enjoyed both, though we probably would have preferred just a full day at Xel-ha. The food was as people said, some not so good, but if you choose from the fresh items (salad bar, fruit, the grill, etc.) it was generally okay. I loved the guacamole and lived on it - on my eggs in the morning, salad at lunch and dinner! Breakfast was the best as it was omelets or other types of eggs made for you.We will definitely go again as we thought it was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A great winter getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from Mar.1 to Mar.8. We were a party of 8. It was wonderful to leave the neverending winter of 2003 and 4 hrs. later be in 30 degree C weather. The resort was very nice. The grounds were well kept with flowered walkways, palm trees, and green grass abounding.The pool was a good size freeform pool that was divided into 2 parts. The one part had a swim up bar and therefor was more adult oriented. The bartenders were a great bunch of guys. This can be said of all the staff there. Get to know the young coop students. They work long hours and project a lot of energy making sure you have a good time. The food was real good. I have read some reviews from people complaining about the food and have to think that they could never be satisfied if they could not find something they liked every night. The selection was very good,the food fresh, they often cooked it in front of you. The fruit was delicious and fresh. The coffee is outstanding.This section of the ocean is very beautiful. We swam in it every day and had a blast as it was quite wavy while we were there. The beach is beautiful white sand that never gets hot on your feet. There are plenty of lounges for every one. There are palm trees on the beach that supply shade and some relief from the sun.The rooms were quite nice. However, we did have a problem initially with the musty smell. (We had anticipated this as we read about it in reviews beforehand)***ATTN: Management- when people check out, don't bottle up the room and shut off the fans and A/C. This allows the musty smell to build up and as the old saying goes "first impressions are lasting". O.K. having said that, the smell does disipate and was hardly noticable the next morning. The only other problem was that the showers are very slippery (speaking from experience with the floor) A shower mat can be obtained if reqested. I wish we had!! This is constuctive critisim only as overall we had a great time.This resort is very close to Xcaret (eco park) this is a must see. Xel-ha is also an eco park that has great snorkling. Tulum is a very close Mayan ruin and is coupled with the trip to Xel ha which is a good way to get both as the ruin take about an hour to see.If its ruins you want take the day and go to Chezen itsa. It is awesome.Also, with the all inclusive you can eat breakfast and lunch at the nearby Riu resorts Tequila and Yucatan as well as attend their entertainment at night. It is nice to have this variety and we sampled it all.This was a very nice resort and we had a great time. I wish we could have gotten a 10 day trip. That would have made it that much better!!!

Reviews.Title: “A week in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Vegas1
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent a great week March 1-8th, at the RIU Playacar. The resort exceeded our expectations in terms of the buffet food, cleanliness of the rooms, and friendly hi energy staff. Yes the rooms had a slight musty smell, but this is to be expected in a humid tropical climate.There are 2 seating times for dinner each evening at 6:30 and 8:30 p.m. We found the later seating allowed us a full day at the beach/pool, then time to relax for a couple hours before dinner. Try to book your "Steak House" dinner reservation by 7:15 a.m or else that evening's sittings may be full.The pool area was very popular and there were various activities during the day such as aerobics classes and fashion shows. The beach area was fantastic....with some topless sunbathers. Don't let your wife catch you looking!! The activities/entertainment team was friendly, and encouraged guests to take part in the various activities and evening shows if you wanted to. It was also cool just to relax with a drink and enjoy the show too!There is a shopping centre across the street from the Hotel, where we ended up doing most of our shopping. But, take advantage of shopping in PDCarmen and Cozumel and have fun bartering the prices down. Check with your tour rep who has scheduled hours in the hotel lobby each day. They can offer valuable tips on what excurions to book based on your interests. We took a cab to Xcaret Eco Park for $10 U.S. Had a great time snorkelig in the underground river thru the caves, viewing the coral reef habitants in the Aquarium, and taking in the various Mayan Shows. Also, take the modern comfortable ferry to Cozumel to spend a day shopping/touring the island. There were 4 cruise ships in harbour the day that we were in Cozumel.We had a great time at this hotel and look forward to returning!!

Reviews.Title: “left early”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was awful. The ocean was so pretty and the plant life all around was nice. But the good things stopped there. The food was horrible. We did not eat their food the entire time we were there. The rooms had a musty smell, although that didn't bother us too much. What did bother us is that the sheets and all the clothes were always wet, and you always felt dirty. The service was much better to the Europeans than it was to the Americans. Overall, we had a horrible time at the resort, the only time we had fun was when we left the resort to do other things. We decided to leave early and go home. We have been having a lot more fun in Houston than we did in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Time in paradise during a long cold winter.”
Reviews.Author: DianeA
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending the week 2/16-2/24 at the RIU Playacar. I had been a bit worried after reading reviews about the smell and the food. We used apple vacations and it was smooth sailing from check in at the St Louis airport to our check in. The cancun airport went smoothly . All the paper work was in order. We were great by the reps and shown to our bus. At checkin we were given a welcome drink and welcome smiles. We were treated kindly by all the workers. Our room were clean. The shower got hot and had plenty of pressure. It drained perfectly. There was a damp slight odor but we rarely used the air conditioner. Just kept the patio door open and the fan going. I did bring and use an air freshner. but really didnt need it. Other than the first day we got all the appropriate towels...etc.. THings do not dry. We used the little rack out on the patio which was great for drying towels and bathing suits. One thing noted is that only one plug in for the bathroom. I wish had brought an extension bar. I use a couple hair appliances. The bar of soap is tiny. I am glad brought one from home. thank goodness for reviews... The insulated mug also was a great idea..... you just ask for a fill up at the bar and they happily oblige you. We are not big drinkers but the fruity drinks I ordered were all very good. They hit the spot while you relaxed on the beach knowing all your friends and coworkers were having to deal with snow. *s*The room has a mini bar with pepsi, beer and water. also had hard liquors in dispensers. The water and beach is phenomenal. Plenty of chairs. no need to go and hold them as have had at other places. The pool is great. The water a little cold but refreshing. The air was very warm and the beach had a great breeze . THere are thongs and toplessness. It was not an issue with us. That did not bother us. It is done discretely. No parading around that we saw. You can just walk in the wonderful white sand for as long as you wish. There are alot of Europeans. Look out speedos.... *s*Now the food. I go to an all inclusive because I like to have it all paid up . I dont want to have to ration what I order and what drinks can have. We never felt the desire to need to eat at the specialty restaurants. The breakfast was the best. Made to order eggs... pancakes. french toast, cereals. and then meat and cheeses and breads. The juice is made from fresh fruit right there. The pineapple was delicious. I enjoyed trying new things . I think you just have to be open and accepting that a all inclusive is buffet dining. It is not going to be gourmet. One evening they had the biggest shrimp .They constantly there making dishes and bringing dishes in from the kitchen. I had the best fish and grilled vegetables one evening. I had to go back for seconds. Our waiter was so good. Dinner is assigned a time and table. You can be there anytime between 6:30 to 8:00 and then the next sitting is at 8:30. It is an opportunity to meet new people. We enjoyed it. I was addicted to the salsa they served. I miss it. There are always soups, pasta dishes, vegetarian dishes. We never went hungry. I also like how they had the beer and soda on tap and from mid morning until dark the restaurante on the beach was open and you could go in and just help yourself or get something from one of the bars . They had popcorn...nachos...and soft serve ice cream in cones all afternoon long. We chose the playacar because it is small. We did not want to dress up. Just went to relax and visits the sites. We had a fabulous time. The water is fabulous. The weather was warm and the staff was fabulous. I can't wait to go back. any questions feel free to email me. We went to town Playa del Carmen...went on a snorkeling adventure and to Tulum. You can also use the RIU tequila and the Yucatan. Those resorts looked beautiful but like ours best. Thank you RIU for a wonderful relaxing time . What a fabulous winter break.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar, Just Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 2/18 - 2/21... everything was just fabulous! All the negatives I have read posted on this site... these people seem picky! The musty smelling rooms are due to the tropical climate. After a while you got used to it. The food was amazing... although they did have a few items repeatedly in the buffet, there was always something different to try. Went to the Mediterranean restaurant once and had the Stuffed Crab, was ok, not great. The staff did a very good job of entertaining everyone, too... even if you didn't participate, it was still fun to watch the goings-on. I have to admit the worst part of this trip was booking a snorkeling tour thru the hotel, at first it seemed like it would be just 3 people on the boat, but once the boat came (after picking up at the other Riu's) there were 40 others on the boat! That lead to not much visability once you were in the water... so try to snorkel thru someplace in town... oh PS, the water is just unbelieveable! Just like a postcard!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, nice beach...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar from Feb 21st to 28th. The resort exceeded our (low) expectations especially around cleanliness, safety and atmosphere. The rooms do have a musty smell, but like everyone else on here we brought some air freshners and that solved the problem. I'm not sure if the mustiness comes from being close to the beach (we stayed in Hawaii within feet of the beach on our last vacation and we had no musty smell there). I think the smell comes from the tap water, which isn't drinkable. They must wash the towels in the same water because new towels we got came with the same musty smell. The rooms are well cleaned everyday and you get 4 bottles of hard liquor and 4 bottles of beer in your room, the beer is refreshed every 2 days. The food in the restaurant was good and the seating is assigned, men also have to wear pants to dinner. The food does tend to get a bit repititive after a few days and the other RIU resorts serve almost identical food so going to the other hotels to eat isn't a big change. The Riu Playacar seemed to be the most popular of the Riu resorts as everyone from the Yucatan and the Tequila seemed to be at our resort for the beach and the pool bar. The pool bar was rocking all the time... the animation team was everywhere and they made sure you had a good time. The beach was very nice and clean and as others have said... expect to see topless sunbathers. The resort was filled with mostly Canadian and European tourists... with a small portion of loud obnoxious americans. We personally saw the mexican staff, who were normally very attentive and friendly, instantly cool when a yank would show up.. so I can see how some american reviewers have a different perspective than the others that are writing here. The animation team seemed to be everywhere and they would sit at your table at dinner and draw you into friendly conversation. At the 6:30 and 8:30 seating times for dinner they formed a receiving line to the restaurant which made all the guests feel ext La Cumbia lounge.. which had a full size stage and sound system. One nice handy tip is that there is a market across the street from the the Playacar and it had everything from all kinds of souveniers, shops, internet cafe etc. The prices at this market were the same if not CHEAPER than the same stuff on 5th ave in PlayaDelCarmen. We visited PlayaDelCarmen a few times and it was definitely worth the trip... the taxi fare from the Playacar area to PDC is SET at 40 pesos with no need to tip the driver. I would highly recommend this resort if you are visiting PDC as it seemed to be the most popular one in the whole Playacar area.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the plan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us went there last week. THE GREAT: -service calls daily-the beach-the food-the service and the people-the activities around the resort(snorkelling, boogeyboarding, Playa Del Carmen, the boutiques, the Mayan Ruins)THE NOT SO BAD:-the pillows and matresses are not that great-the musty smell in the rooms-the showers seem to overflow but this was fixed after one phonecall TIPS:-eat the deep fried banna dessert-eat the coconut ice-cream-nightly entertainment is better at the Tequila so go there after dinner for amazing shows-be sure to go snorkelling-be sure to see Tulum (great sight)-go to Playa Del Carmen for a bargainsI would reccomend this vacation to anyone. There seemed to be alot of older people (we are 23) but it made for quiet days and wild nights at the RIU Tequila (just what I wanted), we also went to the RIU PAPAGAYO one night and it seemed like the best of the three for our beach/entertainment purposes

Reviews.Title: “Met Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family that included two children ages 10 and 15 had an enjoyable stay at the Riu Playacar between 2/14 and 2/21/2003. We live on the shore, and have visited many islands in the Carribean and the "musty" room smell at this hotel is no different than any other located in a hot, humid climate. When the a/c was on and the door closed, any musty smell was soon eliminated. The daily buffet was exceptional, and you could always find something that met your satisfaction. However, the food at the two retaurants that required reservations was much to be desired. Ironically, the daily buffet REQUIRED men to wear long pants at the buffet, but you could wear shorts at the two restaurants that served the below par food and where is was not easy to get a reservation.If you prefer to hang-out on the beach, there is no bar there. You must walk-up to the pool area or the open-air restaurant that serves the buffet lunch. There is no bar in the hotel lobby, or the restaurant that serves the daily buffet dinner, however beer and wine are available at the buffet. The entertainment staff was great...and entertaining. Some nights included professional entertainment that was outstanding, and a Michael Jackson impersonator preformance was exceptional. The entire hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating, including the Mexicans that we encountered during our out-of-hotel excursions.Sorry Riu Playacar, I never go back to the same hotel, but I would consider another Riu hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Go Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We prepared for the worst, but boy, did we waste our time. Our room was clean smelling and our water drained fine. We got 4 drops of rain on the third day we were there. There was plenty of great food, with plenty of divisity. We don't drink and the bartenders didn't have any problem mixing us non-alcoholic versions of the fun drinks. The staff was very friendly and anxious to do anything to make our stay pleasant. The hotel was quiet after 11:00, so we could rest. We tipped housekeeping $1 a day and they took wonderful care with our room. There was plenty to do, with people to plan the activities we wanted to participate in. The beach was beautiful. There were plenty of chairs avaliable. We found the towns of Playcar and Playa Del Carmen to be safe, clean and fun, even with a few annoying salesmen. In a nut shell, we can't wait to return!! Feel free to email us if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some help!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weeks stay at the RIU Playacar in Mexico. Let me start out with the positive. We stayed at the RIU Playacar and We thought it was beautiful, particularly the grounds, the pools and the beach. In addition the staff was extremely friendly, attentive and professional. Given the amount of people and the different tastes and nationalities, We thought the food that was served in the main dining room was very good. There were many, many choices and if someone could not find something to like, shame on them. We were given the choice of making reservations to eat at two other places. The food in these two other rooms unfortunately left a lot to be desired. One night we make reservations for the room called the Steak House. One of the entrees, Sirloin Steak was very tough. I think since the name of the place was the Steak House, a better choice of steak such as Filet Mignon should have been a choice. There was one entrée that did include Filet Mignon with shrimp, but those that had it only got about 5 pieces of Filet Mignon and 5 pieces of Shrimp. We never went to the other Restaurant choice which was called the Mediterranean restaurant. The reason was that we asked several people on different nights what they thought about the food and we always received negative comments. Our room was a nice size and was clean. It came with a porch. However we found the odor not only in the room, but in the whole building to be unacceptable. It was moldy and musty. The hotel asked if we would consider using our towels more than one day for environmental reasons. we would have been more than happy to do that, but the towels never dried! In fact, the clothes in the drawers always seemed to be not quite dry. In addition, there was no iron or ironing board nor a bathtub. We also had very little drawer space. The entertainment also left little to be desired. It was sub par and not the least bit professional. Our idea of entertainment is not playing bingo as an example or being entertained by young people in training for the travel industry.Suggestions: It would be nice to know what the other Rius were having for dinner and for entertainment and be able to go there. We were told we could only go there for breakfast and lunch.Also we were told that there was a gym or workout area. That was in another Riu and the equipment was very limited. When I was in there, there were 2 other people and it was crowded. I had to wait to use the equipment I wanted. There were 9 people in my party. We may return to Mexico, but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Nice But Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the RIU Playacar. 02/01/03-02/06/03. The resort is very clean and the weather was perfect!!! The negatives about the resort are the food and drinks.The food was just average and the drinks were made with off brand liquor. We did not like that you had to make a reservation to eat at the buffet restaurant. Other all-inclusives that we have been to you can come and go as you please. All and all the resort was nice...the room was nice, the musty smell was there but reading these reviews I was prepared and brought an air freshner but couldnt really tell it helped that much. But I think all the hotels in this area have that smell. Like I said it was ok but I will choose another resort in the playacar area...really liked the area.

Reviews.Title: “Mucho Grande!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Playacar in Nov'02, we couldn't have asked for a more beautiful spot. The food was great, and the staff were terrific. As far as the musty smell in the rooms, it usually happens in humid climates and in my experience is to be expected, it's not offensive at all. The beach is beautiful and I loved that there were more than enough lounges for everyone, I never had to search for a spot to sit. The other selling point for me was that it wasn't over the top, stuffy or full of itself, it was comfortable and laid back, everything I look for in a holiday. Keep up the good work Riu!

Reviews.Title: “Riu nice !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, we brought along small air fresheners for the musty smell, got the ceiling fan going. Both the beach and the pool were great fun. we received awesome service. the variety on the buffet for all three daily meals was never boring. Altogether, we really had a relaxing holiday and enjoyed our 1 week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Playacar Jan. 18, 2003 through the 25th. We had a wonderful time. A very fun place. All of the staff made us feel very welcome and special. The food was very good. The beach was extremely clean and beautiful. The tropical foliage and the grounds were kept immaculate. The main bar at the La Cumbia theatre was the most fun. The bartenders were very nice, fun and talented. To name a few of the best...Osvaldo, Carlos, Maurino, Nelson, Wilson, Lourdes, Claudia, Eloisa and Yvonne. I hope I didn't leave anyone out. They were the best group of bartenders we have ever had the pleasure of meeting. The waiters and waitresses in the buffet restaurant were wonderful. We will definitely be returning to Riu Playacar next year and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 7 day stay at the RIU Playacar. There was definitely good points and bad points to the trip. Some things couldn't be helped (like the weather!) but other things I think could be corrected - and I do intend on corresponding with the RIU to let them know about it. I agree with some of the reviews. First of all, YES, the room did have a damp/musty smell. I guess that since I read about this before I arrived, I was expecting it. It wasn't pleasant, but it wasn't too bad either. I guess if I were to go there again, I'd bring along a scented candle or air freshener. Also, the room did feel "damp" so our clothes felt damp before we put them on. Perhaps they need to invest in dehumidifiers! Other than that, the room was fine. There wasn't a tub, but I never take baths anyhow, so that was fine. They always have about 3-4 big bottles of purified water in your refrigerator in addition to Pepsi, Pepsi light (not Diet Pepsi, more like "Tab") carbonated water and Corona. They also have 4 bottles of alcohol - the labels are in Spanish, so I'm not sure what they all were. That wasn't really necessary since you could go to the bar and get a drink most of the time! One other complaint that I do intend on reporting back to RIU about is that we NEVER got all of our towels back. If you want to reuse the same towels, you just hang them up. If you want fresh towels, put them in the shower. We started off with 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels, 2 washcloths and a bath mat. We only ended up with a bath mat 2 out of 7 days we were there. Some days we'd only get 1 hand towel and other days we'd get no hand towels and 1 washcloth. One day we did tell our rep that we didn't get any towels. Perhaps the maids didn't want us to be so wasteful, but since nothing seemed to dry in the room, we did want fresh towels just so they could be dry. Perhaps the maids wanted a bigger tip! The next good/bad thing was the food. Breakfast to me was great. I loved getting made to order omelettes or eggs over easy. They also had pancakes, french toast and a variety of breads, fruits, etc. Lunches took place down near the pool. For some reason, I just couldn't really get into the food for lunch. They always had hot dogs (kind of cold) and hamburgers (more like meatloaf than a burger) and nachos with a variety of toppings. Also available was soft serve ice cream. Dinner time was my big complaint. I have to agree with the reviewers who didn't care for the food - especially anything with beef. It was tough as shoe leather! Fortunately, there was enough food to find something to eat. The one big complaint that we had was about the "Steak" restaurant. We tried a few times to get in. It was always booked. One day we set the alarm to make early reservations, and the head waiter was no where to be found. He claimed later that he was there, so the fact that he was not telling the truth was very annoying. My husband decided to take a walk to where they served the steak and I believe that they had about 12 tables total set up - that's out of probably 50 tables available in that area. We never did get into that restaurant, but since the beef was so poor in the buffet, perhaps it was in our best interest not to get in! Also, the other reviewers are correct in the fact that you are assigned a table for dinner. That could be good or bad depending on who you are sitting near. Fortunately for us, we ended up sitting with a very nice couple and by our last day, we ended up attending the evening entertainment with them. The rest of the vacation was wonderful. The grounds were beautiful! The pool looked inviting, but since it was a little breezy out, after sticking our feet in the water one day, we decided that the ocean was warmer.
