They had an entertainment staff that almost seemed like "camp counsellors" who would try to engage you if you wanted to learn a line dance or play games such as bingo, table tennis, etc. They didn't pressure you to do anything you didn't want to. The beach was gorgeous! Yes, there were several "vendors" coming around trying to sell you silver items, beads, trinkets, etc, but if you said you were'nt interested, they left you alone. Also, be aware that there are several topless bathers. It didn't really bother me, but I guess it could be embarrasing if you brough along your sons and if they'd stop and point!!! The evening entertainment was nice. The shows rotate among the various RIU resorts, so you get a different show every night. Some were better than others, but all in all, it was nice. The entertainment staff did a wonderful job to get you into the mood of the show and the announcer was amazing! I think he spoke at least 4 different languages. It's too bad he had to talk so fast to get everything out! We booked our trip through Funjet. Everything went so smoothly thanks to them. We were told by our travel agent to look for the "Lomas" people with the white pants and ties and bright blue shirts. They got us to transportation at the airport, booked any side trips, arranged for our pick up back to the airport and made sure we were at the correct location at the airport. That brings me to one last point about the trip. You do need to be careful for people who try to book tours for you down there. We were told that there are a lot of people who try to sign you up for "time shares" and try to entice you with free trips to Xcaret, Tulum, etc. When we encountered these people, we told them that we're all set for the week, or that we're leaving tomorrow. The people are very friendly and try to engage you into conversation by looking at a tee shirt or baseball cap you're wearing, or if they notice your wrist bracelet from the hotel. It's best to just smile and keep walking and tell them you're all set or else you'll be taking up a lot of your precious time. I know this review is rather wordy, but this is the information I would have liked to have before I arrived. I think perhaps for several hundred dollars more, I'd think about upgrading to the RIU Palace. I heard from a couple who ended up staying there that the food was 3 times as good and everything was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Exciting Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrific! It's the best hotel that we have been too. This hotel has alot of very exciting entertainment. Very funny and very interactive. Especially with kids. The beach is great. It's not to overcrowded. They have alot of pool activities. The people are very polite. Room service is great. One day we had our towels made into an elephant. The next day we had them made in a butterfly etc. The food excellent. The was always food out. The drinks are great. The swim up if fanstastic. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar ...Wonderful choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the Riu Playacar Dec. 14 - 21. It was our first trip of this type. We were so pleased with our choice of the Riu Playacar. The resort was spotless. The staff went out of their way to make our vacation the best possible. All resorts that close to water is going to have a musty smell. We had read about this and took 2 glade air fresheners, one for the bathroom and one for the rest of the room. They worked just fine. The pool was cold but it felt good after a day of laying out in the sun! The food was wonderful! I think the steak we had at the Steak house was one of the best we had ever had. We brought insulated mugs with us and when we went up to the bar, they know what we wanted and filled them with a smile! We got a lot of helpful information at the ... web site. You can aske questions and "experts" answer them. We are returning in December with our two teenage boys, friends and family! It is going to be our Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Food and Water”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Carribean and we went in late August . Really hot, but beach and water were simply beautiful. You can't imagine! The staff were very friendly and always wanting to make your trip fun and memorable. The food in the restaurants were outstanding and varied in culinary treats of all countries. We highly recommend the Riu Playa Car for a memorable time and laid back vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the whining?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My week long stay (dec 14-dec 21) was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and welcoming, "hola"s coming from every turn. The rooms smelled, yes, but after awhile you get used to it. The beds weren't too hard, and I had no complaints about the shower. We always had plenty of drinks in the minibar. No problem getting reservations at the buffet or at the specialties. Each reservation was made after breakfast. The beach was beautiful, but the pool was cold. The entertainment crew was fabulous. Most of them are multi-lingual (check out MC Danny - at least 5 languages). They always got the crowd into the shows. The bar service was great. Victor was always welcoming and helpful. We did have problems with our toilet for the first few days, but everything else was good. After reading all of the reviews, I'd say the majority are correct... it is a wonderful place. The others who complained, your incidents never surfaced for us, quite the opposite. I'm hoping on returning something in 2003.

Reviews.Title: “The best All-Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the finest All-Inclusive I have ever been to. The food and ammenities are terriffic! But, more importantly the staff is second to none. RIU knows what it is doing at Playacar and I will be heading back in March 2003 for my fifth trip with another twenty or so travelers. Bill Fleming Island Heights, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time to Playacar. Loved the hotel and the entire area. Food was excellent even in the specialty restaurants. Had no trouble getting reservations. Staff was super friendly. Our room was kind of musty also. The whole resort was absolute spotless. One minor problem was the ladies washroom by the buffet pool restaurant. A lot of times it was out of either toilet paper or hand towels. The only thing missing was a bar in the lobby that you could have sat at while waiting for dinner. Definitely would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our goal was to get a good deal and what a deal we got. The RUI Playacar was clean, friendly, and the food was excellent, best tasting we've had in Mexico (especially compared to the Reef Club in Cozumel). The manager was highly visible and asked several times how our stay was. They went out of their way to met our needs. The beach was soft sand with plenty of palm trees for a pm siesta. They had huts on the beach for massages and hair braiding. One day was a beach party with live music, food, and dancing. The nightly shows were good and some were down right funny, they involved the audience. The steak house/Italian Restuarant was not as good as the buffet. Every night was a knew food on the buffet and plenty of it. I would not be able to try everything in 7 days. Small shopping center across the street and 2 miles of shops at Playa Del CArmen( comes alive at night with live music) just a 30 minute walk or 5 minute taxi ride. This hotel was close to everything. We snorkeled a Cenote( fantastic), took a tour to the Coba Ruins and Mayan Villiage (also great), and visited Islu Mujares on the Golden Cruise (nice, got to see the sun set). Too much to see and do. We'll have to come back. Overall this has been a great value and the best trip we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Non-stop fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I both in our 20's just had a blast at the Rui Playacar. At first we thought we made a mistake after seeing only couples and seniors, but after the first night we became aquainted with the staff and met other guests that were in our age group. The resort itself is beautiful and the views are breathtaking. They would go out of their way to make sure that we were happy. We did requested a different room in the beginning since it was on the first floor and had a musky smell. They arranged another room by the next day on the third floor. In the new room they had a basket of friuts waiting with a note hoping that this room was to our liking and it made a big difference with better views and no musky smell. The staff was extremely friendly and always helpful like bartenders Carlos and Roberto whom service was impecable. Also, the entertainment staff was extremely energetic and alway got the crowd into the shows and events. Entertainment staff such as Juan and Antonio was the best and have to definitely say "thanks guys for a great time". There's three other Rui's resorts all in walking distance that you have access to each one has it's own characteristics and charm. The food was great and I don't understand why some would write and complain. Don't expect fast food here, all is fresh and you can tell that they do very much so caters to the Europeans which is a nice change than from some other resorts. I did last year went on a Carnival cruise and found the food to be aweful and at best just OK. As for the nightlife in the resort there is one club in the Tequila resort opens every night and the other club in the Yucatan resort opens from Thursday nights to Sunday. My friend and I went to both on the same night and found them to be OK, great for couples and others who are content with sticking with the resort's guests. It's nice and convienent that you don't have to pay to get in and all your drinks are included, but we did go into town for the nightlife and after that we became regulars. Each night we would go to bars and clubs in town such as the Blue Parott, Captain Tutix and next door to Kuba. All of these clubs are located on the beach and we met more people that were in our age group and each night was a blast. The drinks were affordable, there's no cover charge and a cab ride is approxiately 4 US dollars each way. We were disappointed with our tour operator that was at the resort that sold us our excursions. We did managed to go on two different ones and had a great time on both, but realized after just across the street from the resort at the shopping plaza where the Tourist Information, we could have gone on these excursions for almost half of the price than we paid for. So my advise to anyone that is planning on going on some excursions, shop around first and you can save a whole lot of money. Also, remember to bargain with the locals for any goods or sovenirs. Anyone that does not mind to do a little physical activity should definitely check out the Mayan Ruins. Very unique and interesting. Overall, my friend and I really, really enjoyed ourselves. I have been to many differents resorts and I have to say that this is one of the best that I've ever been to. This was the first time to Mexico and to a Rui resort and it will definitely not be my last. I would recommend this trip to anyone, young and old, with children or without, groups or singles, anyone wanting to have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “1st time to Mexico, loved the Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Riu Playacar Resort from November 14 - November 21. We had a wonderful time. We were a little nervous because it was our first time going to Mexico, but everything was wonderful. The resort is really beautiful and the landscaping is really nice. I did overhear some people saying that their rooms were a little musty and that they had requested new rooms. Our room did have a very light odor, but it was not enough for us to request a new room. Breakfast is by far the best meal of the day, made to order omelets, eggs (any style), bacon, sausage, toast, tons of different kinds of breads, fresh fruit, yogurt, fresh squeezed furit juices, etc....The buffet offered quite a variety and we were never disappointed. If you come to this resort and can't find a thing to eat, you must be really picky!! The drinks were good, we are not big drinkers but what we did try was tasty. The grounds at this resort are kept so clean. We never had a problem with cleanliness. We tipped the maid $2-3 U.S. dollars a day. She took really good care of us during our stay. We did the tour to Tulum/Xel-ha. It is a must do, even if you decide to go on your own, please go....you won't regret it. The beach is gorgeous, we walked down towards the Allegro and Reef Club Resorts and found that the beach there just wasn't quite as nice as the Riu Playacar, but they were pretty. We booked once at the seafood restaurant and we had the stuffed crab and it was delicious! We tried for at least 2 mornings to book at the Steakhouse and we had no luck....When they say the bookings start at 7 am, they mean that! We went to 5th Avenue and it is such a neat little place, everyone telling you to come into their "Mexican Wal-mart". We walked along the beach and even walked all the way down to the Porto Real Hotel (very nice). We had dinner one night at La Parrilla Restaurant. Very, very good food. All in all we had a wonderful time and we truly do plan to return to the Riu Play ng to have a good, relaxing vacation. I'm sure I left out several things, but if I can answer any questions, please e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a week Nov 2-9 at Rui Playacar. Found the staff very friendly,always wanting to please. This place was spotless and the housekeeping staff was constantly sweeping/ cleaning the public areas. Food & drinks abundant with a good variety. I didn't find the drinks watered down , in fact the bartenders asked if we wanted a single or double. We were fortunate to have only 1 day of rain and the resort provides umbellas for each room. The beach is truly beautiful and clean. Lots of lounge chairs. We had no towel problems on the beach or in our room. The room had a musty basement smell that I got used to quickly. We had no trouble getting reservations at steak house or seafood house. We did not sit at the same table for breakfast but were at the same one at the dinner buffet. There was plenty for us to do at the resort but we chose to relax at the pool or beach. I did end up getting intestinal upset around day 4. Beware of the vendors on the beach and in the town, they are bothersome!

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable first time-Riu Playacar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days, 5 nights at the Riu Playacar (Nov 10-14). This was my first trip to Mexico. I had a good time. The food was very good...loved the European-style coffee with 'crema' on top in the buffet place by the pool. Plus steamed milk to go with it! Drinks were not strong, but then I preferred this. For a strong drink try the ones on the menu that are advertised as long drinks. Liquor in the rooms is awful (what is that stuff???!!!) Bring alot of single bills (American) for tipping. We had problems getting any and none one seemed to have any, or didn't want to give out any. Alot of Europeans which gave the hotel an international flair. Loved that. Go to COBA. JORGE is a wonderful, informative guide. Friendly staff worked very hard, be sure to tip. This one is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Groundhog day”
Reviews.Author: wil100
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Riu last January. The hotel itself is nice enough and clean (not as nice as others in the area we have stayed at ie Iberostar Quetzal/Tucan). What we hated... we had to sit at the same table at the same time for dinner each night at the buffet and the same table for breakfast. So no matter who you met or how your day went there we were at table 118 by ourselves. The buffet was THE EXACT SAME each night. At least they could shuffle it around a bit to make it look different. By the 3rd day we were all referring to this as "Ground Hog Day". The a la carte restaurant was so so. We were also under the impression we could dine at all 3 Riu's. Not the case - you can drink and play at all 3 (not the Palace though - the nicest Riu) but you cannot eat anywhere except your assigned table at your assigned time. I will never book another Riu and I will refuse to be assigned a table and time at any resort I pay this much to visit in the future. I find these reviews very helpful and will be travelling to Mexico in January for the 10th time. Trying to decide between Iberotar Paraiso Del Mar and Bahia Principe Akumal.

Reviews.Title: “Rui Playacar was the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned for the Rui Playacar after a week stay Oct 23-30th. The resort was beautiful-extremely clean and the service was wonderful. Two pools, one with a swim up bar, and the other on the quiet side for relaxing and reading. You could be as active or relaxed as you choose. The beach was spectacular, white sand and turquise waters. We ate at the steak specialty resturant once and it was ok but not worth signing up at 7am. I thought the buffet was better.The menus changed daily and they had to cover a lot of diffrent cultures and the food was very very good. There are two bars and the drinks were served very quickly (try a half-moon) We ate breakfast at both the Rui Yucatan and Tequila and thought the Playacar was the nicest of the three. There was not one bad thing I could complain about, and the price was unbelieveable at $650- Also try the one hour body massage for $28(you think you are in heaven). Would return in a heartbeat-already saving to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Playacar gets 2 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reviews were very helpful before we left. Rooms are musty due to the open design and humidity. Suggest candles or Febreese. Rooms are a bit dim but have everything you need including minibar with sodas, water and liquor. Staff is more than accomadating! Refill minibar every other day but tim them a buck and leave a note and you will have what you ask for. Most people at the resort are European so if you object to topless sunbathing, better find some place else to go. Men do have to wear pants to dinner but they can be jeans. Mostly couples average age of 30's at the resort. No singles or spring break atmosphere! Entertainment is ok. About the same as a criuse ship. Good some nights and cheesy others! Staff at hotel are wonderful and really enjoyed our stay and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon From Hell!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off we were sent down in the middle of a hurricane. The entertainment staff was lacking during the 4.5 days of rain there wasn't a thing todo. The showers clogged up if you used to much water pressure and the water pressure would change depending on what other people in the hotel were doing. The rooms SMELLED and I can't stress enough that they SMELLED. If you go bring an air freshner. The rooms were very damp. Every night when it was time to go to bed the bed sheets were damp and they also smelled. You couldn't hang anything to dry because it wouldn't not even if you put it outside. The cleaning staff had a hard time understanding that if you take towels replace them with new ones and when the sun final can out they ran out of towels at the pool everyday. So hang onto your towel. The beach was small but nice. Watch out for the mexicans they are constantly bugging you to by something and other resorts would come up to you and try and get you to go to there resort. I have stayed at other RIU resorts before and wouldn't recommend this one. My Husband and I can honestly say we will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Playacar, not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from a week at the RIU Playacar. It was a pretty nice place, clean. Good points. 1. Staff was friendly. 2. Food was good, but it got repetitious after a week. 3. Drinks at the bars were good, didn't seem to be watered down. 4. Room was clean, air conditioning worked fine. 5. Grounds were beautiful beach was really nice. Plenty of lounge chairs, nice pools. Bad Points. 1. Had a hard communicating with the maid that we needed more than one bath towel for two people and we needed a bath mat. 2. Specialty seaafood restaurant good, service slow. 3. Liquor provided in room was pretty poor. 4. Shower would back up a little, never overflowed. Toilet stopped up once, fixed promptly. Room was slighty musty but was fine when you turned on the air. 5. Entertainment was so-so. Emcee introduced everything in 4 different languages, got wearing after a little while. 6. If you go during hurricane season like we did, be sure to bring cards, lots of books, or a gameboy. Nothing much to do when the beach and the pools are closed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Good Food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, my husband and I just returned from the Riu Playacar on September 28th/02. We were stuck in the terrible hurricane and only had one full day of sun, but still enjoyed our vacation. The hotel staff is very friendly, they will help you and answer any questions you may have. The rooms are clean and don't really smell as bad as people tend to say. A good suggestion is to bring air freshner with you and spray it every 2 or 3 days to keep your room smelling nice and fresh. The food was very nice, we had buffey every single day, since people say that the sea food and the steak house are not that great. Every day they make something different and there is a lot to choose from . ( Trust me I am a picky eater but I actually thought that the food was very nice ) The beach is absolutely beautiful, eventhough we only got to enjoy it for one day. It's huge and very clean. I am a beach person and I would honestly rate this beach as a 10 out of 10. The pool itself is also very nice, however I didn't even get a chance to swim in it. After 1 pm until 9 pm there isn't really that much to do, so if the weather isn't great.. REMEMBER TO BRING CARDS WITH YOU!!. The nightly entertainment is good, it starts at 9 and finishes at 11 pm. To rate this hotel out of 10 I would give it an 8 just because none of the rooms face the ocean or the pool, so unless you enjoy the garden view you shouldn't have any reason not to give this hotel a 10. For anyone who has any questions, I would be happy to answer them. TAKE CARE AND HAVE FUN IN THE SUN.

HotelInfo.Name: Riu Playacar
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Xamen-Ha | Manzana 3, Lote 6, Playacar, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
